
512 
FXUS64 KLZK 221723 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1120 AM CST WED DEC 22 2004

.DISCUSSION...
NEXT ROUND OF PRECIP WORKING INTO THE FA FROM THE SW ATTM. HOURLY 
ANALYSIS OF SFC TEMPS INDC FREEZING LINE HAS MADE PROGRESS SWD OVR 
ERN AND CNTRL AR...WHERE TERRAIN IS FLATTER. MEANWHILE...LEADING 
EDGE OF FREEZING TEMPS HAS HELD IN PLACE OVER THE AR RVR VALLEY.

EFFECT OF EVAP COOLING CONT TO RESULT IN A MIXTURE OF PRECIP OVR 
CNTRL AND WRN AR. CHANGEOVER TO ALL SNOW EXPECTED IN LOCATIONS WHERE 
BEST CAA CONTS THIS AFTN. MIXED PRECIP EXPECTED OVR CNTRL AND 
EVENTUALLY SRN AR AS SFC TEMPS SLOLY FALL. EXTENDED WINTER STORM 
WARNING FURTHER SWD ACRS W-CNTRL AR INTO THIS EVENING WHERE TERRAIN 
FEATURES WL HELP TO ENHANCE SNOW AMOUNTS. REST OF HEADLINES LEFT AS 
IS.

MUCH LOWER DEWPOINTS HAVE ADVECTED INTO NRN AR THIS MRNG. THIS MAY 
HOLD DOWN PRECIP AMOUNTS ACRS THAT AREA THIS AFTN AND EVENING. 

UPDATED ZNS AND GRIDS ALREADY OUT.
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 353 AM CST WED DEC 22 2004

THE MAIN TOPIC THIS MORNING IS THE WINTER STORM WHICH IS WELL 
UNDERWAY. THE LATEST SURFACE MAP SHOWED AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
CENTERED NEAR GALVESTON TEXAS WITH AN INVERTED TROUGH EXTENDING 
NORTHEAST INTO SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS. MUCH COLDER AIR WAS NORTH OF THIS 
TROUGH. MONTICELLO AND ELDORADO CONTINUE TO BE IN THE WARM SECTOR. 
THE COLD AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE AREA TODAY AND TEMPERATURES WILL 
BE FALLING THROUGHOUT THE DAY. THE LATEST RADAR IMAGERY SHOWED 
ABUNDANT RAINFALL OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE CWA WITH INCREASING 
COVERAGE IN THE SOUTHWEST. 

WILL ISSUE A WINTER STORM WARNING FOR NORTHERN COUNTIES AND A WINTER 
WEATHER ADVISORY FOR PARTS OF CENTRAL ARKANSAS THROUGH 9 PM TONIGHT. 
THE COLD AIR WILL BE SHALLOW INITIALLY AS IT MOVES IN. THIS WILL 
BRING A CHANCE OF FREEZING RAIN BEFORE THE RAIN CHANGES OVER TO 
SNOW. THE LATEST FORECAST SOUNDING SHOWS A WARM LAYER JUST ABOVE THE 
GROUND THROUGH 18Z FOR KLZK. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH 
PREVIOUS RUNS WITH THE MOVEMENT OF THIS SYSTEM. RAIN WILL CHANGE TO 
SNOW IN THE NORTH EARLY THIS MORNING...AND 18-20Z IN THE LITTLE ROCK 
METRO AREA. 3-5 INCHES OF SNOW ARE EXPECTED IN THE NORTH...1-2 
INCHES IN CENTRAL ARKANSAS... AND LESS THAN AN INCH IN THE SOUTH. 
NORTH WINDS WILL GUST TO 30 MPH ALSO THIS AFTERNOON. WILL GO WITH 
100 PERCENT POPS TODAY...THEN DECREASE POPS THIS EVENING. ALL PRECIP 
SHOULD MOVE OUT OF THE STATE BY 12Z THURSDAY. 

HIGH PRESSURE AND DRY WEATHER MOVES IN FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. COLD 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE THE RULE HOWEVER.  
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...WINTER STORM WARNING UNTIL 900 PM 
CST WEDNESDAY FOR ZONES ARZ003>007...ARZ012>016...ARZ021... 
ARZ024>025.

WINTER STORM WARNING UNTIL 900 PM CST WEDNESDAY FOR ZONES 
ARZ022>023...ARZ030>031...ARZ037>038...ARZ040>041.

WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 900 PM CST WEDNESDAY FOR ZONES
ARZ022>023...ARZ030>034...ARZ037>047...ARZ052>054.
&&

$$

501 
FXUS64 KLZK 220953
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
353 AM CST WED DEC 22 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT
THE MAIN TOPIC THIS MORNING IS THE WINTER STORM WHICH IS WELL 
UNDERWAY. THE LATEST SURFACE MAP SHOWED AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
CENTERED NEAR GALVESTON TEXAS WITH AN INVERTED TROUGH EXTENDING 
NORTHEAST INTO SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS. MUCH COLDER AIR WAS NORTH OF THIS 
TROUGH. MONTICELLO AND ELDORADO CONTINUE TO BE IN THE WARM SECTOR. 
THE COLD AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE AREA TODAY AND TEMPERATURES WILL 
BE FALLING THROUGHOUT THE DAY. THE LATEST RADAR IMAGERY SHOWED 
ABUNDANT RAINFALL OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE CWA WITH INCREASING 
COVERAGE IN THE SOUTHWEST. 

WILL ISSUE A WINTER STORM WARNING FOR NORTHERN COUNTIES AND A WINTER 
WEATHER ADVISORY FOR PARTS OF CENTRAL ARKANSAS THROUGH 9 PM TONIGHT. 
THE COLD AIR WILL BE SHALLOW INITIALLY AS IT MOVES IN. THIS WILL 
BRING A CHANCE OF FREEZING RAIN BEFORE THE RAIN CHANGES OVER TO 
SNOW. THE LATEST FORECAST SOUNDING SHOWS A WARM LAYER JUST ABOVE THE 
GROUND THROUGH 18Z FOR KLZK. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH 
PREVIOUS RUNS WITH THE MOVEMENT OF THIS SYSTEM. RAIN WILL CHANGE TO 
SNOW IN THE NORTH EARLY THIS MORNING...AND 18-20Z IN THE LITTLE ROCK 
METRO AREA. 3-5 INCHES OF SNOW ARE EXPECTED IN THE NORTH...1-2 
INCHES IN CENTRAL ARKANSAS... AND LESS THAN AN INCH IN THE SOUTH. 
NORTH WINDS WILL GUST TO 30 MPH ALSO THIS AFTERNOON. WILL GO WITH 
100 PERCENT POPS TODAY...THEN DECREASE POPS THIS EVENING. ALL PRECIP 
SHOULD MOVE OUT OF THE STATE BY 12Z THURSDAY. 

HIGH PRESSURE AND DRY WEATHER MOVES IN FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. COLD 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE THE RULE HOWEVER.  
&&

.LONG TERM...SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY
QUITE A PATTERN CHANGE IN THE LONG TERM WITH NORTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT/ARCTIC COLD REPLACED BY LARGE TROUGH IN THE WEST/SOUTHWEST 
FLOW ALOFT/A WARMING TREND. 

TEMPERATURES WILL REBOUND QUITE NICELY...WITH READINGS IN THE SINGLE 
DIGITS/TEENS THE MORNING OF CHRISTMAS EDGING UPWARD INTO THE 30S/40S 
BY TUESDAY MORNING. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL GO FROM THE 30S ON 
CHRISTMAS DAY TO THE 50S/LOWER 60S BY TUESDAY. 

MOST OF THE LONG TERM WILL BE DRY. HOWEVER...AS TROUGH IN THE WEST 
NEARS...MOISTURE WILL INCREASE RAPIDLY ON TUESDAY WITH A CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS IN THE FORECAST. THE PATTERN WOULD SUGGEST THAT THUNDER MAY 
DEVELOP TUESDAY NIGHT...BUT DID NOT INCLUDE AT THIS TIME. WILL WAIT 
FOR LATER RUNS TO DETERMINE THE TRACK OF DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE... 
AND HOW FAR NORTH IT GOES. A MORE NORTHERLY TRACK WOULD FAVOR 
THUNDER...WITH A TRACK FARTHER SOUTH INDICATING A MORE GENERAL RAIN. 
(46)
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    38  18  30  14 / 100  70   0  10 
HARRISON AR       29  10  21   5 / 100  80   0  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    40  21  31  15 / 100  60   0  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     43  23  32  16 / 100  70   0  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  29  10  21   5 / 100  80   0  10 
MONTICELLO AR     49  25  34  18 / 100  70   0  10 
SEARCY AR         36  17  27  13 / 100  80   0  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      39  20  30  14 / 100  60   0  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   35  14  25  11 / 100  80   0  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...WINTER STORM WARNING UNTIL 900 PM 
CST WEDNESDAY FOR ZONES ARZ003>007...ARZ012>016... 
ARZ021...ARZ024>025.

WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 900 PM CST WEDNESDAY FOR ZONES
ARZ022>023...ARZ030>034...ARZ037>047...ARZ052>054.

&&

$$

51/46






000 
FXUS64 KLZK 220953
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
353 AM CST WED DEC 22 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT
THE MAIN TOPIC THIS MORNING IS THE WINTER STORM WHICH IS WELL 
UNDERWAY. THE LATEST SURFACE MAP SHOWED AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE 
CENTERED NEAR GALVESTON TEXAS WITH AN INVERTED TROUGH EXTENDING 
NORTHEAST INTO SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS. MUCH COLDER AIR WAS NORTH OF THIS 
TROUGH. MONTICELLO AND ELDORADO CONTINUE TO BE IN THE WARM SECTOR. 
THE COLD AIR WILL FILTER INTO THE AREA TODAY AND TEMPERATURES WILL 
BE FALLING THROUGHOUT THE DAY. THE LATEST RADAR IMAGERY SHOWED 
ABUNDANT RAINFALL OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE CWA WITH INCREASING 
COVERAGE IN THE SOUTHWEST. 

WILL ISSUE A WINTER STORM WARNING FOR NORTHERN COUNTIES AND A WINTER 
WEATHER ADVISORY FOR PARTS OF CENTRAL ARKANSAS THROUGH 9 PM TONIGHT. 
THE COLD AIR WILL BE SHALLOW INITIALLY AS IT MOVES IN. THIS WILL 
BRING A CHANCE OF FREEZING RAIN BEFORE THE RAIN CHANGES OVER TO 
SNOW. THE LATEST FORECAST SOUNDING SHOWS A WARM LAYER JUST ABOVE THE 
GROUND THROUGH 18Z FOR KLZK. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH 
PREVIOUS RUNS WITH THE MOVEMENT OF THIS SYSTEM. RAIN WILL CHANGE TO 
SNOW IN THE NORTH EARLY THIS MORNING...AND 18-20Z IN THE LITTLE ROCK 
METRO AREA. 3-5 INCHES OF SNOW ARE EXPECTED IN THE NORTH...1-2 
INCHES IN CENTRAL ARKANSAS... AND LESS THAN AN INCH IN THE SOUTH. 
NORTH WINDS WILL GUST TO 30 MPH ALSO THIS AFTERNOON. WILL GO WITH 
100 PERCENT POPS TODAY...THEN DECREASE POPS THIS EVENING. ALL PRECIP 
SHOULD MOVE OUT OF THE STATE BY 12Z THURSDAY. 

HIGH PRESSURE AND DRY WEATHER MOVES IN FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. COLD 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE THE RULE HOWEVER.  
&&

.LONG TERM...SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY
QUITE A PATTERN CHANGE IN THE LONG TERM WITH NORTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT/ARCTIC COLD REPLACED BY LARGE TROUGH IN THE WEST/SOUTHWEST 
FLOW ALOFT/A WARMING TREND. 

TEMPERATURES WILL REBOUND QUITE NICELY...WITH READINGS IN THE SINGLE 
DIGITS/TEENS THE MORNING OF CHRISTMAS EDGING UPWARD INTO THE 30S/40S 
BY TUESDAY MORNING. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL GO FROM THE 30S ON 
CHRISTMAS DAY TO THE 50S/LOWER 60S BY TUESDAY. 

MOST OF THE LONG TERM WILL BE DRY. HOWEVER...AS TROUGH IN THE WEST 
NEARS...MOISTURE WILL INCREASE RAPIDLY ON TUESDAY WITH A CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS IN THE FORECAST. THE PATTERN WOULD SUGGEST THAT THUNDER MAY 
DEVELOP TUESDAY NIGHT...BUT DID NOT INCLUDE AT THIS TIME. WILL WAIT 
FOR LATER RUNS TO DETERMINE THE TRACK OF DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE... 
AND HOW FAR NORTH IT GOES. A MORE NORTHERLY TRACK WOULD FAVOR 
THUNDER...WITH A TRACK FARTHER SOUTH INDICATING A MORE GENERAL RAIN. 
(46)
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    38  18  30  14 / 100  70   0  10 
HARRISON AR       29  10  21   5 / 100  80   0  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    40  21  31  15 / 100  60   0  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     43  23  32  16 / 100  70   0  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  29  10  21   5 / 100  80   0  10 
MONTICELLO AR     49  25  34  18 / 100  70   0  10 
SEARCY AR         36  17  27  13 / 100  80   0  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      39  20  30  14 / 100  60   0  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   35  14  25  11 / 100  80   0  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...WINTER STORM WARNING UNTIL 900 PM 
CST WEDNESDAY FOR ZONES ARZ003>007...ARZ012>016... 
ARZ021...ARZ024>025.

WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 900 PM CST WEDNESDAY FOR ZONES
ARZ022>023...ARZ030>034...ARZ037>047...ARZ052>054.

&&

51/46






694 
FXUS64 KLZK 220400
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1000 PM CST TUE DEC 21 2004

.DISCUSSION...
RATHER SOLID AREA OF RAIN WITH ISOLATED THUNDER HAS DEVELOPED ALONG 
AND NORTH OF THE FRONT IN CENTRAL AND NORTH CENTRAL SECTIONS. ONLY
PATCHY RAIN TO THE SOUTH. RAIN SHOULD INCREASE LATER TONIGHT AS THE
MAIN UPPER SHORT WAVE INTENSIFIES AND APPROACHES THE AREA. TEMPS
SLOWLY FALLING AND ARE PRETTY CLOSE TO WHAT IS FORECAST...SO NO 
CHANGES MADE THERE. STILL COULD SEE RAIN MIX WITH THEN CHANGE TO 
SNOW LATER TONIGHT IN THE NORTH WITH SOME ACCUMULATION BY 12Z SO
WILL LEAVE ADVISORY AS IS. UPDATED ZONES TO ELIMINATE EVENING
WORDING AND ALSO ADJUSTED POPS FOR TONIGHT TO FIT CURRENT TRENDS.
WENT WITH CATEGORICAL IN NORTH AND CENTRAL AND LIKELY IN SOUTH
THEN INCREASED POPS TO CATEGORICAL IN EAST LATER. ALSO INCREASED
QPF IN NORTH CENTRAL AND EAST FOR TONIGHT. REST OF FORECAST LOOKS
ON TRACK FOR NOW.
&&
29

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 335 PM CST TUE DEC 21 2004 

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT
RUNNING BEHIND THIS AFTN WITH COMPLICATED FCST...SO SHORT TERM DISC 
WL BE BRIEF.

STILL HAVING TO CONTEND WITH A TRANSITION FROM SPRING TO WINTER ONCE 
AGAIN ACRS THE FA DURG THE NEXT 24 TO 48 HOURS. WARMER/MORE HUMID  
AIRMASS HAS WORKED NWD INTO SRN AND CNTRL AR THIS AFTN...WITH TEMPS 
IN THE 50S AND 60S. READINGS IN THE 40S NOTED OVER NRN AR. BAND OF 
SHOWERS HAS PERSISTED ALONG THE DIVIDING LINE OF THE AIRMASSES.

SFC LOW DVLPG TO THE S OF AR IS FCST TO LIFT NEWD LASTER TNGT AND 
WED. THIS WL BRING COLDER AIRMASS BACK SWD THRU THE STATE. LOOKS 
LIKE WE WILL SEE A RAIN TO SNOW TRANSITION OVER N-CNTRL AR LATE TNGT 
AND OVER TO ALL SNOW WED. SNOW AMOUNTS TNGT LOOK ON THE ORDER OF 1-2 
INCHES...WITHIN ADVY CRITERIA. ELSEHWERE...EXPECT HIGH RAIN CHCS 
WITH EVEN A CHC OF THUNDER OVR SRN AR.

EXPECT THE RAIN TO MIX WITH AND CHANGE OVER TO SNOW CNTRL AR LATE IN 
THE DAY WED AND WED EVENING. KEPT WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FOR 
WED SOUTH OF ADVY WHERE SNOWFALL TOTALS STILL IN QUESTION. ANOTHER 
UPPER SYSTEM MOVES THRU THE AREA ON WED NIGHT. MODEL SNOW QPF FROM 
THE MESOETA INDCS MORE ACCUMULATION POSSIBLE WED NIGHT.
&&

.LONG TERM...FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY
MID WEEK WINTER STORM WILL HAVE DEPARTED THE AREA BY FRIDAY. ARCTIC 
HIGH WILL TAKE OVER IN ITS PLACE. MAJOR CHANGES TO THE LONG TERM 
FORECAST WERE ESSENTIALLY RESTRICTED TO TEMPERATURES OVER THE 
HOLIDAY WEEKEND.

GFS...DGEX...ECMWF AND UKMET ARE ALL IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH COLD AIR 
INFILTRATING THE REGION FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. BY FRIDAY 
MORNING...APPEARS THAT H85 TEMPS WILL BE IN THE -14 TO -16 RANGE 
ACROSS NORTHERN ARKANSAS...-12 TO -10 ACROSS CENTRAL AR...AND -8 TO 
-10 IN THE SOUTH. THERE WILL LIKELY BE SCT CLOUDS FRIDAY AM ACROSS 
NORTHERN 2/3 OF STATE AS MOISTURE ROTATES THROUGH BASE OF H5 TROUGH. 
KEPT SNOW CHANCES OUT FOR NOW...NOT SEEING ENOUGH EVIDENCE TO 
SUGGEST PRECIP AT THIS TIME. WITH SEVERAL INCHES OF SNOW POSSIBLY IN 
PLACE ACROSS THE NORTH...SFC RIDGE IN PLACE...AND LIGHT 
WINDS...TEMPERATURES WILL PLUMMET ACROSS THE NORTH FRIDAY MORNING. 
WENT WITH SINGLE DIGITS ABOVE ZERO ACROSS NORTHERN TIER OF 
COUNTIES...AND TEENS REST OF STATE.

LOWERED HIGH TEMPS FRIDAY TWO CATEGORIES FOR SEVERAL REASONS. 1. LOW 
TEMPS ARE NOW EXPECTED TO BE A BIT LOWER THAN PREVIOUSLY FORECASTED. 
2. CAA REGIME WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE STATE. 3. H85 TEMPS WILL 
REMAIN IN THE MINUS TEENS. EVEN WITH FULL SUNSHINE...HERE AT LITTLE 
ROCK WE/D ONLY MIX OUT TO 900 MB...GIVING A HIGH IN THE LOW TO MID 
20S.

MORE COLD WEATHER CHRISTMAS MORNING. AFTER DISCUSSING WITH SEVERAL 
SURROUNDING OFFICES...FEEL THAT THE SFC RIDGE WILL STILL BE IN THE 
AREA SATURDAY MORNING. WITH CLEAR SKIES EXPECTED...LIGHT WINDS...AND 
THE SNOWPACK STILL IN PLACE...SATURDAY HAS THE POTENTIAL TO BE 
COLDER THAN FRIDAY. HOWEVER...WENT WITH SIMILAR TEMPS TO FRIDAY FOR 
SATURDAY DUE TO SLIGHTLY JILTED CONFIDENCE ON PROGRESSION OF SFC 
HIGH. BUT SITUATION BEARS WATCHING.

WAA WILL KICK BACK IN LATE SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL MAKE A NICE 
REBOUND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. KEPT SLIGHT CHANCES FOR RAIN IN THE 
FORECAST FOR MONDAY/TUESDAY TIMEFRAME. BOTH GFS AND DGEX SHOWING 
NICE RETURN FLOW ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE HIGH. INTERESTING TO NOTE 
THAT DGEX BRING +12 H85 TEMPS ALL THE WAY INTO THE UPPER MIDWEST 
MONDAY. THAT SEEMS PRETTY HOPEFUL FOR DECEMBER IN MINNESOTA/DAKOTAS. 
BUT WARMER TEMPS AND INCREASING MOISTURE MAKE IT INTO THE MIDSOUTH 
AHEAD OF NEXT SYSTEM. GFS BRINGS COLD FRONT THROUGH THE STATE 
TUESDAY. BUT ALOT OF AMBIGUITIES THAT FAR OUT WITH TIMING AND 
STRENGTH...SO JUST WENT WITH SLIGHT POPS FOR THE MONDAY/TUESDAY 
PERIOD.
&&

.COORDINATION...
THANKS TO WFO/S SGF...MEM...TUL AND PAH FOR PRODUCTIVE COORDINATION 
EFFORTS TODAY.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES....WINTER STORM WATCH FROM 600 AM 
CST WEDNESDAY UNTIL 600 PM CST WEDNESDAY FOR ZONES ARZ016...
ARZ021>025...ARZ030>031.

WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FROM MIDNIGHT CST WEDNESDAY UNTIL 600 PM CST
WEDNESDAY FOR ZONES ARZ003>007...ARZ012>015.
&&

$$

KEPT SNOW CHANCES OUT FOR NOW...NOT SEEING ENOUGH EVIDENCE TO 
SUGGEST PRECIP AT THIS TIME. WITH SEVERAL INCHES OF SNOW POSSIBLY IN 
PLACE ACROSS THE NORTH...SFC RIDGE IN PLACE...AND LIGHT 
WINDS...TEMPERATURES WILL PLUMMET ACROSS THE NORTH FRIDAY MORNING. 
WENT WITH SINGLE DIGITS ABOVE ZERO ACROSS NORTHERN TIER OF 
COUNTIES...AND TEENS REST OF STATE.

LOWERED HIGH TEMPS FRIDAY TWO CATEGORIES FOR SEVERAL REASONS. 1. LOW 
TEMPS ARE NOW EXPECTED TO BE A BIT LOWER THAN PREVIOUSLY FORECASTED. 
2. CAA REGIME WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE STATE. 3. H85 TEMPS WILL 
REMAIN IN THE MINUS TEENS. EVEN WITH FULL SUNSHINE...HERE AT LITTLE 
ROCK WE/D ONLY MIX OUT TO 900 MB...GIVING A HIGH IN THE LOW TO MID 
20S.

MORE COLD WEATHER CHRISTMAS MORNING. AFTER DISCUSSING WITH SEVERAL 
SURROUNDING OFFICES...FEEL THAT THE SFC RIDGE WILL STILL BE IN THE 
AREA SATURDAY MORNING. WITH CLEAR SKIES EXPECTED...LIGHT WINDS...AND 
THE SNOWPACK STILL IN PLACE...SATURDAY HAS THE POTENTIAL TO BE 
COLDER THAN FRIDAY. HOWEVER...WENT WITH SIMILAR TEMPS TO FRIDAY FOR 
SATURDAY DUE TO SLIGHTLY JILTED CONFIDENCE ON PROGRESSION OF SFC 
HIGH. BUT SITUATION BEARS WATCHING.

WAA WILL KICK BACK IN LATE SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL MAKE A NICE 
REBOUND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. KEPT SLIGHT CHANCES FOR RAIN IN THE 
FORECAST FOR MONDAY/TUESDAY TIMEFRAME. BOTH GFS AND DGEX SHOWING 
NICE RETURN FLOW ON THE BACKSIDE OF THE HIGH. INTERESTING TO NOTE 
THAT DGEX BRING +12 H85 TEMPS ALL THE WAY INTO THE UPPER MIDWEST 
MONDAY. THAT SEEMS PRETTY HOPEFUL FOR DECEMBER IN MINNESOTA/DAKOTAS. 
BUT WARMER TEMPS AND INCREASING MOISTURE MAKE IT INTO THE MIDSOUTH 
AHEAD OF NEXT SYSTEM. GFS BRINGS COLD FRONT THROUGH THE STATE 
TUESDAY. BUT ALOT OF AMBIGUITIES THAT FAR OUT WITH TIMING AND 
STRENGTH...SO JUST WENT WITH SLIGHT POPS FOR THE MONDAY/TUESDAY 
PERIOD.
&&

.COORDINATION...
THANKS TO WFO/S SGF...MEM...TUL AND PAH FOR PRODUCTIVE COORDINATION 
EFFORTS TODAY.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES....WINTER STORM WATCH FROM 600 AM 
CST WEDNESDAY UNTIL 600 PM CST WEDNESDAY FOR ZONES ARZ016...
ARZ021>025...ARZ030>031.

WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FROM MIDNIGHT CST WEDNESDAY UNTIL 600 PM CST
WEDNESDAY FOR ZONES ARZ003>007...ARZ012>015.
&&

$$

44/55/220





181 
FXUS64 KLZK 211110
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
400 AM CST TUE DEC 21 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT
RUNNING BEHIND THIS MORNING WITH LOTS TO LOOK AT. OF COURSE...THE 
PRIMARY CONCERN IS IMPENDING WINTER STORM ACROSS NORTHERN ARKANSAS 
LATE TONIGHT/WEDNESDAY.

LATEST GUIDANCE IS A LITTLE LESS AGGRESSIVE WITH MOISTURE THAN IN 
PREVIOUS RUNS. APPEARS THAT MAIN MOISTURE WILL GET SHUNTED TO THE 
EAST OVERNIGHT...WITH MOISTURE MOST ABUNDANT ALONG MISSISSIPPI 
RIVER. THERE...IN ADDITION TO RAIN BEING LIKELY THIS EVENING...
LOOKS RATHER CONVECTIVE WITH THUNDER INTRODUCED TO THE FORECAST IN 
ABOUT THE SOUTHEAST HALF OF THE STATE. SYSTEM ALOFT WILL THEN MOVE 
OVER REGION FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS WITH ABUNDANT MOISTURE SHOVED 
INTO TENNESSEE/OHIO VALLEYS. 

THIS IS NOT TO SAY THAT THERE WILL NOT BE ANY MOISTURE 
LEFT...BECAUSE THERE WILL BE. JUST NOT AS MUCH AS PREVIOUSLY 
ADVERTISED. WHAT MOISTURE IS THERE WILL CHANGE TO SNOW TONIGHT 
ACROSS NORTHERN ARKANSAS AS AN ARCTIC FRONT PLUNGES TOWARD THE GULF 
COAST. A CHANGEOVER TO SNOW WILL OCCUR IN CENTRAL SECTIONS OF THE 
STATE BY MIDDAY WEDNESDAY...WITH SNOW IN THE SOUTH BY WEDNESDAY
EVENING. 

THE PRECIPITATION SHIELD WILL BE NORTH OF DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE 
HEADING FROM EASTERN TEXAS ACROSS THE GULF COAST. SINCE THIS WILL BE 
A RATHER LONG TERM EVENT...LIGHT SNOW IN THE NORTH WILL ACCUMULATE 
OVER TIME. CURRENTLY...CALLING FOR UP TO 5 INCHES IN SOME 
AREAS...ALTHOUGH 2 TO 4 INCHES WILL BE COMMON. MUCH MORE SNOW IN THE 
OFFING TOWARD THE OHIO VALLEY WHERE MORE ABUNDANT MOISTURE WILL 
RESIDE.

IN ADDITION TO THE MOISTURE ISSUE...ALSO CONCERNED ABOUT WARM GROUND 
TEMPERATURES. THIS WILL CUT DOWN ON SNOW ACCUMULATIONS 
INITIALLY...AND WILL HAVE AN IMPACT ON STORM TOTALS.

ASIDE FROM THIS...GIVEN THE EXPECTED SNOW IN THE NORTH...HAVE 
CONTINUED A WINTER STORM WATCH LATE TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY IN AREAS 
NORTH OF CLARKSVILLE AND BATESVILLE.

LIGHT SNOW WILL BE FLYING IN MUCH OF ARKANSAS BY WEDNESDAY EVENING 
AFTER TEMPERATURES FALL THROUGHOUT THE DAY. SNOW WILL EVENTUALLY 
COME TO AN END BEFORE DAWN THURSDAY.

LOOKING AHEAD...LOOKS DRY THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. HOWEVER... 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE WELL BELOW NORMAL...WITH THE COLDEST AIR OF THE 
SEASON THUS FAR.  (46)       
&&

.LONG TERM...SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY
UPPER TROUGH IS EAST OF ARKANSAS ON SATURDAY WITH AN UPPER RIDGE 
OVER THE WESTERN U.S. THIS WILL PROVIDE NORTHWEST FLOW OVER ARKANSAS 
FOR A SHORT TIME WITH COLD TEMPERATURES AND HIGH PRESSURE THE RESULT 
AT THE SURFACE. SOUTHWEST FLOW RETURNS ON SUNDAY AND WILL BRING A 
WARM UP TO THE AREA. DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY. MOISTURE INCREASES ACROSS THE AREA MONDAY AND A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF RAIN SHOWERS IS EXPECTED BY LATE MONDAY AS A COLD FRONT 
APPROACHES FROM THE NORTHWEST. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    59  39  39  22 /  50  80  90  60 
HARRISON AR       53  28  28  14 /  40  90  90  60 
HOT SPRINGS AR    61  38  38  22 /  40  80  90  60 
PINE BLUFF AR     61  41  41  24 /  50  80  90  60 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  52  29  29  15 /  40  90  90  60 
MONTICELLO AR     63  44  44  26 /  50  80  80  60 
SEARCY AR         55  37  37  21 /  50  80  90  60 
MOUNT IDA AR      62  37  37  22 /  40  80  90  60 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   58  35  35  20 /  40  80  90  60 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...WINTER STORM WATCH IN NORTHERN 
ARKANSAS LATE TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY FOR ZONES ARZ003>007... 
ARZ012>016...021>024.
&&

46/51






815 
FXUS64 KLZK 210413 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1007 PM CST MON DEC 20 2004

.DISCUSSION...
MINOR ADJUSTMENTS MADE TO WINDS THAT ARE STAYING UP A BIT AND THUS 
BUMPED OVERNIGHT LOWS A BIT. ALSO TWEAKED DEWPOINTS TO AGREE WITH 
PRESENT CONDITIONS. WIND CHILLS AND RH ADJUSTED TO NEW DATA. REST OF 
FORECAST APPEARS REASONABLE.
(38)  
&&

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION
252 PM CST MON DEC 20 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY
WILL BE BRIEF...MAIN CONCERN IS POTENTIAL FOR A WINTER WEATHER EVENT 
LATE TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.

OVERALL UPPER LEVEL PATTERNS WILL BECOME QUITE ENERGETIC DURING THIS 
PERIOD. SEVERAL SHORT WAVES IN SPLIT FLOW WILL HELP CARVE A TROUGH 
INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS BY LATE WEDNESDAY. STRONG ISENTROPIC LIFT 
WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE REGIONBY LATE TUESDAY. FORECAST SOUNDINGS 
AND VERTICAL MOTIONS FIELDS SUPPORT AN AREA OF SNOW ACROSS MUCH OF 
THE NORTH LATE TUESDAY...SPREADING SLOWLY SOUTH ON WEDNESDAY.  
PRECIPITATION WILL DIMINISH FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST ON WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT.  HAVE ISSUED A WINTER STORM WATCH FOR THE POTENTIAL FOR 
SIGNIFICANT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS.

THANKS FOR EXTRA COORDINATION SGF...PAH...MEG...AND HPC.

&&

.LONG TERM...FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY
AFTER A BUSY SHORT TERM...QUIET BUT COLD WEATHER WILL MOVE INTO THE 
STATE FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD...ALTHOUGH SEVERAL FORECAST 
COMPLEXITIES MANAGED TO CREEP INTO THE MIX.

ARCTIC AIR MASS WILL BE MOVING INTO THE STATE AT THE BEGINNING OF 
THE LONG TERM. FEEL THAT GFS MAY BE A BIT OVERZEALOUS BY BRINGING 
H85 -10 ISOTHERM CLEAR TO THE MEXICAN BORDER..SO SOUTHERN EXTENT OF 
COLD AIR IS LIKELY OVER DONE THERE. HOWEVER...BOTH GFS AND DGEX ARE 
BRINGING -12 TO -16 H85 TEMPS TO NORTHERN AR FRIDAY MORNING. WITH 
THE POSSIBILITY OF NORTHERN STRETCHES OF THE STATE HAVING SEVERAL 
INCHES OF SNOW ON THE GROUND...WENT AHEAD AND LOWERED TEMPS A BIT. 
WITH -15C AT 850MB AND SNOW ON THE GROUND...NEAR ZERO WOULD BE 
POSSIBLE. ONLY SAVING GRACE FRIDAY MORNING WOULD BE A CLOUD LAYER 
MOVING IN AS MOISTURE ROTATES THROUGH THE BOTTOM OF THE H5 TROUGH. 
WAS TEMPTED TO ADD SLIGHT POPS...BUT FEEL THAT THERE WON/T BE ENOUGH 
TO LIFT TO PRECIPITATE ANY MOISTURE OUT.

SATURDAY MORNING COULD BE A DIFFERENT STORY THOUGH. SFC HIGH WILL BE 
CENTERED OVER SOUTHERN MO SATURDAY MORNING. WINDS WILL CALM...SKIES 
WILL BE CLEAR...FRESH SNOW WILL BE ON THE GROUND. ALTHOUGH 8H5 TEMPS 
LOOK TO BE IMPROVING...THE MODELS HAVE A TENDENCY TO SPEED UP THE 
PROGRESSION OF THE SFC HIGHS. SO WHAT AM I SAYING...CHRISTMAS 
MORNING COULD BE QUITE COLD ACROSS ARKANSAS.

HIGH MOVES OFF SUNDAY AND WAA REGIME TAKES HOLD. SOUTHERLY WINDS 
LATE IN THE WEEKEND WILL BRING WARMER AIR/MORE MOISTURE INTO 
NORTHERN ARKANSAS. WARMER AIR MOVING OVER THE SNOW PACK WILL ALLOW 
IT THE SNOW TO QUICKLY MELT. MAY HAVE TO CONSIDER FOG LATE IN THE 
WEEKEND/EARLY IN THE WEEK. BUT ALL OF THAT IS DEPENDENT ON HOW 
MUCH/WHEN/WHERE SNOW FALLS WEDNESDAY. SKIES LOOK TO REMAIN FAIRLY 
CLEAR HEADING THROUGH MONDAY THOUGH...BUT DGEX AND GFS HINTING AND 
NEXT SYSTEM FOR LATER NEXT WEEK. MORE MOISTURE MAY BE AVAILABLE THIS 
TIME AROUND...WILL HAVE TO KEEP A CLOSE EYE ON IT. (220) &&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    41  57  39  39 /   0  50  70  70 
HARRISON AR       36  53  28  30 /   0  40  80  60 
HOT SPRINGS AR    42  58  39  39 /   0  50  70  70 
PINE BLUFF AR     42  59  41  44 /   0  50  70  80 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  36  53  28  30 /   0  40  80  70 
MONTICELLO AR     43  61  44  47 /   0  50  80  80 
SEARCY AR         40  56  37  37 /   0  50  80  70 
MOUNT IDA AR      42  58  37  37 /   0  50  80  60 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   40  55  35  35 /   0  50  80  60 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...WINTER STORM WATCH FROM 600 
PM CST TUESDAY UNTIL 559 PM CST WEDNESDAY FOR ZONES 
ARZ003>007...ARZ012>016...ARZ021>024

&&

AFTER A BUSY SHORT TERM...QUIET BUT COLD WEATHER WILL MOVE INTO THE 
STATE FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD...ALTHOUGH SEVERAL FORECAST 
COMPLEXITIES MANAGED TO CREEP INTO THE MIX.

THE LONG TERM. FEEL THAT GFS MAY BE A BIT OVERZEALOUS BY BRINGING 
H85 -10 ISOTHERM CLEAR TO THE MEXICAN BORDER..SO SOUTHERN EXTENT OF

WAS TEMPTED TO ADD SLIGHT POPS...BUT FEEL THAT THERE WON/T BE ENOUGH 
TO LIFT TO PRECIPITATE ANY MOISTURE OUT.

CENTERED OVER SOUTHERN MO SATURDAY MORNING. WINDS WILL CALM...SKIES 
WILL BE CLEAR...FRESH SNOW WILL BE ON THE GROUND. ALTHOUGH 8H5 TEMPS

PROGRESSION OF THE SFC HIGHS. SO WHAT AM I SAYING...CHRISTMAS 
MORNING COULD BE QUITE COLD ACROSS ARKANSAS.

HIGH MOVES OFF SUNDAY AND WAA REGIME TAKES HOLD. SOUTHERLY WINDS 
LATE IN THE WEEKEND WILL BRING WARMER AIR/MORE MOISTURE INTO 
NORTHERN ARKANSAS. WARMER AIR MOVING OVER THE SNOW PACK WILL ALLOW 
IT THE SNOW TO QUICKLY MELT. MAY HAVE TO CONSIDER FOG LATE IN THE 
WEEKEND/EARLY IN THE WEEK. BUT ALL OF THAT IS DEPENDENT ON HOW 
MUCH/WHEN/WHERE SNOW FALLS WEDNESDAY. SKIES LOOK TO REMAIN FAIRLY 
CLEAR HEADING THROUGH MONDAY THOUGH...BUT DGEX AND GFS HINTING AND 
NEXT SYSTEM FOR LATER NEXT WEEK. MORE MOISTURE MAY BE AVAILABLE THIS 
TIME AROUND...WILL HAVE TO KEEP A CLOSE EYE ON IT. (220) &&

PM CST TUESDAY UNTIL 559 PM CST WEDNESDAY FOR ZONES 
ARZ003>007...ARZ012>016...ARZ021>024

55/56/220






000 
FXUS64 KLZK 202105
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
252 PM CST MON DEC 20 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY
WILL BE BRIEF...MAIN CONCERN IS POTENTIAL FOR A WINTER WEATHER EVENT 
LATE TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.

OVERALL UPPER LEVEL PATTERNS WILL BECOME QUITE ENERGETIC DURING THIS 
PERIOD. SEVERAL SHORT WAVES IN SPLIT FLOW WILL HELP CARVE A TROUGH 
INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS BY LATE WEDNESDAY. STRONG ISENTROPIC LIFT 
WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE REGIONBY LATE TUESDAY. FORECAST SOUNDINGS AND 
VERTICAL MOTIONS FIELDS SUPPORT AN AREA OF SNOW ACROSS MUCH OF THE 
NORTH LATE TUESDAY...SPREADING SLOWLY SOUTH ON WEDNESDAY.  
PRECIPITATION WILL DIMINISH FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST ON WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT.  HAVE ISSUED A WINTER STORM WATCH FOR THE POTENTIAL FOR 
SIGNIFICANT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS.

THANKS FOR EXTRA COORDINATION SGF...PAH...MEG...AND HPC.

&&

.LONG TERM...FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY
AFTER A BUSY SHORT TERM...QUIET BUT COLD WEATHER WILL MOVE INTO THE 
STATE FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD...ALTHOUGH SEVERAL FORECAST 
COMPLEXITIES MANAGED TO CREEP INTO THE MIX.

ARCTIC AIR MASS WILL BE MOVING INTO THE STATE AT THE BEGINNING OF 
THE LONG TERM. FEEL THAT GFS MAY BE A BIT OVERZEALOUS BY BRINGING 
H85 -10 ISOTHERM CLEAR TO THE MEXICAN BORDER..SO SOUTHERN EXTENT OF 
COLD AIR IS LIKELY OVER DONE THERE. HOWEVER...BOTH GFS AND DGEX ARE 
BRINGING -12 TO -16 H85 TEMPS TO NORTHERN AR FRIDAY MORNING. WITH 
THE POSSIBILITY OF NORTHERN STRETCHES OF THE STATE HAVING SEVERAL 
INCHES OF SNOW ON THE GROUND...WENT AHEAD AND LOWERED TEMPS A BIT. 
WITH -15C AT 850MB AND SNOW ON THE GROUND...NEAR ZERO WOULD BE 
POSSIBLE. ONLY SAVING GRACE FRIDAY MORNING WOULD BE A CLOUD LAYER 
MOVING IN AS MOISTURE ROTATES THROUGH THE BOTTOM OF THE H5 TROUGH. 
WAS TEMPTED TO ADD SLIGHT POPS...BUT FEEL THAT THERE WON/T BE ENOUGH 
TO LIFT TO PRECIPITATE ANY MOISTURE OUT.

SATURDAY MORNING COULD BE A DIFFERENT STORY THOUGH. SFC HIGH WILL BE 
CENTERED OVER SOUTHERN MO SATURDAY MORNING. WINDS WILL CALM...SKIES 
WILL BE CLEAR...FRESH SNOW WILL BE ON THE GROUND. ALTHOUGH 8H5 TEMPS 
LOOK TO BE IMPROVING...THE MODELS HAVE A TENDENCY TO SPEED UP THE 
PROGRESSION OF THE SFC HIGHS. SO WHAT AM I SAYING...CHRISTMAS 
MORNING COULD BE QUITE COLD ACROSS ARKANSAS.

HIGH MOVES OFF SUNDAY AND WAA REGIME TAKES HOLD. SOUTHERLY WINDS LATE 
IN THE WEEKEND WILL BRING WARMER AIR/MORE MOISTURE INTO NORTHERN 
ARKANSAS. WARMER AIR MOVING OVER THE SNOW PACK WILL ALLOW IT THE 
SNOW TO QUICKLY MELT. MAY HAVE TO CONSIDER FOG LATE IN THE 
WEEKEND/EARLY IN THE WEEK. BUT ALL OF THAT IS DEPENDENT ON HOW 
MUCH/WHEN/WHERE SNOW FALLS WEDNESDAY. SKIES LOOK TO REMAIN FAIRLY 
CLEAR HEADING THROUGH MONDAY THOUGH...BUT DGEX AND GFS HINTING AND 
NEXT SYSTEM FOR LATER NEXT WEEK. MORE MOISTURE MAY BE AVAILABLE THIS 
TIME AROUND...WILL HAVE TO KEEP A CLOSE EYE ON IT. (220)
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    41  57  39  39 /   0  50  70  70 
HARRISON AR       36  53  28  30 /   0  40  80  60 
HOT SPRINGS AR    42  58  39  39 /   0  50  70  70 
PINE BLUFF AR     42  59  41  44 /   0  50  70  80 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  36  53  28  30 /   0  40  80  70 
MONTICELLO AR     43  61  44  47 /   0  50  80  80 
SEARCY AR         40  56  37  37 /   0  50  80  70 
MOUNT IDA AR      42  58  37  37 /   0  50  80  60 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   40  55  35  35 /   0  50  80  60 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...WINTER STORM WATCH FROM 600 
PM CST TUESDAY UNTIL 559 PM CST WEDNESDAY FOR ZONES 
ARZ003>007...ARZ012>016...ARZ021>024

55/56/220






725 
FXUS64 KLZK 201656
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1045 AM CST MON DEC 20 2004

.DISCUSSION...
UPDATE NEEDED THIS MORNING TO TREND GRIDS/ZONES TO CURRENT 
CONDITIONS. NOT A CLOUD IN THE SKY THIS MORNING AS HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL CONTINUE TO DOMINATE FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY. WINDS HAVE 
COME UP JUST ABOUT EVERYWHERE AND WITH GRADIENT ONLY EXPECTED TO 
TIGHTEN THROUGH EARLY AFTERNOON...CURRENT LAKE WIND ADVISORY LOOKS 
GOOD. 

TEMPERATURES A BIT PROBLEMATIC WITH AIR MASS SLOW TO WARM AFTER VERY 
CHILLY START. WARMER AIR ALREADY STARTING TO NOSE INTO THE SOUTHWEST 
CORNER OF THE STATE WITH READINGS STILL IN THE 20S STILL OVER THE 
FAR NORTHEAST. HAVE TRENDED TEMPERATURES WARMER FROM SOUTHWEST TO 
NORTHEAST FOR THE REMAINDER OF TODAY. OTHER CHANGES INCLUDE 
ADJUSTMENTS TO CLOUD COVER AND DEW POINTS.

&&
PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 400 AM CST MON DEC 20 2004
SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT
BUSY SHORT TERM TO SAY THE LEAST. THE HEADLINER WILL BE THE 
POTENTIAL FOR A WINTER STORM TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY. MORE ON THAT 
LATER.

FIRST...A LOOK AT TODAY. ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE WILL HEAD TO THE 
EAST...WITH A STORM SYSTEM JUST BEGINNING TO DEVELOP IN THE HIGH 
PLAINS. BETWEEN THE TWO SYSTEMS...QUITE THE PRESSURE GRADIENT AND 
MORE SO THAN WAS EXPERIENCED ON SUNDAY. GIVEN THAT WINDS WERE FAIRLY 
BREEZY ON SUNDAY...WOULD SURMISE THAT GUSTS WILL BE STRONGER TODAY. 
SO...HAVE POSTED LAKE WIND ADVISORY FOR MOST OF ARKANSAS THROUGH 
THIS AFTERNOON.

TONIGHT/TUESDAY...SYSTEM IN THE SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL COME TOGETHER 
MORE. SOUTHERLY WINDS AHEAD OF SYSTEM WILL BRING WARMER CONDITIONS...
WITH HIGH TEMPERATURES TUESDAY AFTERNOON IN THE 50S/60S. SO WHY ARE 
WE MENTIONING WINTER WEATHER DURING THE THE MIDWEEK TIME FRAME?

AS HAS BEEN THE CASE LATELY...THE POLAR JET WILL BRING ANOTHER IN A 
SERIES OF ARCTIC FRONTS FROM THE NORTH LATE TUESDAY/WEDNESDAY. THE 
ODDITY HERE IS THAT THE SUBTROPICAL JET HAS BEEN QUIET FOR AWHILE...
WITH COLD/DRY WEATHER THE NORM. NOT THIS TIME. PLENTY OF ENERGY 
PROVIDED BY THE SUBTROPICAL JET NOT TO MENTION DECENT AMOUNT OF 
MOISTURE. STORM SYSTEM IN SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL RAPIDLY STRENGTHEN
BY WEDNESDAY...AND WILL RESIDE ALONG THE CENTRAL GULF COAST. WITH
MOISTURE SURROUNDING THE SYSTEM AND WITH COLD AIR IN PLACE...SNOW
IS IN THE FORECAST.

SNOW WILL BEGIN DEVELOPING IN NORTHWEST ARKANSAS TUESDAY NIGHT 
BEFORE SPREADING INTO CENTRAL SECTIONS OF THE STATE BY WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES WILL BE FALLING STATEWIDE DURING THIS 
TIME FRAME. BY WEDNESDAY EVENING...SNOW WILL REMAIN LIKELY IN MOST 
AREAS EXCEPT FOR MAYBE THE SOUTHEAST. IT APPEARS THAT PRECIPITATION 
WILL END LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

AT THIS TIME...IT APPEARS THAT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS MAY MEET WARNING 
CRITERIA...WITH PERHAPS 3 OR 4 INCHES IN THE NORTHERN COUNTIES. 
TOWARD CENTRAL SECTIONS OF THE STATE...AN INCH OR TWO OF SNOW IS NOT 
OUT OF THE QUESTION. AS IS THE CASE WITH MOST WINTER STORMS AROUND 
HERE...EVERYTHING WILL HINGE ON HOW QUICKLY COLD AIR SPREADS THROUGH 
THE STATE AND HOW MUCH MOISTURE WILL BE AVAILABLE. SINCE THIS EVENT 
IS STILL A COUPLE OF DAYS AWAY...CONFIDENCE IS A LITTLE SHAKY.

AFTER THE SYSTEM DEPARTS WEDNESDAY NIGHT...THE SHORT TERM WILL
END ON A BITTERLY COLD NOTE ON THURSDAY. (46) 
&&          

.LONG TERM...FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY
UPPER TROUGH FINALLY MOVES EAST OF THE AREA FRIDAY. SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE MOVES INTO THE AREA ON FRIDAY AND WILL REMAIN OVER THE 
REGION THROUGH THE CHRISTMAS WEEKEND. EXPECT DRY CONDITIONS THROUGH 
THE EXTENDED PERIOD. MAIN CONSIDERATION WILL BE COLD TEMPERATURES. 
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE IN PLACE WITH LIGHT WINDS ALLOWING 
TEMPERATURES TO DIP DURING THE NIGHTS. FRIDAY NIGHT LOW TEMPERATURES 
SHOULD BE IN THE SINGLE DIGITS NORTH WITH TEENS IN THE SOUTH. WARMER 
TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED SUNDAY AS THE HIGH PRESSURE MOVES EAST AND 
SOUTHWEST FLOW RETURNS TO THE AREA. 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 400 AM CST MON DEC 20 2004
SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT
BUSY SHORT TERM TO SAY THE LEAST. THE HEADLINER WILL BE THE 
POTENTIAL FOR A WINTER STORM TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY. MORE ON THAT 
LATER.

FIRST...A LOOK AT TODAY. ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE WILL HEAD TO THE 
EAST...WITH A STORM SYSTEM JUST BEGINNING TO DEVELOP IN THE HIGH 
PLAINS. BETWEEN THE TWO SYSTEMS...QUITE THE PRESSURE GRADIENT AND 
MORE SO THAN WAS EXPERIENCED ON SUNDAY. GIVEN THAT WINDS WERE FAIRLY 
BREEZY ON SUNDAY...WOULD SURMISE THAT GUSTS WILL BE STRONGER TODAY. 
SO...HAVE POSTED LAKE WIND ADVISORY FOR MOST OF ARKANSAS THROUGH 
THIS AFTERNOON.

TONIGHT/TUESDAY...SYSTEM IN THE SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL COME TOGETHER 
MORE. SOUTHERLY WINDS AHEAD OF SYSTEM WILL BRING WARMER CONDITIONS...
WITH HIGH TEMPERATURES TUESDAY AFTERNOON IN THE 50S/60S. SO WHY ARE 
WE MENTIONING WINTER WEATHER DURING THE THE MIDWEEK TIME FRAME?

AS HAS BEEN THE CASE LATELY...THE POLAR JET WILL BRING ANOTHER IN A 
SERIES OF ARCTIC FRONTS FROM THE NORTH LATE TUESDAY/WEDNESDAY. THE 
ODDITY HERE IS THAT THE SUBTROPICAL JET HAS BEEN QUIET FOR AWHILE...
WITH COLD/DRY WEATHER THE NORM. NOT THIS TIME. PLENTY OF ENERGY 
PROVIDED BY THE SUBTROPICAL JET NOT TO MENTION DECENT AMOUNT OF 
MOISTURE. STORM SYSTEM IN SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL RAPIDLY STRENGTHEN
BY WEDNESDAY...AND WILL RESIDE ALONG THE CENTRAL GULF COAST. WITH
MOISTURE SURROUNDING THE SYSTEM AND WITH COLD AIR IN PLACE...SNOW
IS IN THE FORECAST.

SNOW WILL BEGIN DEVELOPING IN NORTHWEST ARKANSAS TUESDAY NIGHT 
BEFORE SPREADING INTO CENTRAL SECTIONS OF THE STATE BY WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES WILL BE FALLING STATEWIDE DURING THIS 
TIME FRAME. BY WEDNESDAY EVENING...SNOW WILL REMAIN LIKELY IN MOST 
AREAS EXCEPT FOR MAYBE THE SOUTHEAST. IT APPEARS THAT PRECIPITATION 
WILL END LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

AT THIS TIME...IT APPEARS THAT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS MAY MEET WARNING 
CRITERIA...WITH PERHAPS 3 OR 4 INCHES IN THE NORTHERN COUNTIES. 
TOWARD CENTRAL SECTIONS OF THE STATE...AN INCH OR TWO OF SNOW IS NOT 
OUT OF THE QUESTION. AS IS THE CASE WITH MOST WINTER STORMS AROUND 
HERE...EVERYTHING WILL HINGE ON HOW QUICKLY COLD AIR SPREADS THROUGH 
THE STATE AND HOW MUCH MOISTURE WILL BE AVAILABLE. SINCE THIS EVENT 
IS STILL A COUPLE OF DAYS AWAY...CONFIDENCE IS A LITTLE SHAKY.

AFTER THE SYSTEM DEPARTS WEDNESDAY NIGHT...THE SHORT TERM WILL
END ON A BITTERLY COLD NOTE ON THURSDAY. (46) 
&&          

.LONG TERM...FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY
UPPER TROUGH FINALLY MOVES EAST OF THE AREA FRIDAY. SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE MOVES INTO THE AREA ON FRIDAY AND WILL REMAIN OVER THE 
REGION THROUGH THE CHRISTMAS WEEKEND. EXPECT DRY CONDITIONS THROUGH 
THE EXTENDED PERIOD. MAIN CONSIDERATION WILL BE COLD TEMPERATURES. 
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE IN PLACE WITH LIGHT WINDS ALLOWING 
TEMPERATURES TO DIP DURING THE NIGHTS. FRIDAY NIGHT LOW TEMPERATURES 
SHOULD BE IN THE SINGLE DIGITS NORTH WITH TEENS IN THE SOUTH. WARMER 
TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED SUNDAY AS THE HIGH PRESSURE MOVES EAST AND 
SOUTHWEST FLOW RETURNS TO THE AREA.

430 
FXUS64 KLZK 200357 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
950 PM CST SUN DEC 19 2004

.DISCUSSION...
ADJUSTED DEWPOINTS TO BETTER AGREE WITH CURRENT DATA. TEMPERATURE 
AND WINDS FOR OVERNIGHT STILL LOOK ON TRACK SO NO ADJUSTMENT NEEDED 
THERE. FRESHENED UP THE EVENING WORDING.
(38)

&&

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
245 PM CST SUN DEC 19 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT
CHALLENGING FORECAST TO SAY THE LEAST. COLDER AIR HAS CONTINUED TO 
FLOW SOUTHWARD INTO ARKANSAS THIS AFTERNOON. HIGH TEMPERATURES 
GENERALLY OCCURRED EARLY IN THE DAY...THEN FELL SLOWLY OR HELD 
STEADY. 

VERY COLD NIGHT IN STORE FOR THE AREA TONIGHT. READINGS WILL 
FALL TO NEAR 10 DEGREES IN THE NORTH UPWARDS TO LOWER 20S IN THE 
SOUTH. COULD EVEN SEE A FEW SINGLE DIGITS IN THE FAR NORTHERN 
VALLEYS. A FAIR BREEZE WILL CONTINUE TONIGHT...THUS WIND CHILL 
INDICES WILL ALSO BE QUITE COLD. WILL ISSUE A WIND CHILL ADVISORY 
FOR THE NORTHERN TWO TIERS OF COUNTIES FOR TONIGHT AS WIND CHILLS 
FALL INTO THE 0 TO -5 RANGE...AND MAYBE A LITTLE COLDER IN THE 
VALLEYS. 

AFTER A VERY COLD START MONDAY MORNING...HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
SHIFT RAPIDLY OFF TO THE EAST AND BRING A RETURN OF BREEZY SOUTHERLY 
WINDS. VERY RAPID WARMUP EXPECTED ON MONDAY WITH AFTERNOON 
TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 40S TO MID 50S. DRY CONDITIONS EXPECTED 
MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. SHORT WAVE AHEAD OF MAIN UPPER LEVEL TROF 
WILL BRING SMALL CHANCES OF RAIN TO THE AREA ON TUESDAY. 
TEMPERATURES ON TUESDAY WILL BE EVEN WARMER THAN THOSE ON MONDAY 
WITH READINGS 50S AND LOWER 60S. THAT...HOWEVER...WILL BE THE END OF 
THE MILDER READINGS. 

MAIN H5 TROF WILL BEGIN TO AFFECT THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT WITH MUCH 
COLDER AIR MOVING INTO THE STATE FROM THE NORTH. CHANCES FOR SNOW 
WILL INCREASE OVER THE NORTH AS THE NIGHT PROGRESSES. A MIX OF RAIN 
AND SNOW WILL BE POSSIBLE OVER THE CENTRAL SECTIONS...WITH MAINLY 
RAIN IN THE SOUTH. FAIRLY CLASSIC SETUP FOR A GOOD SNOW IN THE NORTH 
INDICATED BY GFS. SNOWFALL TOTALS IN THE NORTH EXPECTED IN THE 1 TO 
3 INCH RANGE TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY WITH POSSIBLY MORE ON THE 
RIDGELINES. PRECIPITATION SHOULD CHANGE OVER TO SNOW ACROSS THE 
ENTIRE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY
UPPER LEVEL TROF REMAINS OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY...BUT 
FINALLY MOVES BY DURING THE DAY ON FRIDAY. WRAPAROUND MOISTURE 
CONTINUES TO SLOWLY LIFT NORTHEASTWARD AWAY FROM THE AREA ON 
THURSDAY...SO DECREASING CHANCES OF LIGHT SNOW. MAIN TROF LINE COMES 
INTO THE AREA FROM THE WEST ON THURSDAY NIGHT. PUT SOME SMALL SNOW 
POPS IN FOR THURSDAY NIGHT. DRY CONDITIONS SHOULD RETURN ON FRIDAY 
AND CONTINUE INTO THE CHRISTMAS WEEKEND. TEMPERATURES...HOWEVER... 
WILL REMAIN COLD. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    18  53  39  57 /   0   0  10  30 
HARRISON AR       15  52  37  50 /   0   0  10  20 
HOT SPRINGS AR    19  55  41  57 /   0   0  10  30 
PINE BLUFF AR     19  52  39  60 /   0   0  10  40 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  12  49  36  50 /   0   0  10  30 
MONTICELLO AR     19  52  39  62 /   0   0  10  40 
SEARCY AR         15  49  37  54 /   0   0  10  30 
MOUNT IDA AR      19  55  41  56 /   0   0  10  30 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   15  54  38  54 /   0   0  10  30 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...WIND CHILL ADVISORY FROM MIDNIGHT 
CST MONDAY UNTIL 700 AM CST MONDAY FOR ZONES ARZ003>007...ARZ012>015.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
950 PM CST SUN DEC 19 2004

.DISCUSSION...
ADJUSTED DEWPOINTS TO BETTER AGREE WITH CURRENT DATA. TEMPERATURE 
AND WINDS FOR OVERNIGHT STILL LOOK ON TRACK SO NO ADJUSTMENT NEEDED 
THERE. FRESHENED UP THE EVENING WORDING.
(38)

&&

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
245 PM CST SUN DEC 19 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT
CHALLENGING FORECAST TO SAY THE LEAST. COLDER AIR HAS CONTINUED TO 
FLOW SOUTHWARD INTO ARKANSAS THIS AFTERNOON. HIGH TEMPERATURES 
GENERALLY OCCURRED EARLY IN THE DAY...THEN FELL SLOWLY OR HELD 
STEADY. 

VERY COLD NIGHT IN STORE FOR THE AREA TONIGHT. READINGS WILL 
FALL TO NEAR 10 DEGREES IN THE NORTH UPWARDS TO LOWER 20S IN THE 
SOUTH. COULD EVEN SEE A FEW SINGLE DIGITS IN THE FAR NORTHERN 
VALLEYS. A FAIR BREEZE WILL CONTINUE TONIGHT...THUS WIND CHILL 
INDICES WILL ALSO BE QUITE COLD. WILL ISSUE A WIND CHILL ADVISORY 
FOR THE NORTHERN TWO TIERS OF COUNTIES FOR TONIGHT AS WIND CHILLS 
FALL INTO THE 0 TO -5 RANGE...AND MAYBE A LITTLE COLDER IN THE 
VALLEYS. 

AFTER A VERY COLD START MONDAY MORNING...HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
SHIFT RAPIDLY OFF TO THE EAST AND BRING A RETURN OF BREEZY SOUTHERLY 
WINDS. VERY RAPID WARMUP EXPECTED ON MONDAY WITH AFTERNOON 
TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 40S TO MID 50S. DRY CONDITIONS EXPECTED 
MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. SHORT WAVE AHEAD OF MAIN UPPER LEVEL TROF 
WILL BRING SMALL CHANCES OF RAIN TO THE AREA ON TUESDAY. 
TEMPERATURES ON TUESDAY WILL BE EVEN WARMER THAN THOSE ON MONDAY 
WITH READINGS 50S AND LOWER 60S. THAT...HOWEVER...WILL BE THE END OF 
THE MILDER READINGS. 

MAIN H5 TROF WILL BEGIN TO AFFECT THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT WITH MUCH 
COLDER AIR MOVING INTO THE STATE FROM THE NORTH. CHANCES FOR SNOW 
WILL INCREASE OVER THE NORTH AS THE NIGHT PROGRESSES. A MIX OF RAIN 
AND SNOW WILL BE POSSIBLE OVER THE CENTRAL SECTIONS...WITH MAINLY 
RAIN IN THE SOUTH. FAIRLY CLASSIC SETUP FOR A GOOD SNOW IN THE NORTH 
INDICATED BY GFS. SNOWFALL TOTALS IN THE NORTH EXPECTED IN THE 1 TO 
3 INCH RANGE TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY WITH POSSIBLY MORE ON THE 
RIDGELINES. PRECIPITATION SHOULD CHANGE OVER TO SNOW ACROSS THE 
ENTIRE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY
UPPER LEVEL TROF REMAINS OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY...BUT 
FINALLY MOVES BY DURING THE DAY ON FRIDAY. WRAPAROUND MOISTURE 
CONTINUES TO SLOWLY LIFT NORTHEASTWARD AWAY FROM THE AREA ON 
THURSDAY...SO DECREASING CHANCES OF LIGHT SNOW. MAIN TROF LINE COMES 
INTO THE AREA FROM THE WEST ON THURSDAY NIGHT. PUT SOME SMALL SNOW 
POPS IN FOR THURSDAY NIGHT. DRY CONDITIONS SHOULD RETURN ON FRIDAY 
AND CONTINUE INTO THE CHRISTMAS WEEKEND. TEMPERATURES...HOWEVER... 
WILL REMAIN COLD. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...


231 
FXUS64 KLZK 191019
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
400 AM CST SUN DEC 19 2004

.SHORT TERM...
COLD FRONT PUSHING SOUTH OF ARKANSAS THIS MORNING...WITH ANOTHER 
SHOT OF ARCTIC AIR. TEMPERATURES AS A WHOLE WILL BE STEADY OR SLOWLY 
FALLING TODAY...ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTHEAST HALF OF THE STATE. 

WILL BE BREEZY TODAY CENTRAL/EAST BEHIND THE FRONT...WITH WINDS 
SUBSIDING TONIGHT UNDER DOME OF ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE. HIGH WILL 
BRING TEMPERATURES IN THE TEENS TO NORTHEAST ARKANSAS TONIGHT...WITH 
RETURN FLOW IN THE WEST KEEPING TEMPERATURES IN THE 20S.

RETURN FLOW WILL REALLY GET CRANKING ON MONDAY...WITH WINDY AND 
WARMER CONDITIONS. WITH DRY WEATHER CONTINUING...TEMPERATURES WILL 
TOP OUT IN THE 40S/50S. FORECAST TO THIS POINT SOUNDS SIMPLE...BUT 
COMPLEXITY LIES AHEAD.

PATTERN CHANGE SET FOR UPCOMING WEEK...AS HIGH PRESSURE IN THE WEST 
RETROGRADES INTO THE PACIFIC AND TROUGH DEEPENS IN THE ROCKIES. 
STORM SYSTEM WILL BEGIN INTENSIFYING IN THE SOUTHERN PLAINS BY EARLY 
TUESDAY...WITH MOISTURE RAPIDLY INCREASING AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM 
TUESDAY AFTERNOON/NIGHT.

INITIALLY...WILL BE TOO WARM FOR ANYTHING BUT RAIN TUESDAY 
AFTERNOON/EVENING. HOWEVER...SYSTEM WILL BEGIN TO HEAD EAST 
OVERNIGHT TUESDAY...WITH NORTHERLY WIND BRINGING COLDER 
AIR.

AT THIS TIME...APPEARS THAT RAIN/SNOW MIX WILL OCCUR TUESDAY NIGHT 
IN THE NORTH...WITH THE MIX SPREADING INTO ABOUT THE NORTHWEST HALF 
OF THE STATE ON WEDNESDAY. COULD BE SOME ACCUMULATING SNOW IN PARTS 
OF THE NORTH/WEST...BUT A LITTLE TOO EARLY TO SAY HOW MUCH WITH ANY 
CONFIDENCE. WILL MENTION THAT SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE WILL RESIDE TO 
THE EAST OF ARKANSAS BY WEDNESDAY...SO WOULD THINK THAT ANY SNOW 
WOULD BE LIGHT. 

HEADING INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT...PRECIPITATION WILL COME TO A 
CLOSE...WITH VERY COLD AIR LEFT BEHIND TO START THE LONG TERM. 
(46)                      
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH CONTINUES ACROSS THE AREA THURSDAY. UPPER RIDGE 
CONTINUES ALONG WEST COAST OF THE U.S. GFS IS PRETTY CONSISTENT WITH 
THE UPPER TROUGH. SEVERAL SHORT WAVES WILL ROTATE AROUND THIS TROUGH 
AND BRING SMALL CHANCES OF LIGHT SNOW TO THE AREA. WILL INCLUDE 
SLIGHT CHANCES THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING. GFS IS A 
LITTLE FASTER WITH THIS SYSTEM THAN PREVIOUS RUNS. PRECIP SHOULD BE 
EAST OF AREA BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN FOR 
FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY AND WILL NOT EXPECT ANY PRECIPITATION 
DURING THIS TIME. 

TEMPERATURES WILL BE COLD DURING THE EXTENDED PERIOD. LOW 
TEMPERATURES THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY NIGHT WILL BE 10 TO 20 
DEGREES. MOST AREAS WILL HAVE HIGH TEMPERATURES IN THE 20S AND 30S. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    41  20  53  39 /  10   0   0  10 
HARRISON AR       32  21  52  38 /  10   0   0  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    44  22  55  41 /  10   0   0  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     43  21  53  39 /  10   0   0  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  31  16  49  37 /  10   0   0  10 
MONTICELLO AR     45  20  52  39 /  10   0   0  10 
SEARCY AR         37  17  50  38 /  10   0   0  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      44  23  55  41 /  10   0   0  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   39  19  54  38 /  10   0   0  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$



707 
FXUS64 KLZK 190409
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1010 PM CST SAT DEC 18 2004

.DISCUSSION...
COLD FRONT HAS MOVED OUT OF THE STATE. ONLY EFFECT FROM IT IS LOWER 
DEW POINTS AND AN INCREASE IN NORTHWEST WIND. THE BLAST OF ARCTIC
AIR IS STILL TO THE NORTH AND SHOWED UP WELL ON UPPER CHARTS THIS
EVENING WITH ARKANSAS ABOUT AT THE BASE OF THE UPPER TROF. EXPECT
THE ARCTIC AIR TO INVADE THE STATE LATER TONIGHT. UPDATED GRIDS 
TO RAISE TEMPS OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS TO FIT OBS CLOSER. STILL
LOOK FOR BIG RALLY IN TEMPS IN THE NORTH LATER. LEFT CHANCE OF
FLURRIES IN THE NORTH AND NORTHEAST BUT DELAYED ONSET UNTIL 09Z
OR LATER THEN CONTINUED FLURRIES INTO MID MORNING. LOWERED DEW POINTS
SOME FOR REST OF TONIGHT INTO SUNDAY MORNING BASED ON OBSERVED DATA. 
ALSO ALTERED SKY COVER TO FIT OBS A LITTLE BETTER. SENT OUT ZONE 
UPDATE WITH SOME MINS RAISED FOR TONIGHT ESPECIALLY IN SOUTH AND
MENTIONED FLURRIES LATE OR TOWARD MORNING.
&&
29

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 235 PM CST SAT DEC 18 2004 

.SYNOPSIS...
COMPLICATED FORECAST SITUATION CONTINUES. NORTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL 
CONTINUE TO SEND SYSTEMS THROUGH THE AREA FOR MUCH OF THE SHORT 
TERM. BY MID WEEK...UPPER TROUGH WILL DEEPEN IN THE WEST...WITH 
SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE RETURN NOTED. WITH COLLISION OF COLD AIR FROM 
THE NORTHWEST...AND MOISTURE FROM THE SOUTHWEST AND WEST...AREA 
HEADING FOR A PROLONGED PERIOD OF ACTIVE WEATHER. MY APOLOGIES FOR 
BEING SO VERBOSE...

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT

THROUGH TONIGHT...COLD FRONT SHOWING UP RATHER NICELY ON SATELLITE 
AND WSR-88D...OVER NRN AND WRN ARKANSAS /JBR-SRC-MEZ/. SYSTEM WILL 
CONTINUE HEADING THROUGH THE AREA...CLEARING OUT LATE TONIGHT. TEMPS 
WILL FALL SHARPLY WITH THE SUNSET...AND PASSAGE OF THE FRONT. SOME 
FLURRIES WILL BE POSSIBLE OVER NORTHEASTERN ARKANSAS LATE TONIGHT. 
HOWEVER...NOT MUCH MOISTURE NOTED OVER THE REMAINDER OF THE 
AREA...SO ONLY SOME AC AND CIRRUS WILL BE NOTED. 

.SUNDAY...SURFACE RIDGE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA IN THE NORTHWEST 
FLOW. VERY COLD TEMPERATURES WILL BE NOTED OVER A LARGE PORTION OF 
THE AREA. POSITION OF THE RIDGE AND RESUMPTION OF RETURN FLOW WILL 
PLAY A LARGE PART IN TEMPERATURES ON SUNDAY. APPEARS TO BE A VERY 
SHARP SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST GRADIENT...WITH DIURNAL MAXES VARYING 
AS MUCH AS 20 DEGREES FROM SW TO NE. THUS...SERIOUS TEMPERATURE BUST 
POTENTIAL IS A HAZARD FOR SUNDAY. 

.SUNDAY NIGHT...RETURN FLOW WILL SET UP OVER WESTERN ARKANSAS ON 
SUNDAY NIGHT...AS SURFACE RIDGE HEADS SOUTHEAST. LOCATIONS IN THE 
WEST ARE LIKELY TO SEE MINS IN THE MID TO LATE EVENING TIME 
FRAME...BEFORE STEADYING OUT AFTER MIDNIGHT...AND POSSIBLY BEGINNING 
A SLOW RISE JUST BEFORE DAWN. DON/T GET ME WRONG THOUGH. ITS STILL 
GOING TO BE COLD. 

.MONDAY...RAPID TEMPERATURE RECOVERY WILL BE THE PRIMARY ISSUE ON 
MONDAY. RIGHT NOW...LOOKS AS THOUGH HIGHS COULD TOP OUT IN THE MID 
40S NORTHEAST TO THE MID 50S SOUTHWEST. ONE THING THAT MAY THROW A 
WRENCH INTO THESE NUMBERS IS WIND SPEED AND DIRECTION. IF WINDS CAN 
GO COMPLETELY SOUTH BY MID DAY...COULD BE A LITTLE WARMER THAN 
EXPECTED. AS THE RIDGE EXITS...AND NEXT SYSTEM DEVELOPS OUT IN THE 
PLAINS...GRADIENT WILL TIGHTEN UP...PRODUCING BREEZY CONDITIONS ON 
MONDAY AFTERNOON. 

.MONDAY NIGHT...MOISTURE WILL INCREASE FROM THE SOUTH AND SOUTHWEST 
ON MONDAY NIGHT..AS YET ANOTHER IN A CONTINUING SERIES OF SURFACE 
FRONTS MOVES INTO NORTHERN ARKANSAS. LOOKS AS THOUGH THERE COULD BE 
A CHANCE OF LIGHT RAIN...MIXING WITH FLURRIES TOWARD TUESDAY 
MORNING...AS ISENTROPIC UPLIFT SETS UP OVER NORTHERN ARKANSAS BEHIND 
THE FRONT...AND SURFACE TEMPS FALL BELOW FREEZING.

.TUESDAY...THIS WILL BE ANOTHER DAY WHERE TEMPERATURE TRENDS WILL BE 
HARD TO PIN DOWN. WITH FRONT EXPECTED TO BE SW-NE ORIENTED OVER MID-
CWA...AND INCREASED CLOUD COVER...MAXES IN THE NORTHWEST AND WEST 
ARE LIKELY TO BE REACHED TOWARD MID DAY...AND IN THE REMAINDER OF 
THE AREA BY EARLY AFTERNOON. THEN...TEMPS EXPECTED TO BEGIN FALLING 
THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE AFTERNOON. 

.TUESDAY NIGHT...WHILE MUCH OF THE AREA WILL STAY IN THE MID 30S TO 
LOWER 40S...NORTHERN ARKANSAS WILL FALL BACK DOWN INTO THE UPPER 
20S/LOWER 30S. SNOW WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THESE AREAS...WITH RAIN 
POSSIBLY MIXING WITH SNOW IN THE ARKANSAS RIVER VALLEY...EXTENDING  
TOWARD CROWLEY/S RIDGE. EVERYONE ELSE GETS RAIN. 
&&

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY
LATEST GFS RUN IS FASTER WITH WINTER TYPE PRECIPITATION DURING THE 
MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. SURFACE LOW JUST SOUTHEAST OF ARKANSAS IS 
FARTHER EAST AND MOVES AWAY FASTER THAN PREVIOUS MODEL RUN. THINK 
THAT IT MAY BE A LITTLE FAST ON MOVEMENT NORTHEASTWARD...SO HAVE 
PRETTY MUCH LEFT WEDNESDAY WITH WHAT WAS PREVIOUSLY FORECAST. MAINLY 
CHANCE OF RAIN OR SNOW NORTH...AND CHANCE OF RAIN SOUTH. COLD 
CANADIAN AIR WILL REMAIN IN PLACE THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK. NEXT 
SHORT WAVE AFFECTS THE AREA WITH SMALL CHANCES OF SNOW THURSDAY 
NIGHT...FRIDAY MORNING TIME FRAME. 
&&

.COORDINATION/COLLABORATION...
OUR THANKS TO WFO SPRINGFIELD...PADUCAH...AND TULSA FOR GOOD 
COLLABORATION AND DISCUSSION ON A DIFFICULT FORECAST. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    32  40  18  53 /  10  10   0   0 
HARRISON AR       24  31  18  52 /  10  10   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    33  45  23  55 /  10   0   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     34  43  22  53 /  10  10   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  24  29  16  49 /  10  10   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     34  46  23  52 /  10  10   0   0 
SEARCY AR         30  37  16  50 /  10  10   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      33  45  25  55 /  10   0   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   29  39  18  54 /  10  10   0   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

SHORT TERM 57 / LONG TERM 22/220


000 
FXUS64 KLZK 190409
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1010 PM CST SAT DEC 18 2004

.DISCUSSION...
COLD FRONT HAS MOVED OUT OF THE STATE. ONLY EFFECT FROM IT IS LOWER 
DEW POINTS AND AN INCREASE IN NORTHWEST WIND. THE BLAST OF ARCTIC
AIR IS STILL TO THE NORTH AND SHOWED UP WELL ON UPPER CHARTS THIS
EVENING WITH ARKANSAS ABOUT AT THE BASE OF THE UPPER TROF. EXPECT
THE ARCTIC AIR TO INVADE THE STATE LATER TONIGHT. UPDATED GRIDS 
TO RAISE TEMPS OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS TO FIT OBS CLOSER. STILL
LOOK FOR BIG RALLY IN TEMPS IN THE NORTH LATER. LEFT CHANCE OF
FLURRIES IN THE NORTH AND NORTHEAST BUT DELAYED ONSET UNTIL 09Z
OR LATER THEN CONTINUED FLURRIES INTO MID MORNING. LOWERED DEW POINTS
SOME FOR REST OF TONIGHT INTO SUNDAY MORNING BASED ON OBSERVED DATA. 
ALSO ALTERED SKY COVER TO FIT OBS A LITTLE BETTER. SENT OUT ZONE 
UPDATE WITH SOME MINS RAISED FOR TONIGHT ESPECIALLY IN SOUTH AND
MENTIONED FLURRIES LATE OR TOWARD MORNING.
&&
29

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 235 PM CST SAT DEC 18 2004 

.SYNOPSIS...
COMPLICATED FORECAST SITUATION CONTINUES. NORTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL 
CONTINUE TO SEND SYSTEMS THROUGH THE AREA FOR MUCH OF THE SHORT 
TERM. BY MID WEEK...UPPER TROUGH WILL DEEPEN IN THE WEST...WITH 
SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE RETURN NOTED. WITH COLLISION OF COLD AIR FROM 
THE NORTHWEST...AND MOISTURE FROM THE SOUTHWEST AND WEST...AREA 
HEADING FOR A PROLONGED PERIOD OF ACTIVE WEATHER. MY APOLOGIES FOR 
BEING SO VERBOSE...

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT

THROUGH TONIGHT...COLD FRONT SHOWING UP RATHER NICELY ON SATELLITE 
AND WSR-88D...OVER NRN AND WRN ARKANSAS /JBR-SRC-MEZ/. SYSTEM WILL 
CONTINUE HEADING THROUGH THE AREA...CLEARING OUT LATE TONIGHT. TEMPS 
WILL FALL SHARPLY WITH THE SUNSET...AND PASSAGE OF THE FRONT. SOME 
FLURRIES WILL BE POSSIBLE OVER NORTHEASTERN ARKANSAS LATE TONIGHT. 
HOWEVER...NOT MUCH MOISTURE NOTED OVER THE REMAINDER OF THE 
AREA...SO ONLY SOME AC AND CIRRUS WILL BE NOTED. 

.SUNDAY...SURFACE RIDGE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA IN THE NORTHWEST 
FLOW. VERY COLD TEMPERATURES WILL BE NOTED OVER A LARGE PORTION OF 
THE AREA. POSITION OF THE RIDGE AND RESUMPTION OF RETURN FLOW WILL 
PLAY A LARGE PART IN TEMPERATURES ON SUNDAY. APPEARS TO BE A VERY 
SHARP SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST GRADIENT...WITH DIURNAL MAXES VARYING 
AS MUCH AS 20 DEGREES FROM SW TO NE. THUS...SERIOUS TEMPERATURE BUST 
POTENTIAL IS A HAZARD FOR SUNDAY. 

.SUNDAY NIGHT...RETURN FLOW WILL SET UP OVER WESTERN ARKANSAS ON 
SUNDAY NIGHT...AS SURFACE RIDGE HEADS SOUTHEAST. LOCATIONS IN THE 
WEST ARE LIKELY TO SEE MINS IN THE MID TO LATE EVENING TIME 
FRAME...BEFORE STEADYING OUT AFTER MIDNIGHT...AND POSSIBLY BEGINNING 
A SLOW RISE JUST BEFORE DAWN. DON/T GET ME WRONG THOUGH. ITS STILL 
GOING TO BE COLD. 

.MONDAY...RAPID TEMPERATURE RECOVERY WILL BE THE PRIMARY ISSUE ON 
MONDAY. RIGHT NOW...LOOKS AS THOUGH HIGHS COULD TOP OUT IN THE MID 
40S NORTHEAST TO THE MID 50S SOUTHWEST. ONE THING THAT MAY THROW A 
WRENCH INTO THESE NUMBERS IS WIND SPEED AND DIRECTION. IF WINDS CAN 
GO COMPLETELY SOUTH BY MID DAY...COULD BE A LITTLE WARMER THAN 
EXPECTED. AS THE RIDGE EXITS...AND NEXT SYSTEM DEVELOPS OUT IN THE 
PLAINS...GRADIENT WILL TIGHTEN UP...PRODUCING BREEZY CONDITIONS ON 
MONDAY AFTERNOON. 

.MONDAY NIGHT...MOISTURE WILL INCREASE FROM THE SOUTH AND SOUTHWEST 
ON MONDAY NIGHT..AS YET ANOTHER IN A CONTINUING SERIES OF SURFACE 
FRONTS MOVES INTO NORTHERN ARKANSAS. LOOKS AS THOUGH THERE COULD BE 
A CHANCE OF LIGHT RAIN...MIXING WITH FLURRIES TOWARD TUESDAY 
MORNING...AS ISENTROPIC UPLIFT SETS UP OVER NORTHERN ARKANSAS BEHIND 
THE FRONT...AND SURFACE TEMPS FALL BELOW FREEZING.

.TUESDAY...THIS WILL BE ANOTHER DAY WHERE TEMPERATURE TRENDS WILL BE 
HARD TO PIN DOWN. WITH FRONT EXPECTED TO BE SW-NE ORIENTED OVER MID-
CWA...AND INCREASED CLOUD COVER...MAXES IN THE NORTHWEST AND WEST 
ARE LIKELY TO BE REACHED TOWARD MID DAY...AND IN THE REMAINDER OF 
THE AREA BY EARLY AFTERNOON. THEN...TEMPS EXPECTED TO BEGIN FALLING 
THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE AFTERNOON. 

.TUESDAY NIGHT...WHILE MUCH OF THE AREA WILL STAY IN THE MID 30S TO 
LOWER 40S...NORTHERN ARKANSAS WILL FALL BACK DOWN INTO THE UPPER 
20S/LOWER 30S. SNOW WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THESE AREAS...WITH RAIN 
POSSIBLY MIXING WITH SNOW IN THE ARKANSAS RIVER VALLEY...EXTENDING  
TOWARD CROWLEY/S RIDGE. EVERYONE ELSE GETS RAIN. 
&&

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY
LATEST GFS RUN IS FASTER WITH WINTER TYPE PRECIPITATION DURING THE 
MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. SURFACE LOW JUST SOUTHEAST OF ARKANSAS IS 
FARTHER EAST AND MOVES AWAY FASTER THAN PREVIOUS MODEL RUN. THINK 
THAT IT MAY BE A LITTLE FAST ON MOVEMENT NORTHEASTWARD...SO HAVE 
PRETTY MUCH LEFT WEDNESDAY WITH WHAT WAS PREVIOUSLY FORECAST. MAINLY 
CHANCE OF RAIN OR SNOW NORTH...AND CHANCE OF RAIN SOUTH. COLD 
CANADIAN AIR WILL REMAIN IN PLACE THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK. NEXT 
SHORT WAVE AFFECTS THE AREA WITH SMALL CHANCES OF SNOW THURSDAY 
NIGHT...FRIDAY MORNING TIME FRAME. 
&&

.COORDINATION/COLLABORATION...
OUR THANKS TO WFO SPRINGFIELD...PADUCAH...AND TULSA FOR GOOD 
COLLABORATION AND DISCUSSION ON A DIFFICULT FORECAST. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

HARRISON AR       24  31  18  52 /  10  10   0   0


374 
FXUS64 KLZK 181015
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
400 AM CST SAT DEC 18 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT
PERSISTENT LARGE RIDGE IN THE WEST CONTINUES TO KEEP UPPER FLOW OUT 
OF THE NORTHWEST...WITH ARCTIC AIR PERIODICALLY MAKING ITS WAY 
TOWARD ARKANSAS. 

NEXT ARCTIC FRONT SET TO ARRIVE LATER TODAY/TONIGHT...WITH MUCH 
COLDER AIR TO FOLLOW. AHEAD OF FRONT...QUITE A WARMUP IN STORE THIS 
AFTERNOON...WITH ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES IN THE FORECAST. READINGS 
WILL TOP OUT IN THE 50S/60S.

A DIFFERENT WORLD ON SUNDAY...WITH HIGH TEMPERATURES MAINLY IN THE 
30S/40S...AND A FEW 50S IN THE SOUTHWEST. OTHER THAN A FEW FLURRIES 
EARLY IN THE NORTHEAST...HARDLY ANY MOISTURE SURROUNDING FRONT TO 
MENTION PRECIPITATION.

AS OF LATE...SUBTROPICAL JET HAS GONE INTO HIBERNATION...WITH NEAR 
RECORD RAINFALL IN OCTOBER/NOVEMBER REPLACED WITH ABNORMALLY DRY 
WEATHER THIS MONTH. THIS WILL CHANGE A BIT TOWARD THE END OF THE 
SHORT TERM. RIDGE IN THE WEST WILL RETROGRADE/WEAKEN SOMEWHAT BY 
TUESDAY...WITH TROUGH DEEPENING IN THE ROCKIES. APPEARS THAT STORM 
SYSTEM WILL START DEVELOPING IN THE PLAINS...AND WILL GET CRANKED UP 
AS IT HEADS EAST OF THE REGION BY MIDWEEK.

AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM...MOISTURE JUST BEGINNING TO LOOK APPRECIABLE... 
WITH CHANCE OF LIGHT RAIN/LIGHT SNOW IN THE FORECAST TUESDAY/TUESDAY 
NIGHT. MOISTURE BECOMES MUCH MORE ABUNDANT IN THE SOUTHEAST UNITED 
STATES...SO PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS AROUND HERE NOTHING TO WRITE HOME 
ABOUT. AFTER SYSTEM GOES BY...ANOTHER SHOT OF COLD AIR WILL ARRIVE 
TO START THE LONG TERM.  (46)                  
&&

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY
AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH DIGS INTO THE NATIONS MID SECTION ON 
WEDNESDAY. THIS WILL BRING A CHANCE OF SNOW TO NORTH ARKANSAS AND 
RAIN TO THE SOUTH. COLDER AIR WILL BE IN PLACE AND FRIGID 
TEMPERATURES WILL LAST THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK. DRY AIR MOVES IN 
FOR THURSDAY BUT A SHORT WAVE MAKES ITS WAY ACROSS THE AREA THURSDAY 
NIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING. TEMPERATURES WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW 
ACROSS THE ENTIRE CWFA. SNOW AMOUNTS APPEAR TO BE VERY LIGHT AT THIS 
TIME. HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN MOVE INTO ARKANSAS FRIDAY AFTERNOON. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    60  31  40  20 /  10  10  10   0 
HARRISON AR       55  23  34  19 /  10  10  10   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    61  32  43  24 /  10  10  10   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     61  33  42  20 /  10  10  10   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  54  23  32  17 /  10  10  10   0 
MONTICELLO AR     62  33  44  21 /  10  10  10   0 
SEARCY AR         58  29  37  18 /  10  10  10   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      61  32  43  25 /  10  10   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   58  28  39  20 /  10  10  10   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

46/51






000 
FXUS64 KLZK 181015
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
400 AM CST SAT DEC 18 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT
PERSISTENT LARGE RIDGE IN THE WEST CONTINUES TO KEEP UPPER FLOW OUT 
OF THE NORTHWEST...WITH ARCTIC AIR PERIODICALLY MAKING ITS WAY 
TOWARD ARKANSAS. 

NEXT ARCTIC FRONT SET TO ARRIVE LATER TODAY/TONIGHT...WITH MUCH 
COLDER AIR TO FOLLOW. AHEAD OF FRONT...QUITE A WARMUP IN STORE THIS 
AFTERNOON...WITH ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES IN THE FORECAST. READINGS 
WILL TOP OUT IN THE 50S/60S.

A DIFFERENT WORLD ON SUNDAY...WITH HIGH TEMPERATURES MAINLY IN THE 
30S/40S...AND A FEW 50S IN THE SOUTHWEST. OTHER THAN A FEW FLURRIES 
EARLY IN THE NORTHEAST...HARDLY ANY MOISTURE SURROUNDING FRONT TO 
MENTION PRECIPITATION.

AS OF LATE...SUBTROPICAL JET HAS GONE INTO HIBERNATION...WITH NEAR 
RECORD RAINFALL IN OCTOBER/NOVEMBER REPLACED WITH ABNORMALLY DRY 
WEATHER THIS MONTH. THIS WILL CHANGE A BIT TOWARD THE END OF THE 
SHORT TERM. RIDGE IN THE WEST WILL RETROGRADE/WEAKEN SOMEWHAT BY 
TUESDAY...WITH TROUGH DEEPENING IN THE ROCKIES. APPEARS THAT STORM 
SYSTEM WILL START DEVELOPING IN THE PLAINS...AND WILL GET CRANKED UP 
AS IT HEADS EAST OF THE REGION BY MIDWEEK.

AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM...MOISTURE JUST BEGINNING TO LOOK APPRECIABLE... 
WITH CHANCE OF LIGHT RAIN/LIGHT SNOW IN THE FORECAST TUESDAY/TUESDAY 
NIGHT. MOISTURE BECOMES MUCH MORE ABUNDANT IN THE SOUTHEAST UNITED 
STATES...SO PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS AROUND HERE NOTHING TO WRITE HOME 
ABOUT. AFTER SYSTEM GOES BY...ANOTHER SHOT OF COLD AIR WILL ARRIVE 
TO START THE LONG TERM.  (46)                  
&&

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY
AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH DIGS INTO THE NATIONS MID SECTION ON 
WEDNESDAY. THIS WILL BRING A CHANCE OF SNOW TO NORTH ARKANSAS AND 
RAIN TO THE SOUTH. COLDER AIR WILL BE IN PLACE AND FRIGID 
TEMPERATURES WILL LAST THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK. DRY AIR MOVES IN 
FOR THURSDAY BUT A SHORT WAVE MAKES ITS WAY ACROSS THE AREA THURSDAY 
NIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING. TEMPERATURES WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW 
ACROSS THE ENTIRE CWFA. SNOW AMOUNTS APPEAR TO BE VERY LIGHT AT THIS 
TIME. HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN MOVE INTO ARKANSAS FRIDAY AFTERNOON. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    60  31  40  20 /  10  10  10   0 
HARRISON AR       55  23  34  19 /  10  10  10   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    61  32  43  24 /  10  10  10   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     61  33  42  20 /  10  10  10   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  54  23  32  17 /  10  10  10   0 
MONTICELLO AR     62  33  44  21 /  10  10  10   0 
SEARCY AR         58  29  37  18 /  10  10  10   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      61  32  43  25 /  10  10   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   58  28  39  20 /  10  10  10   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

46/51






994 
FXUS64 KLZK 180357
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
955 PM CST FRI DEC 17 2004

DISCUSSION...TEMPS HAVE FALLEN INTO THE LOWER 30S IN SOME OF THE
USUAL COOL SPOTS IN THE ARKANSAS RIVER VALLEY AND SOUTHEAST. SOME
LIGHT SOUTHWEST WINDS HAVE DEVELOPED WHICH MAY CURB MUCH MORE 
DECREASE IN TEMPS BUT WINDS ARE CALM ACROSS MOST OF THE SOUTH. 
UPDATED TO LOWER MINS A LITTLE IN THE ARKANSAS RIVER VALLEY AND
PARTS OF THE WEST AS WELL AS THE SOUTHEAST. ALSO SET WINDS TO 
CALM IN THE SOUTH FOR MOST OF THE NIGHT WITH SOME INCREASE TOWARD 
MORNING. REST OF FORECAST LOOKS ON TRACK. 
&&
29

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 258 PM CST FRI DEC 17 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT

.TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...
WEAK SURFACE BOUNDARY WHICH IS BARELY A WIND SHIFT LINE IS CURRENTLY 
OVER SOUTHERN MISSOURI...HEADING SOUTHWARD TOWARD NORTHERN ARKANSAS. 
SYSTEM WILL MOVE THROUGH TONIGHT...FOLLOWED BY A WEAK COLD FRONT ON 
SATURDAY. THIS WILL BE FOLLOWED BY TEMPERATURE FALLS DURING THE 
AFTERNOON IN NORTHWESTERN ARKANSAS WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE FRONT. 
GRADIENT WILL PICK UP BEHIND THE FRONT. WILL BE MOSTLY CLOUDY...WITH 
DECENT WINDS DURING THE NIGHT...AND THIS SHOULD KEEP TEMPERATURES 
FROM COMPLETELY BOTTOMING OUT. HOWEVER...WIND CHILL WILL BE A 
FACTOR...AS INDICES COULD DIP DOWN INTO THE TEENS IN NORTHERN 
ARKANSAS. 

WHILE MOISTURE ISN/T OVERLY ABUNDANT...UPPER SUPPORT IS CERTAINLY 
PRESENT. HAVE CONTINUED TO INCLUDE A CHANCE OF SPRINKLES/FLURRIES AS 
THE SYSTEM SWINGS ACROSS. 

.SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT...
SURFACE RIDGE WILL SWEEP ACROSS ON SUNDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL STILL 
BE RATHER COLD...WITH HIGHS TOPPING OUT IN THE LOWER 30S 
NORTHEAST...TO THE MID 40S/UPPER 40S SOUTHWEST AND SOUTH. AS THE 
HIGH SLIDES EAST EARLY SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH WARM ADVECTION SETTING 
UP. TEMPERATURES IN WESTERN ARKANSAS COULD VERY WELL REACH THEIR 
MINIMUMS BEFORE MIDNIGHT...STEADYING OUT OR SLOWLY RISING TOWARD 
DAWN. 

.MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT...
COLD FRONT AND DEVELOPING SURFACE LOW WILL APPROACH NORTHWEST 
ARKANSAS ON MONDAY. MOISTURE WILL INCREASE...WITH LIGHT RAIN 
BECOMING POSSIBLE LATE MONDAY NIGHT. THE RAIN MAY MIX WITH SNOW 
TOWARD MORNING...PARTICULARLY OVER NORTHERN ARKANSAS. (57)
&&

.LONG TERM...MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY
COMPLEX SITUATION CONTINUES THROUGH MUCH OF THE WEEK LEADING UP TO 
CHRISTMAS. SEVERAL SHORT WAVES RIDE ALONG NORTHWEST FLOW... 
AMPLIFYING THE H5 POLAR VORTEX. BY MID WEEK...DEEP TROUGH CARVING 
OUT OF THE SOUTHWEST U.S...WITH SOUTHERN JET OVERTAKING THE NORTHERN 
BRANCH. THIS WILL LIKELY LEAD TO A DECENT STORM MID/LATE NEXT WEEK 
SOMEWHERE IN THE EASTERN US...BUT MODELS CONTINUE TO INDICATE THAT 
THE MAIN SYSTEM WILL COME TOGETHER WELL EAST OF OUR AREA OF CONCERN.

.MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...
HOWEVER...THAT DOES NOT MEAN ARKANSAS WILL HAVE BORING WEATHER FOR 
THE EXTENDED PERIOD. INTRODUCED POPS TUESDAY...AND CARRIED THEM 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING. SURFACE LOW WILL DROP OUT OF OKLAHOMA 
TUESDAY...AND SWING THROUGH SOUTHERN ARKANSAS LATE TUESDAY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY. 295K ISENTROPIC ANALYSIS SHOWS PLENTY OF LIFT AHEAD OF 
THE SYSTEM. LOW LEVELS WILL SATURATE RATHER EASILY...LEADING TO RAIN 
AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM. BEHIND THE SYSTEM WEDNESDAY...ANOTHER SHOT OF 
SATURATED AIR WILL RIDE ANOTHER PUSH OF WARM AIR ADVECTION FROM 
SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST ARKANSAS. LOOKING AT TEMPERATURE FIELDS... 
BELIEVE THAT COLUMN WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR AN ALL SNOW EVENT 
NORTH...AND RAIN OR SNOW CENTRAL AND MAYBE SOUTH. SNOW AMOUNTS WOULD 
BE LIGHT AS MOISTURE PATCH PUSHES THROUGH THE STATE QUICKLY.

.THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...
QUIET WEATHER THURSDAY BEFORE THE NEXT SYSTEM ARRIVES FRIDAY. 
TAPERED BACK POPS ON FRIDAY. COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH THE STATE 
DURING THE DAY. TIMING WILL BE AN ISSUE...OPTED TO BRING THE FRONT 
THROUGH EARLY IN THE DAY...WHICH KEPT HIGHS ON FRIDAY COOL. BROUGHT 
SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SNOW ALONG WITH THE FRONT...MAINLY CENTRAL AND 
NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE STATE. MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED THOUGH...AS 
THETA ANALYSIS SHOWS THE LOW LEVELS NOT QUITE SATURATING. HIGH 
PRESSURE MOVES IN EARLY CHRISTMAS MORNING. H85 TEMPS DROP INTO THE 
MINUS TEENS...EQUATING TO NEAR 10 IN THE NORTH TO NEAR 20 ACROSS THE 
REST OF THE STATE. (22/220)
&&

.COORDINATION/COLLABORATION...
THANKS TO WFO MEMPHIS...TULSA...AND SPRINGFIELD FOR ALL 
COLLABORATION EFFORTS ON THIS FORECAST PACKAGE. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    36  59  32  41 /  10  10  10  10 
HARRISON AR       37  53  24  32 /  10  10  10  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    35  59  33  45 /  10  10  10  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     36  59  34  43 /  10  10  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  37  52  24  31 /  10  10  10  10 
MONTICELLO AR     35  60  34  46 /  10  10  10  10 
SEARCY AR         36  56  30  38 /  10  10  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      34  59  33  45 /  10  10  10  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   32  57  29  41 /  10  10  10  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KLZK 172058
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
258 PM CST FRI DEC 17 2004

TO SAY THAT THIS FORECAST PACKAGE IS A DIFFICULT ONE IS PUTTING IT 
MILDLY. NEXT SEVEN DAYS WILL BE DOMINATED BY STRONG NORTHWESTERLY 
AND WESTERLY FLOW...WHICH WILL ALLOW A SUCCESSIVE SERIES OF SYSTEMS 
TO AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA. COLD PATTERN IN PLACE WILL ALLOW THE 
CHANCE OF SOME WINTRY PRECIPITATION. THE BIG ISSUE IS TIMING. 
TIMING...AS WELL AS TEMPERATURES. 

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT

.TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...
WEAK SURFACE BOUNDARY WHICH IS BARELY A WIND SHIFT LINE IS CURRENTLY 
OVER SOUTHERN MISSOURI...HEADING SOUTHWARD TOWARD NORTHERN ARKANSAS. 
SYSTEM WILL MOVE THROUGH TONIGHT...FOLLOWED BY A WEAK COLD FRONT ON 
SATURDAY. THIS WILL BE FOLLOWED BY TEMPERATURE FALLS DURING THE 
AFTERNOON IN NORTHWESTERN ARKANSAS WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE FRONT. 
GRADIENT WILL PICK UP BEHIND THE FRONT. WILL BE MOSTLY CLOUDY...WITH 
DECENT WINDS DURING THE NIGHT...AND THIS SHOULD KEEP TEMPERATURES 
FROM COMPLETELY BOTTOMING OUT. HOWEVER...WIND CHILL WILL BE A 
FACTOR...AS INDICES COULD DIP DOWN INTO THE TEENS IN NORTHERN 
ARKANSAS. 

WHILE MOISTURE ISN/T OVERLY ABUNDANT...UPPER SUPPORT IS CERTAINLY 
PRESENT. HAVE CONTINUED TO INCLUDE A CHANCE OF SPRINKLES/FLURRIES AS 
THE SYSTEM SWINGS ACROSS. 

.SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT...
SURFACE RIDGE WILL SWEEP ACROSS ON SUNDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL STILL 
BE RATHER COLD...WITH HIGHS TOPPING OUT IN THE LOWER 30S 
NORTHEAST...TO THE MID 40S/UPPER 40S SOUTHWEST AND SOUTH. AS THE

ARKANSAS ON MONDAY. MOISTURE WILL INCREASE...WITH LIGHT RAIN 
BECOMING POSSIBLE LATE MONDAY NIGHT. THE RAIN MAY MIX WITH SNOW 
TOWARD MORNING...PARTICULARLY OVER NORTHERN ARKANSAS. (57)
&&

.LONG TERM...MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY
COMPLEX SITUATION CONTINUES THROUGH MUCH OF THE WEEK LEADING UP TO 
CHRISTMAS. SEVERAL SHORT WAVES RIDE ALONG NORTHWEST FLOW... 
AMPLIFYING THE H5 POLAR VORTEX. BY MID WEEK...DEEP TROUGH CARVING

BRANCH. THIS WILL LIKELY LEAD TO A DECENT STORM MID/LATE NEXT WEEK 
SOMEWHERE IN THE EASTERN US...BUT MODELS CONTINUE TO INDICATE THAT 
THE MAIN SYSTEM WILL COME TOGETHER WELL EAST OF OUR AREA OF CONCERN.

.MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...
HOWEVER...THAT DOES NOT MEAN ARKANSAS WILL HAVE BORING WEATHER FOR 
THE EXTENDED PERIOD. INTRODUCED POPS TUESDAY...AND CARRIED THEM 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING. SURFACE LOW WILL DROP OUT OF OKLAHOMA

.MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...
HOWEVER...THAT DOES NOT MEAN ARKANSAS WILL HAVE BORING WEATHER FOR 
THE EXTENDED PERIOD. INTRODUCED POPS TUESDAY...AND CARRIED THEM 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING. SURFACE LOW WILL DROP OUT OF OKLAHOMA 
TUESDAY...AND SWING THROUGH SOUTHERN ARKANSAS LATE TUESDAY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY. 295K ISENTROPIC ANALYSIS SHOWS PLENTY OF LIFT AHEAD OF 
THE SYSTEM. LOW LEVELS WILL SATURATE RATHER EASILY...LEADING TO RAIN 
AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM. BEHIND THE SYSTEM WEDNESDAY...ANOTHER SHOT OF 
SATURATED AIR WILL RIDE ANOTHER PUSH OF WARM AIR ADVECTION FROM 
SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST ARKANSAS. LOOKING AT TEMPERATURE FIELDS... 
BELIEVE THAT COLUMN WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR AN ALL SNOW EVENT 
NORTH...AND RAIN OR SNOW CENTRAL AND MAYBE SOUTH. SNOW AMOUNTS WOULD 
BE LIGHT AS MOISTURE PATCH PUSHES THROUGH THE STATE QUICKLY.

.THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...
QUIET WEATHER THURSDAY BEFORE THE NEXT SYSTEM ARRIVES FRIDAY. 
TAPERED BACK POPS ON FRIDAY. COLD FRONT WILL PUSH THROUGH THE STATE 
DURING THE DAY. TIMING WILL BE AN ISSUE...OPTED TO BRING THE FRONT 
THROUGH EARLY IN THE DAY...WHICH KEPT HIGHS ON FRIDAY COOL. BROUGHT 
SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SNOW ALONG WITH THE FRONT...MAINLY CENTRAL AND 
NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE STATE. MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED THOUGH...AS 
THETA ANALYSIS SHOWS THE LOW LEVELS NOT QUITE SATURATING. HIGH 
PRESSURE MOVES IN EARLY CHRISTMAS MORNING. H85 TEMPS DROP INTO THE 
MINUS TEENS...EQUATING TO NEAR 10 IN THE NORTH TO NEAR 20 ACROSS THE 
REST OF THE STATE. (22/220)
&&

.COORDINATION/COLLABORATION...
THANKS TO WFO MEMPHIS...TULSA...AND SPRINGFIELD FOR ALL 
COLLABORATION EFFORTS ON THIS FORECAST PACKAGE. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    36  59  32  41 /  10  10  10  10 
HARRISON AR       37  53  24  32 /  10  10  10  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    35  59  33  45 /  10  10  10  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     36  59  34  43 /  10  10  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  37  52  24  31 /  10  10  10  10 
MONTICELLO AR     35  60  34  46 /  10  10  10  10 
SEARCY AR         36  56  30  38 /  10  10  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      34  59  33  45 /  10  10  10  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   32  57  29  41 /  10  10  10  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

SHORT TERM 57 / LONG TERM 22/220





149 
FXUS64 KLZK 171710 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1110 AM CST FRI DEC 17 2004

.DISCUSSION...
RATHER NICE THIS MORNING OVER THE FORECAST AREA. WINDS HAVE BEEN 
LIGHT AND VARIABLE...TO NORTHEASTERLY IN MOST OF THE AREA. THIS HAS 
AND WILL CONTINUE TO KEEP WARMING IN CHECK. WEAK SURFACE BOUNDARY 
CURRENTLY OVER CENTRAL/SOUTHERN MISSOURI WILL MOVE INTO NORTHERN 
ARKANSAS LATER TODAY...BUT THIS SYSTEM LOOKS TO NOT HAVE A 
SIGNFICANT EFFECT BEFORE TONIGHT. 

BASICALLY...GOING FORECAST LOOKS GOOD. HAVE UPDATED TEXT FORECASTS 
TO CLEAN UP SOME TEMPORAL WORDING...AND GRAPHICS AND GRIDS TO BETTER 
ADJUST FOR SENSIBLE WEATHER TRENDS. 
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 355 AM CST FRI DEC 17 2004

POLAR JET CONTINUES TO BE DOMINANT IN THE SHORT TERM...WITH ARCTIC 
COLD DRIVEN TOWARD ARKANSAS AND NOT MUCH MOISTURE AVAILABLE. 

NEXT IN A SERIES OF FRONTS SET TO HEAD INTO ARKANSAS FROM THE NORTH 
BY SATURDAY OR SO. AHEAD OF THE FRONT...SOME MODERATION IN 
TEMPERATURE TODAY/TONIGHT AS READINGS CLIMB TO NEAR NORMAL LEVELS.

AFTER FRONT GOES THROUGH...WILL GET BREEZY AND COLDER. DATA HAS 
TENDED NOT TO BE AS CHILLY BEHIND THE FRONT AS IN PREVIOUS RUNS 
WITH BRUNT OF COLD AIR HEADED TOWARD THE OHIO VALLEY. ALSO...WHILE 
COLDEST AIR WILL ARRIVE SUNDAY NIGHT WITH ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE 
SETTLING OVER REGION...RETURN FLOW ALREADY SETTING UP IN 
NORTHERN/WESTERN ARKANSAS SO NOT AS COLD THERE.

WHILE MAY NOT BE AS COLD THIS WEEKEND...STILL EXPECTING BELOW NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES. ALSO...ENOUGH MOISTURE PRESENT AROUND FRONT TO MENTION 
A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SNOW/FLURRIES SATURDAY NIGHT/EARLY SUNDAY.

PATTERN BECOMING A LITTLE MORE INTERESTING TO END THE SHORT 
TERM...WITH RIDGE IN THE WESTERN UNITED STATES FLATTENING A 
BIT...AND SUBTROPICAL JET BECOMING A LITTLE MORE ACTIVE. MOISTURE 
LEVELS WILL BE MORE APPRECIABLE EARLY NEXT WEEK...WITH BETTER 
CHANCES OF PRECIPITATION.

PROGRESSIVE ZONAL FLOW ON TUESDAY WILL ALLOW A COLD FRONT TO SWING 
THROUGH THE AREA. LIGHT RAIN OR SNOW CAN BE EXPECTED WITH THIS 
SYSTEM. THE SNOW WOULD MAINLY BE EXPECTED IN THE MORNING. NORTHEAST 
SECTIONS COULD SEE RAIN OR SNOW TUESDAY NIGHT ON THE BACK SIDE OF 
THE AREA OF LOW PRESSURE. PRECIPITATION WILL MOVE OUT OF THE AREA BY 
WEDNESDAY MORNING. 

AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH DIGS INTO THE MID SECTION OF THE COUNTRY ON 
WEDNESDAY AND WILL BRING A SOUTHWEST FLOW BACK TO THE AREA. LIGHT 
RAIN SHOULD OVERSPREAD THE AREA WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND SNOW 
FLURRIES WILL BE SEEN ACROSS THE NORTH HALF OF THE AREA BY WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT. DRIER AIR MOVES IN FOR THURSDAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUT YET 
ANOTHER SHORT WAVE MOVES THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. THE AIR WILL BE 
COLD ENOUGH FOR FLURRIES THURSDAY NIGHT. VERY LOW THICKNESS VALUES 
WILL BE IN PLACE OVER THE AREA THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT...516DM 
ACROSS THE CENTRAL PART OF THE STATE. 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$


358 
FXUS64 KLZK 170420
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1020 PM CST THU DEC 16 2004

DISCUSSION...
UPDATED AGAIN TO LOWER MIN TEMP FORECASTS IN A FEW AREAS MAINLY IN
THE WEST AND SOUTHEAST. ALSO TOOK SKY COVER TO MOSTLY CLEAR IN MOST
AREAS BUT KEPT PARTLY CLOUDY IN SOUTH WHERE SOME CLOUDS REMAIN.   
&&
29

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 220 PM CST THU DEC 16 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT
ELONGATED SHRTWV AXIS OVR SERN AR ATTM WL CONT TO DRIFT SLOLY EWD 
TNGT. HAVE CONTD TO SEE A DECENT AMOUNT OF RETURNS ON THE 88D THIS 
AFTN ASSOCD WITH THIS FEATURE. HOWEVER...WITH A GOOD AMOUNT OF LOW 
LVL DRY AIR STILL IN PLACE...LTL OF THE PRECIP IS REACHING THE 
GROUND. MAY LEAVE SOME LINGERING SLGT CHC POPS IN THE SERN ZNS EARLY 
TNGT. MEANWHILE...SFC CDFNT WAS STILL LOCATED TO THE NW OF AR AT MID 
AFTN. WEAK PRE-FRONTAL TROF WAS NOTED OVR EXTREME NWRN AR...ALONG 
WITH SOME MID LVL CLOUDS.

MODEL SOLUTIONS TODAY ARE IN DECENT AGREEMENT FOR THE FIRST HALF OF 
THE SHORT TERM...WITH TIMING DIFFERENCES NOTED IN THE LATER PDS. 
EXPECT WEAK FNT TO WORK INTO THE FA TNGT BEFORE FALLING APART ON 
FRI. WITH LIGHT WINDS AND PATCHY CLOUDS...TEMPS TNGT WL NOT BE AS 
COLD AS THIS MRNG/S READINGS.

WEAK RDG OF HIGH PRES WL SETTLE INTO THE STATE FOR FRI AND MOST OF 
SAT. SFC WINDS WL RETURN TO A MORE S-SWLY DIRECTION FRI NIGHT AND 
SAT...ALLOWING TEMPS TO RETURN CLOSER TO NORMAL. EXPECT THE COLDEST 
READINGS FRI NIGHT TO OCCUR IN THE SHELTERED VALLEYS OF NRN AND WRN 
AR.

NEXT IN THE SERIES OF FNT/S IS FCST TO MOVE SWD ACRS THE FA SAT AFTN 
AND NIGHT. ETA SOLUTION IS A BIT FASTER WITH FROPA AS COMPARED TO 
THE GFS. DECIDED TO STICK CLOSER TO THE ETA SOLUTION AT THIS TIME AS 
THE MODEL TENDS TO HAVE A BETTER HANDLE WITH THESE TYPES OF 
AIRMASSES. LATER RUNS SHOULD COME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT WITH OVERALL 
TIMING. 

MODELS CONT TO SHOW A BAND OF MOISTURE ALONG AND BEHIND THE 
FNT/PRE-FRONTAL TROF. PLACED SOME POST-FRONTAL POPS /SLGT CHC/ FOR 
SAT AFTN ACRS N AR AND OVR MOST OF THE FA SAT NIGHT. COULD SEE SOME 
OF THE PRECIP BECOME A RAIN/SNOW MIX ACRS N-CNTRL AR SAT EVENING 
WITH CAA IN FULL SWING....WITH NO ACCUMULATION EXPECTED. BULK OF SIG 
MOISTURE SHIFTS E OF THE STATE AFT 06Z...BUT HAVE KEPT A MENTION OF 
FLURRIES FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF N AR PER GOING FCST.

BLUSTERY CONDS WL PREVAIL SUN WITH GUSTY NWLY WINDS AND DAYTIME 
TEMPS MAINLY IN THE 30S. THE MERCURY IS EXPECTED TO PLUNGE INTO THE 
TEENS SUN NIGHT OVER THE FA. 
&&

.LONG TERM...MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY
SURFACE BOUNDARY WILL BE APPROACHING THE FORECAST AREA FROM THE 
NORTHWEST ON MONDAY. RETURN FLOW WILL SET UP OUT AHEAD OF THE 
SYSTEM. SOME MOISTURE INCREASE WILL BE NOTED AS THE SYSTEM MOVES 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA. THOUGH UPPER SUPPORT AT THIS POINT APPEARS 
TO BE LACKING...SYSTEM COULD SQUEEZE OUT A FEW FLURRIES EARLY 
TUESDAY MORNING. FRONT AND AN ASSOCIATED UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL 
BEGIN MOVING INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY ON TUESDAY NIGHT. THERE WILL 
BE A CONTINUED SLIGHT CHANCE OF LIGHT RAIN...WITH THE RAIN POSSIBLY 
MIXING WITH SNOW IN THE NORTHEAST HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA BEFORE 
SUNRISE ON WEDNESDAY. THIS SYSTEM WILL BE FOLLOWED IN RAPID 
SUCCESSION BY YET ANOTHER SYSTEM ON THURSDAY. STRONG NORTHWESTERLY 
FLOW WILL BE PREVALENT OVER THIS PORTION OF THE COUNTRY...WITH 
INFLUX OF COLD CANADIAN AIR CONTINUING. 

THERE/S BEEN A GREAT DEAL OF TALK LATELY ABOUT THE CHANCES OF WINTRY 
PRECIPITATION DURING THE LATTER EXTENDED PERIODS...PARTICULARLY 
TOWARD CHRISTMAS. BASED ON WHAT IS CURRENTLY INDICATED BY THE 
MODELS...POPS ARE...AT BEST...20 PERCENT. WITH THE COLD AIRMASS IN 
PLACE...THERE COULD BE A MIXTURE OF SNOW FLURRIES OR LIGHT SNOW...
PARTICULARLY TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. HOWEVER...IT APPEARS 
THAT ANY WINTRY PRECIPITATION WOULD BE BRIEF...WITH NO ACCUMULATION 
EXPECTED. THAT BEING SAID...KEEP IN MIND THAT THIS FAR OUT...THE 
MODELS ALWAYS VARY...AND TEND TO COME MORE IN LINE WHEN THE LONG 
TERM PERIODS BECOME THE SHORT TERM PERIODS. FORECASTING PRECIP TYPE 
CAN BE CHALLENGING...PARTICULARLY IN THE LONG TERM PERIODS.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

44/57
