INTO THE FORECAST AREA. THOUGH UPPER SUPPORT AT THIS POINT APPEARS 
TO BE LACKING...SYSTEM COULD SQUEEZE OUT A FEW FLURRIES EARLY 
TUESDAY MORNING. FRONT AND AN ASSOCIATED UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL 
BEGIN MOVING INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY ON TUESDAY NIGHT. THERE WILL 
BE A CONTINUED SLIGHT CHANCE OF LIGHT RAIN...WITH THE RAIN POSSIBLY 
MIXING WITH SNOW IN THE NORTHEAST HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA BEFORE 
SUNRISE ON WEDNESDAY. THIS SYSTEM WILL BE FOLLOWED IN RAPID 
SUCCESSION BY YET ANOTHER SYSTEM ON THURSDAY. STRONG NORTHWESTERLY 
FLOW WILL BE PREVALENT OVER THIS PORTION OF THE COUNTRY...WITH 
INFLUX OF COLD CANADIAN AIR CONTINUING. 

THERE/S BEEN A GREAT DEAL OF TALK LATELY ABOUT THE CHANCES OF WINTRY 
PRECIPITATION DURING THE LATTER EXTENDED PERIODS...PARTICULARLY 
TOWARD CHRISTMAS. BASED ON WHAT IS CURRENTLY INDICATED BY THE 
MODELS...POPS ARE...AT BEST...20 PERCENT. WITH THE COLD AIRMASS IN 
PLACE...THERE COULD BE A MIXTURE OF SNOW FLURRIES OR LIGHT SNOW...
PARTICULARLY TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. HOWEVER...IT APPEARS 
THAT ANY WINTRY PRECIPITATION WOULD BE BRIEF...WITH NO ACCUMULATION 
EXPECTED. THAT BEING SAID...KEEP IN MIND THAT THIS FAR OUT...THE 
MODELS ALWAYS VARY...AND TEND TO COME MORE IN LINE WHEN THE LONG 
TERM PERIODS BECOME THE SHORT TERM PERIODS. FORECASTING PRECIP TYPE 
CAN BE CHALLENGING...PARTICULARLY IN THE LONG TERM PERIODS.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

44/57









506 
FXUS64 KLZK 170149
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
750 PM CST THU DEC 16 2004

DISCUSSION...
RAIN HAS MOVED OUT OF THE CWA SO UPDATED TO TAKE RAIN OUT OF THE
FORECAST. REST OF FORECAST ON TRACK AT THIS TIME BUT TEMP AT KPBF IS
ALREADY NEAR THE FORECAST MIN. WILL MONITOR TEMP AND SKY TRENDS OVER 
THE NEXT COUPLE OF HOURS. MAY NEED FURTHER UPDATE LATER FOR MIN TEMPS
AND SKY COVER.
&&
29

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 220 PM CST THU DEC 16 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT
ELONGATED SHRTWV AXIS OVR SERN AR ATTM WL CONT TO DRIFT SLOLY EWD 
TNGT. HAVE CONTD TO SEE A DECENT AMOUNT OF RETURNS ON THE 88D THIS 
AFTN ASSOCD WITH THIS FEATURE. HOWEVER...WITH A GOOD AMOUNT OF LOW 
LVL DRY AIR STILL IN PLACE...LTL OF THE PRECIP IS REACHING THE 
GROUND. MAY LEAVE SOME LINGERING SLGT CHC POPS IN THE SERN ZNS EARLY 
TNGT. MEANWHILE...SFC CDFNT WAS STILL LOCATED TO THE NW OF AR AT MID 
AFTN. WEAK PRE-FRONTAL TROF WAS NOTED OVR EXTREME NWRN AR...ALONG 
WITH SOME MID LVL CLOUDS.

MODEL SOLUTIONS TODAY ARE IN DECENT AGREEMENT FOR THE FIRST HALF OF 
THE SHORT TERM...WITH TIMING DIFFERENCES NOTED IN THE LATER PDS. 
EXPECT WEAK FNT TO WORK INTO THE FA TNGT BEFORE FALLING APART ON 
FRI. WITH LIGHT WINDS AND PATCHY CLOUDS...TEMPS TNGT WL NOT BE AS 
COLD AS THIS MRNG/S READINGS.

WEAK RDG OF HIGH PRES WL SETTLE INTO THE STATE FOR FRI AND MOST OF 
SAT. SFC WINDS WL RETURN TO A MORE S-SWLY DIRECTION FRI NIGHT AND 
SAT...ALLOWING TEMPS TO RETURN CLOSER TO NORMAL. EXPECT THE COLDEST 
READINGS FRI NIGHT TO OCCUR IN THE SHELTERED VALLEYS OF NRN AND WRN 
AR.

NEXT IN THE SERIES OF FNT/S IS FCST TO MOVE SWD ACRS THE FA SAT AFTN 
AND NIGHT. ETA SOLUTION IS A BIT FASTER WITH FROPA AS COMPARED TO 
THE GFS. DECIDED TO STICK CLOSER TO THE ETA SOLUTION AT THIS TIME AS 
THE MODEL TENDS TO HAVE A BETTER HANDLE WITH THESE TYPES OF 
AIRMASSES. LATER RUNS SHOULD COME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT WITH OVERALL 
TIMING. 

MODELS CONT TO SHOW A BAND OF MOISTURE ALONG AND BEHIND THE 
FNT/PRE-FRONTAL TROF. PLACED SOME POST-FRONTAL POPS /SLGT CHC/ FOR 
SAT AFTN ACRS N AR AND OVR MOST OF THE FA SAT NIGHT. COULD SEE SOME 
OF THE PRECIP BECOME A RAIN/SNOW MIX ACRS N-CNTRL AR SAT EVENING 
WITH CAA IN FULL SWING....WITH NO ACCUMULATION EXPECTED. BULK OF SIG 
MOISTURE SHIFTS E OF THE STATE AFT 06Z...BUT HAVE KEPT A MENTION OF 
FLURRIES FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF N AR PER GOING FCST.

BLUSTERY CONDS WL PREVAIL SUN WITH GUSTY NWLY WINDS AND DAYTIME 
TEMPS MAINLY IN THE 30S. THE MERCURY IS EXPECTED TO PLUNGE INTO THE 
TEENS SUN NIGHT OVER THE FA. 
&&

.LONG TERM...MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY
SURFACE BOUNDARY WILL BE APPROACHING THE FORECAST AREA FROM THE 
NORTHWEST ON MONDAY. RETURN FLOW WILL SET UP OUT AHEAD OF THE 
SYSTEM. SOME MOISTURE INCREASE WILL BE NOTED AS THE SYSTEM MOVES 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA. THOUGH UPPER SUPPORT AT THIS POINT APPEARS 
TO BE LACKING...SYSTEM COULD SQUEEZE OUT A FEW FLURRIES EARLY 
TUESDAY MORNING. FRONT AND AN ASSOCIATED UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL 
BEGIN MOVING INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY ON TUESDAY NIGHT. THERE WILL 
BE A CONTINUED SLIGHT CHANCE OF LIGHT RAIN...WITH THE RAIN POSSIBLY 
MIXING WITH SNOW IN THE NORTHEAST HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA BEFORE 
SUNRISE ON WEDNESDAY. THIS SYSTEM WILL BE FOLLOWED IN RAPID 
SUCCESSION BY YET ANOTHER SYSTEM ON THURSDAY. STRONG NORTHWESTERLY 
FLOW WILL BE PREVALENT OVER THIS PORTION OF THE COUNTRY...WITH 
INFLUX OF COLD CANADIAN AIR CONTINUING. 

THERE/S BEEN A GREAT DEAL OF TALK LATELY ABOUT THE CHANCES OF WINTRY 
PRECIPITATION DURING THE LATTER EXTENDED PERIODS...PARTICULARLY 
TOWARD CHRISTMAS. BASED ON WHAT IS CURRENTLY INDICATED BY THE 
MODELS...POPS ARE...AT BEST...20 PERCENT. WITH THE COLD AIRMASS IN 
PLACE...THERE COULD BE A MIXTURE OF SNOW FLURRIES OR LIGHT SNOW...
PARTICULARLY TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. HOWEVER...IT APPEARS 
THAT ANY WINTRY PRECIPITATION WOULD BE BRIEF...WITH NO ACCUMULATION 
EXPECTED. THAT BEING SAID...KEEP IN MIND THAT THIS FAR OUT...THE 
MODELS ALWAYS VARY...AND TEND TO COME MORE IN LINE WHEN THE LONG 
TERM PERIODS BECOME THE SHORT TERM PERIODS. FORECASTING PRECIP TYPE 
CAN BE CHALLENGING...PARTICULARLY IN THE LONG TERM PERIODS.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1120 AM CST THU DEC 16 2004

.DISCUSSION...
SENT ANOTHER UPDATE TO CLEAN UP MRNG WORDING. LEFT SLGT CHC POPS FOR 
SRN ZNS THIS AFTN AS WEAK SHRTWV COTNS TO MOVE ACRS THAT AREA. WEAK 
FNTL BNDRY NOTED TO THE NW OF AR AT LATE MRNG...ALIGNED ROUGHLY 
ALONG I-44 CORRIDOR. EXPECT BNDRY TO WORK SLOLY SEWD THIS AFTN. 
OTHER THAN A GRADUAL WIND SHIFT...BAND OF MID LVL CLOUDS ONLY OTHER 
NOTABLE FEATURE WITH IT. ADJUSTED AFTN HIGH TEMPS BASED ON LATEST 
TRENDS...WITH COOLEST READINGS EXPECTED OVR SERN AR WHERE THICKER 
CLOUDS EXPECTED MUCH OF THE AFTN. NO OTHER CHGS TO FCST. UPDATED 
GRIDS AND ZNS ALREADY OUT.


358 
FXUS64 KLZK 161437 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
835 AM CST THU DEC 16 2004

.DISCUSSION...
PRECIP FALLING FROM MAINLY MID CLOUDS HAS MANAGED TO REACH THE 
GROUND OVR THE SRN PARTS OF THE FA THIS MRNG. SFC REPORTS ALSO INDC 
SOME SLEET MIXING WITH THE RAIN DUE TO EFFECTS OF EVAP COOLING. HAVE 
UPDATED GRIDS AND ZNS TO ACCOUNT FOR THESE TRENDS. SFC TEMPS IN MOST 
LOCATIONS ARE ARND 32F...SO DO NOT EXPECT ANY TRAVEL PROBLEMS. 
UPDATED PRODUCTS ALREADY ISSUED.
&&

PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 350 AM CST THU DEC 16 2004

HIGH PRESSURE OFF TO THE SOUTHEAST THIS MORNING...WITH LIGHT SOUTH 
SOUTHEAST WINDS KEEPING TEMPS WARMER THAN WEDNESDAY MORNING. 
HOWEVER...ALL AREAS STILL BELOW FREEZING. HIGH CLOUDS ARE MOVING IN 
AHEAD OF COLD FRONT IN THE PLAINS...WITH LOWER CLOUDS MOVING 
NORTHEAST OUT OF TEXAS AND LOUISIANA DUE TO A SHORTWAVE ALONG THE 
GULF.

MOISTURE WILL MOVE NORTH TODAY INTO SOUTHERN ARKANSAS AHEAD OF COLD 
FRONT. THUS...HAVE CONTINUED THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN THE EXTREME 
SOUTH...BUT THINK MOST OF THE LIGHT RAIN WILL BE SOUTH IN LOUISIANA. 
DUE TO CLOUDS AROUND...TEMPS WILL NOT WARM AS RAPIDLY AS WEDNESDAY 
...WITH HIGHS TODAY MAINLY IN THE MID TO UPPER 40S.

COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT...FOLLOWED 
BY WEAK HIGH PRESSURE. COOLER AND DRIER AIR WILL MOVE IN...BUT TEMPS 
WILL NOT BE QUITE AS COLD.

STRONGER FRONT AND UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE INTO THE STATE SATURDAY 
AND SATURDAY NIGHT. PREVIOUS FORECAST INCLUDED CHANCE OF SNOW 
FLURRIES IN THE NORTHEAST...AND SAW NO REASON TO DEVIATE. MAIN STORY 
WILL BE COLDER AIR MOVING IN SUNDAY. HAVE TRENDED TEMP FORECASTS TO 
SHOW HIGHS SUNDAY EARLY IN THE DAY...WITH TEMPS FALLING IN THE 
AFTERNOON. HIGHS ON SUNDAY MAY BE TOO OPTIMISTIC...AND WILL HAVE TO 
WATCH WITH FUTURE MODEL RUNS.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

44





000 
FXUS64 KLZK 161437 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
835 AM CST THU DEC 16 2004

.DISCUSSION...
PRECIP FALLING FROM MAINLY MID CLOUDS HAS MANAGED TO REACH THE 
GROUND OVR THE SRN PARTS OF THE FA THIS MRNG. SFC REPORTS ALSO INDC 
SOME SLEET MIXING WITH THE RAIN DUE TO EFFECTS OF EVAP COOLING. HAVE 
UPDATED GRIDS AND ZNS TO ACCOUNT FOR THESE TRENDS. SFC TEMPS IN MOST 
LOCATIONS ARE ARND 32F...SO DO NOT EXPECT ANY TRAVEL PROBLEMS. 
UPDATED PRODUCTS ALREADY ISSUED.
&&

PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 350 AM CST THU DEC 16 2004

HIGH PRESSURE OFF TO THE SOUTHEAST THIS MORNING...WITH LIGHT SOUTH 
SOUTHEAST WINDS KEEPING TEMPS WARMER THAN WEDNESDAY MORNING. 
HOWEVER...ALL AREAS STILL BELOW FREEZING. HIGH CLOUDS ARE MOVING IN 
AHEAD OF COLD FRONT IN THE PLAINS...WITH LOWER CLOUDS MOVING 
NORTHEAST OUT OF TEXAS AND LOUISIANA DUE TO A SHORTWAVE ALONG THE 
GULF.

MOISTURE WILL MOVE NORTH TODAY INTO SOUTHERN ARKANSAS AHEAD OF COLD 
FRONT. THUS...HAVE CONTINUED THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN THE EXTREME 
SOUTH...BUT THINK MOST OF THE LIGHT RAIN WILL BE SOUTH IN LOUISIANA. 
DUE TO CLOUDS AROUND...TEMPS WILL NOT WARM AS RAPIDLY AS WEDNESDAY 
...WITH HIGHS TODAY MAINLY IN THE MID TO UPPER 40S.

COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT...FOLLOWED 
BY WEAK HIGH PRESSURE. COOLER AND DRIER AIR WILL MOVE IN...BUT TEMPS 
WILL NOT BE QUITE AS COLD.

STRONGER FRONT AND UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE INTO THE STATE SATURDAY 
AND SATURDAY NIGHT. PREVIOUS FORECAST INCLUDED CHANCE OF SNOW 
FLURRIES IN THE NORTHEAST...AND SAW NO REASON TO DEVIATE. MAIN STORY 
WILL BE COLDER AIR MOVING IN SUNDAY. HAVE TRENDED TEMP FORECASTS TO 
SHOW HIGHS SUNDAY EARLY IN THE DAY...WITH TEMPS FALLING IN THE 
AFTERNOON. HIGHS ON SUNDAY MAY BE TOO OPTIMISTIC...AND WILL HAVE TO 
WATCH WITH FUTURE MODEL RUNS.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

44





153 
FXUS64 KLZK 160956
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
350 AM CST THU DEC 16 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT
HIGH PRESSURE OFF TO THE SOUTHEAST THIS MORNING...WITH LIGHT SOUTH 
SOUTHEAST WINDS KEEPING TEMPS WARMER THAN WEDNESDAY MORNING. 
HOWEVER...ALL AREAS STILL BELOW FREEZING. HIGH CLOUDS ARE MOVING IN 
AHEAD OF COLD FRONT IN THE PLAINS...WITH LOWER CLOUDS MOVING 
NORTHEAST OUT OF TEXAS AND LOUISIANA DUE TO A SHORTWAVE ALONG THE 
GULF.

MOISTURE WILL MOVE NORTH TODAY INTO SOUTHERN ARKANSAS AHEAD OF COLD 
FRONT. THUS...HAVE CONTINUED THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN THE EXTREME 
SOUTH...BUT THINK MOST OF THE LIGHT RAIN WILL BE SOUTH IN LOUISIANA. 
DUE TO CLOUDS AROUND...TEMPS WILL NOT WARM AS RAPIDLY AS WEDNESDAY 
...WITH HIGHS TODAY MAINLY IN THE MID TO UPPER 40S.

COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT...FOLLOWED 
BY WEAK HIGH PRESSURE. COOLER AND DRIER AIR WILL MOVE IN...BUT TEMPS 
WILL NOT BE QUITE AS COLD.

STRONGER FRONT AND UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE INTO THE STATE SATURDAY 
AND SATURDAY NIGHT. PREVIOUS FORECAST INCLUDED CHANCE OF SNOW 
FLURRIES IN THE NORTHEAST...AND SAW NO REASON TO DEVIATE. MAIN STORY 
WILL BE COLDER AIR MOVING IN SUNDAY. HAVE TRENDED TEMP FORECASTS TO 
SHOW HIGHS SUNDAY EARLY IN THE DAY...WITH TEMPS FALLING IN THE 
AFTERNOON. HIGHS ON SUNDAY MAY BE TOO OPTIMISTIC...AND WILL HAVE TO 
WATCH WITH FUTURE MODEL RUNS.
&&

.LONG TERM...MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY
MODELS CONTINUE THEIR TREND OR BRINGING IN MUCH COLDER AIR TO THE 
REGION EARLY IN THE PERIOD. FLOW REMAINS VERY PROGRESSIVE AND THE 
DRASTIC COOL DOWN APPEARS TO BE SHORT LIVED. MONDAY MORNING WILL BE 
A CHILLY ONE ACROSS THE AREA WITH WIDESPREAD TEENS. NEW MEX GUIDANCE 
IS ADVERTISING SINGLE DIGITS ACROSS THE NORTH. LITTLE HESITANT TO GO 
QUITE THAT LOW BUT WILL CONTINUE THE TREND OF LOWERING TEMPS IN THIS 
TIME FRAME. HIGHS ON MONDAY WILL STRUGGLE TO REACH 40 DEGREES IN 
MOST AREAS. OVERALL MEX NUMBERS DO NOT APPEAR TO BE TOO UNREASONABLE 
WITH THE EXCEPTION OF MONDAY MORNING AND THEY WILL BE FOLLOWED 
FAIRLY CLOSELY.

UPPER FLOW FORECAST TO DAMPEN OUT AND TURN MORE ZONAL AS NEXT COLD 
FRONT KICKS OUT OF THE ROCKIES. LIKE ALL THE PREVIOUS BOUNDARIES... 
THIS ONE PROGGED TO GO THROUGH DRY WITH ANOTHER REINFORCING SHOT OF 
COLD AIR AS UPPER FLOW ONCE AGAIN TURNS NORTHWEST. MODELS WERE 
PREVIOUSLY ADVERTISING WEAK LOW PRESSURE MOVING ALONG THE GULF COAST 
AND POSSIBLE WEAK OVERRUNNING PRECIP EVENT FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
EARLY WEDNESDAY. MODELS BACKING OFF A BIT NOW ON THIS SCENARIO. WITH 
MODELS A BIT INCONSISTENT IN THE DAY SIX AND SEVEN TIME FRAME...WILL 
LOWER POPS TO SILENT TENS FOR NOW AND SEE HOW THE WHOLE THING WORKS 
OUT.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    49  31  50  31 /  10  10   0   0 
HARRISON AR       47  28  47  32 /  10  10   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    49  32  50  32 /  10  10   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     47  32  50  32 /  10  10   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  47  28  46  31 /  10  10   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     47  32  51  32 /  20  10   0   0 
SEARCY AR         48  30  48  30 /  10  10   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      48  32  50  32 /  10  10   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   48  30  49  29 /  10  10   0   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

58/56





585 
FXUS64 KLZK 160356
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
955 PM CST WED DEC 15 2004

DISCUSSION...SENT OUT UPDATE MAINLY TO CLEAR UP EVENING WORDING AND
GO WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES FOR ALL AREAS AS HIGH CLOUDS MOVE INTO 
THE AREA AHEAD OF A BROAD UPPER TROF TO THE WEST. MIN TEMP FORECASTS
LOOK PRETTY GOOD. WILL BE SITUATION WHERE LOW LYING AREAS WILL BE
THE COLDEST AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS STAY WARMER. MADE SOME MINOR
CHANGES TO DEW POINT AND RH GRIDS TO REFLECT OBSERVED CONDITIONS
AT 03Z.

29
&&

PREV DISCUSSION...  
ISSUED AT 225 PM CST WED DEC 15 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT
SFC HIGH PRES CONTS TO SLIDE OFF TO THE E OF AR...ALLOWING SLY WIND 
FLOW TO RETURN TO THE FA THIS AFTN. AFTER A COLD START TO THE 
DAY...AFTN READINGS HAD REBOUNDED INTO THE UPPER 30S TO MID 40S.

MODELS RMN IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH OVERALL WX PATTERN THRU THE SHORT 
TERM WITH SERIES OF TROFS PROGGED TO SEWD ACRS THE FA IN CONTD 
PROGRESSIVE UPPER FLOW PATTERN. FIRST IN THE SERIES WAS DROPPING 
SEWD OUT OF THE ERN ROCKIES THIS AFTN. THIS FEATURE...ALONG WITH 
ASSOCD CDFNT...WL PASS ACRS AR THU AFTN AND NIGHT. ETA STILL INDCS A 
DECENT AMOUNT OF LOW LVL RH WORKING INTO SERN AR AHEAD OF FROPA THU 
AFTN AND EVENING AS LOW LVL JET INCRS. THUS...HAVE INSERTED SLIGHT 
CHC OF LIGHT RAIN FOR THE SERN ZNS.

A REINFORCING SHOT OF COOLER AND DRIER AIR WL OVERSPREAD AR FRI AND 
FRI NIGHT THANKS TO WEAK SFC HIGH PRES. MORE SIG SHRTWV/CDFNT MOVES 
THRU THE STATE SAT AND SAT NIGHT. THIS FNT WL BRING MUCH COLDER 
ARCTIC AIRMASS INTO THE MID-SOUTH STARTING SAT NIGHT. HAVE ADDED A 
CHC OF FLURRIES FOR NRN AR SAT NIGHT AS UPPER TROF AXIS AND 
POST-FRONTAL MOISTURE SHIFTS SEWD. BULK OF MOISTURE QUICKLY SHIFTS 
EWD BY LATE SAT NIGHT...SO HAVE LEFT THE REST OF THE FA DRY FOR NOW.

TEMPS WL BE THE PRIMARY FCST CHALLENGE THRU THE ENTIRE PD. BOTH ETA 
AND GFS MOS IN CLOSE AGREEMENT THROUGHOUT THE SHORT TERM. HAVE 
GENERALLY STAYED WITHIN A FEW DEGREES OF MODEL OUTPUT FOR TEMPS. 
&&

.LONG TERM...SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY
PRIMARY ISSUES IN THE EXTENDED DEAL WITH TEMPERATURE TRENDS...POPS 
AND PRECIPITATION TYPE.

WHAT A DIFFERENCE A DAY MAKES. A COLD DIFFERENCE THAT IS. MODELS ARE 
CONTINUING TO TREND TEMPERATURES MUCH COLDER DURING THE EXTENDED 
PERIODS. WITH STRONG H5 FLOW CONTINUING...AND NO SIGNIFICANT 
DEVIATIONS IN THE PATTERN...THIS IS CERTAINLY NO SURPRISE. HAVE THUS 
CONTINUED TO TREND TEMPS LOWER...BUT NOT QUITE AS LOW AS GUIDANCE 
/I.E. 8 DEGREES ON MONDAY MORNING AT HARRISON IF YOU BELIEVE THE 
MEX/. 

SURFACE RIDGE WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA ON SUNDAY...WITH CLEAR AND DRY 
CONDITIONS FOR THE FIRST PART OF THE WEEK. BY SUNDAY NIGHT...TEMPS 
WILL BE IN THE TEENS STATEWIDE...AND HIGHS ON MONDAY WILL LIKELY 
STRUGGLE TO REACH 40 DEGREES. 

RIDGE WILL MOVE TO THE EAST LATE MONDAY...WITH RETURN FLOW SETTING 
UP. WARMING TREND WILL BE NOTED...HOWEVER...THIS WILL BE SHORT 
LIVED. UPPER FLOW WILL BECOME MORE ZONAL AS H5 RIDGE WILL MOVE 
TOWARD THE EAST COAST. THIS WILL ALLOW COLD FRONT AND DEVELOPING 
SURFACE LOW TO SWEEP DOWN FROM THE ROCKIES...AND ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. THIS WILL BE FOLLOWED BY YET 
ANOTHER COOLDOWN...AS NORTHWESTERLY FLOW BUILDS BACK IN JUST BEYOND 
THE END OF THE PERIOD. 

AS FAR AS POPS AND PRECIP TYPE ARE CONCERNED...LOOKS LIKE THERE 
COULD BE A MIXTURE OF RAIN AND FLURRIES/SNOW ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY MORNING OVER ROUGHLY THE NORTHWEST HALF OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. FORECAST SOUNDINGS INDICATE ONLY A SHALLOW MELTING LAYER...AND 
BY 12Z WEDNESDAY...TEMPERATURES IN THESE AREAS WILL LARGELY BE BELOW 
FREEZING. CRITICAL THICKNESS VALUES ALSO WOULD INDICATE SNOW OVER 
THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA AS WELL. HAVE GONE BELOW 
GUIDANCE FOR POPS...MAINLY SLIGHT CHANCE/20 PERCENT. OF 
COURSE...THIS FAR OUT THINGS HAVE A TENDENCY TO CHANGE QUITE A BIT. 
/SURPRISE SURPRISE/. WILL KEEP AN EYE ON THIS...TRENDING THE 
FORECAST AS NECESSARY.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

000 
FXUS64 KLZK 160356
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
955 PM CST WED DEC 15 2004

DISCUSSION...SENT OUT UPDATE MAINLY TO CLEAR UP EVENING WORDING AND
GO WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES FOR ALL AREAS AS HIGH CLOUDS MOVE INTO 
THE AREA AHEAD OF A BROAD UPPER TROF TO THE WEST. MIN TEMP FORECASTS
LOOK PRETTY GOOD. WILL BE SITUATION WHERE LOW LYING AREAS WILL BE
THE COLDEST AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS STAY WARMER. MADE SOME MINOR
CHANGES TO DEW POINT AND RH GRIDS TO REFLECT OBSERVED CONDITIONS
AT 03Z.

29
&&

PREV DISCUSSION...  
ISSUED AT 225 PM CST WED DEC 15 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT
SFC HIGH PRES CONTS TO SLIDE OFF TO THE E OF AR...ALLOWING SLY WIND 
FLOW TO RETURN TO THE FA THIS AFTN. AFTER A COLD START TO THE 
DAY...AFTN READINGS HAD REBOUNDED INTO THE UPPER 30S TO MID 40S.

MODELS RMN IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH OVERALL WX PATTERN THRU THE SHORT 
TERM WITH SERIES OF TROFS PROGGED TO SEWD ACRS THE FA IN CONTD 
PROGRESSIVE UPPER FLOW PATTERN. FIRST IN THE SERIES WAS DROPPING 
SEWD OUT OF THE ERN ROCKIES THIS AFTN. THIS FEATURE...ALONG WITH 
ASSOCD CDFNT...WL PASS ACRS AR THU AFTN AND NIGHT. ETA STILL INDCS A 
DECENT AMOUNT OF LOW LVL RH WORKING INTO SERN AR AHEAD OF FROPA THU 
AFTN AND EVENING AS LOW LVL JET INCRS. THUS...HAVE INSERTED SLIGHT 
CHC OF LIGHT RAIN FOR THE SERN ZNS.

A REINFORCING SHOT OF COOLER AND DRIER AIR WL OVERSPREAD AR FRI AND 
FRI NIGHT THANKS TO WEAK SFC HIGH PRES. MORE SIG SHRTWV/CDFNT MOVES 
THRU THE STATE SAT AND SAT NIGHT. THIS FNT WL BRING MUCH COLDER 
ARCTIC AIRMASS INTO THE MID-SOUTH STARTING SAT NIGHT. HAVE ADDED A 
CHC OF FLURRIES FOR NRN AR SAT NIGHT AS UPPER TROF AXIS AND 
POST-FRONTAL MOISTURE SHIFTS SEWD. BULK OF MOISTURE QUICKLY SHIFTS 
EWD BY LATE SAT NIGHT...SO HAVE LEFT THE REST OF THE FA DRY FOR NOW.

TEMPS WL BE THE PRIMARY FCST CHALLENGE THRU THE ENTIRE PD. BOTH ETA 
AND GFS MOS IN CLOSE AGREEMENT THROUGHOUT THE SHORT TERM. HAVE 
GENERALLY STAYED WITHIN A FEW DEGREES OF MODEL OUTPUT FOR TEMPS. 
&&

.LONG TERM...SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY
PRIMARY ISSUES IN THE EXTENDED DEAL WITH TEMPERATURE TRENDS...POPS 
AND PRECIPITATION TYPE.

WHAT A DIFFERENCE A DAY MAKES. A COLD DIFFERENCE THAT IS. MODELS ARE 
CONTINUING TO TREND TEMPERATURES MUCH COLDER DURING THE EXTENDED 
PERIODS. WITH STRONG H5 FLOW CONTINUING...AND NO SIGNIFICANT 
DEVIATIONS IN THE PATTERN...THIS IS CERTAINLY NO SURPRISE. HAVE THUS 
CONTINUED TO TREND TEMPS LOWER...BUT NOT QUITE AS LOW AS GUIDANCE 
/I.E. 8 DEGREES ON MONDAY MORNING AT HARRISON IF YOU BELIEVE THE 
MEX/. 

SURFACE RIDGE WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA ON SUNDAY...WITH CLEAR AND DRY 
CONDITIONS FOR THE FIRST PART OF THE WEEK. BY SUNDAY NIGHT...TEMPS 
WILL BE IN THE TEENS STATEWIDE...AND HIGHS ON MONDAY WILL LIKELY 
STRUGGLE TO REACH 40 DEGREES. 

RIDGE WILL MOVE TO THE EAST LATE MONDAY...WITH RETURN FLOW SETTING 
UP. WARMING TREND WILL BE NOTED...HOWEVER...THIS WILL BE SHORT 
LIVED. UPPER FLOW WILL BECOME MORE ZONAL AS H5 RIDGE WILL MOVE 
TOWARD THE EAST COAST. THIS WILL ALLOW COLD FRONT AND DEVELOPING 
SURFACE LOW TO SWEEP DOWN FROM THE ROCKIES...AND ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. THIS WILL BE FOLLOWED BY YET 
ANOTHER COOLDOWN...AS NORTHWESTERLY FLOW BUILDS BACK IN JUST BEYOND 
THE END OF THE PERIOD. 

AS FAR AS POPS AND PRECIP TYPE ARE CONCERNED...LOOKS LIKE THERE 
COULD BE A MIXTURE OF RAIN AND FLURRIES/SNOW ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY MORNING OVER ROUGHLY THE NORTHWEST HALF OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. FORECAST SOUNDINGS INDICATE ONLY A SHALLOW MELTING LAYER...AND 
BY 12Z WEDNESDAY...TEMPERATURES IN THESE AREAS WILL LARGELY BE BELOW 
FREEZING. CRITICAL THICKNESS VALUES ALSO WOULD INDICATE SNOW OVER 
THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA AS WELL. HAVE GONE BELOW 
GUIDANCE FOR POPS...MAINLY SLIGHT CHANCE/20 PERCENT. OF 
COURSE...THIS FAR OUT THINGS HAVE A TENDENCY TO CHANGE QUITE A BIT. 
/SURPRISE SURPRISE/. WILL KEEP AN EYE ON THIS...TRENDING THE 
FORECAST AS NECESSARY.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

SEWD OUT OF THE ERN ROCKIES THIS AFTN. THIS FEATURE...ALONG WITH 
ASSOCD CDFNT...WL PASS ACRS AR THU AFTN AND NIGHT. ETA STILL INDCS A 
DECENT AMOUNT OF LOW LVL RH WORKING INTO SERN AR AHEAD OF FROPA THU 
AFTN AND EVENING AS LOW LVL JET INCRS. THUS...HAVE INSERTED SLIGHT 
CHC OF LIGHT RAIN FOR THE SERN ZNS.

A REINFORCING SHOT OF COOLER AND DRIER AIR WL OVERSPREAD AR FRI AND 
FRI NIGHT THANKS TO WEAK SFC HIGH PRES. MORE SIG SHRTWV/CDFNT MOVES 
THRU THE STATE SAT AND SAT NIGHT. THIS FNT WL BRING MUCH COLDER 
ARCTIC AIRMASS INTO THE MID-SOUTH STARTING SAT NIGHT. HAVE ADDED A 
CHC OF FLURRIES FOR NRN AR SAT NIGHT AS UPPER TROF AXIS AND 
POST-FRONTAL MOISTURE SHIFTS SEWD. BULK OF MOISTURE QUICKLY SHIFTS 
EWD BY LATE SAT NIGHT...SO HAVE LEFT THE REST OF THE FA DRY FOR NOW.

TEMPS WL BE THE PRIMARY FCST CHALLENGE THRU THE ENTIRE PD. BOTH ETA 
AND GFS MOS IN CLOSE AGREEMENT THROUGHOUT THE SHORT TERM. HAVE 
GENERALLY STAYED WITHIN A FEW DEGREES OF MODEL OUTPUT FOR TEMPS. 
&&

.LONG TERM...SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY
PRIMARY ISSUES IN THE EXTENDED DEAL WITH TEMPERATURE TRENDS...POPS 
AND PRECIPITATION TYPE.

WHAT A DIFFERENCE A DAY MAKES. A COLD DIFFERENCE THAT IS. MODELS ARE 
CONTINUING TO TREND TEMPERATURES MUCH COLDER DURING THE EXTENDED 
PERIODS. WITH STRONG H5 FLOW CONTINUING...AND NO SIGNIFICANT 
DEVIATIONS IN THE PATTERN...THIS IS CERTAINLY NO SURPRISE. HAVE THUS 
CONTINUED TO TREND TEMPS LOWER...BUT NOT QUITE AS LOW AS GUIDANCE 
/I.E. 8 DEGREES ON MONDAY MORNING AT HARRISON IF YOU BELIEVE THE 
MEX/. 

SURFACE RIDGE WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA ON SUNDAY...WITH CLEAR AND DRY 
CONDITIONS FOR THE FIRST PART OF THE WEEK. BY SUNDAY NIGHT...TEMPS 
WILL BE IN THE TEENS STATEWIDE...AND HIGHS ON MONDAY WILL LIKELY 
STRUGGLE TO REACH 40 DEGREES. 

RIDGE WILL MOVE TO THE EAST LATE MONDAY...WITH RETURN FLOW SETTING 
UP. WARMING TREND WILL BE NOTED...HOWEVER...THIS WILL BE SHORT 
LIVED. UPPER FLOW WILL BECOME MORE ZONAL AS H5 RIDGE WILL MOVE 
TOWARD THE EAST COAST. THIS WILL ALLOW COLD FRONT AND DEVELOPING 
SURFACE LOW TO SWEEP DOWN FROM THE ROCKIES...AND ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. THIS WILL BE FOLLOWED BY YET 
ANOTHER COOLDOWN...AS NORTHWESTERLY FLOW BUILDS BACK IN JUST BEYOND 
THE END OF THE PERIOD. 

AS FAR AS POPS AND PRECIP TYPE ARE CONCERNED...LOOKS LIKE THERE 
COULD BE A MIXTURE OF RAIN AND FLURRIES/SNOW ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY MORNING OVER ROUGHLY THE NORTHWEST HALF OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. FORECAST SOUNDINGS INDICATE ONLY A SHALLOW MELTING LAYER...AND 
BY 12Z WEDNESDAY...TEMPERATURES IN THESE AREAS WILL LARGELY BE BELOW 
FREEZING. CRITICAL THICKNESS VALUES ALSO WOULD INDICATE SNOW OVER 
THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA AS WELL. HAVE GONE BELOW 
GUIDANCE FOR POPS...MAINLY SLIGHT CHANCE/20 PERCENT. OF 
COURSE...THIS FAR OUT THINGS HAVE A TENDENCY TO CHANGE QUITE A BIT. 
/SURPRISE SURPRISE/. WILL KEEP AN EYE ON THIS...TRENDING THE 
FORECAST AS NECESSARY.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

44/57





994 
FXUS64 KLZK 150944
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
340 AM CST WED DEC 15 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT
HIGH PRESSURE SLOWLY MOVES OFF TO THE EAST TODAY. AFTER A COLD START 
THIS MORNING...SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL ALLOW TEMPS TO CLIMB 
THIS AFTERNOON FOR READINGS WARMER THAN MONDAY. HIGH CLOUDS OVER THE 
PLAINS WILL MOVE EAST AND INHIBIT SOME WARMING TODAY.

COLD FRONT MOVING SOUTH OUT OF MISSOURI WILL REINFORCE THE COLD AND 
DRY AIRMASS. MODELS HINTING AT SHORTWAVE MOVING NORTHEAST OUT OF 
LOUISIANA HAVING SOME MOISTURE...BUT FIND THIS SCENARIO HARD TO 
BELIEVE DUE TO DRY AIR IN PLACE. HAVE HELD OFF ON PRECIP AT THIS 
TIME...WITH A WIND SHIFT AND INCREASING CLOUDS THE ONLY NOTICEABLE 
FEATURES WITH THE COLD FRONT LATE THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY NIGHT.

DRY CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH SATURDAY. WINDS RETURN TO THE 
SOUTHWEST AHEAD OF NEXT TROUGH MOVING SOUTH FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS 
FOR A BRIEF WARMUP. UPPER TROUGH PLACEMENT WILL BE MAIN PLAYER IN 
TEMPS FOR OVERNIGHT SATURDAY. MODELS ARE SHOWING TROUGH TO BE JUST 
TO THE EAST OF THE AREA...KEEPING THE COLDEST AIR EAST OF THE 
ARKANSAS. HOWEVER...IF TROUGH MOVES TO THE WEST...TEMPERATURES COULD 
BE QUITE COLD FOR SUNDAY MORNING.
&&

.LONG TERM...SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY
SOME CHANGES NEEDED TO THE EXTENDED GRIDS/ZONES THIS MORNING AS BOTH 
THE NUMERICAL GUIDANCE AND THE MODELS ARE SHOWING COLDER AIR THAN 
PREVIOUSLY FORECASTED COMING BACK IN. FRONTAL SYSTEM AND DEEP TROF 
THAT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT WILL BE WELL EAST OF THE 
STATE BY SUNDAY MORNING. HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE FOR DAYS FIVE 
AND SIX FOR THE CONTINUATION OF DRY WEATHER. STRONG NORTH TO 
NORTHWEST FLOW FOR SUNDAY AND EARLY MONDAY SETS THE STAGE FOR MORE 
COLD WEATHER BEFORE FLOW DAMPENS OUT LATE ON DAY SIX AS UPPER LEVEL 
RIDGE CRESTS OVER THE UPPER MIDWEST. 

SURFACE HIGH IS OF CANADIAN ORIGIN AND LOOKS TO QUITE CHILLY. 
LOWERED BOTH MAXES AND MINS FOR DAYS FIVE AND SIX. IF ORIGIN OF THE 
HIGH COMES TO FRUITION...TEMPERATURES MAY BE NEEDED TO BE TWEAKED 
DOWNWARD FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY BUT WILL TAKE A WAIT AND SEE APPROACH 
FOR NOW.

PROGRESSIVE NATURE OF THE PATTERN CONTINUES AND RIDGE IS QUICKLY 
KICKED EASTWARD BY THE NEXT IN THE SEEMINGLY ENDLESS PARADE OF 
SYSTEMS MOVING THROUGH THE VERY ACTIVE NORTHERN STREAM. RETURN FLOW 
STARTS TO GET REESTABLISHED LATE TUESDAY ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE 
DEPARTING HIGH BUT BEST CHANCES OF PRECIP WILL FALL BEYOND THE DAY 
SEVEN PERIOD. TEMPERATURES EXPECTED TO BE WARMER DAY SEVEN AS WELL.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    45  25  49  32 /   0   0  10  10 
HARRISON AR       45  25  47  28 /   0   0  10  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    47  25  49  32 /   0   0  10  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     46  26  50  33 /   0   0  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  43  25  47  28 /   0   0  10  10 
MONTICELLO AR     47  27  51  34 /   0   0  10  10 
SEARCY AR         44  24  48  30 /   0   0  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      47  25  49  32 /   0   0  10  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   45  24  48  30 /   0   0  10  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

044 
FXUS64 KLZK 150406 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
959 PM CST TUE DEC 14 2004

.DISCUSSION...
COLDEST NIGHT OF THE SEASON STILL IN STORE...BUT MAY NOT BE 
QUITE AS COLD AS PREVIOUSLY THOUGHT. TEENS REMAIN IN THE FORECAST
ACROSS NORTHERN/WESTERN ARKANSAS...BUT TEMPERATURES MAY STAY UP A 
BIT ACROSS PORTIONS OF CENTRAL/SOUTHERN ARKANSAS. DEWPOINTS IN THESE 
AREAS HAVE STEADIED OUT...AND THE GROUND IS STILL FAIRLY WARM. (46)  
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 215 PM CST TUE DEC 14 2004

CANADIAN HIGH PRES CENTERED JUST OF THE W OF AR THIS AFTN... 
PROVIDING SUNNY SKIES AND COLD TEMPS. MID AFTN READINGS WERE 
GENERALLY IN THE 30S STATEWIDE.

MAIN FCST CONCERN IN THE SHORT TERM WL BE TEMP TRENDS. THE HIGH 
CENTER WL MOVE OVR AR TNGT...RESULTING IN THE COLDEST NIGHT OF THE 
SEASON WITH CALM WINDS AND CLEAR SKIES. EXPECT LOWS IN THE TEENS TO 
BE COMMON ACRS THE FA...WITH SOME SINGLE DIGITS A GOOD BET IN THE 
COLDER VALLEYS OF NRN AND WRN AR.

THE HIGH IS FCST TO SHIFT SLOLY EWD ON WED...ALLOWING SFC WINDS TO 
RETURN A S-SELY DIRECTION BY AFTN. HAVE GONE A FEW DEGREES BLO MOS 
TEMPS FOR HIGHS ON WED AS MODELS ALWAYS TRY TO WARM THINGS UP TOO 
FAST IN THIS TYPE OF PATTERN. EXPECT SOME HIGH CLOUDS TO AFFECT THE 
AREA ON WED AHEAD OF NEXT UPPER SYS.

MODELS CONT TO PROG A SERIES OF UPPER TROFS DROPPING SEWD ACRS THE 
MID-SOUTH THE NEXT FEW DAYS...BRINGING REINFORCING SHOTS OF COOLER 
AND DRIER AIR. NEXT CDFNT IS PROGGED TO MOVE ACRS AR LATE THU AND 
THU NIGHT. ONLY LOOKING AT INCRSD CLOUD COVER WITH FROPA AS GULF 
MOISTURE RMNS CUTOFF. CLOUDS WL PERSIST INTO FRI AS UPPER TROF AXIS 
WORKS SLOLY SEWD THRU THE AREA. HIGH PRES WL SETTLE BACK INTO THE FA 
FRI NIGHT.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
215 PM CST TUE DEC 14 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT
CANADIAN HIGH PRES CENTERED JUST OF THE W OF AR THIS AFTN... 
PROVIDING SUNNY SKIES AND COLD TEMPS. MID AFTN READINGS WERE 
GENERALLY IN THE 30S STATEWIDE.

MAIN FCST CONCERN IN THE SHORT TERM WL BE TEMP TRENDS. THE HIGH 
CENTER WL MOVE OVR AR TNGT...RESULTING IN THE COLDEST NIGHT OF THE 
SEASON WITH CALM WINDS AND CLEAR SKIES. EXPECT LOWS IN THE TEENS TO 
BE COMMON ACRS THE FA...WITH SOME SINGLE DIGITS A GOOD BET IN THE 
COLDER VALLEYS OF NRN AND WRN AR.

THE HIGH IS FCST TO SHIFT SLOLY EWD ON WED...ALLOWING SFC WINDS TO 
RETURN A S-SELY DIRECTION BY AFTN. HAVE GONE A FEW DEGREES BLO MOS 
TEMPS FOR HIGHS ON WED AS MODELS ALWAYS TRY TO WARM THINGS UP TOO 
FAST IN THIS TYPE OF PATTERN. EXPECT SOME HIGH CLOUDS TO AFFECT THE 
AREA ON WED AHEAD OF NEXT UPPER SYS.

MODELS CONT TO PROG A SERIES OF UPPER TROFS DROPPING SEWD ACRS THE 
MID-SOUTH THE NEXT FEW DAYS...BRINGING REINFORCING SHOTS OF COOLER 
AND DRIER AIR. NEXT CDFNT IS PROGGED TO MOVE ACRS AR LATE THU AND 
THU NIGHT. ONLY LOOKING AT INCRSD CLOUD COVER WITH FROPA AS GULF 
MOISTURE RMNS CUTOFF. CLOUDS WL PERSIST INTO FRI AS UPPER TROF AXIS 
WORKS SLOLY SEWD THRU THE AREA. HIGH PRES WL SETTLE BACK INTO THE FA 
FRI NIGHT.
&&

.LONG TERM...SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY
500MB FLOW WILL REMAIN NORTHWESTERLY AND VIGOROUS /GREATER THAN 60KT 
MOSTLY/ THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIODS. THUS...THERE WILL CONTINUE TO 
BE A RAPID SUCCESSION OF SYSTEMS FROM THE NORTHWEST. MOISTURE 
PROFILES ARE NOT THAT IMPRESSIVE...SO ONLY INCREASED CLOUDS WILL BE 
NOTED...WITH LITTLE OR NO CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION. WEAK FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY WILL MOVE THROUGH LATE SATURDAY...WITH ANOTHER LATE SUNDAY. 

BY LATE MONDAY...SURFACE RIDGE WILL MOVE INTO THE MID SOUTH. RETURN 
FLOW WILL BEGIN SETTING UP BY LATE TUESDAY AS THE RIDGE SLIDES 
EASTWARD...AND ANOTHER WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY MOVES TOWARD ARKANSAS 
FROM THE HIGH PLAINS. 

AS FAR AS TEMPERATURES GO...WINTER WILL BE IN FULL SWING. WITH THE 
CONTINUED NORTHWESTERLY FLOW REGIME...INFLUX OF COLD CANADIAN AIR 
WILL CONTINUE. LOW TEMPERATURES WILL MOSTLY FALL BELOW FREEZING...
AND HIGHS WILL MOSTLY STRUGGLE TO MAKE IT OUT OF THE LOWER 50S. 
GUESS ITS ABOUT THAT TIME OF YEAR FOR IT. 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

44/57







211 
FXUS64 KLZK 140915
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
313 AM CST TUE DEC 14 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...
MODELS CONTINUE TO BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH 84 HOURS AND NO 
SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO THE GOING FORECAST LIKELY. PROGRESSIVE FLOW 
TO CONTINUE THROUGH THE PERIOD AND WILL SIMPLY CONTINUE THE PREVIOUS 
NIGHTS THINKING AND GO WITH A BLEND OF SOLUTIONS. DRY FORECAST 
EXPECTED THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH ONLY A REMOTE CHANCE OF SCATTERED 
PRECIPITATION ON DAY THREE.

MODELS CONSISTENT WITH TROFFING OVER THE EASTERN CONUS AND RIDGING 
OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS. PATTERN KEEPS THE AREA IN A DEEP NORTH TO 
NORTHWEST FLOW TODAY BEFORE FLOW FLATTENS OUT FOR WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY AS NEXT TROF...CURRENTLY OFF THE WEST COAST...APPROACHES. 
TROF PASSES THROUGH THE REGION WITH LITTLE FANFARE THURSDAY NIGHT 
WITH A RETURN TO NORTHWEST FLOW FOR FRIDAY.

ON THE SURFACE...CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS CENTERED OVER THE 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN PLAINS. SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS VERY DRY AIR 
MOVING INTO THE STATE WITH DEW POINT TEMPERATURES OVER THE NORTH 
DOWN IN THE SINGLE DIGITS. WHILE CHILLY...ENOUGH OF A GRADIENT 
EXISTS TO KEEP US FROM TOTALLY BOTTOMING OUT THIS MORNING. 
TEMPERATURES ONLY EXPECTED TO RECOVER INTO THE 40S ACROSS THE AREA 
TODAY AS WINDS DIE OFF AND DRIER AIR OVERSPREADS THE AREA. HIGH WILL 
BUILD EASTWARD THIS AFTERNOON AND CREST OVER THE AREA TONIGHT. IDEAL 
RADIATIONAL COOLING AND NO SAVING GRADIENT TONIGHT WITH TEMPERATURES 
EXPECTED TO BOTTOM OUT WITH COLDEST NIGHT OF THE SEASON TO DATE. 
MODELS HINTING AT SOME POSSIBLE RETURN FLOW LATE EARLY WEDNESDAY 
MORNING BUT IT APPEARS TO BE COMING IN TOO LATE TO MAKE MUCH OF AN 
IMPACT.

HIGH SLIPS OFF TO THE EAST WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND RETURN FLOW DOES 
GET ESTABLISHED WITH CORRESPONDING INCREASE IN THICKNESS VALUES 
AND TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

ATTENTION WILL THEN TURN TO THE AFOREMENTIONED APPROACHING TROF AND 
ASSOCIATED SURFACE BOUNDARY. LOW PRESSURE SCOOTS ACROSS SOUTHERN 
CANADA AND DRAGS THE BOUNDARY ACROSS THE AREA LATE THURSDAY AND 
THURSDAY NIGHT...EXITING THE SOUTHEAST CORER OF THE STATE BY FRIDAY 
MORNING. THERE IS AN INCREASE IN MOISTURE BUT SYSTEM DYNAMICALLY 
CHALLENGED. NO PRECIP EXPECTED AS IT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA. CLOUD 
COVER WILL HELP KEEP TEMPERATURES UP THURSDAY NIGHT. TEMPERATURES 
APPEAR TO REBOUND VERY QUICKLY FRIDAY AFTER THE BOUNDARY PASSES WITH 
TEMPERATURES RETURNING TO NORMAL OR CLOSE TO IT. FWC NUMBERS APPEARS 
TO BE A LITTLE TOO WARM AND WILL GO CLOSER TO THE MAV NUMBERS.

&&
LONG TERM...SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY
HIGH PRESSURE ONCE AGAIN WILL BE THE MAIN WEATHER FEATURE. UPPER 
TROUGH WILL STAY JUST TO THE EAST OF THE AREA. ONLY NOTICEABLE 
WEATHER CHANGE WILL BE INCREASED CLOUD COVER. TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
NEAR NORMAL.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    41  17  47  27 /   0   0   0   0 
HARRISON AR       40  14  45  25 /   0   0   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    43  17  48  28 /   0   0   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     42  17  48  28 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  39  14  44  25 /   0   0   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     43  18  49  28 /   0   0   0   0 
SEARCY AR         40  16  45  26 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      43  17  49  28 /   0   0   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   41  16  46  26 /   0   0   0   0

000 
FXUS64 KLZK 140915
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
313 AM CST TUE DEC 14 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...
MODELS CONTINUE TO BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH 84 HOURS AND NO 
SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO THE GOING FORECAST LIKELY. PROGRESSIVE FLOW 
TO CONTINUE THROUGH THE PERIOD AND WILL SIMPLY CONTINUE THE PREVIOUS 
NIGHTS THINKING AND GO WITH A BLEND OF SOLUTIONS. DRY FORECAST 
EXPECTED THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH ONLY A REMOTE CHANCE OF SCATTERED 
PRECIPITATION ON DAY THREE.

MODELS CONSISTENT WITH TROFFING OVER THE EASTERN CONUS AND RIDGING 
OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS. PATTERN KEEPS THE AREA IN A DEEP NORTH TO 
NORTHWEST FLOW TODAY BEFORE FLOW FLATTENS OUT FOR WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY AS NEXT TROF...CURRENTLY OFF THE WEST COAST...APPROACHES. 
TROF PASSES THROUGH THE REGION WITH LITTLE FANFARE THURSDAY NIGHT 
WITH A RETURN TO NORTHWEST FLOW FOR FRIDAY.

ON THE SURFACE...CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS CENTERED OVER THE 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN PLAINS. SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS VERY DRY AIR 
MOVING INTO THE STATE WITH DEW POINT TEMPERATURES OVER THE NORTH 
DOWN IN THE SINGLE DIGITS. WHILE CHILLY...ENOUGH OF A GRADIENT 
EXISTS TO KEEP US FROM TOTALLY BOTTOMING OUT THIS MORNING. 
TEMPERATURES ONLY EXPECTED TO RECOVER INTO THE 40S ACROSS THE AREA 
TODAY AS WINDS DIE OFF AND DRIER AIR OVERSPREADS THE AREA. HIGH WILL 
BUILD EASTWARD THIS AFTERNOON AND CREST OVER THE AREA TONIGHT. IDEAL 
RADIATIONAL COOLING AND NO SAVING GRADIENT TONIGHT WITH TEMPERATURES 
EXPECTED TO BOTTOM OUT WITH COLDEST NIGHT OF THE SEASON TO DATE. 
MODELS HINTING AT SOME POSSIBLE RETURN FLOW LATE EARLY WEDNESDAY 
MORNING BUT IT APPEARS TO BE COMING IN TOO LATE TO MAKE MUCH OF AN 
IMPACT.

HIGH SLIPS OFF TO THE EAST WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND RETURN FLOW DOES 
GET ESTABLISHED WITH CORRESPONDING INCREASE IN THICKNESS VALUES 
AND TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

ATTENTION WILL THEN TURN TO THE AFOREMENTIONED APPROACHING TROF AND 
ASSOCIATED SURFACE BOUNDARY. LOW PRESSURE SCOOTS ACROSS SOUTHERN 
CANADA AND DRAGS THE BOUNDARY ACROSS THE AREA LATE THURSDAY AND 
THURSDAY NIGHT...EXITING THE SOUTHEAST CORER OF THE STATE BY FRIDAY 
MORNING. THERE IS AN INCREASE IN MOISTURE BUT SYSTEM DYNAMICALLY 
CHALLENGED. NO PRECIP EXPECTED AS IT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA. CLOUD 
COVER WILL HELP KEEP TEMPERATURES UP THURSDAY NIGHT. TEMPERATURES 
APPEAR TO REBOUND VERY QUICKLY FRIDAY AFTER THE BOUNDARY PASSES WITH 
TEMPERATURES RETURNING TO NORMAL OR CLOSE TO IT. FWC NUMBERS APPEARS 
TO BE A LITTLE TOO WARM AND WILL GO CLOSER TO THE MAV NUMBERS.

&&
LONG TERM...SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY
HIGH PRESSURE ONCE AGAIN WILL BE THE MAIN WEATHER FEATURE. UPPER 
TROUGH WILL STAY JUST TO THE EAST OF THE AREA. ONLY NOTICEABLE 
WEATHER CHANGE WILL BE INCREASED CLOUD COVER. TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
NEAR NORMAL.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    41  17  47  27 /   0   0   0   0 
HARRISON AR       40  14  45  25 /   0   0   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    43  17  48  28 /   0   0   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     42  17  48  28 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  39  14  44  25 /   0   0   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     43  18  49  28 /   0   0   0   0 
SEARCY AR         40  16  45  26 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      43  17  49  28 /   0   0   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   41  16  46  26 /   0   0   0   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

FXUS64 KLZK 140401
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
959 PM CST MON DEC 13 2004

.DISCUSSION...
WILL ISSUE A MINOR UPDATE TO BASICALLY GET RID OF THE EVENING 
WORDING. ADJUSTED GRID TEMPERATURES ALSO BASED ON CURRENT TRENDS BUT 
LOW TEMPERATURES TONIGHT LOOK TO BE IN GOOD SHAPE. HIGH PRESSURE IS 
CENTERED OVER THE PLAINS. WINDS WILL DECREASE A BIT TONIGHT BUT 
THERE WILL STILL BE A BREEZE. COLD TEMPERATURES WILL OVERSPREAD THE 
ENTIRE AREA TONIGHT HOWEVER. AS THE HIGH MOVES EAST TOMORROW...LOWS 
TOMORROW NIGHT WILL BE A BIT COLDER. 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.


000 
FXUS64 KLZK 131951
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
ISSUED BY NWS MEMPHIS TN
150 PM CST MON DEC 13 2004

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE HIGH MOVING OUT OF THE ROCKIES AT MID-DAY. WINDS HAVE NOT
BEEN QUITE AS STRONG AS EARLIER ANTICIPATED...AND WILL ALLOW LAKE
WIND ADVISORY TO END WITH ISSUANCE OF AFTERNOON ZONE PACKAGE. TEMPS
RANGING FROM LOWER 40S EXTREME NORTH TO LOW-MID 50S SOUTH. CLOSEST
CLOUDS ARE IN NE KS AND EC MO...AND POSE NO THREAT TO AR.
&&

.SHORT TERM (THROUGH THURSDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE SLOWLY SOUTHEAST AND BE CENTERED OVER SE AR
BY WEDNESDAY MORNING. AIRMASS IS VERY DRY...AND EXPECT LITTLE IF
ANY CLOUDINESS THROUGH WEDNESDAY. SHORTWAVE AND COLD FRONT WILL MOVE
THROUGH AR ON THURSDAY. MOISTURE EXTREMELY LIMITED...AND EXPECT NO
MORE THAN CLOUDS DURING THE DAY THURSDAY.

WHILE SKIES WILL BE CLEAR TONIGHT...EXPECT WINDS TO STAY UP AROUND 5
TO 10 MPH. WHEN COMBINED WITH CURRENT AND UPSTREAM DEWPOINTS...
CURRENT FORECAST LOWS APPEAR ABOUT ONE CATEGORY TOO COOL. HIGHS
TOMORROW ABOUT 7-10 DEGREES COOLER THAN TODAY. MAV GUIDANCE APPEARS
TOO COLD BY ABOUT 5 DEGREES. CURRENT FORECAST REASONABLE AND FITS
WITH SURROUNDING OFFICES.

WEDNESDAY MORNING WILL BE THE COLDEST OF THE SEASON WITH SURFACE
HIGH DIRECTLY OVER THE AREA. MOST OR ALL OF ARKANSAS WILL BE IN THE
TEENS WEDNESDAY MORNING. CURRENT FORECAST TEMPS ALSO LOOK
REASONABLE FOR WEDNESDAY...MOS GUIDANCE USUALLY WARMS HIGHS TOO
QUICKLY WITH THE DEPARTING ARCTIC AIRMASS...EVEN WITH SOUTHERLY
WINDS. TEMPS MODERATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY.
&&

.LONG TERM (BEYOND THURSDAY)...
NORTHWEST FLOW WILL BE PREDOMINANT FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD. NO
SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE AVAILABLE FOR PRECIPITATION. PERIODS OF CLOUDS
MAINLY THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY...AND AGAIN ON SUNDAY.
TEMPERATURES A LITTLE CLOSER TO SEASONAL NORMS THAN WHAT WE WILL SEE
TOMORROW.

GFS SHOWS POTENTIAL FOR AN EVEN COLDER AIRMASS THE MIDDLE OF NEXT
WEEK...BEYOND THE SCOPE OF THIS FORECAST. COULD BE A CHILLY
CHRISTMAS IF THE PATTERN HOLDS.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$


582 
FXUS64 KLZK 131420 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
815 AM CST MON DEC 13 2004

.DISCUSSION...
WITH GUSTS ALREADY THIS MORNING...WENT AHEAD AND POSTED LAKE WIND 
ADVISORY FOR ALL OF COUNTY WARNING AREA TODAY. WINDS AHEAD OF STRONG 
ARCTIC HIGH PRESSURE IN THE PLAINS. SYSTEM WILL BUILD OVER REGION 
THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS...WITH PRESSURE GRADIENT RELAXING AND WINDS 
DECREASING. HOWEVER...THE COLDEST AIR OF THE SEASON ON THE 
WAY...WITH TEENS/20S TONIGHT AND TUESDAY NIGHT. (46)  
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 240 AM CST MON DEC 13 2004

NO REAL SURPRISES OR SIGNIFICANT CHANGES CONCERNING THE FORECAST. 
ALL SHORT TERM MODELS ARE ON THE SAME PAGE WITH THE PROGRESSIVE 
UPPER LEVEL PATTERN AND THE COLDEST AIR OF THE SEASON TO DATE STILL 
SLATED TO COME ON IN EARLY THIS WEEK. GFS AND ETA ALMOST IDENTICAL 
THROUGH 84 HOURS AND WILL SIMPLY GO WITH A BLEND OF SOLUTIONS THIS 
MORNING. THERE IS A LITTLE DISCREPANCY IN THE MAV AND FWC NUMBERS. 
FWC NUMBERS CONSISTENTLY RUNNING A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN THE MAV. 
WILL SPLIT THE DIFFERENCES HERE BUT OVERALL FORECAST WILL STILL BE 
QUITE CHILLY WITH TEMPERATURES BELOW SEASONAL NORMALS...ESPECIALLY 
EARLY IN THE PERIOD.

WITH THE GULF SHUT OFF FOR THE FORESEEABLE FUTURE...DRY CONDITIONS 
WILL PREVAIL. COLD FRONT THAT MOVED THROUGH SUNDAY NOW WELL SOUTH OF 
THE AREA WITH CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE SLIDING DOWN THE SPINE OF THE 
ROCKIES. GRADIENT STILL A LITTLE TIGHT AND BIG FORECAST DILEMMA THIS 
MORNING IS WHETHER OR NOT TO ISSUE A LAKE WIND ADVISORY FOR TODAY. 
AS HIGH CONTINUES TO BUILD IN AND SURFACE LOW OVER THE GREAT LAKES 
WEAKENS...GRADIENT SHOULD RELAX. SINCE SITUATION IS BORDERLINE AT 
BEST...WILL NOT ISSUE AT THIS TIME BUT I RESERVE THE RIGHT TO CHANGE 
THIS THINKING BY PRESS TIME.

STRONG UPPER LOW OVER THE EASTERN LAKES PULLS OUT IN RESPONSE TO 
STRONG HEIGHT FALLS OVER THE WESTERN CONUS WITH RESULTANT NORTHWEST 
FLOW. NEXT PACIFIC SYSTEM CARVES OUT AS ANOTHER TROF OVER THE GREAT 
BASIN LATE WEDNESDAY WITH WEAK RIDGING OVER THE MID SOUTH FOR SOME 
MODERATION IN TEMPS TOWARDS WEEKS END. CUT OFF FORMS OVER THE SW 
CONUS LATE WHICH WILL BEAR WATCHING DOWN THE ROAD.

LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS DEW POINT FRONT OVER SOUTHERN MISSOURI 
WITH CONSIDERABLY DRIER AIR TO THE NORTH OF IT. DRIER AIR MOVES OVER 
THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON WITH SURFACE HIGH SETTLING INTO THE TEXAS 
PANHANDLE BY TUESDAY MORNING. WIDESPREAD TEMPERATURES IN THE 20S 
EXPECTED TUESDAY MORNING WITH TEENS IN THE NORTH. JUST ENOUGH OF A 
GRADIENT WILL EXIST TO KEEP TEMPERATURES FROM TOTALLY BOTTOMING OUT 
BUT BY JUST A FEW DEGREES. HIGH MOVES ACROSS THE AREA TUESDAY FOR 
VERY COOL READINGS DURING THE DAY. HIGH ON TOP OF THE CWA BY 
WEDNESDAY MORNING. DRY AIR...NO WINDS AND SUBSIDENCE SUPPORT 
COLDEST MORNING OF THE SEASON. TEENS LIKELY AREA WIDE WITH SINGLE 
DIGITS IN THE NORMALLY COLDER PLACES.

HIGH SLIPS OFF TO THE EAST WEDNESDAY AND RETURN FLOW STARTS TO GET 
REESTABLISHED LATE IN THE DAY WITH TEMPERATURES SLOWLY MODERATING 
THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. NEXT COLD FRONT STARTS TO 
APPROACH EARLY THURSDAY AS LOW PRESSURE PASSES WELL TO THE NORTH. 
FRONT LACKING MOISTURE AND OTHERWISE DYNAMICALLY CHALLENGED AS IT 
PASSES OVER THE AREA THURSDAY NIGHT FOR A CONTINUATION OF THE DRY 
CONDITIONS.

HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN CONTROL THROUGH THE EXTENDED FOR DRY 
CONDITIONS. UPPER TROUGH MOVES JUST TO THE EAST SUNDAY...WITH 
INCREASED CLOUD COVER. TEMPS FOR THE MOST PART WILL REMAIN SLIGHTLY 
BELOW NORMAL. OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD AND NO MAJOR 
CHANGES MADE.

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...LAKE WIND ADVISORY TODAY FOR ZONES
ARZ003>007...012>016...021>025...030>034...037>047...052>057...
062>069.
&&

PINE BLUFF AR     53  23  43  19 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  45  14  37  13 /   0   0   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     55  24  44  19 /   0   0   0   0 
SEARCY AR         50  19  41  16 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      53  21  41  18 /   0   0   0   0


000 
FXUS64 KLZK 130842
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
240 AM CST MON DEC 13 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...
NO REAL SURPRISES OR SIGNIFICANT CHANGES CONCERNING THE FORECAST. 
ALL SHORT TERM MODELS ARE ON THE SAME PAGE WITH THE PROGRESSIVE 
UPPER LEVEL PATTERN AND THE COLDEST AIR OF THE SEASON TO DATE STILL 
SLATED TO COME ON IN EARLY THIS WEEK. GFS AND ETA ALMOST IDENTICAL 
THROUGH 84 HOURS AND WILL SIMPLY GO WITH A BLEND OF SOLUTIONS THIS 
MORNING. THERE IS A LITTLE DISCREPANCY IN THE MAV AND FWC NUMBERS. 
FWC NUMBERS CONSISTENTLY RUNNING A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN THE MAV. 
WILL SPLIT THE DIFFERENCES HERE BUT OVERALL FORECAST WILL STILL BE 
QUITE CHILLY WITH TEMPERATURES BELOW SEASONAL NORMALS...ESPECIALLY 
EARLY IN THE PERIOD.

WITH THE GULF SHUT OFF FOR THE FORESEEABLE FUTURE...DRY CONDITIONS 
WILL PREVAIL. COLD FRONT THAT MOVED THROUGH SUNDAY NOW WELL SOUTH OF 
THE AREA WITH CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE SLIDING DOWN THE SPINE OF THE 
ROCKIES. GRADIENT STILL A LITTLE TIGHT AND BIG FORECAST DILEMMA THIS 
MORNING IS WHETHER OR NOT TO ISSUE A LAKE WIND ADVISORY FOR TODAY. 
AS HIGH CONTINUES TO BUILD IN AND SURFACE LOW OVER THE GREAT LAKES 
WEAKENS...GRADIENT SHOULD RELAX. SINCE SITUATION IS BORDERLINE AT 
BEST...WILL NOT ISSUE AT THIS TIME BUT I RESERVE THE RIGHT TO CHANGE 
THIS THINKING BY PRESS TIME.

STRONG UPPER LOW OVER THE EASTERN LAKES PULLS OUT IN RESPONSE TO 
STRONG HEIGHT FALLS OVER THE WESTERN CONUS WITH RESULTANT NORTHWEST 
FLOW. NEXT PACIFIC SYSTEM CARVES OUT AS ANOTHER TROF OVER THE GREAT 
BASIN LATE WEDNESDAY WITH WEAK RIDGING OVER THE MID SOUTH FOR SOME 
MODERATION IN TEMPS TOWARDS WEEKS END. CUT OFF FORMS OVER THE SW 
CONUS LATE WHICH WILL BEAR WATCHING DOWN THE ROAD.

LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS DEW POINT FRONT OVER SOUTHERN MISSOURI 
WITH CONSIDERABLY DRIER AIR TO THE NORTH OF IT. DRIER AIR MOVES OVER 
THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON WITH SURFACE HIGH SETTLING INTO THE TEXAS 
PANHANDLE BY TUESDAY MORNING. WIDESPREAD TEMPERATURES IN THE 20S 
EXPECTED TUESDAY MORNING WITH TEENS IN THE NORTH. JUST ENOUGH OF A 
GRADIENT WILL EXIST TO KEEP TEMPERATURES FROM TOTALLY BOTTOMING OUT 
BUT BY JUST A FEW DEGREES. HIGH MOVES ACROSS THE AREA TUESDAY FOR 
VERY COOL READINGS DURING THE DAY. HIGH ON TOP OF THE CWA BY 
WEDNESDAY MORNING. DRY AIR...NO WINDS AND SUBSIDENCE SUPPORT 
COLDEST MORNING OF THE SEASON. TEENS LIKELY AREA WIDE WITH SINGLE 
DIGITS IN THE NORMALLY COLDER PLACES.

HIGH SLIPS OFF TO THE EAST WEDNESDAY AND RETURN FLOW STARTS TO GET 
REESTABLISHED LATE IN THE DAY WITH TEMPERATURES SLOWLY MODERATING 
THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. NEXT COLD FRONT STARTS TO 
APPROACH EARLY THURSDAY AS LOW PRESSURE PASSES WELL TO THE NORTH. 
FRONT LACKING MOISTURE AND OTHERWISE DYNAMICALLY CHALLENGED AS IT 
PASSES OVER THE AREA THURSDAY NIGHT FOR A CONTINUATION OF THE DRY 
CONDITIONS.
&&

.LONG TERM...FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...
HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN CONTROL THROUGH THE EXTENDED FOR DRY 
CONDITIONS. UPPER TROUGH MOVES JUST TO THE EAST SUNDAY...WITH 
INCREASED CLOUD COVER. TEMPS FOR THE MOST PART WILL REMAIN SLIGHTLY 
BELOW NORMAL. OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD AND NO MAJOR 
CHANGES MADE.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    52  21  42  18 /   0   0   0   0 
HARRISON AR       46  15  37  13 /   0   0   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    53  22  42  19 /   0   0   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     53  23  43  19 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  45  14  37  13 /   0   0   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     55  24  44  19 /   0   0   0   0 
SEARCY AR         50  19  41  16 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      53  21  41  18 /   0   0   0   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
225 PM CST SUN DEC 12 2004

.DISCUSSION...
A SERIES OF COLD FRONTS WILL MOVE ACROSS MY CW AREA DURING THE NEXT 
SEVERAL DAYS. MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED...SO LITTLE OR NO 
PRECIPITATION IS EXPECTED. MINIMUMS TONIGHT WILL DROP TO NOTICEABLE 
LEVELS...BUT AN EVEN MORE SIGNIFICANT COOL DOWN IS EXPECTED MONDAY 
NIGHT WHEN A LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE FROM CANADA SETTLES OVER 
THE REGION AND WINDS DECREASE...GIVING WAY TO STRONG RADIATIONAL 
COOLING. STRONG AND GUSTY WINDS ARE POSSIBLE TOMORROW AND A LAKE 
WIND ADVISORY MAY BE REQUIRED. WIND CHILL VALUES WILL BE LOW.
(38)    
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

745 
FXUS64 KLZK 121810 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1145 AM CST SUN DEC 12 2004

.DISCUSSION...
THE WINDS ARE NOW STRONGER AND MORE GUSTY THAN EARLIER EXPECTED SO 
HAVE BUMPED THEN UP A BIT FOR THIS AFTRERNOON. WENT AHEAD AND 
INCREASED THE WINDS FOR TOMORROW AND TOMORROW NIGHT BASED ON THE
LATEST GUIDANCE WHICH IS LIKELY TO VERIFY BETTER. WILL LIKELY HAVE 
TO ADJUST THE MINS TONIGHT DOWNWARD SOME MORE...BUT WILL DO THAT 
AFTER THIS MORNING UPDATE. THATS ALL FOR NOW.
(38)    
&&

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION ISSUED AT 232 AM...
.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...
OVERALL THE FORECAST IN GOOD SHAPE AND ONLY SOME MINOR CHANGES ARE 
ANTICIPATED. MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE OVERALL PATTERN OF A 
PERSISTENT WESTERN CONUS RIDGE AND A PERSISTENT EASTERN CONUS TROF. 
PATTERN WOULD KEEP AREA IN A CONTINUOUS AND RATHER DEEP NORTHWEST 
FLOW...ESPECIALLY EARLY ON. WITH ALL SHORT TERM MODELS AGREEING ON 
THIS SCENARIO AND WITH NO MAJOR DIFFERENCES NOTED...WILL GO WITH A 
BLEND OF FORECAST SOLUTIONS THIS MORNING.

PATTERN DURING THE PERIOD WILL BE CHARACTERIZED BY WEAK COLD FRONTS 
MOVING THROUGH THE AREA. THESE FEATURES WILL COME THROUGH DRY AS 
MOISTURE AND DYNAMICS ARE LACKING. FRONTS WILL ACT TO REINFORCE THE 
COOL AIR OVER THE MID SOUTH WITH SOME OF THE COLDEST AIR OF THE 
SEASON PROGGED TO COME IN EARLY NEXT WEEK.

FIRST FRONT NOW MOVING INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS AND WILL MOVE ACROSS 
THE AREA BY MID TO LATE AFTERNOON. SOUTHERLY WINDS IN ADVANCE OF THE 
SYSTEM WILL ALLOW FOR SOME WARMING TODAY BEFORE FROPA. TEMPERATURES 
COOLER MONDAY MORNING BUT MODELS BRING IN A SECONDARY SHOT OF 
CONSIDERABLY COOLER AIR EARLY MONDAY AS CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE 
SLIDES DOWN THE FRONT RANGE OF THE ROCKIES. VERY DRY AIR MOVES IN 
FOR TUESDAY MORNING AND EXCEPTIONAL RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS 
EXPECTED WITH VIRTUALLY NO WIND. GUIDANCE SUGGESTING LOW TO MID 20S 
ACROSS THE SOUTH AND CENTRAL AND LOWER TEENS ACROSS THE NORTH. SEE 
NO REASON TO ARGUE AT THIS POINT AND WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED TO SEE 
SOME OF THE NORMALLY COLDER AREAS DIP INTO THE SINGLE DIGITS.

HIGH SETTLES OVER THE AREA WEDNESDAY MORNING FOR ANOTHER COLD 
NIGHT. MODELS IN A BIT OF DISAGREEMENT ON HOW COLD IT WILL GET. GFS 
SOLUTION WOULD KEEP TEMPERATURES COMPARABLE TO TUESDAY MORNINGS. 
ETA12 SOLUTION HAS A LIGHT SOUTHERLY FLOW DEVELOPING BUT EVEN IF 
THIS COMES TO FRUITION...TEMPERATURES WOULD LIKELY BE ONLY A FEW 
DEGREES WARMER. HIGH SLIPS OFF TO THE EAST ON WEDNESDAY WITH A 
NEXT FRONT BEGINNING TO APPROACH THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE STATE.  
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...
WEAK FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THURSDAY...BUT WILL REMAIN DRY. ONLY 
NOTICEABLE CHANGE WILL BE WIND SHIFT. HIGH PRESSURE WILL FOLLOW AND 
REMAIN IN CONTROL FOR DRY CONDITIONS. TEMPS WILL GRADUALLY WARM 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND. NO MAJOR CHANGES TO THE GOING GRIDS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    65  37  51  23 /   0   0   0   0 
HARRISON AR       60  30  45  17 /   0   0   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    66  37  52  24 /   0   0   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     66  39  52  25 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  60  30  44  16 /   0   0   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     67  40  54  26 /   0   0   0   0 
SEARCY AR         62  36  49  21 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      66  37  52  23 /   0   0   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   64  35  50  21 /   0   0   0   0


158 
FXUS64 KLZK 120254 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
855 PM CST SAT DEC 11 2004

.DISCUSSION...
HAVE JUST SENT OUT AN UPDATE TO THE FORECAST. FOR THE MOST 
PART...GOING PACKAGE LOOKED OKAY FOR THE DELTA REGION...AND A LARGE 
PORTION OF CENTRAL ARKANSAS...BUT LOCAL ADJUSTMENTS HAD TO BE MADE 
TO BETTER HANDLE VALLEY AREAS IN THE WEST AND NORTH. WINDS IN THE 
VALLEYS HAVE GONE NEAR CALM...AND WITH ONLY SOME THIN CIRRUS NOTED...
THESE AREAS WILL HAVE A GOOD SHOT AT SOME STRONG RADIATIONAL 
COOLING. ALSO...WINDS ARE A BIT STRONGER OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN AND 
IN THE DELTA REGION...SO KEPT THESE AREAS WARMER AS THE INCREASING 
SOUTHERLY FLOW PUTS THE SKIDS ON SIGNIFICANT COOLING. 

SOME OF THE MORE TYPICAL COLD SPOTS...LEAD HILL...GILBERT...
RUSSELLVILLE...WILL LIKELY SEE READINGS BELOW FREEZING. HAVE 
ATTEMPTED TO REFLECT THIS TREND IN ALL FORECASTS. 

COLD FRONT UP IN THE PLAINS ON SCHEDULE TO MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA ON SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. ONLY SHALLOW MOISTURE 
AVAILABLE WITH THE SYSTEM...SO NO PRECIP EXPECTED. HOWEVER...SYSTEM 
WILL BRING REINFORCING SHOT OF COLD AIR INTO ARKANSAS. PERSISTANT...
STRONG NWRLY 500MB FLOW WILL CONTINUE THROUGH MUCH OF THE NEXT FIVE 
TO SEVEN DAYS...BRINGING SOME OF THE COLDEST AIR OF THE SEASON. 
WIDESPREAD TEMPERATURES IN THE TEENS AND 20S ARE EXPECTED BY MIDWEEK 
OVER MUCH OF ARKANSAS. 
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 200 PM CST SAT DEC 11 2004

UPPER PATTERN HAS NOT CHANGED SIGNIFICANTLY FROM YESTERDAY.
THE SURFACE LOW DID NOT MOVE OUT AS FAST AS THOUGHT ORIGINALLY. THIS 
RESULTED IN LINGERING LOW CLOUDS AROUND THE RATHER LARGE LOW OVER 
UPSTATE NEW YORK. WARMING IS EXPECTED STILL AHEAD OF SUNDAYS COLD 
FRONT. THEN COOLING WILL TAKE PLACE MONDAY WITH LARGE HIGH DROPPING 
SOUTH ALONG THE PLAINS. THIS HIGH WILL STAY WEST OF THE STATE...SO A 
MUCH DRIER REGIME WILL SET UP OVER THE MID SOUTH. COORDINATION CHAT 
WENT BACK AND FORTH ABOUT THE DEW POINTS THAT WILL BE ASSOCIATED 
WITH THIS HIGH. I LEANED TOWARDS AN EVAPORATION WARNING BUT WAS 
OVER-RULED.

SURFACE HIGH WILL BE OVER THE AREA WEDNESDAY MORNING WITH VERY DRY 
AIR IN PLACE. THIS WILL LEAD TO TEMPS WELL DOWN INTO THE 20S AND DEW 
POINTS IN THE TEENS IF NOT LOWER. THE HIGH MOVES OFF TO THE EAST BY 
LATE WEDNESDAY AND DEW POINTS SHOULD RECOVER SOME. ANOTHER WEAK 
FRONT MOVES THROUGH ON THURSDAY. SOME MOISTURE ACCOMPANIES IT BUT 
NOT ENOUGH TO MENTION A CHANCE OF PRECIP IN THE FORECAST. BEHIND 
THIS FRONT...THE MAIN SURFACE HIGH IS PROGGED TO BE IN THE GREAT 
BASIN SO THE AIR MASS SHOULD NOT BE AS COLD. STILL WILL HAVE MINS A 
LITTLE BELOW FREEZING WITH MAXES IN THE UPPER 40S TO LOWER 50S. 
TEMPS SHOULD SLOWLY RISE INTO NEXT WEEKEND WITH WESTERLY SURFACE 
FLOW. GENERAL NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT THROUGH THE PERIOD SHOULD HELP 
KEEP THINGS DRY.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

57






000 
FXUS64 KLZK 120254 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
855 PM CST SAT DEC 11 2004

.DISCUSSION...
HAVE JUST SENT OUT AN UPDATE TO THE FORECAST. FOR THE MOST 
PART...GOING PACKAGE LOOKED OKAY FOR THE DELTA REGION...AND A LARGE 
PORTION OF CENTRAL ARKANSAS...BUT LOCAL ADJUSTMENTS HAD TO BE MADE 
TO BETTER HANDLE VALLEY AREAS IN THE WEST AND NORTH. WINDS IN THE 
VALLEYS HAVE GONE NEAR CALM...AND WITH ONLY SOME THIN CIRRUS NOTED...
THESE AREAS WILL HAVE A GOOD SHOT AT SOME STRONG RADIATIONAL 
COOLING. ALSO...WINDS ARE A BIT STRONGER OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN AND 
IN THE DELTA REGION...SO KEPT THESE AREAS WARMER AS THE INCREASING 
SOUTHERLY FLOW PUTS THE SKIDS ON SIGNIFICANT COOLING. 

SOME OF THE MORE TYPICAL COLD SPOTS...LEAD HILL...GILBERT...
RUSSELLVILLE...WILL LIKELY SEE READINGS BELOW FREEZING. HAVE 
ATTEMPTED TO REFLECT THIS TREND IN ALL FORECASTS. 

COLD FRONT UP IN THE PLAINS ON SCHEDULE TO MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA ON SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. ONLY SHALLOW MOISTURE 
AVAILABLE WITH THE SYSTEM...SO NO PRECIP EXPECTED. HOWEVER...SYSTEM 
WILL BRING REINFORCING SHOT OF COLD AIR INTO ARKANSAS. PERSISTANT...
STRONG NWRLY 500MB FLOW WILL CONTINUE THROUGH MUCH OF THE NEXT FIVE 
TO SEVEN DAYS...BRINGING SOME OF THE COLDEST AIR OF THE SEASON. 
WIDESPREAD TEMPERATURES IN THE TEENS AND 20S ARE EXPECTED BY MIDWEEK 
OVER MUCH OF ARKANSAS. 
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 200 PM CST SAT DEC 11 2004

UPPER PATTERN HAS NOT CHANGED SIGNIFICANTLY FROM YESTERDAY.
THE SURFACE LOW DID NOT MOVE OUT AS FAST AS THOUGHT ORIGINALLY. THIS 
RESULTED IN LINGERING LOW CLOUDS AROUND THE RATHER LARGE LOW OVER 
UPSTATE NEW YORK. WARMING IS EXPECTED STILL AHEAD OF SUNDAYS COLD 
FRONT. THEN COOLING WILL TAKE PLACE MONDAY WITH LARGE HIGH DROPPING 
SOUTH ALONG THE PLAINS. THIS HIGH WILL STAY WEST OF THE STATE...SO A 
MUCH DRIER REGIME WILL SET UP OVER THE MID SOUTH. COORDINATION CHAT 
WENT BACK AND FORTH ABOUT THE DEW POINTS THAT WILL BE ASSOCIATED 
WITH THIS HIGH. I LEANED TOWARDS AN EVAPORATION WARNING BUT WAS 
OVER-RULED.

SURFACE HIGH WILL BE OVER THE AREA WEDNESDAY MORNING WITH VERY DRY 
AIR IN PLACE. THIS WILL LEAD TO TEMPS WELL DOWN INTO THE 20S AND DEW 
POINTS IN THE TEENS IF NOT LOWER. THE HIGH MOVES OFF TO THE EAST BY 
LATE WEDNESDAY AND DEW POINTS SHOULD RECOVER SOME. ANOTHER WEAK 
FRONT MOVES THROUGH ON THURSDAY. SOME MOISTURE ACCOMPANIES IT BUT 
NOT ENOUGH TO MENTION A CHANCE OF PRECIP IN THE FORECAST. BEHIND 
THIS FRONT...THE MAIN SURFACE HIGH IS PROGGED TO BE IN THE GREAT 
BASIN SO THE AIR MASS SHOULD NOT BE AS COLD. STILL WILL HAVE MINS A 
LITTLE BELOW FREEZING WITH MAXES IN THE UPPER 40S TO LOWER 50S. 
TEMPS SHOULD SLOWLY RISE INTO NEXT WEEKEND WITH WESTERLY SURFACE 
FLOW. GENERAL NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT THROUGH THE PERIOD SHOULD HELP 
KEEP THINGS DRY.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

32/29





471 
FXUS64 KLZK 110855
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
249 AM CST SAT DEC 11 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT
WRAP-AROUND CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO DECREASE OVER THE NORTHEASTERN 
SECTIONS EARLY TODAY AS UPPER LOW MOVES NORTHEASTWARD INTO CANADA.
THE REST OF ARKANSAS WILL SEE MOSTLY SUNNY TO PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES
TODAY AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS OVER BAJA CALIFORNIA. A DRY SPELL IS 
EXPECTED OVER MOST OF ARKANSAS THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS. WILL USE A 
BLEND OF ETA/NGM/GFS MOS GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES. HIGHS TODAY WILL 
LIKELY BE NEAR NORMAL BUT SHOULD BE ABOUT TEN DEGREES HIGHER 
TOMORROW...THEN BACK DOWN TO NEAR NORMAL THE DAY AFTER AS ANOTHER IN 
A SERIES OF COLD FRONTS MOVES ACROSS MY CW AREA. LOW TEMPS TUESDAY 
NIGHT ARE LIKELY TO BE ABOUT TEN DEGREES BELOW NORMAL AS A CANADIAN
AIR MASS DROPS IN OVER US.
(38)    
&&

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...
ONCE AGAIN THIS MORNING...PERSISTENCE SEEMS THE WAY TO GO CONCERNING 
THE MEDIUM RANGE MODELS. ALL MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT IN THE 
LARGE SCALE WITH A MEAN EASTERN PACIFIC/WESTERN CONUS RIDGE AND A 
MEAN EASTERN CONUS TROF. PATTERN WILL KEEP THE AREA IN A PERSISTENT 
NORTHWEST FLOW THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH OVERALL FLOW FLATTENING OUT 
SOMEWHAT ON OCCASION. TEMPERATURES WILL AVERAGE BELOW NORMAL IN 
SPITE OF GUIDANCE INDICATING A SLIGHT WARMING TREND THROUGH THE 
PERIOD.

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OF CANADIAN ORIGIN WILL BE SITTING ON TOP OF 
THE CWA WEDNESDAY MORNING WITH A VERY CHILLY START TO THE DAY. HIGH 
WILL DRIFT OFF TO THE EAST BUT RETURN FLOW IS SLOW TO GET 
REESTABLISHED AND THICKNESS VALUES ONLY SUPPORT HIGHS IN THE MID 
40S. MODELS BRING A WEAK BOUNDARY ACROSS LATE THURSDAY BUT WITH 
LIMITED MOISTURE AND LACK OF DYNAMICS WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY. 
ANOTHER AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE STARTS TO BUILD DOWN THE ROCKIES ON 
FRIDAY BUT HIGH IS OF PACIFIC ORIGIN. THICKNESS VALUES SUPPORT A 
SLIGHT WARMING TREND ON DAYS SIX AND SEVEN AND THIS LOOKS 
REASONABLE. MEX NUMBERS APPEAR TO SUPPORT THIS THINKING AND ARE 
GENERALLY ACCEPTED.  
(56)
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    53  38  65  37 /   0   0  10  10 
HARRISON AR       50  38  60  30 /   0   0  10  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    55  39  66  37 /   0   0  10  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     54  38  66  39 /   0   0  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  48  37  60  30 /   0   0  10  10 
MONTICELLO AR     55  38  67  40 /   0   0  10  10 
SEARCY AR         50  37  63  36 /  10   0  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      56  39  66  37 /   0   0  10  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   53  38  64  35 /   0   0  10  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

MOUNTAIN HOME AR  48  37  60  30 /   0   0  10  10

38/56 





688 
FXUS64 KLZK 110653 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1240 AM CST SAT DEC 11 2004

.DISCUSSION...FRESHENED UP REST OF TONIGHT.
(38)
&&

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
935 PM CST FRI DEC 10 2004

.DISCUSSION...
GOING FORECAST ON TARGET. IN GENERAL...KEPT WINDS UP A LITTLE LONGER 
OVERNIGHT...ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTH AND EAST. IN THE SAME AREAS... 
CLOUDS LOOK RATHER PERSISTENT...WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS 
MENTIONED IN THE FORECAST. (46)
&&  

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 230 PM CST FRI DEC 10 2004

IN THE SHORT TERM...UPPER TROF WILL BE MOVING AWAY FROM ARKANSAS 
QUICKLY TONIGHT. THIS WILL RESULT IN A GRADUAL SHIFT FROM NORTHWEST 
FLOW TO ZONAL FLOW BY 12Z TUESDAY. NO MAJOR FEATURES WILL MOVE OVER 
THE STATE IN THIS PERIOD...SO THE SURFACE PATTERN WILL PRESENT THE 
CHALLENGES.

STRONG GRADIENT THIS AFTERNOON WILL BE RELAXING TO THE POINT OF 
WINDS FALLING BELOW OUR LOCAL CRITERIA FOR LAKE WIND ADVISORIES. 
THUS THE ADVISORIES WILL BE ALLOWED TO EXPIRE AT 4 PM WITHOUT 
RENEWAL. LOW CLOUD SHIELD ROTATING AROUND THE SURFACE LOW WILL BE 
LIFTING TO THE NORTHEAST QUICKLY TONIGHT. SMALL CHANCES OF LIGHT 
RAIN WILL EXIST FOR THE EXTREME NORTHEAST SECTION OF THE STATE EARLY 
THIS EVENING...BEFORE 06Z...SO A DRY FORECAST FROM THAT POINT ON.

TEMPERATURES WILL BE GETTING INTO THE 30S TONIGHT AS WINDS DIE DOWN 
AND THE SKY CLEARS. HIGHS SATURDAY WILL BE PRIMARILY IN THE 50S 
BECAUSE OF CONTINUED NORTHWEST WINDS. HOWEVER...RETURN FLOW WILL BE 
QUICK TO SET UP...SO THAT OVERNIGHT INTO SUNDAY MORNING THE WINDS 
WILL VEER AND PUSH LOWS INTO THE 30S AND 40S. HIGHS ON SUNDAY WILL 
BE HARD TO PEG. THE POTENTIAL TO REBOUND BEFORE THE NEXT FRONTAL 
PASSAGE IS THERE. GFS NUMBERS HAVE BEEN VERIFYING WELL...SO DECIDED 
TO FOLLOW THEM OR GO ABOVE SLIGHTLY. DRY FRONT WILL DROP ACROSS THE 
STATE SUNDAY. TEMPS WILL BEGIN A SLOW COOLING TREND IN NORTHEASTERLY 
WINDS.

IN THE LONG TERM...AREA WILL BE DOMINATED BY HIGH PRESSURE FROM THE 
NORTH WITH MOSTLY NORTHERLY WINDS. THIS SHOULD LEAD TO COOLER THAN 
NORMAL TEMPS. FLOW ALOFT WILL GENERALLY BE FROM THE NORTHWEST WITH 
THE FLOW PATTERN AMPLIFYING BY THE END OF THE PERIOD. KEPT DRY 
WEATHER IN FORECAST. NEW GFS BRINGS A SHEARED SHORT WAVE ACROSS 
TUESDAY WITH SOME MOISTURE INCREASE. INCREASED CLOUDS FOR TUESDAY 
DUE TO THIS BUT LOOKS LIKE MOISTURE WILL BE INSUFFICIENT FOR A 
CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION. LOOKS MORE LIKE AN UPSLOPE PRECIP PATTERN 
WHICH WOULD AFFECT AREAS WEST OF THE CWA.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

STRONG GRADIENT THIS AFTERNOON WILL BE RELAXING TO THE POINT OF 
WINDS FALLING BELOW OUR LOCAL CRITERIA FOR LAKE WIND ADVISORIES. 
THUS THE ADVISORIES WILL BE ALLOWED TO EXPIRE AT 4 PM WITHOUT 
RENEWAL. LOW CLOUD SHIELD ROTATING AROUND THE SURFACE LOW WILL BE 
LIFTING TO THE NORTHEAST QUICKLY TONIGHT. SMALL CHANCES OF LIGHT 
RAIN WILL EXIST FOR THE EXTREME NORTHEAST SECTION OF THE STATE EARLY 
THIS EVENING...BEFORE 06Z...SO A DRY FORECAST FROM THAT POINT ON.

TEMPERATURES WILL BE GETTING INTO THE 30S TONIGHT AS WINDS DIE DOWN 
AND THE SKY CLEARS. HIGHS SATURDAY WILL BE PRIMARILY IN THE 50S 
BECAUSE OF CONTINUED NORTHWEST WINDS. HOWEVER...RETURN FLOW WILL BE 
QUICK TO SET UP...SO THAT OVERNIGHT INTO SUNDAY MORNING THE WINDS 
WILL VEER AND PUSH LOWS INTO THE 30S AND 40S. HIGHS ON SUNDAY WILL 
BE HARD TO PEG. THE POTENTIAL TO REBOUND BEFORE THE NEXT FRONTAL 
PASSAGE IS THERE. GFS NUMBERS HAVE BEEN VERIFYING WELL...SO DECIDED 
TO FOLLOW THEM OR GO ABOVE SLIGHTLY. DRY FRONT WILL DROP ACROSS THE 
STATE SUNDAY. TEMPS WILL BEGIN A SLOW COOLING TREND IN NORTHEASTERLY 
WINDS.

IN THE LONG TERM...AREA WILL BE DOMINATED BY HIGH PRESSURE FROM THE 
NORTH WITH MOSTLY NORTHERLY WINDS. THIS SHOULD LEAD TO COOLER THAN 
NORMAL TEMPS. FLOW ALOFT WILL GENERALLY BE FROM THE NORTHWEST WITH 
THE FLOW PATTERN AMPLIFYING BY THE END OF THE PERIOD. KEPT DRY 
WEATHER IN FORECAST. NEW GFS BRINGS A SHEARED SHORT WAVE ACROSS 
TUESDAY WITH SOME MOISTURE INCREASE. INCREASED CLOUDS FOR TUESDAY 
DUE TO THIS BUT LOOKS LIKE MOISTURE WILL BE INSUFFICIENT FOR A 
CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION. LOOKS MORE LIKE AN UPSLOPE PRECIP PATTERN 
WHICH WOULD AFFECT AREAS WEST OF THE CWA.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

46







000 
FXUS64 KLZK 110340 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
935 PM CST FRI DEC 10 2004

.DISCUSSION...
GOING FORECAST ON TARGET. IN GENERAL...KEPT WINDS UP A LITTLE LONGER 
OVERNIGHT...ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTH AND EAST. IN THE SAME AREAS... 
CLOUDS LOOK RATHER PERSISTENT...WITH MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS 
MENTIONED IN THE FORECAST. (46)
&&  

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 230 PM CST FRI DEC 10 2004

IN THE SHORT TERM...UPPER TROF WILL BE MOVING AWAY FROM ARKANSAS 
QUICKLY TONIGHT. THIS WILL RESULT IN A GRADUAL SHIFT FROM NORTHWEST 
FLOW TO ZONAL FLOW BY 12Z TUESDAY. NO MAJOR FEATURES WILL MOVE OVER 
THE STATE IN THIS PERIOD...SO THE SURFACE PATTERN WILL PRESENT THE 
CHALLENGES.

STRONG GRADIENT THIS AFTERNOON WILL BE RELAXING TO THE POINT OF 
WINDS FALLING BELOW OUR LOCAL CRITERIA FOR LAKE WIND ADVISORIES. 
THUS THE ADVISORIES WILL BE ALLOWED TO EXPIRE AT 4 PM WITHOUT 
RENEWAL. LOW CLOUD SHIELD ROTATING AROUND THE SURFACE LOW WILL BE 
LIFTING TO THE NORTHEAST QUICKLY TONIGHT. SMALL CHANCES OF LIGHT 
RAIN WILL EXIST FOR THE EXTREME NORTHEAST SECTION OF THE STATE EARLY 
THIS EVENING...BEFORE 06Z...SO A DRY FORECAST FROM THAT POINT ON.

TEMPERATURES WILL BE GETTING INTO THE 30S TONIGHT AS WINDS DIE DOWN 
AND THE SKY CLEARS. HIGHS SATURDAY WILL BE PRIMARILY IN THE 50S 
BECAUSE OF CONTINUED NORTHWEST WINDS. HOWEVER...RETURN FLOW WILL BE 
QUICK TO SET UP...SO THAT OVERNIGHT INTO SUNDAY MORNING THE WINDS 
WILL VEER AND PUSH LOWS INTO THE 30S AND 40S. HIGHS ON SUNDAY WILL 
BE HARD TO PEG. THE POTENTIAL TO REBOUND BEFORE THE NEXT FRONTAL 
PASSAGE IS THERE. GFS NUMBERS HAVE BEEN VERIFYING WELL...SO DECIDED 
TO FOLLOW THEM OR GO ABOVE SLIGHTLY. DRY FRONT WILL DROP ACROSS THE

WINDS.

NORTH WITH MOSTLY NORTHERLY WINDS. THIS SHOULD LEAD TO COOLER THAN 
NORMAL TEMPS. FLOW ALOFT WILL GENERALLY BE FROM THE NORTHWEST WITH 
THE FLOW PATTERN AMPLIFYING BY THE END OF THE PERIOD. KEPT DRY 
WEATHER IN FORECAST. NEW GFS BRINGS A SHEARED SHORT WAVE ACROSS 
TUESDAY WITH SOME MOISTURE INCREASE. INCREASED CLOUDS FOR TUESDAY 
DUE TO THIS BUT LOOKS LIKE MOISTURE WILL BE INSUFFICIENT FOR A 
CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION. LOOKS MORE LIKE AN UPSLOPE PRECIP PATTERN 
WHICH WOULD AFFECT AREAS WEST OF THE CWA.

32/29





165 
FXUS64 KLZK 100947
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
341 AM CST FRI DEC 10 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT
A RATHER STRONG SURFACE BASED LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM JUST TO OUR 
NORTHEAST CONTINUES TO DEEPEN AS IT DIVES SOUTHEASTWARD WITH THE
PRESSURE GRADIENT ACROSS ARKANSAS INCREASING. THIS WILL BRING 
INCREASING WINDS TO MUCH OF ARKANSAS. A LAKE WIND ADVISORY WILL BE 
IN EFFECT TODAY FOR MY ENTIRE CW AREA. THE PRESSURE GRADIENT WILL 
RELAX WITH WINDS DECREASING TONIGHT. 
SOME OF THE WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE WILL SKIRT THE NORTHEAST SECTIONS
THIS EVENING SO WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN FOR A BRIEF PERIOD 
OVER THE NORTHEAST THIS EVENING. THE REST OF MY CW AREA WILL CONTINUE
RAIN-FREE. AND ASIDE FROM THIS SLIGHT CHANCE...LITTLE OR NO RAIN IS 
EXPECTED TODAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. A SERIES OF COLD FRONTS WILL 
KEEP US IN A ROLLER COASTER SCENARIO THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS WITH 
TEMPERATURES DIPPING BELOW NORMAL AFTER THE FRONTAL PASSAGES. 
(38)    
&&

.LONG TERM...TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...
CONSISTENCY PREVAILS IN THE MEDIUM RANGE WITH NO SIGNIFICANT 
DIFFERENCES IN THE FORECAST SOLUTIONS. ALL MODELS CONTINUE TO 
ADVERTISE PERSISTENT EASTERN CONUS TROFFING THROUGH OUT THE PERIOD 
THAT DOES DAMPEN WITH TIME . RESULT IS A CONTINUOUS NORTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT FOR THE AREA WITH TEMPERATURES RUNNING BEHIND SEASONAL NORMS.

PERIOD SHAPING UP TO BE CHILLY BUT DRY WITH NO REAL PRECIP CHANCES 
UNTIL POSSIBLY LATE ON DAY SEVEN. PERIOD STARTS OFF WITH CANADIAN 
HIGH PRESSURE MOVING INTO THE NATIONS MID SECTION. NORTHEAST 
SURFACE WIND AND SOME MOISTURE TRAPPED UNDER THE RIDGE WILL LIKELY 
PRODUCE MORNING STRATUS TUESDAY MORNING AND POSSIBLY WEDNESDAY 
MORNING. ONCE STRATUS BURNS OFF...HIGH OVER THE REGION BRINGS MAINLY 
CLEAR...ALBEIT COOL...CONDITIONS. HIGH SLIPS OFF TO THE EAST ON DAY 
SEVEN WITH SOME RETURN FLOW COMING BACK FOR SOME WARMING. NEXT IN 
THE ONGOING SERIES OF COLD FRONTS APPROACHES FOR LATE DAY SEVEN BUT 
WILL CONTINUE TO KEEP FORECAST DRY AS NO SIGNIFICANT DYNAMICS OR 
MOISTURE ARE SEEN THIS FAR OUT.

TEMPERATURES TO AVERAGE 5 TO 8 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL FOR DAYS FIVE 
AND SIX AND MAYBE A DEGREE OF TWO BELOW NORMAL FOR DAY SEVEN. 
OVERNIGHT LOWS IN THE 20S LIKELY STATEWIDE. MEX NUMBERS LOOK 
REASONABLE AND ARE GENERALLY ACCEPTED BUT WILL STILL SHAVE A FEW 
DEGREES OFF THE GUIDANCE FOR DAY SEVEN.
(56)
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    54  35  54  37 /  10  10   0   0 
HARRISON AR       49  31  51  37 /  10  10   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    55  37  55  38 /   0  10   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     55  36  55  38 /  10  10   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  48  29  51  36 /  10  10   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     56  38  55  38 /  10  10   0   0 
SEARCY AR         53  33  52  36 /  10  10  10   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      54  37  56  38 /   0  10   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   53  35  53  37 /  10  10   0   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
AR...LAKE WIND ADVISORY FROM 800 AM CST FRIDAY UNTIL 400 PM CST
FRIDAY FOR ZONES ARZ003>007...ARZ012>016...ARZ021>025...ARZ030>034...
ARZ037>047...ARZ052>057...ARZ062>069.
&&

$$

PINE BLUFF AR     55  36  55  38 /  10  10   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  48  29  51  36 /  10  10   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     56  38  55  38 /  10  10   0   0

38/56






854 
FXUS64 KLZK 100518 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1115 PM CST THU DEC 9 2004

.DISCUSSION...
FRESHENED UP LZKZFP.
(38)
&&

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION... 
940 PM CST THU DEC 9 2004

.DISCUSSION...
POLAR JET BECOMING MORE OF A FACTOR INTO MID DECEMBER. IN THE 
SHORT TERM...TRANSITIONING FROM HEAVY/EXCESSIVE PRECIPITATION TO 
DRIER/COOLER PATTERN.

GOING FORECAST PRETTY MUCH ON TRACK. FRONT/TROF WILL HEAD QUICKLY 
THROUGH ARKANSAS TONIGHT FROM THE PLAINS...WITH NORTHWEST WINDS 
INCREASING. WINDY WEATHER ANTICIPATED ON FRIDAY...AND WORDED 
ACCORDINGLY IN THE FORECAST. 

ADDED MORE CLOUDS IN THE NORTH/EAST FRIDAY WITH SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
RAIN MENTIONED IN THE NORTHEAST COUNTIES. OTHERWISE...LOOKS DRY AND 
COOLER IN MOST AREAS. (46)
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 224 PM CST THU DEC 9 2004

IN THE SHORT TERM...H5 TROF WILL AMPLIFY OVER THE EASTERN SECTION OF 
THE COUNTRY TONIGHT WHILE IT CONTINUES MOVING EAST. THE RIDGE TO OUR 
WEST WILL GO THROUGH AMPLIFICATION AS WELL. STRENGTH OF THE RIDGE 
WILL RESULT IN STRONG WESTERLIES ACROSS THE NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE 
COUNTRY AND AROUND THE GREAT LAKES THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT.

THE SURFACE PATTERN IS INTERESTING. A SURFACE LOW OVER THE NORTHERN 
PLAINS WILL DIVE SOUTHEAST AND DEEPEN OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. 
GRADIENT WILL TIGHTEN BEGINNING TONIGHT...SO WINDS WILL INCREASE IN 
STRENGTH OVERNIGHT AND THEY WILL BECOME GUSTY IN CHARACTER FOR 
FRIDAY. THE LOW WILL SHIFT TO THE EAST COAST FRIDAY NIGHT FROM THE 
OHIO VALLEY...BUT ITS CIRCULATION WILL KEEP ENOUGH CYCLONIC BEND TO 
THE ISOBARS TO KEEP WINDS UP DURING THE NIGHT TOMORROW NIGHT.

TEMPERATURES PRESENT ANOTHER CHALLENGING SITUATION...ESPECIALLY FOR 
THE NORTHEAST QUARTER OF THE STATE. COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL BE 
PRONOUNCED OVER THAT AREA...AND PRECIPITATION TYPE BECOMES AN ISSUE. 
FORECAST SOUNDINGS HINT THAT THE LOWEST LAYERS WILL STAY ABOVE 
FREEZING FRIDAY NIGHT. THE COMBINATION OF WINDS AND ABOVE FREEZING 
IN THE LOWEST 750 METERS MAKE ME LEAN TOWARD LIGHT RAIN ONLY FOR THE 
NORTHEAST SECTIONS AND WITH LOW POPS AT THAT BECAUSE THE DYNAMICS 
WILL BE MOVING AWAY FROM THE STATE.

SATURDAYS HIGHS WILL BOUNCE BACK IN LIGHT OF WESTERLY COMPONENT TO 
WINDS AROUND SURFACE RIDGE OVER THE LOWER GULF COAST AND THE 
DEEPENING TROF OVER THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN PLAINS/UPPER MIDWEST.

SURFACE LOW ALONG THE CANADIAN BORDER WILL DROP INTO THE GREAT LAKES 
DRAGGING A DRY FRONT ACROSS ARKANSAS SUNDAY AFTERNOON..AND 
REINFORCING THE COOLER AIR FOR SUNDAY NIGHT. 

IN THE LONG TERM...COOLER AIR WILL FOLLOW BEHIND COLD FRONT...WITH 
COOL AND DRY AIR REMAINING THROUGH WEDNESDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL 
REMAIN COOLER THAN NORMAL...WITH LOWS IN THE 20S TO NEAR 30...AND 
HIGHS IN THE 40S AND LOWER 50S. READINGS WILL WARM BY 
THURSDAY...AHEAD OF NEXT SYSTEM DEVELOPING IN THE PLAINS.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

38








WILL BE MOVING AWAY FROM THE STATE.

SATURDAYS HIGHS WILL BOUNCE BACK IN LIGHT OF WESTERLY COMPONENT TO 
WINDS AROUND SURFACE RIDGE OVER THE LOWER GULF COAST AND THE 
DEEPENING TROF OVER THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN PLAINS/UPPER MIDWEST.

SURFACE LOW ALONG THE CANADIAN BORDER WILL DROP INTO THE GREAT LAKES 
DRAGGING A DRY FRONT ACROSS ARKANSAS SUNDAY AFTERNOON..AND 
REINFORCING THE COOLER AIR FOR SUNDAY NIGHT. 

IN THE LONG TERM...COOLER AIR WILL FOLLOW BEHIND COLD FRONT...WITH 
COOL AND DRY AIR REMAINING THROUGH WEDNESDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL 
REMAIN COOLER THAN NORMAL...WITH LOWS IN THE 20S TO NEAR 30...AND 
HIGHS IN THE 40S AND LOWER 50S. READINGS WILL WARM BY 
THURSDAY...AHEAD OF NEXT SYSTEM DEVELOPING IN THE PLAINS.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

38








629 
FXUS64 KLZK 100343 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
940 PM CST THU DEC 9 2004

.DISCUSSION...
POLAR JET BECOMING MORE OF A FACTOR INTO MID DECEMBER. IN THE 
SHORT TERM...TRANSITIONING FROM HEAVY/EXCESSIVE PRECIPITATION TO 
DRIER/COOLER PATTERN.

GOING FORECAST PRETTY MUCH ON TRACK. FRONT/TROF WILL HEAD QUICKLY 
THROUGH ARKANSAS TONIGHT FROM THE PLAINS...WITH NORTHWEST WINDS 
INCREASING. WINDY WEATHER ANTICIPATED ON FRIDAY...AND WORDED 
ACCORDINGLY IN THE FORECAST. 

ADDED MORE CLOUDS IN THE NORTH/EAST FRIDAY WITH SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
RAIN MENTIONED IN THE NORTHEAST COUNTIES. OTHERWISE...LOOKS DRY AND 
COOLER IN MOST AREAS. (46)
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 224 PM CST THU DEC 9 2004

IN THE SHORT TERM...H5 TROF WILL AMPLIFY OVER THE EASTERN SECTION OF 
THE COUNTRY TONIGHT WHILE IT CONTINUES MOVING EAST. THE RIDGE TO OUR 
WEST WILL GO THROUGH AMPLIFICATION AS WELL. STRENGTH OF THE RIDGE 
WILL RESULT IN STRONG WESTERLIES ACROSS THE NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE 
COUNTRY AND AROUND THE GREAT LAKES THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT.

THE SURFACE PATTERN IS INTERESTING. A SURFACE LOW OVER THE NORTHERN 
PLAINS WILL DIVE SOUTHEAST AND DEEPEN OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. 
GRADIENT WILL TIGHTEN BEGINNING TONIGHT...SO WINDS WILL INCREASE IN 
STRENGTH OVERNIGHT AND THEY WILL BECOME GUSTY IN CHARACTER FOR 
FRIDAY. THE LOW WILL SHIFT TO THE EAST COAST FRIDAY NIGHT FROM THE 
OHIO VALLEY...BUT ITS CIRCULATION WILL KEEP ENOUGH CYCLONIC BEND TO 
THE ISOBARS TO KEEP WINDS UP DURING THE NIGHT TOMORROW NIGHT.

TEMPERATURES PRESENT ANOTHER CHALLENGING SITUATION...ESPECIALLY FOR 
THE NORTHEAST QUARTER OF THE STATE. COLD AIR ADVECTION WILL BE 
PRONOUNCED OVER THAT AREA...AND PRECIPITATION TYPE BECOMES AN ISSUE. 
FORECAST SOUNDINGS HINT THAT THE LOWEST LAYERS WILL STAY ABOVE 
FREEZING FRIDAY NIGHT. THE COMBINATION OF WINDS AND ABOVE FREEZING 
IN THE LOWEST 750 METERS MAKE ME LEAN TOWARD LIGHT RAIN ONLY FOR THE 
NORTHEAST SECTIONS AND WITH LOW POPS AT THAT BECAUSE THE DYNAMICS 
WILL BE MOVING AWAY FROM THE STATE.

SATURDAYS HIGHS WILL BOUNCE BACK IN LIGHT OF WESTERLY COMPONENT TO 
WINDS AROUND SURFACE RIDGE OVER THE LOWER GULF COAST AND THE 
DEEPENING TROF OVER THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN PLAINS/UPPER MIDWEST.

SURFACE LOW ALONG THE CANADIAN BORDER WILL DROP INTO THE GREAT LAKES 
DRAGGING A DRY FRONT ACROSS ARKANSAS SUNDAY AFTERNOON..AND 
REINFORCING THE COOLER AIR FOR SUNDAY NIGHT. 

IN THE LONG TERM...COOLER AIR WILL FOLLOW BEHIND COLD FRONT...WITH 
COOL AND DRY AIR REMAINING THROUGH WEDNESDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL 
REMAIN COOLER THAN NORMAL...WITH LOWS IN THE 20S TO NEAR 30...AND 
HIGHS IN THE 40S AND LOWER 50S. READINGS WILL WARM BY 
THURSDAY...AHEAD OF NEXT SYSTEM DEVELOPING IN THE PLAINS.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$
