44/51









750 
FXUS64 KLZK 030239
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
835 PM CST THU DEC  2 2004

.DISCUSSION...
NO UPDATES NEEDED THIS EVENING. CURRENT FORECAST RIGHT ON TRACK WITH 
ONLY MINOR TWEAKING OF THE GRIDS NEEDED. HIGH PRESSURE...DRY AIR 
MASS AND LIGHT WINDS WILL SET THE STAGE FOR ANOTHER SUB FREEZING 
NIGHT. WITH ALL AREAS OF THE CWA NOW HAVING EXPERIENCED SUB FREEZING 
TEMPS...HIGHLIGHTS NO LONGER NEEDED.
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 255 PM CST THU DEC  2 2004

WEAK COLD FRONT THROUGH THE REGION TODAY...BUT WITH LITTLE MORE THAN 
A WIND SHIFT. HIGH PRESSURE BEHIND FRONT WILL PROVIDE DRY WEATHER 
THROUGH AT LEAST SATURDAY...WITH BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES.

READINGS WILL DROP BELOW FREEZING TONIGHT AND AGAIN FRIDAY NIGHT IN 
SOME AREAS. HOWEVER...MOST SPOTS HAVE ALREADY HAD A FREEZE...SO 
FREEZE WARNING NOT NECESSARY.

TOWARD THE END OF THE SHORT TERM...HIGH PRESSURE WILL HEAD EAST WITH 
WINDS BECOMING MORE SOUTHERLY. MOISTURE WILL INCREASE RAPIDLY 
SATURDAY NIGHT...WITH RAIN BECOMING LIKELY THROUGH SUNDAY. 

LOOKS UNSTABLE ENOUGH FOR AT LEAST A MENTION OF THUNDER IN SOUTHERN 
ARKANSAS SUNDAY. KEPT IT RAIN FARTHER NORTH. (46)

RAINY PERIOD GRADUALLY WILL BE COMING TO AN END BY LATE MONDAY...AS 
SURFACE HIGH PUSHES IN FROM THE PLAINS...AND COLD FRONT MOVES OUT OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. DRY WEATHER WILL BE SHORT LIVED...HOWEVER AS MID 
AND UPPER FLOW REMAINS STRONG AND ZONAL. DUE LARGELY TO 
STRENGTHENING UPPER RIDGE IN THE EASTERN GULF...FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
WILL STALL...AND BEGIN MOVING BACK TO THE NORTH AS A WARM FRONT. 

SURFACE LOW APPEARS TO DEVELOP ALONG THE BOUNDARY...AND STRONG UPPER 
TROUGH WILL INTERACT WITH THE SYSTEM...ALLOWING FOR MORE RAIN ON 
WEDNESDAY INTO EARLY THURSDAY AS THE SURFACE SYSTEM MOVES ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN TWO THIRDS OF ARKANSAS. WILL BE CONTENDING WITH POSSIBLE 
MIXED PRECIP ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY MORNING OVER ABOUT THE 
NORTHWESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA /FROM BOONEVILLE TO ASH 
FLAT...AND WESTWARD/.  NEAR TO BELOW FREEZING SURFACE TEMPERATURES...
AND LOW 1000-500 MB THICKNESS VALUES WARRANT AT LEAST A MENTION OF A 
MIXTURE OF RAIN AND FLURRIES. TEMPERATURES...WHERE BELOW FREEZING...
SHOULD ONLY BE THAT WAY BRIEFLY WHICH SHOULD HELP TO PRECLUDE A 
CHANGEOVER. UPPER RIDGE WILL PUSH INTO THE REGION BY THURSDAY 
MORNING...BRINGING A DRY AND COOL END TO THE EXTENDED PERIODS. 

BIGGEST CHANGE TO THE EXTENDED PERIODS WAS TO ADD MIXED PRECIP TO 
THE NORTHWEST. ALSO...ADJUSTED POP TRENDS BETTER IN LINE WITH 
CURRENT THINKING. (57)

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$


633 
FXUS64 KLZK 020929
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
325 AM CST THU DEC  2 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY
HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL THIS MORNING...WITH ONLY A FEW HIGH CLOUDS 
MOVING TO THE NORTH AND SOUTH OF THE STATE. TEMPERATURES THIS 
MORNING HAVE APPROACHED OR FALLEN BELOW FREEZING ACROSS THE 
AREA...WITH FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FOR THE SOUTHEAST UNTIL 8 AM.

MAIN STORY IN THE SHORT TERM IS TEMPERATURES. A WEAK FRONT WILL MOVE 
IN FROM THE NORTHWEST TODAY...BUT DUE TO LACK OF MOISTURE...WILL 
ONLY NOTICE A WIND SHIFT AND SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPS. AN INCREASE IN 
CLOUDS WILL BE SEEN IN THE NORTH...BUT OVERALL MOSTLY SUNNY 
CONDITIONS TODAY.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. AS THE HIGH MOVES 
EAST SATURDAY...SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL BRING MOISTURE BACK TO THE AREA 
SATURDAY AHEAD OF THE NEXT SYSTEM. FRIDAY AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE SIMILAR TO TODAY...WITH HIGHS SATURDAY A FEW DEGREES WARMER 
DUE TO THE HIGHER MOISTURE CONTENT.

THE NEXT CHANCE FOR RAIN COMES AHEAD OF TROUGH IN THE DESERT 
SOUTHWEST. TEMPERATURES ON SUNDAY WILL BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER DUE 
TO CLOUD COVER AND RAIN.
&&

.LONG TERM...SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY
A COUPLE OF SHORT WAVES WILL ROTATE THROUGH THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT
THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. KEPT CHANCE POPS IN FOR SUNDAY NIGHT INTO
MONDAY THEN DECREASED POPS MONDAY AFTERNOON AS A DRY SLOT MOVES 
INTO THE STATE. UPPER FLOW FLATTENS OUT TUESDAY THEN TURNS SOUTHWEST
AHEAD OF ANOTHER UPPER TROF WEDNESDAY. WENT WITH DRY FORECAST 
MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH EARLY WEDNESDAY BUT BROUGHT CHANCE POPS IN
WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AHEAD OF THE NEXT UPPER LOW. GULF OPENS UP
WEDNESDAY AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM AND A COLD FRONT MOVING DOWN THE
PLAINS. MOISTURE SHOULD BE SUFFICIENT FOR A CHANCE OF RAIN BY
LATE IN THE DAY. FAIRLY GOOD BLAST OF COLD AIR WILL MOVE INTO
THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT BUT IT DOES NOT LOOK AS COLD AS IT
DID ON YESTERDAYS GFS AND THIS IS LIKELY TO CHANGE FACE A FEW
TIMES BEFORE THE TIME ARRIVES. BASED ON THE WET PATTERN FOR
SUNDAY NIGHT...RAISED MINS A BIT FOR SUNDAY NIGHT WITH MOST AREAS
IN THE 40S. ALSO LOWERED TEMPS AT END OF PERIOD. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    56  34  56  34 /   0   0   0   0 
HARRISON AR       51  28  53  31 /   0   0   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    57  33  56  34 /   0   0   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     57  34  56  35 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  50  28  52  31 /   0   0   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     58  34  57  35 /   0   0   0   0 
SEARCY AR         55  32  55  33 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      57  33  57  34 /   0   0   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   55  31  56  32 /   0   0   0   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...FREEZE WARNING FOR THIS 
MORNING FOR ZONES ARZ056>057...ARZ063>065...ARZ068>069.
&&

58/29





000 
FXUS64 KLZK 020929
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
325 AM CST THU DEC  2 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY
HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL THIS MORNING...WITH ONLY A FEW HIGH CLOUDS 
MOVING TO THE NORTH AND SOUTH OF THE STATE. TEMPERATURES THIS 
MORNING HAVE APPROACHED OR FALLEN BELOW FREEZING ACROSS THE 
AREA...WITH FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FOR THE SOUTHEAST UNTIL 8 AM.

MAIN STORY IN THE SHORT TERM IS TEMPERATURES. A WEAK FRONT WILL MOVE 
IN FROM THE NORTHWEST TODAY...BUT DUE TO LACK OF MOISTURE...WILL 
ONLY NOTICE A WIND SHIFT AND SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPS. AN INCREASE IN 
CLOUDS WILL BE SEEN IN THE NORTH...BUT OVERALL MOSTLY SUNNY 
CONDITIONS TODAY.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. AS THE HIGH MOVES 
EAST SATURDAY...SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL BRING MOISTURE BACK TO THE AREA 
SATURDAY AHEAD OF THE NEXT SYSTEM. FRIDAY AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE SIMILAR TO TODAY...WITH HIGHS SATURDAY A FEW DEGREES WARMER 
DUE TO THE HIGHER MOISTURE CONTENT.

THE NEXT CHANCE FOR RAIN COMES AHEAD OF TROUGH IN THE DESERT 
SOUTHWEST. TEMPERATURES ON SUNDAY WILL BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER DUE 
TO CLOUD COVER AND RAIN.
&&

.LONG TERM...SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY
A COUPLE OF SHORT WAVES WILL ROTATE THROUGH THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT
THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. KEPT CHANCE POPS IN FOR SUNDAY NIGHT INTO
MONDAY THEN DECREASED POPS MONDAY AFTERNOON AS A DRY SLOT MOVES 
INTO THE STATE. UPPER FLOW FLATTENS OUT TUESDAY THEN TURNS SOUTHWEST
AHEAD OF ANOTHER UPPER TROF WEDNESDAY. WENT WITH DRY FORECAST 
MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH EARLY WEDNESDAY BUT BROUGHT CHANCE POPS IN
WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AHEAD OF THE NEXT UPPER LOW. GULF OPENS UP
WEDNESDAY AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM AND A COLD FRONT MOVING DOWN THE
PLAINS. MOISTURE SHOULD BE SUFFICIENT FOR A CHANCE OF RAIN BY
LATE IN THE DAY. FAIRLY GOOD BLAST OF COLD AIR WILL MOVE INTO
THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT BUT IT DOES NOT LOOK AS COLD AS IT
DID ON YESTERDAYS GFS AND THIS IS LIKELY TO CHANGE FACE A FEW
TIMES BEFORE THE TIME ARRIVES. BASED ON THE WET PATTERN FOR
SUNDAY NIGHT...RAISED MINS A BIT FOR SUNDAY NIGHT WITH MOST AREAS
IN THE 40S. ALSO LOWERED TEMPS AT END OF PERIOD. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    56  34  56  34 /   0   0   0   0 
HARRISON AR       51  28  53  31 /   0   0   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    57  33  56  34 /   0   0   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     57  34  56  35 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  50  28  52  31 /   0   0   0   0

58/29





457 
FXUS64 KLZK 020244
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
840 PM CST WED DEC  1 2004

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS RIGHT ON TRACK AND NO UPDATES ARE NEEDED THIS 
EVENING. CLEAR SKIES AND CALM WINDS WILL ALLOW SUB FREEZING 
TEMPERATURES AREA WIDE. PLACEMENT OF THE FREEZE WARNING LOOKS GOOD. 
WILL TWEAK A FEW GRIDS TO REFLECT CURRENT TRENDS BUT CHANGES WILL 
HAVE NO EFFECT ON THE SENSIBLE WEATHER. 
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 210 PM CST WED DEC  1 2004

DRY/CONTINUED COOL WEATHER WILL BE THE THEME DURING MUCH OF THE 
SHORT TERM.

COLD TEMPERATURES IN STORE TONIGHT WITH CLEAR SKY/LIGHT WINDS. 
TEMPERATURES WILL DROP BELOW FREEZING IN MUCH OF ARKANSAS...WITH THE 
FIRST FREEZE OF THE SEASON IN THE SOUTHEAST. FOR THIS REASON...A 
FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR THE SOUTHEAST COUNTIES 
OVERNIGHT.

WEAK COLD FRONT WILL HEAD THROUGH THE REGION FROM THE NORTHWEST 
ON THURSDAY. OTHER THAN A FEW MORE CLOUDS ACROSS THE NORTH AND A 
WIND SHIFT...THE FRONT WILL GO THROUGH WITH LITTLE FANFARE.

AHEAD OF THE FRONT...A LITTLE WARMER ON THURSDAY WITH AFTERNOON 
READINGS IN THE 50S. SLIGHTLY COOLER BEHIND THE FRONT ON FRIDAY WITH 
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING INTO ARKANSAS FROM THE PLAINS.

TO START THE WEEKEND...HIGH PRESSURE WILL SLIDE TO THE EAST...WITH 
RETURN FLOW BRINGING INCREASING MOISTURE. STORM SYSTEM WILL RIDE 
SUBTROPICAL JET THROUGH THE SOUTHERN ROCKIES...WITH RAIN DEVELOPING 
AHEAD OF SYSTEM FROM TEXAS INTO LOUISIANA...ARKANSAS AND 
MISSISSIPPI. GIVEN THIS...INCREASED CHANCE OF RAIN SATURDAY 
NIGHT. (46)       

RAIN CHANCES WILL BE ONGOING EARLY IN THE EXTENDED...AS DEVELOPING 
SURFACE LOW APPROACHES FROM THE GULF COAST...AND INTERACTS WITH 
UPPER TROUGH SWINGING ACROSS FROM OKLAHOMA. GREATEST CHANCES OF RAIN 
WILL BE CONFINED TO SOUTHERN ARKANSAS FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT...
SPREADING OVER THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA BY MONDAY MORNING. 
UPPER FLOW WILL BECOME MORE SOUTHWESTERLY...ALLOWING FOR SEVERAL 
UPPER IMPULSES TO MOVE UP IN THE MEAN FLOW AND INTERACT WITH ANY 
SYNOPTIC OR MESOSCALE SURFACE BOUNDARIES OVER THE AREA. 

RAIN CHANCES WILL CONTINUE UNTIL TUESDAY...WHEN FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
MOVES ACROSS THE AREA...AND STRONGER UPPER TROUGH PUSHES THAT SYSTEM 
TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. SURFACE RIDGE WILL PASS OVER NORTHERN 
ARKANSAS BY WEDNESDAY...WITH CLOUDS RETURNING FROM THE WEST BY THE 
END OF THE PERIOD....AS YET ANOTHER IN A SERIES OF SURFACE 
BOUNDARIES HEADS TOWARD ARKANSAS FROM THE PLAINS. 

ALL IN ALL NO BIG CHANGES MADE TO THE EXTENDED. (57) 

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

491 
FXUS64 KLZK 010916
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
315 AM CST WED DEC  1 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY
MAIN STORY THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK WILL BE TEMPERATURES. UPPER 
LOW AND ASSOCIATED CLOUD COVER MOVING EAST INTO OHIO VALLEY... 
LEAVING CLEAR SKIES AND COLD TEMPERATURES ACROSS ARKANSAS. IN A 
STARK CONTRAST TO RECENT RAINY WEATHER...SUNNY SKIES AND MILD 
TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE FORECAST TODAY. READINGS IN SOME LOCATIONS 
WILL BE 10 TO 15 DEGREES WARMER THAN AFTERNOON READINGS TUESDAY... 
EVEN AFTER THE COOL START THIS MORNING.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL TONIGHT. WEAK FRONT WILL MOVE 
ACROSS THE NORTH...BUT WITH DRY AIR IN PLACE...ONLY EXPECT A WIND 
SHIFT AND SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPERATURES. WITH HIGH HOLDING STRONG 
OVER SOUTHERN ARKANSAS...EXPECT ANOTHER COLD NIGHT TONIGHT WITH 
TEMPS FALLING TO FREEZING OR JUST BELOW IN THE SOUTHEAST. WILL ISSUE 
A FREEZE WARNING FOR THIS AREA...AS THIS IS THE LAST AREA TO SEE 
FREEZING TEMPERATURES.

HIGHS ON THURSDAY WILL A LITTLE COOLER IN THE NORTH DUE TO FRONTAL 
PASSAGE...BUT WILL STAY IN THE 50S. SIMILAR READINGS WILL BE IN 
STORE FOR SATURDAY.
&&

.LONG TERM...SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY
A COUPLE OF SHORT WAVES MOVE ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD...EACH WITH A COLD FRONT. SOME MOISTURE MOVES INTO THE AREA 
AHEAD OF EACH SYSTEM. FORECAST ALREADY HAD 20 TO 30 PERCENT POPS 
WITH THESE SYSTEMS AND BASICALLY KEPT THEM THE SAME WITH SOME MINOR 
TWEAKS. NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES MADE TO TEMP GRIDS WITH MINS MOSTLY 
IN THE 30S TO LOWER 40S AND MAXES MOSTLY IN THE 50S THROUGH THE 
PERIOD.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    54  31  54  32 /   0   0   0   0 
HARRISON AR       52  29  51  28 /   0   0   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    54  31  55  33 /   0   0   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     54  31  56  33 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  52  28  51  28 /   0   0   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     55  31  57  33 /   0   0   0   0 
SEARCY AR         53  31  53  31 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      54  31  55  33 /   0   0   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   53  31  53  31 /   0   0   0   0 
&&

ARZ066>067.

&&

$$

58/29







934 
FXUS64 KLZK 302100
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
300 PM CST TUE NOV 30 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT
STORM SYSTEM WILL HEAD EAST OVERNIGHT...WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING
INTO ARKANSAS FROM THE PLAINS. RAIN IN THE EAST WILL END THIS 
EVENING...WITH SKIES GRADUALLY CLEARING. 

WIDESPREAD FREEZING TEMPERATURES OVERNIGHT...BUT PARTS OF THE 
SOUTHEAST WILL REMAIN ABOVE FREEZING. WILL KEEP A FREEZE WARNING IN 
EFFECT FOR PARTS OF SOUTHWEST/SOUTH CENTRAL ARKANSAS TONIGHT...BUT 
WILL CANCEL WARNING IN THE SOUTHEAST.

OTHERWISE...A FAIRLY TRANQUIL SHORT TERM WITH THE SUBTROPICAL JET 
TAKING A BREAK. AFTER TONIGHT...NO PRECIPITATION IN THE SHORT 
TERM...WITH AT/BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES. (46)    
&&

.LONG TERM...FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY
EXTENDED PERIODS START OUT FAIRLY BENIGN...WITH SURFACE RIDGE OVER 
THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY...AND NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT OVER 
MUCH OF THE MIDDLE PORTION OF THE COUNTRY. THUS...TEMPERATURES WILL 
START OUT FAIRLY COOL ON FRIDAY. WARMING TREND WILL BEGIN DURING THE 
WEEKEND...AS UPPER FLOW FLATTENS OUT...AND LOW PRESSURE BEGINS TO 
DEVELOP AND MOVE NORTHWARD FROM THE SOUTH TEXAS GULF COAST. MOISTURE 
WILL SPREAD UP INTO THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE DAY SUNDAY...WITH 
RAIN BECOMING POSSIBLE OUT AHEAD OF APPROACHING SURFACE SYSTEM. 

SURFACE SYSTEM LOOKS TO STALL OUT BRIEFLY NEAR SOUTHERN ARKANSAS...
WITH ANOTHER ROUND OF RAIN POSSIBLE AS AN UPPER TROUGH GIVES SURFACE 
SYSTEM A PUSH FURTHER NORTHWARD. BY MONDAY NIGHT AND INTO TUESDAY...
COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA...WITH RAIN CHANCES CONTINUING. 
SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGING WILL PUSH THE COLD FRONT EASTWARD BY THE 
TUESDAY DAYTIME PERIOD...WITH COOLER AND DRIER CONDITIONS RETURNING. 

DID NOT MAKE ANY EARTH-SHATTERING CHANGES TO THE EXTENDED. UPPED 
TEMPERATURES A COUPLE OF DEGREES ON SUNDAY AND MONDAY. ALSO...RAISED 
POPS TO CHANCE CATEGORY FOR THAT TIME FRAME AS WELL. ON THE 
WHOLE...REMAINDER EXTENDED LOOKS GOOD. (57)
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    30  54  31  55 /  10   0   0   0 
HARRISON AR       25  52  31  51 /  10   0   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    30  54  32  55 /  10   0   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     32  54  31  56 /  20   0   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  25  52  29  50 /  10   0   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     33  55  31  57 /  20   0   0   0 
SEARCY AR         30  53  31  54 /  20   0   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      29  54  31  55 /  10   0   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   28  53  30  54 /  10   0   0   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...FREEZE WARNING FOR LATE TONIGHT 
FOR ZONES ARZ052>055..ARZ062...ARZ066...ARZ067.

$$

46/57






446 
FXUS64 KLZK 301801 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1155 AM CST TUE NOV 30 2004

.DISCUSSION...
RAIN BEGINNING TO TAPER OFF IN THE WEST...BUT WILL CONTINUE IN THE 
EAST THIS AFTERNOON. WENT AHEAD AND UPDATED FORECAST TO ACCOUNT FOR 
PRECIPITATION TRENDS...WITH MOST RAIN OVER BY THIS EVENING. A FEW
SNOWFLAKES MAY MIX WITH RAIN IN THE NORTH FROM HARRISON AND DEER TO 
MOUNTAIN HOME...BUT LITTLE/NO ACCUMULATION EXPECTED.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO ARKANSAS FROM THE PLAINS TONIGHT. THE 
COLDEST NIGHT SO FAR THIS SEASON...WITH 20S/LOWER 30S IN THE 
FORECAST. NORTHERN/CENTRAL SECTIONS OF THE STATE HAVE ALREADY 
EXPERIENCED A FREEZE...BUT NOT IN THE SOUTH. HENCE...A FREEZE 
WARNING HAS BEEN POSTED FOR THE SOUTHERN COUNTIES TONIGHT. 

WILL BE DRY THE NEXT FEW DAYS WITH BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES. (46)
&&   

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 400 AM CST TUE NOV 30 2004

UPPER TROF IS MOVING INTO THE PLAINS WITH A POSITIVE TILT. AREA OF 
RAIN ASSOCIATED WITH IT IS SLOWLY MOVING INTO WESTERN SECTIONS OF 
THE CWA AT ISSUE TIME AND THIS AREA SHOULD EXPAND EARLY THIS 
MORNING. THIS AREA OF RAIN SHOULD BEGIN TO MOVE OUT THIS AFTERNOON 
AS A DRY SLOT MOVES IN AND THE UPPER TROF LIFTS TO THE NORTHEAST 
ACROSS SOUTHERN MISSOURI. WILL HAVE 80 PERCENT POPS ACROSS THE AREA 
THIS MORNING THEN DECREASE POPS FROM THE WEST THIS AFTERNOON. COLD 
AIR WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA ESPECIALLY THIS AFTERNOON. WENT WITH NEAR
STEADY TEMPS THIS MORNING THEN SLOWLY FALLING TEMPS THIS AFTERNOON. 
WILL BE CLOSE IN THE EXTREME NORTH WHETHER PRECIP WILL END BEFORE 
MIXING WITH OR BRIEFLY CHANGING TO SNOW. WENT WITH BRIEF RAIN/SNOW 
MIX IN THAT AREA THIS AFTERNOON. THE UPPER TROF MOVES RAPIDLY OFF TO 
THE NORTHEAST TONIGHT AND QUITE DRY AIR MOVES IN. WEAK SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE DEVELOPS NEARBY. THIS SHOULD RESULT IN NEARLY CALM WINDS 
AND WILL RESULT IN GOOD COOLING. NOTICED EXCEPTIONALLY COLD TEMPS 
THIS MORNING IN PARTS OF KANSAS/NEBRASKA/COLORADO AND GUIDANCE HAS 
BEEN PROGRESSIVELY COMING IN LOWER ON MINS FOR TONIGHT. THE VERY LOW 
TEMPS IN THE PLAINS ARE LIKELY THE RESULT OF SNOW COVER BUT 
INDICATORS POINT TO TEMPS COMING IN BELOW MOS ACROSS THE AREA 
TONIGHT. THIS WILL RESULT IN A HARD FREEZE IN THE NORTHWEST AND A 
LIGHT FREEZE MOST EVERYWHERE ELSE. MUCH OF SOUTHERN ARKANSAS HAS NOT 
REACHED FREEZING YET SO FAR THIS FALL SO WILL ISSUE A FREEZE WARNING 
FOR THAT AREA. NEARLY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT WILL DOMINATE THE AREA FOR 
THE REST OF THE WEEK WITH WEAK SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE. THIS MAY 
ACTUALLY RESULT IN THREE STRAIGHT MOSTLY SUNNY DAYS ALTHOUGH THAT IS 
NOT A GIVEN AS A COUPLE OF WEAK SHORT WAVES WILL MOVE THROUGH THE 
GENERAL AREA...BUT MOISTURE LOOKS SCARCE WITH ALL OF THEM AND THEIR 
MAIN IMPACT WILL BE ON OTHER AREAS. THERE SHOULD BE A GOOD WARMUP ON 
WEDNESDAY WITH MAXES WELL INTO THE 50S BUT ANOTHER GOOD NIGHT OF 
RADIATIONAL COOLING WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH NEARLY CALM WINDS AND DRY 
AIR IN PLACE.    
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...FREEZE WARNING FOR LATE TONIGHT 
FOR ZONES ARZ052>057...ARZ062>069. 
&&

$$

46

CONTINUED THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ON SUNDAY WITH THE NEXT SYSTEM 
APPROACHING THE STATE. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL READINGS.

29/58








220 
FXUS64 KLZK 292058
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
258 PM CST MON NOV 29 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...

LOCAL RADARS ARE CURRENTLY ARE INDICATING RAINFALL...COVERING MOST 
OF THE FORECAST AREA. AN OVERALL DECREASE IN INTENSITY OF THE 
PRECIPITATION HAS BEEN NOTED SINCE 18Z.  

LATEST SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATES AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH NOW LOCATED 
JUST EAST OF THE FOUR CORNERS REGION. THIS FEATURE WILL CONTINUE 
EASTWARD...THEN WILL ACCELERATE NORTHEAST BY LATE TUESDAY.

MAIN CONCERN IS FOR POTENTIAL FOR EXCESSIVE RAINFALL OVERNIGHT. 
EXPECT PRONOUNCED ISENTROPIC LIFT IN THE 750-850 LAYER TO CONTINUE 
FOR MUCH OF THE OVERNIGHT HOURS...WITH THE STRONGEST AXIS OF LIFT TO 
MOVE EASTWARD WITH TIME. ALTHOUGH ANTECEDENT CONDITIONS ARE QUITE 
WET...EXPECTED NATURE OF PRECIPITATION /MAINLY STRATIFORM/...AND QPF 
DOES NOT SUPPORT A FLASH FLOOD WATCH. NEAR TERM CONDITIONS WILL BE 
CLOSELY MONITORED.

PRECIPITATION WILL DECREASE ON TUESDAY...AS THE STRONGER FORCING 
MOVES EASTWARD. ALL PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE CLEAR OF THE FORECAST 
AREA BY 01/06Z.

AFTER THE UPPER TROUGH EJECTS NORTHEAST...NEAR ZONAL FLOW WILL 
DEVELOP ACROSS MUCH OF THE U.S. DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...AS LOW LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE DEVELOPS IN THE 
REGION. 

&&

.LONG TERM...FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY
DRY WEATHER EXPECTED IN THE EARLY PART OF THE LONG TERM AS HIGH 
PRESSURE CONTINUES OVER THE AREA. NEXT STORM SYSTEM WILL AFFECT THE 
AREA ON SUNDAY WITH ONLY SMALL CHANCES FOR RAIN. DRY WEATHER TO 
RETURN ON MONDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    46  51  32  54 / 100  60  30   0 
HARRISON AR       37  40  25  52 /  80  40  20   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    46  50  32  54 / 100  50  30   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     47  52  34  54 / 100  60  40   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  37  42  26  51 /  90  50  20   0 
MONTICELLO AR     49  54  35  54 / 100  70  50   0 
SEARCY AR         45  50  31  53 / 100  60  30   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      44  48  31  55 / 100  50  20   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   42  47  29  54 / 100  50  20   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

55/22






000 
FXUS64 KLZK 292058
AFDLZK

FOR MUCH OF THE OVERNIGHT HOURS...WITH THE STRONGEST AXIS OF LIFT TO 
MOVE EASTWARD WITH TIME. ALTHOUGH ANTECEDENT CONDITIONS ARE QUITE 
WET...EXPECTED NATURE OF PRECIPITATION /MAINLY STRATIFORM/...AND QPF 
DOES NOT SUPPORT A FLASH FLOOD WATCH. NEAR TERM CONDITIONS WILL BE 
CLOSELY MONITORED.

PRECIPITATION WILL DECREASE ON TUESDAY...AS THE STRONGER FORCING 
MOVES EASTWARD. ALL PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE CLEAR OF THE FORECAST 
AREA BY 01/06Z.

AFTER THE UPPER TROUGH EJECTS NORTHEAST...NEAR ZONAL FLOW WILL 
DEVELOP ACROSS MUCH OF THE U.S. DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...AS LOW LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE DEVELOPS IN THE 
REGION. 

&&

.LONG TERM...FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY
DRY WEATHER EXPECTED IN THE EARLY PART OF THE LONG TERM AS HIGH 
PRESSURE CONTINUES OVER THE AREA. NEXT STORM SYSTEM WILL AFFECT THE 
AREA ON SUNDAY WITH ONLY SMALL CHANCES FOR RAIN. DRY WEATHER TO 
RETURN ON MONDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    46  51  32  54 / 100  60  30   0 
HARRISON AR       37  40  25  52 /  80  40  20   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    46  50  32  54 / 100  50  30   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     47  52  34  54 / 100  60  40   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  37  42  26  51 /  90  50  20   0 
MONTICELLO AR     49  54  35  54 / 100  70  50   0 
SEARCY AR         45  50  31  53 / 100  60  30   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      44  48  31  55 / 100  50  20   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   42  47  29  54 / 100  50  20   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

55/22






257 
FXUS64 KLZK 291859 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
100 PM CST MON NOV 29 2004

.DISCUSSION...
SOME BREAKOUT IN THE CLOUDS SEEN IN THE EXTREME SOUTHEASTERN 
SECTIONS. HAVE RAISED MAXIMUM TEMPERATURES IN THOSE AREAS AS 
READINGS ARE WARMING UP NICELY. ALL UPDATES OUT.
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 1045 AM CST MON NOV 29 2004

RAIN CONTINUES TO HAVE A HARD TIME GETTING STARTED OVER THE 
SOUTHEASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. DECIDED TO LOWER POPS TO 
CHANCE CATEGORY FOR ABOUT THE SOUTHEASTERN THIRD FOR THIS AFTERNOON. 
LEFT CATEGORICAL REST OF THE AREA FOR THE AFTERNOON. RAISED MAXIMUM 
TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES FOR THIS AFTERNOON...ESPECIALLY OVER THE 
SOUTHEAST WHERE RAIN HAS NOT HELD READINGS DOWN. 

ISSUED AT 820 AM CST MON NOV 29 2004 

RAIN SOMEWHAT SLOW TO DEVELOP OVER THE SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...SO HAVE UPDATED FORECASTS TO SHOW RAIN 
SLOWLY INCREASING OVER THOSE AREAS AS THE DAY PROGRESSES. 
UNQUALIFIED POPS WILL CONTINUE OVER THE NORTH AS PREVIOUS FORECAST 
STATED. ALL UPDATES GONE.

ISSUED AT 400 AM CST MON NOV 29 2004

UPPER TROF MOVING OUT OF THE SOUTHWESTERN U.S. TOWARD THE AREA. 
RAIN HAS REACHED ACROSS THE WESTERN HALF OF THE AREA AT ISSUE TIME
AND SHOULD SLOWLY SPREAD TO THE EAST AS THE LOWER LEVELS OF THE
ATMOSPHERE SATURATE. MOISTURE WILL INCREASE ACROSS THE AREA TODAY
AND WARM ADVECTION WILL HELP GET RAIN GOING IN MOST ALL AREAS. 
THIS WILL CONTINUE OFF AND ON THROUGH TUESDAY. A WEAK FRONT MAY 
MOVE THROUGH TONIGHT INTO TUESDAY WHICH WILL BACK WINDS AT LOWER 
LEVELS AND SET UP MORE OF AN OVERRUNNING SITUATION. OVERALL 
INSTABILITY WILL BE LACKING BUT SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY MAY 
BE SEEN ESPECIALLY IN THE SOUTH. WILL GO WITH STEADY STRATIFORM 
RAIN FOR THE AREA WITH ISOLATED THUNDER IN THE SOUTH THIS 
AFTERNOON INTO TUESDAY. RATHER HEAVY RAINFALL ACCUMULATIONS ARE
LIKELY WITH MANY AREAS GETTING AN INCH OR TWO...BUT IT LOOKS LIKE IT
WILL BE SPREAD OUT OVER A LONG PERIOD OF TIME. RAINFALL RATES
FALL SHORT OF FLASH FLOOD GUIDANCE...SO WILL NOT ISSUE A WATCH AT
THIS TIME. WILL HAVE 100 PERCENT POPS IN ALL AREAS TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...ALTHOUGH POPS WILL START OUT LOWER IN THE EAST THIS
MORNING. WILL GO WITH 90 PERCENT POPS ACROSS THE BOARD FOR TUESDAY
MORNING...THEN DECREASE FROM THE WEST DURING THE AFTERNOON AS A
DRY SLOT MOVES INTO THE AREA. TIMING OF THIS STILL A LITTLE 
QUESTIONABLE. SHOULD SEE LITTLE VARIATION IN TEMPERATURE THROUGH
TUESDAY. DRIER AIR PUNCHES IN FOR TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY.
KEPT SOME SMALL POPS FOR EARLY TUESDAY NIGHT IN CASE THE UPPER
TROF LIFTS OUT SLOWER THAN EXPECTED OR THE DRY SLOT IS SLOWER
DEVELOPING THEN HAVE NO POPS AFTER MIDNIGHT TUESDAY NIGHT. THE
CLEAR SKIES AND DRIER AIR SHOULD RESULT IN MINS INTO THE 30S IN
MOST AREAS AND 20S IN THE NORTH. WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY LOOK
LIKE THEY WILL BE MOSTLY SUNNY DAYS RIGHT NOW ALTHOUGH BACK TO 
BACK MOSTLY SUNNY DAYS HAS BEEN UNHEARD OF AROUND HERE RECENTLY.   

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE IN CONTROL THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL...WITH COOL OVERNIGHT READINGS. 
UPPER FLOW SWITCHES FROM NORTHWEST TO SOUTHWEST DURING THE WEEKEND 
IN RESPONSE TO UPPER LOW FORMING IN THE FOUR CORNERS. FOR NOW...HAVE 
INCLUDED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SUNDAY. 

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

22






ISSUED AT 400 AM CST MON NOV 29 2004

UPPER TROF MOVING OUT OF THE SOUTHWESTERN U.S. TOWARD THE AREA. 
RAIN HAS REACHED ACROSS THE WESTERN HALF OF THE AREA AT ISSUE TIME
AND SHOULD SLOWLY SPREAD TO THE EAST AS THE LOWER LEVELS OF THE
ATMOSPHERE SATURATE. MOISTURE WILL INCREASE ACROSS THE AREA TODAY
AND WARM ADVECTION WILL HELP GET RAIN GOING IN MOST ALL AREAS.

MOVE THROUGH TONIGHT INTO TUESDAY WHICH WILL BACK WINDS AT LOWER

RAIN FOR THE AREA WITH ISOLATED THUNDER IN THE SOUTH THIS 
AFTERNOON INTO TUESDAY. RATHER HEAVY RAINFALL ACCUMULATIONS ARE

FALL SHORT OF FLASH FLOOD GUIDANCE...SO WILL NOT ISSUE A WATCH AT

MORNING. WILL GO WITH 90 PERCENT POPS ACROSS THE BOARD FOR TUESDAY
MORNING...THEN DECREASE FROM THE WEST DURING THE AFTERNOON AS A
DRY SLOT MOVES INTO THE AREA. TIMING OF THIS STILL A LITTLE 
QUESTIONABLE. SHOULD SEE LITTLE VARIATION IN TEMPERATURE THROUGH
TUESDAY. DRIER AIR PUNCHES IN FOR TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY.
KEPT SOME SMALL POPS FOR EARLY TUESDAY NIGHT IN CASE THE UPPER
TROF LIFTS OUT SLOWER THAN EXPECTED OR THE DRY SLOT IS SLOWER
DEVELOPING THEN HAVE NO POPS AFTER MIDNIGHT TUESDAY NIGHT. THE
CLEAR SKIES AND DRIER AIR SHOULD RESULT IN MINS INTO THE 30S IN

QUESTIONABLE. SHOULD SEE LITTLE VARIATION IN TEMPERATURE THROUGH
TUESDAY. DRIER AIR PUNCHES IN FOR TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY.
KEPT SOME SMALL POPS FOR EARLY TUESDAY NIGHT IN CASE THE UPPER
TROF LIFTS OUT SLOWER THAN EXPECTED OR THE DRY SLOT IS SLOWER
DEVELOPING THEN HAVE NO POPS AFTER MIDNIGHT TUESDAY NIGHT. THE
CLEAR SKIES AND DRIER AIR SHOULD RESULT IN MINS INTO THE 30S IN
MOST AREAS AND 20S IN THE NORTH. WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY LOOK
LIKE THEY WILL BE MOSTLY SUNNY DAYS RIGHT NOW ALTHOUGH BACK TO 
BACK MOSTLY SUNNY DAYS HAS BEEN UNHEARD OF AROUND HERE RECENTLY.   

&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE IN CONTROL THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL...WITH COOL OVERNIGHT READINGS. 
UPPER FLOW SWITCHES FROM NORTHWEST TO SOUTHWEST DURING THE WEEKEND 
IN RESPONSE TO UPPER LOW FORMING IN THE FOUR CORNERS. FOR NOW...HAVE 
INCLUDED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SUNDAY. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    51  46  51  34 / 100 100  90  30 
HARRISON AR       46  37  43  27 / 100 100  90  20 
HOT SPRINGS AR    52  47  51  34 / 100 100  90  30 
PINE BLUFF AR     53  48  53  35 / 100 100  90  40 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  46  37  44  27 / 100 100  90  20 
MONTICELLO AR     55  50  55  37 / 100 100  90  50 
SEARCY AR         49  43  49  30 / 100 100  90  30 
MOUNT IDA AR      52  46  51  34 / 100 100  90  20 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   49  42  48  30 / 100 100  90  20 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

29/58


000 
FXUS64 KLZK 290912
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
400 AM CST MON NOV 29 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY
UPPER TROF MOVING OUT OF THE SOUTHWESTERN U.S. TOWARD THE AREA. 
RAIN HAS REACHED ACROSS THE WESTERN HALF OF THE AREA AT ISSUE TIME
AND SHOULD SLOWLY SPREAD TO THE EAST AS THE LOWER LEVELS OF THE
ATMOSPHERE SATURATE. MOISTURE WILL INCREASE ACROSS THE AREA TODAY
AND WARM ADVECTION WILL HELP GET RAIN GOING IN MOST ALL AREAS. 
THIS WILL CONTINUE OFF AND ON THROUGH TUESDAY. A WEAK FRONT MAY 
MOVE THROUGH TONIGHT INTO TUESDAY WHICH WILL BACK WINDS AT LOWER 
LEVELS AND SET UP MORE OF AN OVERRUNNING SITUATION. OVERALL 
INSTABILITY WILL BE LACKING BUT SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY MAY 
BE SEEN ESPECIALLY IN THE SOUTH. WILL GO WITH STEADY STRATIFORM 
RAIN FOR THE AREA WITH ISOLATED THUNDER IN THE SOUTH THIS 
AFTERNOON INTO TUESDAY. RATHER HEAVY RAINFALL ACCUMULATIONS ARE
LIKELY WITH MANY AREAS GETTING AN INCH OR TWO...BUT IT LOOKS LIKE IT
WILL BE SPREAD OUT OVER A LONG PERIOD OF TIME. RAINFALL RATES
FALL SHORT OF FLASH FLOOD GUIDANCE...SO WILL NOT ISSUE A WATCH AT
THIS TIME. WILL HAVE 100 PERCENT POPS IN ALL AREAS TODAY AND 
TONIGHT...ALTHOUGH POPS WILL START OUT LOWER IN THE EAST THIS
MORNING. WILL GO WITH 90 PERCENT POPS ACROSS THE BOARD FOR TUESDAY
MORNING...THEN DECREASE FROM THE WEST DURING THE AFTERNOON AS A
DRY SLOT MOVES INTO THE AREA. TIMING OF THIS STILL A LITTLE 
QUESTIONABLE. SHOULD SEE LITTLE VARIATION IN TEMPERATURE THROUGH
TUESDAY. DRIER AIR PUNCHES IN FOR TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY.
KEPT SOME SMALL POPS FOR EARLY TUESDAY NIGHT IN CASE THE UPPER
TROF LIFTS OUT SLOWER THAN EXPECTED OR THE DRY SLOT IS SLOWER
DEVELOPING THEN HAVE NO POPS AFTER MIDNIGHT TUESDAY NIGHT. THE
CLEAR SKIES AND DRIER AIR SHOULD RESULT IN MINS INTO THE 30S IN
MOST AREAS AND 20S IN THE NORTH. WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY LOOK
LIKE THEY WILL BE MOSTLY SUNNY DAYS RIGHT NOW ALTHOUGH BACK TO 
BACK MOSTLY SUNNY DAYS HAS BEEN UNHEARD OF AROUND HERE RECENTLY.   

&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE IN CONTROL THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL...WITH COOL OVERNIGHT READINGS. 
UPPER FLOW SWITCHES FROM NORTHWEST TO SOUTHWEST DURING THE WEEKEND 
IN RESPONSE TO UPPER LOW FORMING IN THE FOUR CORNERS. FOR NOW...HAVE 
INCLUDED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR SUNDAY. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    51  46  51  34 / 100 100  90  30 
HARRISON AR       46  37  43  27 / 100 100  90  20 
HOT SPRINGS AR    52  47  51  34 / 100 100  90  30 
PINE BLUFF AR     53  48  53  35 / 100 100  90  40 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  46  37  44  27 / 100 100  90  20 
MONTICELLO AR     55  50  55  37 / 100 100  90  50 
SEARCY AR         49  43  49  30 / 100 100  90  30 
MOUNT IDA AR      52  46  51  34 / 100 100  90  20 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   49  42  48  30 / 100 100  90  20

29/58








782 
FXUS64 KLZK 282026
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
221 PM CST SUN NOV 28 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...
MODELS SHOWING A FEW DIFFERENCES TODAY OVER THE PAST FEW DAYS WITH 
BOTH THE GFS AND ETA COMING BACK WEAKER WITH THE DEVELOPING SYSTEM 
AND QUICKER WITH MOVING IT OUT TUESDAY NIGHT. ETA CHANGES APPEAR TO 
BE MORE DRASTIC WHICH WOULD LEND SUPPORT TO THE GFS. OF GREATER 
CONCERN IS THE WEDGE OF DRY AIR BELOW 700MB BOTH MODELS ARE SHOWING. 
COLUMN DOES NOT REALLY SATURATE UNTIL MID MORNING. ONLY REAL EFFECT 
WOULD BE TO HOLD OFF THE STEADIER RAIN UNTIL LATER IN THE DAY. WITH 
HEAVIER RAIN NOT EXPECTED UNTIL LATER IN THE DAY AND WITH FLASH 
FLOOD GUIDANCE AROUND 3 INCHES PER SIX HOURS...WILL HOLD OFF ON ANY 
HIGHLIGHTS FOR NOW.

HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO SLIP OFF TO THE EAST AND CLOUDS COMING IN 
A LITTLE FASTER THAN SCHEDULED. WATER VAPOR IMAGERY CONTINUES TO 
SHOW THE MAIN PLAYERS QUITE CLEARLY THIS AFTERNOON. PLUME OF PACIFIC 
MOISTURE CONTINUES TO STREAM INTO THE AREA ON THE WESTERN PERIPHERY 
OF AN UPPER LEVEL HIGH SITTING IN THE GULF. PWAT VALUES FORECAST TO 
RISE TONIGHT AND BE BETWEEN 1 AND 1/5 INCHES THROUGHOUT THE EVENT. 
WV IMAGERY ALSO SHOWING STRONG WAVE MOVING DOWN THE WEST COAST. 
FEATURE WILL EVENTUALLY CLOSE OFF INTO AN UPPER LOW OVER THE FOUR 
CORNERS WITH POSITIVELY TILTED TROF EXTENDING NORTHEAST FROM IT. 
ENTIRE SYSTEM IS FORECAST TO MOVE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN ROCKIES AND 
EVENTUALLY INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS. SYSTEM WILL BE SHEARING OUT THE 
WHOLE TIME WITH MAIN ENERGY PASSING WELL TO THE NORTH AND THE 
TRAILING END OF THE WEAKENING TROF AXIS MOVING OVER THE CWA TUESDAY 
NIGHT.

SURFACE LOW ALREADY STARTING TO SPIN UP OVER THE CENTRAL ROCKIES AND 
EXPECTED TO BE OVER SOUTHWEST OKLAHOMA BY MONDAY MORNING. WILL TAPER 
BACK THE POPS SOMEWHAT TONIGHT TO ACCOUNT FOR THE LOW LEVEL DRY AIR. 
WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY WITH INVERTED SURFACE TROF OVER THE AREA 
MONDAY. NOW EXPECTING AREA WIDE RAIN BY MID MORNING WHICH WILL 
CONTINUE INTO TUESDAY AS SURFACE LOW CRAWLS TO THE EAST. RAINFALL 
AMOUNTS DO NOT APPEAR TO BE OVERLY EXCESSIVE BUT A GENERAL 2 INCH 
RAINFALL SEEMS LIKELY. WIDESPREAD CONVECTION DOES NOT APPEAR LIKELY 
BUT SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY IS NOTED. COULD BE SOME LOCALLY 
HEAVIER AMOUNTS WITH GOOD LOW LEVEL FORCING.

SURFACE LOW PROGGED TO BE OVER EASTERN ARKANSAS EARLY TUESDAY WITH 
INVERTED TROF BEING SHUNTED INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. STILL PLENTY 
OF MOISTURE THROUGH LATE TUESDAY BUT RAIN SHOULD BEGIN TO BREAK UP 
OVER THE NORTHWEST LATE WITH MODELS NOW QUICKER MOVING THE SYSTEM 
OUT. WILL END STEADY RAIN OVER THE NORTHWEST LATE TUESDAY AND AREA 
WIDE BY MIDNIGHT WEDNESDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS 
EXPANDS EASTWARD.

REALLY NO COLD AIR IN SIGHT UNTIL AFTER THE TROF AXIS PASSES AND BY 
EVEN THEN MOISTURE IS LONG GONE. EVENT WILL BE ALL LIQUID ACROSS THE 
CWA. HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THE END OF 
THE PERIOD FOR DRY CONDITIONS. TEMPERATURES WILL AVERAGE CLOSE TO 
NORMAL ALTHOUGH EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER AND RAIN WILL KEEP TEMPS DOWN 
EARLY IN THE PERIOD. WILL GO WITH A BLEND OF FWC/MAV NUMBERS THIS 
AFTERNOON. 
&&

.LONG TERM...FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...
ASIDE FROM A WEAK SHORTWAVE WHICH COULD POSSIBLY BRING ABOUT A BRIEF 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS ON SATURDAY...THE WEATHER WILL BE RATHER 
UNEVENTFUL AND QUITE DRY THROUGH THE PERIOD. TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
NEAR NORMAL DURING THESE THREE DAYS.(38)    
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    44  51  46  51 /  60  90  90  80 
HARRISON AR       40  46  37  42 /  70  90  90  80 
HOT SPRINGS AR    46  52  47  51 /  60  90  90  80 
PINE BLUFF AR     45  53  48  53 /  50  90  90  80 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  39  46  37  43 /  70  90  90  80 
MONTICELLO AR     46  55  50  55 /  50  90  90  80 
SEARCY AR         43  49  43  49 /  60  90  90  80 
MOUNT IDA AR      46  52  46  51 /  70  90  90  80 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   44  49  42  48 /  70  90  90  80 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&


480 
FXUS64 KLZK 281818
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1215 PM CST SUN NOV 28 2004

.DISCUSSION...
QUICK UPDATE NEEDED THIS AFTERNOON AS CLOUDS COMING IN A LITTLE 
FASTER THAN EXPECTED. WILL UPDATE THE GRIDS/ZONES AND GO MOSTLY 
CLOUDY. ENOUGH DRY AIR IN THE LOW LEVELS WILL KEEP ANY PRECIP FROM 
FALLING. TEMPS WILL ALSO NEED TO BE LOWERED A FEW DEGREES WITH MORE 
CLOUD COVER.
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 422 AM CST SUN NOV 28 2004

DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...BUT THAT 
WILL BE SHORT-LIVED. STRONG H5 TROF APPROACHING FROM THE WEST WILL 
BRING INCREASING CLOUDS OVER THE AREA TODAY...AND CHANCES OF RAIN 
BACK IN THE FORECAST FOR TONIGHT. POPS WILL BE GENERALLY CATEGORICAL 
ON MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. MOISTURE BEGINS TO LESSEN FROM THE 
NORTHWEST ON TUESDAY...BUT POPS WILL STILL REMAIN HIGH...WITH LIKELY 
IN THE NORTHWEST AND CATEGORICAL MOST OTHER AREAS. CHANCES OF RAIN 
WILL DECREASE FURTHER FROM NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST TUESDAY NIGHT. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR OR A LITTLE BELOW NORMAL TODAY...THEN WILL 
BE BELOW NORMAL REST OF THE SHORT TERM PERIOD.  

NO MAJOR CHANGES TO FORECAST AT THIS TIME. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE IN 
CONTROL AFTER SYSTEM EXITS THE STATE WEDNESDAY. UPPER TROUGH WILL 
MOVE INTO THE REGION SATURDAY...SO INTRODUCED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK.

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

ON MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. MOISTURE BEGINS TO LESSEN FROM THE 
NORTHWEST ON TUESDAY...BUT POPS WILL STILL REMAIN HIGH...WITH LIKELY 
IN THE NORTHWEST AND CATEGORICAL MOST OTHER AREAS. CHANCES OF RAIN 
WILL DECREASE FURTHER FROM NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST TUESDAY NIGHT. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR OR A LITTLE BELOW NORMAL TODAY...THEN WILL 
BE BELOW NORMAL REST OF THE SHORT TERM PERIOD.  
&&

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY
NO MAJOR CHANGES TO FORECAST AT THIS TIME. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE IN 
CONTROL AFTER SYSTEM EXITS THE STATE WEDNESDAY. UPPER TROUGH WILL 
MOVE INTO THE REGION SATURDAY...SO INTRODUCED A SLIGHT CHANCE POP. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    54  43  53  47 /  10  60  80  80 
HARRISON AR       50  39  48  38 /  10  70  80  60 
HOT SPRINGS AR    55  45  54  48 /  10  70  80  80 
PINE BLUFF AR     55  44  55  49 /  10  60  80  90 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  49  38  48  38 /  10  70  80  70 
MONTICELLO AR     55  45  57  51 /  10  60  90  90 
SEARCY AR         53  42  51  44 /  10  60  80  80 
MOUNT IDA AR      55  45  54  47 /  10  70  80  70 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   54  43  51  43 /  10  70  80  70 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

22/58






275 
FXUS64 KLZK 280348
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
944 PM CST SAT NOV 27 2004

.DISCUSSION...
WILL ISSUE A MINOR UPDATE FOR LOWERING TEMPERATURE TRENDS BASED ON 
CURRENT OBSERVATIONS. TEMPERATURES IN THE NORTH AND WEST FELL 
QUICKLY THIS EVENING SINCE THE WINDS HAVE SETTLED DOWN IN THOSE 
AREAS. HIGH PRESSURE IS CURRENTLY CENTERED OVER EASTERN OKLAHOMA AND 
WILL MOVE EAST INTO ARKANSAS TONIGHT. THIS WILL KEEP SKIES MOSTLY 
CLEAR OVERNIGHT. SATELLITE IMAGES SHOW CLOUDS TRYING TO MOVE INTO 
ARKANSAS BUT ARE DISSIPATING ONCE THEY ENCOUNTER THE AREA OF HIGH 
PRESSURE. WILL KEEP SKIES MOSTLY CLEAR OVERNIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
MOVE OFF TO THE EAST ON SUNDAY AND WILL ALLOW THE NEXT STORM SYSTEM 
TO MOVE INTO THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT. 
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 159 PM CST SAT NOV 27 2004

SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...
MODELS CONTINUE THEIR RECENT ADVERTISEMENT OF A VERY ACTIVE SOUTHERN 
STREAM AND A POSSIBLE SIGNIFICANT RAIN EVENT FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK AS 
THE SOUTHWEST UPPER LOW KICKS OUT. ALL THE MODELS ARE TRENDING 
FASTER WITH THIS SYSTEM WITH THE ETA THE QUICKEST. GFS NOT AS QUICK 
EITHER BUT IT IS ALSO THE STRONGER SOLUTION. I STILL FEEL IT MAY BE 
A TAD UNDERDONE WITH GOOD OVERRRUNING PATTERN DEVELOPING IN SPITE OF 
THE MODEL QPFS BACKING OFF SOMEWHAT. STILL FEEL LIKE THE GFS IS THE 
WAY TO GO AND WILL LEAN IN ITS DIRECTION.

LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD FRONT THAT MOVED THROUGH AROUND 
LUNCH TIME THIS AFTERNOON WELL EAST OF THE AREA. COLD AIR ADVECTION 
PATTERN PREVENTED TEMPERATURES FROM RISING VERY MUCH. GUSTY 
NORTHWEST WINDS WILL SLOWLY DIMINISH AFTER SUNSET. CURRENT LAKE WIND 
ADVISORY SET TO EXPIRE AT 6 PM AND SEE NO REASON TO EXTEND IT.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD ACROSS THE REGION OVERNIGHT BRINGING CLEAR 
SKIES AND CHILLY READINGS. OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL NOT BOTTOM OUT 
COMPLETELY AS MODELS BRING INCREASING MID TO HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE IN 
ADVANCE OF THE NEXT SYSTEM. MOISTURE WILL NOT MAKE IT TO PARTS OF 
THE NORTH AND WIDESPREAD BELOW FREEZING TEMPS EXPECTED HERE.

WAVE THAT WILL EVENTUALLY CARVE OUT THE UPPER LOW OVER THE SOUTHWEST 
CONUS CLEARLY SEEN ON WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SLIDING DOWN THE WEST 
COAST. WAVE EXPECTED TO DIVE UNDER THE WESTERN CONUS TROF AND CLOSE 
OFF THE UPPER LOW NEAR THE FOUR CORNERS BY EARLY MONDAY. SURFACE 
HIGH IN TOP OF US SUNDAY MORNING WILL MOVE TO THE EAST WITH SOUTHERLY
FLOW RETURNING. AS TROF BEGINS TO SHARPEN OUT WEST...WEAK RIDGING 
RETURNS OVER THE SOUTHEAST CONUS. WITH RESULTANT SOUTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT...ABUNDANT MOISTURE SHOULD BE PULLED IN OVER THE AREA. WILL 
LEAVE PRECIPITATION OUT FOR SUNDAY.

SURFACE LOW SPINS UP OVER EASTERN NEW MEXICO LATE SUNDAY. WARM 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY LOCATED OVER THE SOUTHERN PART OF THE STATE WITH 
INVERTED SURFACE TROF IN PLACE BY MONDAY MORNING. WITH EVOLUTION OF 
SYSTEM FASTER...WILL INCREASE POPS TO LIKELY SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
ADVANCE THEM EASTWARD OVERNIGHT. CATEGORICAL POPS AREA WIDE BY MID 
MORNING MONDAY. RAIN TO CONTINUE MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY WITH 
SURFACE LOW PASSING TO THE SOUTH OF THE STATE AND OVERRRUNING 
PATTERN CONTINUING. PLACEMENT OF THE PARENT LOW WOULD PRECLUDE MUCH 
IN THE WAY OF THUNDER AS WHAT INSTABILITY EXISTS IS ELEVATED. 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN A VERY GOOD POSSIBILITY THROUGH MID DAY TUESDAY 
AS PWATS INCREASE TO NEAR 2 INCHES WITH UPPER HIGH IN THE GULF 
PUMPING IN MOISTURE. SUSPECT FLASH FLOOD WATCHES ARE FORTH COMING. 

LOW AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT FINALLY MOVE INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
LATE TUESDAY. SOME DRIER AIR DOES TRIES TO MOVE INTO THE EXTREME 
NORTH LATE TUESDAY. DRY AIR MOVES SOUTH TUESDAY NIGHT AND WILL TREND 
POPS DOWN THROUGH THE NIGHT...REMOVING IT FROM THE SOUTHEAST EARLY 
WEDNESDAY MORNING. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT.   

CONCERNING TEMPERATURES...AFTER A PLEASANT DAY SUNDAY...ABUNDANT 
CLOUD COVER THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES BELOW 
NORMAL. UPPER LOW INITIALLY OVER THE SOUTHWEST EVOLVES INTO AN 
ELONGATED TROF THAT SWEEPS THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. COLDER AIR DOES 
COME BACK INTO THE AREA IN ITS WAKE BUT MOISTURE WILL BE LACKING AT 
THAT TIME SO NO WINTERY PRECIPITATION IS EXPECTED. WILL GO WITH A 
BLEND OF THE WARMER MAV NUMBERS AND THE COOLER FWC NUMBERS THIS 
AFTERNOON.   

BY EARLY THURSDAY...A DRY AIR MASS WILL PREVAIL STATEWIDE WITH A 
NEARLY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT...AND EVEN DRIER AIR OUT WEST HEADED TOWARDS 
ARKANSAS. BY FRIDAY NIGHT...AN AREA OF SOMEWHAT HIGHER MOISTURE 
MAKES IT INTO THE SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF ARKANSAS...WITH MOISTURE 
INCREASING BY SATURDAY MORNING OVER MAINLY THE SOUTHERN HALF...YET 
MEAN RH WILL STILL BE ON THE LOW SIDE. A SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT BY 
LATE SUNDAY WILL BRING DRIER AIR INTO THE WESTERN SECTIONS. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL ON THURSDAY...FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. 
(38)
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

51






862 
FXUS64 KLZK 280005
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
604 PM CST SAT NOV 27 2004

.DISCUSSION...
WILL UPDATE FORECASTS TO REMOVE LAKE WIND ADVISORY.
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 159 PM CST SAT NOV 27 2004

SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...
MODELS CONTINUE THEIR RECENT ADVERTISEMENT OF A VERY ACTIVE SOUTHERN 
STREAM AND A POSSIBLE SIGNIFICANT RAIN EVENT FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK AS 
THE SOUTHWEST UPPER LOW KICKS OUT. ALL THE MODELS ARE TRENDING 
FASTER WITH THIS SYSTEM WITH THE ETA THE QUICKEST. GFS NOT AS QUICK 
EITHER BUT IT IS ALSO THE STRONGER SOLUTION. I STILL FEEL IT MAY BE 
A TAD UNDERDONE WITH GOOD OVERRRUNING PATTERN DEVELOPING IN SPITE OF 
THE MODEL QPFS BACKING OFF SOMEWHAT. STILL FEEL LIKE THE GFS IS THE 
WAY TO GO AND WILL LEAN IN ITS DIRECTION.

LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD FRONT THAT MOVED THROUGH AROUND 
LUNCH TIME THIS AFTERNOON WELL EAST OF THE AREA. COLD AIR ADVECTION 
PATTERN PREVENTED TEMPERATURES FROM RISING VERY MUCH. GUSTY 
NORTHWEST WINDS WILL SLOWLY DIMINISH AFTER SUNSET. CURRENT LAKE WIND 
ADVISORY SET TO EXPIRE AT 6 PM AND SEE NO REASON TO EXTEND IT.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD ACROSS THE REGION OVERNIGHT BRINGING CLEAR 
SKIES AND CHILLY READINGS. OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL NOT BOTTOM OUT 
COMPLETELY AS MODELS BRING INCREASING MID TO HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE IN 
ADVANCE OF THE NEXT SYSTEM. MOISTURE WILL NOT MAKE IT TO PARTS OF 
THE NORTH AND WIDESPREAD BELOW FREEZING TEMPS EXPECTED HERE.

WAVE THAT WILL EVENTUALLY CARVE OUT THE UPPER LOW OVER THE SOUTHWEST 
CONUS CLEARLY SEEN ON WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SLIDING DOWN THE WEST 
COAST. WAVE EXPECTED TO DIVE UNDER THE WESTERN CONUS TROF AND CLOSE 
OFF THE UPPER LOW NEAR THE FOUR CORNERS BY EARLY MONDAY. SURFACE 
HIGH IN TOP OF US SUNDAY MORNING WILL MOVE TO THE EAST WITH SOUTHERLY
FLOW RETURNING. AS TROF BEGINS TO SHARPEN OUT WEST...WEAK RIDGING 
RETURNS OVER THE SOUTHEAST CONUS. WITH RESULTANT SOUTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT...ABUNDANT MOISTURE SHOULD BE PULLED IN OVER THE AREA. WILL 
LEAVE PRECIPITATION OUT FOR SUNDAY.

SURFACE LOW SPINS UP OVER EASTERN NEW MEXICO LATE SUNDAY. WARM 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY LOCATED OVER THE SOUTHERN PART OF THE STATE WITH 
INVERTED SURFACE TROF IN PLACE BY MONDAY MORNING. WITH EVOLUTION OF 
SYSTEM FASTER...WILL INCREASE POPS TO LIKELY SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
ADVANCE THEM EASTWARD OVERNIGHT. CATEGORICAL POPS AREA WIDE BY MID 
MORNING MONDAY. RAIN TO CONTINUE MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY WITH 
SURFACE LOW PASSING TO THE SOUTH OF THE STATE AND OVERRRUNING 
PATTERN CONTINUING. PLACEMENT OF THE PARENT LOW WOULD PRECLUDE MUCH 
IN THE WAY OF THUNDER AS WHAT INSTABILITY EXISTS IS ELEVATED. 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN A VERY GOOD POSSIBILITY THROUGH MID DAY TUESDAY 
AS PWATS INCREASE TO NEAR 2 INCHES WITH UPPER HIGH IN THE GULF 
PUMPING IN MOISTURE. SUSPECT FLASH FLOOD WATCHES ARE FORTH COMING. 

LOW AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT FINALLY MOVE INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
LATE TUESDAY. SOME DRIER AIR DOES TRIES TO MOVE INTO THE EXTREME 
NORTH LATE TUESDAY. DRY AIR MOVES SOUTH TUESDAY NIGHT AND WILL TREND 
POPS DOWN THROUGH THE NIGHT...REMOVING IT FROM THE SOUTHEAST EARLY 
WEDNESDAY MORNING. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT.   

CONCERNING TEMPERATURES...AFTER A PLEASANT DAY SUNDAY...ABUNDANT 
CLOUD COVER THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES BELOW 
NORMAL. UPPER LOW INITIALLY OVER THE SOUTHWEST EVOLVES INTO AN 
ELONGATED TROF THAT SWEEPS THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. COLDER AIR DOES 
COME BACK INTO THE AREA IN ITS WAKE BUT MOISTURE WILL BE LACKING AT 
THAT TIME SO NO WINTERY PRECIPITATION IS EXPECTED. WILL GO WITH A 
BLEND OF THE WARMER MAV NUMBERS AND THE COOLER FWC NUMBERS THIS 
AFTERNOON.   
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...
BY EARLY THURSDAY...A DRY AIR MASS WILL PREVAIL STATEWIDE WITH A 
NEARLY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT...AND EVEN DRIER AIR OUT WEST HEADED TOWARDS 
ARKANSAS. BY FRIDAY NIGHT...AN AREA OF SOMEWHAT HIGHER MOISTURE 
MAKES IT INTO THE SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF ARKANSAS...WITH MOISTURE 
INCREASING BY SATURDAY MORNING OVER MAINLY THE SOUTHERN HALF...YET 
MEAN RH WILL STILL BE ON THE LOW SIDE. A SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT BY 
LATE SUNDAY WILL BRING DRIER AIR INTO THE WESTERN SECTIONS. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL ON THURSDAY...FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. 
(38)  
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    35  57  43  49 /   0  10  70  90 
HARRISON AR       28  52  39  46 /   0  10  70  90 
HOT SPRINGS AR    34  58  45  50 /   0  10  70  90 
PINE BLUFF AR     35  58  44  50 /   0  10  60  90 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  27  52  38  46 /   0  10  70  90 
MONTICELLO AR     34  59  45  50 /   0  10  60  90 
SEARCY AR         33  55  42  48 /   0  10  60  90 
MOUNT IDA AR      33  58  45  50 /   0  10  70  90 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   31  56  43  48 /   0  10  70  90 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

THE SOUTHWEST UPPER LOW KICKS OUT. ALL THE MODELS ARE TRENDING 
FASTER WITH THIS SYSTEM WITH THE ETA THE QUICKEST. GFS NOT AS QUICK 
EITHER BUT IT IS ALSO THE STRONGER SOLUTION. I STILL FEEL IT MAY BE 
A TAD UNDERDONE WITH GOOD OVERRRUNING PATTERN DEVELOPING IN SPITE OF 
THE MODEL QPFS BACKING OFF SOMEWHAT. STILL FEEL LIKE THE GFS IS THE 
WAY TO GO AND WILL LEAN IN ITS DIRECTION.

LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD FRONT THAT MOVED THROUGH AROUND 
LUNCH TIME THIS AFTERNOON WELL EAST OF THE AREA. COLD AIR ADVECTION 
PATTERN PREVENTED TEMPERATURES FROM RISING VERY MUCH. GUSTY 
NORTHWEST WINDS WILL SLOWLY DIMINISH AFTER SUNSET. CURRENT LAKE WIND 
ADVISORY SET TO EXPIRE AT 6 PM AND SEE NO REASON TO EXTEND IT.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD ACROSS THE REGION OVERNIGHT BRINGING CLEAR 
SKIES AND CHILLY READINGS. OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL NOT BOTTOM OUT 
COMPLETELY AS MODELS BRING INCREASING MID TO HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE IN 
ADVANCE OF THE NEXT SYSTEM. MOISTURE WILL NOT MAKE IT TO PARTS OF 
THE NORTH AND WIDESPREAD BELOW FREEZING TEMPS EXPECTED HERE.

WAVE THAT WILL EVENTUALLY CARVE OUT THE UPPER LOW OVER THE SOUTHWEST 
CONUS CLEARLY SEEN ON WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SLIDING DOWN THE WEST 
COAST. WAVE EXPECTED TO DIVE UNDER THE WESTERN CONUS TROF AND CLOSE 
OFF THE UPPER LOW NEAR THE FOUR CORNERS BY EARLY MONDAY. SURFACE 
HIGH IN TOP OF US SUNDAY MORNING WILL MOVE TO THE EAST WITH SOUTHERLY
FLOW RETURNING. AS TROF BEGINS TO SHARPEN OUT WEST...WEAK RIDGING 
RETURNS OVER THE SOUTHEAST CONUS. WITH RESULTANT SOUTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT...ABUNDANT MOISTURE SHOULD BE PULLED IN OVER THE AREA. WILL 
LEAVE PRECIPITATION OUT FOR SUNDAY.

SURFACE LOW SPINS UP OVER EASTERN NEW MEXICO LATE SUNDAY. WARM 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY LOCATED OVER THE SOUTHERN PART OF THE STATE WITH 
INVERTED SURFACE TROF IN PLACE BY MONDAY MORNING. WITH EVOLUTION OF 
SYSTEM FASTER...WILL INCREASE POPS TO LIKELY SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
ADVANCE THEM EASTWARD OVERNIGHT. CATEGORICAL POPS AREA WIDE BY MID 
MORNING MONDAY. RAIN TO CONTINUE MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY WITH 
SURFACE LOW PASSING TO THE SOUTH OF THE STATE AND OVERRRUNING 
PATTERN CONTINUING. PLACEMENT OF THE PARENT LOW WOULD PRECLUDE MUCH 
IN THE WAY OF THUNDER AS WHAT INSTABILITY EXISTS IS ELEVATED. 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN A VERY GOOD POSSIBILITY THROUGH MID DAY TUESDAY 
AS PWATS INCREASE TO NEAR 2 INCHES WITH UPPER HIGH IN THE GULF 
PUMPING IN MOISTURE. SUSPECT FLASH FLOOD WATCHES ARE FORTH COMING. 

LOW AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT FINALLY MOVE INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
LATE TUESDAY. SOME DRIER AIR DOES TRIES TO MOVE INTO THE EXTREME 
NORTH LATE TUESDAY. DRY AIR MOVES SOUTH TUESDAY NIGHT AND WILL TREND 
POPS DOWN THROUGH THE NIGHT...REMOVING IT FROM THE SOUTHEAST EARLY 
WEDNESDAY MORNING. HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT.   

CONCERNING TEMPERATURES...AFTER A PLEASANT DAY SUNDAY...ABUNDANT 
CLOUD COVER THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES BELOW 
NORMAL. UPPER LOW INITIALLY OVER THE SOUTHWEST EVOLVES INTO AN 
ELONGATED TROF THAT SWEEPS THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. COLDER AIR DOES 
COME BACK INTO THE AREA IN ITS WAKE BUT MOISTURE WILL BE LACKING AT 
THAT TIME SO NO WINTERY PRECIPITATION IS EXPECTED. WILL GO WITH A 
BLEND OF THE WARMER MAV NUMBERS AND THE COOLER FWC NUMBERS THIS 
AFTERNOON.   
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...
BY EARLY THURSDAY...A DRY AIR MASS WILL PREVAIL STATEWIDE WITH A 
NEARLY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT...AND EVEN DRIER AIR OUT WEST HEADED TOWARDS 
ARKANSAS. BY FRIDAY NIGHT...AN AREA OF SOMEWHAT HIGHER MOISTURE 
MAKES IT INTO THE SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF ARKANSAS...WITH MOISTURE 
INCREASING BY SATURDAY MORNING OVER MAINLY THE SOUTHERN HALF...YET 
MEAN RH WILL STILL BE ON THE LOW SIDE. A SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT BY 
LATE SUNDAY WILL BRING DRIER AIR INTO THE WESTERN SECTIONS. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL ON THURSDAY...FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. 
(38)  
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    35  57  43  49 /   0  10  70  90 
HARRISON AR       28  52  39  46 /   0  10  70  90 
HOT SPRINGS AR    34  58  45  50 /   0  10  70  90 
PINE BLUFF AR     35  58  44  50 /   0  10  60  90 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  27  52  38  46 /   0  10  70  90 
MONTICELLO AR     34  59  45  50 /   0  10  60  90 
SEARCY AR         33  55  42  48 /   0  10  60  90 
MOUNT IDA AR      33  58  45  50 /   0  10  70  90 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   31  56  43  48 /   0  10  70  90 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

56/38





000 
FXUS64 KLZK 272001
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
159 PM CST SAT NOV 27 2004

SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...
MODELS CONTINUE THEIR RECENT ADVERTISEMENT OF A VERY ACTIVE SOUTHERN 
STREAM AND A POSSIBLE SIGNIFICANT RAIN EVENT FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK AS 
THE SOUTHWEST UPPER LOW KICKS OUT. ALL THE MODELS ARE TRENDING 
FASTER WITH THIS SYSTEM WITH THE ETA THE QUICKEST. GFS NOT AS QUICK 
EITHER BUT IT IS ALSO THE STRONGER SOLUTION. I STILL FEEL IT MAY BE 
A TAD UNDERDONE WITH GOOD OVERRRUNING PATTERN DEVELOPING IN SPITE OF 
THE MODEL QPFS BACKING OFF SOMEWHAT. STILL FEEL LIKE THE GFS IS THE 
WAY TO GO AND WILL LEAN IN ITS DIRECTION.

LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD FRONT THAT MOVED THROUGH AROUND 
LUNCH TIME THIS AFTERNOON WELL EAST OF THE AREA. COLD AIR ADVECTION 
PATTERN PREVENTED TEMPERATURES FROM RISING VERY MUCH. GUSTY 
NORTHWEST WINDS WILL SLOWLY DIMINISH AFTER SUNSET. CURRENT LAKE WIND 
ADVISORY SET TO EXPIRE AT 6 PM AND SEE NO REASON TO EXTEND IT.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD ACROSS THE REGION OVERNIGHT BRINGING CLEAR 
SKIES AND CHILLY READINGS. OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL NOT BOTTOM OUT 
COMPLETELY AS MODELS BRING INCREASING MID TO HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE IN 
ADVANCE OF THE NEXT SYSTEM. MOISTURE WILL NOT MAKE IT TO PARTS OF 
THE NORTH AND WIDESPREAD BELOW FREEZING TEMPS EXPECTED HERE.

WAVE THAT WILL EVENTUALLY CARVE OUT THE UPPER LOW OVER THE SOUTHWEST 
CONUS CLEARLY SEEN ON WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SLIDING DOWN THE WEST 
COAST. WAVE EXPECTED TO DIVE UNDER THE WESTERN CONUS TROF AND CLOSE 
OFF THE UPPER LOW NEAR THE FOUR CORNERS BY EARLY MONDAY. SURFACE

RETURNS OVER THE SOUTHEAST CONUS. WITH RESULTANT SOUTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT...ABUNDANT MOISTURE SHOULD BE PULLED IN OVER THE AREA. WILL 
LEAVE PRECIPITATION OUT FOR SUNDAY.

INVERTED SURFACE TROF IN PLACE BY MONDAY MORNING. WITH EVOLUTION OF 
SYSTEM FASTER...WILL INCREASE POPS TO LIKELY SUNDAY NIGHT AND

MORNING MONDAY. RAIN TO CONTINUE MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY WITH 
SURFACE LOW PASSING TO THE SOUTH OF THE STATE AND OVERRRUNING 
PATTERN CONTINUING. PLACEMENT OF THE PARENT LOW WOULD PRECLUDE MUCH 
IN THE WAY OF THUNDER AS WHAT INSTABILITY EXISTS IS ELEVATED. 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAIN A VERY GOOD POSSIBILITY THROUGH MID DAY TUESDAY 
AS PWATS INCREASE TO NEAR 2 INCHES WITH UPPER HIGH IN THE GULF 
PUMPING IN MOISTURE. SUSPECT FLASH FLOOD WATCHES ARE FORTH COMING.



911 
FXUS64 KLZK 271622
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1010 AM CST SAT NOV 27 2004

.DISCUSSION...
UPDATE ON THE WAY THIS MORNING. LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COLD 
FRONT JUST TO THE EAST OF THE METROPOLITAN AREA. WINDS HAVE SHIFTED 
TO THE NORTHWEST OVER THE WESTERN PART OF THE STATE AND ARE ALREADY 
INCREASING WITH TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT COMING IN. LAKE WIND 
ADVISORY WILL CONTINUE. 

JUST A FEW SHOWERS OVER THE FAR EASTERN PART OF THE CWA AND RAPIDLY 
MOVING EASTWARD. EXPECTING JUST A FEW SCATTERED SHOWERS TO REMAIN 
THROUGH NOON AND THAT SHOULD TAKE CARE OF IT. SKIES REMAIN CLOUDY 
EXCEPT FOR A FEW BREAKS WITH CLEARING LINE JUST TO THE WEST OF THE 
STATE. LATEST MESO ETA CONTINUES TO SHOW CLEARING SKIES THIS 
AFTERNOON AS DRIER AIR WORKS EAST. 

TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE TO BE PROBLEMATIC. TEMPERATURES ALREADY 
STARTING TO FALL OVER THE NORTHWEST AS COLD AIR ADVECTION PATTERN 
GETS ESTABLISHED. BELIEVE MOST AREAS HAVE ALREADY ACHIEVED THEIR 
DAYTIME MAXES AND WILL GO WITH SLOWLY FALLING OR STEADY TEMPS THE 
REST OF THE DAY.

OTHER UPDATES WILL BE TO CLEAN UP WORDING AND TREND POPS DOWNWARD. 
NEW SUITE OF PRODUCTS OUT SHORTLY.
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...ISSUED AT 400 AM CST SAT NOV 27 2004

SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS WIDESPREAD THIS MORNING...BUT WILL BE CONFINED 
TO NORTHERN/EASTERN ARKANSAS TOWARD DAWN AND WILL EXIT THE STATE TO 
EAST BY LUNCHTIME. SOME SMALL HAIL STILL POSSIBLE WITH STORMS THIS 
MORNING...WITH LOW WET BULB ZERO LEVELS. 

STORM SYSTEM WILL DRAG COLD FRONT THROUGH ARKANSAS THIS 
MORNING...WITH GUSTY NORTHWEST WINDS TO FOLLOW THIS AFTERNOON. WILL 
ISSUE LAKE WIND ADVISORY FOR ENTIRE COUNTY WARNING AREA AS A 
RESULT. 

SKY WILL CLEAR THIS AFTERNOON...WITH WINDS DIMINISHING TONIGHT AND 
COOLER TEMPERATURES NOTED. BELOW FREEZING TEMPERATURES TONIGHT IN 
PARTS OF THE NORTH/WEST...BUT WIDESPREAD FREEZE NOT 
ANTICIPATED.

FOR THE REST OF THE SHORT TERM...SUNDAY WILL START OFF 
TRANQUIL...BUT A NEW STORM SYSTEM WILL APPROACH FROM THE PLAINS. 
APPEARS THAT CLOUDS WILL INCREASE SUNDAY AFTERNOON...WITH RAIN 
BECOMING LIKELY IN WESTERN ARKANSAS SUNDAY NIGHT. 

RAIN IN THE FORECAST IN MUCH OF THE STATE MONDAY/TUESDAY. LOOKS LIKE 
TRACK OF STORM SYSTEM WILL BE MAINLY SOUTH OF THE REGION...KEEPING 
ARKANSAS COOL WITH THUNDER MAINLY CONFINED TO GULF COAST REGION. 
(46)            

HAVE MADE A FEW UPDATES TO FORECASTS IN THIS PERIOD...MAINLY TO 
BETTER DEFINE PRECIPITATION TIMING EARLY THIS PERIOD. NEAR NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES WILL PREVAIL DURING THIS PERIOD. (55) 

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

FXUS64 KLZK 270327 AAA
AFDLZK
ARZ001>075-271030-

STATE FORECAST FOR ARKANSAS...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
926 PM CST FRI NOV 26 2004

.OVERNIGHT...CLOUDY AND BREEZY WITH SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. LOWS 
IN THE MID 40S TO MID 50S. 
.SATURDAY...A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EARLY...OTHERWISE 
CLEARING. BREEZY. HIGHS IN THE LOWER 50S TO MID 60S. 
.SATURDAY NIGHT...CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY. LOWS IN THE UPPER 20S TO 
UPPER 30S.  
.SUNDAY...PARTLY CLOUDY. HIGHS IN THE 50S. 
.SUNDAY NIGHT...INCREASING CLOUDS WITH INCREASING CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS. LOWS IN THE UPPER 30S TO MID 40S.

.EXTENDED FORECAST...
.MONDAY...MOSTLY CLOUDY. THUNDERSTORMS BECOMING LIKELY. HIGHS IN THE 
UPPER 40S TO UPPER 50S. 
.TUESDAY...MOSTLY CLOUDY. NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. LOWS 
IN THE UPPER 30S NORTHWEST TO MID 50S SOUTH. HIGHS IN THE UPPER 40S 
NORTHWEST TO UPPER 60S SOUTHEAST. 
.WEDNESDAY...PARTLY CLOUDY. SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE MORNING MAINLY OVER EAST SECTIONS. LOWS IN THE 
LOWER 30S NORTHWEST TO THE LOWER 50S SOUTHEAST. HIGHS IN THE MID 40S 
TO MID 50S.

.EXTENDED FORECAST...
.MONDAY...MOSTLY CLOUDY. THUNDERSTORMS BECOMING LIKELY. HIGHS IN THE 
UPPER 40S TO UPPER 50S. 
.TUESDAY...MOSTLY CLOUDY. NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. LOWS 
IN THE UPPER 30S NORTHWEST TO MID 50S SOUTH. HIGHS IN THE UPPER 40S 
NORTHWEST TO UPPER 60S SOUTHEAST. 
.WEDNESDAY...PARTLY CLOUDY. SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS IN THE MORNING MAINLY OVER EAST SECTIONS. LOWS IN THE 
LOWER 30S NORTHWEST TO THE LOWER 50S SOUTHEAST. HIGHS IN THE MID 40S 
TO MID 50S. 

$$







840 
FXUS64 KLZK 270329 CCA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
900 PM CST FRI NOV 26 2004

.DISCUSSION...
ISOLATED SHOWERS HAVE DEVELOPED ACROSS PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST 
ARKANSAS. HAVE MADE SEVERAL ADJUSTMENTS TO THE GRIDS. 
FIRST...INCREASED TEMPERATURES BASED ON CURRENT OBSERVATIONS AS 
TEMPERATURES WERE RISING IN THE WESTERN PART OF THE STATE WITH 
STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION. THEREFORE...INCREASED LOW TEMPERATURES 
TONIGHT A COUPLE OF DEGREES. SATELLITE SHOWS ABUNDANT CLOUD COVER 
AND MORE TO COME AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING FRONT...WHICH WAS ACROSS 
CENTRAL OKLAHOMA. THE FRONT WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE RAPIDLY EASTWARD. 
AS IT DOES SO...SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP 
ACROSS THE AREA. SO SECONDLY...INCREASED POPS IN THE WEST A BIT FOR 
OVERNIGHT. A FEW OF THE STORMS COULD REACH SEVERE LIMITS TONIGHT. 
TOMORROWS POPS LOOK GOOD AS THE FRONT WILL MOVE QUICKLY THROUGH AND 
POPS WILL DECREASE RAPIDLY. THIRDLY...WINDS WILL BE A FACTOR. BREEZY 
10 TO 20 MPH WINDS ARE EXPECTED TONIGHT...AND SHOULD BE HIGHER FOR 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON. WILL ADVISE ONCOMING SHIFT AND THEY WILL DECIDE 
IF LAKE WIND ADVISORY WILL BE NEEDED FOR SATURDAY.  
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 207 PM CST FRI NOV 26 2004

TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT
AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO APPROACH AND WILL LIKELY BE 
OVER THE TEXAS PANHANDLE BY EARLY TONIGHT...GIVING ARKANSAS A 
SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WITH A SIGNIFICANT VORT MAX BRINGING POSITIVE 
VORTICITY ADVECTION TO MOST OF MY CW AREA BY MIDNIGHT TONIGHT. THE 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE HAS BEEN INCREASING OVER THE REGION SINCE THIS 
MORNING. A WELL DEFINED SURFACE BASED LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL BE 
CENTERED OVER SOUTHEASTERN KANSAS BY MIDNIGHT TONIGHT...WITH A GOOD 
SOUTHERLY FETCH OF GULF OF MEXICO MOISTURE INTO ARKANSAS. WILL 
THEREFORE KEEP A MENTION OF SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS TONIGHT. SOME STORMS MAY BECOME SEVERE...MAINLY IN THE 
SOUTH. A COOLER AND DRIER AIR MASS WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION LATE 
SATURDAY MORNING. A SECOND AND MORE IMPRESSIVE STORM SYSTEM MOVES IN 
LATE SATURDAY NIGHT. THE GFS TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE APPEARS REASONABLE 
SO WILL NOT VENTURE TOO FAR FROM THESE.(38)      

RELATIVELY GOOD AGREEMENT THIS AFTERNOON. GFS SOLUTION CONTINUES TO 
BE THE MOST CONSISTENT ALTHOUGH EVEN IT IS HAVING A FEW TIMING 
ISSUES. WITH NO REAL DIFFERENCES OF NOTE...WILL GO WITH A BLEND OF 
FORECAST SOLUTIONS THIS AFTERNOON WITH A LEAN TOWARDS THE GFS. EVEN 
GFS HAS COME BACK CONSIDERABLY WETTER FOR WEDNESDAY VERSUS PREVIOUS 
RUNS. SOLUTION SUPPORTED BY OTHER MEDIUM RANGE MODELS AS WELL. 

PRECIPITATION EVENT APPEARS TO BE WRAPPING UP EARLY WEDNESDAY WITH 
SURFACE LOW SOUTH OF LAKE MICHIGAN AND COLD FRONT ALREADY IN THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY. WITH MAIN TROF AXIS OVER STILL OVER EASTERN 
OKLAHOMA AND PLENTY OF RESIDUAL MOISTURE..WILL STILL HAVE TO HOLD 
ONTO POPS AT LEAST THROUGH MIDDAY. TROF IS EAST OF THE AREA BY 
WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON WITH DRIER AIR ADVECTING IN FAIRLY QUICKLY AS 
SURFACE HIGH AND WEAK RIDGING BUILD OVER THE AREA. HIGH WILL 
DOMINATE FOR DAYS SIX AND SEVEN WITH DRY CONDITIONS. SOME MOISTURE 
TRIES TO SNEAK INTO THE SOUTH LATE ON DAY SEVEN BUT WILL NOT 
INTRODUCE ANY POPS AT THIS POINT.  

BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES EXPECTED WEDNESDAY WITH ABUNDANT EARLY 
MORNING CLOUD COVER AND NORTHWEST WINDS. TEMPERATURES MODERATE ON 
THURSDAY AND EVEN MORE SO FRIDAY AS SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL RETURN ON 
THE BACK SIDE OF THE HIGH AS IT MOVES ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST CONUS. 
MEX GUIDANCE LOOKS REASONABLE AND WILL BE FOLLOWED PRETTY CLOSELY. 
MORE VERY COOL MORNINGS APPEAR LIKELY.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

HOT SPRINGS AR    50  60  36  56 /  60  20   0  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     52  61  38  56 /  80  40   0  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  46  54  29  50 /  60  20   0  10 
MONTICELLO AR     53  63  39  57 /  80  40   0  10 
SEARCY AR         50  59  36  53 /  80  40   0  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      49  61  35  56 /  60  20   0  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   47  59  33  54 /  60  20   0  10

38/56





593 
FXUS64 KLZK 261606 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1000 AM CST FRI NOV 26 2004

.DISCUSSION...
WILL DO MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO ONGOING FORECAST WHICH IS ON TRACK. WEB
UPDATED GRAPHICS...DIGITAL FORECASTS AND TEXT WILL BE OUT SHORTLY.
(38)
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 355 AM 

ACTIVE PATTERN IN THE SHORT TERM...WHICH WOULD BE NORMAL GIVEN THE 
TIME OF YEAR. 

WEATHER WILL REMAIN TRANQUIL TODAY...WITH HIGH PRESSURE SLIDING TO 
THE EAST. THIS WILL CREATE A BREEZY SOUTH/SOUTHWEST WIND...AND NOT 
QUITE ENOUGH FOR A LAKE WIND ADVISORY. MOISTURE LEVELS WILL BEGIN 
INCREASING LATER THIS AFTERNOON AS LOW LEVEL JET INCREASES FROM GULF 
COAST REGION.

AS MOISTURE FILTERS INTO ARKANSAS...STRONG SHORTWAVE WILL ARRIVE 
FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS LATE TONIGHT/EARLY SATURDAY. LOOKS LIKE 
WIDESPREAD SHOWERS WILL DEVELOP MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT...WITH 
A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS. WOULD NOT RULE OUT ISOLATED SEVERE 
WEATHER WITH SYSTEM.

CLEARING WILL QUICKLY TAKE PLACE BEHIND SYSTEM ON SATURDAY...WITH 
COOLER AIR NOTED AS WINDS SHIFT TO THE NORTHWEST. MANY AREAS WILL 
DROP INTO THE 30S SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT NOT EXPECTING A WIDESPREAD 
FREEZE.

RETURN FLOW WILL SET UP ON SUNDAY/SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH CLOUDS 
INCREASING ONCE AGAIN. NEW SHORTWAVE WILL APPROACH FROM THE 
PLAINS...WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS TO END THE SHORT TERM.
(46)         

LATEST VARIOUS OPERATIONS RUNS OF MEDIUM RANGE MODELS HAVE A 
REASONABLE AGREEMENT REGARDING HANDLING OF AN UPPER LOW THAT WILL 
APPROACH THE REGION EARLY THIS PERIOD. THIS SYSTEM SHOULD CLEAR THE 
REGION BY EARLY WEDNESDAY. (55)

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

46/55






091 
FXUS64 KLZK 260409
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1009 PM CST THU NOV 25 2004

.DISCUSSION...
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES WERE NOTED ACROSS THE STATE TONIGHT ON THE LATEST 
SATELLITE IMAGERY. CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY INCREASE AS THE 
NEXT COLD FRONT APPROACHES FROM THE NORTHWEST. ADJUSTED LOW 
TEMPERATURES TONIGHT A BIT. FEEL COOLEST TEMPERATURES WILL BE IN THE 
EAST AND WARMEST TEMPERATURES IN THE WEST AS HIGH PRESSURE MOVES TO 
THE EAST. STRONGER WINDS IN THE WEST WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES UP 
OVERNIGHT. CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION WILL BEGIN TOMORROW NIGHT AHEAD 
OF THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT.  
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 212 PM CST THU NOV 25 2004

THE TIMING OF THE NEXT PRECIPITATION EPISODE TO AFFECT ARKANSAS IS 
BEST HANDLED BY THE 20 KM RUC...SO WILL LEAN MORE IN THIS DIRECTION 
WITH ONLY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO ACCOUNT FOR OROGRAPHIC AFFECTS. HIGH 
PRESSURE NOW OVER US WILL BE MOVING EASTWARD TONIGHT AND FRIDAY. BY 
FRIDAY NIGHT...A SURFACE BASED LOW WILL BE MOVING SOUTHEASTWARD 
ACROSS SOUTHEAST KANSAS. A TROUGH WILL EXTEND FROM THIS LOW INTO 
SOUTH TEXAS. A COLD FRONT WILL EXTEND FROM THE KANSAS LOW TO 
MINNESOTA. AHEAD OF THIS APPROACHING SYSTEM...A SOUTHERLY WIND WILL 
BRING ADDITIONAL MOISTURE FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO TO COMBINE WITH A 
MOIST UNSTABLE AIR MASS MOVING TOWARDS ARKANSAS FROM THE NORTH. THIS 
WILL TRIGGER THE DEVELOPMENT OF SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
OVER THE NORTHERN SECTIONS FRIDAY NIGHT AND THEN WILL SPREAD TO THE 
REST OF THE CW AREA. THE SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL ALSO PUSH TEMPERATURES 
BACK UP ABOVE NORMAL OVER MOST OF ARKANSAS. WILL GO AHEAD AND 
INCREASE THE PROBABILITY OF PRECIPITATION ON MONDAY NIGHT IN ORDER 
TO BETTER MESH WITH THE NEW AND IMPROVED GUIDANCE.

RELATIVELY GOOD AGREEMENT THIS AFTERNOON. GFS SOLUTION CONTINUES TO 
BE THE MOST CONSISTENT ALTHOUGH EVEN IT IS HAVING A FEW TIMING 
ISSUES. WITH NO REAL DIFFERENCES OF NOTE...WILL GO WITH A BLEND OF 
FORECAST SOLUTIONS THIS AFTERNOON WITH A LEAN TOWARDS THE GFS.

VERY ACTIVE SOUTHERN STREAM WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE PERIOD. NEXT 
IN WHAT SEEMS A NEVER ENDING SERIES OF UPPER LOWS DROPS INTO THE 
SOUTHWEST CONUS AND LIFTS OUT FAIRLY QUICKLY. UPPER LOW WILL BE OVER 
EASTERN COLORADO AT THE ONSET OF THE PERIOD WITH DEEPENING SURFACE 
LOW OVER CENTRAL TEXAS. HIGH PRESSURE OFF THE MID ATLANTIC COAST 
WILL KEEP PLENTY OF GULF MOISTURE FLOWING INTO THE DEVELOPING LOW. 
WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BE LOCATED JUST TO THE SOUTH OF THE STATE 
SETTING THE STAGE FOR OVERRUNNING RAINS TUESDAY BUT AREA APPEARS TO 
BE DRY SLOTTED LATE. TROF AXIS PASSES OVER THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT. 

REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED LOOKS DRY AT THIS POINT WITH SURFACE HIGH 
STARTING TO SLIDE DOWN THE ROCKIES. ANOTHER LOW FORMS IN THE GULF 
LATE IN THE PERIOD BUT MOISTURE DOES NOT RETURN UNTIL BEYOND THE 
MEDIUM RANGE. WILL HAVE TO WATCH THIS TO SEE IF SYSTEM DEVELOPS 
QUICKER THAN CURRENTLY BEING ADVERTISED. MAV TEMPERATURES LOOK 
REASONABLE AND PRETTY MUCH IN LINE WITH CURRENT FORECAST. WILL MAKE 
VERY FEW CHANGES HERE AND OVERALL TEMPS WILL AVERAGE A FEW DEGREES 
BELOW NORMAL.  

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

51






MONTICELLO AR     40  65  52  63 /   0   0  30  30 
SEARCY AR         37  63  49  59 /  10  10  40  40 
MOUNT IDA AR      38  64  50  61 /   0  10  40  40 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   37  62  49  59 /  10  10  40  40 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

38/56





174 
FXUS64 KLZK 251430 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
824 AM CST THU NOV 25 2004

.DISCUSSION...
MINOR TWEAKS TO FRESHEN UP WORDING FOR THIS MORNING...OTHERWISE REST 
OF FORECAST IS RIGHT ON TARGET AND IN MOST EXCELLENT FORM. UPDATED 
DIGITAL DATA AND GRAPHICS HAVE ALREARY BEEN ISSUED. 
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 354 AM CST THU NOV 25 2004 

FREEZE WARNING WILL STAY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 THIS MORNING. CLEAR SKIES 
WILL NOT LAST TOO LONG...AS THE FAST FLOW ALOFT WILL BRING A STRONG 
SHORT WAVE FOR OVERNIGHT FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY. IN KEEPING WITH A 
FAST FLOW...SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY WILL BE DRY...BUT THE NEXT 
SHORT WAVE WILL BE APPROACHING THE STATE FROM THE SOUTHWEST FOR THE 
BEGINNING OF THE LONG TERM.

IN THE SURFACE FEATURES...WE WILL HAVE RETURN FLOW ON THE BACK SIDE 
OF THE HIGH BY TONIGHT...SO THERE WILL BE NO NEED FOR ANOTHER FREEZE 
WARNING. A LOW WILL GATHER STRENGTH OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS MIDDAY 
FRIDAY. IT WILL SLIDE SOUTHEAST A BIT TOWARDS NORTH CENTRAL OKLAHOMA 
AND THEN SHOOT NORTHEASTWARD...DRAGGING A COLD FRONT ACROSS ARKANSAS 
LATE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO MIDDAY SATURDAY. ALL THE RAIN ASSOCIATED WITH 
THIS SYSTEM SHOULD BE FROM THE WARM SECTOR AS THE MOISTURE STREAMS 
NORTH FROM THE GULF...JUST AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT. TEMPERATURES 
SHOULD MODERATE RATHER WELL AFTER THIS MORNING BECAUSE OF THE WARMER 
AIR THAT WILL BE ADVECTED FROM THE SOUTHWEST AROUND THE HIGH 
CENTERED AROUND THE SOUTHEAST SECTION OF THE COUNTRY.

LOOKS LIKE SERIES OF UPPER LOWS WILL BE COMING OUT OF THE SOUTHWEST 
INTO THE PLAINS OVER THE NEXT WEEK OR SO. ONE WILL MOVE OUT MONDAY 
AND TUESDAY. INDICATIONS ARE THIS WILL COME OUT FARTHER NORTH THAN 
THE UPPER LOW OF THE PAST TWO DAYS AND THE AIR MASS WILL BE COOLER. 
RETURN MOISTURE AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM WILL MOVE IN SUNDAY NIGHT SO 
WILL PUT IN MENTION OF RAIN BEGINNING SUNDAY NIGHT WHICH WILL 
CONTINUE THROUGH TUESDAY. ON TUESDAY AS THE UPPER TROF NEARS THE 
AREA...THERE ARE SIGNS A STRONG SURFACE LOW MAY BE DRAWN NORTH 
ACROSS ARKANSAS AND SOME WARMER AIR MAY MANAGE TO REACH EASTERN 
SECTIONS. PUT IN SOME THUNDER IN THE EAST FOR TUESDAY AFTERNOON 
ALTHOUGH THIS SCENARIO WILL LIKELY CHANGE WITH TIME. GFS SHOWS GOOD 
DRY PUNCH MOVING IN TUESDAY NIGHT SO ENDED POPS EARLY TUESDAY NIGHT 
AND KEPT IT DRY THE REST OF THE WAY. KEPT TEMP FORECASTS ABOUT THE 
SAME BUT DID RAISE MINS A LITTLE ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY DUE TO RETURN 
MOISTURE IN PLACE AND LIKELY LOW CLOUD COVER.

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&
32/29

$$

LOOKS LIKE SERIES OF UPPER LOWS WILL BE COMING OUT OF THE SOUTHWEST 
INTO THE PLAINS OVER THE NEXT WEEK OR SO. ONE WILL MOVE OUT MONDAY 
AND TUESDAY. INDICATIONS ARE THIS WILL COME OUT FARTHER NORTH THAN 
THE UPPER LOW OF THE PAST TWO DAYS AND THE AIR MASS WILL BE COOLER.

AND KEPT IT DRY THE REST OF THE WAY. KEPT TEMP FORECASTS ABOUT THE 
SAME BUT DID RAISE MINS A LITTLE ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY DUE TO RETURN 
MOISTURE IN PLACE AND LIKELY LOW CLOUD COVER.

32/29





162 
FXUS64 KLZK 250408 CCA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1006 PM CST WED NOV 24 2004

.DISCUSSION...
WILL ISSUE UPDATE TO FORECAST MAINLY FOR WORDING. TEMPERATURES LOOK 
TO BE ON TRACK FOR THE OVERNIGHT PERIOD. ADJUSTED GRID TEMPERATURES 
SLIGHTLY BASED ON CURRENT OBSERVATIONS. SKIES WILL CONTINUE TO CLEAR 
OUT TONIGHT AND TEMPERATURES WILL DROP A BIT MORE RAPIDLY AFTER 
MIDNIGHT. WILL ADD A FEW MORE COUNTIES TO THE FREEZE WARNING. LIGHT 
PRECIPITATION NOTED EARLY THIS EVENING ON KLZK RADAR HAS MOVED EAST 
OF THE AREA. 
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 224 PM WED NOV 24 2004

WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO DISSIPATE THROUGH THE EVENING HOURS ACROSS 
THE AREA. THEREFORE THE LAKE WIND ADVISORY HAS BEEN ALLOWED TO 
EXPIRE. SATELLITE IMAGES SHOWED THE CLEARING LINE NEAR THE OKLAHOMA 
BORDER AND CONTINUING TO MOVE EAST. MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES THIS EVENING 
WILL BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR BY MORNING AS HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO 
MOVE EAST. 

ISSUED AT 224 PM WED NOV 24 2004

SHORT RANGE MODELS ARE ALL IN GOOD AGREEMENT THIS AFTERNOON. GFS AND 
ETA BOTH ON THE SAME PAGE REGARDING THE EXITING UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER 
THE NATIONS MID SECTION. WITH NO REAL DISCREPANCIES BETWEEN THE 
MODELS...WILL GO WITH A BLEND OF FORECAST SOLUTIONS THIS AFTERNOON.

LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES RAPIDLY DEEPENING SURFACE LOW OVER 
SOUTHERN ILLINOIS AND RACING OFF TO THE NORTHEAST. SYSTEM FASTER AND 
STRONGER THAN MODELS WERE EARLIER SHOWING. ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT HAS 
EXITED THE STATE WITH STRING COLD AIR ADVECTION PATTERN UNDERWAY.  
HIGH TEMPERATURES ACROSS MOST OF THE CWA WERE ACHIEVED EARLY IN THE 
DAY WITH STEADY OR SLOWLY FALLING TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE AFTERNOON.

TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT BETWEEN THE DEPARTING LOW AND BUILDING HIGH 
NOW OVER WESTERN TEXAS WILL SLOWLY SLACKEN THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. 
LAKE WIND ADVISORY CURRENTLY IN EFFECT WILL NOT BE EXPANDED BEYOND 
THAT TIME.

TROF AXIS STILL HAS TO PASS THROUGH THE REGION LATE THIS AFTERNOON 
AND EARLY THIS EVENING. UNTIL ACTUALLY AXIS CLEARS...A FEW SCATTERED 
SHOWERS CAN NOT BE RULED OUT. A FEW WET FLAKES ALSO ARE POSSIBLE 
ESPECIALLY AT ELEVATION BUT NOT ENOUGH TO WORTH MENTIONING IN THE 
FORECAST AT THIS TIME.

COLDEST AIR OF THE SEASON TO DATE CONTINUES TO POUR INTO THE AREA 
FROM THE NORTHWEST. MODELS CONTINUE TO ADVERTISE CLEARING SKIES 
OVERNIGHT AND WITH DECOUPLING WINDS...VERY COLD OVERNIGHT LOWS ARE 
EXPECTED. CURRENT PLACEMENT OF FREEZE ADVISORY LOOKS GOOD. REMAINDER 
OF THE CWA WILL DROP INTO THE MID 30S. 

AFOREMENTIONED HIGH WILL SLIDE ALONG THE GULF COAST ON THANKSGIVING 
DAY. SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL RETURN LATE IN THE DAY AS THE HIGH SLIPS 
TO THE EAST OF THE AREA. TEMPERATURES WILL STILL BE ABOUT 5 TO 10 
DEGREES BELOW NORMAL BUT SOUTHERLY COMPONENT WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES 
FROM BOTTOMING OUT ONCE AGAIN FRIDAY MORNING.

FLOW ON FRIDAY STARTS OFF ZONAL AND BECOMES MORE SOUTHWEST DURING 
THE DAY AS NEXT TROUGH DIGS INTO THE NATIONS MID SECTION. SOUTHERLY 
SURFACE COMPONENT WILL BRING WARMER DAYTIME MAXES. FWC NUMBERS SEEM 
A LITTLE HIGH AND WILL GO CLOSER TO THE MAV NUMBERS. 

NEXT TROUGH PASSES OVER THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY. 
PARENT LOW IS WELL TO THE NORTH BUT MODELS CONSISTENT WITH SECONDARY 
DEVELOPMENT ON THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT.  LOW WOULD FORM OVER 
NORTHEAST OKLAHOMA FRIDAY EVENING AND MOVE INTO EASTERN MISSOURI BY 
SATURDAY MORNING. DYNAMICS NOT TERRIBLY IMPRESSIVE BUT ENOUGH 
MOISTURE RETURN AND SURFACE CONVERGENCE WARRANTS SCATTERED POPS. 

SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH QUICKLY SATURDAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE ON THE 
SURFACE AND ZONAL FLOW ALOFT RETURNING FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY. NEXT SYSTEM STARTS TO APPROACH THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT WITH 
MOISTURE INCREASING. WILL HOLD OFF ON ANY PRECIPITATION IN THE 
SUNDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME AT THIS TIME.  

WILL GO WITH THE PREFERRED GFSLR MODEL. HAD TO ADJUST A FEW MAX AND 
MINS DOWNWARD SINCE NEW THINKING IS LEANING THAT WAY. THERE WILL BE 
A ZONAL UPPER LEVEL FLOW WITH A LIMITED AMOUNT OF MEAN RH EARLY IN 
THE PERIOD. AN AREA OF SOMEWHAT HIGHER MOISTURE IS HOWEVER AT THAT 
TIME EXPECTED TO BE MOVING ACROSS OKLAHOMA TOWARDS ARKANSAS. BY 
MONDAY MORNING...A CUT-OFF H5 LOW HAS DEVELOPED AND DROPPED 
SOUTHEASTWARD INTO THE FOUR CORNERS REGION...WITH UPPER FLOW OVER 
ARKANSAS NOW BECOMING MORE OF A SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST FLOW. THE 
HIGHER MOISTURE IS NOW MAINLY CONCENTRATED OVER THE NORTHWESTERN 
SECTIONS OF ARKANSAS. A DRIER AIRMASS WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION BY 
TUESDAY. NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES WILL PREVAIL SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY...WITH COOLER THAN NORMAL WEATHER EXPECTED BY TUESDAY.

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...FREEZE WARNING FOR TONIGHT AND 
EARLY TOMORROW FOR ZONES ARZ003>007...ARZ012>016... 
ARZ021>025...ARZ030>034...ARZ037>042.
&&

$$

51






