TO BE ON TRACK FOR THE OVERNIGHT PERIOD. ADJUSTED GRID TEMPERATURES 
SLIGHTLY BASED ON CURRENT OBSERVATIONS. SKIES WILL CONTINUE TO CLEAR 
OUT TONIGHT AND TEMPERATURES WILL DROP A BIT MORE RAPIDLY AFTER 
MIDNIGHT. WILL ADD A FEW MORE COUNTIES TO THE FREEZE WARNING. LIGHT 
PRECIPITATION NOTED EARLY THIS EVENING ON KLZK RADAR HAS MOVED EAST 
OF THE AREA. 
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 224 PM WED NOV 24 2004

WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO DISSIPATE THROUGH THE EVENING HOURS ACROSS 
THE AREA. THEREFORE THE LAKE WIND ADVISORY HAS BEEN ALLOWED TO 
EXPIRE. SATELLITE IMAGES SHOWED THE CLEARING LINE NEAR THE OKLAHOMA 
BORDER AND CONTINUING TO MOVE EAST. MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES THIS EVENING 
WILL BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR BY MORNING AS HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO 
MOVE EAST. 

ISSUED AT 224 PM WED NOV 24 2004

SHORT RANGE MODELS ARE ALL IN GOOD AGREEMENT THIS AFTERNOON. GFS AND 
ETA BOTH ON THE SAME PAGE REGARDING THE EXITING UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER 
THE NATIONS MID SECTION. WITH NO REAL DISCREPANCIES BETWEEN THE 
MODELS...WILL GO WITH A BLEND OF FORECAST SOLUTIONS THIS AFTERNOON.

LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES RAPIDLY DEEPENING SURFACE LOW OVER 
SOUTHERN ILLINOIS AND RACING OFF TO THE NORTHEAST. SYSTEM FASTER AND 
STRONGER THAN MODELS WERE EARLIER SHOWING. ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT HAS 
EXITED THE STATE WITH STRING COLD AIR ADVECTION PATTERN UNDERWAY.  
HIGH TEMPERATURES ACROSS MOST OF THE CWA WERE ACHIEVED EARLY IN THE 
DAY WITH STEADY OR SLOWLY FALLING TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE AFTERNOON.

TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT BETWEEN THE DEPARTING LOW AND BUILDING HIGH 
NOW OVER WESTERN TEXAS WILL SLOWLY SLACKEN THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. 
LAKE WIND ADVISORY CURRENTLY IN EFFECT WILL NOT BE EXPANDED BEYOND 
THAT TIME.

TROF AXIS STILL HAS TO PASS THROUGH THE REGION LATE THIS AFTERNOON 
AND EARLY THIS EVENING. UNTIL ACTUALLY AXIS CLEARS...A FEW SCATTERED 
SHOWERS CAN NOT BE RULED OUT. A FEW WET FLAKES ALSO ARE POSSIBLE 
ESPECIALLY AT ELEVATION BUT NOT ENOUGH TO WORTH MENTIONING IN THE 
FORECAST AT THIS TIME.

COLDEST AIR OF THE SEASON TO DATE CONTINUES TO POUR INTO THE AREA 
FROM THE NORTHWEST. MODELS CONTINUE TO ADVERTISE CLEARING SKIES 
OVERNIGHT AND WITH DECOUPLING WINDS...VERY COLD OVERNIGHT LOWS ARE 
EXPECTED. CURRENT PLACEMENT OF FREEZE ADVISORY LOOKS GOOD. REMAINDER 
OF THE CWA WILL DROP INTO THE MID 30S. 

AFOREMENTIONED HIGH WILL SLIDE ALONG THE GULF COAST ON THANKSGIVING 
DAY. SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL RETURN LATE IN THE DAY AS THE HIGH SLIPS 
TO THE EAST OF THE AREA. TEMPERATURES WILL STILL BE ABOUT 5 TO 10 
DEGREES BELOW NORMAL BUT SOUTHERLY COMPONENT WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES 
FROM BOTTOMING OUT ONCE AGAIN FRIDAY MORNING.

FLOW ON FRIDAY STARTS OFF ZONAL AND BECOMES MORE SOUTHWEST DURING 
THE DAY AS NEXT TROUGH DIGS INTO THE NATIONS MID SECTION. SOUTHERLY 
SURFACE COMPONENT WILL BRING WARMER DAYTIME MAXES. FWC NUMBERS SEEM 
A LITTLE HIGH AND WILL GO CLOSER TO THE MAV NUMBERS. 

NEXT TROUGH PASSES OVER THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY. 
PARENT LOW IS WELL TO THE NORTH BUT MODELS CONSISTENT WITH SECONDARY 
DEVELOPMENT ON THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT.  LOW WOULD FORM OVER 
NORTHEAST OKLAHOMA FRIDAY EVENING AND MOVE INTO EASTERN MISSOURI BY 
SATURDAY MORNING. DYNAMICS NOT TERRIBLY IMPRESSIVE BUT ENOUGH 
MOISTURE RETURN AND SURFACE CONVERGENCE WARRANTS SCATTERED POPS. 

SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH QUICKLY SATURDAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE ON THE 
SURFACE AND ZONAL FLOW ALOFT RETURNING FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY. NEXT SYSTEM STARTS TO APPROACH THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT WITH 
MOISTURE INCREASING. WILL HOLD OFF ON ANY PRECIPITATION IN THE 
SUNDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME AT THIS TIME.  

WILL GO WITH THE PREFERRED GFSLR MODEL. HAD TO ADJUST A FEW MAX AND 
MINS DOWNWARD SINCE NEW THINKING IS LEANING THAT WAY. THERE WILL BE 
A ZONAL UPPER LEVEL FLOW WITH A LIMITED AMOUNT OF MEAN RH EARLY IN 
THE PERIOD. AN AREA OF SOMEWHAT HIGHER MOISTURE IS HOWEVER AT THAT 
TIME EXPECTED TO BE MOVING ACROSS OKLAHOMA TOWARDS ARKANSAS. BY 
MONDAY MORNING...A CUT-OFF H5 LOW HAS DEVELOPED AND DROPPED 
SOUTHEASTWARD INTO THE FOUR CORNERS REGION...WITH UPPER FLOW OVER 
ARKANSAS NOW BECOMING MORE OF A SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST FLOW. THE 
HIGHER MOISTURE IS NOW MAINLY CONCENTRATED OVER THE NORTHWESTERN 
SECTIONS OF ARKANSAS. A DRIER AIRMASS WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION BY 
TUESDAY. NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES WILL PREVAIL SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY...WITH COOLER THAN NORMAL WEATHER EXPECTED BY TUESDAY.

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...FREEZE WARNING FOR TONIGHT AND 
EARLY TOMORROW FOR ZONES ARZ003>007...ARZ012>016... 
ARZ021>025...ARZ030>034...ARZ037>042.
&&

$$

51








FXUS64 KLZK 250406 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1006 PM CST WED NOV 24 2004

.DISCUSSION...
WILL ISSUE UPDATE TO FORECAST MAINLY FOR WORDING. TEMPERATURES LOOK 
TO BE ON TRACK FOR THE OVERNIGHT PERIOD. ADJUSTED GRID TEMPERATURES 
SLIGHTLY BASED ON CURRENT OBSERVATIONS. SKIES WILL CONTINUE TO CLEAR 
OUT TONIGHT AND TEMPERATURES WILL DROP A BIT MORE RAPIDLY AFTER 
MIDNIGHT. WILL ADD A FEW MORE COUNTIES TO THE FREEZE WARNING. LIGHT

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 224 PM WED NOV 24 2004

SHORT RANGE MODELS ARE ALL IN GOOD AGREEMENT THIS AFTERNOON. GFS AND 
ETA BOTH ON THE SAME PAGE REGARDING THE EXITING UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER 
THE NATIONS MID SECTION. WITH NO REAL DISCREPANCIES BETWEEN THE 
MODELS...WILL GO WITH A BLEND OF FORECAST SOLUTIONS THIS AFTERNOON.

LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES RAPIDLY DEEPENING SURFACE LOW OVER 
SOUTHERN ILLINOIS AND RACING OFF TO THE NORTHEAST. SYSTEM FASTER AND 
STRONGER THAN MODELS WERE EARLIER SHOWING. ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT HAS 
EXITED THE STATE WITH STRING COLD AIR ADVECTION PATTERN UNDERWAY.

DAY WITH STEADY OR SLOWLY FALLING TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE AFTERNOON.

NOW OVER WESTERN TEXAS WILL SLOWLY SLACKEN THROUGH THE AFTERNOON.

THAT TIME.

TROF AXIS STILL HAS TO PASS THROUGH THE REGION LATE THIS AFTERNOON 
AND EARLY THIS EVENING. UNTIL ACTUALLY AXIS CLEARS...A FEW SCATTERED 
SHOWERS CAN NOT BE RULED OUT. A FEW WET FLAKES ALSO ARE POSSIBLE 
ESPECIALLY AT ELEVATION BUT NOT ENOUGH TO WORTH MENTIONING IN THE 
FORECAST AT THIS TIME.

COLDEST AIR OF THE SEASON TO DATE CONTINUES TO POUR INTO THE AREA 
FROM THE NORTHWEST. MODELS CONTINUE TO ADVERTISE CLEARING SKIES 
OVERNIGHT AND WITH DECOUPLING WINDS...VERY COLD OVERNIGHT LOWS ARE 
EXPECTED. CURRENT PLACEMENT OF FREEZE ADVISORY LOOKS GOOD. REMAINDER 
OF THE CWA WILL DROP INTO THE MID 30S. 

AFOREMENTIONED HIGH WILL SLIDE ALONG THE GULF COAST ON THANKSGIVING 
DAY. SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL RETURN LATE IN THE DAY AS THE HIGH SLIPS 
TO THE EAST OF THE AREA. TEMPERATURES WILL STILL BE ABOUT 5 TO 10 
DEGREES BELOW NORMAL BUT SOUTHERLY COMPONENT WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES 
FROM BOTTOMING OUT ONCE AGAIN FRIDAY MORNING.

FLOW ON FRIDAY STARTS OFF ZONAL AND BECOMES MORE SOUTHWEST DURING 
THE DAY AS NEXT TROUGH DIGS INTO THE NATIONS MID SECTION. SOUTHERLY 
SURFACE COMPONENT WILL BRING WARMER DAYTIME MAXES. FWC NUMBERS SEEM

DEVELOPMENT ON THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT.  LOW WOULD FORM OVER 
NORTHEAST OKLAHOMA FRIDAY EVENING AND MOVE INTO EASTERN MISSOURI BY 
SATURDAY MORNING. DYNAMICS NOT TERRIBLY IMPRESSIVE BUT ENOUGH 
MOISTURE RETURN AND SURFACE CONVERGENCE WARRANTS SCATTERED POPS. 

SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH QUICKLY SATURDAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE ON THE 
SURFACE AND ZONAL FLOW ALOFT RETURNING FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY. NEXT SYSTEM STARTS TO APPROACH THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT WITH 
MOISTURE INCREASING. WILL HOLD OFF ON ANY PRECIPITATION IN THE 
SUNDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME AT THIS TIME.  

WILL GO WITH THE PREFERRED GFSLR MODEL. HAD TO ADJUST A FEW MAX AND 
MINS DOWNWARD SINCE NEW THINKING IS LEANING THAT WAY. THERE WILL BE 
A ZONAL UPPER LEVEL FLOW WITH A LIMITED AMOUNT OF MEAN RH EARLY IN 
THE PERIOD. AN AREA OF SOMEWHAT HIGHER MOISTURE IS HOWEVER AT THAT 
TIME EXPECTED TO BE MOVING ACROSS OKLAHOMA TOWARDS ARKANSAS. BY 
MONDAY MORNING...A CUT-OFF H5 LOW HAS DEVELOPED AND DROPPED 
SOUTHEASTWARD INTO THE FOUR CORNERS REGION...WITH UPPER FLOW OVER 
ARKANSAS NOW BECOMING MORE OF A SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST FLOW. THE 
HIGHER MOISTURE IS NOW MAINLY CONCENTRATED OVER THE NORTHWESTERN

TUESDAY. NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES WILL PREVAIL SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY...WITH COOLER THAN NORMAL WEATHER EXPECTED BY TUESDAY.

HIGHER MOISTURE IS NOW MAINLY CONCENTRATED OVER THE NORTHWESTERN 
SECTIONS OF ARKANSAS. A DRIER AIRMASS WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION BY 
TUESDAY. NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES WILL PREVAIL SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY...WITH COOLER THAN NORMAL WEATHER EXPECTED BY TUESDAY.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

51







000 
FXUS64 KLZK 250026 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
626 PM CST WED NOV 24 2004

.DISCUSSION...
WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO DISSIPATE THROUGH THE EVENING HOURS ACROSS 
THE AREA. THEREFORE THE LAKE WIND ADVISORY HAS BEEN ALLOWED TO 
EXPIRE. SATELLITE IMAGES SHOWED THE CLEARING LINE NEAR THE OKLAHOMA 
BORDER AND CONTINUING TO MOVE EAST. MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES THIS EVENING 
WILL BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR BY MORNING AS HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO 
MOVE EAST. 
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 

SHORT RANGE MODELS ARE ALL IN GOOD AGREEMENT THIS AFTERNOON. GFS AND 
ETA BOTH ON THE SAME PAGE REGARDING THE EXITING UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER 
THE NATIONS MID SECTION. WITH NO REAL DISCREPANCIES BETWEEN THE 
MODELS...WILL GO WITH A BLEND OF FORECAST SOLUTIONS THIS AFTERNOON.

LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES RAPIDLY DEEPENING SURFACE LOW OVER 
SOUTHERN ILLINOIS AND RACING OFF TO THE NORTHEAST. SYSTEM FASTER AND 
STRONGER THAN MODELS WERE EARLIER SHOWING. ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT HAS 
EXITED THE STATE WITH STRING COLD AIR ADVECTION PATTERN UNDERWAY.  
HIGH TEMPERATURES ACROSS MOST OF THE CWA WERE ACHIEVED EARLY IN THE 
DAY WITH STEADY OR SLOWLY FALLING TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE AFTERNOON.

TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT BETWEEN THE DEPARTING LOW AND BUILDING HIGH 
NOW OVER WESTERN TEXAS WILL SLOWLY SLACKEN THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. 
LAKE WIND ADVISORY CURRENTLY IN EFFECT WILL NOT BE EXPANDED BEYOND 
THAT TIME.

TROF AXIS STILL HAS TO PASS THROUGH THE REGION LATE THIS AFTERNOON 
AND EARLY THIS EVENING. UNTIL ACTUALLY AXIS CLEARS...A FEW SCATTERED 
SHOWERS CAN NOT BE RULED OUT. A FEW WET FLAKES ALSO ARE POSSIBLE 
ESPECIALLY AT ELEVATION BUT NOT ENOUGH TO WORTH MENTIONING IN THE 
FORECAST AT THIS TIME.

COLDEST AIR OF THE SEASON TO DATE CONTINUES TO POUR INTO THE AREA 
FROM THE NORTHWEST. MODELS CONTINUE TO ADVERTISE CLEARING SKIES 
OVERNIGHT AND WITH DECOUPLING WINDS...VERY COLD OVERNIGHT LOWS ARE 
EXPECTED. CURRENT PLACEMENT OF FREEZE ADVISORY LOOKS GOOD. REMAINDER 
OF THE CWA WILL DROP INTO THE MID 30S. 

AFOREMENTIONED HIGH WILL SLIDE ALONG THE GULF COAST ON THANKSGIVING 
DAY. SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL RETURN LATE IN THE DAY AS THE HIGH SLIPS 
TO THE EAST OF THE AREA. TEMPERATURES WILL STILL BE ABOUT 5 TO 10 
DEGREES BELOW NORMAL BUT SOUTHERLY COMPONENT WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES 
FROM BOTTOMING OUT ONCE AGAIN FRIDAY MORNING.

FLOW ON FRIDAY STARTS OFF ZONAL AND BECOMES MORE SOUTHWEST DURING 
THE DAY AS NEXT TROUGH DIGS INTO THE NATIONS MID SECTION. SOUTHERLY 
SURFACE COMPONENT WILL BRING WARMER DAYTIME MAXES. FWC NUMBERS SEEM 
A LITTLE HIGH AND WILL GO CLOSER TO THE MAV NUMBERS. 

NEXT TROUGH PASSES OVER THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY. 
PARENT LOW IS WELL TO THE NORTH BUT MODELS CONSISTENT WITH SECONDARY 
DEVELOPMENT ON THE ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT.  LOW WOULD FORM OVER 
NORTHEAST OKLAHOMA FRIDAY EVENING AND MOVE INTO EASTERN MISSOURI BY 
SATURDAY MORNING. DYNAMICS NOT TERRIBLY IMPRESSIVE BUT ENOUGH 
MOISTURE RETURN AND SURFACE CONVERGENCE WARRANTS SCATTERED POPS. 

SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH QUICKLY SATURDAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE ON THE 
SURFACE AND ZONAL FLOW ALOFT RETURNING FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY. NEXT SYSTEM STARTS TO APPROACH THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT WITH 
MOISTURE INCREASING. WILL HOLD OFF ON ANY PRECIPITATION IN THE 
SUNDAY NIGHT TIME FRAME AT THIS TIME.  

WILL GO WITH THE PREFERRED GFSLR MODEL. HAD TO ADJUST A FEW MAX AND 
MINS DOWNWARD SINCE NEW THINKING IS LEANING THAT WAY. THERE WILL BE 
A ZONAL UPPER LEVEL FLOW WITH A LIMITED AMOUNT OF MEAN RH EARLY IN 
THE PERIOD. AN AREA OF SOMEWHAT HIGHER MOISTURE IS HOWEVER AT THAT 
TIME EXPECTED TO BE MOVING ACROSS OKLAHOMA TOWARDS ARKANSAS. BY 
MONDAY MORNING...A CUT-OFF H5 LOW HAS DEVELOPED AND DROPPED 
SOUTHEASTWARD INTO THE FOUR CORNERS REGION...WITH UPPER FLOW OVER 
ARKANSAS NOW BECOMING MORE OF A SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST FLOW. THE 
HIGHER MOISTURE IS NOW MAINLY CONCENTRATED OVER THE NORTHWESTERN 
SECTIONS OF ARKANSAS. A DRIER AIRMASS WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION BY 
TUESDAY. NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES WILL PREVAIL SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY...WITH COOLER THAN NORMAL WEATHER EXPECTED BY TUESDAY.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$



964 
FXUS64 KLZK 241642
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1042 AM CST WED NOV 24 2004

.DISCUSSION...
FORECAST IS FAIRLY ON TRACK THIS MORNING. THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
THAT BROUGHT SEVERAL INCHES OF RAIN TO THE STATE IS QUICKLY MOVING 
OUT OF THE AREA. AT 16Z...THE CENTER OF THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WAS 
LOCATED OVER S IL. STRONG PRESSURE COUPLET OF 8 PLUS MB WITH THE 
SYSTEM IS ALSO BLASTING THROUGH THE STATE. LOCAL WSR-88DS SHOWING 
THE RAIN/SNOW BAND ACROSS MO/OK SUBSIDING OVER THE LAST HOUR...AS 
DRY AIR WORKS INTO THE AREA AND MUCH OF THE FORCING EXITS 
EASTWARD...WHICH IS DEPICTED NICELY IN THE 12Z ETA. A SECONDARY 
COLD FRONT IS ALSO SHOWING UP IN THE WIND FIELDS. AM SLIGHTLY 
CONCERNED WITH THIS FEATURE TOUCHING OFF A FEW SHOWERS ACROSS THE 
STATE AS IT MOVES THROUGH...AS ANY SUNSHINE ALONG WITH COOLING TEMPS 
IN THE MID LAYERS WOULD LEAD TO SLIGHT DESTABILIZATION OF THE PBL. 
CLOUD COVER IS RATHER EXTENSIVE THOUGH...AND WITH STRONG CAA BEHIND 
THE SYSTEM QUICKLY MOISTENING THE LOW LAYERS OF THE 
ATMOSPHERE...DONT FEEL LIKE MANY BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS WILL BE 
REALIZED. ALTHOUGH WINDS ARE GUSTING INTO THE MID AND UPPER 20S 
ACROSS THE STATE...I DONT EXPECT THEM TO CONTINUE AS THE 
AFOREMENTIONED PRESSURE COUPLET RAPIDLY VACATES. TEMPS ARE ON TRACK 
FOR THE DAY...AS IS REST OF FORECAST AT THIS TIME.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 406 AM CST WED NOV 24 2004

THE H5 LOW WEAKENED AND OPENED SOONER THAN EXPECTED. IT WILL SLIDE 
OFF TO THE NORTHEAST FASTER...SO THIS WILL HAVE THE RESULT OF ENDING 
PRECIPITATION OVER THE STATE QUICKER. THERE WILL BE SOME WRAP AROUND 
CLOUDS AND RAIN CHANCES...BUT THEY WILL END BY 00Z THU. A FAST ZONAL 
FLOW WILL SET UP ONCE THIS TROF MOVES OUT OF THE WAY. THE NEXT SHORT 
WAVE TO APPROACH THE STATE FROM THE WEST WILL BRING POPS BACK INTO 
THE FORECAST FOR FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. THE STRONG COLD FRONT 
WILL BRING WEST TO NORTHWEST WINDS TODAY...BUT THEY WILL NOT BE 
QUITE AS GUSTY AS THEY HAD BEEN SHOWN WITH PREVIOUS RUNS...SO THERE 
WILL BE NO NEED FOR LAKE WIND ADVISORIES AT THIS TIME. COLD AIR 
ADVECTION WILL BE STRONG...SO A FREEZE WARNING FOR MY NORTHERN AND 
WEST CENTRAL COUNTIES WILL BE ISSUED. MOISTURE WILL BE LEAVING OUR 
FORECAST AREA BEFORE THE COLD AIR ARRIVES...SO IT APPEARS WE WILL 
MISS AN ENCOUNTER WITH WINTRY PRECIPITATION THIS ROUND. TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE QUITE COLD BY THURSDAY MORNING ON ACCOUNT OF THE STRONG 
FRONT...BUT RETURN FLOW WILL SET UP RATHER QUICKLY...LOWS THURSDAY 
NIGHT WILL BENEFIT FROM A SOUTHERLY FETCH. HIGHS FRIDAY WILL BENEFIT 
FROM THE SAME SOUTHERLY WINDS.

HAVE BEEN BUSY WITH SHORT TERM WEATHER AND COULD NOT GIVE GOOD 
ATTENTION TO THE EXTENDED. THUS LITTLE SIGNIFICANT CHANGE WAS MADE. 
LOOKS LIKE NEXT UPPER TROF AND FRONT WILL BE PAST THE AREA BY 
SATURDAY NIGHT SO CONTINUED DRY FORECAST FOR THEN. THE NEXT TROF AND 
COLD FRONT APPROACH SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY WITH THE FRONT MOVING 
THROUGH ON TUESDAY. UPSLOPE PATTERN BEGINS SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT 
WHICH WILL AFFECT AREAS WEST OF THE CWA THEN A WEAK SHORT WAVE ALONG 
THE GULF COAST BRINGS MOISTURE INTO THE AREA FOR MONDAY. PUT CHANCE 
POPS IN FOR MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. GFS PATTERN FOR NEXT TUESDAY 
LOOKS SIMILAR TO PATTERN OF THIS TUESDAY...BUT UPPER LOW IS PROGGED 
TO COME OUT FARTHER TO THE NORTH AND THE AIR IN PLACE LOOKS COOLER 
TO START WITH. WITH THE DYNAMICS MOVING NORTH AND THE AIR LESS 
UNSTABLE...SEVERE WEATHER THREAT DOES NOT LOOK GOOD AT THIS 
TIME...BUT WILL HAVE TO SEE HOW THIS UNFOLDS OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS. 
DID NOT FORECAST THUNDER WITH THE SYSTEM FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK FOR NOW.

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

220






OFF TO THE NORTHEAST FASTER...SO THIS WILL HAVE THE RESULT OF ENDING 
PRECIPITATION OVER THE STATE QUICKER. THERE WILL BE SOME WRAP AROUND 
CLOUDS AND RAIN CHANCES...BUT THEY WILL END BY 00Z THU. A FAST ZONAL 
FLOW WILL SET UP ONCE THIS TROF MOVES OUT OF THE WAY. THE NEXT SHORT 
WAVE TO APPROACH THE STATE FROM THE WEST WILL BRING POPS BACK INTO 
THE FORECAST FOR FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. THE STRONG COLD FRONT 
WILL BRING WEST TO NORTHWEST WINDS TODAY...BUT THEY WILL NOT BE 
QUITE AS GUSTY AS THEY HAD BEEN SHOWN WITH PREVIOUS RUNS...SO THERE 
WILL BE NO NEED FOR LAKE WIND ADVISORIES AT THIS TIME. COLD AIR 
ADVECTION WILL BE STRONG...SO A FREEZE WARNING FOR MY NORTHERN AND 
WEST CENTRAL COUNTIES WILL BE ISSUED. MOISTURE WILL BE LEAVING OUR 
FORECAST AREA BEFORE THE COLD AIR ARRIVES...SO IT APPEARS WE WILL 
MISS AN ENCOUNTER WITH WINTRY PRECIPITATION THIS ROUND. TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE QUITE COLD BY THURSDAY MORNING ON ACCOUNT OF THE STRONG 
FRONT...BUT RETURN FLOW WILL SET UP RATHER QUICKLY...LOWS THURSDAY 
NIGHT WILL BENEFIT FROM A SOUTHERLY FETCH. HIGHS FRIDAY WILL BENEFIT 
FROM THE SAME SOUTHERLY WINDS.

HAVE BEEN BUSY WITH SHORT TERM WEATHER AND COULD NOT GIVE GOOD 
ATTENTION TO THE EXTENDED. THUS LITTLE SIGNIFICANT CHANGE WAS MADE. 
LOOKS LIKE NEXT UPPER TROF AND FRONT WILL BE PAST THE AREA BY 
SATURDAY NIGHT SO CONTINUED DRY FORECAST FOR THEN. THE NEXT TROF AND 
COLD FRONT APPROACH SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY WITH THE FRONT MOVING 
THROUGH ON TUESDAY. UPSLOPE PATTERN BEGINS SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT 
WHICH WILL AFFECT AREAS WEST OF THE CWA THEN A WEAK SHORT WAVE ALONG 
THE GULF COAST BRINGS MOISTURE INTO THE AREA FOR MONDAY. PUT CHANCE 
POPS IN FOR MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. GFS PATTERN FOR NEXT TUESDAY 
LOOKS SIMILAR TO PATTERN OF THIS TUESDAY...BUT UPPER LOW IS PROGGED 
TO COME OUT FARTHER TO THE NORTH AND THE AIR IN PLACE LOOKS COOLER 
TO START WITH. WITH THE DYNAMICS MOVING NORTH AND THE AIR LESS 
UNSTABLE...SEVERE WEATHER THREAT DOES NOT LOOK GOOD AT THIS 
TIME...BUT WILL HAVE TO SEE HOW THIS UNFOLDS OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS. 
DID NOT FORECAST THUNDER WITH THE SYSTEM FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK FOR NOW.

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

220







FXUS64 KLZK 241010

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
406 AM CST WED NOV 24 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY
THE H5 LOW WEAKENED AND OPENED SOONER THAN EXPECTED. IT WILL SLIDE 
OFF TO THE NORTHEAST FASTER...SO THIS WILL HAVE THE RESULT OF ENDING 
PRECIPITATION OVER THE STATE QUICKER. THERE WILL BE SOME WRAP AROUND 
CLOUDS AND RAIN CHANCES...BUT THEY WILL END BY 00Z THU. A FAST ZONAL 
FLOW WILL SET UP ONCE THIS TROF MOVES OUT OF THE WAY. THE NEXT SHORT 
WAVE TO APPROACH THE STATE FROM THE WEST WILL BRING POPS BACK INTO 
THE FORECAST FOR FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. THE STRONG COLD FRONT 
WILL BRING WEST TO NORTHWEST WINDS TODAY...BUT THEY WILL NOT BE 
QUITE AS GUSTY AS THEY HAD BEEN SHOWN WITH PREVIOUS RUNS...SO THERE 
WILL BE NO NEED FOR LAKE WIND ADVISORIES AT THIS TIME. COLD AIR 
ADVECTION WILL BE STRONG...SO A FREEZE WARNING FOR MY NORTHERN AND 
WEST CENTRAL COUNTIES WILL BE ISSUED. MOISTURE WILL BE LEAVING OUR 
FORECAST AREA BEFORE THE COLD AIR ARRIVES...SO IT APPEARS WE WILL 
MISS AN ENCOUNTER WITH WINTRY PRECIPITATION THIS ROUND. TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE QUITE COLD BY THURSDAY MORNING ON ACCOUNT OF THE STRONG 
FRONT...BUT RETURN FLOW WILL SET UP RATHER QUICKLY...LOWS THURSDAY 
NIGHT WILL BENEFIT FROM A SOUTHERLY FETCH. HIGHS FRIDAY WILL BENEFIT 
FROM THE SAME SOUTHERLY WINDS.
&&

.LONG TERM...SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY
HAVE BEEN BUSY WITH SHORT TERM WEATHER AND COULD NOT GIVE GOOD 
ATTENTION TO THE EXTENDED. THUS LITTLE SIGNIFICANT CHANGE WAS MADE. 
LOOKS LIKE NEXT UPPER TROF AND FRONT WILL BE PAST THE AREA BY 
SATURDAY NIGHT SO CONTINUED DRY FORECAST FOR THEN. THE NEXT TROF AND 
COLD FRONT APPROACH SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY WITH THE FRONT MOVING 
THROUGH ON TUESDAY. UPSLOPE PATTERN BEGINS SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT 
WHICH WILL AFFECT AREAS WEST OF THE CWA THEN A WEAK SHORT WAVE ALONG 
THE GULF COAST BRINGS MOISTURE INTO THE AREA FOR MONDAY. PUT CHANCE 
POPS IN FOR MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. GFS PATTERN FOR NEXT TUESDAY 
LOOKS SIMILAR TO PATTERN OF THIS TUESDAY...BUT UPPER LOW IS PROGGED 
TO COME OUT FARTHER TO THE NORTH AND THE AIR IN PLACE LOOKS COOLER 
TO START WITH. WITH THE DYNAMICS MOVING NORTH AND THE AIR LESS 
UNSTABLE...SEVERE WEATHER THREAT DOES NOT LOOK GOOD AT THIS 
TIME...BUT WILL HAVE TO SEE HOW THIS UNFOLDS OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS. 
DID NOT FORECAST THUNDER WITH THE SYSTEM FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK FOR NOW.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    56  33  53  39 /  50  10  10  10 
HARRISON AR       45  26  50  37 /  70  10  10  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    56  33  53  39 /  50  10  10  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     59  35  54  40 /  40  10  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  47  28  50  37 /  70  10  10  10 
MONTICELLO AR     60  36  55  40 /  30  10  10  10 
SEARCY AR         55  33  52  38 /  60  10  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      55  32  53  39 /  50  10  10  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   51  29  51  38 /  60  10  10  10

ARZ021>024...ARZ030>031...ARZ037>041.

FLASH FLOOD WATCH UNTIL 600 AM CST WEDNESDAY FOR ZONES ARZ006>007...

32/29





237 
FXUS64 KLZK 240421 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1020 PM CST TUE NOV 23 2004

.DISCUSSION...
VERY HEAVY RAINFALL ACROSS MUCH OF THE SOUTHEASTERN 2/3 OF THE 
FORECAST AREA EARLIER TONIGHT. NEXT AREA OF RAINFALL OVER 
NORTHEASTERN TEXAS AND SOUTHEASTERN OKLAHOMA WILL AFFECT THE AREA 
OVERNIGHT. WITH SATURATED GROUND CONDITIONS...DECIDED TO ISSUE A 
FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR MUCH OF THE AREA FOR OVERNIGHT. AN ADDITIONAL 
INCH OR TWO OF RAINFALL WILL BE POSSIBLE. FORECAST FOR WEDNESDAY 
PRETTY MUCH ON TRACK WITH PRECIPITATION ENDING BY DAYS END. ALL 
UPDATES GONE.
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 234 PM CST TUE NOV 23 2004

SHORT TERM MODELS HAVE COME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT THIS AFTERNOON 
WITH THE SYSTEM PULLING OUT OF THE SOUTHWEST CONUS. BIGGEST 
DISCREPANCY CONTINUES TO BE IN THE QPF FIELDS WITH GFS DEVELOPING A 
BULLS EYE OVER THE RWHILE THE OTHER MODELS NOT REALLY PICKING UP ON. 
WITH THE OTHER PARAMETERS BEING IN SUCH GOOD AGREEMENT WILL GO WITH 
A BLEND OF SOLUTIONS WITH A LEAN TOWARDS THE SLIGHTLY SLOWER ETA.

FIRST WAVE OF LIGHT RAIN ENDED EARLY TODAY WITH MAIN SHOW STARTING 
TO COME IN FROM THE WEST. DEEP CONVECTION FIRED UP OVER EASTERN 
TEXAS/OKLAHOMA EARLY IN AN AREA OF FAVORABLE DYNAMICS ON THE NOSE OF 
A HIGH LEVEL JET STREAK ROUNDING THE BASE OF THE SOUTHWEST CONUS 
TROUGH. PRECIPITATION AREA AS FAR EAST AS WEST CENTRAL ARKANSAS. 
FEATURE CLEARLY SEEN ON WATER VAPOR IMAGERY THIS AFTERNOON SPINNING 
OVER THE NEW MEXICO/TEXAS BORDER...FAVORABLE DIVERGENT PATTERN ALSO 
SEEN ON WATER VAPOR CHANNEL.

CONVECTION FIRING UP ALONG A FRONTAL BOUNDARY STRETCHED OUT ACROSS 
EASTERN TEXAS. SURFACE LOW FORECAST TO DEVELOP IN NORTHEAST TEXAS 
LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND LIFT OUT IN ADVANCE OF THE MAIN UPPER 
SYSTEM. EXPECTING LINE OF STORMS TO SWEEP THROUGH THE CWA THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. SOUTHERN HALF OF THE CWA UNDER A TORNADO 
WATCH UNTIL 03Z AND THIS SEEMS REASONABLE WITH A WARM FRONT IN THE 
VICINITY TO HELP WITH ADDITIONAL LIFT. SEVERE WEATHER ALREADY 
CONFIRMED IN MONTOGERMY COUNTY AT THIS TIME.

UPPER WAVE MOVES INTO EXTREME NORTHWEST ARKANSAS BY MORNING WITH 
TROF AXIS PASSING THROUGH LATER WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. SURFACE 
REFLECTION OVER NORTHERN ARKANSAS BY WEDNESDAY MORNING WITH 
CONSIDERABLE DRY SLOT OVER THE STATE. DRY SLOT FILLS IN RATHER 
QUICKLY THOUGH AS MOISTURE WRAPS AROUND THE BACKSIDE OF THE 
DEPARTING LOW. WILL TAPER OFF POPS FROM NORTH TO SOUTH. RATHER TIGHT 
GRADIENT SPELLS A BREEZY DAY WITH COLD AIR ADVECTION PATTERN IN THE 
WAKE OF THE SYSTEM. TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY TO BE ESPECIALLY TRICKY 
WITH VERY LITTLE WARMING EXPECTED OVER THE NORTH AND MINIMAL WARMING 
ELSEWHERE. MAV NUMBERS RUNNING A FEW DEGREES COOLER THAN THE FWC 
GUIDANCE AND APPEARS MORE REASONABLE AND AS SUCH WILL LEAN ITS WAY. 

HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE GULF COAST WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THANKSGIVING DAY WITH CLEARING SKIES. TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
WILL FALL INTO THE UPPER 20S OVER THE NORTH. FREEZE WARNINGS MAY 
NEED TO BE HOISTED. HIGH MOVES OFF TO THE EAST BY LATE THURSDAY WITH 
SOUTHERLY SURFACE WINDS RETURNING LATE BUT COOL CONDITIONS STILL 
EXPECTED. WEAK WAVE MOVES THROUGH ON NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT BUT 
MOISTURE IS LIMITED. 

ZONAL FLOW ALOFT FOR FRIDAY BUT ANOTHER DRY BUT COOL DAY. NEXT TROF 
APPROACHES FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. SYSTEM NOT NEARLY AS 
IMPRESSIVE AS STORM MOVING THROUGH NOW BUT ENOUGH MOISTURE AND 
DYNAMICS AROUND TO JUSTIFY SCATTERED POPS. TEMPERATURES TO REMAIN 
COOL.  

BY EARLY SUNDAY...THE PREFERRED GFSLR MODEL SHOWS ARKANSAS UNDER A 
NEARLY ZONAL UPPER LEVEL FLOW WITH A LIMITED AMOUNT OF MEAN RH. AN 
AREA OF SOMEWHAT HIGHER MOISTURE IS HOWEVER AT THAT TIME EXPECTED TO 
BE MOVING ACROSS OKLAHOMA TOWARDS ARKANSAS. BY MONDAY MORNING...A 
CUT-OFF H5 LOW HAS DEVELOPED AND DROPPED SOUTHEASTWARD INTO THE FOUR 
CORNERS REGION...WITH UPPER FLOW OVER ARKANSAS NOW BECOMING MORE OF 
A SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST FLOW. THE HIGHER MOISTURE IS NOW MAINLY 
CONCENTRATED OVER THE NORTHWESTERN SECTIONS OF ARKANSAS. A DRIER 
AIRMASS WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION BY TUESDAY. NEAR NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES WILL PREVAIL SUNDAY AND MONDAY...WITH COOLER THAN 
NORMAL WEATHER EXPECTED BY TUESDAY.   

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...FLASH FLOOD WATCH UNTIL 600 AM 
CST WEDNESDAY FOR ZONES ARZ006>007...ARZ014>016...ARZ023>025... 
ARZ031>034...ARZ039>047...ARZ0 52>057...ARZ062>069.

&&

$$

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
234 PM CST TUE NOV 23 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...

WITH THE SYSTEM PULLING OUT OF THE SOUTHWEST CONUS. BIGGEST

.LONG TERM...SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...
BY EARLY SUNDAY...THE PREFERRED GFSLR MODEL SHOWS ARKANSAS UNDER A 
NEARLY ZONAL UPPER LEVEL FLOW WITH A LIMITED AMOUNT OF MEAN RH. AN 
AREA OF SOMEWHAT HIGHER MOISTURE IS HOWEVER AT THAT TIME EXPECTED TO

A SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST FLOW. THE HIGHER MOISTURE IS NOW MAINLY 
CONCENTRATED OVER THE NORTHWESTERN SECTIONS OF ARKANSAS. A DRIER 
AIRMASS WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION BY TUESDAY. NEAR NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES WILL PREVAIL SUNDAY AND MONDAY...WITH COOLER THAN 
NORMAL WEATHER EXPECTED BY TUESDAY.   
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    50  57  34  52 /  80  70  10  10 
HARRISON AR       43  45  27  49 /  90  90  20  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    50  57  33  52 /  80  60  10  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     53  60  36  53 /  80  50  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  44  46  28  49 /  90  90  30  10 
MONTICELLO AR     55  61  37  54 /  80  40  10  10 
SEARCY AR         49  55  33  51 /  80  70  20  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      50  56  32  51 /  80  60  10  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   47  52  30  50 /  80  80  10  10

56/38






000 
FXUS64 KLZK 232037
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
234 PM CST TUE NOV 23 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...
SHORT TERM MODELS HAVE COME INTO BETTER AGREEMENT THIS AFTERNOON 
WITH THE SYSTEM PULLING OUT OF THE SOUTHWEST CONUS. BIGGEST 
DISCREPANCY CONTINUES TO BE IN THE QPF FIELDS WITH GFS DEVELOPING A 
BULLS EYE OVER THE RWHILE THE OTHER MODELS NOT REALLY PICKING UP ON. 
WITH THE OTHER PARAMETERS BEING IN SUCH GOOD AGREEMENT WILL GO WITH 
A BLEND OF SOLUTIONS WITH A LEAN TOWARDS THE SLIGHTLY SLOWER ETA.

FIRST WAVE OF LIGHT RAIN ENDED EARLY TODAY WITH MAIN SHOW STARTING 
TO COME IN FROM THE WEST. DEEP CONVECTION FIRED UP OVER EASTERN 
TEXAS/OKLAHOMA EARLY IN AN AREA OF FAVORABLE DYNAMICS ON THE NOSE OF 
A HIGH LEVEL JET STREAK ROUNDING THE BASE OF THE SOUTHWEST CONUS 
TROUGH. PRECIPITATION AREA AS FAR EAST AS WEST CENTRAL ARKANSAS. 
FEATURE CLEARLY SEEN ON WATER VAPOR IMAGERY THIS AFTERNOON SPINNING 
OVER THE NEW MEXICO/TEXAS BORDER...FAVORABLE DIVERGENT PATTERN ALSO 
SEEN ON WATER VAPOR CHANNEL.

CONVECTION FIRING UP ALONG A FRONTAL BOUNDARY STRETCHED OUT ACROSS 
EASTERN TEXAS. SURFACE LOW FORECAST TO DEVELOP IN NORTHEAST TEXAS 
LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND LIFT OUT IN ADVANCE OF THE MAIN UPPER 
SYSTEM. EXPECTING LINE OF STORMS TO SWEEP THROUGH THE CWA THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. SOUTHERN HALF OF THE CWA UNDER A TORNADO 
WATCH UNTIL 03Z AND THIS SEEMS REASONABLE WITH A WARM FRONT IN THE 
VICINITY TO HELP WITH ADDITIONAL LIFT. SEVERE WEATHER ALREADY 
CONFIRMED IN MONTOGERMY COUNTY AT THIS TIME.

UPPER WAVE MOVES INTO EXTREME NORTHWEST ARKANSAS BY MORNING WITH 
TROF AXIS PASSING THROUGH LATER WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. SURFACE 
REFLECTION OVER NORTHERN ARKANSAS BY WEDNESDAY MORNING WITH 
CONSIDERABLE DRY SLOT OVER THE STATE. DRY SLOT FILLS IN RATHER 
QUICKLY THOUGH AS MOISTURE WRAPS AROUND THE BACKSIDE OF THE 
DEPARTING LOW. WILL TAPER OFF POPS FROM NORTH TO SOUTH. RATHER TIGHT 
GRADIENT SPELLS A BREEZY DAY WITH COLD AIR ADVECTION PATTERN IN THE 
WAKE OF THE SYSTEM. TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY TO BE ESPECIALLY TRICKY 
WITH VERY LITTLE WARMING EXPECTED OVER THE NORTH AND MINIMAL WARMING 
ELSEWHERE. MAV NUMBERS RUNNING A FEW DEGREES COOLER THAN THE FWC 
GUIDANCE AND APPEARS MORE REASONABLE AND AS SUCH WILL LEAN ITS WAY. 

HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE GULF COAST WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THANKSGIVING DAY WITH CLEARING SKIES. TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
WILL FALL INTO THE UPPER 20S OVER THE NORTH. FREEZE WARNINGS MAY 
NEED TO BE HOISTED. HIGH MOVES OFF TO THE EAST BY LATE THURSDAY WITH 
SOUTHERLY SURFACE WINDS RETURNING LATE BUT COOL CONDITIONS STILL 
EXPECTED. WEAK WAVE MOVES THROUGH ON NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT BUT 
MOISTURE IS LIMITED. 

ZONAL FLOW ALOFT FOR FRIDAY BUT ANOTHER DRY BUT COOL DAY. NEXT TROF 
APPROACHES FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY. SYSTEM NOT NEARLY AS 
IMPRESSIVE AS STORM MOVING THROUGH NOW BUT ENOUGH MOISTURE AND 
DYNAMICS AROUND TO JUSTIFY SCATTERED POPS. TEMPERATURES TO REMAIN 
COOL.  
&&

.LONG TERM...SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...
BY EARLY SUNDAY...THE PREFERRED GFSLR MODEL SHOWS ARKANSAS UNDER A 
NEARLY ZONAL UPPER LEVEL FLOW WITH A LIMITED AMOUNT OF MEAN RH. AN 
AREA OF SOMEWHAT HIGHER MOISTURE IS HOWEVER AT THAT TIME EXPECTED TO 
BE MOVING ACROSS OKLAHOMA TOWARDS ARKANSAS. BY MONDAY MORNING...A 
CUT-OFF H5 LOW HAS DEVELOPED AND DROPPED SOUTHEASTWARD INTO THE FOUR 
CORNERS REGION...WITH UPPER FLOW OVER ARKANSAS NOW BECOMING MORE OF 
A SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST FLOW. THE HIGHER MOISTURE IS NOW MAINLY 
CONCENTRATED OVER THE NORTHWESTERN SECTIONS OF ARKANSAS. A DRIER 
AIRMASS WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION BY TUESDAY. NEAR NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES WILL PREVAIL SUNDAY AND MONDAY...WITH COOLER THAN 
NORMAL WEATHER EXPECTED BY TUESDAY.   
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    50  57  34  52 /  80  70  10  10 
HARRISON AR       43  45  27  49 /  90  90  20  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    50  57  33  52 /  80  60  10  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     53  60  36  53 /  80  50  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  44  46  28  49 /  90  90  30  10 
MONTICELLO AR     55  61  37  54 /  80  40  10  10

BEGINS TO LIFT OUT. TEMPERATURE FORECAST WILL CONTINUE TO BE QUITE 
TRICKY BUT FOR NOW WILL LEAVE ALL OVER FORECAST PARAMETERS IN PLACE.

649 
FXUS64 KLZK 231423
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
819 AM CST TUE NOV 23 2004

.DISCUSSION...
QUICK UPDATE THIS MORNING TO CANCEL DENSE FOG ADVISORY. FOG HAS 
LIFTED ACROSS MOST OF THE CWA EXCEPT FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. FOG 
IS NOT WIDESPREAD ENOUGH TO JUSTIFY AN ADVISORY. REST OF THE 
FORECAST ON TRACK FOR NOW.  
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 343 AM CST TUE NOV 23 2004

UPPER LOW OVER THE SOUTHERN ROCKIES WILL BE MOVING NORTHEAST AND 
OPENING UP AS IT GETS CAUGHT UP IN THE NORTHERN FLOW ALOFT BY 
WEDNESDAY MORNING. THE SOUTHERN STREAM FEATURE WILL CONTINUE PHASING 
IN WITH THE NORTHERN STREAM AND IT WILL BE GETTING OUT OF OUR 
WEATHER PICTURE. ZONAL FLOW WILL RETURN IN THE WAKE OF THE LOW AND 
TROF. A SHORT WAVE WILL BE APPROACHING FROM THE WEST BY FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON...BUT IT WILL NOT BRING ANY RAIN CHANCES UNTIL FRIDAY 
NIGHT. THE SURFACE PATTERN IS COMPLEX AND IT WILL BE THE FOCUS OF 
MOST OF OUR WEATHER IN THE NEXT DAY OR TWO. INITIALLY...WE WILL HAVE 
TO DEAL WITH THE CURRENT LOW CLOUDS...RAIN AND FOG. I WILL KEEP THE 
DENSE FOG ADVISORY THAT IS IN EFFECT ALREADY FOR THE ENTIRE CWA 
UNTIL MID MORNING (10A). SOME FOG MAY LINGER AFTER THAT TIME...BUT 
IT WILL NOT BE DENSE ENOUGH TO RESTRICT VISIBILITY TO ADVISORY 
CRITERION. TEMPERATURES TODAY WILL BE SLIGHTLY LOWER THAN MOS 
NUMBERS SHOW IN LIGHT OF YESTERDAYS LACK OF WARMING WITH THE CLOUDS 
FOG AND DRIZZLE OR LIGHT RAIN. A COLD FRONT WILL DROP INTO THE 
NORTHWEST PART OF THE STATE TONIGHT...SO LOWS WILL RANGE WIDELY BY 
WEDNESDAY MORNING. COLD ADVECTION WILL BE FELT STRONGER IN THE 
NORTHWEST SO TEMPERATURES THERE WILL RISE LITTLE FROM THEIR MORNING 
LOWS. CENTRAL AND SOUTH ARKANSAS WILL BENEFIT FROM SOME TEMPERATURE 
RISE IN THE DRY SLOT. GRADIENT WILL BE STRONG AROUND THE SURFACE LOW 
FROM MIDDAY WEDNESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY EVENING...RESULTING IN 
NOTICEABLE WIND CHILLS. WEDNESDAY NIGHT WILL BE A RATHER COLD NIGHT 
FOR ALL SECTIONS OF THE STATE. FREEZING TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE 
NORTHWEST MAY REQUIRE A FREEZE WARNING FOR THAT PART OF THE STATE 
SINCE WE HAVE BEEN EXPERIENCING ABOVE NORMAL LOWS. HIGHS THURSDAY 
WILL BEGIN TO BENEFIT FROM RETURN FLOW ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE 
SURFACE RIDGE TO OUR SOUTH...AND LOWS THURSDAY NIGHT WILL STAY ABOVE 
FREEZING FOR THE SAME REASON. HIGHS FRIDAY WILL CONTINUE A SLIGHT 
WARMING TREND.

A COUPLE OF COLD FRONTS WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA IN THE EXTENDED. 
EACH WILL BE ACCOMPANIED BY SOME MOISTURE AND WILL HAVE SOME CHANCE 
POPS WITH EACH. TIMING RIGHT NOW LOOKS LIKE LATE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO 
SATURDAY FOR THE FIRST FRONT AND SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY FOR THE 
SECOND FRONT. A WEAK SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES OVER THE 
AREA SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. COLD AND DRY AIR SHOULD ACCOMPANY 
THAT AND LOWERED TEMP AND DEW POINT FORECASTS TO ACCOUNT FOR THAT 
AND MAY NOT BE COLD ENOUGH. OTHERWISE TEMPS IN THE EXTENDED PERIOD 
WILL RUN NEAR OR A LITTLE BELOW NORMAL.

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

878 
FXUS64 KLZK 230320 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
920 PM CST MON NOV 22 2004

.DISCUSSION...
QUICK UPDATE TO CLEAN UP TONIGHTS WORDING IN TEXT PRODUCTS. ALSO 
TWEAKED MINIMUM TEMPERATURES FOR OVERNIGHT IN A FEW AREAS. ALL 
UPDATES GONE. 
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 720 PM CST MON NOV 22 2004

FOG IS CONTINUING TO FORM AND BECOME DENSER. DECIDED TO ISSUE A 
DENSE FOG ADVISORY FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA UNTIL MID MORNING ON 
TUESDAY. THOSE AREAS THAT HAVE NOT FOGGED IN YET SHOULD BE FOGGING 
IN AS THE NIGHT PROGRESSES. ALL UPDATES GONE.

ISSUED AT 255 PM CST MON NOV 22 2004

AFTER A RATHER MILD NOVEMBER THUS FAR...BIG CHANGES ARE COMING IN 
THE NEXT FEW DAYS. MUCH COLDER AIR WILL ROLL INTO ARKANSAS BY 
MIDWEEK...WITH FREEZING TEMPERATURES IN NORTHERN/WESTERN ARKANSAS
BY THANKSGIVING MORNING. 

IN THE SHORT TERM...STATIONARY FRONT NEAR ARKANSAS/LOUISIANA BORDER 
WILL NOT MOVE MUCH TONIGHT/TUESDAY MORNING. NORTH OF THE 
FRONT...RAIN WILL DEVELOP OVERNIGHT AND WILL BECOME WIDESPREAD. 
AREAS OF FOG WILL ALSO FORM...WITH TEMPERATURES SHOWING VERY LITTLE 
FLUCTUATION. 

TOWARD TUESDAY AFTERNOON...RATHER VIGOROUS SYSTEM ALOFT WILL MOVE 
FROM TEXAS PANHANDLE INTO CENTRAL TEXAS...AND WILL BECOME NEGATIVELY 
TILTED. SURFACE LOW WILL BEGIN INTENSIFYING IN NORTHEAST TEXAS...AND 
WILL HEAD ACROSS SOUTHERN ARKANSAS TUESDAY EVENING. 

MODELS DIVERGING ON HOW FAR NORTH LOW WILL DEVELOP...WHICH WILL HAVE 
A BEARING ON WHERE SEVERE WEATHER WILL OCCUR TUESDAY 
AFTERNOON/NIGHT. AT THIS TIME...WILL STICK WITH KEEPING LOW IN 
SOUTHERN COUNTIES...WITH SEVERE STORMS MAINLY CONFINED TO AREAS 
ALONG THE GULF COAST. FROM EASTERN TEXAS TO LOUISIANA/MISSISSIPPI...
SQUALL LINE WILL BE LIKELY WITH TORNADOES POSSIBLE. IN ARKANSAS... 
LOOKS MORE LIKE A RAIN/ISOLATED THUNDER EVENT. RAIN MAY BE HEAVY IN 
SOUTHERN ARKANSAS.

LOW WILL EXIT TO THE NORTHEAST ON WEDNESDAY. MUCH COLDER AIR WILL 
WRAP AROUND THE SYSTEM...WITH MOISTURE STICKING AROUND OVER NORTHERN 
ARKANSAS. GOING WITH RAIN LIKELY NORTH OF LITTLE ROCK ON 
WEDNESDAY...WITH SNOWFLAKES NORTH OF THE BORDER IN MISSOURI. IN 
ADDITION TO SOME LEFTOVER PRECIPITATION...WILL ALSO BE BREEZY... 
MAKING IT FEEL EVEN COLDER.

WEDNESDAY NIGHT...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO REGION...WITH SKY 
CLEARING/WIND DIMINISHING. TEMPERATURES WILL LIKELY DROP BELOW 
FREEZING IN NORTHERN/WESTERN ARKANSAS...WITH MID/UPPER 30S 
ELSEWHERE. 

COLD AIR WILL NOT STICK AROUND LONG...WITH RETURN FLOW SETTING UP AS 
WEEKEND APPROACHES. NEXT FRONT INTO ARKANSAS FROM THE PLAINS OVER 
THE WEEKEND WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS. (46)           

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

22






000 
FXUS64 KLZK 230320 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
920 PM CST MON NOV 22 2004

.DISCUSSION...
QUICK UPDATE TO CLEAN UP TONIGHTS WORDING IN TEXT PRODUCTS. ALSO 
TWEAKED MINIMUM TEMPERATURES FOR OVERNIGHT IN A FEW AREAS. ALL 
UPDATES GONE. 
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 720 PM CST MON NOV 22 2004

FOG IS CONTINUING TO FORM AND BECOME DENSER. DECIDED TO ISSUE A 
DENSE FOG ADVISORY FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA UNTIL MID MORNING ON 
TUESDAY. THOSE AREAS THAT HAVE NOT FOGGED IN YET SHOULD BE FOGGING 
IN AS THE NIGHT PROGRESSES. ALL UPDATES GONE.

ISSUED AT 255 PM CST MON NOV 22 2004

AFTER A RATHER MILD NOVEMBER THUS FAR...BIG CHANGES ARE COMING IN 
THE NEXT FEW DAYS. MUCH COLDER AIR WILL ROLL INTO ARKANSAS BY 
MIDWEEK...WITH FREEZING TEMPERATURES IN NORTHERN/WESTERN ARKANSAS
BY THANKSGIVING MORNING. 

IN THE SHORT TERM...STATIONARY FRONT NEAR ARKANSAS/LOUISIANA BORDER 
WILL NOT MOVE MUCH TONIGHT/TUESDAY MORNING. NORTH OF THE 
FRONT...RAIN WILL DEVELOP OVERNIGHT AND WILL BECOME WIDESPREAD. 
AREAS OF FOG WILL ALSO FORM...WITH TEMPERATURES SHOWING VERY LITTLE 
FLUCTUATION. 

TOWARD TUESDAY AFTERNOON...RATHER VIGOROUS SYSTEM ALOFT WILL MOVE 
FROM TEXAS PANHANDLE INTO CENTRAL TEXAS...AND WILL BECOME NEGATIVELY 
TILTED. SURFACE LOW WILL BEGIN INTENSIFYING IN NORTHEAST TEXAS...AND 
WILL HEAD ACROSS SOUTHERN ARKANSAS TUESDAY EVENING. 

MODELS DIVERGING ON HOW FAR NORTH LOW WILL DEVELOP...WHICH WILL HAVE 
A BEARING ON WHERE SEVERE WEATHER WILL OCCUR TUESDAY 
AFTERNOON/NIGHT. AT THIS TIME...WILL STICK WITH KEEPING LOW IN 
SOUTHERN COUNTIES...WITH SEVERE STORMS MAINLY CONFINED TO AREAS 
ALONG THE GULF COAST. FROM EASTERN TEXAS TO LOUISIANA/MISSISSIPPI...
SQUALL LINE WILL BE LIKELY WITH TORNADOES POSSIBLE. IN ARKANSAS... 
LOOKS MORE LIKE A RAIN/ISOLATED THUNDER EVENT. RAIN MAY BE HEAVY IN 
SOUTHERN ARKANSAS.

LOW WILL EXIT TO THE NORTHEAST ON WEDNESDAY. MUCH COLDER AIR WILL 
WRAP AROUND THE SYSTEM...WITH MOISTURE STICKING AROUND OVER NORTHERN 
ARKANSAS. GOING WITH RAIN LIKELY NORTH OF LITTLE ROCK ON 
WEDNESDAY...WITH SNOWFLAKES NORTH OF THE BORDER IN MISSOURI. IN 
ADDITION TO SOME LEFTOVER PRECIPITATION...WILL ALSO BE BREEZY... 
MAKING IT FEEL EVEN COLDER.

WEDNESDAY NIGHT...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO REGION...WITH SKY 
CLEARING/WIND DIMINISHING. TEMPERATURES WILL LIKELY DROP BELOW 
FREEZING IN NORTHERN/WESTERN ARKANSAS...WITH MID/UPPER 30S 
ELSEWHERE. 

COLD AIR WILL NOT STICK AROUND LONG...WITH RETURN FLOW SETTING UP AS 
WEEKEND APPROACHES. NEXT FRONT INTO ARKANSAS FROM THE PLAINS OVER 
THE WEEKEND WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS. (46)           

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KLZK 221636 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1030 AM CST MON NOV 22 2004

.DISCUSSION...
GOING FORECAST OK FOR THE MOST PART. RAIN WILL REMAIN LIKELY FROM 
CENTRAL INTO SOUTHERN ARKANSAS THIS AFTERNOON...WITH PATCHY FOG AS 
WELL. WITH LOTS OF CLOUDS...TEMPERATURES WILL ONLY GO UP A COUPLE OF 
DEGREES FROM CURRENT READINGS...WITH LOWER 50S TO MID 60S COMMON.

FOG WILL REDEVELOP TONIGHT WITH RAIN BECOMING WIDESPREAD. 
TEMPERATURES WILL CHANGE LITTLE...AND MAY EVEN RISE AFTER MIDNIGHT. 

STORM SYSTEM WILL INTENSIFY OVER CENTRAL TEXAS TUESDAY/TUESDAY 
NIGHT...AND WILL EVENTUALLY TRACK ACROSS SOUTHERN ARKANSAS. AT THIS 
POINT...SOME SEVERE WEATHER POSSIBLE IN THE SOUTHERN COUNTIES...BUT 
MAINLY ALONG THE GULF COAST. 

AFTER SYSTEM LIFTS TO THE NORTHEAST...COLDER AIR WILL WRAP AROUND 
THE SYSTEM WEDNESDAY/WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WITH SOME SUNSHINE/BELOW 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES THANKSGIVING DAY. (46)
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE. 
&&

$$

46






000 
FXUS64 KLZK 221636 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1030 AM CST MON NOV 22 2004

.DISCUSSION...
GOING FORECAST OK FOR THE MOST PART. RAIN WILL REMAIN LIKELY FROM 
CENTRAL INTO SOUTHERN ARKANSAS THIS AFTERNOON...WITH PATCHY FOG AS 
WELL. WITH LOTS OF CLOUDS...TEMPERATURES WILL ONLY GO UP A COUPLE OF 
DEGREES FROM CURRENT READINGS...WITH LOWER 50S TO MID 60S COMMON.

FOG WILL REDEVELOP TONIGHT WITH RAIN BECOMING WIDESPREAD. 
TEMPERATURES WILL CHANGE LITTLE...AND MAY EVEN RISE AFTER MIDNIGHT. 

STORM SYSTEM WILL INTENSIFY OVER CENTRAL TEXAS TUESDAY/TUESDAY 
NIGHT...AND WILL EVENTUALLY TRACK ACROSS SOUTHERN ARKANSAS. AT THIS 
POINT...SOME SEVERE WEATHER POSSIBLE IN THE SOUTHERN COUNTIES...BUT 
MAINLY ALONG THE GULF COAST. 

AFTER SYSTEM LIFTS TO THE NORTHEAST...COLDER AIR WILL WRAP AROUND 
THE SYSTEM WEDNESDAY/WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WITH SOME SUNSHINE/BELOW 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES THANKSGIVING DAY. (46)
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

46






316 
FXUS64 KLZK 220947
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
400 AM CST MON NOV 22 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY
WEATHER THE NEXT THREE DAYS WILL BE AFFECTED BY THE BEHAVIOR OF THE
STRONG UPPER LOW OVER SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA THIS MORNING. IT IS EXPECTED
TO COME EAST AND MOVE OVER NORTHWESTERN ARKANSAS LATE TUESDAY NIGHT 
INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING. SINCE THE SYSTEM IS NOT COMING OUT YET...THERE
ARE STILL UNCERTAINTIES ON TIMING AND LOCATION OF THE UPPER LOW AS
IT MOVES ACROSS THE SOUTH CENTRAL U.S.  UNTIL THIS LOW BEGINS TO
APPROACH...THE AREA WILL BE IN AN OVERRUNNING PATTERN WITH A NEARLY
STATIONARY FRONT TO THE SOUTH. THIS WILL LIKELY LAST INTO TUESDAY.
DO NOT SEE MUCH CHANGE IN THE WEATHER UNTIL THEN. LOW CLOUDS
WILL CONTINUE. MOST AREAS HAVE RATHER DENSE FOG THIS MORNING AND
WILL ISSUE A DENSE FOG ADVISORY THROUGH MUCH OF THE MORNING FOR
THE WHOLE AREA ALTHOUGH NOT EVERYONE WILL MEET VISIBILITY 
CRITERIA. WITH THIS OVERRUNNING PATTERN CONTINUING...SOME FOG MAY
PERSIST THROUGH THE DAY INTO TONIGHT AND TUESDAY. AS FOR POPS...
WILL HAVE THE HIGHEST POPS CLOSEST TO THE FRONT WHERE MOISTURE
IS MORE PLENTIFUL DECREASING TO CHANCE POPS IN THE NORTH. LOOK FOR 
MOSTLY LIGHT AMOUNTS OF RAIN TODAY. ALSO...THERE SHOULD BE LITTLE
OR NO INSTABILITY...SO WILL NOT MENTION THUNDER. TEMPS SHOULD NOT 
RISE MUCH AND WENT WITH MAXES CLOSE TO THOSE OF YESTERDAY. FOR
TONIGHT...SHORT WAVES MOVE INTO THE AREA AND MOISTURE INCREASES. 
THIS WILL RESTULT IN POSSIBLY HEAVIER RAINS...BUT AT THIS TIME
IT STILL LOOKS LIKE THE REAL HEAVY RAIN WILL STAY TO THE SOUTH. 
WENT WITH LIKELY POPS IN THE NORTH INCREASING TO CATEGORICAL IN
THE SOUTH. PUT IN ISOLATED THUNDER FOR ABOUT THE SOUTHERN HALF
FOR SOME ELEVATED CONVECTION. WENT CLOSE TO PERSISTENCE FOR 
MINS. ON TUESDAY...THE MAIN UPPER LOW WILL APPROACH THE AREA. 
THE LOW WILL BE COMING IN FARTHER TO THE SOUTH AND INDICATIONS
ARE THAT THIS CWA WILL STAY IN THE COOL SECTOR FOR MOST OF THE
DAY. WILL SEE INCREASE IN RAIN AND HEAVY RAIN THREAT WILL INCREASE. 
DO NOT SEE MUCH CHANCE OF SEVERE WEATHER DURING THE DAY TUESDAY.
GENERALLY WENT BETWEEN MAV AND FWC FOR MAXES. WOULD LOOK FOR A 
RAPID MOVING SQUALL LINE TO DEVELOP WITH THE PACIFIC FRONT ON 
TUESDAY SOMEWHERE IN TEXAS. THIS SHOULD PUSH ACROSS LOUISIANA 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WILL LIKELY EXTEND SOMEWHERE INTO ARKANSAS. 
LOOKS LIKE NORTHERN EXTENT OF THE SQUALL LINE WILL BE IN CENTRAL
OR SOUTHERN ARKANSAS AND THE BEST CHANCE FOR SEVERE WEATHER WITH
IT WILL BE IN SOUTHERN AND EASTERN SECTIONS WITH A STRONG SURFACE
LOW DEVELOPING IN ARKANSAS. THE WARM FRONT MAY NOT GET FAR NORTH 
EXCEPT IN EASTERN SECTIONS WHICH IS OFTEN THE CASE. THE NORTHERN 
HALF OF THE AREA MAY STAY IN THE COOL SECTOR WHICH WILL LIMIT 
INSTABILITY AND SEVERE WEATHER. MAIN CHANCE OF SEVERE MAY BE
HAIL PRODUCING THUNDERSTORMS WITH MAYBE AN ISOLATED BOW ECHO 
OR TWO. WILL HAVE CATEGORICAL POPS WITH SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
MENTIONED. SINCE CONFIDENCE IN SEVERE THREAT IS NOT SO HIGH FOR
THIS AREA...WILL NOT MENTION SEVERE IN THE ZONES BUT WILL HIT IT
IN THE HWO AND WEATHER SUMMARIES. APPEARS THE SQUALL LINE SHOULD
RACE WELL EAST OF THE AREA BY LATE TUESDAY NIGHT AND ENDED ALL
THUNDER BY 12Z WEDNESDAY. GOING INTO WEDNESDAY...WRAP AROUND
MOISTURE WILL BE THE MAIN PLAYER AS THE UPPER LOW MOVES ACROSS 
NORTHERN ARKANSAS AND WEAKENS. STILL LOOKS LIKE THE LOW WILL
MOVE ENOUGH TO THE NORTH AND COLD ENOUGH AIR WILL STAY AWAY ENOUGH
TO NOT HAVE TO WORRY ABOUT A CHANGE TO WINTER PRECIP IN THE 
NORTH...BUT IT COULD GET CLOSE IN THE EXTREME NORTH. WILL KEEP SOME 
POPS IN CENTRAL AND NORTHERN AREAS FOR WEDNESDAY. WENT WITH NEARLY
STEADY OR SLOWLY FALLING TEMPS. COLDER AIR SHOULD MOVE IN WEDNESDAY
NIGHT AND THANKSGIVING AS THE UPPER LOW MOVES AWAY. MUCH OF THE 
NORTH MAY HAVE A FREEZE THURSDAY MORNING.     
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY
ONE SHORT WAVE WILL BE LEAVING OUR VICINITY THURSDAY NIGHT AND THE 
FLOW BECOMES ZONAL UNTIL THE NEXT WAVE TAKES SHAPE FOR THE WEEK END. 
BY 12Z SUNDAY...THE NEXT TROF WILL INTENSIFY AND IT WILL PUSH 
NORTHEAST FROM THE OK PAN HANDLE TO KMKC TO SOUTH CENTRAL WISCONSIN. 
IT WILL PRODUCE A SURFACE LOW THAT WILL TRACK FROM CENTRAL KANSAS TO 
THE GREAT LAKES AREA. THIS WILL BRING A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS 
SUNDAY JUST AHEAD OF THE DRY SURGE...AND A CHANCE OF SHOWERS IN ITS 
WAKE WITH WRAP AROUND MOISTURE FOR LATE SUNDAY. WINDS WILL BE A 
CONCERN WITH THIS SURFACE FEATURE AS WELL...SO GRIDS HAVE FAIRLY 
STRONG SURFACE WINDS BEGINNING 06Z SUNDAY INTO THE END OF THE 
FORECAST PERIOD. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    57  52  63  53 /  60  70  90  90 
HARRISON AR       53  48  57  44 /  30  60  90  90 
HOT SPRINGS AR    58  53  63  52 /  60  70  90  90 
PINE BLUFF AR     60  54  65  55 /  60  80  90  90 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  53  48  57  44 /  30  60  90  90 
MONTICELLO AR     62  55  69  56 /  70  80  90  80 
SEARCY AR         56  51  63  52 /  50  70  90  90 
MOUNT IDA AR      58  53  63  52 /  60  70  90  90 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   56  51  61  49 /  50  70  90  90 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...DENSE FOG ADVISORY UNTIL 1000 AM 
CST TODAY FOR ZONES 
ARZ003>007...ARZ012>016...ARZ021>025...ARZ030>034...ARZ037>047...
ARZ052>057...ARZ062>069. 
&&

$$

29/32








097 
FXUS64 KLZK 220324 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
925 PM CST SUN NOV 21 2004

.DISCUSSION...
QUICK UPDATE TO CLEAN UP TONIGHTS WORDING ON TEXT FORECASTS...AND 
TWEAK OVERNIGHT TEMPERATURES. ALL UPDATES OUT.
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 250 PM CST SUN NOV 21 2004

LOW CLOUDS AND CHILLY NELY SFC FLOW PREVAILS ACRS THE FA THIS AFTN. 
SOME PATCHY LIGHT RAIN ALSO NOTED. TEMPS HAVE ONLY MANAGED A FEW 
DEGREES OF RECOVERY FROM MRNG LOWS...WITH MID-AFTN READINGS IN THE 
50S TO LOWER 60S.

MODELS CONT TO INDC THAT SWLY FLOW ALOFT WL PREVAIL ACRS THE 
MID-SOUTH THE NEXT FEW DAYS WITH PARENT UPPER LOW SITUATED OVR THE 
SWRN STATES. SEVERAL SHRTWVS ARE FCST TO MOVE NEWD ACRS AR IN THE 
SHORT TERM. EACH UPPER FEATURE WILL INTERACT WITH SFC FNT S OF AR TO 
PRODUCE A CONTD OVERRUNNING PATTERN.

THE NEXT UPPER WAVE IS FCST TO PASS S OF THE AREA LATER TNGT AND 
MON. HAVE CONTD TRENDS OF GOING FCST WITH HIGHEST POPS MENTIONED OVR 
SRN AR AND LOWER CHCS TO THE N. ANOTHER ROUND OF RAINFALL WILL 
AFFECT THE AREA MON NIGHT INTO TUE ASSOCD WITH THE NEXT UPPER WAVE.

MAIN UPPER LOW HEADS INTO THE SRN PLAINS ON TUE AND CONTS NEWD TUE 
NIGHT AND WED. DIFFERENCES NOTED BETWEEN THE ETA AND GFS WITH 
EVENTUALLY TRACK OF UPPER LOW. ETA IS FURTHER N WITH UPPER/SFC LOW 
TRACK AS COMPARED TO THE GFS SOLUTION. AT THIS POINT...HAVE USED A 
BLEND OF BOTH SOLUTIONS AND EXPECT MODELS TO COME INTO BETTER 
AGREEMENT THE NEXT RUNS. EVENTUAL TRACK OF THIS SYS WILL DETERMINE 
THE POTENTIAL FOR SVR WX.

UPPER SYS AND ASSOCD SFC CDFNT MOVES E OF THE LATE TUE NIGHT AND 
WED...ALLOWING COLDER AIR TO MOVE IN. HAVE LEFT SOME CHC POPS IN FOR 
WRAPAROUND PRECIP LATE TUE NIGHT INTO WED. APPEARS THAT THE CHC OF 
ANY WINTRY PRECIP WL STAY JUST TO THE NW OF THE FA ATTM...BUT WILL 
BEAR WATCHING.

NORTHWEST FLOW DOMINATES THROUGH FRIDAY. HIGH PRESSURE MOVES INTO 
THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT...BRINGING IN SUBSIDENCE AND DRIER AIR. 
HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE THROUGH MUCH OF FRIDAY...AS THE UPPER 
TROUGH MOVES TO THE EAST COAST. A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE 
AREA FRIDAY AFTERNOON BUT WILL WASH OUT AS HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS. A 
SURFACE LOW DEVELOPS OVER THE ROCKIES ON SATURDAY AND MOVES INTO 
NORTH TEXAS ON SUNDAY AND NORTH OF ARKANSAS SUNDAY NIGHT. SOUTHWEST 
FLOW RETURNS ON SATURDAY AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING LOW. WILL INCLUDE 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.

MID WEEK TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOLER WITH HIGH PRESSURE IN PLACE. 
HOWEVER...A SLIGHT WARM UP IS EXPECTED LATE IN THE WEEK AND THROUGH 
THE WEEKEND.

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

22







50S TO LOWER 60S.

MODELS CONT TO INDC THAT SWLY FLOW ALOFT WL PREVAIL ACRS THE 
MID-SOUTH THE NEXT FEW DAYS WITH PARENT UPPER LOW SITUATED OVR THE 
SWRN STATES. SEVERAL SHRTWVS ARE FCST TO MOVE NEWD ACRS AR IN THE 
SHORT TERM. EACH UPPER FEATURE WILL INTERACT WITH SFC FNT S OF AR TO 
PRODUCE A CONTD OVERRUNNING PATTERN.

THE NEXT UPPER WAVE IS FCST TO PASS S OF THE AREA LATER TNGT AND 
MON. HAVE CONTD TRENDS OF GOING FCST WITH HIGHEST POPS MENTIONED OVR 
SRN AR AND LOWER CHCS TO THE N. ANOTHER ROUND OF RAINFALL WILL 
AFFECT THE AREA MON NIGHT INTO TUE ASSOCD WITH THE NEXT UPPER WAVE.

MAIN UPPER LOW HEADS INTO THE SRN PLAINS ON TUE AND CONTS NEWD TUE 
NIGHT AND WED. DIFFERENCES NOTED BETWEEN THE ETA AND GFS WITH 
EVENTUALLY TRACK OF UPPER LOW. ETA IS FURTHER N WITH UPPER/SFC LOW 
TRACK AS COMPARED TO THE GFS SOLUTION. AT THIS POINT...HAVE USED A 
BLEND OF BOTH SOLUTIONS AND EXPECT MODELS TO COME INTO BETTER 
AGREEMENT THE NEXT RUNS. EVENTUAL TRACK OF THIS SYS WILL DETERMINE 
THE POTENTIAL FOR SVR WX.

UPPER SYS AND ASSOCD SFC CDFNT MOVES E OF THE LATE TUE NIGHT AND 
WED...ALLOWING COLDER AIR TO MOVE IN. HAVE LEFT SOME CHC POPS IN FOR 
WRAPAROUND PRECIP LATE TUE NIGHT INTO WED. APPEARS THAT THE CHC OF 
ANY WINTRY PRECIP WL STAY JUST TO THE NW OF THE FA ATTM...BUT WILL 
BEAR WATCHING.
&&

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY
NORTHWEST FLOW DOMINATES THROUGH FRIDAY. HIGH PRESSURE MOVES INTO 
THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT...BRINGING IN SUBSIDENCE AND DRIER AIR. 
HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE THROUGH MUCH OF FRIDAY...AS THE UPPER 
TROUGH MOVES TO THE EAST COAST. A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE 
AREA FRIDAY AFTERNOON BUT WILL WASH OUT AS HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS. A 
SURFACE LOW DEVELOPS OVER THE ROCKIES ON SATURDAY AND MOVES INTO 
NORTH TEXAS ON SUNDAY AND NORTH OF ARKANSAS SUNDAY NIGHT. SOUTHWEST 
FLOW RETURNS ON SATURDAY AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING LOW. WILL INCLUDE 
CHANCE OF SHOWERS SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING.

MID WEEK TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOLER WITH HIGH PRESSURE IN PLACE. 
HOWEVER...A SLIGHT WARM UP IS EXPECTED LATE IN THE WEEK AND THROUGH 
THE WEEKEND.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

44/51









503 
FXUS64 KLZK 211651 AAB
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1050 AM CST SUN NOV 21 2004

.DISCUSSION...
SCTD PATCHES OF LGT RAIN CONT OVR MUCH OF THE FA THIS MRNG. EXPECT 
THIS TREND TO CONT THRU THE AFTN...SO HAVE LOWERED POPS TO CHC CAT 
ACRS THE AREA. EXPECT FEW IF ANY BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS THIS AFTN WITH 
A COOL NELY WIND CONTG. EXPECT TEMPS TO ONLY WARM A FEW DEGREES FROM 
CURRENT READINGS FOR HIGHS...SO HAVE ADJUSTED HOURLY GRIDDED TEMPS 
ACCORDINGLY. REST OF FCST IN GOOD SHAPE. UPDATED GRIDS AND ZNS GONE 
TO PRESS.

44





869 
FXUS64 KLZK 211252
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
650 AM CST SUN NOV 21 2004

.DISCUSSION...
AREA OF RAIN THAT HAD COVERED MUCH OF THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE CWA
HAS ALREADY SHIFTED OFF TO THE EAST FASTER THAN ANTICIPATED INDICATING
THAT THE SHORT WAVE IS LIKELY MOVING THROUGH FASTER. AREAS OF LIGHT
RAIN AND DRIZZLE CONTINUE ELSEWHERE. ALSO...TEMPS DID NOT FALL OFF
AS MUCH OVERNIGHT AS ANTICIPATED AND ARE CLOSE TO THE FORECAST 
MAXES. UPDATED TO LOWER POPS IN THE SOUTH TO LIKELY (60 PERCENT)
AND RAISED MOST MAX TEMP FORECASTS ABOUT A CATEGORY. THE LOW CLOUDS
AND NORTHEAST WINDS AND POSSIBLY SOME COLD ADVECTION SHOULD KEEP
TEMPS FROM RISING MUCH...BUT THEY STILL MAY GO UP AS MUCH AS 
5 DEGREES.

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 400 AM CST SUN NOV 21 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY
THE NEXT THREE DAYS WILL BE DOMINATED BY A BIG UPPER TROF IN THE
SOUTHWEST AND THE RESULTING SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT OVER THE AREA WITH
SEVERAL SHORT WAVES MOVING THROUGH. IT LOOKS LIKE THE TROF ITSELF
WILL MOVE OUT ACROSS THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT. WEAK COLD FRONT ACROSS
THE AREA THIS MORNING WILL LIKELY REACH INTO SOUTHERN SECTIONS OR 
JUST TO THE SOUTH OF THE CWA AND BECOME NEARLY STATIONARY. THIS
WILL RESULT IN AN OVERRUNNING PATTERN FOR ARKANSAS THROUGH MONDAY
NIGHT AND POSSIBLY MUCH OF TUESDAY. CHANCES OF RAIN WILL BE ENHANCED
EACH TIME A SHORT WAVE MOVES THROUGH. ONE AREA IN THE SOUTH THIS 
MORNING IS ALREADY SHIFTING EAST AT ISSUE TIME. DESPITE THIS...
WILL CONTINUE WITH CATEGORICAL POPS IN THE SOUTH FOR TODAY WITH
POPS DECREASING TO LIKELY ACROSS CENTRAL SECTIONS AND CHANCE IN
THE NORTH. DID TAPER OFF POPS DURING THE AFTERNOON. THE UNSTABLE
AIR IS MAINLY TO THE SOUTH OF THE AREA SO THE PRECIPITATION SHOULD
BE MOSTLY STRATIFORM BUT COULD SEE ISOLATED THUNDER IN THE SOUTH. 
THAT SHOULD HOLD THROUGH MONDAY. WENT WITH HIGH CHANCE POPS IN THE 
NORTH TO LIKELY IN THE SOUTH FOR TONIGHT THEN LIKELY POPS ACROSS
THE AREA FOR MONDAY. AS THE MAIN TROF APPROACHES MONDAY NIGHT...WENT
WITH CATEGORICAL POPS. THE HEAVY RAIN POTENTIAL WILL INCREASE MONDAY
NIGHT AS DIFFLUENCE INCREASES AHEAD OF THE UPPER TROF. THE BEST CHANCE
OF HEAVY RAIN WILL BE NEAR AND JUST NORTH OF THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. 
STILL MANY UNCERTAINTIES ABOUT THE ACTUAL TRACK OF THE UPPER LOW AS
IT COMES OUT ON TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. THIS WILL AFFECT WHERE
THE SURFACE LOW TRACKS AND HOW THE ATTENDANT WARM AND COLD...AND
POSSIBLY EVEN OCCLUDED...FRONTS MOVE. THIS WILL HAVE A BEARING ON 
THE CHANCE OF ANY SEVERE WEATHER FOR ARKANSAS. THE WARM FRONT MAY NOT
GET THROUGH MUCH OF ARKANSAS AND IF THAT WERE THE CASE THE BEST 
INSTABILITY AND CHANCE OF SEVERE WEATHER WOULD REMAIN SOUTH OF THE
AREA. PRESENT INDICATIONS ARE THAT THE WARM FRONT AND WARM SECTOR
WILL AT LEAST GET INTO SOUTHEASTERN ARKANSAS AND THE NORTHWEST 
HAS THE LEAST CHANCE OF GETTING INTO THE WARM AIR. KEPT TEMPS
IN THE 50S IN THE NORTHWEST FOR TUESDAY WHILE WARMED UP THE 
SOUTHEAST INTO THE LOWER 70S. BROADBRUSHED A 70 PERCENT CHANCE
OF THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE AREA FOR TUESDAY AND MENTIONED HEAVY
RAIN. WILL HOLD OFF ON SEVERE WORDING UNTIL THAT THREAT BECOMES 
BETTER FOCUSED. LOOKING RIGHT NOW LIKE A SQUALL LINE WILL BE THE
MAIN WEATHER MOVING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING. 
CONTINUED CHANCES OF RAIN INTO TUESDAY NIGHT WITH POPS DECREASING.
KEPT THUNDER IN THE FORECAST EARLY BUT DROPPED MENTION OF THUNDER
AFTER MIDNIGHT AS THE AREA SHOULD BE INTO THE COOLER AIR BY THEN. 
MOST OF THE WRAP AROUND MOISTURE WILL STAY TO THE NORTH OF THE 
AREA BUT DID KEEP HIGHER POPS IN THE NORTH. PRESENT INDICATIONS
ARE THE AIR COLD ENOUGH TO PRESENT A CHANCE OF WINTER PRECIPITATION
WILL STAY TO THE NORTH OF THE CWA. CONTINUED SOME POPS INTO WEDNESDAY
FOR WRAPAROUND CONCERNS BUT HAVE ALL POPS OUT BY AFTERNOON. 
WITH THE EXCEPTION OF TUESDAY MAXES AS MENTIONED EARLIER...GENERALLY
WENT CLOSE TO THE MAV/MEX FOR TEMP FORECASTS THROUGH WEDNESDAY.     
&&

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY
NORTHWEST FLOW WILL BE THE DOMINANT FEATURE THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING 
WHEN A WEAK SHORT WAVE TURNS THE FLOW ZONAL THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING 
AND SOUTHWESTERLY BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON. RAIN CHANCES WILL BE HIGHER 
JUST TO OUR NORTH ON FRIDAY AND OVER EASTERN ARKANSAS FOR SATURDAY. 
AT THE SURFACE...DRY AIR WILL MOVE RAPIDLY ACROSS THE STATE FROM 
NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST ON THURSDAY. THEN...MOISTURE WILL COVER THE 
NORTHERN SECTIONS OF ARKANSAS FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EASTERN ARKANSAS 
SATURDAY MORNING. SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL INCREASE IN STRENGTH DURING 
THE DAYLIGHT HOURS SUNDAY. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    58  51  57  51 /  60  50  60  80 
HARRISON AR       53  42  50  46 /  40  40  60  80 
HOT SPRINGS AR    59  52  58  52 /  70  50  60  80 
PINE BLUFF AR     60  53  60  54 /  80  60  60  80 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  53  42  50  46 /  40  40  60  80 
MONTICELLO AR     62  54  62  57 /  80  60  60  80 
SEARCY AR         57  50  56  50 /  60  50  60  80 
MOUNT IDA AR      58  51  58  51 /  70  50  60  80 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   56  49  55  49 /  60  50  60  80 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

BETTER FOCUSED. LOOKING RIGHT NOW LIKE A SQUALL LINE WILL BE THE
MAIN WEATHER MOVING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING. 
CONTINUED CHANCES OF RAIN INTO TUESDAY NIGHT WITH POPS DECREASING.
KEPT THUNDER IN THE FORECAST EARLY BUT DROPPED MENTION OF THUNDER
AFTER MIDNIGHT AS THE AREA SHOULD BE INTO THE COOLER AIR BY THEN. 
MOST OF THE WRAP AROUND MOISTURE WILL STAY TO THE NORTH OF THE 
AREA BUT DID KEEP HIGHER POPS IN THE NORTH. PRESENT INDICATIONS
ARE THE AIR COLD ENOUGH TO PRESENT A CHANCE OF WINTER PRECIPITATION
WILL STAY TO THE NORTH OF THE CWA. CONTINUED SOME POPS INTO WEDNESDAY
FOR WRAPAROUND CONCERNS BUT HAVE ALL POPS OUT BY AFTERNOON. 
WITH THE EXCEPTION OF TUESDAY MAXES AS MENTIONED EARLIER...GENERALLY
WENT CLOSE TO THE MAV/MEX FOR TEMP FORECASTS THROUGH WEDNESDAY.     
&&

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY
NORTHWEST FLOW WILL BE THE DOMINANT FEATURE THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING 
WHEN A WEAK SHORT WAVE TURNS THE FLOW ZONAL THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING 
AND SOUTHWESTERLY BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON. RAIN CHANCES WILL BE HIGHER 
JUST TO OUR NORTH ON FRIDAY AND OVER EASTERN ARKANSAS FOR SATURDAY. 
AT THE SURFACE...DRY AIR WILL MOVE RAPIDLY ACROSS THE STATE FROM 
NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST ON THURSDAY. THEN...MOISTURE WILL COVER THE 
NORTHERN SECTIONS OF ARKANSAS FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EASTERN ARKANSAS 
SATURDAY MORNING. SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL INCREASE IN STRENGTH DURING 
THE DAYLIGHT HOURS SUNDAY. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    58  51  57  51 /  60  50  60  80 
HARRISON AR       53  42  50  46 /  40  40  60  80 
HOT SPRINGS AR    59  52  58  52 /  70  50  60  80 
PINE BLUFF AR     60  53  60  54 /  80  60  60  80 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  53  42  50  46 /  40  40  60  80 
MONTICELLO AR     62  54  62  57 /  80  60  60  80 
SEARCY AR         57  50  56  50 /  60  50  60  80 
MOUNT IDA AR      58  51  58  51 /  70  50  60  80 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   56  49  55  49 /  60  50  60  80 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

29/32






141 
FXUS64 KLZK 210336 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
935 PM CST SAT NOV 20 2004

.DISCUSSION...
QUICK UPDATE TO CLEAN UP WORDING IN THE TEXT PRODUCTS...AND TWEAK 
TEMPERATURES FOR OVERNIGHT. OTHERWISE PREVIOUS FORECAST ON TRACK. 
ALL UPDATES GONE.
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 230 PM CST SAT NOV 20 2004

LATEST SFC/MSAS DATA INDCS THE SFC CDFNT LOCATED ROUGHLY FROM THE MO 
BOOTHEEL...ACRS N-CNTRL AND W-CNTRL AR ATTM. HAVE SEEN SOME DRIER 
AIR WORK IN BEHIND THE FNT WITH TEMPS ARND 60F. MEANWHILE...BREAKS 
IN THE CLOUDS AHEAD OF THE BNDRY HAVE ALLOWED READINGS TO WARM WELL 
INTO THE 60S OVR CNTRL AND SRN AR.

MODELS STILL IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH LARGE SCALE TRENDS IN THE SHORT 
TERM. UPPER FLOW WL CONT FROM THE SW...WITH SEVERAL SHRTWVS PROGGED 
TO AFFECT THE AREA THE NEXT FEW DAYS. TIMING AND STRENGTH OF EACH 
IMPULSE RMNS THE MAIN FCST CONCERN...ALONG WITH RESULTING RAIN CHCS.

NEXT UPPER SYS IS EVIDENT ON THE WATER VAPOR THIS AFTN LIFTING OUT 
OF THE SWRN STATES. HAVE SEEN ELEVATED CONVECTION FORM OVR SERN AND 
CNTRL TX THIS AFTN. ADDITIONAL PRECIP IS EXPECTED TO DVLP TNGT IN 
ADVANCE OF THE SHRTWV...EVENTUALLY AFFECTING MUCH OF THE FA. EXPECT 
SFC FNT TO STALL OUT VCNTY OF THE AR/LA BRDR LATER TNGT AND AID IN 
OVERRUNNING PRECIP. HAVE HIGHEST POPS TNGT OVR CNTRL AND SRN AR... 
WITH LOWER CHCS N. EXPECT UPPER SYS TO SHIFT E OF THE FA SUN AFTN...
ALLOWING RAINFALL TO BECOME MORE SCTD.

MORE IMPRESSIVE UPPER WAVE...CURRENTLY ROUNDING THE UPPER TROF OVR 
SRN CA...WL AFFECT AR MON AND MON NIGHT. EXPECT MORE WIDESPREAD 
RAINFALL AS SFC FNT LIFTS SLOWLY NWD AND UPPER SYS PROVIDES AMPLE 
LIFT. HAVE MENTIONED ISOLD THUNDER MAINLY S OF THE SFC FNT MON AND 
MON NIGHT.

GENERALLY WENT WITH A BLEND OF MOS TEMPS FOR MOST OF THE SHORT TERM. 
DAYTIME HIGHS WILL BE DETERMINED BY EXTENT OF RAIN AND CLOUD COVER.
LIKE TODAY...IF AREAS MANAGE A FEW BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS...TEMPS CAN 
STILL MAKE A DECENT REBOUND THIS TIME OF YEAR.

PROGRESSIVE PATTERN CONTINUES NEXT WEEK. AN UPPER LEVEL LOW IN WEST 
TEXAS TUESDAY MORNING WILL MOVE NORTHEAST INTO OKLAHOMA...AND INTO 
THE MIDWEST TUESDAY NIGHT. THE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH ARKANSAS 
ON TUESDAY...HOWEVER MULTIPLE SHORT WAVES WILL SWING THROUGH THE 
TROUGH AND CONTINUE CHANCES OF RAIN INTO WEDNESDAY. HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS INTO THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY WHICH SHOULD KEEP 
THANKSGIVING DAY DRY. NORTHWEST FLOW SETS UP ON THURSDAY WHICH WILL 
ALLOW SYSTEMS TO MOVE SWIFTLY THROUGH THE AREA. ANOTHER COLD FRONT 
APPROACHES FROM THE NORTHWEST LATE IN THE WEEK AND WILL BRING 
CHANCES OF SHOWERS FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON INTO SATURDAY MORNING. 

TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL THROUGH THE PERIOD. LOWS THURSDAY 
MORNING ARE ANTICIPATED IN THE 30S AND 40S WITH 50S FOR HIGH 
TEMPERATURES.

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

.DISCUSSION...

TO EXPIRE ON TIME. HAVE SEEN QUITE A FEW BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS ACRS 
CNTRL AND SRN PARTS OF THE FA...ALLOWING TEMPS TO WARM ABV FCST MAX 
TEMPS. MEANWHILE...CDFNT WAS LOCATED OVR NWRN AR WITH DRIER AIR 
FILTERING IN BEHIND IT.

TEMPS. MORE CLOUDS ADVANCING TOWARD AR FROM THE SW ATTM...SO EXPECT 
READINGS TO BE HELD IN CHECK BY MID AFTN. CONFINED RAIN CHCS TO SRN 
THIRD OF THE AREA FOR THIS AFTN WITH NEXT UPPER IMPULSE STILL SW OF 
THE FA. UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONES ALREADY OUT.

44





584 
FXUS64 KLZK 200936
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
400 AM CST SAT NOV 20 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY
COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA TODAY WITH A COUPLE OF WEAK SHORT 
WAVES MOVING THROUGH. SOME PATCHY VERY LIGHT RAIN AND DRIZZLE HAS
BEEN REPORTED THROUGHOUT THE AREA DURING THE NIGHT SO WILL NEED TO 
HAVE SOME MENTION OF RAIN IN THE FORECAST EVERYWHERE TODAY. BEST 
MOISTURE IS IN THE SOUTH SO WILL HAVE HIGHER POPS IN THAT AREA. 
WENT CLOSE TO PERSISTENCE ON MAX TEMPS FOR TODAY. FRONT WILL LIKELY
MOVE INTO SOUTHERN ARKANSAS OR NORTHERN LOUISIANA TONIGHT AND STALL
FOR A COUPLE OF DAYS. THIS WILL SET UP AN OVERRUNNING SITUATION
FOR THE AREA AS WEAK SHORT WAVES COME OUT OF SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. 
THE BEST MOISTURE AND LIFT WILL REMAIN IN THE SOUTH SO WILL KEEP
HIGHER POPS IN THAT AREA. LITTLE OR NO INSTABILITY IS PROGGED IN
THE AREA SO WOULD LOOK FOR MAINLY LIGHT RAIN. MAV TEMPS LOOK 
THE MOST REASONABLE OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS AS THERE SHOULD 
BE LITTLE DIURNAL VARIATION IN TEMPS. UPPER LOW IN THE SOUTHWEST 
BEGINS TO MOVE OUT ON MONDAY AND WILL APPROACH THE AREA TUESDAY.
MORE SIGNIFICANT RAINS FROM THIS MAY REACH THE AREA LATE MONDAY
AND MONDAY NIGHT. A WARM FRONT WILL DEVELOP AND MOVE NORTH AND
THIS COULD BE A FOCUS FOR HEAVY RAIN. SOME UNSTABLE AIR WILL
MOVE IN FROM THE SOUTH SO WILL BEGIN MENTION OF THUNDER ON 
MONDAY NIGHT. TROF STARTS TO MOVE ACROSS THE PLAINS TUESDAY. 
GFS HINTING AT A SQUALL LINE MOVING RAPIDLY THROUGH THE AREA
TUESDAY AFTERNOON. THIS SITUATION IS LIKELY TO CHANGE SOME MORE
OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS BUT GIVEN THE STRONG DYNAMICS THERE
COULD BE A SIGNIFICANT SEVERE WEATHER THREAT. FOR NOW WILL
GO WITH THUNDERSTORMS LIKELY FOR TUESDAY.    
&&

.LONG TERM...TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY
UPPER PATTERN CONTINUES THE RAPID SUCCESSION OF TROFS WITH A LOW 
CUTTING OFF IN THE SOUTHWEST AND THEN EJECTING IT 
NORTHEAST...DRAGGING A SURFACE LOW AND COLD FRONT ACROSS THE MID 
SOUTH. THIS PATTERN WILL BE ATTENDED BY THE TYPICAL MOIST AND 
SOUTHERLY FLOW IN THE WARM SECTOR...FOLLOWED BY THE COLD FRONT AND 
THE RAIN SHIELD. THE DEVIL IS IN THE TIMING OF ALL THESE FEATURES.

TEMPEATURES SEEM TOO LOW IN MEX NUMBERS FOR THURSDAY MORNING AND 
FRIDAY MORNING IN LIGHT OF THE FAST RETURN TO SOUTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT...WHICH WOULD TEND TOO KEEP WARM ADVECTION GOING WITH 
MODERATE TO STRONG WINDS AT THE SURFACE. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    61  52  58  49 /  30  50  50  40 
HARRISON AR       58  42  52  43 /  20  30  30  30 
HOT SPRINGS AR    61  51  60  50 /  30  60  50  40 
PINE BLUFF AR     63  54  60  51 /  40  60  50  40 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  58  43  52  43 /  20  30  30  30 
MONTICELLO AR     65  55  63  53 /  40  70  50  40 
SEARCY AR         60  51  56  48 /  30  40  40  30 
MOUNT IDA AR      61  51  59  50 /  30  60  50  40 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   60  49  56  47 /  30  40  40  30 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

CUTTING OFF IN THE SOUTHWEST AND THEN EJECTING IT 
NORTHEAST...DRAGGING A SURFACE LOW AND COLD FRONT ACROSS THE MID 
SOUTH. THIS PATTERN WILL BE ATTENDED BY THE TYPICAL MOIST AND 
SOUTHERLY FLOW IN THE WARM SECTOR...FOLLOWED BY THE COLD FRONT AND 
THE RAIN SHIELD. THE DEVIL IS IN THE TIMING OF ALL THESE FEATURES.

TEMPEATURES SEEM TOO LOW IN MEX NUMBERS FOR THURSDAY MORNING AND 
FRIDAY MORNING IN LIGHT OF THE FAST RETURN TO SOUTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT...WHICH WOULD TEND TOO KEEP WARM ADVECTION GOING WITH 
MODERATE TO STRONG WINDS AT THE SURFACE. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    61  52  58  49 /  30  50  50  40 
HARRISON AR       58  42  52  43 /  20  30  30  30 
HOT SPRINGS AR    61  51  60  50 /  30  60  50  40 
PINE BLUFF AR     63  54  60  51 /  40  60  50  40 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  58  43  52  43 /  20  30  30  30 
MONTICELLO AR     65  55  63  53 /  40  70  50  40 
SEARCY AR         60  51  56  48 /  30  40  40  30 
MOUNT IDA AR      61  51  59  50 /  30  60  50  40 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   60  49  56  47 /  30  40  40  30 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

29/32






630 
FXUS64 KLZK 200408 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1008 PM CST FRI NOV 19 2004

.DISCUSSION...
QUICK UPDATE TO CLEAN UP ZONE FORECAST WORDING AND TWEAK 
TEMPERATURES FOR OVERNIGHT. OTHERWISE...PREVIOUS PACKAGE LOOKS ON 
TRACK. ALL UPDATES OUT.
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 245 PM CST FRI NOV 19 2004

LOW CLOUDS PERSIST OVER MUCH OF THE FA THIS AFTN. A FEW BREAKS HAVE 
BEEN NOTED OVER PARTS OF NRN AND SRN AR. TEMPS HAVE LAGGED IN THE 
50S OVER MOST AREAS...WITH A FEW LOWER 60S NOTED IN THE S.

MODELS CONT TO PROG SWLY FLOW ALOFT FOR THE MID-SOUTH THRU THE SHORT 
TERM. A SERIES OF IMPULSES WL LIFT NEWD ACRS THE REGION...WITH 
TIMING AND STRENGTH OF EACH WV HANDLED A BIT DIFFERENTLY BY EACH 
MODEL SOLUTION.

HAVE CONTD A MENTION OF LOW CHC POPS FOR THE FA LATER TNGT AS THE 
FIRST IMPULSE IS PROGGED TO AFFECT THE STATE. APPEARS BEST LIFT WL 
OCCUR OVER SRN HALF OF AR. MEANWHILE...WEAK CDFNT IS FCST TO MOVE 
INTO NWRN AR SAT AND WORK SLOLY SEWD INTO SRN AR BEFORE STALLING OUT 
LATER SUN. PLAN TO KEEP CHC POPS IN THE FCST MAINLY ALONG AND AHEAD 
OF THE FNT INTO SUN.

A STRONGER UPPER SYS IS FCST TO MOVE INTO THE SRN PLAINS SUN NIGHT. 
WAA/LIFT WL INCRS AS APCHG UPPER SYS INTERACTS WITH SFC BNDRY IN THE 
AREA. HAVE INDCD GOOD RAIN CHCS FOR THE FA LATER SUN NIGHT. DECIDED 
TO KEEP POPS IN CHC CAT ATTM AS TIMING ISSUES LIKELY TO COME INTO 
PLAY DURG THAT TIME PD.

MAIN FORECAST CHALLENGE IS FORECAST TIMING OF A STRONG UPPER LEVEL 
SYSTEM THAT WILL EJECT NORTHEASTWARD FROM THE SOUTHWEST U.S. EARLY 
IN THE PERIOD. EXAMINATION OF MODEL ENSEMBLES RESULTS IN A SOMEWHAT 
INCREASED CONFIDENCE IN PRECIPITATION FORECASTS /LATEST FORECASTS 
ALREADY HAVE BEEN UPDATED TO REFLECT THIS CONFIDENCE/.  

EXCESSIVE RAINFALL WILL BE POSSIBLE LATE MONDAY THROUGH LATE 
TUESDAY.

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

44/55





312 
FXUS64 KLZK 191658 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1055 AM CST FRI NOV 19 2004

.DISCUSSION...
VSBYS HAVE IMPROVED OVR THE FA AT LATE MRNG. WENT AHEAD AND REMOVED 
FOG AND DRIZZLE FROM THE FCST. LOW CLOUDS WL PERSIST ACRS THE AREA 
THIS AFTN...WITH A FEW BREAKS EXPECTED. TWEAKED MAX TEMPS A FEW 
DEGREES LOWER BASED ON LATEST TRENDS. UPDATED ZNS AND GRIDS ALREADY 
OUT.
&&

.PREV DISUSSION...
ISSUED AT 400 AM CST FRI NOV 19 2004

SHORT WAVE HAS MOVED PAST THE AREA BUT MOISTURE REMAINS. AREAS OF FOG
AND DRIZZLE COVER MUCH OF THE CWA ESPECIALLY THE EASTERN HALF. THIS
SHOULD CONTINUE INTO THE MORNING. GETTING TO BE THE TIME OF YEAR 
THAT FOG MAY HANG IN ALL DAY. MODELS SHOW SOME DRYING NEAR THE GROUND
THIS AFTERNOON BUT KEEP MOISTURE AT LOW LEVELS SUGGESTING STRATUS 
WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE DAY BUT THE FOG WILL LIFT. WILL GO WITH 
AREAS OF FOG AND DRIZZLE THROUGH MID MORNING THEN KEEP A CHANCE OF
DRIZZLE THE REST OF THE DAY. SEE LITTLE CHANCE FOR MEASURABLE RAIN
WITH NO SIGNIFCANT SHORT WAVES OR FRONTS AROUND. TEMPS MAY NOT MOVE 
UP TOO MUCH AND AM RELUCTANT TO GO AS WARM AS GUIDANCE ON MAXES. A 
WEAK SHORT WAVE MOVES INTO THE AREA TONIGHT BUT OVERALL MOISTURE IS 
STILL NOT HIGH BUT WILL KEEP SMALL POPS GOING WITH SLIGHTLY HIGHER 
POPS IN THE SOUTH. FOG WILL PROBABLY BE AN ISSUE AGAIN BUT WILL LET 
DAY SHIFT EVALUATE THAT. MINS SHOULD BE SIMILAR TO THIS MORNING. 
ON SATURDAY...A COLD FRONT MOVES INTO NORTHWESTERN SECTIONS BY
LATE IN THE DAY WHILE A SHEARED SHORT WAVE WILL BE ACROSS THE SOUTH. 
WENT WITH CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE AREA WITH THE HIGHEST POPS IN 
THE SOUTH. WENT CLOSE TO PERSISTENCE ON MAXES. SHORT WAVE MOVES 
PAST THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT WHILE THE WEAK FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE 
AREA. KEPT LIKELY POPS OVER ABOUT THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE AREA WITH
30 PERCENT POPS IN THE NORTH. AFTER THAT...AN OVERRUNNING PATTERN
SETS UP WITH A STRONG UPPER TROF IN THE SOUTHWEST. KEPT SMALL
POPS GOING THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT THEN INCREASED POPS TO THE SOUTH
MONDAY AS THE UPPER TROF BEGINS TO COME OUT.   

UPPER LEVEL PATTERN WILL CONTINUE MOVING RIGHT ALONG WITH TROFS 
DROPPING INTO THE SOUTHWEST PART OF THE COUNTRY...PRODUCING A CUT 
OFF LOW BRIEFLY...AND EJECTING IT TO THE NORTHEAST IN FAIRLY FAST 
FLOW AS THE WESTERLIES AND THE LOW COME IN PHASE. THE SURFACE 
PATTERN WILL REFLECT THOSE CHANGES WITH A LOW MOVING NORTHEAST 
ACROSS THE STATE...BRINGING COOLER AND SOMEWHAT DRIER AIR FOR 
THURSDAY. THE NEXT FRONT WILL NOT BE TOO FAR BEYOND THE END OF THIS 
FORECAST. 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

323 
FXUS64 KLZK 190339 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
938 PM CST THU NOV 18 2004

.DISCUSSION...
FOG AND DRIZZLE BECOMING A LITTLE MORE WIDESPREAD AT MID EVENING... 
SO UPDATED FORECASTS TO INCLUDE AREAS OF FOG AND DRIZZLE FOR 
OVERNIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING. ALSO LOWERED MINIMUM TEMPERATURES 
ABOUT A CATEGORY OVERNIGHT IN MANY AREAS AFTER REVIEW OF 03Z 
READINGS. ALL UPDATES OUT.
&&


.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 657 PM CST THU NOV 18 2004

RAINFALL HAS PRETTY WELL MOVE EASTWARD OUT OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
SOME AREAS OF FOG AND DRIZZLE ARE OCCURRING AFTER RAINFALL HAS 
ENDED. UPDATED FORECASTS TO REMOVE RAINFALL AND START PATCHY FOG AND 
DRIZZLE NOW INSTEAD OF AFTER MIDNIGHT. ALL UPDATES OUT. 


.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 249 PM CST THU NOV 18 2004

UPPER LOW LOCATED IN THE VCNTY OF NE OK/NW AR ATTM. RAIN AREA ASSOCD 
WITH SYS MAINLY CONFINED TO NRN AND ERN AR. UPPER SYS WIL CONT 
WEAKEN TO LIFT SLOLY NEWD TNGT AND FRI. EXPECT BULK OF PRECIP TO 
CONT TAPERING OFF OVERNIGHT. PLAN TO TAKE ONE LAST LOOK AT RADAR 
TRENDS BEFORE FINAL DECISION ON POPS FOR EARLY TNGT. WL ALSO MENT 
PTCHY FOG AND DRIZZLE FOR LATER TNGT AND EARLY FRI MNRG WITH LIGHT 
WINDS AND ABUNDANT LINGERING MOISTURE.

ONCE UPPER SYS PULLS OUT OF THE REGION...SWLY FLOW ALOFT IS FCST TO 
PERSIST ACRS THE FA THRU THE SHORT TERM. EXPECT PLENTY OF CLOUDS TO 
CONT AS LOW LVL RH RMNS ABUNDANT. FNTL BNDRY CURRENTLY TO OUR N AND 
W WL MOVE INTO THE STATE LATER FRI AND FRI NIGHT...EVENTUALLY 
STALLING OUT OVER SERN AR. MEANWHILE...SEVERAL WEAK IMPULSES 
ALOFT...MOVG THRU THE UPPER FLOW...WL FOCUS RAIN CHCS IN THE VCNTY 
OF THE FNTL BNDRY SAT AND SUN.

ANOTHER WELL DEFINED UPPER TROUGH WILL APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA 
DURING THIS PERIOD. HAVE TRENDED PRECIPITATION FORECASTS TO ACCOUNT 
FOR THE PROGRESSION OF THIS FEATURE. NEAR TO SLIGHTLY BELOW 
TEMPERATURES WILL PREVAIL. 

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

22






AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
938 PM CST THU NOV 18 2004

.DISCUSSION...
FOG AND DRIZZLE BECOMING A LITTLE MORE WIDESPREAD AT MID EVENING... 
SO UPDATED FORECASTS TO INCLUDE AREAS OF FOG AND DRIZZLE FOR 
OVERNIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING. ALSO LOWERED MINIMUM TEMPERATURES 
ABOUT A CATEGORY OVERNIGHT IN MANY AREAS AFTER REVIEW OF 03Z 
READINGS. ALL UPDATES OUT.
&&


.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 657 PM CST THU NOV 18 2004

RAINFALL HAS PRETTY WELL MOVE EASTWARD OUT OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
SOME AREAS OF FOG AND DRIZZLE ARE OCCURRING AFTER RAINFALL HAS 
ENDED. UPDATED FORECASTS TO REMOVE RAINFALL AND START PATCHY FOG AND 
DRIZZLE NOW INSTEAD OF AFTER MIDNIGHT. ALL UPDATES OUT.

44





872 
FXUS64 KLZK 180950
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
350 AM CST THU NOV 18 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT
KLZK RADAR SHOWS RAIN ACROSS MUCH OF THE AREA THIS MORNING 
CONTINUING TO MOVE NORTH. A FEW BREAKS IN THE RAIN ARE NOTED BUT 
THESE WILL SOON FILL BACK IN THIS MORNING. SATELLITE IMAGES SHOW 
CLOUD COVER ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA AND THE UPPER LOW IS INDICATED 
OVER OKLAHOMA. TEMPERATURES ARE AGAIN ON THE MILD SIDE THIS MORNING 
...MOSTLY IN THE 50S WITH A FEW LOWER 60S IN THE SOUTH.

MODELS ARE EVEN MORE PROGRESSIVE WITH THIS SYSTEM ON THE LATEST RUN. 
GFS SEEMS TO HAVE A GOOD HANDLE ON IT AND WILL STAY CLOSE. THE UPPER 
LOW WILL MOVE ACROSS NORTHWEST ARKANSAS TODAY AND INTO SOUTHWEST 
ILLINOIS BY TONIGHT. BEST CHANCES OF RAIN ACROSS THE AREA APPEAR TO 
BE THIS MORNING AND INTO EARLY AFTERNOON BEFORE DECREASING. WILL 
ALSO INCLUDE ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE DAY TODAY...AS CROSS 
SECTIONS CONTINUE TO SHOW GOOD LIFT. A WARM FRONT IN NORTH LOUISIANA 
WILL NOT MOVE MUCH TODAY AND A DEVELOPING COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO 
WEST ARKANSAS BY FRIDAY MORNING. WITH THE SURFACE LOW MOVING 
NORTH...THE COLD FRONT WILL BE SLOW TO MOVE THROUGH THE AREA. THIS 
WILL KEEP CHANCES OF RAIN IN THE FORECAST THROUGH THE WEEKEND. 
ANOTHER SURFACE LOW DEVELOPS IN SOUTHERN ARKNASAS BY SUNDAY... 
CONTINUING THE CHANCES OF RAIN. THIS WILL ALSO PROVIDE THE BEST 
CHANCES OF RAIN IN SOUTH ARKANSAS THROUGH THE WEEKEND. 

A LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE MOVES INTO THE NORTH SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
WILL BRING COOLER TEMPERATURES TO THE AREA AT THAT TIME. 
OTHERWISE...TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE FAIRLY MILD.
&&

.LONG TERM...MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY
MODELS THIS MORNING HAVE DIVERGED VERY LITTLE FROM THE PREVIOUS RUNS 
BUT SOME CHANGES TO THE POPS ARE STILL ANTICIPATED.PATTERN CONTINUES 
TO BECOME VERY PROGRESSIVE AND GFS CONTINUES TO BE THE MODEL OF 
CHOICE. ONCE AGAIN GFS WILL BE FOLLOWED FAIRLY CLOSELY. MODEL STILL 
LOOKS A TAD TOO QUICK WITH EJECTING THE CUT OFF LOW OUT OF THE 
SOUTHWEST CONUS LATE IN THE PERIOD SO WILL FOLLOW A SLOWER TREND 
HERE.

MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW PERIOD STARTING OFF WITH STRONG MID LEVEL 
RIDGING OFF THE WEST COAST WITH POSITIVELY TILTED TROUGH EXTENDING 
FROM ST JAMES BAY TO BAJA. NORTHERN PORTION OF THE TROF WILL 
ACCELERATE EASTWARD WHILE STRONG UPPER LOW CUTS OFF OVER NORTHWEST 
MEXICO. UPPER LOW WILL THEN BEGIN ITS EASTWARD PROGRESSION PASSING 
OVER THE CENTER OF THE STATE WEDNESDAY MORNING WITH UPPER TROF 
ARRIVING QUICKLY BEHIND IT. BELIEVE OUR CURRENT POPS ARE TOO LOW 
WEDNESDAY AND WILL NEED TO BE ADJUSTED ACCORDINGLY.

UNTIL THEN...PATTERN WILL ALSO BE A BIT UNSETTLED. FRONT THAT MOVES 
THROUGH SUNDAY TAKES UP RESIDENCE ALONG THE GULF COAST. SURFACE WAVE 
DEVELOPS ON THE FRONT MONDAY TO JUSTIFY AT LEAST SCATTERED POPS OVER 
THE SOUTHERN THIRD OF THE CWA. MODELS NOW GENERATING WEAK SURFACE 
LOW JUST SOUTH OF THE ARKLATEX LATE TUESDAY IN ADVANCE OF THE 
APPROACHING UPPER WAVE WITH ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE. POPS WILL 
NEED TO BE RAISED HERE AS WELL WITH HIGHER POPS TO THE SOUTH.

WITH NO OVERLY COLD AIR IN SITE...TEMPERATURES WILL BE CLOSE TO OR 
EVEN A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE NORMAL. LATEST MEX NUMBERS SUPPORT THIS 
LINE OF THINKING AND ARE GENERALLY ACCEPTED.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    65  52  68  53 /  90  50  20  30 
HARRISON AR       60  49  63  46 /  80  50  30  30 
HOT SPRINGS AR    67  52  68  52 /  80  40  20  30 
PINE BLUFF AR     67  54  69  54 /  80  40  20  30 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  59  49  63  47 /  80  60  30  30 
MONTICELLO AR     69  55  70  57 /  80  40  20  30 
SEARCY AR         63  52  66  52 /  80  50  20  30 
MOUNT IDA AR      67  51  68  52 /  80  40  20  30 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   64  51  65  51 /  80  50  20  20 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$
