386 
FXUS64 KLZK 180342 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
940 PM CST WED NOV 17 2004

.DISCUSSION...
FORECAST WELL ON TRACK. TWEAKED TEMPERATURES AND DEWPOINTS A LITTLE 
AFTER REVIEWING MID EVENING READINGS. REST OF PACKAGE LEFT PRETTY 
MUCH UNCHANGED. 
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 245 PM CST WED NOV 17 2004

LEADING EDGE OF THICKER CLOUD DECK NOTED JUST TO THE SW OF THE FA 
THIS AFTN. UPPER LOW WAS CENTERED OVR THE TX PANHANDLE AND HAS BEEN 
SLOLY MOVG TO THE NE DURG THE DAY.

MODELS STILL IN AGREEMENT WITH OVERALL FCST TRENDS DURG THE SHORT 
TERM PD. UPPER SYS IS PROGGED TO MOVE NEWD ACRS OK ON THU AND INTO 
MO THU NIGHT. INCRSG LIFT AND WAA ASSOCD WITH THE SYS WILL ALLOW 
RAINFALL TO OVERSPREAD THE FA GRADUALLY FROM THE SW TNGT. HAVE THE 
HIGHEST POPS OVER THE SWRN HALF OF THE FA TNGT...WITH ONLY SMALL 
CHCS IN NERN AR WHERE HIGH PRES STILL HOLDING FIRM. MAIN RAIN AREA 
WILL SHIFT NEWD ON THU AS UPPER SUPPORT LIFTS TO OUR N. EXPECT 
PRECIP TO BE MORE SCTD OVER WRN AND SRN AR BY THU AFTN.

HAVE SOME LINGERING CHC POPS...MAINLY OVER NRN AR THU EVENING... 
CLOSER TO DEPARTING UPPER LOW. WL LEAVE SLGT CHC POPS ELSEWHERE INTO 
FRI WITH PLENTY OF RESIDUAL LOW LVL MOISTURE IN PLACE.

CDFNT IS PROGGED TO AFFECT NWRN LATER FRI NIGHT. SOME DIFFERENCES 
NOTED WITH TIMING AND LOCATION OF FNT ACRS THE FA ATTM. FOR THAT 
REASON...HAVE KEPT 20-30 PERCENT POPS PER CURRENT FCST. 

WENT WITH A BLEND OF ETA AND GFS MOS FOR TEMPS DURG THE PD.

SOUTHWESTERLY UPPER LEVEL FLOW WILL PREVAIL ACROSS THE REGION DURING 
THIS PERIOD. A STRONG UPPER LEVEL LOW NEAR THE 4 CORNERS REGION AT 
THE START OF THE PERIOD IS FORECAST TO MOVE JUST SOUTH OF THE REGION 
BY LATE WEDNESDAY. THIS FEATURE WILL HELP PUSH A POLAR FRONT TOWARDS 
THE FORECAST AREA LATE IN THIS PERIOD. 

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

FORECAST WELL ON TRACK. TWEAKED TEMPERATURES AND DEWPOINTS A LITTLE 
AFTER REVIEWING MID EVENING READINGS. REST OF PACKAGE LEFT PRETTY 
MUCH UNCHANGED. 
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 245 PM CST WED NOV 17 2004

LEADING EDGE OF THICKER CLOUD DECK NOTED JUST TO THE SW OF THE FA 
THIS AFTN. UPPER LOW WAS CENTERED OVR THE TX PANHANDLE AND HAS BEEN 
SLOLY MOVG TO THE NE DURG THE DAY.

MODELS STILL IN AGREEMENT WITH OVERALL FCST TRENDS DURG THE SHORT 
TERM PD. UPPER SYS IS PROGGED TO MOVE NEWD ACRS OK ON THU AND INTO 
MO THU NIGHT. INCRSG LIFT AND WAA ASSOCD WITH THE SYS WILL ALLOW 
RAINFALL TO OVERSPREAD THE FA GRADUALLY FROM THE SW TNGT. HAVE THE 
HIGHEST POPS OVER THE SWRN HALF OF THE FA TNGT...WITH ONLY SMALL 
CHCS IN NERN AR WHERE HIGH PRES STILL HOLDING FIRM. MAIN RAIN AREA 
WILL SHIFT NEWD ON THU AS UPPER SUPPORT LIFTS TO OUR N. EXPECT 
PRECIP TO BE MORE SCTD OVER WRN AND SRN AR BY THU AFTN.

HAVE SOME LINGERING CHC POPS...MAINLY OVER NRN AR THU EVENING... 
CLOSER TO DEPARTING UPPER LOW. WL LEAVE SLGT CHC POPS ELSEWHERE INTO 
FRI WITH PLENTY OF RESIDUAL LOW LVL MOISTURE IN PLACE.

CDFNT IS PROGGED TO AFFECT NWRN LATER FRI NIGHT. SOME DIFFERENCES 
NOTED WITH TIMING AND LOCATION OF FNT ACRS THE FA ATTM. FOR THAT 
REASON...HAVE KEPT 20-30 PERCENT POPS PER CURRENT FCST. 

WENT WITH A BLEND OF ETA AND GFS MOS FOR TEMPS DURG THE PD.

SOUTHWESTERLY UPPER LEVEL FLOW WILL PREVAIL ACROSS THE REGION DURING 
THIS PERIOD. A STRONG UPPER LEVEL LOW NEAR THE 4 CORNERS REGION AT 
THE START OF THE PERIOD IS FORECAST TO MOVE JUST SOUTH OF THE REGION 
BY LATE WEDNESDAY. THIS FEATURE WILL HELP PUSH A POLAR FRONT TOWARDS 
THE FORECAST AREA LATE IN THIS PERIOD. 

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

22







44/55





997 
FXUS64 KLZK 170936
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
335 AM CST WED NOV 17 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT
SATELLITE IMAGERY THIS MORNING CONTINUES TO SHOW AMPLE CLOUDS ACROSS 
THE AREA. WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWS THE UPPER LOW IN SOUTHWEST TEXAS 
PUSHING EAST. TEMPERATURES THIS MORNING WERE WARMEST IN THE WESTERN 
SECTIONS DUE TO GOOD WAA. 

UPPER RIDGE OVER MUCH OF EASTERN U.S. WILL BEGIN TO 
WEAKEN AS THE UPPER LOW MOVES EAST TONIGHT. THE SURFACE LOW LOCATED 
IN CENTRAL TEXAS THIS MORNING WILL MOVE NORTH INTO OKLAHOMA 
TONIGHT...DRAGGING THE ASSOCIATED WARM FRONT CLOSER TO ARKANSAS. 
THIS WILL SET THE STAGE FOR SOME OVERRUNNING PRECIPITATION TONIGHT. 
WILL SPREAD CHANCES EASTWARD OVERNIGHT TONIGHT. MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT AND A BIT FASTER WITH THE ARRIVAL OF THE PRECIPITATION... 
BUT NONE THE LESS AS THE LOW APPROACHES...PRECIPITATION WILL BECOME 
LIKELY BY AFTERNOON ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA. CROSS SECTIONS SHOW THE 
BEST LIFT DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS OF THURSDAY SO WILL 
INCLUDE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR THURSDAY. MODELS ARE 
INDICATING 1 TO 2 INCHES POSSIBLE ON THURSDAY. CLOSED UPPER LOW WILL 
MOVE NORTH OF THE STATE THURSDAY NIGHT AND WILL DECREASE POPS. 
SEVERAL LINGERING SHORT WAVES ROTATE THROUGH ON FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY...SO WILL NEED TO KEEP POPS IN THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. 

TEMPERATURES WILL BE A COUPLE DEGREES WARMER TODAY WITH SOME 
SUNSHINE AND WARM SOUTHEAST WINDS BEING RESPONSIBLE. WILL NOT EXPECT 
A BIG WARM UP ON THURSDAY DUE TO CLOUD COVER AND PRECIPITATION. 
SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES WILL RETURN FOR FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY.
&&

.LONG TERM...SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY
MODELS CONTINUE TO BE IN DECENT AGREEMENT REGARDING THE OVERALL 
PATTERN WITH DIFFERENCES IN THE FINER DETAILS. HOWEVER...DIFFERENCES 
ARE LESS THAN THAN THEY HAVE BEEN OVER THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS. GFS 
HAS BEEN THE MOST CONSISTENT SOLUTION SO FAR AND HAS NOT CHANGED 
CONSIDERABLY OVER THE PAST FEW RUNS. OTHER MEDIUM RANGE MODELS SEEM 
TO BE MOVING TOWARDS THE OVERALL GFS SOLUTION AND FOR THAT PRIMARY 
REASON...I WILL ALSO GO THAT WAY AND LEAN HEAVILY TOWARDS THE GFS 
SOLUTION.

MODELS CONTINUE TO BUILD A VERY STRONG RIDGE THAT PARALLELS THE 
WESTERN CONUS COAST. MEANWHILE TROFFING EXTENDS FROM CENTRAL CANADA 
ALL THE WAY TO SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA WITH ADDITIONAL RIDGING ALONG 
THE EASTERN SEABOARD. NORTHERN PART OF THE TROF STRETCHES OUT TO THE 
CANADIAN MARITIMES WHILE THE SOUTHERN PART SINKS INTO NORTHERN 
MEXICO EFFECTIVELY DAMPENING OUT THE EAST COAST RIDGE. FRONTAL 
SYSTEM FROM SATURDAY WILL STALL OUT ALONG THE GULF COAST WHILE 
ANOTHER WEAKER FRONT WILL DROP DOWN FROM THE NORTH ON SUNDAY. 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES WITH THIS FRONT APPEARS TO BE LIMITED BY LACK 
OF SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE...PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL BE LOW. 
 
THE FRONT MOVES TO THE EAST AS A STRONG GREAT BASIN HIGH DEVELOPS 
AND STARTS TO SLIDE TO THE EAST. POSITION OF THE HIGH WILL KEEP AREA 
IN A PREDOMINATE NORTHEAST TO EAST FLOW WHICH WILL RESULT IN 
ABUNDANT CLOUD COVER AND COOL TEMPERATURES. KEPT TUESDAY DRY AS HIGH 
BEGINS TO TAKE OVER. MEX TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE LOOKS REASONABLE AND 
WILL BE FOLLOWED FAIRLY CLOSELY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    72  52  63  53 /  10  50  60  60 
HARRISON AR       72  51  62  50 /  10  50  60  60 
HOT SPRINGS AR    72  52  63  53 /  10  50  60  60 
PINE BLUFF AR     73  53  65  54 /  10  50  60  60 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  70  51  62  50 /  10  50  60  60 
MONTICELLO AR     74  54  66  56 /  10  40  60  60 
SEARCY AR         72  51  64  52 /  10  40  60  60 
MOUNT IDA AR      72  52  62  53 /  10  50  60  60 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   72  51  62  52 /  10  50  60  60 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

51/56


512 
FXUS64 KLZK 170346
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
945 PM CST TUE NOV 16 2004

.DISCUSSION...
NO UPDATES PLANNED AT THIS TIME. TEMPERATURES AND SKY CONDITION ARE 
STILL ON TRACK. 32
&&

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 300 PM CST TUE NOV 16 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY
UPPER LOW IN THE SOUTHWEST WILL SLOWLY BEGIN TO MOVE OUT WITH A
NEGATIVE TILT BUT A RATHER STRONG UPPER RIDGE WILL REMAIN IN THE
ARKANSAS AREA AND KEEP THE MAIN EFFECTS OF THE APPROACHING TROF 
TO THE WEST OF THE CWA THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. WENT CLOSE TO 
PERSISTENCE ON THE FORECAST THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. SOME SHOWERS 
MAY REACH NORTHERN AND WESTERN SECTIONS AS THEY DID LAST NIGHT AND
THIS MORNING...SO LEFT SMALL POPS IN FOR THOSE AREAS. LOW CLOUDS 
SHOULD INCREASE DURING THE NIGHT TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT BUT 
WILL LIKELY SCATTER OUT IN MOST AREAS DURING THE DAY. THIS ALONG
WITH WARM AIR ALOFT SHOULD ALLOW MAXES TO REACH 70 OR BETTER IN MOST 
AREAS WEDNESDAY. MINS WILL MOSTLY HOLD IN THE LOWER 50S. ON THURSDAY
THE UPPER TROF BEGINS TO MOVE INTO THE AREA WHILE WEAKENING. MOISTURE
INCREASE MOVES IN SO WILL INCREASE POPS DURING THE DAY TO CHANCE 
CATEGORY. THE INCREASED CLOUDS AND CHANCE OF RAIN SHOULD HOLD MAXES 
IN THE 60S BUT STILL WENT A LITTLE ABOVE THE COOLER MAV IN CASE 
THE MOISTURE INCREASE IS SLOWER TO EVOLVE. LOOKS LIKE THE BEST 
CHANCE OF RAIN WILL BE THURSDAY NIGHT AS THE WEAKENING UPPER TROF
SWINGS ACROSS THE AREA. WENT WITH LIKELY POPS IN ALL AREAS. THIS
SHIFTS OFF TO THE EAST FRIDAY AND WENT BACK TO CHANCE POPS ACROSS
THE AREA. 
&&

.LONG TERM...FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY
ONLY MADE MINOR CHANGES TO THE EXTENDED. KEPT CHANCES OF RAIN INTO
THE WEEKEND AS BROAD TROFFING ALOFT WILL BE IN THE AREA AND A
WEAK FRONTAL SYSTEM MAY BE STALLED IN THE AREA. THE FRONT MOVES 
TO THE EAST AS A STRONG GREAT BASIN HIGH DEVELOPS. LEFT POPS
OUT WITH COOLER TEMPS. ANOTHER REINFORCING COLD FRONT MOVES IN
FROM THE NORTHWEST TUESDAY BUT IT LOOKS MOISTURE STARVED AT THIS 
TIME SO WENT WITH DRY AND COOL FORECAST FOR TUESDAY. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    52  72  52  65 /  10  10  10  40 
HARRISON AR       51  70  51  64 /  20  20  20  40 
HOT SPRINGS AR    52  72  52  65 /  10  10  10  40 
PINE BLUFF AR     53  73  53  67 /  10  10  10  30 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  51  70  51  64 /  20  20  20  40 
MONTICELLO AR     54  74  54  68 /  10  10  10  30 
SEARCY AR         51  72  51  66 /  10  10  10  30 
MOUNT IDA AR      52  72  52  64 /  10  10  10  40 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   51  71  51  64 /  10  10  10  40 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

SEARCY AR         51  72  51  66 /  10  10  10  30 
MOUNT IDA AR      52  72  52  64 /  10  10  10  40

FXUS64 KLZK 161953
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
300 PM CST TUE NOV 16 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY
UPPER LOW IN THE SOUTHWEST WILL SLOWLY BEGIN TO MOVE OUT WITH A
NEGATIVE TILT BUT A RATHER STRONG UPPER RIDGE WILL REMAIN IN THE
ARKANSAS AREA AND KEEP THE MAIN EFFECTS OF THE APPROACHING TROF 
TO THE WEST OF THE CWA THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. WENT CLOSE TO 
PERSISTENCE ON THE FORECAST THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. SOME SHOWERS 
MAY REACH NORTHERN AND WESTERN SECTIONS AS THEY DID LAST NIGHT AND
THIS MORNING...SO LEFT SMALL POPS IN FOR THOSE AREAS. LOW CLOUDS 
SHOULD INCREASE DURING THE NIGHT TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT BUT 
WILL LIKELY SCATTER OUT IN MOST AREAS DURING THE DAY. THIS ALONG
WITH WARM AIR ALOFT SHOULD ALLOW MAXES TO REACH 70 OR BETTER IN MOST 
AREAS WEDNESDAY. MINS WILL MOSTLY HOLD IN THE LOWER 50S. ON THURSDAY
THE UPPER TROF BEGINS TO MOVE INTO THE AREA WHILE WEAKENING. MOISTURE
INCREASE MOVES IN SO WILL INCREASE POPS DURING THE DAY TO CHANCE 
CATEGORY. THE INCREASED CLOUDS AND CHANCE OF RAIN SHOULD HOLD MAXES 
IN THE 60S BUT STILL WENT A LITTLE ABOVE THE COOLER MAV IN CASE 
THE MOISTURE INCREASE IS SLOWER TO EVOLVE. LOOKS LIKE THE BEST 
CHANCE OF RAIN WILL BE THURSDAY NIGHT AS THE WEAKENING UPPER TROF
SWINGS ACROSS THE AREA. WENT WITH LIKELY POPS IN ALL AREAS. THIS
SHIFTS OFF TO THE EAST FRIDAY AND WENT BACK TO CHANCE POPS ACROSS
THE AREA. 
&&

.LONG TERM...FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY
ONLY MADE MINOR CHANGES TO THE EXTENDED. KEPT CHANCES OF RAIN INTO
THE WEEKEND AS BROAD TROFFING ALOFT WILL BE IN THE AREA AND A
WEAK FRONTAL SYSTEM MAY BE STALLED IN THE AREA. THE FRONT MOVES 
TO THE EAST AS A STRONG GREAT BASIN HIGH DEVELOPS. LEFT POPS
OUT WITH COOLER TEMPS. ANOTHER REINFORCING COLD FRONT MOVES IN
FROM THE NORTHWEST TUESDAY BUT IT LOOKS MOISTURE STARVED AT THIS 
TIME SO WENT WITH DRY AND COOL FORECAST FOR TUESDAY. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    52  72  52  65 /  10  10  10  40 
HARRISON AR       51  70  51  64 /  20  20  20  40 
HOT SPRINGS AR    52  72  52  65 /  10  10  10  40 
PINE BLUFF AR     53  73  53  67 /  10  10  10  30 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  51  70  51  64 /  20  20  20  40

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

1100 AM CST TUE NOV 16 2004

.DISCUSSION...
UPPER LOW CONTINUES WELL TO THE SOUTHWEST OF THE AREA WHILE A RATHER
STRONG UPPER RIDGE...ESPECIALLY AT 850 AND 700 MB...COVERS THE AREA.
CLOUDS HAVE BROKEN UP IN MANY AREAS AND LOOK LIKE THEY WILL SCATTER 
OUT IN MOST AREAS BY AFTERNOON. BASED ON 10 AM TEMPS...RAISED ALL 
MAXES TO AT LEAST 70 FOR THIS AFTERNOON WITH MID 70S IN THE 
SOUTHEAST. ADJUSTED SKY GRIDS FOR PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS THIS
AFTERNOON. GRADIENT SUGGESTS 10 MPH WINDS BUT OBSERVED WINDS WERE
LOWER SO LITTLE CHANGE MADE TO WIND FORECASTS. KEPT SMALL POPS IN 
THE WEST AND NORTH FOR THIS AFTERNOON. WILL LIKELY KEEP THAT PATTERN
GOING THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT ON THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE.



584 
FXUS64 KLZK 160953
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
352 AM CST TUE NOV 16 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT
UPPER LOW CONTINUES OVER THE SOUTHWEST U.S. THIS MORNING WITH 
AMPLIFIED RIDGE OVER THE CENTRAL U.S...WITH UPPER RIDGE AXIS OVER 
ARKANSAS. SATELLITE IMAGES SHOW ABUNDANT CLOUD COVER ACROSS THE 
AREA. A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS WERE NOTED IN SOUTHERN MISSOURI ON THE 
LATEST RADAR. 

THIS UPPER LOW WILL START MOVING EAST TODAY. THE UPPER RIDGE WILL DO 
A PRETTY GOOD JOB OF LIMITING RAINFALL ACROSS THE AREA. THE RIDGE 
WILL KEEP THE BEST CHANCES OF RAIN ACROSS THE WEST AND NORTH THROUGH 
EARLY THURSDAY. WILL KEEP CHANCES OF SHOWERS LOW THROUGH EARLY 
THURSDAY. WILL INCREASE POPS ON THURSDAY AS A COLD FRONT 
APPROACHES FROM THE NORTH. WILL INCLUDE A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS 
FOR FRIDAY WITH BETTER LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER LOW AND STRONG 
VORTICITY MOVE ACROSS THE AREA. LOOKS AS THOUGH THE FRONT WILL STALL 
ACROSS THE AREA THROUGH FRIDAY.  

THE WARMEST DAYS WILL BE TODAY AND WEDNESDAY AS COOLER AIR WILL 
ARRIVE ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. HOWEVER TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN 
SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL. 
&&

.LONG TERM...SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY...
MODELS GENERALLY ALL IN THE SAME BOAT IN THE MEDIUM RANGE WITH 
REGARDS TO THE MAJOR PLAYERS. STILL SEEING SOME TIMING AND STRENGTH 
DIFFERENCES IN THE FINER DETAILS THAT ARE ALWAYS EXPECTED. MODELS 
WHICH WERE WILDLY ALL OVER THE PLACE JUST A FEW NIGHTS AGO HAVE COME 
INTO BETTER AGREEMENT AND ARE BASICALLY NOW FOLLOWING THE GFS 
SOLUTION. WITH THIS TYPE OF CONTINUITY...WILL LEAN HEAVILY TOWARDS 
THE GFS SOLUTION.

OVERALL PROGRESSIVE PATTERN WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH 
BROAD TROF IN THE NATIONS MID SECTION ANCHORED BY RIDGING ON BOTH 
COASTS. STILL A FAIR AMOUNT OF MOISTURE LEFT BEHIND IN THE WAKE OF 
THE REMNANTS OF THE UPPER LOW. NEXT FRONT QUICKLY DROPS DOWN FROM 
THE NORTHWEST AND WILL BE IN EXTREME NORTHWEST ARKANSAS BY THE START 
OF THE PERIOD. FRONT QUICKLY CRUISES THROUGH THE STATE SATURDAY FOR 
CHANCE POPS AT THIS POINT. AIR MASS BEHIND THE FRONT IS OF PACIFIC 
ORIGIN AND NO REAL COLD AIR IS IN SIGHT ALTHOUGH TEMPERATURES WILL 
DROP OFF IN THE WAKE OF THE FRONT. 

RIDGING BUILDS OFF THE WEST COAST AND UPPER TROF TAKES ON A POSITIVE 
TILT SUNDAY AND MONDAY AS ANOTHER CUT OFF LOW BEGINS TO GET CARVED 
OUT IN THE SOUTHWEST CONUS. SURFACE HIGH LOCATED OVER THE WESTERN 
PLAINS WILL PROVIDE NORTH TO NORTHEAST SURFACE WINDS TO KEEP THE 
CLOUDS AND COOL AIR ON PLACE IN SPITE OF SOUTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPING 
LATE IN THE PERIOD.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    67  51  71  51 /  10  10  10  20 
HARRISON AR       65  49  69  47 /  20  20  20  20 
HOT SPRINGS AR    68  52  72  52 /  20  20  10  30 
PINE BLUFF AR     68  52  72  52 /  10  10  10  20 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  65  48  69  47 /  20  10  10  20 
MONTICELLO AR     68  53  72  53 /  10  10  10  20 
SEARCY AR         65  50  70  50 /  20  10  10  20 
MOUNT IDA AR      68  52  71  52 /  20  20  20  30 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   65  50  70  50 /  20  20  10  20 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KLZK 160339
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
930 PM CST MON NOV 15 2004

.DISCUSSION...
MOSTLY CLOUDY FORECAST IS HOLDING WELL. TEMPERATURES ARE FALLING 
SLOWLY...SO NO CHANGE NEEDED TO FORECAST AT THE MOMENT. 32
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 224 PM CST MON NOV 15 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT
SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATES THAT THE UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER 
EXTREME NORTHWEST MEXICO HAS MOVED LITTLE DURING THE LAST 24 HOURS. 
UPPER AIR ANALYSIS INDICATES A RELATIVELY SMALL AMPLITUDE MID LEVEL 
RIDGE IS IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION. THIS RIDGE IS EXPECTED TO 
ACTUALLY SHARPEN DURING THIS PERIOD AS THE UPPER LOW FINALLY MOVES 
EAST. DEEP SOUTHERLY FLOW...AND LARGE SCALE LIFT WILL REMAIN TO THE 
WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA DURING MOST OF THIS PERIOD.

DIURNAL TEMPERATURE TRENDS DURING THIS PERIOD WILL BE MODULATED BY 
ABUNDANT HIGH CLOUD COVER. 
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH MONDAY
THE UPPER LOW IS FINALLY EXPECTED TO DIRECTLY AFFECT THE FORECAST 
AREA FRIDAY AND EARLY SATURDAY.  EXPECT THE HIGHER OVERALL 
PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS TO AFFECT THE SOUTHWESTERN 1/3 OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE QUICKLY THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA EARLY 
SATURDAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    47  65  50  68 /  10  10  20  10 
HARRISON AR       45  61  48  66 /  20  20  20  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    48  66  51  69 /  20  20  20  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     48  66  51  69 /  10  10  10  10

THE UPPER LOW IS FINALLY EXPECTED TO DIRECTLY AFFECT THE FORECAST 
AREA FRIDAY AND EARLY SATURDAY.  EXPECT THE HIGHER OVERALL 
PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS TO AFFECT THE SOUTHWESTERN 1/3 OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE QUICKLY THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA EARLY 
SATURDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    47  65  50  68 /  10  10  20  10 
HARRISON AR       45  61  48  66 /  20  20  20  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    48  66  51  69 /  20  20  20  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     48  66  51  69 /  10  10  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  45  60  47  66 /  20  20  20  10 
MONTICELLO AR     49  66  52  69 /  10  10  10  10 
SEARCY AR         46  63  49  67 /  10  20  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      48  66  51  68 /  20  20  20  20 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   47  63  49  67 /  20  20  20  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

000 
FXUS64 KLZK 152027
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
224 PM CST MON NOV 15 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT
SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATES THAT THE UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER 
EXTREME NORTHWEST MEXICO HAS MOVED LITTLE DURING THE LAST 24 HOURS. 
UPPER AIR ANALYSIS INDICATES A RELATIVELY SMALL AMPLITUDE MID LEVEL 
RIDGE IS IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION. THIS RIDGE IS EXPECTED TO 
ACTUALLY SHARPEN DURING THIS PERIOD AS THE UPPER LOW FINALLY MOVES 
EAST. DEEP SOUTHERLY FLOW...AND LARGE SCALE LIFT WILL REMAIN TO THE 
WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA DURING MOST OF THIS PERIOD.

DIURNAL TEMPERATURE TRENDS DURING THIS PERIOD WILL BE MODULATED BY 
ABUNDANT HIGH CLOUD COVER. 

&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH MONDAY
THE UPPER LOW IS FINALLY EXPECTED TO DIRECTLY AFFECT THE FORECAST 
AREA FRIDAY AND EARLY SATURDAY.  EXPECT THE HIGHER OVERALL 
PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS TO AFFECT THE SOUTHWESTERN 1/3 OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE QUICKLY THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA EARLY 
SATURDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    47  65  50  68 /  10  10  20  10

PINE BLUFF AR     48  66  51  69 /  10  10  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  45  60  47  66 /  20  20  20  10 
MONTICELLO AR     49  66  52  69 /  10  10  10  10



324 
FXUS64 KLZK 151537 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
935 AM CST MON NOV 15 2004

.DISCUSSION...
QUICK UPDATE FOR TEMP TRENDS AND SKY COVER. RAINFALL WILL STAY TO 
THE WEST OF ARKANSAS THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON...AND WILL APPROACH 
WESTERN ARKANSAS TONIGHT. UPDATES ALREADY OUT...AND WILL CONTINUE TO 
MONITOR SKY COVER AND TEMPS.
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 304 AM CST MON NOV 15 2004

ALL SHORT RANGE MODELS ARE CONTINUING THEIR TREND OF MOVING THE CUT 
OFF LOW CURRENTLY OVER THE GULF OF CALIFORNIA SLOWLY TO THE EAST. 
THERE IS BETTER AGREEMENT THIS MORNING WITH THIS DEVELOPING SCENARIO 
VERSUS THE PAST FEW MODEL RUNS WITH A SUBSEQUENT INCREASE IN 
FORECASTER CONFIDENCE. WILL CONTINUE THE TREND OF LATE AND GO WITH A 
BLEND OF FORECAST MODELS WITH A LEAN TOWARDS THE SLIGHTLY MORE 
CONSISTENT GFS SOLUTION.

WATER VAPOR IMAGERY PRETTY MUCH MUCH TELLS THE STORY WITH ALL MAJOR 
PLAYERS CLEARLY SEEN. AFOREMENTIONED CUT OFF CONTINUES TO SPIN OVER 
THE SOUTHWEST WITH EVENTUAL KICKER UPSTREAM OVER THE CENTRAL 
PACIFIC. RIDGE OVER THE NATIONS MIDSECTION...CENTERED IN THE CENTRAL 
GULF...WITH SHORT WAVE MOVING ACROSS THE TOP OF IT ALSO EVIDENT. 

UPPER LOW FORECAST TO SIT AND SPIN OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS TAKING 
ON A NEGATIVE TILT BUT MAKING VERY LITTLE EASTWARD PROGRESSION 
AGAINST THE MID LEVEL RIDGE. CENTRAL PACIFIC SYSTEM FINALLY KICKS 
THE SYSTEM OUT ON DAY THREE. SYSTEM WEAKENS AS IT MOVES EAST AND NOT 
MUCH MORE THAN ANN OPEN WAVE OVER EASTERN TEXAS BY THE END OF THE 
PERIOD. RIDGE EVENTUALLY KNOCKED DOWN AND SHUNTED EAST BY THIS WAVE 
AND ADDITIONAL SYSTEM MOVING ACROSS SOUTHERN CANADA.

MEANWHILE...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE OHIO VALLEY DRIFTS SLOWLY 
SOUTH THROUGH THE PERIOD MAINTAINING A MOIST EAST TO SOUTHEAST 
SURFACE COMPONENT. PATTERN WILL RESULT IN A CONTINUATION OF LOW 
CLOUDS OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE PERIOD. 

PLENTY OF DEEP MOISTURE DRAWN UP ON THE WESTERN PERIPHERY OF THE 
HIGH. THE POSITION OF THE HIGH AND THE OVERALL SLUGGISH SPEED OF 
THE PATTERN WOULD PRECLUDE THE DEEP MOISTURE FROM GETTING INTO THE 
REGION UNTIL THE EXTENDED PERIOD. UPPER LOW DOES EJECT A FEW WEAK 
SHORTWAVES EARLY IN THE PERIOD THAT MOVE ACROSS THE NORTH. BUT WITH 
THE RIDGE HOLDING FIRM...ONLY SCATTERED POPS ARE JUSTIFIED AT THIS 
POINT. WITH NO SIGNIFICANT SHORTWAVES SEEN FOR WEDNESDAY OR 
THURSDAY AND RIDGE HOLDING TIGHT...WILL TRIM POPS BACK ALL AREAS 
EXCEPT THE WEST. WILL MAINTAIN HIGHER POPS HERE TO ACCOUNT FOR WHATS 
LEFT OF THE UPPER LOW APPROACHING THE AREA. 

TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE TO BE PROBLEMATIC. EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER 
WILL NOT ALLOW FOR MUCH OF A DIURNAL RANGE THROUGH THE PERIOD. A 
SLOW WARMING TREND WILL OCCUR THROUGH THE WEEK AS SOUTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT SLOWLY DEVELOPS. BLEND OF THE MAV/FWC NUMBERS WILL BE USED 
WITH A LEAN TOWARDS THE SLIGHTLY COOLER FWC.

PATTERN REMAINS COMPLICATED THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH MODELS OFFERING 
DIFFERING SOLUTIONS. WILL CONTINUE TO GO WITH A BLEND OF GFS/ECMWF 
SOLUTIONS BASED ON THEIR CONTINUITY OVER THE PAST FEW DAYS.

REMNANTS OF UPPER LOW FINALLY PUSH THROUGH FRIDAY AS LOW PRESSURE 
MOVES ACROSS SOUTHERN CANADA. ASSOCIATED WEAK COLD FRONT MOVES 
THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT FOR BEST RAIN FALL CHANCES THIS WEEK. IN THE 
WAKE OF THE FRONT...BROAD TROF OVER THE NATIONS MID SECTION IS 
CARVED OUT AS STRONG RIDGE BUILDS ALONG THE WEST COAST. 

MOIST SOUTHWEST FLOW CONTINUES OVER THE AREA WITH A FEW SHORTWAVES 
PASSING THROUGH TO JUSTIFY AT LEAST CHANCE POPS THROUGHOUT THE 
PERIOD. STRONGER FRONT BEGINS TO PRESS DOWN FROM THE NORTH LATE 
SUNDAY AND TROUGH SHARPENS UP CONSIDERABLY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
MILD ON FRIDAY PROCEEDING THE FRONT BUT COOLING OFF FOR THE WEEKEND 
WITH EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER AND NORTHWEST WINDS.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

404 
FXUS64 KLZK 142106
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
300 PM CST SUN NOV 14 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT
UPPER RIDGE OVER ARKANSAS...AND PLACEMENT WILL DELAY PRECIPITATION 
ONSET THE NEXT FEW DAYS. SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT BRINGING MOISTURE AND 
HIGHER DEWPOINTS TO SOUTH ARKANSAS...AND THESE WILL CONTINUE THE 
NORTHWARD TREK.

SHORTWAVES MOVING OFF OF UPPER TROUGH IN THE SOUTHWEST WILL GENERATE 
SLIGHT CHANCES OF RAIN BEGINNING MONDAY EVENING AND CONTINUING 
THROUGH TUESDAY. MODELS SLOWING PROGRESSION OF UPPER LOW...SO BACKED 
OFF ON POPS WEDNESDAY...BUT KEPT SLIGHT CHANCES IN.

TEMPERATURES WILL WARM GRADUALLY THROUGH THE SHORT TERM...DUE TO 
SOUTHWEST FLOW.
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY   
WET WEATHER PATTERN IN THE OFFING FOR THE FIRST PART OF THE 
EXTENDED. MODELS CONTINUE TO SLOW DOWN MOVEMENT OF UPPER LEVEL LOW. 
CHANCES OF RAIN AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED ON THURSDAY AND 
THURSDAY NIGHT. MAIN MOISTURE AND UPPER SYSTEM WILL COME THROUGH ON 
FRIDAY. THEN DRY CONDITIONS BACK IN FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE ABOVE NORMAL THE EARLY PART OF THE EXTENDED... 
THEN WILL COOL OFF TO NEAR OR A LITTLE BELOW NORMAL BY LATE PART OF 
EXTENDED.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    47  60  48  63 /  10  10  10  20 
HARRISON AR       43  58  46  59 /  10  20  20  30 
HOT SPRINGS AR    48  61  49  64 /  10  20  20  20 
PINE BLUFF AR     48  62  49  64 /  10  10  10  20 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  43  58  46  59 /  10  20  20  30 
MONTICELLO AR     49  63  50  65 /  10  10  10  20 
SEARCY AR         45  60  47  61 /  10  10  10  20 
MOUNT IDA AR      48  61  49  64 /  10  20  20  20 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   46  60  47  62 /  10  20  20  20

UPPER RIDGE OVER ARKANSAS...AND PLACEMENT WILL DELAY PRECIPITATION 
ONSET THE NEXT FEW DAYS. SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT BRINGING MOISTURE AND 
HIGHER DEWPOINTS TO SOUTH ARKANSAS...AND THESE WILL CONTINUE THE 
NORTHWARD TREK.

SHORTWAVES MOVING OFF OF UPPER TROUGH IN THE SOUTHWEST WILL GENERATE 
SLIGHT CHANCES OF RAIN BEGINNING MONDAY EVENING AND CONTINUING 
THROUGH TUESDAY. MODELS SLOWING PROGRESSION OF UPPER LOW...SO BACKED 
OFF ON POPS WEDNESDAY...BUT KEPT SLIGHT CHANCES IN.

TEMPERATURES WILL WARM GRADUALLY THROUGH THE SHORT TERM...DUE TO 
SOUTHWEST FLOW.
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY   
WET WEATHER PATTERN IN THE OFFING FOR THE FIRST PART OF THE 
EXTENDED. MODELS CONTINUE TO SLOW DOWN MOVEMENT OF UPPER LEVEL LOW. 
CHANCES OF RAIN AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED ON THURSDAY AND 
THURSDAY NIGHT. MAIN MOISTURE AND UPPER SYSTEM WILL COME THROUGH ON 
FRIDAY. THEN DRY CONDITIONS BACK IN FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE ABOVE NORMAL THE EARLY PART OF THE EXTENDED... 
THEN WILL COOL OFF TO NEAR OR A LITTLE BELOW NORMAL BY LATE PART OF 
EXTENDED.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    47  60  48  63 /  10  10  10  20 
HARRISON AR       43  58  46  59 /  10  20  20  30 
HOT SPRINGS AR    48  61  49  64 /  10  20  20  20 
PINE BLUFF AR     48  62  49  64 /  10  10  10  20 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  43  58  46  59 /  10  20  20  30 
MONTICELLO AR     49  63  50  65 /  10  10  10  20 
SEARCY AR         45  60  47  61 /  10  10  10  20 
MOUNT IDA AR      48  61  49  64 /  10  20  20  20 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   46  60  47  62 /  10  20  20  20 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

58/22





867 
FXUS64 KLZK 141713
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1112 AM CST SUN NOV 14 2004

.DISCUSSION...
QUICK UPDATE TO TWEAK WINDS AND TEMPS TODAY. CLOUD COVER HOLDING 
STRONG OVER THE STATE...WITH COOL READINGS TO CONTINUE. REST OF 
FORECAST ON TRACK. UPDATES ALREADY OUT.
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 350 AM CST SUN NOV 14 2004

PATTERN WILL NOT CHANGE MUCH IN THE SHORT TERM...WITH LARGE AREA OF 
HIGH PRESSURE IN THE EASTERN UNITED STATES AND STORM SYSTEM SLOWLY 
PROGRESSING TOWARD THE AREA FROM THE SOUTHERN ROCKIES. IN 
BETWEEN...ARKANSAS WILL HAVE LOTS OF CLOUDS AND A GRADUAL WARMING 
TREND.

UNDER THE CLOUDS...PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL BE NON-EXISTENT EARLY 
ON...WITH SMALL CHANCES OF RAIN STARTING ABOUT MONDAY. MOISTURE HARD 
PRESSED TO DEEPEN GIVEN RIDGE ALOFT AHEAD OF STORM SYSTEM TO 
WEST...AND LOW DEWPOINTS AT THE SURFACE PROVIDED BY EAST/NORTHEAST 
WIND GENERATED BY HIGH PRESSURE TO EAST.

MORE SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE BOTTLED UP IN THE PLAINS...AND THIS WILL 
FINALLY ARRIVE LATE IN THE SHORT TERM/TO BEGIN THE LONG 
TERM. 

WHILE WARMING TREND WILL BE NOTED...TEMPERATURES WILL START OFF 
BELOW NORMAL THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS. READINGS MORE NORMAL/A LITTLE 
ABOVE NORMAL BY TUESDAY/WEDNESDAY. (46)                

MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW BOTH LACK OF CONTINUITY AND LACK OF 
AGREEMENT CONCERNING THEIR SOLUTIONS TO THE RATHER COMPLEX PATTERN 
FORECAST IN THE MEDIUM RANGE. WITH NO CLEAR CUT OR EVEN NEAR 
CONSISTENT SOLUTION BEING OFFERED...FEEL THE BEST CHOICE MAY BE TO 
MAINTAIN THE STATUS QUO AND SEE IF THE MODELS CONVERGE ON A SOLUTION.

MODELS MOVE THE CUT OFF LOW THAT WAS OVER NORTHERN MEXICO EARLIER 
INTO THE WESTERN PLAINS AND UP AND OVER THE PERSISTENT MID LATITUDE 
RIDGE OVER THE NATIONS MID SECTION. FEATURE EVENTUALLY TRANSLATES 
INTO AN OPEN WAVE AND MOVES OFF TO THE NORTHEAST ON FRIDAY AS A 
RATHER LARGE BUT TROF BUILDS ONTO THE NATIONS MID SECTION FOR DAY 
SEVEN.

GREATEST DIFFERENCE IN THE MODELS IS PLACEMENT OF THE SURFACE LOW. 
EARLIER RUNS HAD THE SURFACE LOW PASSING TO THE SOUTH OF THE STATE 
WHICH WOULD HAVE BEEN IDEAL FOR OVERRUNNING RAINS. LATEST RUNS NOW 
HAVE THE SURFACE LOW OVER KANSAS AND MOVING NORTHEAST. HIGH PRESSURE 
OVER THE EASTERN CONUS WILL KEEP PLENTY OF MOISTURE OVER THE AREA 
AND AT LEAST SCATTERED PRECIPITATION CHANCES. KEY TO THE FORECAST 
SEEMS TO BE THE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE GREAT LAKES WHICH IS 
WEAKENING THE DEVELOPING SYSTEM. WITH SO MUCH UNCERTAINTY...VERY FEW 
CHANGES HAVE BEEN MADE TO THE EXTENDED FORECAST. MODELS CONTINUE TO 
SHOW NO OVERLY COLD AIR IN SITE WITH MEX NUMBERS GENERALLY 
ACCEPTED. (56)

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

070 
FXUS64 KLZK 140342 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
930 PM CST SAT NOV 13 2004

LOW CLOUDS HAVE MOVED IN FROM THE EAST UNDERNEATH THE HIGH CLOUDS 
THAT ARE ADVANCING FROM THE WEST. TEMPERATURES HAVE GONE UP A DEGREE 
OR TWO AT SOME LOCATIONS...WHILE THEY HAVE DROPPED ONLY ONE DEGREE 
AT OTHER SPOTS. CHANGED THE CLOUD COVER IN THE GRIDS AND UPPED THE 
LOWS TONIGHT. UPDATE OUT ALREADY (32).

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 250 PM CST SAT NOV 13 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT
LOW CLOUDS OVER THE EXTREME SOUTHEAST TODAY...WITH MID AND HIGH 
CLOUDS OVER THE REST OF THE STATE. NORTHEAST WINDS KEPT COOL AND DRY 
AIR OVER THE STATE.

LARGE TROUGH OVER THE DESERT SOUTHWEST WILL BE THE MAIN PLAYER IN 
THE WEATHER THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. MOISTURE IS BEGINNING TO RETURN 
IN THE SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW...WITH LOWER CLOUDS PRESENT OVER OKLAHOMA 
AND TEXAS. THIS RETURN OF MOISTURE WILL HELP KEEP TEMPERATURES 
WARMER TONIGHT THAN THIS MORNING.

CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE ON THE INCREASE SUNDAY...BUT WITH THE UPPER 
ENERGY STAYING TO THE WEST OF THE STATE...PRECIP WILL REMAIN OUT OF 
THE PICTURE. SLIGHT CHANCES WILL BEGIN MONDAY FROM WEST TO EAST DUE 
TO THE UPPER LOW...BUT THE MAIN PRECIP CHANCES WILL COME WITH THE 
COLD FRONT APPROACHING TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT.

AS FAR AS TEMPERATURES...A GRADUAL WARMING TREND WILL OCCUR...WITH 
READINGS APPROACHING NORMAL BY TUESDAY.
&&

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY
WET WEATHER PATTERN IN THE OFFING FOR MOST OF THE LONG TERM. LOW 
PRESSURE ALOFT APPROACHING FROM THE SOUTHWEST BY MID WEEK WILL BRING 
CHANCES FOR RAINFALL WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. MOISTURE WILL 
DECREASE AS THE LOW MOVES AWAY ON SATURDAY. THUS...DRY CONDITIONS 
EXPECTED ON SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN NEAR NORMAL.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    41  55  45  59 /  10  10  10  10 
HARRISON AR       36  52  42  56 /  10  10  10  20 
HOT SPRINGS AR    42  55  46  60 /  10  10  10  20 
PINE BLUFF AR     42  57  45  60 /  10  10  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  36  52  41  56 /  10  10  10  20 
MONTICELLO AR     43  58  45  62 /  10  10  10  10 
SEARCY AR         39  54  43  58 /  10  10  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      42  54  47  60 /  10  10  10  20 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   39  53  44  58 /  10  10  10  20 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

ENERGY STAYING TO THE WEST OF THE STATE...PRECIP WILL REMAIN OUT OF 
THE PICTURE. SLIGHT CHANCES WILL BEGIN MONDAY FROM WEST TO EAST DUE 
TO THE UPPER LOW...BUT THE MAIN PRECIP CHANCES WILL COME WITH THE 
COLD FRONT APPROACHING TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT.

AS FAR AS TEMPERATURES...A GRADUAL WARMING TREND WILL OCCUR...WITH 
READINGS APPROACHING NORMAL BY TUESDAY.
&&

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY
WET WEATHER PATTERN IN THE OFFING FOR MOST OF THE LONG TERM. LOW 
PRESSURE ALOFT APPROACHING FROM THE SOUTHWEST BY MID WEEK WILL BRING 
CHANCES FOR RAINFALL WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT. MOISTURE WILL 
DECREASE AS THE LOW MOVES AWAY ON SATURDAY. THUS...DRY CONDITIONS 
EXPECTED ON SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN NEAR NORMAL.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    41  55  45  59 /  10  10  10  10 
HARRISON AR       36  52  42  56 /  10  10  10  20 
HOT SPRINGS AR    42  55  46  60 /  10  10  10  20 
PINE BLUFF AR     42  57  45  60 /  10  10  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  36  52  41  56 /  10  10  10  20 
MONTICELLO AR     43  58  45  62 /  10  10  10  10 
SEARCY AR         39  54  43  58 /  10  10  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      42  54  47  60 /  10  10  10  20 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   39  53  44  58 /  10  10  10  20 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

58/22





215 
FXUS64 KLZK 131635
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1035 AM CST SAT NOV 13 2004

.DISCUSSION...
QUICK UPDATE MAINLY TO TWEAK SKY AND TEMPS. COOL START TO THE 
MORNING WITH PARTS OF NORTHERN ARKANSAS FALLING BELOW FREEZING. 
CLOUD COVER OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF...BUT MOST LOCATIONS WILL BE 
PARTLY CLOUDY. OVERALL...GOING FORECAST LOOKS GOOD AND UPDATES 
ALREADY GONE.
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 355 AM CST SAT NOV 13 2004

STRONG HIGH PRESSURE WILL SAG SOUTHWARD THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES AND 
OHIO VALLEY THE NEXT FEW DAYS. AT THE SAME TIME...A STORM SYSTEM 
WILL HEAD ACROSS THE SOUTHERN ROCKIES INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. 
AHEAD OF THE STORM SYSTEM...LOTS OF CLOUDS WILL BE NOTED ACROSS THE 
SOUTHWEST TODAY...AND FROM WESTERN INTO CENTRAL ARKANSAS ON 
SUNDAY/MONDAY. THE HIGH IN THE OHIO VALLEY WILL PREVENT THE CLOUDS 
FROM BUILDING INTO THE EASTERN COUNTIES.

CIRCULATION AROUND THE HIGH WILL CONTINUE BRINGING AN EAST TO 
NORTHEAST WIND...WITH COOL WEATHER RESULTING. IN GENERAL...BELOW 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED DURING THE SHORT TERM. 

DEWPOINTS WILL STAY RATHER LOW THIS WEEKEND WITH DRY AIRMASS NEAR 
THE SURFACE. THIS WILL HELP PREVENT TEMPERATURES FROM CLIMBING MUCH 
DURING THE DAY UNDER THE CLOUDS...WITH SOME OF THE COOLEST READINGS 
IN THE WESTERN HALF OF THE STATE. DAYTIME TEMPERATURES WILL TEND TO 
BE A BIT WARMER IN THE EAST WITH A LITTLE MORE SUNSHINE. 

DRY AIRMASS WILL ALSO HELP POSTPONE ANY SIGNIFICANT RAIN THE NEXT 
FEW DAYS...WITH HIGH PRESSURE SLOWING THE PROGRESSION OF THE STORM 
TO THE WEST. ONLY SMALL CHANCES FOR RAIN MENTIONED TOWARD THE END OF 
THE SHORT TERM...WITH THE BEST CHANCES IN THE WESTERN COUNTIES. (46)

CONTINUES TO APPEAR THAT ACTIVE PATTERN WILL BE SHAPING UP FOR THE 
EXTENDED. SOUTHWESTERLY 500 MB FLOW OVER THE AREA WILL ALLOW FOR 
PACIFIC MOISTURE TO STREAM UP OVER MUCH OF THE SOUTHERN UNITED 
STATES. IN THE INITIAL EXTENDED PERIODS...THIS MOISTURE WILL BE 
IMPEDED SOMEWHAT BY UPPER RIDGE...WHICH LOOKS TO FLATTEN OUT TOWARD 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 

SIGNIFICANT INCREASE IN MOISTURE WILL OCCUR ALONG AND NORTH OF 
APPROACHING WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY WHICH WILL BE MOVING UP FROM THE 
GULF COAST ON WEDNESDAY. ISENTROPIC UPLIFT SITUATION WILL BE SETTING 
UP...WITH RAIN DEVELOPING NORTH OF THE SURFACE BOUNDARY AND TO THE 
NORTHEAST OF DEVELOPING SURFACE LOW. UPPER LEVEL IMPULSES MOVING UP 
IN THE MEAN FLOW AND ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WILL ALLOW FOR SOME 
EMBEDDED THUNDER WITHIN THE RAIN. 

UPPER LOW WILL BE FAIRLY DEEP AS IT EJECTS OUT OF NORTHERN MEXICO BY 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. SPEED OF THE SYSTEM IS IN QUESTION...AS MODEL 
SOLUTIONS ARE DIFFERING TO VARYING DEGREES THIS MORNING. IF THE 
UPPER RIDGE FLATTENS OUT BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT...GOING FORECAST TRENDS 
SHOULD PAN OUT...WITH SYSTEM MOVING ACROSS SOUTHERN ARKANSAS SOME 
TIME THURSDAY/THURSDAY NIGHT. HOWEVER...IF UPPER RIDGE STAYS IN 
PLACE...THE LOW AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE SYSTEM COULD BE DELAYED BY AS 
MUCH AS 6 TO 12 HOURS OR MORE. 

TO TOP THAT ALL OFF...DGEX IS ACTUALLY PUSHING THE SYSTEM THROUGH 
THE AREA BY LATE THURSDAY...WITH THE GFS ABOUT 12 HOURS SLOWER...AND 
THE ECMWF/UKMET/CANADIAN SOLUTIONS EVEN SLOWER THAN THAT. CURRENT 
FORECAST TAKES A MIDDLE OF THE ROAD APPROACH WHICH IS NOT AS SLOW AS 
THE OTHER MODELS. NEEDLESS TO SAY...CONFIDENCE IN TIMING THESE 
FEATURES IS NOT VERY HIGH.

THANKS TO WFO MEMPHIS AND WFO JACKSON FOR COLLABORATION EFFORTS THIS 
MORNING. (57)

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$


696 
FXUS64 KLZK 130352
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
950 PM CST FRI NOV 12 2004

.DISCUSSION...
LOW CLOUDS CLEARED DOWN TO ABOUT THE LITTLE ROCK AREA AROUND SUNSET
THEN STOPPED. CLEARING HAS CHANGED LITTLE IF NOT MOVED A LITTLE 
NORTH DURING THE EVENING. MEANWHILE HIGH CLOUDS HAVE MOVED IN AHEAD 
OF THE UPPER TROF IN THE SOUTHWEST. TEMPS HAVE NOT DROPPED OFF TOO
GREATLY DUE TO THE CLOUDS AND CONTINUING NORTH TO NORTHEAST WINDS UP 
TO 10 KT. SENT OUT UPDATE TO SLIGHTLY RAISE MIN TEMP FORECASTS IN
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN SECTIONS WHERE LOW CLOUDS MAY REMAIN MOST OF 
THE NIGHT. MINS IN THE NORTH STILL LOOK GOOD. SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS
MADE TO WIND FORECASTS THROUGH EARLY MORNING WHICH DO NOT SHOW UP
IN THE TEXT FORECASTS. ALSO INCREASED CLOUD FORECASTS IN THE SOUTH.
LOW CLOUDS MAY BREAK UP SATURDAY ALTHOUGH CONFIDENCE IS NOT REAL
HIGH ON THAT IN THE SOUTH. FORECAST FOR SATURDAY KEPT ABOUT THE
SAME FOR NOW.  
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

29







687 
FXUS64 KLZK 122044
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
245 PM CST FRI NOV 12 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT
LOW STRATUS HELD ON FOR MUCH OF THE DAY...WITH A CLEARING TAKE PLACE 
IN THE NORTH. HOWEVER...LOW CLOUDS HANGING ON IN THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS AROUND HARRISON. EVEN THROUGH SKIES ARE CLEARING 
NOW...ONCE THE SUN SETS AND COOLER AIR MOVES IN...THINK THAT CLOUDS 
WILL REDEVELOP SOMEWHAT. ALSO...CIRRUS MOVING EAST FROM THE PLAINS 
WILL HELP CURB TEMPS. ALL THAT BEING SAID...THINK THAT TEMPS WILL 
GET TO JUST ABOVE FREEZING TONIGHT IN THE EXTREME NORTH. SOME OF THE 
NORMALLY COLDER LOCATIONS COULD SEE READINGS RIGHT AROUND THE 
FREEZING MARK.

CLOUDS WILL HANG ON IN THE SOUTH OVERNIGHT...BEFORE GRADUALLY 
DECREASING DURING THE DAY SATURDAY. NORTHEAST FLOW WILL KEEP COOL 
TEMPERATURES IN THE FORECAST FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.

THE CUT OFF LOW IN THE SOUTHWEST WILL BE THE MAIN PLAYER IN THE 
FORECAST FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. MOISTURE BEGINS TO INCREASE SUNDAY 
NIGHT. CONTINUED THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE FORECAST MONDAY NIGHT 
STARTING IN THE WEST AND MOVING EAST.
&&

.LONG TERM...TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY 
WET WEATHER PATTERN IN THE OFFING FOR MUCH OF THE LONG TERM. ONE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM ALOFT WILL MOVE JUST NORTH OF THE AREA ON TUESDAY 
AND WILL BRING SMALL CHANCES OF RAINFALL TO THE AREA. ANOTHER UPPER 
LEVEL TROF WILL APPROACH FROM THE SOUTHWEST BY MID WEEK. THIS SYSTEM 
WILL MAINLY PASS JUST SOUTH OF THE STATE. SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE WILL 
MOVE NORTHWARD AS THE SYSTEM APPROACHES AND BRING INCREASING CHANCES 
OF RAINFALL WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. BY FRIDAY...THE SYSTEM SHOULD 
MOVE SOUTHEAST OF THE AREA WITH DRY CONDITIONS EXPECTED. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    40  55  40  56 /   0  10  10  10 
HARRISON AR       34  55  36  55 /   0  10  10  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    41  55  41  57 /   0  10  10  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     42  55  42  57 /   0  10  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  34  55  36  55 /   0  10  10  10 
MONTICELLO AR     43  56  43  59 /   0  10  10  10 
SEARCY AR         39  55  38  56 /   0  10  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      40  56  41  57 /   0  10  10  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   38  55  39  56 /   0  10  10  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

WILL REDEVELOP SOMEWHAT. ALSO...CIRRUS MOVING EAST FROM THE PLAINS 
WILL HELP CURB TEMPS. ALL THAT BEING SAID...THINK THAT TEMPS WILL 
GET TO JUST ABOVE FREEZING TONIGHT IN THE EXTREME NORTH. SOME OF THE 
NORMALLY COLDER LOCATIONS COULD SEE READINGS RIGHT AROUND THE 
FREEZING MARK.

CLOUDS WILL HANG ON IN THE SOUTH OVERNIGHT...BEFORE GRADUALLY 
DECREASING DURING THE DAY SATURDAY. NORTHEAST FLOW WILL KEEP COOL 
TEMPERATURES IN THE FORECAST FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.

THE CUT OFF LOW IN THE SOUTHWEST WILL BE THE MAIN PLAYER IN THE 
FORECAST FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. MOISTURE BEGINS TO INCREASE SUNDAY 
NIGHT. CONTINUED THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE FORECAST MONDAY NIGHT 
STARTING IN THE WEST AND MOVING EAST.
&&

.LONG TERM...TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY 
WET WEATHER PATTERN IN THE OFFING FOR MUCH OF THE LONG TERM. ONE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM ALOFT WILL MOVE JUST NORTH OF THE AREA ON TUESDAY 
AND WILL BRING SMALL CHANCES OF RAINFALL TO THE AREA. ANOTHER UPPER 
LEVEL TROF WILL APPROACH FROM THE SOUTHWEST BY MID WEEK. THIS SYSTEM 
WILL MAINLY PASS JUST SOUTH OF THE STATE. SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE WILL 
MOVE NORTHWARD AS THE SYSTEM APPROACHES AND BRING INCREASING CHANCES 
OF RAINFALL WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. BY FRIDAY...THE SYSTEM SHOULD 
MOVE SOUTHEAST OF THE AREA WITH DRY CONDITIONS EXPECTED. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    40  55  40  56 /   0  10  10  10 
HARRISON AR       34  55  36  55 /   0  10  10  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    41  55  41  57 /   0  10  10  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     42  55  42  57 /   0  10  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  34  55  36  55 /   0  10  10  10 
MONTICELLO AR     43  56  43  59 /   0  10  10  10 
SEARCY AR         39  55  38  56 /   0  10  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      40  56  41  57 /   0  10  10  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   38  55  39  56 /   0  10  10  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

58/22





925 
FXUS64 KLZK 121723
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1121 AM CST FRI NOV 12 2004

.DISCUSSION...
PLENTY OF LOW STRATUS AROUND THE AREA...WITH ONLY A FEW BREAKS IN 
THE NORTH. CLOUDS WILL HANG TOUGH TODAY DUE TO COLD AIR 
ADVECTION...SO IF ANY BREAKS DO OCCUR...THEY WILL BE SHORT LIVED. 
SOME DRIZZLE REPORTED THIS MORNING...BUT ENDED IN THE LAST COUPLE OF 
HOURS. ADJUSTED HIGHS DOWN BY A COUPLE OF DEGREES AS CLOUD COVER 
WILL INHIBIT HEATING.

CLEARING WILL START ACROSS THE EXTREME NORTH THIS EVENING...BUT WILL 
BE CONFINED TO AREAS NEAR THE MISSOURI BORDER. TEMPS WILL HAVE TO BE 
LOOKED AT CLOSELY FOR TONIGHT FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF REACHING 
FREEZING.
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 355 AM CST FRI NOV 12 2004

COLD FRONT PUSHING TO SOUTH OF ARKANSAS THIS MORNING...WITH COOLER 
AIR FILTERING INTO THE STATE FROM THE NORTH/NORTHEAST. LOTS OF LOW 
CLOUDS IN PLACE...AND THAT WILL BE THE THEME FOR TODAY WITH SOME 
MORNING DRIZZLE/FOG. SURE FEELING A WHOLE LOT MORE LIKE FALL...AND 
TEMPERATURES NOT APT TO REBOUND MUCH IN THE SHORT TERM. 

HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING BEHIND FRONT WILL PRODUCE A PERSISTENT 
NORTHEAST WIND INTO FIRST PART OF THE WEEKEND. AS HIGH NUDGES INTO 
THE REGION...STORM SYSTEM ALOFT WILL HEAD THROUGH THE SOUTHERN 
ROCKIES TODAY/TONIGHT. RIDGING AHEAD OF SYSTEM MAY ALLOW FOR SOME 
BRIEF CLEARING...MAINLY IN NORTHERN ARKANSAS THIS AFTERNOON AND THE 
NORTHEAST HALF OF THE STATE TONIGHT. HOWEVER...AS SYSTEM 
APPROACHES...CLOUDS WILL BE ON THE INCREASE AGAIN SATURDAY/SUNDAY. 

SYSTEM WILL SPREAD CHANCES FOR RAIN INTO THE STATE LATE 
MONDAY/TUESDAY...WITH A WET PATTERN HEADING INTO THE LONG 
TERM.

TEMPERATURES WILL BE TRICKY...AND WILL HINGE ON CLOUD COVER. 
CONFIDENCE IS NOT REAL HIGH IN THE AMOUNT OF CLEARING THAT WILL TAKE 
PLACE TODAY/SATURDAY...WITH LOTS OF CLOUDS A SAFE BET SUNDAY/MONDAY. 
WILL MENTION THAT FAIR AMOUNT OF CLOUDS AND A NORTHEAST WIND THIS 
TIME OF YEAR USUALLY MEANS COOLER THAN NORMAL TEMPERATURES...AND 
THAT IS WHAT IS NOTED IN THE FORECAST. FREEZING TEMPERATURES NOT 
REAL LIKELY IN THE SHORT TERM...BUT IT WILL BE A CLOSE CALL TONIGHT 
IN THE NORTH...ESPECIALLY IF CLEARING OCCURS.                   

FAIRLY ACTIVE WEATHER PATTERN IS SHAPING UP FOR THE LONG TERM. BY 
MONDAY NIGHT...RETURN FLOW WILL START TO SET UP OVER WESTERN/
NORTHERN ARKANSAS AS SURFACE RIDGE OVER THE OHIO VALLEY STARTS TO 
MOVE NORTHEAST. UPPER FLOW WILL BECOME MORE SOUTHWESTERLY...AND AS A 
RESULT...MOISTURE WILL INCREASE OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF THE AREA. 

WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BEGIN MOVING BACK TO THE NORTH FROM 
TEXAS. FAIRLY POTENT 500 MB LOW WILL BEGIN EJECTING OUT OF MEXICO AS 
WELL. PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL INCREASE FROM THE SOUTHWEST ON 
WEDNESDAY AS THE UPPER SYSTEM AND DEVELOPING SURFACE LOW ALONG THE 
FRONT APPROACH THE AREA. PRECIPITATION WILL START OUT FAIRLY 
STRATIFORM...WITH ELEVATED STORMS DEVELOPING ALONG AND TO THE NORTH 
OF THE SURFACE BOUNDARY. 

SYSTEMS WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA SOME TIME DURING THE THURSDAY/
FRIDAY TIME FRAME. MODELS DIFFERING TO VARYING DEGREES IN TIMING 
THESE FEATURES...SO RIGHT NOW WILL NOT GO ANY HIGHER THAN CHANCE 
POPS FOR THESE PERIODS. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL...AS 
SURFACE FLOW STAYS OUT OF THE EAST AND SOUTHEAST...AND UPPER FLOW 
PATTERN REMAINS SOUTHWESTERLY TO ZONAL.

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

NORTHEAST WIND INTO FIRST PART OF THE WEEKEND. AS HIGH NUDGES INTO

ROCKIES TODAY/TONIGHT. RIDGING AHEAD OF SYSTEM MAY ALLOW FOR SOME 
BRIEF CLEARING...MAINLY IN NORTHERN ARKANSAS THIS AFTERNOON AND THE 
NORTHEAST HALF OF THE STATE TONIGHT. HOWEVER...AS SYSTEM

MONDAY/TUESDAY...WITH A WET PATTERN HEADING INTO THE LONG 
TERM.

CONFIDENCE IS NOT REAL HIGH IN THE AMOUNT OF CLEARING THAT WILL TAKE

THAT IS WHAT IS NOTED IN THE FORECAST. FREEZING TEMPERATURES NOT

.LONG TERM...MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY
FAIRLY ACTIVE WEATHER PATTERN IS SHAPING UP FOR THE LONG TERM. BY 
MONDAY NIGHT...RETURN FLOW WILL START TO SET UP OVER WESTERN/
NORTHERN ARKANSAS AS SURFACE RIDGE OVER THE OHIO VALLEY STARTS TO 
MOVE NORTHEAST. UPPER FLOW WILL BECOME MORE SOUTHWESTERLY...AND AS A 
RESULT...MOISTURE WILL INCREASE OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF THE AREA. 

WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL BEGIN MOVING BACK TO THE NORTH FROM 
TEXAS. FAIRLY POTENT 500 MB LOW WILL BEGIN EJECTING OUT OF MEXICO AS 
WELL. PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL INCREASE FROM THE SOUTHWEST ON 
WEDNESDAY AS THE UPPER SYSTEM AND DEVELOPING SURFACE LOW ALONG THE 
FRONT APPROACH THE AREA. PRECIPITATION WILL START OUT FAIRLY 
STRATIFORM...WITH ELEVATED STORMS DEVELOPING ALONG AND TO THE NORTH 
OF THE SURFACE BOUNDARY. 

SYSTEMS WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA SOME TIME DURING THE THURSDAY/
FRIDAY TIME FRAME. MODELS DIFFERING TO VARYING DEGREES IN TIMING 
THESE FEATURES...SO RIGHT NOW WILL NOT GO ANY HIGHER THAN CHANCE 
POPS FOR THESE PERIODS. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL...AS 
SURFACE FLOW STAYS OUT OF THE EAST AND SOUTHEAST...AND UPPER FLOW 
PATTERN REMAINS SOUTHWESTERLY TO ZONAL. (57)

198 
FXUS64 KLZK 120354
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION 
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
955 PM CST THU NOV 11 2004

.DISCUSSION...
UPPER TROF MOVING PAST THE AREA TONIGHT WITH COLD AIR MOVING IN
AHEAD OF A SURFACE HIGH BUILDING IN FROM THE PLAINS. TEMPS SHOULD
CONTINUE SLOWLY FALLING THROUGH THE NIGHT BUT STRATUS OVERCAST
SHOULD KEEP TEMPS FROM FALLING TOO MUCH. FORECAST TEMPS LOOK GOOD
AT THIS POINT SO NO CHANGES MADE THERE. RAIN HAS MOVED OUT OF
THE CWA ACCORDING TO RADAR BUT KHRO ASOS HAS KEPT REPORTING RAIN
THROUGH THE EVENING. THINK THIS MAY ACTUALLY BE DRIZZLE. UPDATED
ZONES TO TAKE EVENING RAIN OUT OF THE FORECAST BUT KEPT A CHANCE
OF DRIZZLE IN THE NORTH AND NORTHEAST THROUGH MUCH OF THE NIGHT
AND ADDED PATCHY FOG THROUGH THE NIGHT TO THE SAME AREAS. SOME
TWEAKS MADE TO THE WIND FORECASTS TO MATCH THE OBS.   
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&



633 
FXUS64 KLZK 112125
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
325 PM CST THU NOV 11 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT
RAIN HAD PRETTY WELL ENDED OVER THE FORECAST AREA BY MID AFTERNOON. 
WITH H5 LOW LIFTING SLOWLY NORTHEASTWARD...WILL KEEP A SMALL CHANCE 
OF SHOWERS THIS EVENING OVER THE EXTREME NORTHEASTERN AND EXTREME 
SECTIONS. CONSIDERABLE CLOUDINESS WILL CONTINUE OVER THE AREA DURING 
THE NIGHT. THIS WILL HELP HOLD TEMPERATURES UP. THUS...WILL NOT SEE 
ANY WIDESPREAD FREEZING TEMPERATURES IN THE NORTH OVERNIGHT. THE 
EXCEPTION MAY BE ISOLATED AREAS OVER THE EXTREME NORTH THAT ARE 
ALWAYS COLDER THAN THE SURROUNDING AREAS. MOISTURE WILL BE SLOW TO 
EXIT THE AREA ON FRIDAY. THIS COUPLED WITH NORTHEASTERLY WINDS AND 
CYCLONIC FLOW WILL HELP HOLD QUITE A FEW CLOUDS IN OVER THE AREA ON 
FRIDAY. CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO BREAK FRIDAY NIGHT. DRY WEATHER AND 
MAINLY PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE WEEKEND. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOL. 
&&

.LONG TERM...MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IN THE SOUTHWEST WILL BE THE MAIN PLAYER IN THE 
EXTENDED FORECAST. MODELS ARE COMING BACK SLOWER WITH THE 
SYSTEM...SO HAVE ACCORDINGLY SLOWED THE POP TRENDS. MONDAY WILL BE 
DRY AS HIGH PRESSURE OVERHEAD AHEAD OF AFOREMENTIONED SYSTEM. THE 
HIGH WILL HEAD EAST TUESDAY...WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS INCLUDED FOR 
TUESDAY NIGHT. WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY ARE LOOKING WET...WITH CHANCE 
POPS. IN TIME...THESE WILL PROBABLY HAVE TO BE INCREASED...BUT DUE 
TO UNCERTAINTY IN TIMING...HAVE HELD OFF ON A DRAMATIC CHANGE FROM 
THE PREVIOUS FORECAST. AFTER A COOL START MONDAY...TEMPERATURES WILL 
BE NEAR NORMAL TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    47  53  41  55 /  10  10  10  10 
HARRISON AR       38  49  31  52 /  10  10  10  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    47  53  41  55 /  10  10  10  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     49  55  41  56 /  10  10  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  39  49  31  52 /  10  10  10  10 
MONTICELLO AR     50  57  43  57 /  10  10  10  10 
SEARCY AR         45  52  39  55 /  10  10  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      46  53  41  55 /  10  10  10  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   43  52  38  54 /  10  10  10  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

POPS. IN TIME...THESE WILL PROBABLY HAVE TO BE INCREASED...BUT DUE 
TO UNCERTAINTY IN TIMING...HAVE HELD OFF ON A DRAMATIC CHANGE FROM 
THE PREVIOUS FORECAST. AFTER A COOL START MONDAY...TEMPERATURES WILL 
BE NEAR NORMAL TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    47  53  41  55 /  10  10  10  10 
HARRISON AR       38  49  31  52 /  10  10  10  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    47  53  41  55 /  10  10  10  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     49  55  41  56 /  10  10  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  39  49  31  52 /  10  10  10  10 
MONTICELLO AR     50  57  43  57 /  10  10  10  10 
SEARCY AR         45  52  39  55 /  10  10  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      46  53  41  55 /  10  10  10  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   43  52  38  54 /  10  10  10  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

22/58








000 
FXUS64 KLZK 112129 CCA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
325 PM CST THU NOV 11 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT
RAIN HAD PRETTY WELL ENDED OVER THE FORECAST AREA BY MID AFTERNOON. 
WITH H5 LOW LIFTING SLOWLY NORTHEASTWARD...WILL KEEP A SMALL CHANCE 
OF SHOWERS THIS EVENING OVER THE EXTREME NORTHEASTERN AND EXTREME 
EASTERN SECTIONS. CONSIDERABLE CLOUDINESS WILL CONTINUE OVER THE 
AREA DURING THE NIGHT. THIS WILL HELP HOLD TEMPERATURES UP. 
THUS...WILL NOT SEE ANY WIDESPREAD FREEZING TEMPERATURES IN THE 
NORTH OVERNIGHT. THE EXCEPTION MAY BE ISOLATED AREAS OVER THE 
EXTREME NORTH THAT ARE ALWAYS COLDER THAN THE SURROUNDING AREAS. 
MOISTURE WILL BE SLOW TO EXIT THE AREA ON FRIDAY. THIS COUPLED WITH 
NORTHEASTERLY WINDS AND CYCLONIC FLOW WILL HELP HOLD QUITE A FEW 
CLOUDS IN OVER THE AREA ON FRIDAY. CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO BREAK FRIDAY 
NIGHT. DRY WEATHER AND MAINLY PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS WILL CONTINUE 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND. TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOL. 
&&

.LONG TERM...MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IN THE SOUTHWEST WILL BE THE MAIN PLAYER IN THE 
EXTENDED FORECAST. MODELS ARE COMING BACK SLOWER WITH THE 
SYSTEM...SO HAVE ACCORDINGLY SLOWED THE POP TRENDS. MONDAY WILL BE 
DRY AS HIGH PRESSURE OVERHEAD AHEAD OF AFOREMENTIONED SYSTEM. THE 
HIGH WILL HEAD EAST TUESDAY...WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS INCLUDED FOR 
TUESDAY NIGHT. WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY ARE LOOKING WET...WITH CHANCE 
POPS. IN TIME...THESE WILL PROBABLY HAVE TO BE INCREASED...BUT DUE 
TO UNCERTAINTY IN TIMING...HAVE HELD OFF ON A DRAMATIC CHANGE FROM 
THE PREVIOUS FORECAST. AFTER A COOL START MONDAY...TEMPERATURES WILL 
BE NEAR NORMAL TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    47  53  41  55 /  10  10  10  10 
HARRISON AR       38  49  31  52 /  10  10  10  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    47  53  41  55 /  10  10  10  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     49  55  41  56 /  10  10  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  39  49  31  52 /  10  10  10  10 
MONTICELLO AR     50  57  43  57 /  10  10  10  10 
SEARCY AR         45  52  39  55 /  10  10  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      46  53  41  55 /  10  10  10  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   43  52  38  54 /  10  10  10  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
325 PM CST THU NOV 11 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT
RAIN HAD PRETTY WELL ENDED OVER THE FORECAST AREA BY MID AFTERNOON. 
WITH H5 LOW LIFTING SLOWLY NORTHEASTWARD...WILL KEEP A SMALL CHANCE 
OF SHOWERS THIS EVENING OVER THE EXTREME NORTHEASTERN AND EXTREME 
SECTIONS. CONSIDERABLE CLOUDINESS WILL CONTINUE OVER THE AREA DURING

22/58






076 
FXUS64 KLZK 111741 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1140 AM CST THU NOV 11 2004

.DISCUSSION...
UPDATED FORECASTS TO REMOVE POPS FROM THE EXTREME WEST AND SOUTHWEST 
FOR THIS AFTERNOON. ELSEWHERE KEPT 20-30 PCT POPS FOR REMAINDER OF 
AFTERNOON...WITH BIGGER POPS IN THE NORTHEAST...CLOSER TO THE UPPER 
LOW. UPDATES GONE. 
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 214 AM CST THU NOV 11 2004

PROGRESSIVE NATURE OF OVERALL PATTERN SUPPORTED BY ALL OPERATIONAL 
MODELS THIS MORNING WITH SPLIT FLOW OVER THE CONUS. ACTIVE SOUTHERN 
STREAM CONTAINS TWO DISTINCT UPPER LOWS SEEN CLEARLY ON WATER VAPOR 
IMAGERY THIS MORNING. POSITION OF THE UPPER LOW OVER EAST CENTRAL 
OKLAHOMA VERY CLOSE TO PLACEMENT OF BOTH THE GFS AND ETA SOLUTIONS. 
GFS HAS VARIED VERY LITTLE FROM ITS THINKING OVER THE PAST SEVERAL 
DAYS WHILE ETA HAS CONTINUED TO BE A BIT INCONSISTENT. AS SUCH... 
WILL LEAN HEAVILY TOWARDS A GFS SOLUTION THIS MORNING.

AFOREMENTIONED UPPER LOW OVER EAST CENTRAL OKLAHOMA MOVES SLOWLY 
EASTWARD ACROSS NORTHERN ARKANSAS THROUGH THE DAY. SYSTEM CONTINUES 
TO SLOWLY WEAKEN OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY BEFORE DISSIPATING AS IT 
GETS ABSORBED INTO A TROF OVER THE GREAT LAKES. SYSTEM VERTICALLY 
STACKED WITH ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW JUST TO THE SOUTH OF THE UPPER 
LOW. COLD FRONT EXTENDS FROM THE SURFACE LOW ACROSS EASTERN OKLAHOMA 
AND TEXAS. SECOND COLD FRONT EXTENDS ALMOST IMMEDIATELY BEHIND THE 
FIRST ONE ACROSS THE PLAINS WITH SOME RATHER CHILLY AIR BEHIND IT. 
PLENTY OF SHOWERS OVER THE EASTERN TWO THIRDS OF THE CWA IN AN AREA 
OF WARM AIR ADVECTION AND ENHANCED LIFT. ANOTHER AREA OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE WEST ALONG A WIND SHIFT LINE WITH GOOD 
SURFACE CONVERGENCE AND SOME DIFFLUANCE ALOFT. 

THUNDERSTORMS HAVE BECOME MORE ELEVATED WITH TIME AND INSTABILITY 
REMAINS WEAK. SEVERE CONCERNS ARE MINIMAL ALTHOUGH SOME GUSTY WINDS 
CAN NOT BE RULED OUT. 

MODELS CAME BACK SLOWER WITH THIS MORNING WITH SURFACE LOW AND 
ASSOCIATED FRONTS NOT REACHING THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER UNTIL LATE IN 
THE DAY. COLDER AIR SWEEPS IN BEHIND THE FRONT WITH STEADY OR SLOWLY 
FALLING TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE NORTH IN DEVELOPING COLD AIR 
ADVECTION PATTERN. PRECIP WRAPPING AROUND THE BACK SIDE OF THE LOW 
OVER NORTHERN OKLAHOMA AND SOUTHERN KANSAS. WITH SLOWER MOVEMENT OF 
THE SYSTEM AND RESIDUAL RAIN...WILL KEEP POPS GOING ALL DAY BUT WILL
BEGIN TO TAPER THEM OFF FROM WEST TO EAST EARLY THIS MORNING. WOULD 
NOT BE SURPRISED TO SEE SOME HAIL ACROSS THE NORTH TODAY AS POCKET 
OF COLD AIR ASSOCIATED WITH THE LOW MOVES ACROSS. AIR MASS COULD 
DESTABILIZE ENOUGH WITH ANY DAYTIME HEATING ALTHOUGH IT APPEARS THIS 
WOULD BE MINIMAL. 

ONCE LOW PULLS OUT...SECONDARY COLD FRONT SWEEPS THROUGH AND 
CANADIAN HIGH BEGINS TO BUILD IN. COOLEST AIR OF THE SEASON TO DATE  
COMES IN ON GUSTY NORTH TO NORTHEAST WINDS. WHILE GRADIENT BETWEEN 
THE DEPARTING LOW AND BUILDING HIGH TIGHTENS...IT APPEARS WINDS WILL 
STAY BELOW WIND LAKE ADVISORY CRITERIA BUT IT WILL BE CLOSE. ENOUGH 
CLOUD COVER WILL BE LEFT TONIGHT TO KEEP TEMPS FROM TOTALLY 
BOTTOMING OUR BUT WIDESPREAD 30S STILL APPEAR LIKELY ACROSS THE 
NORTH. HIGH BUILDS DOWN FRIDAY FOR CLEARING SKIES WITH TEMPERATURES 
HARD PRESSED TO GET OUT OF THE UPPER 40S NORTH AND 50S ELSEWHERE.

COLDEST NIGHT WILL BE FRIDAY NIGHT WITH WIDESPREAD 30S EXPECTED. 
UPPER 20S ACROSS THE NORTH ALSO SEEM LIKELY. HIGH WILL DOMINATE ON 
SATURDAY WITH TEMPERATURES REMAINING COOL. HIGH BEGINS TO MOVE 
EASTWARD ON SUNDAY BUT EASTERLY SURFACE FLOW WOULD PRECLUDE ANY 
SUBSTANTIAL WARMING THROUGH THE WEEKEND. AS NEXT SYSTEM IN THE 
SOUTHWEST CONUS BEGINS TO LIFT OUT SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...SOME 
MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO ENCROACH ON THE STATE AND WILL KEEP LOW POPS 
IN SUNDAY NIGHT. CLOUDS WILL KEEP TEMPS FROM TOTALLY BOTTOMING OUT 
SUNDAY AND MONDAY MORNINGS. WENT WITH A BLEND OF MAV AND FWC 
NUMBERS. 

BY EARLY MONDAY...THE PREFERRED NEW 11.00 GFS90 MODEL RUN WITH A 
DEEPENING CLOSED-OFF H5 LOW NEAR NORTHERN BAJA WILL LIKELY VERIFY 
BEST. THIS PUTS ARKANSAS UNDER A SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WITH A SERIES 
OF VORTS EXPECTED TO APPROACH FROM THE SOUTHWEST AND BRING ABOUT 
PERIODS OF RAIN MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. A FEW THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
DEVELOP BY LATE TUESDAY AS A STRONGER VORT MOVES ACROSS. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL.  

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

22

SOUTHWEST CONUS BEGINS TO LIFT OUT SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...SOME 
MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO ENCROACH ON THE STATE AND WILL KEEP LOW POPS 
IN SUNDAY NIGHT. CLOUDS WILL KEEP TEMPS FROM TOTALLY BOTTOMING OUT 
SUNDAY AND MONDAY MORNINGS. WENT WITH A BLEND OF MAV AND FWC 
NUMBERS. 

BY EARLY MONDAY...THE PREFERRED NEW 11.00 GFS90 MODEL RUN WITH A 
DEEPENING CLOSED-OFF H5 LOW NEAR NORTHERN BAJA WILL LIKELY VERIFY 
BEST. THIS PUTS ARKANSAS UNDER A SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WITH A SERIES 
OF VORTS EXPECTED TO APPROACH FROM THE SOUTHWEST AND BRING ABOUT 
PERIODS OF RAIN MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. A FEW THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
DEVELOP BY LATE TUESDAY AS A STRONGER VORT MOVES ACROSS. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
920 AM CST THU NOV 11 2004

.DISCUSSION...
MOST OF THE RAINFALL HAD MOVED OUT OF THE FORECAST AREA BY 15Z. 
UPDATED FORECASTS TO LOWER POPS TO CHANCE CATEGORY FOR ALL SECTIONS 
FOR THE REMAINDER OF TODAY. WENT HIGHEST POPS IN THE NORTH...CLOSER 
TO THE UPPER LOW...AND LOWER POPS CENTRAL AND SOUTH. UPDATES GONE.
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
ISSUED AT 214 AM CST THU NOV 11 2004

PROGRESSIVE NATURE OF OVERALL PATTERN SUPPORTED BY ALL OPERATIONAL 
MODELS THIS MORNING WITH SPLIT FLOW OVER THE CONUS. ACTIVE SOUTHERN 
STREAM CONTAINS TWO DISTINCT UPPER LOWS SEEN CLEARLY ON WATER VAPOR 
IMAGERY THIS MORNING. POSITION OF THE UPPER LOW OVER EAST CENTRAL 
OKLAHOMA VERY CLOSE TO PLACEMENT OF BOTH THE GFS AND ETA SOLUTIONS. 
GFS HAS VARIED VERY LITTLE FROM ITS THINKING OVER THE PAST SEVERAL 
DAYS WHILE ETA HAS CONTINUED TO BE A BIT INCONSISTENT. AS SUCH... 
WILL LEAN HEAVILY TOWARDS A GFS SOLUTION THIS MORNING.

AFOREMENTIONED UPPER LOW OVER EAST CENTRAL OKLAHOMA MOVES SLOWLY 
EASTWARD ACROSS NORTHERN ARKANSAS THROUGH THE DAY. SYSTEM CONTINUES 
TO SLOWLY WEAKEN OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY BEFORE DISSIPATING AS IT 
GETS ABSORBED INTO A TROF OVER THE GREAT LAKES. SYSTEM VERTICALLY 
STACKED WITH ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW JUST TO THE SOUTH OF THE UPPER 
LOW. COLD FRONT EXTENDS FROM THE SURFACE LOW ACROSS EASTERN OKLAHOMA 
AND TEXAS. SECOND COLD FRONT EXTENDS ALMOST IMMEDIATELY BEHIND THE 
FIRST ONE ACROSS THE PLAINS WITH SOME RATHER CHILLY AIR BEHIND IT.

THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE WEST ALONG A WIND SHIFT LINE WITH GOOD 
SURFACE CONVERGENCE AND SOME DIFFLUANCE ALOFT. 

THUNDERSTORMS HAVE BECOME MORE ELEVATED WITH TIME AND INSTABILITY 
REMAINS WEAK. SEVERE CONCERNS ARE MINIMAL ALTHOUGH SOME GUSTY WINDS 
CAN NOT BE RULED OUT. 

MODELS CAME BACK SLOWER WITH THIS MORNING WITH SURFACE LOW AND 
ASSOCIATED FRONTS NOT REACHING THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER UNTIL LATE IN 
THE DAY. COLDER AIR SWEEPS IN BEHIND THE FRONT WITH STEADY OR SLOWLY 
FALLING TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE NORTH IN DEVELOPING COLD AIR 
ADVECTION PATTERN. PRECIP WRAPPING AROUND THE BACK SIDE OF THE LOW 
OVER NORTHERN OKLAHOMA AND SOUTHERN KANSAS. WITH SLOWER MOVEMENT OF 
THE SYSTEM AND RESIDUAL RAIN...WILL KEEP POPS GOING ALL DAY BUT WILL
BEGIN TO TAPER THEM OFF FROM WEST TO EAST EARLY THIS MORNING. WOULD 
NOT BE SURPRISED TO SEE SOME HAIL ACROSS THE NORTH TODAY AS POCKET 
OF COLD AIR ASSOCIATED WITH THE LOW MOVES ACROSS. AIR MASS COULD 
DESTABILIZE ENOUGH WITH ANY DAYTIME HEATING ALTHOUGH IT APPEARS THIS

OVER NORTHERN OKLAHOMA AND SOUTHERN KANSAS. WITH SLOWER MOVEMENT OF 
THE SYSTEM AND RESIDUAL RAIN...WILL KEEP POPS GOING ALL DAY BUT WILL
BEGIN TO TAPER THEM OFF FROM WEST TO EAST EARLY THIS MORNING. WOULD 
NOT BE SURPRISED TO SEE SOME HAIL ACROSS THE NORTH TODAY AS POCKET 
OF COLD AIR ASSOCIATED WITH THE LOW MOVES ACROSS. AIR MASS COULD 
DESTABILIZE ENOUGH WITH ANY DAYTIME HEATING ALTHOUGH IT APPEARS THIS 
WOULD BE MINIMAL. 

ONCE LOW PULLS OUT...SECONDARY COLD FRONT SWEEPS THROUGH AND 
CANADIAN HIGH BEGINS TO BUILD IN. COOLEST AIR OF THE SEASON TO DATE  
COMES IN ON GUSTY NORTH TO NORTHEAST WINDS. WHILE GRADIENT BETWEEN 
THE DEPARTING LOW AND BUILDING HIGH TIGHTENS...IT APPEARS WINDS WILL 
STAY BELOW WIND LAKE ADVISORY CRITERIA BUT IT WILL BE CLOSE. ENOUGH 
CLOUD COVER WILL BE LEFT TONIGHT TO KEEP TEMPS FROM TOTALLY 
BOTTOMING OUR BUT WIDESPREAD 30S STILL APPEAR LIKELY ACROSS THE 
NORTH. HIGH BUILDS DOWN FRIDAY FOR CLEARING SKIES WITH TEMPERATURES 
HARD PRESSED TO GET OUT OF THE UPPER 40S NORTH AND 50S ELSEWHERE.

COLDEST NIGHT WILL BE FRIDAY NIGHT WITH WIDESPREAD 30S EXPECTED. 
UPPER 20S ACROSS THE NORTH ALSO SEEM LIKELY. HIGH WILL DOMINATE ON 
SATURDAY WITH TEMPERATURES REMAINING COOL. HIGH BEGINS TO MOVE 
EASTWARD ON SUNDAY BUT EASTERLY SURFACE FLOW WOULD PRECLUDE ANY 
SUBSTANTIAL WARMING THROUGH THE WEEKEND. AS NEXT SYSTEM IN THE 
SOUTHWEST CONUS BEGINS TO LIFT OUT SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...SOME 
MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO ENCROACH ON THE STATE AND WILL KEEP LOW POPS 
IN SUNDAY NIGHT. CLOUDS WILL KEEP TEMPS FROM TOTALLY BOTTOMING OUT 
SUNDAY AND MONDAY MORNINGS. WENT WITH A BLEND OF MAV AND FWC 
NUMBERS. 

BY EARLY MONDAY...THE PREFERRED NEW 11.00 GFS90 MODEL RUN WITH A 
DEEPENING CLOSED-OFF H5 LOW NEAR NORTHERN BAJA WILL LIKELY VERIFY 
BEST. THIS PUTS ARKANSAS UNDER A SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WITH A SERIES 
OF VORTS EXPECTED TO APPROACH FROM THE SOUTHWEST AND BRING ABOUT 
PERIODS OF RAIN MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. A FEW THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
DEVELOP BY LATE TUESDAY AS A STRONGER VORT MOVES ACROSS. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL.  

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

22






290 
FXUS64 KLZK 110816
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
214 AM CST THU NOV 11 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...
PROGRESSIVE NATURE OF OVERALL PATTERN SUPPORTED BY ALL OPERATIONAL 
MODELS THIS MORNING WITH SPLIT FLOW OVER THE CONUS. ACTIVE SOUTHERN 
STREAM CONTAINS TWO DISTINCT UPPER LOWS SEEN CLEARLY ON WATER VAPOR 
IMAGERY THIS MORNING. POSITION OF THE UPPER LOW OVER EAST CENTRAL 
OKLAHOMA VERY CLOSE TO PLACEMENT OF BOTH THE GFS AND ETA SOLUTIONS. 
GFS HAS VARIED VERY LITTLE FROM ITS THINKING OVER THE PAST SEVERAL 
DAYS WHILE ETA HAS CONTINUED TO BE A BIT INCONSISTENT. AS SUCH... 
WILL LEAN HEAVILY TOWARDS A GFS SOLUTION THIS MORNING.

AFOREMENTIONED UPPER LOW OVER EAST CENTRAL OKLAHOMA MOVES SLOWLY 
EASTWARD ACROSS NORTHERN ARKANSAS THROUGH THE DAY. SYSTEM CONTINUES 
TO SLOWLY WEAKEN OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY BEFORE DISSIPATING AS IT 
GETS ABSORBED INTO A TROF OVER THE GREAT LAKES. SYSTEM VERTICALLY 
STACKED WITH ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW JUST TO THE SOUTH OF THE UPPER 
LOW. COLD FRONT EXTENDS FROM THE SURFACE LOW ACROSS EASTERN OKLAHOMA 
AND TEXAS. SECOND COLD FRONT EXTENDS ALMOST IMMEDIATELY BEHIND THE 
FIRST ONE ACROSS THE PLAINS WITH SOME RATHER CHILLY AIR BEHIND IT. 
PLENTY OF SHOWERS OVER THE EASTERN TWO THIRDS OF THE CWA IN AN AREA 
OF WARM AIR ADVECTION AND ENHANCED LIFT. ANOTHER AREA OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE WEST ALONG A WIND SHIFT LINE WITH GOOD 
SURFACE CONVERGENCE AND SOME DIFFLUANCE ALOFT. 

THUNDERSTORMS HAVE BECOME MORE ELEVATED WITH TIME AND INSTABILITY 
REMAINS WEAK. SEVERE CONCERNS ARE MINIMAL ALTHOUGH SOME GUSTY WINDS 
CAN NOT BE RULED OUT. 

MODELS CAME BACK SLOWER WITH THIS MORNING WITH SURFACE LOW AND 
ASSOCIATED FRONTS NOT REACHING THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER UNTIL LATE IN 
THE DAY. COLDER AIR SWEEPS IN BEHIND THE FRONT WITH STEADY OR SLOWLY 
FALLING TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE NORTH IN DEVELOPING COLD AIR 
ADVECTION PATTERN. PRECIP WRAPPING AROUND THE BACK SIDE OF THE LOW 
OVER NORTHERN OKLAHOMA AND SOUTHERN KANSAS. WITH SLOWER MOVEMENT OF 
THE SYSTEM AND RESIDUAL RAIN...WILL KEEP POPS GOING ALL DAY BUT WILL
BEGIN TO TAPER THEM OFF FROM WEST TO EAST EARLY THIS MORNING. WOULD 
NOT BE SURPRISED TO SEE SOME HAIL ACROSS THE NORTH TODAY AS POCKET 
OF COLD AIR ASSOCIATED WITH THE LOW MOVES ACROSS. AIR MASS COULD 
DESTABILIZE ENOUGH WITH ANY DAYTIME HEATING ALTHOUGH IT APPEARS THIS 
WOULD BE MINIMAL. 

ONCE LOW PULLS OUT...SECONDARY COLD FRONT SWEEPS THROUGH AND 
CANADIAN HIGH BEGINS TO BUILD IN. COOLEST AIR OF THE SEASON TO DATE  
COMES IN ON GUSTY NORTH TO NORTHEAST WINDS. WHILE GRADIENT BETWEEN 
THE DEPARTING LOW AND BUILDING HIGH TIGHTENS...IT APPEARS WINDS WILL 
STAY BELOW WIND LAKE ADVISORY CRITERIA BUT IT WILL BE CLOSE. ENOUGH 
CLOUD COVER WILL BE LEFT TONIGHT TO KEEP TEMPS FROM TOTALLY 
BOTTOMING OUR BUT WIDESPREAD 30S STILL APPEAR LIKELY ACROSS THE 
NORTH. HIGH BUILDS DOWN FRIDAY FOR CLEARING SKIES WITH TEMPERATURES 
HARD PRESSED TO GET OUT OF THE UPPER 40S NORTH AND 50S ELSEWHERE.

COLDEST NIGHT WILL BE FRIDAY NIGHT WITH WIDESPREAD 30S EXPECTED. 
UPPER 20S ACROSS THE NORTH ALSO SEEM LIKELY. HIGH WILL DOMINATE ON 
SATURDAY WITH TEMPERATURES REMAINING COOL. HIGH BEGINS TO MOVE 
EASTWARD ON SUNDAY BUT EASTERLY SURFACE FLOW WOULD PRECLUDE ANY 
SUBSTANTIAL WARMING THROUGH THE WEEKEND. AS NEXT SYSTEM IN THE 
SOUTHWEST CONUS BEGINS TO LIFT OUT SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...SOME 
MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO ENCROACH ON THE STATE AND WILL KEEP LOW POPS 
IN SUNDAY NIGHT. CLOUDS WILL KEEP TEMPS FROM TOTALLY BOTTOMING OUT 
SUNDAY AND MONDAY MORNINGS. WENT WITH A BLEND OF MAV AND FWC 
NUMBERS. 
&&

.LONG TERM...MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...
BY EARLY MONDAY...THE PREFERRED NEW 11.00 GFS90 MODEL RUN WITH A 
DEEPENING CLOSED-OFF H5 LOW NEAR NORTHERN BAJA WILL LIKELY VERIFY 
BEST. THIS PUTS ARKANSAS UNDER A SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WITH A SERIES 
OF VORTS EXPECTED TO APPROACH FROM THE SOUTHWEST AND BRING ABOUT 
PERIODS OF RAIN MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY. A FEW THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
DEVELOP BY LATE TUESDAY AS A STRONGER VORT MOVES ACROSS. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL.  
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    65  42  52  35 /  60  20  10   0 
HARRISON AR       53  31  48  30 /  40  10  10   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    65  42  52  35 /  60  10  10   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     66  43  54  36 /  70  20  10   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  54  32  48  30 /  60  10  10   0 
MONTICELLO AR     67  45  56  37 /  70  20  10   0 
SEARCY AR         64  38  51  34 /  70  20  10   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      64  41  52  33 /  50  10  10   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   59  35  51  32 /  50  10  10   0

209 
FXUS64 KLZK 110414
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1015 PM CST WED NOV 10 2004

.DISCUSSION...
UPPER LOW APPEARS TO BE OVER NORTH CENTRAL OKLAHOMA AT ISSUE
TIME BASED ON SATELLITE. MAIN COLD FRONT IS LAGGING BEHIND THE
SYSTEM. MAIN LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS IS INTO EXTREME EASTERN 
OKLAHOMA AND IT SHOULD PROGRESS EAST INTO ARKANSAS AND ACROSS
THE AREA THROUGH THE NIGHT. MEANWHILE SCATTERED SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED MOSTLY FROM WARM ADVECTION AND 
ISENTROPIC LIFT ACROSS WESTERN AND CENTRAL ARKANSAS. THIS 
HAS ALSO BEEN AIDED BY SOME UPPER DIFFLUENCE AHEAD OF THE UPPER 
LOW. INSTABILITY IS QUITE MARGINAL SO THIS WILL CUT DOWN ON
SEVERE POTENTIAL ALTHOUGH ISOLATED STRONG STORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE.
FIGURE ON ACTIVITY CONTINUING TO INCREASE IN COVERAGE OVER THE
NEXT FEW HOURS SO LEFT POPS AT 80 PERCENT. DID UPDATE MAINLY
TO CLEAR UP EVENING WORDING. UPPED WIND FORECASTS A LITTLE IN THE
EAST WHERE STRONGER SOUTHEAST WINDS HAVE DEVELOPED AHEAD OF THE
PRECIPITATION...BUT THAT SHOULD DECREASE SOME ONCE RAIN BEGINS.
TEMP FORECASTS LOOK GOOD AT THIS TIME.   
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&



342 
FXUS64 KLZK 102103
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
259 PM CST WED NOV 10 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY
LATEST SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWED ABUNDANT CLOUD COVER ACROSS THE 
AREA. KLZK RADAR INDICATED A FEW SPRINKLES MOVING NORTH ACROSS 
CENTRAL ARKANSAS. 

AN UPPER LEVEL LOW WAS LOCATED OVER NORTH OKLAHOMA. A WARM FRONT 
ACROSS SOUTHERN ARKANSAS AT THIS TIME WILL BE MOVING NORTH ACROSS 
THE STATE THIS EVENING. LOW LEVEL SOUTHEAST FLOW WILL BRING MOISTURE 
INTO THE STATE. A COLD FRONT STILL IN WESTERN OKLAHOMA WILL CONTINUE 
MOVING EAST TONIGHT AND WILL MOVE THROUGH ARKANSAS DURING THE DAY ON 
THURSDAY. THIS WILL BE THE MAIN FOCUSING MECHANISM FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS. WILL CONTINUE WITH THE CLOUDY 
SKIES AND HIGH POPS FOR THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. WILL DECREASE POPS ON 
THURSDAY BEHIND THE COLD FRONT AS IT MOVES THROUGH. THIS WILL KEEP 
AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES NEAR STEADY ACROSS THE NORTHWEST HALF OF THE 
STATE ON THURSDAY...AND POSSIBLY FALLING BY LATE AFTERNOON. 

HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. 
COOLER TEMPERATURES WILL MOVE IN BEHIND THE FRONT. COLDEST 
TEMPERATURES OF THE SEASON ARE EXPECTED TO ARRIVE SATURDAY MORNING 
WITH LOWS NEAR 30 DEGREES IN THE NORTH. DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED 
FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. 
&&

.LONG TERM....LONG TERM...SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY UNSETTLED 
CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL DURING THIS PERIOD. UPPER LOW/TROUGH ACROSS 
THE SOUTHWEST U.S. WILL EJECT NORTHEAST BY THE END OF THE PERIOD. 
HAVE TRENDED PRECIPITATION FORECASTS TO REFLECT PREFERRED SLOWER 
SOLUTIONS OF RECENT MEDIUM RANGE MODEL OUTPUT.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    58  65  42  52 /  80  80  10  10 
HARRISON AR       53  52  31  48 /  80  80  10  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    59  65  42  52 /  80  80  10  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     60  66  43  54 /  80  80  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  53  54  32  48 /  80  80  10  10 
MONTICELLO AR     62  67  45  56 /  80  80  20  10 
SEARCY AR         56  64  38  51 /  80  80  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      58  64  41  52 /  80  80  10  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   55  59  35  51 /  80  80  10  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

51





680 
FXUS64 KLZK 101630
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1030 AM CST WED NOV 10 2004

.DISCUSSION...
WITH SOUTHEAST WINDS CONTINUING THROUGH THE AFTERNOON ACROSS THE 
AREA...THE TEMPERATURES ARE IN NEED OF BEING INCREASED. BUMPED 
TEMPERATURES UP 5 TO 7 DEGREES. SATELLITE IMAGES SHOW BROKEN CLOUDS 
ACROSS MUCH OF THE WESTERN TWO THIRDS OF THE STATE. INCREASED CLOUD 
COVER BASED ON CURRENT TRENDS. LATEST KLZK SOUNDING SHOWS A GOOD 
PORTION OF DRY AIR IN PLACE YET. WILL TAKE SOME TIME TO MOISTEN UP 
THE LOWER LEVELS...THEREFORE BETTER CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION WILL BE 
LATE IN THE AFTERNOON WITH CHANCES INCREASING THROUGH THE NIGHT. 
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
PROGRESSIVE NATURE OF OVERALL PATTERN SUPPORTED BY ALL OPERATIONAL 
MODELS THIS MORNING. ETA SOLUTION CONTINUES TO BE INCONSISTENT 
VERSUS THE GFS MODEL OVER THE PAST FEW DAYS WITH REGARDS TO BOTH 
TIMING AND STRENGTH OF THE MAJOR PLAYERS. GFS MODEL ALSO SUPPORTED 
BY OTHER SHORT TERM MODELS AND HAS VARIED VERY LITTLE FROM ITS 
THINKING OVER THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS. AS SUCH...WILL LEAN HEAVILY 
TOWARDS A GFS SOLUTION THIS MORNING.

DRY PATTERN OF LATE WILL BE UNDERGOING A RATHER DRAMATIC CHANGE OVER 
THE NEXT 36 HOURS AS UPPER LEVEL LOW CURRENTLY OVER THE NEW MEXICO 
AND COLORADO BORDER KICKS OUT INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS. FEATURE IS 
QUITE EVIDENT ON WATER VAPOR IMAGERY AND LINES UP VERY WELL WITH THE 
GFS POSITION. WATER VAPOR ALSO SHOWING INCREASING PLUME OF GULF 
MOISTURE. PWAT VALUES OF BARELY 1/2 INCH OFF THE 00Z LZK SOUNDING 
NEARLY TRIPLE ACROSS SOME PARTS OF THE AREA WEDNESDAY AS LOW LEVEL 
FLOW OFF THE GULF INCREASES. APPROACHING LOW DOES WEAKEN SOMEWHAT  
WITH TIME AS IT BEGINS TO PHASE WITH A TROF MOVING ACROSS THE GREAT 
LAKES STATES.

ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW AND COLD FRONT MOVE INTO CENTRAL OKLAHOMA BY 
LATE WEDNESDAY AND ACROSS NORTHERN ARKANSAS WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
EARLY THURSDAY. TO COMPLICATE MATTERS...A STRONG CANADIAN COLD FRONT 
IS LITERALLY ON THE HEELS OF THE FIRST FRONT AND APPEARS TO ABSORB 
IT BY THURSDAY MORNING AS IT SWEEPS ACROSS THE STATE. 

APPROACHING SYSTEM IS ACTUALLY QUITE DYNAMIC WITH PLENTY OF LOW 
LEVEL CONVERGENCE ALONG THE FRONT...GOOD VERTICAL VELOCITY AND SOME 
DECENT...ALBEIT NOT GREAT...UPPER LEVEL DIFFLUANCE. WITH INCREASING 
LOW LEVEL JET AND MOISTURE IN PLACE...RAIN LOOKS LIKELY AREA WIDE. 
BEST DYNAMICS ASSOCIATED WITH THE SYSTEM PASS TO THE NORTH OF THE 
STATE WITH HIGHER RAINFALL AMOUNTS EXPECTED TO THE NORTH. MODELS 
ALSO KICKING THE SYSTEM OUT A LITTLE FASTER SO WILL NEED TO ADJUST 
POPS UPWARDS WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. THUNDERSTORMS ALSO POSSIBLE BUT 
SEVERE WEATHER CONCERN IS LOW. STABILITY IS NOT VERY IMPRESSIVE BUT 
STRONG WINDS ALOFT COULD BE BROUGHT TO THE SURFACE VIA DOWNDRAFTS IN 
ANY STORM THAT DO DEVELOP. SOME HAIL IS ALSO POSSIBLE AS COLD POOL 
ASSOCIATED WITH UPPER LOW SWINGS ACROSS THE NORTH.

MAIN SYSTEM BEGINS TO PULL OUT THURSDAY MORNING WITH PRECIPITATION 
CONTINUING EARLY. ENOUGH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE BEHIND SYSTEM TO WARRANT 
AT LEAST CHANCE POPS THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. CONSIDERABLY WEAKER WAVE 
MOVES ACROSS THE SOUTH THURSDAY NIGHT. WILL ADD SOME LOW POPS HERE 
EARLY TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS FEATURE.  

RATHER TIGHT GRADIENT BEHIND THE FRONT THURSDAY FOR BLUSTERY 
CONDITIONS. A LAKE WIND ADVISORY WILL BE NEEDED IN ALL LIKELIHOOD 
THURSDAY. AS COOL AIR SWEEPS IN...HIGH TEMPERATURES ON THURSDAY 
LIKELY TO OCCUR EARLY WITH STEADY/SLOWLY FALLING TEMPS IN THE 
AFTERNOON.

HIGH BEGINS TO BUILD IN THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. GRADIENT WILL 
SLACKEN BUT SOME OF THE COOLEST AIR SO FAR THIS SEASON WILL BE 
COMING IN. SKIES WILL BE MAINLY CLEAR BUT TEMPERATURES NOT EXPECTED 
TO GET OUT OF THE FIFTIES ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. LOWEST 
TEMPERATURES EXPECTED SATURDAY MORNING WITH WIDESPREAD 20S ACROSS 
THE NORTH AND THIRTIES ELSEWHERE. LOW TEMPERATURES WILL NOT BE AS 
LOW SUNDAY MORNING WITH HIGH MOVING TO THE EAST AND RETURN FLOW 
STARTING TO GET REESTABLISHED. WILL GO WITH A BLEND OF MAV/FWC 
NUMBERS.

SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY
THE NEW 10.00 GFSLR MODEL RUN IS RATHER INTERESTING WITH A DEEPENING 
CLOSED OFF H5 LOW OVER NORTHERN BAJA. THIS PUTS ARKANSAS UNDER A 
SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WITH A SERIES OF VORTS EXPECTED TO APPROACH 
FROM THE SOUTHWEST AND BRING ABOUT PERIODS OF RAIN SUNDAY THROUGH 
TUESDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE BACK TO NEAR NORMAL AFTER A BRIEF 
COOL-DOWN.  
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

51






000 
FXUS64 KLZK 101630
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1030 AM CST WED NOV 10 2004

.DISCUSSION...
WITH SOUTHEAST WINDS CONTINUING THROUGH THE AFTERNOON ACROSS THE 
AREA...THE TEMPERATURES ARE IN NEED OF BEING INCREASED. BUMPED 
TEMPERATURES UP 5 TO 7 DEGREES. SATELLITE IMAGES SHOW BROKEN CLOUDS 
ACROSS MUCH OF THE WESTERN TWO THIRDS OF THE STATE. INCREASED CLOUD 
COVER BASED ON CURRENT TRENDS. LATEST KLZK SOUNDING SHOWS A GOOD 
PORTION OF DRY AIR IN PLACE YET. WILL TAKE SOME TIME TO MOISTEN UP 
THE LOWER LEVELS...THEREFORE BETTER CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION WILL BE 
LATE IN THE AFTERNOON WITH CHANCES INCREASING THROUGH THE NIGHT. 
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
PROGRESSIVE NATURE OF OVERALL PATTERN SUPPORTED BY ALL OPERATIONAL 
MODELS THIS MORNING. ETA SOLUTION CONTINUES TO BE INCONSISTENT 
VERSUS THE GFS MODEL OVER THE PAST FEW DAYS WITH REGARDS TO BOTH 
TIMING AND STRENGTH OF THE MAJOR PLAYERS. GFS MODEL ALSO SUPPORTED 
BY OTHER SHORT TERM MODELS AND HAS VARIED VERY LITTLE FROM ITS 
THINKING OVER THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS. AS SUCH...WILL LEAN HEAVILY 
TOWARDS A GFS SOLUTION THIS MORNING.

DRY PATTERN OF LATE WILL BE UNDERGOING A RATHER DRAMATIC CHANGE OVER 
THE NEXT 36 HOURS AS UPPER LEVEL LOW CURRENTLY OVER THE NEW MEXICO 
AND COLORADO BORDER KICKS OUT INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS. FEATURE IS 
QUITE EVIDENT ON WATER VAPOR IMAGERY AND LINES UP VERY WELL WITH THE 
GFS POSITION. WATER VAPOR ALSO SHOWING INCREASING PLUME OF GULF 
MOISTURE. PWAT VALUES OF BARELY 1/2 INCH OFF THE 00Z LZK SOUNDING 
NEARLY TRIPLE ACROSS SOME PARTS OF THE AREA WEDNESDAY AS LOW LEVEL 
FLOW OFF THE GULF INCREASES. APPROACHING LOW DOES WEAKEN SOMEWHAT  
WITH TIME AS IT BEGINS TO PHASE WITH A TROF MOVING ACROSS THE GREAT 
LAKES STATES.

ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW AND COLD FRONT MOVE INTO CENTRAL OKLAHOMA BY 
LATE WEDNESDAY AND ACROSS NORTHERN ARKANSAS WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
EARLY THURSDAY. TO COMPLICATE MATTERS...A STRONG CANADIAN COLD FRONT 
IS LITERALLY ON THE HEELS OF THE FIRST FRONT AND APPEARS TO ABSORB 
IT BY THURSDAY MORNING AS IT SWEEPS ACROSS THE STATE. 

APPROACHING SYSTEM IS ACTUALLY QUITE DYNAMIC WITH PLENTY OF LOW 
LEVEL CONVERGENCE ALONG THE FRONT...GOOD VERTICAL VELOCITY AND SOME 
DECENT...ALBEIT NOT GREAT...UPPER LEVEL DIFFLUANCE. WITH INCREASING 
LOW LEVEL JET AND MOISTURE IN PLACE...RAIN LOOKS LIKELY AREA WIDE. 
BEST DYNAMICS ASSOCIATED WITH THE SYSTEM PASS TO THE NORTH OF THE 
STATE WITH HIGHER RAINFALL AMOUNTS EXPECTED TO THE NORTH. MODELS 
ALSO KICKING THE SYSTEM OUT A LITTLE FASTER SO WILL NEED TO ADJUST 
POPS UPWARDS WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. THUNDERSTORMS ALSO POSSIBLE BUT 
SEVERE WEATHER CONCERN IS LOW. STABILITY IS NOT VERY IMPRESSIVE BUT 
STRONG WINDS ALOFT COULD BE BROUGHT TO THE SURFACE VIA DOWNDRAFTS IN 
ANY STORM THAT DO DEVELOP. SOME HAIL IS ALSO POSSIBLE AS COLD POOL 
ASSOCIATED WITH UPPER LOW SWINGS ACROSS THE NORTH.

MAIN SYSTEM BEGINS TO PULL OUT THURSDAY MORNING WITH PRECIPITATION 
CONTINUING EARLY. ENOUGH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE BEHIND SYSTEM TO WARRANT 
AT LEAST CHANCE POPS THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. CONSIDERABLY WEAKER WAVE 
MOVES ACROSS THE SOUTH THURSDAY NIGHT. WILL ADD SOME LOW POPS HERE 
EARLY TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS FEATURE.  

RATHER TIGHT GRADIENT BEHIND THE FRONT THURSDAY FOR BLUSTERY

LIKELY TO OCCUR EARLY WITH STEADY/SLOWLY FALLING TEMPS IN THE 
AFTERNOON.

SLACKEN BUT SOME OF THE COOLEST AIR SO FAR THIS SEASON WILL BE 
COMING IN. SKIES WILL BE MAINLY CLEAR BUT TEMPERATURES NOT EXPECTED 
TO GET OUT OF THE FIFTIES ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. LOWEST 
TEMPERATURES EXPECTED SATURDAY MORNING WITH WIDESPREAD 20S ACROSS 
THE NORTH AND THIRTIES ELSEWHERE. LOW TEMPERATURES WILL NOT BE AS 
LOW SUNDAY MORNING WITH HIGH MOVING TO THE EAST AND RETURN FLOW 
STARTING TO GET REESTABLISHED. WILL GO WITH A BLEND OF MAV/FWC 
NUMBERS.
