56/38





789 
FXUS64 KLZK 100357
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
957 PM CST TUE NOV 9 2004

.DISCUSSION...
CIRRUS AND ALTOCU DECKS CURRENTLY STREAMING IN FROM THE WEST. 
SURFACE RIDGE CENTERED OVER THE MID MISSISSIPPI/OHIO VALLEY...WITH 
APPROACHING FRONTAL SYSTEM COMING DOWN OFF THE ROCKIES. SURFACE HIGH 
WILL MOVE EAST TONIGHT...WITH FLOW ALREADY COMING AROUND TO THE 
SOUTH IN THE WESTERN HALF OF THE AREA AND OVER THE REMAINDER OF THE 
AREA TOWARD MORNING. TEMPS HAVE LEVELLED OFF IN MUCH OF THE WEST...
AND HAVE EVEN RISEN IN A FEW PLACES.

WILL BE SENDING OUT AN UPDATE SHORTLY. HAVE ADJUSTED TEMPERATURES A 
BIT...BUMPING READINGS UP A DEGREE OR TWO IN THE CENTRAL AND PARTS 
OF THE EAST. HAVE TRENDED TEMPS MUCH SLOWER IN THE WEST...AND KEPT 
HOURLY TEMPS NEARLY STEADY IN SOME AREAS OVERNIGHT. HAVE ALSO 
ADJUSTED OTHER PARAMETERS BASED ON ONGOING TRENDS.

UPDATE WILL BE OUT WITHIN THE NEXT 10 MINUTES. 
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
DRY PATTERN TO COME TO AN END ON WEDNESDAY. APPROACHING H5 TROF WILL 
BEGIN TO AFFECT THE AREA BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. HAVE SMALL POPS ALL 
AREAS IN THE AFTERNOON. AS SYSTEM GETS CLOSER ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT... 
HAVE INCREASED POPS TO UNQUALIFIED. STRONG COLD FRONT ASSOCIATED 
WITH TROF WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA ON THURSDAY...WITH RAINFALL 
SLOWLY COMING TO END AFTER THE FRONTAL PASSAGE. MUCH COLDER AIR WILL 
FILTER INTO BEHIND THE FRONT ON THURSDAY NIGHT. READINGS WILL FALL 
TO NEAR OR BELOW FREEZING OVER MUCH OF THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA BY FRIDAY MORNING. THIS SHOULD BE THE FIRST WIDESPREAD 
FREEZE OVER THOSE AREAS OF THIS FALL SEASON. COOL TEMPERATURES AND 
DRY CONDITIONS WILL THEN CONTINUE UNDER HIGH PRESSURE INTO THE 
WEEKEND. 

AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL MOVE ACROSS ARKANSAS THIS WEEKEND. AN 
UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE DESERT SOUTHWEST ON FRIDAY 
WILL MOVE INTO THE ROCKIES BY SUNDAY AND WILL CONSEQUENTLY BE OUR 
NEXT WEATHER MAKER. AFTER MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES FOR THE THE FIRST PART 
OF THE WEEKEND...CLOUDS WILL INCREASE SUNDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE SLIDES 
EAST AND RETURN FLOW BRINGS MORE MOISTURE INTO THE AREA. THIS ALONG 
WITH AN APPROACHING SHORT WAVE WILL RESULT IN A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT. THE UPPER TROUGH WILL DEEPEN 
AS IT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA. ANOTHER SHORT WAVE APPROACHES ON 
MONDAY AND PRECIPITATION WILL CONTINUE INTO TUESDAY. TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THE EXTENDED.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

57





OF THE WEEKEND...CLOUDS WILL INCREASE SUNDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE SLIDES 
EAST AND RETURN FLOW BRINGS MORE MOISTURE INTO THE AREA. THIS ALONG 
WITH AN APPROACHING SHORT WAVE WILL RESULT IN A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT. THE UPPER TROUGH WILL DEEPEN 
AS IT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA. ANOTHER SHORT WAVE APPROACHES ON 
MONDAY AND PRECIPITATION WILL CONTINUE INTO TUESDAY. TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THE EXTENDED.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

57





696 
FXUS64 KLZK 092106
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
305 PM CST TUE NOV 9 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT
DRY PATTERN TO COME TO AN END ON WEDNESDAY. APPROACHING H5 TROF WILL 
BEGIN TO AFFECT THE AREA BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. HAVE SMALL POPS ALL 
AREAS IN THE AFTERNOON. AS SYSTEM GETS CLOSER ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT... 
HAVE INCREASED POPS TO UNQUALIFIED. STRONG COLD FRONT ASSOCIATED 
WITH TROF WILL MOVE THROUGH THE AREA ON THURSDAY...WITH RAINFALL 
SLOWLY COMING TO END AFTER THE FRONTAL PASSAGE. MUCH COLDER AIR WILL 
FILTER INTO BEHIND THE FRONT ON THURSDAY NIGHT. READINGS WILL FALL 
TO NEAR OR BELOW FREEZING OVER MUCH OF THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA BY FRIDAY MORNING. THIS SHOULD BE THE FIRST WIDESPREAD 
FREEZE OVER THOSE AREAS OF THIS FALL SEASON. COOL TEMPERATURES AND 
DRY CONDITIONS WILL THEN CONTINUE UNDER HIGH PRESSURE INTO THE 
WEEKEND. 
&&

.LONG TERM...SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY
AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL MOVE ACROSS ARKANSAS THIS WEEKEND. AN 
UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE DESERT SOUTHWEST ON FRIDAY 
WILL MOVE INTO THE ROCKIES BY SUNDAY AND WILL CONSEQUENTLY BE OUR 
NEXT WEATHER MAKER. AFTER MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES FOR THE THE FIRST PART 
OF THE WEEKEND...CLOUDS WILL INCREASE SUNDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE SLIDES 
EAST AND RETURN FLOW BRINGS MORE MOISTURE INTO THE AREA. THIS ALONG 
WITH AN APPROACHING SHORT WAVE WILL RESULT IN A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT. THE UPPER TROUGH WILL DEEPEN 
AS IT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA. ANOTHER SHORT WAVE APPROACHES ON 
MONDAY AND PRECIPITATION WILL CONTINUE INTO TUESDAY. TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THE EXTENDED.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    45  68  54  58 /   0  20  80  60 
HARRISON AR       43  68  48  51 /   0  20  80  60 
HOT SPRINGS AR    45  70  54  57 /   0  20  80  60 
PINE BLUFF AR     46  69  56  61 /   0  20  80  60 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  43  67  50  52 /   0  20  80  60 
MONTICELLO AR     47  70  58  64 /   0  20  80  60 
SEARCY AR         45  67  54  57 /   0  20  80  60 
MOUNT IDA AR      45  70  52  57 /   0  20  80  50 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   44  69  51  55 /   0  20  80  50 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

22/51






785 
FXUS64 KLZK 090858
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
252 AM CST TUE NOV  9 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT
HIGH PRESSURE OVER INDIANA WITH RIDGE INTO ARKANSAS WILL KEEP US IN 
A COOL AND DRY WEATHER PATTERN TODAY. THE DRY SPELL WILL CONTINUE 
THROUGH EARLY WEDNESDAY OVER MOST OF MY CW AREA...BUT WILL END WHEN 
A SIGNIFICANT COLD FRONT APPROACHES AND BRINGS A SLIGHT CHANCE OF
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO MY WESTERN AREA WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. 
WILL DO ONLY MINOR TWEAKING TO ONGOING FORECAST AS IT SEEMS TO BE 
PRETTY MUCH ON TRACK. BY EARLY WEDNESDAY NIGHT...THE GULF OF MEXICO 
WILL BE WIDE OPEN AS SURFACE HIGH CENTER MOVES EAST OFF THE NORTH 
CAROLINA COAST. SOUTHERLY WINDS AROUND THE PERIFERY OF THE HIGH WILL 
FETCH GULF MOISTURE FROM THE NORTHWESTERN GULF OF MEXICO ACROSS 
EASTERN TEXAS AND INTO PARTS OF OKLAHOMA AND WESTERN ARKANSAS. 
THUNDERSTORMS ARE LIKELY OVER MUCH OF ARKANSAS WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  
PERIODS OF SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE INTO THURSDAY AFTERNOON. SOME RAIN 
WILL LINGER INTO EARLY THURSDAY NIGHT. THE PREFERRED GFS MOS 
GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES APPEAR REASONABLE SO WILL STAY CLOSE TO THESE. 
SIGNIFICANTLY COLDER WEATHER WILL MOVE INTO THE NORTHERN SECTIONS OF 
THE NATURAL STATE THURSDAY NIGHT...AND SPREAD TO THE REST OF THE 
STATE BY FRIDAY NIGHT. A FREEZE WARNING MAY BE REQUIRED THURSDAY 
NIGHT. 
&&

.LONG TERM...SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY...
PATTERN CONTINUES TO BECOME INCREASINGLY PROGRESSIVE AT THE START OF 
THE MEDIUM RANGE WITH ANOTHER IN A SERIES OF DISTURBANCES MOVING 
ACROSS THE REGION ON DAYS SIX AND SEVEN. MODELS MORE INCONSISTENT 
THIS MORNING HANDLING THIS SYSTEM VERSUS DAYS PAST WITH STRENGTH OF 
THE APPROACHING WAVE SEEING THE LARGEST DISCREPANCIES. WITH NO REAL 
CONFIDENCE IN ANY OF THE MODELS...WILL GO WITH A BLEND OF SOLUTIONS 
THIS MORNING.

SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL STILL BE DOMINATING ON SATURDAY WITH 
MODERATE RIDGING OVER THE NATIONS MID SECTION ANCHORED BY LONG WAVE 
TROUGHS ON EITHER SIDE OF IT. FULL LATITUDE TROF OVER THE ROCKIES 
EARLY SUNDAY MOVES EASTWARD DURING THE DAY AND MOISTURE BEGINS TO 
RETURN TO THE AREA AS SURFACE HIGH SLIDES OFF TO THE EAST AND RETURN 
FLOW GETS REESTABLISHED. WITH APPROACHING TROF...WILL NEED TO BOOST 
POPS ON SUNDAY AS SYSTEM STARTING TO LOOK MORE DYNAMIC. POPS WILL 
ALSO NEED TO BE ADJUSTED UPWARDS ON DAY SEVEN AS MODELS NOW SHOWING 
INVERTED TROF OVER THE AREA WITH WEAK LOW PRESSURE SOMEWHERE OVER 
CENTRAL OR SOUTHERN LOUISIANA AND THE RATHER BEEFY LOOKING TROUGH ON 
OUR DOORSTEP.

TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE TO BE BELOW NORMAL THROUGH OUT THE PERIOD 
BUT LATEST GUIDANCE KEEPS TEMPERATURES JUST WARM ENOUGH TO PRECLUDE 
ANY MIXED PRECIP OVER THE NORTH. COLDEST DAY WILL BE SATURDAY IN 
SPITE OF ALMOST FULL SUNSHINE WITH TEMPERATURES SLOWLY CRAWLING 
UPWARDS FOR DAYS SIX AND SEVEN. MEX NUMBERS LOOK REASONABLE AND ARE 
GENERALLY ACCEPTED. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    66  44  69  57 /   0   0  10  70 
HARRISON AR       65  44  68  48 /   0   0  20  70 
HOT SPRINGS AR    69  44  69  56 /   0   0  20  70 
PINE BLUFF AR     67  45  69  59 /   0   0  10  70 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  65  45  66  52 /   0   0  20  70 
MONTICELLO AR     68  44  70  60 /   0   0  10  70 
SEARCY AR         66  43  66  57 /   0   0  10  70 
MOUNT IDA AR      70  42  70  54 /   0   0  20  70 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   67  41  69  53 /   0   0  20  70 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

38/56





469 
FXUS64 KLZK 090338
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
937 PM CST MON NOV  8 2004

.DISCUSSION...
WV SAT IMAGERY CURRENTLY INDICATES THIN CIRRUS OVER MUCH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. AS UPPER RIDGE HAS NOSED IN FROM THE WEST...REMAINING 
AC OVER EASTERN ARKANSAS HAS DISSIPATED. SURFACE HIGH CURRENTLY OVER 
THE MID MISSISSIPPI/OHIO VALLEY WILL SLOWLY MOVE EAST THROUGH 
TUESDAY. FLOW WILL COME BACK AROUND TO THE EAST...THEN SOUTH ON 
TUESDAY...WITH SLIGHTLY WARMER TEMPS EXPECTED. 

WITH SKY CONDITIONS MOSTLY CLEAR...AND THE GRADIENT RELAXING...LOWS 
SHOULD HAVE NO PROBLEM DIPPING DOWN INTO THE MID 30S IN THE VALLEYS 
OF NORTHERN AND WESTERN ARKANSAS...TO NEAR 40 DEGREES ELSEWHERE. 
ONLY APPRECIABLE CHANGE TO THE FORECAST WAS TO TREND CONDITIONS TO 
MOSTLY CLEAR TONIGHT...AND MOSTLY SUNNY IN THE EASTERN HALF ON 
TUESDAY. 

SHOULD SEE MORE CLOUDS ON TUESDAY...WITH RETURN FLOW SETTING UP. 
NEXT SYSTEM ON TRACK TO AFFECT THE AREA BY WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT....CLEARING OUT BY FRIDAY. LOOKS LIKE WIDESPREAD FREEZING 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE POSSIBLE IN NORTHERN ARKANSAS BY FRIDAY 
MORNING...AND OVER THE REMAINDER OF THE AREA BY SATURDAY MORNING. FREEZE 
WARNING WILL LIKELY HAVE TO BE ISSUED BY THE END OF THE WEEK. 

UPDATED TEXT AND TABULAR FORECASTS HAVE BEEN SENT. GRIDS AND 
GRAPHICS WILL BE OUT SHORTLY. 
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRES RMNS CENTERED OVR IL THIS AFTN WITH RDG AXIS EXTENDING SWD 
INTO AR...RESULTING IN A CONTD E-NELY WIND FLOW ACRS THE FA. MID 
AFTN TEMPS HAVE WARMED INTO THE 60S AND LOWER 70S AT MOST LOCATIONS. 
WITH DRY AIRMASS STILL IN PLACE...EXPECT A GOOD COOL DOWN AFTER 
SUNSET. MID AND HIGH LVL CLOUDS MAY TEMPER COOLING OVER SWRN PARTS 
OF THE FA THIS EVENING.

MODELS ARE AGAIN IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR THE SHORT TERM. LOOKING AT 
ONE MORE DAY OF DRY WX BEFORE RAIN CHCS RETURN TO THE AREA. SFC RDG 
WL RMN IN PLACE ACRS AR THRU TUE...KEEPING GULF MOISTURE FROM 
RETURNING NWD. MEANWHILE...UPPER LOW OVR THE SWRN STATES IS FCST TO 
TRACK EWD THE NEXT FEW DAYS. SYS WL BEGIN TO OPEN AS IT WORKS INTO 
THE PLAINS STATES WED AND WED NIGHT AND INTERACTS WITH UPPER TROF 
DROPPING SEWD INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION.

GULF MOISTURE WL BEGIN TO RETURN NWD STARTING WED IN ADVANCE OF THE 
UPPER SYS. ASSOCD CDFNT WL APCH NWRN AR WED NIGHT AND MOVE THRU THE 
FA ON THU. RAIN CHCS WL BE ON THE INCRS FROM THE W STARTING LATE WED 
INTO THU AS CDFNT ENCOUNTERS HIGHER MOISTURE LVLS OVR THE MID-SOUTH. 
HAVE USED A BLEND OF THE ETA AND GFS FOR TIMING THE FNT THRU THE 
REGION AND MOS TEMPS. BASED ON THIS...LIKELY WL SEE STEADY OR SLOWLY 
FALLING TEMPS OVR MOST AREAS ON THU. GUSTY NLY WINDS BEHIND FNT WILL 
ADD A DEFINITE CHILL TO THE AIR AS WELL.

NRN AR WL SEE THE FIRST GOOD CHC OF A HARD FREEZE FRI MRNG...WITH 
FREEZING TEMPS POSSIBLE AREAWIDE SAT MRNG. MODELS STILL INDC A GOOD 
BIT OF LOW CLOUDS BEHIND FROPA PERSISTING THRU MUCH OF FRI NIGHT... 
WITH SOME CLEARING POSSIBLE IN THE N LATE. THIS WILL LIKELY HAVE 
SOME IMPACT AS TO THE EXTENT OF FREEZING TEMPS. EXPECT LATER MODEL 
RUNS TO HAVE A BETTER HANDLE ON THESE DETAILS.

AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL MOVE ACROSS ARKANSAS THIS WEEKEND. AN 
UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE DESERT SOUTHWEST ON FRIDAY 
WILL MOVE INTO THE ROCKIES BY SUNDAY AND WILL CONSEQUENTLY BE OUR 
NEXT WEATHER MAKER. AFTER MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES FOR THE THE FIRST PART 
OF THE WEEKEND...CLOUDS WILL INCREASE SUNDAY AFTERNOON AS HIGH 
PRESSURE SLIDES EAST AND RETURN FLOW BRINGS MORE MOISTURE INTO THE 
AREA. THIS ALONG WITH AN APPROACHING SHORT WAVE WILL RESULT IN A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT. THE UPPER 
LOW WILL WEAKEN AS IT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA. ANOTHER SHORT WAVE 
APPROACHES ON MONDAY...BUT MOISTURE LOOKS LIMITED AT THIS TIME. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THE EXTENDED WITH THE 
COOLEST READINGS SATURDAY AND SUNDAY MORNINGS. 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

DROPPING SEWD INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION.

GULF MOISTURE WL BEGIN TO RETURN NWD STARTING WED IN ADVANCE OF THE 
UPPER SYS. ASSOCD CDFNT WL APCH NWRN AR WED NIGHT AND MOVE THRU THE 
FA ON THU. RAIN CHCS WL BE ON THE INCRS FROM THE W STARTING LATE WED 
INTO THU AS CDFNT ENCOUNTERS HIGHER MOISTURE LVLS OVR THE MID-SOUTH. 
HAVE USED A BLEND OF THE ETA AND GFS FOR TIMING THE FNT THRU THE 
REGION AND MOS TEMPS. BASED ON THIS...LIKELY WL SEE STEADY OR SLOWLY 
FALLING TEMPS OVR MOST AREAS ON THU. GUSTY NLY WINDS BEHIND FNT WILL 
ADD A DEFINITE CHILL TO THE AIR AS WELL.

NRN AR WL SEE THE FIRST GOOD CHC OF A HARD FREEZE FRI MRNG...WITH 
FREEZING TEMPS POSSIBLE AREAWIDE SAT MRNG. MODELS STILL INDC A GOOD 
BIT OF LOW CLOUDS BEHIND FROPA PERSISTING THRU MUCH OF FRI NIGHT... 
WITH SOME CLEARING POSSIBLE IN THE N LATE. THIS WILL LIKELY HAVE 
SOME IMPACT AS TO THE EXTENT OF FREEZING TEMPS. EXPECT LATER MODEL 
RUNS TO HAVE A BETTER HANDLE ON THESE DETAILS.
&&

.LONG TERM...FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY
AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE WILL MOVE ACROSS ARKANSAS THIS WEEKEND. AN 
UPPER LEVEL LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE DESERT SOUTHWEST ON FRIDAY 
WILL MOVE INTO THE ROCKIES BY SUNDAY AND WILL CONSEQUENTLY BE OUR 
NEXT WEATHER MAKER. AFTER MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES FOR THE THE FIRST PART 
OF THE WEEKEND...CLOUDS WILL INCREASE SUNDAY AFTERNOON AS HIGH 
PRESSURE SLIDES EAST AND RETURN FLOW BRINGS MORE MOISTURE INTO THE 
AREA. THIS ALONG WITH AN APPROACHING SHORT WAVE WILL RESULT IN A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT. THE UPPER 
LOW WILL WEAKEN AS IT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA. ANOTHER SHORT WAVE 
APPROACHES ON MONDAY...BUT MOISTURE LOOKS LIMITED AT THIS TIME. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THE EXTENDED WITH THE 
COOLEST READINGS SATURDAY AND SUNDAY MORNINGS. 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

44/51






FXUS64 KLZK 082032
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
230 PM CST MON NOV 8 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT
HIGH PRES RMNS CENTERED OVR IL THIS AFTN WITH RDG AXIS EXTENDING SWD 
INTO AR...RESULTING IN A CONTD E-NELY WIND FLOW ACRS THE FA. MID 
AFTN TEMPS HAVE WARMED INTO THE 60S AND LOWER 70S AT MOST LOCATIONS. 
WITH DRY AIRMASS STILL IN PLACE...EXPECT A GOOD COOL DOWN AFTER 
SUNSET. MID AND HIGH LVL CLOUDS MAY TEMPER COOLING OVER SWRN PARTS 
OF THE FA THIS EVENING.

MODELS ARE AGAIN IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR THE SHORT TERM. LOOKING AT 
ONE MORE DAY OF DRY WX BEFORE RAIN CHCS RETURN TO THE AREA. SFC RDG 
WL RMN IN PLACE ACRS AR THRU TUE...KEEPING GULF MOISTURE FROM 
RETURNING NWD. MEANWHILE...UPPER LOW OVR THE SWRN STATES IS FCST TO 
TRACK EWD THE NEXT FEW DAYS. SYS WL BEGIN TO OPEN AS IT WORKS INTO 
THE PLAINS STATES WED AND WED NIGHT AND INTERACTS WITH UPPER TROF 
DROPPING SEWD INTO THE GREAT LAKES REGION.

GULF MOISTURE WL BEGIN TO RETURN NWD STARTING WED IN ADVANCE OF THE 
UPPER SYS. ASSOCD CDFNT WL APCH NWRN AR WED NIGHT AND MOVE THRU THE 
FA ON THU. RAIN CHCS WL BE ON THE INCRS FROM THE W STARTING LATE WED 
INTO THU AS CDFNT ENCOUNTERS HIGHER MOISTURE LVLS OVR THE MID-SOUTH. 
HAVE USED A BLEND OF THE ETA AND GFS FOR TIMING THE FNT THRU THE 
REGION AND MOS TEMPS. BASED ON THIS...LIKELY WL SEE STEADY OR SLOWLY 
FALLING TEMPS OVR MOST AREAS ON THU. GUSTY NLY WINDS BEHIND FNT WILL 
ADD A DEFINITE CHILL TO THE AIR AS WELL.

NRN AR WL SEE THE FIRST GOOD CHC OF A HARD FREEZE FRI MRNG...WITH 
FREEZING TEMPS POSSIBLE AREAWIDE SAT MRNG. MODELS STILL INDC A GOOD 
BIT OF LOW CLOUDS BEHIND FROPA PERSISTING THRU MUCH OF FRI NIGHT... 
WITH SOME CLEARING POSSIBLE IN THE N LATE. THIS WILL LIKELY HAVE 
SOME IMPACT AS TO THE EXTENT OF FREEZING TEMPS. EXPECT LATER MODEL 
RUNS TO HAVE A BETTER HANDLE ON THESE DETAILS.

44





283 
FXUS64 KLZK 080856
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
252 AM CST MON NOV 8 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT
SINCE THE DRY SPELL WILL CONTINUE TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY BUT WILL 
END WHEN A SIGNIFICANT COLD FRONT APPROACHES AND BRINGS A CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS TO MY CW AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WILL DO ONLY MINOR TWEAKING 
TO ONGOING FORECAST AS IT SEEMS TO BE PRETTY MUCH ON TRACK. BY EARLY 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...THE GULF OF MEXICO WILL BE WIDE OPEN AS SURFACE 
HIGH CENTER MOVES EAST OFF THE NORTH CAROLINA COAST. SOUTHERLY WINDS 
AROUND THE PERIFERY OF THE HIGH WILL FETCH GULF MOISTURE FROM THE 
NORTHWESTERN GULF OF MEXICO ACROSS EASTERN TEXAS AND INTO PARTS OF 
OKLAHOMA AND WESTERN ARKANSAS. PERIODS OF THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
CONTINUE INTO THURSDAY NIGHT. THE PREFERRED GFS MOS GUIDANCE 
TEMPERATURES APPEAR REASONABLE...SO WILL STAY CLOSE TO THESE.
&&

.LONG TERM...FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...
MODELS IN SURPRISINGLY GOOD AGREEMENT AT START OF THE PERIOD BEFORE 
DIVERGING SOMEWHAT FOR DAYS SIX AND SEVEN. WHILE THE DETAILS MAY 
DIFFER A BIT...MODELS AGREE ON THE OVERALL TREND OF SIGNIFICANTLY 
COOLER WEATHER FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD. SINCE GFS CONTINUES TO BE 
THE MOST CONSISTENT MODEL...WILL FOLLOW ITS LEAD AND LEAN TOWARDS 
ITS SOLUTION.

COLD FRONT WELL OUT OF THE AREA BY THE START OF THE PERIOD WITH TAIL 
END OF THE TROF AXIS MOVING THROUGH LATE IN THE DAY FRIDAY. HIGH 
PRESSURE CONTINUES TO BUILD INTO THE REGION FRIDAY WITH A RATHER 
TIGHT GRADIENT THROUGH MOST OF THE DAY BEFORE IT RELAXES SOMEWHAT. 
BREEZY TO WINDY CONDITIONS EXPECTED AS HIGH SETTLES OVER THE REGION. 
HIGH IS OF CANADIAN ORIGIN AND COOL TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED IN 
SPITE OF CLEAR SKIES ON DAYS FIVE AND SIX. TEMPERATURES WILL AVERAGE 
AROUND 10 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. LOWS IN THE UPPER 20S TO MID 30S 
LIKELY STATEWIDE SATURDAY MORNING WITH WIDESPREAD 30S FOR SUNDAY 
MORNING. 

SURFACE HIGH SLIPS OFF TO THE EAST ON SUNDAY AND RETURN FLOW TRIES 
TO GET REESTABLISHED AS ANOTHER CUT OFF LOW APPROACHES FROM THE 
SOUTHWESTERN PART OF THE NATION. ONLY SLIGHT WARMING EXPECTED WITH 
EASTERLY SURFACE COMPONENT. LOW SCATTERED POPS APPEAR REASONABLE FOR 
DAY SEVEN OVER THE SOUTHWEST HALF OF THE STATE THIS FAR OUT. A QUICK 
LOOK BEYOND THE LONG TERM PERIOD SHOWS BORDERLINE TEMPERATURES FOR 
WINTERY PRECIPITATION ACROSS THE NORTH SUNDAY NIGHT AND EARLY MONDAY 
WITH WAVE MOVING ACROSS. MEX NUMBERS APPEAR REASONABLE. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    66  41  65  46 /   0   0   0  10 
HARRISON AR       62  37  63  44 /   0   0   0  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    67  42  66  45 /   0   0   0  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     67  41  66  45 /   0   0   0  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  62  37  63  45 /   0   0   0  10 
MONTICELLO AR     67  39  66  43 /   0   0   0  10 
SEARCY AR         65  39  64  44 /   0   0   0  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      66  40  66  45 /   0   0   0  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   65  38  65  43 /   0   0   0  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

38/56






319 
FXUS64 KLZK 080356
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
955 PM CST SUN NOV  7 2004

.DISCUSSION...
LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES WEAK COLD FRONT FROM SOUTHERN 
ARKANSAS...EXTENDING INTO NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI. DRIER AIR CONTINUES 
TO MOVE DOWN FROM THE MOUNTAINS. SURFACE OBS REVEAL 16 DEGREE 
DEWPOINT GRADIENT BETWEEN HARRISON AND LITTLE ROCK. THIS DRY AIR 
WILL CONTINUE MOVING SOUTHWARD TONIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE IN 
BEHIND THE SYSTEM...PUSHING THE FRONT OUT OF THE AREA. 

TEMPERATURES HAVE LEVELLED OFF DURING THE LAST COUPLE OF HOURS. SOME 
STATIONS HAVE ACTUALLY RISEN A DEGREE OR TWO. WILL AT THIS TIME 
MAINTAIN CURRENT FORECAST OF LOWER 40S NORTH TO NEAR 50 SOUTH. 
EXPECTED GRADIENT TONIGHT SHOULD KEEP TEMPERATURES IN CHECK...THOUGH 
VALLEYS OF NORTHERN ARKANSAS MAY SEE READINGS A COUPLE OF DEGREES 
LOWER. 

UPDATED GRIDS AND GRAPHICS HAVE BEEN SENT. NO UPDATES NECESSARY TO 
TEXT FORECASTS AT THIS TIME. 
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE AREA WILL PUT THE AREA UNDER THE 
INFLUENCE OF A SURFACE HIGH TO THE NORTH. THIS HIGH WILL SHIFT 
EAST BUT A RIDGE WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE AREA AT LEAST THROUGH
TUESDAY AND POSSIBLY WEDNESDAY. THIS WILL KEEP THE GULF OF MEXICO 
CLOSED OFF AND KEEP COOL AND DRY WEATHER FOR THE AREA. MADE LITTLE
CHANGE TO TEMP FORECASTS THROUGH TUESDAY AS TEMPS WERE CLOSE TO MOS. 
STILL SOME TIMING QUESTIONS CONCERNING THE UPPER TROF COMING OUT
OF THE SOUTHWEST INTO THE MIDDLE OF THE COUNTRY AROUND MIDWEEK. 
LOOKS NOW LIKE THE BEST MOISTURE AND PVA FROM THE TROF STAY TO 
THE WEST OF THE CWA THROUGH WEDNESDAY SO WILL KEEP RAIN OUT OF THE
FORECAST THROUGH THEN. INCREASED POPS TO 40 PERCENT FROM THE WEST 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS THE TROF AND COLD FRONT MOVE THROUGH THE AREA.
PRESENT INDICATIONS ARE MOISTURE INCREASE WILL NOT BE TREMENDOUS
SO DO NOT LOOK FOR HEAVY RAIN AT THIS TIME. ALSO INSTABILITY LOOKS
MARGINAL. WENT WITH SHOWERS/THUNDER FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT FOR NOW
BUT ANY THUNDER WOULD LIKELY BE ISOLATED OR EMBEDDED.     

SHORT WAVE WILL CROSS THE STATE FROM WEST TO EAST ON THURSDAY AS IT 
GETS ABSORBED IN THE SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW THAT WILL DEVELOP IN ADVANCE 
OF THE LONG WAVE TROF DIGGING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND THE 
NORTHEAST FOR THE WEEK END. THE CUT OFF LOW OUT WEST OPENS UP AND IT 
GETS SHOVED EAST BY THE NEXT TROF DIGGING OVER THE WEST COAST 
SATURDAY. A SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL BE DROPPING SOUTHEAST ACROSS 
ARKANSAS AS A WEAK LOW DIVES OVER THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE STATE 
EARLY ON THURSDAY. SINCE THE SURFACE LOW WILL BE SOUTH OF ARKANSAS 
WHILE THE UPPER VORT WEAKENS...I DECIDED TO INCLUDE ONLY SHOWERS 
WITH THIS FRONTAL PASSAGE. DRY AIR WILL MOVE OVER ARKANSAS BRIEFLY 
ON SATURDAY...AND THEN MOISTURE WILL RETURN PROMPTLY FROM THE 
SOUTHWEST SUNDAY. 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

STILL SOME TIMING QUESTIONS CONCERNING THE UPPER TROF COMING OUT
OF THE SOUTHWEST INTO THE MIDDLE OF THE COUNTRY AROUND MIDWEEK. 
LOOKS NOW LIKE THE BEST MOISTURE AND PVA FROM THE TROF STAY TO 
THE WEST OF THE CWA THROUGH WEDNESDAY SO WILL KEEP RAIN OUT OF THE
FORECAST THROUGH THEN. INCREASED POPS TO 40 PERCENT FROM THE WEST 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS THE TROF AND COLD FRONT MOVE THROUGH THE AREA.
PRESENT INDICATIONS ARE MOISTURE INCREASE WILL NOT BE TREMENDOUS
SO DO NOT LOOK FOR HEAVY RAIN AT THIS TIME. ALSO INSTABILITY LOOKS
MARGINAL. WENT WITH SHOWERS/THUNDER FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT FOR NOW
BUT ANY THUNDER WOULD LIKELY BE ISOLATED OR EMBEDDED.     
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY
SHORT WAVE WILL CROSS THE STATE FROM WEST TO EAST ON THURSDAY AS IT 
GETS ABSORBED IN THE SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW THAT WILL DEVELOP IN ADVANCE 
OF THE LONG WAVE TROF DIGGING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND THE 
NORTHEAST FOR THE WEEK END. THE CUT OFF LOW OUT WEST OPENS UP AND IT 
GETS SHOVED EAST BY THE NEXT TROF DIGGING OVER THE WEST COAST 
SATURDAY. A SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL BE DROPPING SOUTHEAST ACROSS 
ARKANSAS AS A WEAK LOW DIVES OVER THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF THE STATE 
EARLY ON THURSDAY. SINCE THE SURFACE LOW WILL BE SOUTH OF ARKANSAS 
WHILE THE UPPER VORT WEAKENS...I DECIDED TO INCLUDE ONLY SHOWERS 
WITH THIS FRONTAL PASSAGE. DRY AIR WILL MOVE OVER ARKANSAS BRIEFLY 
ON SATURDAY...AND THEN MOISTURE WILL RETURN PROMPTLY FROM THE 
SOUTHWEST SUNDAY. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    46  64  41  64 /   0   0   0   0 
HARRISON AR       40  60  37  62 /   0   0   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    46  65  42  65 /   0   0   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     48  65  41  65 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  40  60  37  62 /   0   0   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     50  65  39  65 /   0   0   0   0 
SEARCY AR         45  63  39  63 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      45  64  40  65 /   0   0   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   44  63  38  64 /   0   0   0   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

29/32






194 
FXUS64 KLZK 071648
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1045 AM CST SUN NOV 7 2004

.DISCUSSION...
COLD FRONT IN NORTHERN PART OF THE CWA MOVING SOUTH A LITTLE SLOWER
THAN EXPECTED. THIS DRY PASSAGE DURING THE DAY WITH MOSTLY SUNNY
SKIES SHOULD ALLOW FOR A STRONG WARMUP...LIKELY MORE THAN THOUGHT
EARLIER IN CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN AREAS. RAISED MAXES TO NEAR OR A
LITTLE ABOVE 80 IN CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN SECTIONS FOR THIS AFTERNOON
AND EVEN WENT UPPER 70S IN THE NORTH AS A FEW PLACES THERE MAY 
EASILY WARM UP THAT MUCH BASED ON LATE MORNING TEMPS. EFFECTS OF 
FRONT SHOULD RESULT IN LOWERING DEW POINTS IN NORTHERN AREAS 
IMMEDIATELY AND INTO CENTRAL SECTIONS DURING THE AFTERNOON WHILE
THE SOUTH MAY KEEP HIGHER DEW POINTS MOST OF THE AFTERNOON. WITH
SOME TURBULENT MIXING GOING ON...WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED TO SEE
DEW POINTS REALLY DROP IN THE NORTH FOR AWHILE THIS AFTERNOON
SO LOWERED DEW POINTS IN THAT AREA INTO THE MID AND UPPER 30S 
WHICH MAY NOT BE LOW ENOUGH. RECOVERY WILL BE LIKELY TOWARD SUNSET.
TEMPS SHOULD DROP RAPIDLY TOWARD SUNSET AND EARLY TONIGHT AS COLD
ADVECTION SETS IN AND DEW POINTS IN NORTH AND CENTRAL MAY COME UP 
A LITTLE BEFORE STARTING TO FALL OFF AGAIN. KEPT FORECAST FOR
TONIGHT AND BEYOND AS IS FOR NOW. FIRST IMPRESSIONS INDICATE NO
SIGNIFICANT CHANGES WILL BE MADE ON THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE. 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

29








006 
FXUS64 KLZK 070842
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
238 AM CST SUN NOV  7 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT
THE DRY SPELL WILL CONTINUE TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY BUT WILL END 
WHEN A SIGNIFICANT COLD FRONT APPROACHES AND BRINGS A CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS TO MY CW AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT. BY EARLY WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT...THE GULF OF MEXICO WILL BE WIDE OPEN AS SURFACE HIGH CENTER 
MOVES EAST OVER THE CAROLINAS. SOUTHERLY WINDS AROUND THE PERIFERY 
OF THE HIGH WILL FETCH GULF MOISTURE FROM THE NORTHWESTERN GULF OF 
MEXICO ACROSS EASTERN TEXAS AND INTO PARTS OF OKLAHOMA AND WESTERN 
ARKANSAS. GFS MOS GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES APPEAR REASONABLE.  
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...
MEDIUM RANGE MODELS SEEM TO BE IN GENERALLY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE 
SYNOPTIC SCALE FEATURES. THERE ARE SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES AND TO A 
LESSER EXTENT...STRENGTH DIFFERENCES CONCERNING THE APPROACHING MID 
LEVEL LOW. WITH FEATURE HAVING MOVED VERY LITTLE IN THE PAST 24 
HOURS AND STILL SITTING OFF THE SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA COAST...WILL GO 
WITH A BLEND OF ECMWF/GFS MODELS AS THEY SEEM TO HAVE A BETTER 
HANDLE ON ITS CURRENT POSITION. WILL LEAN A TAD TOWARDS THE SLIGHTLY 
MORE CONSISTENT GFS SOLUTION.

PERSISTENT RIDGE IN THE NATIONS MID SECTION IS FINALLY BROKEN DOWN 
BY THE APPROACHING UPPER LOW. UPPER LOW WEAKENS CONSIDERABLY BY THE 
TIME IT GETS HERE THURSDAY MORNING AND IS JUST AN FAIRLY STRONG 
OPEN WAVE WHICH PASSES ACROSS SOUTHERN MISSOURI/NORTHERN ARKANSAS 
EARLY IN THE PERIOD. PARENT SURFACE LOW WELL TO THE NORTH OF THE 
AREA. MODELS HAVE COME BACK A LITTLE SLOWER WITH THE ASSOCIATED 
COLD FRONT AND ARE ALSO SHOWING MORE MOISTURE...LIFT AND CONVERGENCE 
THAN PREVIOUS RUNS. WILL NEED TO HOLD ONTO POPS A LITTLE LONGER ON 
THURSDAY THAN CURRENT FORECAST IS SHOWING BUT CAN STILL ONLY JUSTIFY 
SCATTERED POPS.

HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS ONTO THE REGION LATE THURSDAY WITH A RATHER 
TIGHT GRADIENT THROUGH MOST OF FRIDAY BEFORE IT RELAXES. BREEZY TO 
WINDY CONDITIONS EXPECTED AS HIGH SETTLES OVER THE REGION. NO 
PRECIPITATION EXPECTED ON DAYS SIX OR SEVEN BUT HIGH IS OFF CANADIAN 
ORIGIN AND COOL TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED. CLOUDS AND PRECIP WILL 
KEEP TEMPS DOWN ON THURSDAY AND IN SPITE OF CLEAR SKIES ON DAYS SIX 
AND SEVEN...TEMPERATURES WILL STILL AVERAGE AROUND 10 DEGREES BELOW 
NORMAL. LOWS IN THE 30S LIKELY FRIDAY MORNING OVER THE NORTHERN  
HALF OF THE STATE AND LOWS IN THE 30S EXPECTED STATEWIDE SATURDAY 
MORNING. MEX NUMBERS APPEAR REASONABLE. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    76  45  64  41 /   0   0   0   0 
HARRISON AR       71  38  60  37 /   0   0   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    76  45  65  42 /   0   0   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     76  47  65  41 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  70  38  60  37 /   0   0   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     77  47  65  39 /   0   0   0   0 
SEARCY AR         75  43  63  39 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      76  44  64  40 /   0   0   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   75  42  63  38 /   0   0   0   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

741 
FXUS64 KLZK 070440 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1035 PM CST SAT NOV 6 2004

.DISCUSSION...
MADE MINOR TWEAKS TO GOING FORECAST. OVERNIGHT...LOWERED READINGS A 
BIT IN THE USUAL COLD SPOTS ALONG THE ARKANSAS RIVER...IN THE 
NORTHERN VALLEYS...AND IN THE SOUTHEAST. ALSO...GIVEN THE WARMTH 
EXPERIENCED TODAY...UPPED AFTERNOON READINGS A BIT ON SUNDAY... 
ESPECIALLY IN THE SOUTHWEST HALF OF THE STATE. 

OTHERWISE...FRONT PUSHING THROUGH FROM THE NORTH ON SUNDAY WILL 
BRING SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPERATURES TO START THE NEW WEEK. YET 
ANOTHER FRONT WILL ARRIVE FROM THE PLAINS WEDNESDAY/THURSDAY. MORE 
MOISTURE WILL BE AVAILABLE WITH THE LATTER FRONT...WITH SHOWERS 
MENTIONED IN THE FORECAST. COULD BE SIGNIFICANT COOLDOWN TO END THE 
WEEK. (46)
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

46






030 
FXUS64 KLZK 062013
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
300 PM CST SAT NOV 6 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT
SOUTHWESTERLY GRADIENT ACROSS THE AREA BETWEEN A SURFACE HIGH IN 
THE WESTERN GULF OF MEXICO AND A SURFACE TROF SWINGING TOWARD THE
AREA FROM THE NORTHWEST. THIS SHOULD KEEP LIGHT SOUTHWEST WINDS
GOING TONIGHT WHICH SHOULD KEEP TEMPS UP A LITTLE WITH MOST MINS
IN THE UPPER 40S TO LOWER 50S. THE WEAK FRONT SWINGS THROUGH EARLY 
SUNDAY AND HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM THE NORTH. THIS WILL BRING 
COOLER AND DRIER AIR TO THE AREA. TIMING OF THIS FRONT WILL BE 
CRUCIAL TO TEMPS ON SUNDAY. IF THE NEW BLAST OF COOLER AIR DOES NOT
ARRIVE UNTIL LATER SUNDAY MORNING...TEMPS SHOULD BE ABLE TO WARM 
NICELY AS INDICATED BY MOS. THIS IS OFTEN THE CASE WITH A DRY FRONT
MOVING ACROSS ARKANSAS DURING THE MORNING HOURS DURING THE COOL
SEASON. THUS...WILL GO CLOSE TO MOS ON MAXES. THE DRIER AIR WILL
REALLY MAKE ITSELF PRESENT LATE SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT WITH DEW 
POINTS FALLING INTO THE 30S IN  MOST AREAS. THIS ALONG WITH COLD
ADVECTION SHOULD ALLOW MINS TO FALL INTO THE UPPER 30S AND 
LOWER 40S IN MOST OF THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT THEN MONDAY WILL NOT 
BE AS WARM WITH NORTHEAST WINDS AND A LOWER START TO TEMPS IN 
THE MORNING. THE SURFACE RIDGE HANGS IN THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. THE
UPPER TROF TO THE WEST BEGINS TO APPROACH THE AREA TUESDAY BUT
IT WILL BE AT LEAST WEDNESDAY BEFORE IT HAS AN EFFECT ON THE 
WEATHER IN THE AREA.  
&&

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY
THE H5 LOW OVER THE SOUTHWEST PART OF THE COUNTRY EVENTUALLY GETS 
EVICTED AND REPLACED BY ANOTHER LOW TUESDAY MORNING. THE LOW DOES 
WEAKEN AS IT TREKS EAST AND DISSIPATES AS STRONG SHORT WAVE IN THE 
NORTHERN STREAM CROSSES THE CANADIAN BORDER BY 00Z THURSDAY. THIS 
SHORT WAVE WILL PROVIDE THE IMPETUS TO A SURFACE FRONT THAT WILL 
DROP SOUTH ACROSS THE UPPER PLAINS BEGINNING WEDNESDAY MORNING AND 
IT WILL SLIDE SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND THE MS RIVER 
VALLEY DURING THE DAYLIGHT HOURS THURSDAY. THE DISPLACING LOW WILL 
PARK ITSELF JUST OF THE SOUTHWEST COAST OF THE COUNTRY BY THURSDAY 
MORNING AND IT WILL REMAIN THERE THROUGH SATURDAY. BACK AT THE 
SURFACE...PLENTY OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL ACCOMPANY THE 
PASSAGE OF THE COLD FRONT ON THURSDAY...THEN DRY AIR WILL BE IN 
PLACE OVER ARKANSAS BY 12Z FRIDAY WITH A RIDGE CENTERED OVER THE 
TEXAS PANHANDLE. DRY WEATHER WILL CONTINUE THROUGH SATURDAY...WITH A 
PROVISO THAT MOISTURE WILL BE POOLING OVER NORTHERN MEXICO AND MUCH 
OF TEXAS JUST BEYOND THIS FORECAST PERIOD. TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
TEMPERED BY CLOUDS AND RAIN WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...WITH A 
REINFORCING SHOT OF COOLER AIR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    49  75  45  64 /   0   0   0   0 
HARRISON AR       52  70  38  60 /   0   0   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    50  76  45  65 /   0   0   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     50  75  47  65 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  53  70  38  60 /   0   0   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     47  75  47  65 /   0   0   0   0 
SEARCY AR         47  73  43  63 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      48  75  44  64 /   0   0   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   46  73  42  63 /   0   0   0   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

LOWER 40S IN MOST OF THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT THEN MONDAY WILL NOT 
BE AS WARM WITH NORTHEAST WINDS AND A LOWER START TO TEMPS IN 
THE MORNING. THE SURFACE RIDGE HANGS IN THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. THE
UPPER TROF TO THE WEST BEGINS TO APPROACH THE AREA TUESDAY BUT
IT WILL BE AT LEAST WEDNESDAY BEFORE IT HAS AN EFFECT ON THE 
WEATHER IN THE AREA.  
&&

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY
THE H5 LOW OVER THE SOUTHWEST PART OF THE COUNTRY EVENTUALLY GETS 
EVICTED AND REPLACED BY ANOTHER LOW TUESDAY MORNING. THE LOW DOES 
WEAKEN AS IT TREKS EAST AND DISSIPATES AS STRONG SHORT WAVE IN THE 
NORTHERN STREAM CROSSES THE CANADIAN BORDER BY 00Z THURSDAY. THIS 
SHORT WAVE WILL PROVIDE THE IMPETUS TO A SURFACE FRONT THAT WILL 
DROP SOUTH ACROSS THE UPPER PLAINS BEGINNING WEDNESDAY MORNING AND 
IT WILL SLIDE SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND THE MS RIVER 
VALLEY DURING THE DAYLIGHT HOURS THURSDAY. THE DISPLACING LOW WILL 
PARK ITSELF JUST OF THE SOUTHWEST COAST OF THE COUNTRY BY THURSDAY 
MORNING AND IT WILL REMAIN THERE THROUGH SATURDAY. BACK AT THE 
SURFACE...PLENTY OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL ACCOMPANY THE 
PASSAGE OF THE COLD FRONT ON THURSDAY...THEN DRY AIR WILL BE IN 
PLACE OVER ARKANSAS BY 12Z FRIDAY WITH A RIDGE CENTERED OVER THE 
TEXAS PANHANDLE. DRY WEATHER WILL CONTINUE THROUGH SATURDAY...WITH A 
PROVISO THAT MOISTURE WILL BE POOLING OVER NORTHERN MEXICO AND MUCH 
OF TEXAS JUST BEYOND THIS FORECAST PERIOD. TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
TEMPERED BY CLOUDS AND RAIN WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...WITH A 
REINFORCING SHOT OF COOLER AIR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    49  75  45  64 /   0   0   0   0 
HARRISON AR       52  70  38  60 /   0   0   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    50  76  45  65 /   0   0   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     50  75  47  65 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  53  70  38  60 /   0   0   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     47  75  47  65 /   0   0   0   0 
SEARCY AR         47  73  43  63 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      48  75  44  64 /   0   0   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   46  73  42  63 /   0   0   0   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

OTHER AREAS SHOULD REACH THE MID 70S FOR MAXES.

FXUS64 KLZK 061620
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1020 AM CST SAT NOV 6 2004

.DISCUSSION...
SOUTHWEST GRADIENT HAS SET UP ACROSS THE AREA WITH SURFACE HIGH IN THE
WESTERN GULF OF MEXICO AND A SURFACE TROF IN THE PLAINS. THIS SHOULD
RESULT IN MODERATE SOUTHWEST WINDS AND WILL FAVOR A GOOD WARMUP. 
MAX FORECASTS LOOK ON TRACK. DID UPDATE TO CLEAR UP MORNING WORDING
AND ADJUST WIND FORECAST SLIGHTLY. ALSO LOWERED DEW POINTS FROM
SUNDAY AFTERNOON INTO TUESDAY MORNING AS NEW DRY AIR MASS SHOULD
MOVE IN BEHIND A WEAK DRY COLD FRONT SUNDAY. MAY LOWER THE DEW
POINTS SOME MORE FOR THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE.   

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

29 







150 
FXUS64 KLZK 060830
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
238 AM CST SAT NOV 6 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...
THE MAIN FORECAST CHALLENGE DURING THIS PERIOD WILL BE TEMPERATURES. 
EXTENSIVE RIDGING AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL BRING ABOUT LARGE 
SCALE SUBSIDENCE AND MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES OVER MY CWA TODAY THROUGH 
TUESDAY NIGHT. A DRY SPELL WILL PREVAIL. WILL NOT VENTURE FAR FROM 
THE PREFERRED GFS MOS TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE.
&&

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...
MEDIUM RANGE MODELS SEEM TO BE IN GENERALLY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE 
SYNOPTIC SCALE FEATURES. THERE ARE SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES AND TO A 
LESSER EXTENT...STRENGTH DIFFERENCES CONCERNING THE APPROACHING MID 
LEVEL LOW. WITH FEATURE STILL OFF THE CENTRAL CALIFORNIA COAST... 
WILL SIMPLY GO WITH A BLEND OF ECMWF/GFS MODELS AS THEY SEEM TO HAVE 
A BETTER HANDLE ON ITS CURRENT POSITION.

PERIOD STARTS OFF WITH AFOREMENTIONED MID LEVEL LOW HAVING WEAKENED 
TO JUST AN OPEN WAVE. SURFACE WAVE WILL BE LOCATED IN THE CENTRAL 
PLAINS WITH ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT MOVING ACROSS THE AREA WEDNESDAY. 
MOISTURE APPEARS TO BE LIMITED WITH THIS FEATURE AND ONLY CHANCE 
POPS JUSTIFIED AT THIS POINT. OF GREATER SIGNIFICANCE WILL BE COLD 
FRONT COMING IN WEDNESDAY NIGHT. WHILE ONLY CHANCE POPS ONCE AGAIN 
ARE JUSTIFIED...CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD DOWN FROM THE 
NORTH THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND FRIDAY. AIR MASS WILL BE QUITE CHILLY 
WITH HIGHS NOT EXPECTED TO CLIMB OUT OF THE FIFTIES BOTH THURSDAY 
AND FRIDAY WITH MAYBE THE EXCEPTION OF THE EXTREME SOUTH. 

MODELS ALSO SHOWING A TIGHT GRADIENT BETWEEN THE BUILDING HIGH AND 
DEPARTING FRONT ON THURSDAY. WILL KEEP WINDS ON THE FRISKY SIDE WITH 
GRADIENT RELAXING EARLY FRIDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL AVERAGE CLOSE TO 
SEASONABLE ON WEDNESDAY BUT AVERAGE AS MUCH AS TEN DEGREES BELOW 
NORMAL ON DAYS SIX AND SEVEN. TEMPERATURES WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR 
FROST LATE NEXT WEEK.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    74  50  74  47 /   0   0   0   0 
HARRISON AR       76  49  69  42 /   0   0   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    74  50  75  49 /   0   0   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     72  50  75  48 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  76  49  69  41 /   0   0   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     72  49  76  49 /   0   0   0   0 
SEARCY AR         74  49  73  46 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      75  50  75  49 /   0   0   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   75  50  74  46 /   0   0   0   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1045 PM CST FRI NOV 5 2004

.DISCUSSION...
GOING FORECAST LOOKS GOOD AS A WHOLE. LOWERED OVERNIGHT TEMPERATURES 
A BIT IN THE NORTH/NORTHEAST...AND ALSO IN THE ARKANSAS RIVER 
VALLEY. ALSO UPPED DEWPOINTS HEADING INTO SATURDAY AS REGION PICKS 
UP A SOUTHWEST WIND AS HIGH PRESSURE DROPS TO THE SOUTH. 

OTHERWISE...A DRY/WARMER WEEKEND AHEAD. WEAK COLD FRONT WILL PUSH 
THROUGH THE REGION FROM THE NORTH LATE SUNDAY/EARLY MONDAY WITH 
SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPERATURES BUT NO RAIN. STRONGER FRONT SLATED FOR 
WEDNESDAY FROM THE PLAINS...WITH NEXT SIGNIFICANT CHANCE OF 
PRECIPITATION. (46)
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.



223 
FXUS64 KLZK 052020
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
220 PM CST FRI NOV  5 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT
UPPER FLOW WILL CONTINUE FROM THE NORTHWEST DURING THIS PERIOD. A 
WEAK VORT CENTER WILL PUSH ACROSS THE STATE ON SUNDAY. UPPER LOW IN 
THE SOUTHWEST WILL FIND ITS TREK EAST DIFFICULT...SO THE RIDGE WILL 
HOLD OVER THE MID SOUTH. AT THE SURFACE...A DRY FRONT WILL PUSH 
THROUGH THE STATE ON SUNDAY AS SHOWN BY A WIND SHIFT FROM SW TO NW. 
COOL AIR WILL MOVE DOWN TO REINFORCE THE DRY AIR OVER THE STATE 
ALREADY. LOW TEMPERATURES TONIGHT WILL BENEFIT FROM A SOUTHWESTERLY 
COMPONENT. IN THIS INSTANCE...THE SURFACE RIDGE WILL BE CLOSER TO 
THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE STATE AND THAT IS WHERE LOWS WILL DROP 
LOWER THAN ACROSS NORTHERN ARKANSAS. CLOUD-FREE SKY WILL PERSIST 
THROUGH SUNDAY. NEXT SURFACE HIGH WILL INCREASE RH VALUES ENOUGH TO 
PRODUCE A FEW CU AROUND...BUT PLENTY OF SUNSHINE WILL COME THROUGH 
TO WARM HIGHS INTO THE 60S EVEN WITH THE REINFORCING SHOT OF COOL 
AIR.
&&

.LONG TERM...TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY
MAIN FORECAST CHALLENGE DURING THIS PERIOD IS THE POSITION/TIMING OF 
A CLOSED LOW OVER SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA AT THE START OF THE PERIOD. 
OVERALL MODEL CONSENSUS IS TO HAVE THIS FEATURE WEAKEN AS IT MOVES 
NORTHEAST BY MID WEEK. HAVE MADE SOME MINOR MODIFICATIONS TO 
PRECIPITATION FORECASTS TO REFLECT OVERALL CONFIDENCE. COOLER 
CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED AT THE END OF NEXT WEEK. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    44  74  50  74 /   0   0   0   0 
HARRISON AR       46  76  49  69 /   0   0   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    44  74  50  75 /   0   0   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     43  72  50  75 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  46  76  49  69 /   0   0   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     43  72  49  76 /   0   0   0   0 
SEARCY AR         43  74  49  73 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      44  75  50  75 /   0   0   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   44  75  50  74 /   0   0   0   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

32/55






775 
FXUS64 KLZK 051623
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1020 AM CST FRI NOV 5 2004

THE CURRENT FORECAST IS HOLDING ITS OWN. THE SKY IS CLEAR AND 
TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE 50S ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. NO 
UPDATE REQUIRED NOW. (32) THE PREVIOUS DISCUSSION FOLLOWS...

SHORT TERM...FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...
HAVING A HARD RIME COMING UP WITH MUCH TO TALK ABOUT THIS MORNING AS 
A PROLONGED PERIOD OF BENIGN WEATHER IS SHAPING UP. SHORT TERM 
MODELS ALL IN GOOD AGREEMENT AND WILL GO WITH A BLEND OF FORECAST 
SOLUTIONS THIS MORNING. BIGGEST FORECAST CONCERNS WILL BE WITH 
TEMPERATURE FORECAST.

COMPLEX STORM SYSTEM RESPONSIBLE FOR HEAVY RAINFALL TO START THE 
MONTH NOW OVER THE NEW ENGLAND STATES. NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT HAS 
BROUGHT A COOL AND DRY AIR MASS THAT HAS SETTLED OVER THE REGION.
TEMPERATURES CURRENTLY IN THE LOWER 40S ACROSS THE NORTH WITH DEW 
POINTS IN THE UPPER 30S. NOT LOOKING FOR ANY FROST FORMATION THIS 
MORNING AS NEAREST SUB FREEZING DEW POINTS ARE IN CENTRAL MISSOURI.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH WARMER 
TEMPERATURES EXPECTED TODAY AS SOUTHERLY WINDS RETURN. AIR MASS 
REMAINS VIRTUALLY MOISTURE FREE WITH FAIRLY LARGE DIURNAL RANGE. 
WARMING TREND EXPECTED THROUGH THE WEEKEND AS HIGH PRESSURE BOTH 
ALOFT AND ON THE SURFACE WILL CONTINUE. HIGH PRESSURE MOVING ACROSS 
THE NORTHERN PLAINS EARLY NEXT WEEK WILL TURN WINDS BACK TO A 
NORTHERLY DIRECTION FOR SLIGHTLY COOLER CONDITIONS. COOL AIR WILL 
TRY TO BE REINFORCED BY A WEAK BACK DOOR COLD FRONT FOR MONDAY. 
MODELS CONTINUE TO WEAKEN THIS FEATURE WITH TIME AND IT SHOULD HAVE 
NO IMPACT ON OUR SENSIBLE WEATHER. WILL GO WITH A BLEND OF MAV/FWC 
NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURE FORECAST. LOOKING HIGH AND DRY THROUGHOUT 
THE PERIOD.
&&

.LONG TERM...TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...
UPPER LOW MOVES JUST TO THE NORTHEAST OF THE AREA TUESDAY 
NIGHT...WITH A STRONGER TROUGH MOVING IN THURSDAY. CONTINUED THE 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS TUESDAY NIGHT...INCREASING TO CHANCE WEDNESDAY. 
STRONG COLD FRONT WILL MOVE IN THURSDAY. RAIN WILL EXIT THURSDAY 
AFTERNOON...AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE MOVES IN. TEMPS WILL SHOW A 
COOL DOWN...AND WILL NEED TO MONITOR FOR READINGS NEAR FREEZING IN 
THE NORTH BY THE END OF THE WEEK.
TEXT
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    64  43  71  47 /   0   0   0   0 
HARRISON AR       62  40  72  44 /   0   0   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    65  43  72  48 /   0   0   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     65  42  71  47 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  62  40  72  44 /   0   0   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     65  42  72  46 /   0   0   0   0 
SEARCY AR         63  42  71  47 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      65  43  72  48 /   0   0   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   64  43  72  47 /   0   0   0   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

LITTLE ROCK AR    64  43  71  47 /   0   0   0   0 
HARRISON AR       62  40  72  44 /   0   0   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    65  43  72  48 /   0   0   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     65  42  71  47 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  62  40  72  44 /   0   0   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     65  42  72  46 /   0   0   0   0 
SEARCY AR         63  42  71  47 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      65  43  72  48 /   0   0   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   64  43  72  47 /   0   0   0   0

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

56/58





220 
FXUS64 KLZK 050820
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
218 AM CST FRI NOV  5 2004

SHORT TERM...FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...
HAVING A HARD RIME COMING UP WITH MUCH TO TALK ABOUT THIS MORNING AS 
A PROLONGED PERIOD OF BENIGN WEATHER IS SHAPING UP. SHORT TERM 
MODELS ALL IN GOOD AGREEMENT AND WILL GO WITH A BLEND OF FORECAST 
SOLUTIONS THIS MORNING. BIGGEST FORECAST CONCERNS WILL BE WITH 
TEMPERATURE FORECAST.

COMPLEX STORM SYSTEM RESPONSIBLE FOR HEAVY RAINFALL TO START THE 
MONTH NOW OVER THE NEW ENGLAND STATES. NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT HAS 
BROUGHT A COOL AND DRY AIR MASS THAT HAS SETTLED OVER THE REGION.
TEMPERATURES CURRENTLY IN THE LOWER 40S ACROSS THE NORTH WITH DEW 
POINTS IN THE UPPER 30S. NOT LOOKING FOR ANY FROST FORMATION THIS 
MORNING AS NEAREST SUB FREEZING DEW POINTS ARE IN CENTRAL MISSOURI.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH WARMER 
TEMPERATURES EXPECTED TODAY AS SOUTHERLY WINDS RETURN. AIR MASS 
REMAINS VIRTUALLY MOISTURE FREE WITH FAIRLY LARGE DIURNAL RANGE. 
WARMING TREND EXPECTED THROUGH THE WEEKEND AS HIGH PRESSURE BOTH 
ALOFT AND ON THE SURFACE WILL CONTINUE. HIGH PRESSURE MOVING ACROSS 
THE NORTHERN PLAINS EARLY NEXT WEEK WILL TURN WINDS BACK TO A 
NORTHERLY DIRECTION FOR SLIGHTLY COOLER CONDITIONS. COOL AIR WILL 
TRY TO BE REINFORCED BY A WEAK BACK DOOR COLD FRONT FOR MONDAY. 
MODELS CONTINUE TO WEAKEN THIS FEATURE WITH TIME AND IT SHOULD HAVE 
NO IMPACT ON OUR SENSIBLE WEATHER. WILL GO WITH A BLEND OF MAV/FWC 
NUMBERS FOR TEMPERATURE FORECAST. LOOKING HIGH AND DRY THROUGHOUT 
THE PERIOD.
&&

.LONG TERM...TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...
UPPER LOW MOVES JUST TO THE NORTHEAST OF THE AREA TUESDAY 
NIGHT...WITH A STRONGER TROUGH MOVING IN THURSDAY. CONTINUED THE 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS TUESDAY NIGHT...INCREASING TO CHANCE WEDNESDAY. 
STRONG COLD FRONT WILL MOVE IN THURSDAY. RAIN WILL EXIT THURSDAY 
AFTERNOON...AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE MOVES IN. TEMPS WILL SHOW A 
COOL DOWN...AND WILL NEED TO MONITOR FOR READINGS NEAR FREEZING IN 
THE NORTH BY THE END OF THE WEEK.
TEXT
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    64  43  71  47 /   0   0   0   0 
HARRISON AR       62  40  72  44 /   0   0   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    65  43  72  48 /   0   0   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     65  42  71  47 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  62  40  72  44 /   0   0   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     65  42  72  46 /   0   0   0   0 
SEARCY AR         63  42  71  47 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      65  43  72  48 /   0   0   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   64  43  72  47 /   0   0   0   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

56/58





982 
FXUS64 KLZK 042001
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
200 PM CST THU NOV 4 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT
UPPER LOW IN OUR VICINITY MOVES OUT OF OUR AREA FINALLY. CLOUDS 
CONTINUE TO DECREASE AS THE SYSTEM GETS FARTHER AWAY. NORTHWEST FLOW 
WILL TAKE OVER FOR THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS OR SO AS THE H5 RIDGE 
BUILDS TO OUR WEST IN RESPONSE TO SLOW SYSTEM MOVING OUT OF THE 
CALIFORNIA AREA. SURFACE RIDGE WILL TAKE OVER WHILE THE RIDGE ALOFT 
GATHERS STRENGTH. DRY WEATHER IN THE SHORT TERM. MAINLY...I WILL 
NEED TO WORRY ABOUT TEMPERATURES. FIRST PERIOD LOWS WILL DROP INTO 
THE LOWER TO MID 30S ACROSS NORTHWEST ARKANSAS. I PONDERED THE 
POSSIBILITY OF FROST BUT HAVE DECIDED AGAINST A FROST ADVISORY. 
WINDS TODAY WERE ABLE TO GET FAIRLY STRONG...AND THEY WILL DROP OFF 
AFTER DARK. HOWEVER...DO NOT BELIEVE THAT WINDS WILL BECOME CALM... 
SO ENOUGH GRADIENT WILL REMAIN TO KEEP WINDS AT LEAST 5 MPH. LOWS 
FOR TOMORROW NIGHT WILL BENEFIT FROM A WESTERLY COMPONENT AS THE 
SURFACE RIDGE DROPS TO OUR SOUTHEAST...SO I WENT WARMER THAN THOUGHT 
EARLIER. DRY AIR WARMS RATHER NICELY UNDER A CLEAR SKY..SO WENT 
ABOVE MOS FOR HIGHS FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.
&&

.LONG TERM...MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY
DRY WEATHER WILL DOMINATE EARLY IN THE PERIOD WITH NORTHWEST FLOW 
ALOFT AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE RETREATING TO THE NORTHEAST. A SHORT 
WAVE MOVES TO THE NORTHEAST ACROSS THE PLAINS LATE TUESDAY INTO 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEAKENS. APPEARS MAIN PVA WITH THIS WILL STAY TO 
THE NORTHWEST OF THE CWA. MOISTURE INCREASES SOME SO WILL KEEP SMALL 
POPS IN FOR TUESDAY NIGHT BUT WILL DROP POPS FOR DAYTIME TUESDAY AS 
MOISTURE RETURN IS NOT TOO STRONG AS OF THAT TIME. STRONGER UPPER 
TROF WILL APPROACH FROM THE WEST AT MIDWEEK WITH A STRONGER COLD 
FRONT MOVING IN. CONTINUED CHANCE POPS FOR WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY. 
BASED ON LI PROGS...WENT WITH SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS WEDNESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT BUT LOOKS LIKE PRECIPITATION BEHIND THE FRONT WILL 
BECOME STRATIFORM. WENT WITH RAIN IN THE WEST LATE THURSDAY AND 
ACROSS THE CWA INTO THURSDAY NIGHT. RAIN SHOULD MOVE OUT THURSDAY 
NIGHT AS THE UPPER TROF AXIS MOVES INTO THE AREA AND THE COLD FRONT 
SWEEPS WELL EAST WITH A DRY SLOT MOVING IN. STRENGTH OF COLD FRONT 
AND TIME OF YEAR WOULD SUGGEST NEAR FREEZING TEMPS IN THE NORTH AND 
ARKANSAS RIVER VALLEY BY NEXT FRIDAY MORNING EVEN WITH SOME WIND 
KEEPING UP.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    39  65  43  72 /   0   0   0   0 
HARRISON AR       33  63  40  74 /   0   0   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    40  67  43  73 /   0   0   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     42  65  43  71 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  34  62  40  72 /   0   0   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     42  66  42  72 /   0   0   0   0 
SEARCY AR         38  64  43  71 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      36  66  43  73 /   0   0   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   36  64  43  72 /   0   0   0   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

32/29





626 
FXUS64 KLZK 041644
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1030 AM CST THU NOV 4 2004

UPDATE OUT ALREADY. TOOK OUT REFERENCES TO MORNING...REMOVED THE 
DRIZZLE AND INCREASED TO WINDS FOR ALL SECTIONS. GRADIENT WILL KEEP 
WINDS IN THE 10 TO 20 MPH THIS AFTERNOON...15 TO 25 MPH NORTHWEST.
PREVIOUS DISCUSSION FOLLOWS...(32)

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY
UPPER LOW THAT HAS DOMINATED OUR WX FOR THE LAST SEVERAL DAYS CONTS 
TO LIFT NEWD ACRS MO THIS MRNG. WEAK VORT MAX ROTATING ARND THE LOW 
HAS PRODUCED SOME LIGHT RAIN/DRIZZLE OVER PARTS OF THE FA SINCE 
MIDNIGHT. LOW CLOUDS ALSO CONT TO PERSIST WITH BREAK NOTED JUST W 
AND S OF AR. WL MENTION SOME LIGHT PRECIP INTO MID-MRNG FOR PARTS OF 
THE FA.

MODELS STILL IN GOOD AGREEMENT THIS MRNG WITH FCST TRENDS THRU THE 
SHORT TERM. UPPER SYS CONTS HEADING NEWD TODAY. EXPECT LOW CLOUDS TO 
GRADUALLY DECREASE FROM THE SW LATER TODAY...WITH NERN AR HOLDING ON 
TO THE CLOUDS MOST OF THE DAY.

SFC HIGH PRES DROPPING SWD INTO THE PLAINS MAKES ITS PRESENCE KNOWN 
AFTER TODAY WITH COOLER AND DRIER AIR WORKING INTO THE FA. EXPECT 
ONE OF THE COLDEST NIGHTS OF THE FALL SEASON TNGT OVR THE VALLEYS OF 
NWRN AR UNDER MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS. COULD SEE SOME 
PATCHY FROST FORM IN PARTS OF THE AR VALLEY LATER TNGT. WILL HOLD 
OFF ON ANY HEADLINES ATTM.

HIGH PRES WILL PREVAIL THRU SAT. WILL SEE SOME MODERATION IN TEMPS 
BY SAT AS HIGH CENTER SHIFTS FURTHER SWD AND SWLY FLOW STARTS TO 
RETURN. HAVE TRENDED TOWARD COOLER ETA MOS TEMPS FOR THE LATER PDS. 
&&

.LONG TERM...SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE THE AREA
SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY WITH DRY WEATHER. LOW TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE AT OR BELOW NORMAL WITH DEW POINTS IN THE 40S AND 50S. MAX 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE AT OR A LITTLE ABOVE NORMAL. AN UPPER LOW WILL 
EJECT OUT OF THE SOUTHWEST U.S. LATE MONDAY. THIS LOW WILL MOVE 
NORTHEAST INTO THE PLAINS AND BRING A COLD FRONT WITH IT. THE COLD 
FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE STATE LATE WEDNESDAY. DUE TO WARM AIR 
ADVECTION SETTING UP WILL BEGIN SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ON TUESDAY IN THE 
NORTHWEST AND PROGRESS THEM EASTWARD...INCREASING THEM TO CHANCE 
POPS WEDNESDAY MORNING.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

290 
FXUS64 KLZK 040348 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
945 PM CST WED NOV 3 2004

.DISCUSSION...
FORECAST PRETTY MUCH ON TRACK. UPDATED FORECAST TO KEEP CLOUDS IN 
THROUGH MORNING HOURS ON THURSDAY. ALSO ADDED PATCHY FOG 
OVERNIGHT...MAINLY NORTHERN/CENTRAL ARKANSAS.

AFTER CLOUDS THIN OUT ON THURSDAY...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO 
REGION FROM THE PLAINS. LOOKS DRY/COOL INTO THE FIRST PART OF THE 
WEEKEND. LATE IN THE WEEKEND/EARLY NEXT WEEK...HIGH WILL SHIFT TO 
THE SOUTH...WITH WIND BECOMING MORE SOUTHWEST. THIS WILL BEGIN A 
SLOW WARMING TREND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK. (46)
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&


721 
FXUS64 KLZK 031907
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
115 PM CST WED NOV  3 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT
UPPER LOW TO OUR WEST WILL CONTINUE MOVING TOWARD THE NORTHEAST 
TONIGHT. IT WILL PUSH THE SURFACE LOW NORTH JUST EAST OF THE STATE. 
THIS WILL BRING DOWN COOLER AIR AND WRAP AROUND CLOUDS WHICH WILL 
BREAK DOWN GRADUALLY DURING THE DAY THURSDAY. THERE WILL BE SOME 
LIGHT PRECIPITATION SQUEEZED OUT OVERNIGHT...ENDING IN FOG AND 
DRIZZLE ACROSS THE NORTH THURSDAY MORNING. RIDGE WILL BUILD OVER THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...BRINGING WITH IT COOL AND MUCH 
DRIER AIR TO THE MID SOUTH. TEMPERATURES WILL SHIFT FROM ABOVE 
NORMAL TO BELOW NORMAL AND HUMIDITY LEVELS WILL DROP SIGNIFICANTLY.
&&

.LONG TERM...SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE THE AREA
SUNDAY INTO TUESDAY WITH DRY WEATHER AND MINS NEAR OR A LITTLE BELOW
NORMAL AND MAXES NEAR OR A LITTLE ABOVE NORMAL. UPPER LOW MOVES OUT
OF THE SOUTHWEST ABOUT MIDWEEK AND SLIDES TO THE NORTH OF THE AREA
WEDNESDAY. THIS WILL BRING A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE STATE WEDNESDAY. 
PUT IN 30 PERCENT POPS FOR WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT FOR NOW.
LOWERED MAXES FOR WEDNESDAY DUE TO ANTICIPATED CLOUDINESS THEN 
ESTIMATED MINS FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT IN MID 30S IN THE NORTH TOMID 
40S IN THE SOUTH.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    46  59  41  61 /  20  10   0   0 
HARRISON AR       40  54  34  58 /  30  10   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    45  61  41  62 /  20  10   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     47  60  43  62 /  10  10   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  40  53  35  57 /  30  10   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     48  61  44  63 /  10  10   0   0 
SEARCY AR         45  57  40  60 /  30  10   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      45  61  40  62 /  20  10   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   42  58  39  60 /  30  10   0   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

32/29


834 
FXUS64 KLZK 031729
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1125 AM CST WED NOV 3 2004

CLOUDS AND LIGHT PRECIPITATION WILL HOLD DOWN TEMPERATURES EVEN 
LOWER THAN EXPECTED EARLIER...SO UPDATE WILL BE OUT SHORTLY TO LOWER 
HIGHS FOR THIS AFTERNOON. PREVIOUS DISCUSSION FOLLOWS...

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY
MOISTURE CONTS TO STREAM ACRS AR THIS MRNG AHEAD OF SLOW MOVG UPPER 
LOW OVER CNTRL TX. END RESULT HAS BEEN AN INCRS IN PTCHY RAIN OVER 
THE FA SINCE LATE EVENING. MEANWHILE...SFC LOW CENTERED OVR SRN LA 
IS PRODUCING A CHILLY NELY FLOW ACRS AR.

MODELS STILL IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH OVERALL FCST TRENDS IN THE SHORT 
TERM. SFC LOW OVER LA WILL CONT TO LIFT TO THE N TODAY AND TNGT AS 
UPPER LOW BEGINS TO LIFT NEWD ACRS THE SRN PLAINS. EXPECT CLOUDS AND 
NELY WIND FLOW TO KEEP TEMPS FROM WARMING VERY MUCH TODAY. HAVE 
RAISED POPS ACRS THE BOARD TODAY AS SFC AND UPR FEATURES CLOSE IN ON 
THE AREA.

RAIN CHCS WILL GRADUALLY DECREASE FROM THE SW LATE TODAY AND TNGT AS 
THE SFC/UPR LOW SHIFT SLOLY N OF AR. CLOUDS WILL PERSIST OVER THE 
STATE INTO THU WITH CYCLONIC FLOW STILL IN FULL SWING. HAVE HUNG ON 
TO SMALL POPS OVR NRN AR TNGT AND INTO THU MRNG...CLOSER TO 
DEPARTING UPPER SYS.

DRIER AIR FINALLY TAKES OVR LATE THU THRU FRI AS SFC HIGH PRES 
BUILDS INTO THE SRN PLAINS AND DRY NWLY SFC FLOW TAKES OVER. FA WILL 
STILL BE UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF CAA INTO FRI...SO TEMPS ARE EXPECTED 
TO RMN JUST BLO SEASONAL NORMS.
&&

.LONG TERM...FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE IN CONTROL OF THE AREA THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD. MUCH DRIER AIR WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA WITH THE HELP OF A 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. THE NORTHWEST FLOW WILL KEEP COOL READINGS IN 
THE FORECAST THROUGH SATURDAY...THEN A GRADUAL WARMING TREND WILL 
BEGIN ON SUNDAY. SOUTHWEST FLOW WILL RETURN ON TUESDAY AS THE UPPER 
RIDGE MOVES EAST AND ANOTHER A COLD FRONT APPROACHES FROM THE WEST. 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

44/51

251 
FXUS64 KLZK 030254
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
900 PM CST TUE NOV  2 2004

.DISCUSSION...
WATER VAPOR IMAGERY CONTINUES TO SHOW THE DEEP CUT OFF LOW OVER 
WESTERN TEXAS WITH STREAM OF PACIFIC MOISTURE STILL MOVING OVER THE 
STATE. DEEPEST MOISTURE CHANNEL HAS MOVED EAST BUT PLENTY OF LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE REMAINS. LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES THE COLD 
FRONT WEST OF THE STATE.

SCATTERED SHOWERS STILL CONTINUING OVER THE SOUTHEAST PART OF THE 
STATE AS A WEAK WAVE RIPPLES THROUGH WITH AREAS OF DRIZZLE AND FOG 
ELSEWHERE. LATEST MODELS CONTINUE TO BRING ANOTHER SURGE OF MOISTURE 
TO THE REGION OVERNIGHT AS UPPER SYSTEM CRAWLS TOWARDS THE NORTH 
EAST. WILL KEEP HIGH POPS IN PLACE OVERNIGHT BUT QPF AMOUNTS WILL 
BE LOW.

WILL ALSO MAINTAIN HIGH SCATTERED POPS EARLY WEDNESDAY BEFORE DRY 
SLOT COMES IN. UPPER LOW STILL HAS TO MOVE ACROSS THE NORTHERN PART 
OF THE STATE SO ALL DAYS POPS LOOK GOOD UP THERE.

CURRENT FORECAST IN GOOD SHAPE AND ONLY SUPERFICIAL CHANGES ARE 
NEEDED. WILL TWEAK THE GRIDS TO REFLECT CURRENT CONDITIONS BUT 
OVERALL PACKAGE LOOKS IN GOOD SHAPE.

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

667 
FXUS64 KLZK 022029
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
230 PM CST TUE NOV  2 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT
THE THREAT FOR FLASH FLOODING HAS DIMINISHED FOR OUR AREA AS THE 
COLD FRONT HAS CONTINUED PUSHING EAST. THANKS TO MEM JAN AND SHV FOR 
COORDINATING ON THE FLASH FLOOD WATCH. POPS WILL REMAIN IN THE 
FORECAST UNTIL THAT UPPER LOW TO OUR WEST DECIDES TO PULL OFF TO THE 
NORTHEAST BY 12Z THURSDAY. THE SLOW LIFT WILL CAUSE INCLUSION OF 
POPS FOR WED NIGHT...WITH ALL PRECIPITATION ENDING BEFORE SUNRISE 
THURSDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE VARIED TONIGHT BECAUSE OF THE COLD 
FRONT AND MOISTURE. THEN...AS THE COLDER AND DRIER AIR MOVES 
IN...TEMPS WILL TEND TO BE MORE UNIFORMLY COLD. LOWS SHOULD START 
BOUNCING BACK A BIT SATURDAY MORNING IN RESPONSE TO LIGHT WEST OR 
SOUTHWEST WINDS.
&&

.LONG TERM...SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY
HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTROL THROUGH THE EXTENDED...WITH DRY 
CONDITIONS. NORTHWEST FLOW WILL KEEP COOL READINGS IN THE FORECAST 
SATURDAY...THEN A GRADUAL WARMING TREND FOR THE BEGINNING OF NEXT 
WEEK AS THE UPPER RIDGE MOVES OVERHEAD.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    66  52  55  44 /  70  50  50  30 
HARRISON AR       53  42  47  40 /  50  50  60  30 
HOT SPRINGS AR    65  51  54  44 /  70  50  50  20 
PINE BLUFF AR     68  54  57  47 /  80  50  50  20 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  55  42  47  40 /  50  50  60  30 
MONTICELLO AR     69  57  58  48 /  90  50  50  20 
SEARCY AR         66  51  53  42 /  70  50  50  30 
MOUNT IDA AR      63  49  52  43 /  60  50  50  20 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   61  48  51  42 /  50  50  50  30 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

FXUS64 KLZK 021648
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1045 AM CST TUE NOV 2 2004

COLD AIR ADVECTION COUNTERACTING ANY WARMING THAT MIGHT HAVE MANAGED 
TO GET THROUGH THE CLOUDS OVER THE NORTHWEST HALF OF THE STATE 
BEHIND THE COLD FRONT. THE FRONT CONTINUES PROGRESSING SLOWLY TO THE 
SOUTHEAST. DEW POINT DROP-OFF LAGS A BIT BEHIND THE COLD FRONT WITH 
A SIGNIFICANT GRADIENT FARTHER NORTHWEST. THE SOUTHEAST SECTIONS 
REMAIN UNDER THE FLASH FLOOD THREAT SINCE THE GROUND IS SATURATED 
AND THE TOPOGRAPHY IS FLAT. NO UPDATE AT THIS TIME.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...FLASH FLOOD WATCH UNTIL 400 PM 
CST TUESDAY FOR ZONES ARZ034...ARZ046>047...ARZ056>057... 
ARZ063>065...ARZ067>069.

TO GET THROUGH THE CLOUDS OVER THE NORTHWEST HALF OF THE STATE 
BEHIND THE COLD FRONT. THE FRONT CONTINUES PROGRESSING SLOWLY TO THE 
SOUTHEAST. DEW POINT DROP-OFF LAGS A BIT BEHIND THE COLD FRONT WITH 
A SIGNIFICANT GRADIENT FARTHER NORTHWEST. THE SOUTHEAST SECTIONS 
REMAIN UNDER THE FLASH FLOOD THREAT SINCE THE GROUND IS SATURATED 
AND THE TOPOGRAPHY IS FLAT. NO UPDATE AT THIS TIME.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...FLASH FLOOD WATCH UNTIL 400 PM 
CST TUESDAY FOR ZONES ARZ034...ARZ046>047...ARZ056>057... 
ARZ063>065...ARZ067>069.
&&

$$

32





556 
FXUS64 KLZK 020951
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
350 AM CST TUE NOV 2 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY
FIRST OFF THIS MRNG...SFC FNT CURRENTLY BISECTING THE STATE THIS 
MRNG FM NE TO SW. BNDRY IS ON OUR DOORSTEP HERE AS INDCD BY VELOCITY 
DATA ON THE 88D. MEANWHILE...NEXT BATCH OF RAIN WORKING INTO SRN AR 
ATTM.

MODELS ARE GOOD AGREEMENT THIS MRNG WITH OVERALL SYNOPTIC TRENDS IN 
THE SHORT TERM. HOWEVER...MESOSCALE FEATURES WILL PLAY A SIG ROLE IN 
THE FCST IN THE VERY NEAR TERM. SEVERAL SFC LOWS ARE PROGGED TO 
TRACK NEWD ALONG THE SFC BNDRY TODAY AND TNGT. EXPECT FNT TO MEANDER 
OVER CNTRL AND ERN AR...PLAYING HAVOC WITH TEMPS AND POPS.

PLAN ON KEEPING HIGHEST POPS OVER MY SERN ZNS TODAY...WITH LESSER 
CHCS FURTHER N AND W. WILL EXTEND THE FF WATCH THRU TODAY FOR THE 
SERN PARTS OF THE FA WHERE FNTL BNDRY WL PROVIDE FOCUS FOR 
ADDITIONAL RAINFALL OVER AN ALREADY SATURATED GROUND. EXPECT TEMPS 
TO HOLD STEADY OVER AREAS W OF THE SFC BNDRY TODAY.

MODELS HAVE BEEN FAIRLY CONSISTENT WITH TIMING AND TRACK OF MAIN 
UPPER LOW CURRENTLY OVR WRN TX. SYS IS FCST TO LIFT NEWD TNGT AND 
WED INTO OK AND EVENTUALLY PASS N OF AR WED NIGHT AND THU. LOOKING 
AT ANOTHER SHOT OF RAINFALL TNGT AND WED WITH UPPER SYS IN CLOSE 
PROXIMITY TO THE STATE AND AND ASSOCD SFC LOW TRACKS UP THE MS RVR 
VALLEY. RAIN CHCS WILL GRADUALLY DECREASE FROM THE SW LATE IN THE 
DAY WED AS UPPER SYS LIFTS AWAY FROM THE REGION.

HAVE KEPT FCST DRY FOR WED NIGHT. LATER SHIFTS WL NEED TO MONITOR IF 
UPPER SYS DECIDES THE SLOW DOWN. EXPECT A GOOD BIT OF CLOUDS TO 
LINGER WED NIGHT INTO THU AS CYCLONIC FLOW PREVAILS OVER THE AREA. 
CLOUDS SHOULD THIN OUT THU AFTN AS HIGH PRES MOVES IN FROM THE 
PLAINS.
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY
DRY CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD. BY THURSDAY 
NIGHT THE LARGE AREA OF MOISTURE WILL BE NORTHEAST OF THE AREA. HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL BUILD OVER THE REGION FROM THE NORTHWEST. STRONG 
NORTHWEST FLOW WILL DEVELOP ALOFT. MUCH DRIER AIR MOVES INTO 
ARKANSAS FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. A WEAK COLD FRONT MOVES SOUTH FROM 
MISSOURI SUNDAY...BUT DUE TO LACK OF MOISTURE...NO PRECIPITATION IS 
EXPECTED. HIGH TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR NORMAL AND LOW TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL. 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...FLASH FLOOD WATCH UNTIL 400 PM 
CST TUESDAY FOR ZONES ARZ034...ARZ046>047...ARZ056>057... 
ARZ063>065...ARZ067>069.
&&

$$

44/51


745 
FXUS64 KLZK 020309
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
905 PM CST MON NOV  1 2004

.DISCUSSION...
OVERALL FORECAST LOOKS TO BE IN FINE SHAPE AND ONLY SUPERFICIAL 
CHANGES ARE NEEDED THIS EVENING. WATER VAPOR IMAGERY TELLS THE STORY 
THIS EVENING WITH DEEP TROF CLEARLY SEEN SPINNING OVER WESTERN TEXAS 
WITH A PLUME OF SUBTROPICAL MOISTURE FEEDING INTO THE STATE. SLIVER 
OF DRY AIR ALSO SEEN OVER CENTRAL OKLAHOMA BUT IT APPEARS TO BE 
DECREASING WITH TIME. 

LATEST MODELS KEEP DEEP MOISTURE AND HIGH QPF IN PLACE ALL NIGHT 
OVER THE EASTERN PART OF THE STATE. WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY OVER THE 
CENTRAL SECTION OF THE STATE CRAWLING TO THE EAST. STRONG LOW LEVEL 
INFLOW INTO THE SYSTEM EXPECTED TO PERSIST ALL NIGHT WITH FRONT 
PROVIDING ADEQUATE LIFT FOR CONTINUED TRAINING EFFECT. GFS MODEL 
ALSO SHOWING WEAK LOW PRESSURE FORMING ON THE FRONT OVERNIGHT WITH 
INVERTED SURFACE TROF. 00Z LZK SOUNDING GIVES A PWAT OF 1.80 AND 
PWATS REMAIN BETWEEN 1.5 AND 2.0 INCHES OVER THE EAST AND SOUTHEAST 
ALL NIGHT. 

LATEST IR PICTURES SHOWING LARGE AREA OF CONVECTION OVER LOUISIANA 
MOVING TO THE NNE. CONVECTION IN ASSOCIATION WITH SURFACE BOUNDARY 
LIFTING OUT OF THE GULF COAST. PROJECTED PATH OF CONVECTION WOULD 
CARRY IT OVER EASTERN ARKANSAS OVER THE NEXT FEW HOURS WITH 
ADDITIONAL HEAVY RAINFALL EXPECTED. CURRENT FLASH FLOOD WATCH 
COVERAGE LOOK IDEAL WITH MORE OF A SHOWERY TYPE PRECIP THROUGH THE 
NIGHT OVER CENTRAL AND WESTERN SECTIONS. 

WILL ONLY TWEAK THE GRIDS/ZONES THIS EVENING WHICH WILL HAVE VERY 
LITTLE EFFECT ON THE SENSIBLE WEATHER. ZONES WILL NOT BE RERUN AS 
EVERYTHING LOOKS GOOD.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...AR...FLOOD WATCH UNTIL 600 AM CST 
TUESDAY FOR ZONES ARZ016...ARZ024>025...ARZ032>034... 
ARZ043>047...ARZ055>057...ARZ062>069. 

&&


310 
FXUS64 KLZK 012130
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
330 PM CST MON NOV 1 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY
LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUES MOVING SLOWLY TO THE EAST ACROSS
EASTERN PARTS OF THE CWA AT ISSUE TIME. HEAVIEST RAIN HAS SHIFTED INTO
EASTERN AREAS WITH LIGHT RAIN IN THE WEST WHICH HAS BEEN DECREASING. 
LOOKS LIKE MOST ACTIVE WEATHER WILL SLOWLY MOVE TO THE EAST OF THE
AREA THIS EVENING WITH THE MAIN AXIS OF HEAVY RAIN LIKELY BEING IN
EASTERN AREAS AND ONLY AREAS OF RAIN OR SHOWERS IN THE WEST. THUS
WILL DROP THE FLASH FLOOD WATCH IN THE WEST AND CONTINUE IT THROUGH
TONIGHT IN CENTRAL AND EASTERN SECTIONS. ALL ACTIVITY MAY DECREASE
LATER TONIGHT BUT WITH MAIN FRONTAL ZONE STILL IN THE AREA...NEW 
DEVELOPMENT LATER TONIGHT REMAINS POSSIBLE. UPPER LOW WILL TRANSLATE
TO THE EAST TUESDAY. LOOKS LIKE CWA WILL BE MOSTLY INTO THE COOL 
SECTOR SO THE CHANCE OF SEVERE STORMS SHOULD BE EAST OF THE AREA. 
MORE RAIN WILL LIKELY MOVE BACK INTO THE CWA TUESDAY AND TUESDAY
NIGHT AS THE UPPER LOW MOVES CLOSER. WILL GO MOSTLY WITH RAIN AND
ISOLATED THUNDER. THERE IS SOME CHANCE OF MORE HEAVY RAIN LATER 
TUESDAY OR TUESDAY NIGHT BUT WILL LET LATER SHIFTS EVALUATE THIS
FOR FURTHER FLOOD WATCHES. MAIN UPPER LOW MOVES TO THE NORTHEAST
ACROSS NORTHWESTERN ARKANSAS WEDNESDAY...BRIEFLY TAKING ON A NEGATIVE
TILT. LOOKS LIKE MOISTURE WILL BE CLOSE TO THE UPPER LOW CENTER
WEDNESDAY WITH A DRY SLOT FARTHER TO THE SOUTHEAST. KEPT HIGHEST 
POPS IN THE NORTHWEST WEDNESDAY WITH LESSER POPS TO THE SOUTH.  
KEPT RAIN OUT OF THE FORECAST BEYOND WEDNESDAY. TEMP FORECASTS
WILL BE TRICKY. GUIDANCE SHOWS GOOD VARIABILITY AND THE COOLER 
MAV NUMBERS COULD BE REASONABLE. BASICALLY WENT WITH A COMPROMISE
BETWEEN MAV AND FWC ON TEMPS FROM TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT.      
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY
DRY CONDITIONS PREVAIL THROUGH THE EXTENDED. HIGH PRESSURE AT THE 
SURFACE WILL CONTINUE IN NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. A WEAK COLD FRONT 
MOVES SOUTH FROM MISSOURI SUNDAY...BUT DUE TO LACK OF MOISTURE...NO 
PRECIPITATION IS EXPECTED. TEMPS WILL BE 5 TO 10 DEGREES BELOW 
NORMAL. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    61  66  51  58 /  90  80  70  60 
HARRISON AR       51  53  42  50 /  80  80  80  80 
HOT SPRINGS AR    60  65  50  58 /  80  80  70  60 
PINE BLUFF AR     62  67  52  60 / 100  80  80  60 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  53  54  43  50 /  90  80  80  80 
MONTICELLO AR     64  68  53  62 / 100  80  80  50 
SEARCY AR         60  65  50  57 / 100  80  70  60 
MOUNT IDA AR      58  64  50  57 /  80  80  70  60 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   56  61  47  54 /  80  80  70  70 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...AR...FLOOD WATCH UNTIL 600 AM CST 
TUESDAY FOR ZONES ARZ016...ARZ024>025...ARZ032>034... 
ARZ043>047...ARZ055>057...ARZ062>0 69.. 
&&

29/58


379 
FXUS64 KLZK 010952
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
350 AM CST MON NOV 1 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
SOME SCTD SHOWERS NOTED OVER PARTS OF THE FA THIS MRNG...WITH BULK 
OF CONVECTION NOTED OVR ERN OK AND NWRN AR. INCRSG SLY FLOW HAS 
ALLOWED HIGHER DEWPOINTS TO ADVECT FURTHER NWD THIS MRNG.

CONDS STILL SHAPING UP FOR A SIG HEAVY RAINFALL EVENT ACRS THE AREA 
LATER TODAY AND TNGT. MODEL SOLUTIONS THIS MRNG HAVE TRENDED A BIT 
SLOWER WITH OVERALL EWD PROGRESSION OF STORM SYS CURRENTLY TO OUR W. 
WILL STICK WITH A BLEND OF THE GFS AND ETA FOR THIS FCST.

EXPECT AXIS OF HEAVIER RAIN TO WORK SLOLY EWD TODAY...AFFECTING MOST 
OF THE FA BY LATER THIS AFTN. ACTIVITY WILL CONT DURG THE OVERNIGHT 
HRS WITH CONTD THREAT OF FLOODING RAINS. HPC HAS A GOOD BIT OF THE 
AREA OUTLINED FOR HVY RAIN POTENTIAL THRU 12Z TUE. BASED ON ALL OF 
THIS...WILL EXTEND FF WATCH THRU TNGT FOR THE ENTIRE CWA. LOOKING AT 
QPF AMOUNTS ON THE ORDER OF 1 TO 3 INCHES...WITH LOCALLY HIGHER 
TOTALS.

CDFNT IS PROGGED TO ENTER WRN AR THIS EVENING. SEVERAL WAVES ALONG 
THE BNDRY ARE FCST TO TRACK NEWD INTO TUE...HELPING TO ENHANCE 
RAINFALL AMOUNTS. THE FNT WILL STALL JUST TO THE SE OF STATE LATE 
TUE. MEANWHILE...THE UPPER SYS TO FCST TO LIFT NEWD OUT OF TX TUE 
NIGHT AND WED. THIS WILL AID IN THE FORMATION OF ANOTHER SFC LOW 
ALONG THE FNT ACRS ERN AR. APPEARS THE CHCS OF STRONG STORMS WILL 
RMN JUST TO OUR E WHERE MORE UNSTABLE AIRMASS WILL BE. THE EVENTUAL 
TRACK WILL HAVE TO BE WATCHED CLOSELY.

UPPER LOW IS FCST TO TRACK TO THE W OF AR WED. WL NEED TO KEEP RAIN 
CHCS IN FOR MUCH OF WED. COULD SEE SOME DRIER AIR WORK INTO SWRN AR 
LATE IN THE DAY. MUCH COOLER AIR WILL WORK IN BEHIND THE SYS BY WED 
EVENING.
&&

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY
THE EXTENDED FORECAST WILL BE DRY. THE UPPER LOW WILL SLIDE EAST OF 
THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND TAKE PRECIPITATION CHANCES WITH IT. 
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA ON THURSDAY. HOWEVER...A 
QUICK MOVING COLD FRONT WILL CLIP THE NORTH PART OF THE STATE 
THURSDAY NIGHT. THIS IS ANTICIPATED TO MOVE THROUGH DRY SINCE IT 
WILL SEVERELY LACK MOISTURE. AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS THURSDAY NIGHT 
WILL BE THE MAIN RESULT OF THE PASSING FRONT. HIGH PRESSURE AND VERY 
DRY AIR RETURN FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. ANOTHER COLD FRONT ARRIVES 
ON SUNDAY FROM THE NORTH. WILL NOT INCLUDE POPS FOR SUNDAY AT THIS 
TIME AS MOISTURE IS AGAIN LIMITED. TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE PERIOD 
WILL BE NEAR TO SLIGHTLY BELOW NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...FLOOD WATCH FROM 400 AM CST 
MONDAY UNTIL 600 AM CST TUESDAY FOR ZONES ARZ003>007...ARZ012>016... 
ARZ021>025...ARZ030>034...ARZ037>047...ARZ052>057...ARZ062>069.

$$

081 
FXUS64 KLZK 010233
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
830 PM CST SUN OCT 31 2004

.DISCUSSION...
UPDATE ON THE WAY. WILL SEND OUT THE EVENING UPDATE A LITTLE EARLIER 
THAN NORMAL AS PRECIPITATION IS STARTING AHEAD OF SCHEDULE. OVERALL 
PATTERN PRETTY MUCH THE SAME WITH COPIOUS AMOUNTS OF MOISTURE IN 
PLACE...SLOW MOVING FRONTAL SYSTEM PROVIDING PLENTY OF LIFT AND VERY 
FAVORABLE JET DYNAMICS ALL COMING INTO PLAY TO PROVIDE HEAVY 
RAINFALL EVENT FOR THE CWA. LATEST UPPER AIR RUN HAS PWAT VALUES UP 
TO 1.5 INCHES..AN INCREASE OF A HALF INCH SINCE THIS MORNING...AND 
EXPECT THIS TO ONLY INCREASE AS THE NIGHT CONTINUES AS WATER VAPOR 
IMAGERY SHOWS A STRONG TROPICAL TAP.

PRECIP HAS INITIATED A LITTLE QUICKER THAN ZONES/GRIDS INDICATING 
AND PACKAGE WILL BE UPDATED FOR QUICKER TIMING. WILL ALSO BOOST POPS 
OVERNIGHT AS AREA RADARS ARE BEGINNING TO FILL IN. AREA OF RAIN OVER 
THE SOUTHEAST PERSISTING. POPS AND QPF WILL NEED TO BE UPDATED HERE
FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE NIGHT. OTHER CHANGES INVOLVE SOME MINOR 
TWEAKING OF THE CLOUD COVER AND TEMPERATURE GRIDS TO REFLECT CURRENT 
TRENDS.

FLASH FLOOD WATCH SET TO START AT MIDNIGHT AND THIS LOOKS REALLY 
GOOD AND WILL LEAVE IN PLACE. LATEST FLASH FLOOD GUIDANCE NOT 
TERRIBLY HIGH AND WITH AMOUNT OF RAIN EXPECTED...SOME PROBLEMS ARE 
LIKELY...ESPECIALLY IN AREAS WHERE THE GROUND IS ALREADY SATURATED.

ON AN INTERESTING SIDE NOTE...AFTER THE THIRD DRIEST SEPTEMBER ON 
RECORD...THE SECOND WETTEST OCTOBER IS WRAPPING UP. SO FAR 11.46 
INCHES OF RAIN HAS BEEN RECORDED WHICH IS 7.65 INCHES ABOVE NORMAL 
WITH ABOUT 3 HOURS TO GO.

UPDATE WILL BE OUT BY 9 PM.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...FLOOD WATCH FROM 1200 AM CST 
MONDAY UNTIL 600 PM CST MONDAY FOR ZONES ARZ003>007...ARZ012>016... 
ARZ021>025...ARZ030>034...ARZ037>047...ARZ052>057...ARZ062>069.


$$

56

56





181 
FXUS64 KLZK 312134
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
325 PM CST SUN OCT 31 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
RAIN ENDED THIS MORNING...WITH ONLY SCATTERED SHOWERS ACROSS THE 
STATE THIS AFTERNOON. CANNOT RULE OUT SOME THUNDER IN THE SOUTHEAST 
THIS EVENING...WITH AFTERNOON SUNSHINE WARMING TEMPERATURES IN THE 
80S THERE. OTHERWISE...RAIN CONFINED PRETTY MUCH TO THE NORTHWEST 
COUNTIES. NOT FOR LONG.

STORM SYSTEM IN THE PLAINS WILL DRAG A COLD FRONT INTO ARKANSAS LATE 
TONIGHT AND MONDAY. WIDESPREAD SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS WILL ADVANCE 
FROM WESTERN ARKANSAS THROUGH THE REST OF THE STATE...WITH HEAVY 
RAINFALL LIKELY. 

RAINFALL AMOUNTS LATE TONIGHT INTO MONDAY EVENING MAY REACH TWO TO 
THREE INCHES IN MANY AREAS...WITH LOCALLY UP TO 5 INCHES. HAVE NEAR 
RECORD RAINFALL ALREADY THIS MONTH...SO THE GROUND IS PRETTY WELL 
SATURATED. GIVEN THIS...HAVE ISSUED A FLOOD WATCH FOR MUCH OF 
ARKANSAS LATE TONIGHT/MONDAY.

HEAVY RAIN WILL LINGER IN EASTERN ARKANSAS MONDAY NIGHT BEFORE 
SHIFTING TO THE EAST WITH THE FRONT. WILL BE A LULL LATE MONDAY 
NIGHT...WITH COOLER AIR BUILDING INTO NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE STATE 
BEHIND THE FRONT.

UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT STILL BACK IN SOUTHERN PLAINS MONDAY 
NIGHT/TUESDAY. FRONT WILL STALL JUST TO THE SOUTH OF THE STATE... 
WITH WAVE OF LOW PRESSURE FORMING ALONG THE FRONT IN EASTERN TEXAS. 
LOW WILL TRACK TO THE NORTHEAST TUESDAY/TUESDAY NIGHT...WITH 
SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS BECOMING LIKELY IN SOUTHERN ARKANSAS. 
SCATTERED SHOWERS IN THE FORECAST FARTHER NORTH.

SOME OF THE STORMS TUESDAY/TUESDAY NIGHT COULD BE SEVERE... 
ESPECIALLY ALONG THE GULF COAST. SEVERE WEATHER COULD INCLUDE A PART 
OF SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS.

HEADING INTO WEDNESDAY...AFTER SOME LINGERING RAIN IN THE NORTH 
EARLY...AND A FEW SHOWERS IN THE SOUTHEAST...LOOKS DRY AND COOLER 
WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE REGION FROM 
THE WEST WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WITH THE SKY CLEARING AND TEMPERATURES 
FEELING MORE LIKE FALL. (46)                    
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY
EXTENDED PERIODS SHAPING UP TO BE PRETTY NICE. BUILDING UPPER RIDGE 
WILL PUSH H5 LOW OUT OF THE AREA. NORTHWESTERLY TO ZONAL FLOW WILL 
SET UP IN THE UPPER LEVELS...USHERING IN COOLER AND DRIER AIR. WHILE 
COOLDOWN WILL NOT BE DRASTIC...FOLKS WILL SURELY NOTICE CONDITIONS 
CLOSER TO NORMAL THAN WHAT HAS BEEN THE CASE THE LAST FEW WEEKS. 
LOWS WILL RANGE FROM THE MID 30S NORTH TO THE MID AND UPPER 40S 
SOUTH...WITH HIGHS IN THE MID AND UPPER 50S NORTH TO THE LOWER TO 
MID 60S SOUTH. 

WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL APPROACH FROM THE NORTHWEST BY LATE 
THURSDAY. FRONT WILL PRIMARILY BE THE SOURCE OF A REINFORCING SHOT 
OF COLD AIR. MOISTURE PROFILES ARE NOT IMPRESSIVE WITH THE 
SYSTEM...AND UPPER SUPPORT APPEARS TO BE NOWHERE NEAR THE MID SOUTH. 
THUS...DRY FORECAST WILL CONTINUE...WITH ONLY SLIGHT VARIATIONS IN 
TEMPERATURES NOTED. (57)
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    65  75  58  65 /  50 100  90  40 
HARRISON AR       58  67  47  55 /  80 100  50  20 
HOT SPRINGS AR    66  73  59  64 /  60 100  50  40 
PINE BLUFF AR     67  76  60  66 /  30  90  90  60 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  57  67  48  54 /  80 100  50  20 
MONTICELLO AR     68  79  61  68 /  30  90  90  60 
SEARCY AR         64  73  56  64 /  50 100  90  40 
MOUNT IDA AR      66  72  58  64 /  60 100  50  40 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   63  70  55  62 /  80 100  50  30 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...FLOOD WATCH FROM 1200 AM CST 
MONDAY UNTIL 600 PM CST MONDAY FOR ZONES ARZ003>007...ARZ012>016... 
ARZ021>025...ARZ030>034...ARZ037>047...ARZ052>057...ARZ062>069.

$$

46/57






242 
FXUS64 KLZK 311730 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1125 AM CST SUN OCT 31 2004

.DISCUSSION...
AS EXPECTED...WIDESPREAD RAIN LIFTING TO THE NORTH...WITH 
PRECIPITATION BECOMING MORE SHOWERY. APPEARS THAT SCATTERED SHOWERS 
IN THE OFFING THIS AFTERNOON. 

SATELLITE SHOWING CLEARING IN SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS LATE THIS MORNING. 
WITH SUNSHINE...TEMPERATURES WILL WARM INTO THE 80S/DEWPOINTS IN THE 
UPPER 60S AND LOWER 70S. WEAK SHORTWAVE HEADING THROUGH SOUTHERN 
COUNTIES THIS AFTERNOON...WITH POSSIBILITY OF SCATTERED 
THUNDERSTORMS FLARING UP. 

FARTHER NORTH...CLOUDS WILL PRETTY WELL HOLD...WITH READINGS IN THE 
60S/70S.

KIND OF IN A LULL NOW...WITH THE BIG EVENT COMING TONIGHT/MONDAY. 
STORM SYSTEM MOVING FROM THE ROCKIES INTO THE PLAINS WILL DRAG A 
COLD FRONT INTO THE REGION. LOTS OF MOISTURE WILL BE AVAILABLE...
WITH RAIN/THUNDERSTORMS BECOMING WIDESPREAD.

ALREADY HAVE A FLOOD WATCH IN PARTS OF NORTHERN/WESTERN ARKANSAS 
TONIGHT/EARLY MONDAY. LATEST DATA SHOWING RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF 2 TO 3 
INCHES AND LOCALLY MORE GENERALLY NORTH AND WEST OF MOUNT 
IDA...MORRILTON AND BATESVILLE. PARTS OF THIS AREA HAVE ALREADY 
RECEIVED A FOOT OF RAIN THIS MONTH...AND HIGH WATER PROBLEMS APPEAR 
LIKELY. 

RAIN AREA WILL EXPAND EASTWARD ON MONDAY...WITH 1 TO 2 INCH AMOUNTS 
COMMON ACROSS THE REST OF THE REGION AND LOCALLY MORE. RAIN WILL 
COME DOWN AT A PRETTY GOOD CLIP ON NEARLY SATURATED SOIL. GIVEN 
THIS...WILL LIKELY EXPAND THE FLOOD WATCH TO INCLUDE MUCH OF 
ARKANSAS ON MONDAY. (46)
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...FLOOD WATCH FROM 600 PM CST 
SUNDAY UNTIL NOON CST MONDAY FOR ZONES ARZ003>005...ARZ012>013... 
ARZ021>022...ARZ030...ARZ037>038...ARZ040>041.
&&
