

909 
FXUS64 KLZK 241911
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
209 PM CDT TUE AUG 24 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT
MINOR FEATURES IN THE WEAK FLOW ALOFT WILL BE CONTRIBUTING MORE 
INSTABILITY TO THE WARM AND HUMID AIR IN PLACE OVER THE STATE. THE 
MORE SIGNIFICANT SHORT WAVE WILL BE AFFECTING ARKANSAS BEYOND THE 
SHORT RANGE. AT THE SURFACE...LINEAR MCS MOVING THROUGH MO NOW WILL 
BE GETTING CLOSE TO OUR NORTHERN BORDER AND LAYING DOWN A BOUNDARY 
THAT MAY BE THE FOCUS OF SOME CONVECTION LATE TONIGHT OR TOMORROW. 
CONVECTION WILL HAVE A DIURNAL FLAVOR TO IT...BUT KEPT POPS LOW. MOS 
NUMBERS FROM MAV AND FWC WERE SIMILAR VARYING ONLY A DEGREE HERE AND 
THERE...BUT THEY WERE DIFFERENT IN THE POPS WITH THE NGM BEING THE 
DRIER OF THE TWO...SO USED MAV FOR POPS. LITTLE CHANGE IN THE 
PATTERN SINCE SOUTHERLY FETCH WILL KEEP HIGH HUMIDITIES AT THE 
SURFACE. THIS WILL PUSH HI VALUES IN THE 100 TO NEAR 105 RANGE...BUT 
NOT HIGH ENOUGH TO REQUIRE ANY HEAT ADVISORIES YET.
&&

.LONG TERM...SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY
COLD FRONT SHOULD MOVE ACROSS THE AREA OVER THE WEEKEND...LOOKING 
MORE LIKE ON SUNDAY. STILL QUESTION WHETHER UPPER FLOW WILL BUCKLE 
ENOUGH TO ALLOW THE FRONT TO MOVE ACROSS THE CWA. UPPER TROF STILL 
INDICATED TO PASS ACROSS THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT SO THIS SHOULD GIVE 
THE FRONT ENOUGH PUSH TO MOVE THROUGH. MADE SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS TO 
POPS TO REFLECT SLOWER FRONTAL PASSAGE. LOWERED TO 30 PERCENT 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT AND PUT IN SEVERAL HOURS OF 40 PERCENT 
POPS ON SUNDAY. LOWERED POPS FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND KEPT MONDAY 
THROUGH TUESDAY DRY FOR NOW THOUGH CONFIDENCE NOT THE GREATEST OVER 
THAT. MADE ONLY MINOR TWEAKS TO OTHER GRIDS THROUGH MONDAY BUT 
LOWERED MINS A LITTLE FOR MONDAY NIGHT AS HIGH PRESSURE TO THE NORTH 
SHOULD BE IN CONTROL OF THE AREA AND THAT IS ALSO PREDICATED ON 
FRONT MOVING THROUGH ENOUGH TO CLEAR SKIES OUT. WENT FOR MAXES 
TUESDAY IN MID 80S IN THE NORTH AND CLOSE TO 90 ELSEWHERE.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    72  92  73  93 /  20  30  20  20 
HARRISON AR       71  88  71  92 /  20  30  20  20 
HOT SPRINGS AR    73  92  73  93 /  20  30  20  20 
PINE BLUFF AR     73  92  73  93 /  20  30  20  20 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  71  88  71  91 /  20  30  20  20 
MONTICELLO AR     73  93  74  93 /  20  30  20  20 
SEARCY AR         72  90  72  92 /  20  30  20  20 
MOUNT IDA AR      73  92  73  93 /  20  30  20  20 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   72  91  72  93 /  20  30  20  20 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$


383 
FXUS64 KLZK 241539 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1030 AM CDT TUE AUG 24 2004

CURRENT PROBABILITIES OF RAIN LOOK GOOD...BUT THE SKY CONDITION WILL 
CONTINUE MOSTLY CLOUDY RATHER THAN DECREASING THIS AFTERNOON. MADE 
ADJUSTMENTS TO WINDS STATEWIDE AND TO TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE NORTH. 
WATER VAPOR LOOP SHOWS SOMEWHAT DRIER AIR MOVING IN FROM THE 
NORTHWEST BUT SOUNDING SHOWS PLENTY OF MOISTURE LEFT AT THE LOWER 
LEVELS TO BOIL INTO CLOUDS THIS AFTERNOON. 32

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION FOLLOWS...

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT
HAVE SEEN AREAS OF LOW CLOUDS DVLP OVER THE FA OVER THE PAST SEVERAL 
HOURS. A FEW RETURNS NOTED ON RADAR OVER SRN AR. MAIN CONVECTIVE 
ACTIVITY RMNS TO OUR N ACRS SRN MO WHERE SRN EDGE OF MCS CONTS 
WORKING SLOLY SEWD. EXPECT THIS ACTIVITY TO WEAKEN LATER THIS MRNG 
AS IT WORKS INTO NRN AR ARND 11-12Z.

W-SWLY FLOW ALOFT WILL CONT TO BRING A SERIES OF UPPER LVL IMPULSES 
ACRS AR THE NEXT FEW DAYS. TIMING AND STRENGTH RMNS AN ISSUE WITH 
THE VARIOUS MODEL SOLUTIONS AND THUS HAVE USED A BLEND. PLAN TO KEEP 
SCTD POPS IN THE FCST. AFTER TODAY/S ROUND OF PRECIP...EXPECT 
ANOTHER AREA OF CONVECTION TO FORM TO OUR NW LATER TNGT AND AFFECT 
THE FA ON WED. 

ACTUALLY WILL SEE A SLIGHT RISE IN UPPER HGTS BY FRI AHEAD OF UPPER 
TROF MOVG OUT OF THE NRN ROCKIES. THIS WILL ALLOW TEMPS TO RETURN TO 
OR SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL LEVELS FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR AHEAD OF NEXT 
CDFNT. 
&&

.LONG TERM...SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY
MODELS THIS MORNING HAVE COME BACK SLOWER WITH COLD FRONT FOR THIS 
WEEKEND. HAVE LOWERED POPS FOR SATURDAY...WITH FRONT MOVING THROUGH 
THE STATE SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. DRY WEATHER WILL PREVAIL FOR 
MONDAY.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
310 PM CDT MON AUG 23 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS HAVE INCREASED DURING THE AFTERNOON IN 
RESPONSE TO H5 SHORT WAVE AND AFTERNOON HEATING. ACTIVITY WILL 
DECREASE EARLY THIS EVENING AS HEATING SUBSIDES. PRETTY MUCH OF A 
CARBON COPY ON TUESDAY WITH BEST CHANCES OVER THE SOUTH. WEDNESDAY 
WILL SEE LESS OF A CHANCE AS SHORT WAVES BECOME WEAKER AND OVERALL 
MOISTURE LESSENS SOME. THURSDAY SHOULD SEE MAINLY JUST AFTERNOON 
SHOWERS AND STORMS. TEMPERATURES WILL WARM A LITTLE MORE AS THE WEEK 
PROGRESSES. 
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY
A BROAD SHORT WAVE TROUGH WILL BE MOVING ACROSS ARKANSAS IN WEAK 
FLOW ALOFT AND PROVIDING THE PUSH FOR A SLOW-MOVING COLD FRONT 
DURING THE WEEK END. THE VORTICITY CENTER ACCOMPANYING THAT SHORT 
WAVE WILL PROVIDE THE LIFT FOR PRECIPITATION AHEAD OF THE FRONT...IN 
ESSENCE BRINGING CHANCES OF RAIN THAT WILL FLUCTUATE DIURNALLY UNTIL 
THE FRONT CUTS OFF THE MOISTURE.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...



386 
FXUS64 KLZK 230820
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
320 AM CDT MON AUG 23 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT
OLD FNTL BNDRY HAS WASHED OUT OVER THE FA...WITH SFC DEWPOINTS 
RUNNING IN THE UPPER 60S AND LOWER 70S ATTM. AREA OF MID AND HIGH 
CLOUDS CONT TO TRANSLATE EWD ACRS AR EARLY THIS MRNG. HAVE SEEN SOME 
CONVECTION FIRE OVER SRN KS ASSOCD WITH INCREASING WAA PATTERN AND 
APCHG SHRTWV.

MODELS STILL CONSISTENT THIS MRNG WITH TAKING A SERIES OF UPPER 
SHRTWVS ACRS AR THE NEXT FEW DAYS. SOME TIMING AND STRENGTH ISSUES 
NOTED BETWEEN THE GFS AND ETA AND HAVE GONE WITH A BLEND OF THE TWO 
SOLUTIONS FOR THE SHORT TERM.

EXPECT ONGOING CONVECTION IN THE PLAINS TO WORK E-NEWD TODAY AS 
UPPER ENERGY SHIFTS EWD. MODELS STILL INDC THAT BULK OF RAINFALL 
WILL AFFECT OUR NEIGHBORS TO THE N. MEANWHILE...A WEAKER UPPER 
SYSTEM WILL PASS ACRS SRN AR LATER TODAY. HAVE GONE WITH SCTD POPS 
AREAWIDE TODAY. EXPECT PRECIP TO DIMINISH THIS EVENING AS UPPER 
SUPPORT SHIFTS FURTHER EWD.

HAVE KEPT SCTD CONVECTION IN THE FCST FOR THE REST OF THE PD WITH 
WARM AND HUMID AIRMASS IN PLACE AND SEVERAL MORE SHRTWVS MOVG 
THROUGH THE MID SOUTH. EXPECT MOST ACTIVITY TO BE DIURNAL IN NATURE.

TEMPS WILL SLOLY RETURN TO NORMAL LVLS THE NEXT FEW DAYS. CLOUDS AND 
RAINFALL WILL HINDER WARMING IN SOME LOCATIONS. GONE WITH 
PERSISTENCE ON LOWS AND BLENDED THE ETA/GFS MOS FOR MAX TEMPS. 
&&

.LONG TERM...FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY
TROUGH MOVES EAST INTO PLAINS STATES AS RIDGE HEADS EAST FRIDAY. 
DIURNAL PRECIP WILL PREVAIL FRIDAY...BEFORE FRONT MOVES INTO THE 
STATE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. MODELS HAVE SLOWED THIS FEATURE 
SOMEWHAT...SO CONTINUED CHANCE POPS INTO SUNDAY. OTHERWISE...NO 
MAJOR CHANGES MADE TO EXTENDED FORECAST.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

44/58







000 
FXUS64 KLZK 230820
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
320 AM CDT MON AUG 23 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT
OLD FNTL BNDRY HAS WASHED OUT OVER THE FA...WITH SFC DEWPOINTS 
RUNNING IN THE UPPER 60S AND LOWER 70S ATTM. AREA OF MID AND HIGH 
CLOUDS CONT TO TRANSLATE EWD ACRS AR EARLY THIS MRNG. HAVE SEEN SOME 
CONVECTION FIRE OVER SRN KS ASSOCD WITH INCREASING WAA PATTERN AND 
APCHG SHRTWV.

MODELS STILL CONSISTENT THIS MRNG WITH TAKING A SERIES OF UPPER 
SHRTWVS ACRS AR THE NEXT FEW DAYS. SOME TIMING AND STRENGTH ISSUES 
NOTED BETWEEN THE GFS AND ETA AND HAVE GONE WITH A BLEND OF THE TWO 
SOLUTIONS FOR THE SHORT TERM.

EXPECT ONGOING CONVECTION IN THE PLAINS TO WORK E-NEWD TODAY AS 
UPPER ENERGY SHIFTS EWD. MODELS STILL INDC THAT BULK OF RAINFALL 
WILL AFFECT OUR NEIGHBORS TO THE N. MEANWHILE...A WEAKER UPPER 
SYSTEM WILL PASS ACRS SRN AR LATER TODAY. HAVE GONE WITH SCTD POPS 
AREAWIDE TODAY. EXPECT PRECIP TO DIMINISH THIS EVENING AS UPPER 
SUPPORT SHIFTS FURTHER EWD.

HAVE KEPT SCTD CONVECTION IN THE FCST FOR THE REST OF THE PD WITH 
WARM AND HUMID AIRMASS IN PLACE AND SEVERAL MORE SHRTWVS MOVG 
THROUGH THE MID SOUTH. EXPECT MOST ACTIVITY TO BE DIURNAL IN NATURE.

TEMPS WILL SLOLY RETURN TO NORMAL LVLS THE NEXT FEW DAYS. CLOUDS AND 
RAINFALL WILL HINDER WARMING IN SOME LOCATIONS. GONE WITH 
PERSISTENCE ON LOWS AND BLENDED THE ETA/GFS MOS FOR MAX TEMPS. 
&&

.LONG TERM...FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY
TROUGH MOVES EAST INTO PLAINS STATES AS RIDGE HEADS EAST FRIDAY. 
DIURNAL PRECIP WILL PREVAIL FRIDAY...BEFORE FRONT MOVES INTO THE 
STATE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. MODELS HAVE SLOWED THIS FEATURE 
SOMEWHAT...SO CONTINUED CHANCE POPS INTO SUNDAY. OTHERWISE...NO 
MAJOR CHANGES MADE TO EXTENDED FORECAST.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

44/58







374 
FXUS64 KLZK 230237
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
934 PM CDT SUN AUG 22 2004

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS RIGHT ON TARGET AND AND ONLY SUPERFICIAL 
CHANGES NEEDED. WIDELY SCATTERED SHOWERS CONTINUE TO POP UP AND 
DISSIPATE OVER THE NORTH IN THE VICINITY OF A VERY WEAK WAVE PICKED 
UP THE BEST BY THE MESO-ETA. WAVE MOVES TO THE EAST OF THE AREA BY 
MORNING.

CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS PACES WEAK FRONT SOMEWHERE OVER THE SOUTH 
CENTRAL PART OF THE STATE. FRONT BECOMING HARDER TO FIND BUT MODELS 
CONTINUE TO MOVE WHATS LEFT OF IT TO THE NORTH. UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM 
STILL PROGGED TO COME IN FROM THE WEST BUT LATEST RUNS SEEM TO BE 
TAKING IT SLIGHTLY FURTHER NORTH. BEST CHANCES WILL REMAIN TO THE 
NORTH MONDAY. 

CURRENT POPS AND LOWS LOOK RIGHT ON TARGET AND WILL BE LEFT ALONE. 
ONLY CHANGES TO THE PACKAGE WILL BE TWEAKING OF GRIDS/ZONES TO 
REFLECT CURRENT TREND AND CONDITIONS.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
STATIONARY FRONT IN SOUTHERN ARKANSAS THIS AFTERNOON. RADAR SHOWS 
SHOWERS/A FEW THUNDERSTORMS POPPING UP ALONG/NORTH OF THE 
FRONT...MAINLY IN CENTRAL/SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE STATE.
PRECIPITATION WILL LINGER INTO THIS EVENING BEFORE TAPERING OFF.

TONIGHT/MONDAY...MODELS HAVE BEEN CONSISTENT IN SHOWING FRONT 
PUSHING TO THE NORTH AND INTERACTING WITH INCOMING SYSTEM ALOFT FROM 
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. RESULT WILL BE REDEVELOPMENT OF SCATTERED TO 
NUMEROUS SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS IN WEST TONIGHT...AND IN MAINLY 
NORTHERN/CENTRAL ARKANSAS ON MONDAY.

FRONT WILL DEPART TO THE NORTH BY MIDWEEK...WITH RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDING OVER SOUTH CENTRAL/SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES. 
TYPICAL SUMMER PATTERN WILL SET IN TEMPORARILY...WITH WARM/HUMID 
WEATHER AND ONLY ISOLATED THUNDER.

RIDGE WILL SLIDE A LITTLE EAST TO END THE WEEK. THIS WILL PUT REGION 
IN A SOUTHWEST WIND FLOW ALOFT...WITH MOISTURE INCREASING. A NEW 
COLD FRONT WILL ARRIVE FROM THE WEST BY NEXT WEEKEND...WITH 
SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS ONCE AGAIN. SLIGHTLY COOLER/DRIER AIR WILL 
FOLLOW THE FRONT BY SUNDAY OR SO. (46)

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

FXUS64 KLZK 221711 AAA

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1155 AM CDT SUN AUG 22 2004

.DISCUSSION...
FRONT REMAINS STATIONARY IN SOUTHERN ARKANSAS LATE THIS MORNING. 
RADAR SHOWS SHOWERS/A FEW THUNDERSTORMS SPREADING INTO SOUTHERN 
ARKANSAS FROM LOUISIANA ALONG FRONT. WENT AHEAD AND UPPED CHANCES 
FOR PRECIPITATION THIS AFTERNOON IN EXTREME SOUTH FROM CAMDEN TO 
DUMAS. FARTHER NORTH...ONLY ISOLATED/SCATTERED THUNDER EXPECTED TO 
POP UP.

TONIGHT/MONDAY...MODELS HAVE BEEN CONSISTENT IN SHOWING FRONT 
PUSHING TO THE NORTH AND INTERACTING WITH INCOMING SYSTEM ALOFT FROM 
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. RESULT WILL BE REDEVELOPMENT OF SCATTERED TO 
NUMEROUS SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS IN WEST TONIGHT...AND IN MAINLY 
NORTHERN/CENTRAL ARKANSAS ON MONDAY.

FRONT WILL DEPART TO THE NORTH BY MIDWEEK...WITH RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDING OVER SOUTH CENTRAL/SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES. 
TYPICAL SUMMER PATTERN WILL BE NOTED WITH WARM/HUMID WEATHER AND 
ONLY ISOLATED THUNDER.

RIDGE WILL SLIDE A LITTLE EAST TO END THE WEEK. SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT 
WILL PROVIDE MORE MOISTURE. A NEW COLD FRONT WILL ARRIVE FROM THE 
WEST...WITH SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS ONCE AGAIN BY NEXT WEEKEND. (46) 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.



352 
FXUS64 KLZK 220817
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
315 AM CDT SUN AUG 22 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT
SFC OBS OVER THE LAST FEW HOURS INDC THAT SFC BNDRY IS LOCATED OVER 
SRN AR...ROUGHLY ALONG A KDEQ TO KLLQ LINE. WDLY SCTD SHRA/TSRA HAS 
PERSISTED EARLY THIS MRNG OVER W-CNTRL AR ASSOCD WITH A WEAK UPPER 
LVL SYSTEM APCHG FROM THE PLAINS.

MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT THIS MRNG WITH LARGE SCALE FEATURES KEEPING 
A ZONAL FLOW OVER THE FA FOR MUCH OF THE SHORT TERM. HOWEVER...
DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED WITH THE SMALLER SCALE UPPER SHRTWVS THAT ARE 
PROGGED TO AFFECT THE AREA THE NEXT FEW DAYS. THIS MAKES RAIN CHCS 
THE PRIMARY FCST CONCERN FOR MOST OF THE PD.

WITH SFC FNT STILL EXPECTED TO LIFT SLOLY NWD OVER THE NEXT 24 
HOURS...HAVE CONTD WITH SCTD POPS FOR MUCH OF THE AREA. CLOUDS AND 
RAINFALL COVERAGE WITH AFFECT MAX TEMPS TODAY AND HAVE USED A BLEND 
OF VARIOUS MODEL MOS NUMBERS.

HAVE LEFT SCTD POPS IN THE FCST FOR MON AND TUE WITH SEVERAL MORE 
IMPULSES ALOFT PROGGED TO AFFECT THE FA. USED A BLEND OF ETA AND GFS 
MOS FOR TEMPS.

BY WED...UPPER FLOW BEGINS TO AMPLIFY WITH UPPER RIDGING OVER THE 
ERN STATES AND DVLP TROF IN THE W. THIS WILL ALLOW A SFC CDFNT TO 
SLOLY APCH FROM THE W...RESULTING IN ANOTHER CHC OF SHRA/TSRA. 
EXPECT WARMER TEMPS AHEAD OF FNT...BUT HAVE GONE MORE WITH COOLER 
ETA MOS NUMBERS DUE TO EFFECTS OF INCRSG CLOUDS.
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT WITH WEAK UPPER LEVEL DISTURBANCES WILL 
LEAD TO DIURNAL PRECIP THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE 
IN FROM THE WEST LATE NEXT WEEK...BRINGING SCATTERED POPS TO THE 
AREA. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN NEAR NORMAL THROUGH THE EXTENDED. 
ONLY MINOR CHANGES MADE TO THE GOING FORECAST.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$


820 
FXUS64 KLZK 220222
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
920 PM CDT SAT AUG 21 2004

.DISCUSSION...
LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES FRONTAL SYSTEM OVER THE FAR SOUTH... 
ROUGHLY ALONG A DUMAS TO EL DORADO LINE WHERE IT HAS ESSENTIALLY 
STALLED OUT. FRONT ALSO SEEMS TO BE LESS DEFINED THAN JUST A FEW 
HOURS AGO. SCATTERED SHOWERS CONTINUE OVER THE SOUTH IN THE VICINITY 
OF THE FRONT AND OVER THE WEST. LATEST WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWS A 
WEAK WAVE ALONG THE RED RIVER WHICH THE MODELS SLIDE EASTWARD 
OVERNIGHT. 

COMBINATION OF FRONT AND WAVE WILL REQUIRE SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW 
CHANCE POPS ACROSS THE SOUTH TONIGHT WHICH ARE ALREADY IN THE GOING 
FORECAST. BIGGEST CHANGE TO THE PACKAGE WILL BE TO INCREASE POPS 
SLIGHTLY ACROSS THE CENTRAL SECTIONS TO ACCOUNT FOR THE APPROACHING 
WAVE. TEMPERATURES WILL ALSO BE BE TWEAKED DOWNWARD A FEW DEGREES AS 
MANY AREAS ARE ALREADY APPROACHING FORECASTED LOWS IN SPITE OF THE 
AMOUNT OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND SMALL T/TD SPREADS. FOG FORMATION 
STILL EXPECTED OVERNIGHT.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
COLD FRONT HAS MOVED INTO SOUTHERN ARKANSAS...BUT PRETTY MUCH IN 
THE PROCESS OF STALLING. LEFT SMALL CHANCES FOR SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS
AROUND FRONT OVERNIGHT...WITH DRY WEATHER FARTHER NORTH. WITH LOTS 
OF CLOUDS TODAY/LIMITED WARMING...TEMP/DEWPT SPREAD NOT ALL THAT 
MUCH. COULD HAVE SOME FOG FORM OVERNIGHT...ESPECIALLY IN AREAS 
WHERE CLEARING OCCURS.

ON SUNDAY...FRONT IN SOUTHERN ARKANSAS WILL BEGIN HEADING TO THE 
NORTH. THIS IS IN RESPONSE TO RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE STARTING TO 
BUILD IN SOUTH CENTRAL/SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES. SCATTERED SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS IN THE FORECAST TO END THE WEEKEND...WITH SOME 
PRECIPITATION LINGERING INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK.

RIDGE IN PLACE TOWARD THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK...WITH TYPICAL DRY/WARM 
SUMMERTIME WEATHER.

LOOKING AHEAD...RIDGE WILL SHIFT A BIT TO THE EAST...ALLOWING A COLD 
FRONT TO APPROACH FROM THE WEST. MOISTURE LEVELS WILL INCREASE A 
BIT...WITH SMALL CHANCES FOR SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS RETURNING TO END 
THE WEEK. (46)    

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

56

BUILD IN SOUTH CENTRAL/SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES. SCATTERED SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS IN THE FORECAST TO END THE WEEKEND...WITH SOME 
PRECIPITATION LINGERING INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK.

RIDGE IN PLACE TOWARD THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK...WITH TYPICAL DRY/WARM 
SUMMERTIME WEATHER.

LOOKING AHEAD...RIDGE WILL SHIFT A BIT TO THE EAST...ALLOWING A COLD 
FRONT TO APPROACH FROM THE WEST. MOISTURE LEVELS WILL INCREASE A 
BIT...WITH SMALL CHANCES FOR SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS RETURNING TO END 
THE WEEK. (46)    

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

245 PM CDT SAT AUG 21 2004

.DISCUSSION...
COLD FRONT HAS MOVED INTO SOUTHERN ARKANSAS...BUT PRETTY MUCH IN 
THE PROCESS OF STALLING. LEFT SMALL CHANCES FOR SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS
AROUND FRONT OVERNIGHT...WITH DRY WEATHER FARTHER NORTH. WITH LOTS 
OF CLOUDS TODAY/LIMITED WARMING...TEMP/DEWPT SPREAD NOT ALL THAT 
MUCH. COULD HAVE SOME FOG FORM OVERNIGHT...ESPECIALLY IN AREAS 
WHERE CLEARING OCCURS.

ON SUNDAY...FRONT IN SOUTHERN ARKANSAS WILL BEGIN HEADING TO THE 
NORTH. THIS IS IN RESPONSE TO RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE STARTING TO 
BUILD IN SOUTH CENTRAL/SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES. SCATTERED SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS IN THE FORECAST TO END THE WEEKEND...WITH SOME 
PRECIPITATION LINGERING INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK.

RIDGE IN PLACE TOWARD THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK...WITH TYPICAL DRY/WARM 
SUMMERTIME WEATHER.

LOOKING AHEAD...RIDGE WILL SHIFT A BIT TO THE EAST...ALLOWING A COLD 
FRONT TO APPROACH FROM THE WEST. MOISTURE LEVELS WILL INCREASE A 
BIT...WITH SMALL CHANCES FOR SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS RETURNING TO END 
THE WEEK. (46)

FXUS64 KLZK 210841
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
340 AM CDT SAT AUG 21 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT
LATEST SFC OBS AND MSAS DATA INDCS THAT CDFNT BISECTS THE FA FROM SW 
TO NE ATTM. HAVE SEEN SOME SHRA/TSRA FORM IN THE LAST FEW HOURS OVER 
PARTS OF CNTRL AND ERN AR. MEANWHILE...COMPLEX OF STORMS OVER ERN TX 
WORKING SLOWLY EWD AND EXPECT MOST OF THIS ACTIVITY TO EFFECT 
LOCATIONS JUST S OF OUR FA THRU THE MRNG HOURS.

PRIMARY FCST CONCERN FOR THE SHORT TERM IS THE HOW MUCH FURTHER S 
WILL THE SFC FNT MOVE BEFORE STALLING OUT. MODELS HAVE TRIED TO TAKE 
FNT S OF AR FOR THE LAST FEW DAYS. HOWEVER...HAVING A HARD TIME 
GOING WITH THESE SOLUTIONS WITH ZONAL UPPER FLOW IN PLACE. HAVE 
NOTICED THAT THE EARLY PART OF THE 06Z M-ETA IS TAKING FNT INTO SRN 
AR LATER TODAY BEFORE STALLING OUT WHICH SEEMS MORE REASONABLE.

WILL CONT WITH HIGHEST POPS OVER SRN AR TODAY WITH EXPECTED 
PLACEMENT OF THE SFC FNT...WITH DRY FCST FOR THE NRN COUNTIES. WILL 
WAIT UNTIL JUST BEFORE PRESS TIME TO MAKE FINAL CALL ON POPS FOR 
TODAY.

PLAN TO GO WITH SLIGHT CHC POPS FOR SRN AR TNGT WITH FNTL BNDRY IN 
THAT AREA. LITTLE IN THE WAY OF UPPER SUPPORT INDCD BY THE MODELS TO 
JUSTIFY HIGHER RAIN CHCS ATTM.

FNT BEGINS TO LIFT SLOLY NWD ON SUN AS SFC HIGH SHIFTS EWD AND TROF 
TAKES SHAPE OVER THE WRN PLAINS. HAVE CONTD TRENDS OF GOING FCST AND 
INDCD SCTD POPS FOR SUN AND SUN NGT ALONG AND N OF BNDRY. GFS STILL 
SEEMS TO BE SUFFERING FROM FEEDBACK ISSUES SHOWING A STRONG SHORTWV 
MOVG EWD FROM OK AND ACRS NRN AR LATE SUN INTO EARLY MON.

MORE TYPICAL WX FOR LATE AUG RETURNS FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. TEMPS 
RETURN CLOSER TO SEASONAL NORMS ALONG WITH MAINLY AFTN AND EARLY 
EVENING SMALL RAIN CHCS.
&&

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY
SOUTHWEST FLOW BECOMES ESTABLISHED OVER THE MID SOUTH...WITH 
SHORTWAVES BRINGING A CHANCE OF RAIN WEDNESDAY. AT THIS TIME...LEFT 
THE REST OF THE FORECAST DRY DUE TO UNCERTAINTIES IN THE UPPER 
FLOW...BUT LOW CHANCE POPS MAY HAVE TO BE ADDED. TEMPERATURES WILL 
REMAIN NEAR NORMAL. OVERALL...VERY FEW CHANGES MADE TO THE EXTENDED 
FORECAST.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

600 
FXUS64 KLZK 210216
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
915 PM CDT FRI AUG 20 2004

.DISCUSSION...
LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES SURFACE BOUNDARY FROM SOUTHEAST 
MISSOURI TO NORTH OF BATESVILLE TO NEAR WALDRON. SHOWERS AND 
ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE TO FIRE UP NEAR AND ALONG THE 
FRONT. 

LATEST WATER VAPOR IMAGERY SHOWS SHORT WAVE IN CENTRAL OKLAHOMA. 
WAVE PICKED UP PRETTY WELL BY THE MODELS WHICH CARRY IT ACROSS THE 
STATE OVERNIGHT. WAVE AND FRONT SHOULD INTERACT TOGETHER TO PRODUCE 
MORE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH THE NIGHT WITH BEST CHANCES 
OVER CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN SECTIONS IN THE VICINITY OF THE SLOWLY 
SAGGING BOUNDARY. FORECAST FORECASTS COVERS THE SCENARIO WELL AND 
WILL BE LEFT IN PLACE. NO CHANGES TO THE CURRENT PACKAGE.

&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
COLD FRONT PUSHING INTO NORTHERN ARKANSAS EARLY THIS AFTERNOON. 
FRONT WILL EDGE INTO CENTRAL THEN SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE STATE
BEFORE STALLING. MEANWHILE...SYSTEM ALOFT IN OKLAHOMA WILL INTERACT 
WITH THE FRONT OVERNIGHT/SATURDAY MORNING. 

SCATTERED/NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP...MAINLY
ACROSS CENTRAL/SOUTHERN ARKANSAS. IN GENERAL...RAINFALL WILL NOT
BE AS HEAVY AS LAST NIGHT...BUT COULD HAVE POCKETS OF LOCALLY 
HEAVY RAIN. QUARTER TO HALF INCH AMOUNTS WILL BE COMMON...WITH 
SOME AREAS RECEIVING ONE TO TWO INCHES.

PRECIPITATION WILL TAPER OFF A BIT SATURDAY AFTERNOON AS SYSTEM 
DEPARTS TO THE EAST. WILL LIKELY BE SOME REDEVELOPMENT TOWARD 
THE ARKANSAS/LOUISIANA BORDER SATURDAY NIGHT/SUNDAY...AND THEN 
THE FRONT WILL BEGIN MOVING BACK TO THE NORTH.

RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL START BUILDING OVER THE CENTRAL UNITED 
STATES TO END THE WEEKEND/EARLY NEXT WEEK. AS FRONT HEADS 
NORTH...SCATTERED SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS ARE IN THE FORECAST 
THROUGH AT LEAST MONDAY.

AFTER FRONT EXITS TO THE NORTH...PRECIPITATION MORE ISOLATED TOWARD 
MIDWEEK...WITH DRY/WARM TYPICAL SUMMERTIME CONDITIONS TO END THE 
WEEK. (46)         

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

114 
FXUS64 KLZK 201511 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1005 AM CDT FRI AUG 20 2004

.DISCUSSION...
GOING FORECAST PRETTY MUCH ON TARGET...WITH COLD FRONT SLIDING INTO 
ARKANSAS FROM THE NORTH...AND PRETTY MUCH STALLING SOMEWHERE NEAR 
THE ARKANSAS/LOUISIANA BORDER DURING THE WEEKEND. THE RESULT WILL BE 
CONTINUED CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS...MAINLY OVER THE 
SOUTHERN HALF OF THE STATE.

WILL HAVE TO BE A BIT CAREFUL AS TO WHERE FRONT SETS UP...WITH HEAVY 
RAINFALL POSSIBLE NEAR THE FRONT. SHOULD THE FRONT DECIDE TO STALL 
FARTHER NORTH...PRECIPITATION WOULD BE MORE LIKELY TOWARD CENTRAL 
SECTIONS OF THE STATE WHERE RECORD RAINFALL OCCURRED OVERNIGHT. 
AMOUNTS OF 2 TO 5 INCHES OCCURRED FROM LITTLE ROCK TOWARD HOT 
SPRINGS.   

AS FAR AS FORECAST CHANGES...TWEAKED PRECIPITATION CHANCES A BIT 
THIS AFTERNOON...WITH HIGHEST CHANCES SOUTH OF LITTLE ROCK. RADAR 
SHOWING THAT SHOWERS HAVE TAPERED OFF IN THE NORTHERN 
COUNTIES...WITH SHOWERS/A FEW THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUING IN THE 
SOUTHERN COUNTIES. 

GIVEN THAT CLOUDS/PRECIPITATION MOST CONCENTRATED IN SOUTHERN 
ARKANSAS...LOWERED AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES THERE A FEW DEGREES.

LOOKING AHEAD...DATA SUGGESTS THAT STALLED FRONT WILL HEAD BACK TO 
THE NORTH EARLY NEXT WEEK. THIS IN RESPONSE TO A RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDING OVER THE CENTRAL UNITED STATES. WILL BE SCATTERED 
SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS TO BEGIN NEXT WEEK. ONCE FRONT DEPARTS TO THE 
NORTH...WILL HAVE MOSTLY DRY AND WARM WEATHER...WHICH IS TYPICAL FOR 
SUMMERTIME. (46)
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1005 AM CDT FRI AUG 20 2004

.DISCUSSION...
GOING FORECAST PRETTY MUCH ON TARGET...WITH COLD FRONT SLIDING INTO 
ARKANSAS FROM THE NORTH...AND PRETTY MUCH STALLING SOMEWHERE NEAR 
THE ARKANSAS/LOUISIANA BORDER DURING THE WEEKEND. THE RESULT WILL BE 
CONTINUED CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS...MAINLY OVER THE 
SOUTHERN HALF OF THE STATE.

WILL HAVE TO BE A BIT CAREFUL AS TO WHERE FRONT SETS UP...WITH HEAVY 
RAINFALL POSSIBLE NEAR THE FRONT. SHOULD THE FRONT DECIDE TO STALL 
FARTHER NORTH...PRECIPITATION WOULD BE MORE LIKELY TOWARD CENTRAL 
SECTIONS OF THE STATE WHERE RECORD RAINFALL OCCURRED OVERNIGHT. 
AMOUNTS OF 2 TO 5 INCHES OCCURRED FROM LITTLE ROCK TOWARD HOT 
SPRINGS.   

AS FAR AS FORECAST CHANGES...TWEAKED PRECIPITATION CHANCES A BIT 
THIS AFTERNOON...WITH HIGHEST CHANCES SOUTH OF LITTLE ROCK. RADAR 
SHOWING THAT SHOWERS HAVE TAPERED OFF IN THE NORTHERN 
COUNTIES...WITH SHOWERS/A FEW THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUING IN THE 
SOUTHERN COUNTIES. 

GIVEN THAT CLOUDS/PRECIPITATION MOST CONCENTRATED IN SOUTHERN 
ARKANSAS...LOWERED AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES THERE A FEW DEGREES.

LOOKING AHEAD...DATA SUGGESTS THAT STALLED FRONT WILL HEAD BACK TO 
THE NORTH EARLY NEXT WEEK. THIS IN RESPONSE TO A RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDING OVER THE CENTRAL UNITED STATES. WILL BE SCATTERED 
SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS TO BEGIN NEXT WEEK. ONCE FRONT DEPARTS TO THE 
NORTH...WILL HAVE MOSTLY DRY AND WARM WEATHER...WHICH IS TYPICAL FOR 
SUMMERTIME. (46)
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

46







358 
FXUS64 KLZK 200821
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
320 AM CDT FRI AUG 20 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT
MAIN AREA OF CONVECTION EXTENDS FROM W TO E ACRS CNTRL AR EARLY THIS 
MRNG. MEANWHILE...SFC CDFNT IS LOCATED TO THE NW OF THE STATE... 
ROUGHLY ALONG THE I-44 CORRIDOR. SFC LOW ALONG THE FRONT OVER SWRN 
MO WILL CONT LIFTING NEWD THROUGH THE MRNG HRS.

MODELS STILL IN DECENT AGREEMENT THIS MRNG WITH OVERALL FCST TRENDS. 
MAIN FCST CONCERN IS HOW FAR WILL THE SFC BNDRY WORK INTO AR BEFORE 
STALLING OUT AND EFFECTS ON POPS. EXPECT CDFNT TO WORK SLOLY SWD 
INTO THE FA LATER TODAY AND BE LOCATED OVER CNTRL AR BY EARLY SAT 
MRNG. 

MODELS FCST ANOTHER WAVE TO WORK EWD ALONG THE FNT SAT...PROVIDING A 
FOCUS FOR ADDITIONAL SHRA/TSRA. WENT WITH THE ETA SOLUTION BY THIS 
TIME AS THE GFS QPF OUTPUT SEEMS WAY OVERDONE DUE TO FEEDBACK ISSUES.

STILL LOOKS LIKE THE FNT WILL STALL OUT OVER SRN AR/NRN LA AS UPPER 
FLOW IS MORE ZONAL BY THIS TIME. HAVE KEPT SOME SMALL POPS OVER SRN 
HALF OF THE FA SAT NIGHT AND SUN WITH BNDRY IN THE VCNTY. MODEL 
SOLUTIONS INDC THE FNT WILL BEGIN TO HEAD BACK NWD STARTING MON. 
GOING FCST HAS THIS TREND HANDLED WELL AND LEFT SMALL POPS IN FOR 
THE FA.
&&

.LONG TERM...TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY
FRONT MOVES BACK NORTH TUESDAY AS A WARM FRONT...WITH SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS DUE UNCERTAINTY AT THIS TIME. RAINFALL WILL END WEDNESDAY... 
WITH DRY AND WARM CONDITIONS FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. ALL IN 
ALL...FEW CHANGES TO GOING FORECAST.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

44/58





189 
FXUS64 KLZK 191955
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
250 PM CDT THU AUG 19 2004

.DISCUSSION...
HEAVY RAINFALL EVENT IN THE WORKS TONIGHT/FRIDAY AS COLD FRONT 
APPROACHES FROM NORTH AND INTERACTS WITH A SHORTWAVE IN THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS. IN RESPONSE TO SHORTWAVE...SURFACE LOW WILL DEVELOP ALONG 
FRONT...AND WILL TRACK THROUGH NORTHWEST ARKANSAS/SOUTHERN MISSOURI 
OVERNIGHT. 

HAVE GONE WITH CATEGORICAL POPS OVERNIGHT...WITH RAINFALL AMOUNTS 
OF HALF AN INCH TO AN INCH COMMON. HOWEVER...WOULD SURMISE THAT 
QUITE A FEW AREAS IN WESTERN HALF OF STATE WILL MEASURE 1 TO 2 
INCHES...WITH LOCALLY MORE. HAVE MENTIONED POSSIBILITY OF HEAVY     
RAIN IN THE FORECAST.

FRONT TO NORTHWEST WILL EDGE INTO THE STATE ON FRIDAY...AND WILL 
SLOWLY PUSH SOUTHWARD FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY. THE NORTHWEST FLOW 
OF THE PAST THAT RUSHED FRONTS THROUGH IS GONE...WITH CLOSER TO 
ZONAL FLOW THIS TIME. THIS NOT ONLY MEANS THAT COOLER/DRIER AIR WILL 
BE SLOWER TO ARRIVE...THERE WILL ALSO BE HEALTHY CHANCES FOR RAIN 
INTO THE FIRST PART OF THE WEEKEND. THIS WILL BE ESPECIALLY TRUE 
SOUTH OF LITTLE ROCK AS FRONT SLOWS DOWN/COMES TO A GRINDING HALT.

GIVEN THAT THE FRONT MAY STALL...HAVE KEPT AT LEAST SMALL CHANCES 
FOR RAIN IN SOUTHERN ARKANSAS THROUGH THE WEEKEND. HAVE ALSO KEPT IN 
MORE CLOUDS/UPPED DEWPOINTS A BIT BEHIND FRONT. 

HEADING INTO NEXT WEEK...FRONT LOOKS LIKE IT MAY HEAD BACK TO THE 
NORTH AS A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS OVER THE CENTRAL UNITED 
STATES. ISOLATED/SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED...WITH 
A RETURN TO TYPICAL SUMMERTIME WEATHER. (46)     
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    69  82  68  85 /  80  90  50  30 
HARRISON AR       67  77  63  82 /  90  50  30  20 
HOT SPRINGS AR    69  82  68  85 /  80  70  50  40 
PINE BLUFF AR     70  83  69  85 /  80  80  50  40 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  66  77  63  81 /  80  60  30  20 
MONTICELLO AR     70  84  71  86 /  70  80  50  50 
SEARCY AR         70  82  67  84 /  80  90  40  30 
MOUNT IDA AR      68  81  68  85 /  90  60  50  30 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   68  81  67  84 /  90  60  40  30 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

746 
FXUS64 KLZK 191835 AAB
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
130 PM CDT THU AUG 19 2004

.DISCUSSION...
ONE MORE UPDATE TO INCREASE CHANCES OF RAIN ACROSS CENTRAL/WESTERN 
ARKANSAS THIS AFTERNOON. PRECIPITATION WILL BECOME WIDESPREAD 
TONIGHT...WITH AREAS OF HEAVY RAIN LIKELY. WILL INDICATE AS SUCH IN 
THE FORECAST.

RAIN TRIGGERED BY APPROACHING FRONT/STRONG SHORTWAVE FROM NORTHWEST. 
LOW PRESSURE WILL DEVELOP ALONG FRONT...AND WILL DEEPEN OVERNIGHT AS 
IT SWINGS FROM SOUTHERN PLAINS INTO SOUTHERN MISSOURI.

RAIN WILL REMAIN LIKELY ON FRIDAY...MAINLY ACROSS SOUTHEAST HALF OF 
STATE. AM STILL NOT CONFIDENT THAT FRONT WILL TOTALLY EXIT REGION TO 
THE SOUTH OVER THE WEEKEND. WILL EVALUATE NEW DATA...AND MAY KEEP 
SOME PRECIPITATION IN THE SOUTH NEAR SLOWING/STALLED FRONT. (46)
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KLZK 191640 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1130 AM CDT THU AUG 19 2004

.DISCUSSION...
SCATTERED SHOWERS/A FEW THUNDERSTORMS BUILDING INTO WESTERN ARKANSAS 
FROM EASTERN OKLAHOMA THIS MORNING. UPDATED FORECAST TO PUT IN 
PRECIPITATION A LITTLE EARLIER THAN EXPECTED. 

OTHERWISE...FORECAST PRETTY MUCH ON TRACK. RAIN CHANCES WILL 
INCREASE TONIGHT/FRIDAY AS FRONT APPROACHES FROM THE NORTH/SHORTWAVE 
INTERACTS WITH FRONT. 

MAY TWEAK RAIN CHANCES UPWARD TONIGHT GIVEN AMOUNT OF LIFT/MOISTURE 
AVAILABLE. GFS ALSO CONTINUES TO SHOW EXPANSIVE AREA OF 
PRECIPITATION AROUND DEVELOPING SURFACE LOW IN SOUTHERN MISSOURI.

AM STILL NOT CONFIDENT THAT FRONT WILL TOTALLY EXIT REGION TO THE 
SOUTH OVER THE WEEKEND. WILL EVALUATE NEW DATA...AND MAY KEEP SOME 
PRECIPITATION IN THE SOUTH NEAR SLOWING/STALLED FRONT. (46)  
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

587 
FXUS64 KLZK 190919
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
400 AM CDT THU AUG 19 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT
SHORT WAVE WILL CONTINUE TO APPROACH THE STATE TODAY BUT ITS EFFECTS 
WILL BE FELT BEGINNING TONIGHT AND GOING ON THROUGH FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY. THE SURFACE FRONT WILL BE STILL TO OUR NORTHWEST AT 12Z 
FRIDAY AND IT WILL MOVE SLOWLY TO THE SOUTHEAST SO THAT IT WILL BE 
ABOUT TO EXIT THE SOUTHEAST CORNER SATURDAY MORNING. THERE WILL BE 
SMALL CHANCES OF RAIN LINGERING IN THE SOUTHEAST EARLY. TEMPERATURES 
TODAY WILL REACH THE UPPER 80S AND LOWER 90S BECAUSE SUNSHINE WILL 
BE ABUNDANT...THE HIGHS WILL BE COOLING SOMEWHAT FRIDAY AND SATURDAY 
DUE TO CLOUDS AND RAIN. 
&&

.LONG TERM...SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY
DRY WEATHER MOVES BACK IN FOR SUNDAY AFTER A WET LATE WEEK. 
HOWEVER...THIS WILL BE SHORT LIVED. LATEST GFS SHOWS NEXT SHORT WAVE 
TO BEGIN AFFECTING THE AREA ON MONDAY. OUR PREVIOUS FORECAST HAD DRY 
FOR MONDAY...BUT WILL INTRODUCE SMALL POPS FOR NOW. WILL THEN 
CONTINUE SMALL POPS IN FOR REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD. 
TEMPERATURES SHOW A SLOW WARMING TREND THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    92  71  85  66 /  20  40  60  50 
HARRISON AR       88  69  79  61 /  20  50  60  40 
HOT SPRINGS AR    92  71  85  66 /  20  40  60  50 
PINE BLUFF AR     93  72  87  67 /  20  30  60  50 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  88  68  79  61 /  20  50  60  40 
MONTICELLO AR     94  71  89  69 /  20  30  60  50 
SEARCY AR         92  71  84  65 /  20  40  60  50 
MOUNT IDA AR      92  70  85  66 /  30  40  60  50 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   91  70  83  65 /  20  50  60  50

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

445 
FXUS64 KLZK 181955
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
250 PM CDT WED AUG 18 2004

.DISCUSSION...
FLOW BECOMING A LITTLE MORE ZONAL AS RIDGE TO WEST CONTINUES
TO FLATTEN. EVEN SO...SLIGHT NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL BRING 
A COLD FRONT TOWARD THE REGION LATE THURSDAY NIGHT/FRIDAY.
STRONG SHORTWAVE ASSOCIATED WITH FRONT...WITH SURFACE LOW 
FORMING ALONG FRONT IN RESPONSE TO SHORTWAVE. DATA INDICATING
IMPRESSIVE LIFT ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE STATE 
THURSDAY NIGHT...WITH SCATTERED/NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP.

FRONT WILL DROP SOUTH ON FRIDAY...WITH LOTS OF CLOUDS AND 
DECENT CHANCES OF PRECIPITATION CONTINUING. FRONT WILL FINALLY
EXIT REGION TO SOUTH AS THE WEEKEND BEGINS...WITH HIGH PRESSURE
BEHIND FRONT PROVIDING SLIGHTLY COOLER/DRIER AIR.

BY NEXT WEEK...APPEARS THAT RIDGE WILL BEGIN BUILDING OVER CENTRAL 
UNITED STATES. WOULD EXPECT TEMPERATURES/HUMIDITY LEVELS TO 
GO BACK UP ONCE AGAIN...WITH ISOLATED/SCATTERED SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS IN THE FORECAST. (46)          
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    70  89  72  85 /  10  20  40  50 
HARRISON AR       68  85  68  78 /  10  20  60  50 
HOT SPRINGS AR    70  89  71  85 /  10  20  40  50 
PINE BLUFF AR     70  90  72  87 /  10  20  30  50 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  67  85  68  79 /  10  20  60  50 
MONTICELLO AR     69  91  71  89 /  10  20  30  50 
SEARCY AR         69  89  71  84 /  10  20  40  50 
MOUNT IDA AR      69  89  70  85 /  10  30  40  50 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   68  87  69  83 /  10  20  50  50

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

496 
FXUS64 KLZK 180917
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
413 AM CDT WED AUG 18 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT
SHORT WAVE OVER THE ROCKIES DROPS SOUTHEAST AND TURNS THE FLOW MORE 
ZONAL OVER ARKANSAS TODAY. AS IT GATHERS STRENGTH DURING THE DAY 
THURSDAY IT WILL BRING INCREASING CHANCES OF RAIN FOR THURSDAY 
AFTERNOON. CONTINUED SHOTS OF VORTICITY WILL KEEP RAIN CHANCES 
FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT. AT THE SURFACE...MOISTURE WILL BE 
INCREASING FROM SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST THURSDAY...WITH THE COLD 
FRONT POISED TO ENTER THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE STATE FRIDAY 
MORNING. THE FRONT WILL BECOME DIFFUSE ON FRIDAY...BUT IT SHOULD BE 
OVER THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE STATE SATURDAY MORNING. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE ABLE TO WARM TODAY UNDER ABUNDANT SUNSHINE WITH 
90S BECOMING MORE PREVALENT THAN THE PAST COUPLE OF DAYS. THEN...FOR 
THURSDAY...THERE WILL BE MORE CLOUDS OVER ARKANSAS...AND HIGHS 
SHOULD DIP BACK INTO THE 80S FRIDAY. THE HIGHER RAINFALL AMOUNTS 
WILL BEGIN OVER THE NORTHWEST HALF OF THE STATE...AND IT WILL SHIFT 
TO THE SOUTHEAST AS THE FRONT ADVANCES ACROSS THE STATE.
&&

.LONG TERM...SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY
COLD FRONT WILL BE OVER SOUTHEASTERN ARKANSAS SATURDAY MORNING...BUT 
WILL BE SLOW TO MOVE FURTHER. DECREASED CHANCES OF RAINFALL ON 
SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. KEPT SMALL CHANCES OVER THE SOUTH ON 
SUNDAY. NEXT SYSTEM BEGINS TO AFFECT THE AREA BY LATE MONDAY NIGHT. 
SMALL POPS IN FOR LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. TEMPERATURES 
REMAIN A LITTLE BELOW NORMAL DURING LONG TERM. 
TEXT
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    92  70  92  72 /   0  10  20  30 
HARRISON AR       89  68  88  68 /   0  10  20  50 
HOT SPRINGS AR    92  70  92  72 /   0  10  20  40 
PINE BLUFF AR     92  70  92  73 /   0  10  20  30 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  88  67  88  68 /   0  10  20  50 
MONTICELLO AR     93  69  93  73 /   0  10  20  30 
SEARCY AR         91  69  92  71 /   0  10  20  40 
MOUNT IDA AR      93  69  92  72 /   0  10  20  40 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   92  68  91  71 /   0  10  20  40 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

720 
FXUS64 KLZK 172007
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
300 PM CDT TUE AUG 17 2004

.DISCUSSION...
OVERALL PATTERN GRADUALLY CHANGING...WITH RIDGE IN THE WEST BREAKING
DOWN AND FLOW ALOFT BECOMING A LITTLE MORE ZONAL. THIS WILL MAKE IT
A BIT MORE DIFFICULT FOR FRONTS TO PLOW THROUGH THE REGION FROM
THE NORTHWEST...WITH TEMPERATURES CLOSER TO NORMAL.

SPEAKING OF FRONTS...ONE WILL BE APPROACHING FROM THE NORTH
HEADING INTO THURSDAY/FRIDAY. THE FRONT WILL EDGE SLOWLY TO
THE SOUTH...WITH CLOUDS INCREASING AND SCATTERED SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS IN THE FORECAST.

BEFORE FRONT...WEDNESDAY LOOKS DRY...WARMER AND MORE HUMID.
NO RAIN EXPECTED UNTIL FRONT ARRIVES.

CHANCES FOR RAIN MAY STICK AROUND INTO THE WEEKEND...WITH
FRONT LIKELY STALLING IN OR CLOSE TO THE STATE. FOR NOW...
HAVE FRONT SLIDING INTO SOUTHERN ARKANSAS BY SUNDAY WITH
SLIGHT CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION SOUTH OF LITTLE ROCK.
WILL HAVE TO WATCH SITUATION TO SEE IF FRONT DOES INDEED
MAKE IT THAT FAR SOUTH.

AS FAR AS NEXT WEEK...APPEARS THAT RIDGE MAY BUILD OVER CENTRAL
UNTIED STATES...WITH NOT MUCH RAIN/TYPICAL SUMMERTIME
WEATHER. (46)
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    69  92  70  92 /  10   0  10  20
HARRISON AR       65  90  68  88 /  10   0  10  30
HOT SPRINGS AR    67  92  70  92 /  10   0  10  30
PINE BLUFF AR     66  92  70  92 /  10   0  10  20
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  65  89  67  88 /  10   0  10  30
MONTICELLO AR     65  93  69  93 /  10   0  10  20
SEARCY AR         68  91  69  92 /  10   0  10  20
MOUNT IDA AR      65  93  69  92 /  10   0  10  30

154 
FXUS64 KLZK 171155 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
654 AM CDT TUE AUG 17 2004

.DISCUSSION...
QUICK UPDATE TO EXTEND SLIGHT CHANCE POPS TO NORTHEASTERN SECTIONS 
FOR TODAY...BASED ON LATEST RADAR RETURNS. 
&&


.PREV DISCUSSION...
UPPER PATTERN SHOWS SUPPORT FOR LIGHT ECHOES GOING ON ACROSS 
SOUTHERN MISSOURI AND NORTHERN ARKANSAS ALREADY. THIS WILL JUSTIFY 
KEEPING SLIGHT CHANCES ACROSS THE NORTH FOR TODAY. MAV NUMBERS HINT 
AT THESE SHOWERS. DRY FORECAST TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY...THEN WEAK 
SHORT WAVE WEDNESDAY NIGHT WILL SUPPORT 20 PERCENT POPS WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT. SOMEWHAT MORE VIGOROUS SHORT WAVE WILL APPROACH FOR THURSDAY 
AND THURSDAY NIGHT. SURFACE WISE NO FRONTAL PASSAGE DURING THE SHORT 
TERM. GUIDANCE SEEMED TOO HIGH FOR HIGHS TODAY AND TOMORROW SINCE 
WINDS WILL BE LIGHT AND WAA WILL BE LIMITED. TEMPERATURES ON 
THURSDAY WILL BE TEMPERED BY CLOUDS AND RAIN SO WENT BELOW GUIDANCE 
FOR THAT DAY AS WELL. DID NOT VARY SIGNIFICANTLY FROM MOS LOWS.

ZONAL FLOW DURING MUCH OF THE LONG TERM KEEPS A CONTINUING SERIES OF 
H5 SHORT WAVES MOVING OVER THE AREA. HAVE CHANCE POPS IN MOST AREAS 
FROM THURSDAY INTO SUNDAY...THEN DIMINISHING. TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
CLOSER TO NORMAL...BUT WILL STILL REMAIN A LITTLE BELOW. 

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$


806 
FXUS64 KLZK 161901
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
301 PM CDT MON AUG 16 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY
MAIN ISSUE THE NEXT FEW DAYS WILL BE PASSAGE OF UPPER LEVEL WAVES...
AFFECTING WESTERN AND NORTHERN ARKANSAS. PERSISTENT SURFACE RIDGE 
WILL REMAIN IN PLACE OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN PORTION OF THE FORECAST 
AREA FOR SEVERAL DAYS. NORTHWESTERLY FLOW REGIME AT H5 WILL ALLOW 
FOR SEVERAL IMPULSES TO MOVE DOWN IN THE MEAN FLOW. THE FIRST ONE 
WILL BE TONIGHT. ONGOING ISOLD/WDLY SCT CONVECTION OVER SRN KS/NRN 
OK WILL MOVE EASTWARD TONIGHT. DUE TO A GENERAL LACK OF MOISTURE AND 
FAIRLY STRONG CAP...DONT EXPECT ANYTHING MORE THAN ISOLATED SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS IF ANYTHING AT ALL. 

NEXT SYSTEM WILL PASS THROUGH ON TUESDAY...MAINLY AFFECTING NORTHERN 
ARKANSAS WITH ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. BY 
WEDNESDAY...H5 RIDGE WILL BUILD UP FROM THE GULF. FAIRLY STRONG 
FRONT WILL APPROACH FROM THE NORTHWEST...BUT WITH THE RIDGE 
BUILDING...FORWARD PROGRESSION OF THE SYSTEM WILL LIKELY BE HALTED 
FOR A FEW DAYS. 

SURFACE RIDGE WILL GRADUALLY MOVE EAST BY THURSDAY...WITH RETURN 
FLOW SETTING UP IN ITS WAKE. THUS...TEMPERATURES WILL MODERATE BACK 
TOWARD MORE SEASONAL LEVELS.
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY
BY LATE THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY...H5 RIDGE OVER THE SOUTHERN UNITED 
STATES WILL PROGRESS EASTWARD...FINALLY ALLOWING FOR A FRONTAL 
PASSAGE ON SATURDAY. ABUNDANCE OF CLOUD COVER SHOULD ACT TO HOLD 
TEMPERATURES DOWN ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. AS THE FRONT EXITS THE 
FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY...NORTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL SET UP ONCE 
AGAIN...WITH COOLER AND DRIER AIR RETURNING TO ARKANSAS. THIS WILL 
ALLOW FOR SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPERATURES TO BEGIN THE NEXT WEEK. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    63  88  67  91 /  20  10  10   0 
HARRISON AR       61  84  67  88 /  20  20  10   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    64  91  69  94 /  20  10  10   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     62  89  68  92 /  20  10  10   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  61  84  67  88 /  20  20  10   0 
MONTICELLO AR     63  90  69  93 /  10  10  10   0 
SEARCY AR         62  87  67  90 /  20  20  10   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      64  91  69  94 /  20  10  10   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   62  89  68  91 /  20  20  10   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

AREA FOR SEVERAL DAYS. NORTHWESTERLY FLOW REGIME AT H5 WILL ALLOW 
FOR SEVERAL IMPULSES TO MOVE DOWN IN THE MEAN FLOW. THE FIRST ONE 
WILL BE TONIGHT. ONGOING ISOLD/WDLY SCT CONVECTION OVER SRN KS/NRN 
OK WILL MOVE EASTWARD TONIGHT. DUE TO A GENERAL LACK OF MOISTURE AND 
FAIRLY STRONG CAP...DONT EXPECT ANYTHING MORE THAN ISOLATED SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS IF ANYTHING AT ALL. 

NEXT SYSTEM WILL PASS THROUGH ON TUESDAY...MAINLY AFFECTING NORTHERN 
ARKANSAS WITH ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. BY 
WEDNESDAY...H5 RIDGE WILL BUILD UP FROM THE GULF. FAIRLY STRONG 
FRONT WILL APPROACH FROM THE NORTHWEST...BUT WITH THE RIDGE 
BUILDING...FORWARD PROGRESSION OF THE SYSTEM WILL LIKELY BE HALTED 
FOR A FEW DAYS. 

SURFACE RIDGE WILL GRADUALLY MOVE EAST BY THURSDAY...WITH RETURN 
FLOW SETTING UP IN ITS WAKE. THUS...TEMPERATURES WILL MODERATE BACK 
TOWARD MORE SEASONAL LEVELS.
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY
BY LATE THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY...H5 RIDGE OVER THE SOUTHERN UNITED 
STATES WILL PROGRESS EASTWARD...FINALLY ALLOWING FOR A FRONTAL 
PASSAGE ON SATURDAY. ABUNDANCE OF CLOUD COVER SHOULD ACT TO HOLD 
TEMPERATURES DOWN ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. AS THE FRONT EXITS THE 
FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY...NORTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL SET UP ONCE 
AGAIN...WITH COOLER AND DRIER AIR RETURNING TO ARKANSAS. THIS WILL 
ALLOW FOR SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPERATURES TO BEGIN THE NEXT WEEK. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    63  88  67  91 /  20  10  10   0 
HARRISON AR       61  84  67  88 /  20  20  10   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    64  91  69  94 /  20  10  10   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     62  89  68  92 /  20  10  10   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  61  84  67  88 /  20  20  10   0 
MONTICELLO AR     63  90  69  93 /  10  10  10   0 
SEARCY AR         62  87  67  90 /  20  20  10   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      64  91  69  94 /  20  10  10   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   62  89  68  91 /  20  20  10   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

482 
FXUS64 KLZK 160821
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
320 AM CDT MON AUG 16 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT
FORECAST ALREADY HAS A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT WHICH SEEMS ADEQUATE IF NOT A BIT 
OVERDONE. MOISTURE IS AVAILABLE AND IT WILL COME UNDER THE INFLUENCE 
OF A SHORT WAVE. SURFACE RIDGE WILL CONTINUE STRONG THROUGH THE 
SHORT TERM...SO NO MORE PRECIPITATION AFTER TONIGHT. A FRONTAL 
PASSAGE WILL TAKE PLACE BEYOND THE SHORT RANGE. TEMPERATURES WILL 
CONTINUE CREEPING UP A DEGREE OR TWO FOR THE HIGHS AND LOWS WITH 
SOUTH FLOW AND HIGHER MOISTURE LEVELS. ALL IN ALL GREAT TEMPERATURES 
COMPARED TO NORMALS.
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY
MORE SIGNIFICANT H5 SHORT WAVE APPROACHES AREA ON THURSDAY AND MOVES 
ACROSS ON FRIDAY AND EARLY SATURDAY. MOISTURE SLOWLY INCREASES 
THURSDAY...SO LEFT PREVIOUS SMALL POPS IN. THEN GFS INDICATES 
INCREASING MOISTURE ON FRIDAY. WENT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY AND 
FRIDAY NIGHT...DECREASING ON SATURDAY. DRY CONDITIONS RETURN BY 
SUNDAY. TEMPERATURES CONTINUE TO WARM SLOWLY...BUT WILL STILL REMAIN 
A LITTLE BELOW NORMAL.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    85  60  90  67 /  20  20  10  10

32/22





183 
FXUS64 KLZK 151948
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
248 PM CDT SUN AUG 15 2004

.SHORT TERM...
HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES ACROSS THE AREA AT THE SURFACE. AN UPPER 
TROUGH OVER THE AREA THAT HAS BEEN BRINGING NORTHWEST FLOW TO THE 
AREA WILL SHIFT FURTHER EAST ON MONDAY. DUE TO HIGH PRESSURE ALOFT 
OVER THE WESTERN U.S. THE NORTHWEST FLOW WILL CONTINUE OVER 
ARKANSAS. CONVECTION IN CENTRAL OKLAHOMA WILL CONTINUE TO SPREAD MID 
AND HIGH CLOUDS ACROSS MAINLY NORTH AND WEST ARKNASAS TONIGHT. 
PRECIP WILL NOT MAKE IT INTO ARKANSAS TONIGHT THOUGH WITH MUCH DRIER 
AIR IN ARKANSAS. DEW POINTS ARE IN THE 50S IN ARKANSAS AND IN THE 
MID 60S IN OKLAHOMA.  

MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH BRINGING A SHORT WAVE ACROSS THE 
AREA ON MONDAY. WILL INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS FOR MONDAY AS THIS SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH. FEEL THAT 
PRECIP WILL BE VERY ISOLATED IN NATURE. TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY WILL 
BE QUIET. CHANCES OF PRECIP WILL RETURN ON THURSDAY AS LOW PRESSURE 
APPROACHES FROM THE NORTHWEST. 

SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL RETURN ON TUESDAY AND THIS WILL HELP TO WARM 
TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE REST OF THE WEEK. TEMPERATURES WILL RETURN 
TO NORMAL BY MID WEEK.
&&

.LONG TERM...FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...
PATTERN NOT NEARLY AS AMPLIFIED AS PREVIOUS RUNS WERE SHOWING BUT 
PERIOD STILL STARTS WITH RIDGING OVER THE WEST COAST AND DEEP VORTEX 
OVER SOUTH CENTRAL CANADA. ALL MEDIUM RANGE MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THEIR SOLUTIONS SO A BLEND WILL BE USED WITH A LEAN TOWARDS THE 
MORE CONSISTENT GFS. TROF APPROACHES EARLY THE PERIOD WITH GOOD 
MOISTURE RETURN OFF THE GULF AND DECENT LOOKING SHORT WAVE 
ACCOMPANIED WITH GOOD LIFT. WILL CONTINUE SCATTERED POPS AT THIS 
POINT BUT WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED TO SEE HIGHER POPS AS THE WEEK 
PROGRESSES.

FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL THEN BEGIN TOO PRESS DOWN FROM THE NORTH ON 
SATURDAY BUT NEVER SEEMS TO QUITE MAKE IT THROUGH THE STATE 
BEFORE RETREATING BACK TO THE NORTH AS TROPICAL SYSTEM WORKS INTO 
THE GULF. SYSTEM SHOULD BE PICKED UP AND SHUNTED EAST BY TROF 
SITTING OVER THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE COUNTRY AS RIDGE TRIES TO 
REBUILD OVER THE WEST. SUNDAY LOOKS TO BE DRY AT THIS POINT BUT WITH 
TROPICAL SYSTEM IN THE GULF NEXT WEEKEND...CONFIDENCE IS LESS THAN 
TERRIFIC. TEMPERATURES WILL BE CLOSE TO SEASONABLE NORMAL WITH DEW 
POINT TEMPERATURES SLOWLY CREEPING UPWARDS THROUGH THE PERIOD.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    62  86  64  89 /  10  20  20  10 
HARRISON AR       56  80  62  86 /  10  20  20  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    62  86  64  90 /  10  20  20  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     62  86  64  90 /  10  20  20  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  56  80  62  86 /  10  20  20  10 
MONTICELLO AR     62  87  64  90 /  10  20  20  10 
SEARCY AR         60  84  63  88 /  10  20  20  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      61  86  64  90 /  10  20  20  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   60  84  63  88 /  10  20  20  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

.DISCUSSION...
WILL ISSUE A QUICK UPDATE TO THE FORECASTS SHORTLY. HIGH PRESSURE 
AND GENERALLY PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES CONTINUE ACROSS THE AREA. 
CONVECTION IN OKLAHOMA WILL SPREAD CLOUDS INTO WESTERN ARKANSAS. 
THESE WILL BE MAINLY MID AND HIGH CLOUDS. THEREFORE...WILL INCREASE 
CLOUD AMOUNTS IN THE WEST. LOOKING AT CURRENT TRENDS...REST OF THE 
FORECAST LOOKS IN GREAT SHAPE.

104 
FXUS64 KLZK 150731
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
230 AM CDT SUN AUG 15 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT
PREVIOUS GRIDS AND FORECAST PRETTY MUCH ON TRACK IN THE SHORT TERM. 
SURFACE RIDGE CONTINUES OVER THE AREA. NORTHWESTERLY FLOW AT H5 WILL 
CONTINUE TO BRING WEAK SHORT WAVES OVER THE AREA. MOISTURE STILL 
PRETTY LIMITED...SO ONLY SOME CLOUDS FORECAST. BIGGEST QUESTION IS 
CHANCES FOR ANY RAINFALL ON MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. SLIGHTLY 
STRONGER SHORT WAVE FORECAST TO MOVE OVER THE AREA...WITH A LITTLE 
BETTER MOISTURE. DAYSHIFT ON SATURDAY REMOVED MENTION OF RAINFALL 
FOR MONDAY. WITH MODEL UNCERTAINTY...THINK THAT AT THIS TIME WILL 
NOT FLIP-FLOP ON THE FORECAST...AND WILL LEAVE OUT ANY MENTION OF 
RAINFALL FOR MONDAY. AT MOST IF IT NEEDS TO BE ADDED LATER...IT 
WOULD ONLY BE 20 PERCENT OR SO IN THE NORTH. TEMPERATURES WILL 
CONTINUE TO BE BELOW NORMAL...BUT READINGS WARMING A FEW DEGREES 
HIGHER EACH DAY.
&&

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY
UPPER FLOW STARTS WEAK AND SOMEWHAT DISORGANIZED...THEN IT GATHERS 
ITSELF INTO A WELL ORGANIZED TROF AND CLOSED LOW BY SATURDAY 
MORNING. AT THE SURFACE...THIS RUN OF THE GFS DOES NOT SHOW AS CLEAR 
A FRONT AS DURING PREVIOUS RUNS. SMALL CHANCES OF RAIN WILL BEGIN ON 
THURSDAY AND THEY WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE GRADUALLY TO LIKELY OVER 
THE WEST CENTRAL AND SOUTHWEST SECTIONS FOR THE WEEK END. WITH THE 
FRONT TAKING LONGER THAN BEFORE...INCREASED HIGH TEMPERATURES AS 
WELL AS THE LOWS TO ACCOUNT FOR PROLONGED SOUTH WINDS AND HIGHER DEW 
POINTS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    83  61  86  64 /   0  10  10  10 
HARRISON AR       79  57  82  62 /   0  10  10  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    84  61  87  64 /   0  10  10  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     84  61  87  64 /   0  10  10  10
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  78  57  82  62 /   0  10  10  10 
MONTICELLO AR     85  61  87  64 /   0  10  10  10 
SEARCY AR         82  60  85  63 /   0  10  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      84  61  87  64 /   0  10  10  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   82  60  85  63 /   0  10  10  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

44





995 
FXUS64 KLZK 141850
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
148 PM CDT SAT AUG 14 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...
GFS CONTINUES TO BE THE MOST CONSISTENT MODEL ALTHOUGH ITS TRENDING 
SLIGHTLY FASTER AND A LITTLE DEEPER WITH THE CENTRAL CONUS TROF 
VERSUS THIS TIME YESTERDAY. ETA ALSO A TAD FASTER BUT CONTINUES TO 
WAFFLE A BIT WITH SPEED AND INTENSITY OF THE VARIOUS SYSTEMS. GFS 
SEEMS TO BE THE BETTER CHOICE AND WILL FOLLOW ITS SOLUTION PRETTY 
CLOSELY.

MID LEVEL WAVE CLEARLY SEEN ON SATELLITE CONTINUES TO MOVE ACROSS 
SOUTHEAST MISSOURI. MESO-ETA SEEMS TO HAVE THE BEST HANDLE ON THIS 
FEATURE AND KEEPS IT OUT OF THE CWA. RADAR TRENDS SUPPORT THIS AND 
EVEN THOUGH A SPRINKLE OR TWO CAN NOT BE RULED OVER THE NORTHEAST 
PART OF THE CWA...PRECIP CHANCES NOT HIGH ENOUGH TO BE INCLUDED IN 
THE PACKAGE THIS EVENING. OTHERWISE ANOTHER DAY OF RELATIVELY DRY 
AND COOL AIR FOR MID AUGUST.

UPPER LEVEL FLOW STILL HIGHLY AMPLIFIED WITH STRONG RIDGING OVER THE 
WEST AND DEEP TROF OVER THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. PATTERN SLOWLY 
FLATTENS OUT DURING THE PERIOD AS STRONG SHORTWAVE TRIES TO KNOCK 
DOWN THE RIDGE AND THE TROF FILLS IN AND LIFTS OUT. NORTHWEST FLOW 
CONTINUES FOR THE FIRST PART OF THE PERIOD WITH SEVERAL UPPER LEVEL 
DISTURBANCES TRAVERSING THE AREA. MOISTURE WITH ALL THESE WAVES IS 
LIMITED AT BEST AND IN SOME CASES LESS THAN THAT. WILL GO AHEAD AND 
PULL PRECIP FROM THE CURRENT FORECAST MONDAY AS MODELS HAVE CUT WAY 
BACK ON THE MOISTURE.

MODELS DEVELOP INTENSE UPPER LEVEL VORTEX ACROSS CENTRAL CANADA BY 
MID WEEK. RESULT IS A MUCH BROADER TROUGH OVER THE NORTHERN TIER 
STATES AND THE FLOW ACTUALLY TAKES ON MORE OF A WESTERLY COMPONENT. 
BUT WITH NO SIGNIFICANT WAVES/FRONTS SEEN...WILL GO DRY THROUGH OUT 
THE ENTIRE PERIOD.

ON THE SURFACE...HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WILL PRETTY MUCH DOMINATE 
THROUGH THE PERIOD BUT ENOUGH MOISTURE COMES UP ON THE BACK SIDE OF 
THE RIDGE TO KEEP CONDITIONS PARTLY CLOUDY AT LEAST. 

CONCERNING TEMPERATURES...NORTHWEST FLOW WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES 
BELOW NORMAL AND DEW POINT TEMPERATURES IN CHECK...AT LEAST 
INITIALLY. AS FLOW DAMPENS OUT...TEMPERATURES WILL SLOWLY RISE AS 
MID LEVEL HEIGHTS INCREASE AND WINDS TAKE ON MORE OF A SOUTHERLY 
COMPONENT AS SURFACE RIDGE IS PUSHED EAST. DEW POINT TEMPERATURES 
WILL ALSO BE ON THE RISE AS GULF STARTS TO OPEN UP SOMEWHAT.
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...
MODELS SHOW THE RIDGE MOVING EAST OF THE AREA ON THURSDAY AND ALLOW 
A TROUGH TO MOVE INTO THE REGION FROM THE WEST. AN UPPER LOW WILL 
REMAIN OVER THE AREA FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. THIS WILL ALLOW A COLD 
FRONT TO ENTER THE NORTH PART OF THE STATE EARLY SATURDAY. THE SLOW 
MOVEMENT OF THE UPPER LOW IMPLIES THAT THE FRONT WILL STALL ACROSS 
THE MIDDLE OF ARKANSAS. IN ANY CASE SEVERAL SHORT WAVES WILL ALSO 
MOVE ACROSS THE AREA AND SET THE STAGE FOR A MOSTLY CLOUDY AND RAINY 
PERIOD FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. WILL KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE CATEGORY 
FOR NOW FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR 
NORMAL.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    60  84  62  86 /   0   0  10  20 
HARRISON AR       56  81  58  82 /   0   0  10  20 
HOT SPRINGS AR    61  85  62  87 /   0   0  10  20 
PINE BLUFF AR     60  85  62  87 /   0   0  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  55  81  58  82 /   0   0  10  20 
MONTICELLO AR     59  85  62  87 /   0   0  10  10 
SEARCY AR         59  83  61  85 /   0   0  10  20 
MOUNT IDA AR      61  85  62  87 /   0   0  10  20 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   59  84  61  85 /   0   0  10  20 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

56/51





000 
FXUS64 KLZK 141850
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
148 PM CDT SAT AUG 14 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...
GFS CONTINUES TO BE THE MOST CONSISTENT MODEL ALTHOUGH ITS TRENDING 
SLIGHTLY FASTER AND A LITTLE DEEPER WITH THE CENTRAL CONUS TROF 
VERSUS THIS TIME YESTERDAY. ETA ALSO A TAD FASTER BUT CONTINUES TO 
WAFFLE A BIT WITH SPEED AND INTENSITY OF THE VARIOUS SYSTEMS. GFS 
SEEMS TO BE THE BETTER CHOICE AND WILL FOLLOW ITS SOLUTION PRETTY 
CLOSELY.

MID LEVEL WAVE CLEARLY SEEN ON SATELLITE CONTINUES TO MOVE ACROSS 
SOUTHEAST MISSOURI. MESO-ETA SEEMS TO HAVE THE BEST HANDLE ON THIS 
FEATURE AND KEEPS IT OUT OF THE CWA. RADAR TRENDS SUPPORT THIS AND 
EVEN THOUGH A SPRINKLE OR TWO CAN NOT BE RULED OVER THE NORTHEAST 
PART OF THE CWA...PRECIP CHANCES NOT HIGH ENOUGH TO BE INCLUDED IN 
THE PACKAGE THIS EVENING. OTHERWISE ANOTHER DAY OF RELATIVELY DRY 
AND COOL AIR FOR MID AUGUST.

UPPER LEVEL FLOW STILL HIGHLY AMPLIFIED WITH STRONG RIDGING OVER THE 
WEST AND DEEP TROF OVER THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. PATTERN SLOWLY 
FLATTENS OUT DURING THE PERIOD AS STRONG SHORTWAVE TRIES TO KNOCK 
DOWN THE RIDGE AND THE TROF FILLS IN AND LIFTS OUT. NORTHWEST FLOW 
CONTINUES FOR THE FIRST PART OF THE PERIOD WITH SEVERAL UPPER LEVEL 
DISTURBANCES TRAVERSING THE AREA. MOISTURE WITH ALL THESE WAVES IS 
LIMITED AT BEST AND IN SOME CASES LESS THAN THAT. WILL GO AHEAD AND 
PULL PRECIP FROM THE CURRENT FORECAST MONDAY AS MODELS HAVE CUT WAY 
BACK ON THE MOISTURE.

MODELS DEVELOP INTENSE UPPER LEVEL VORTEX ACROSS CENTRAL CANADA BY 
MID WEEK. RESULT IS A MUCH BROADER TROUGH OVER THE NORTHERN TIER 
STATES AND THE FLOW ACTUALLY TAKES ON MORE OF A WESTERLY COMPONENT. 
BUT WITH NO SIGNIFICANT WAVES/FRONTS SEEN...WILL GO DRY THROUGH OUT 
THE ENTIRE PERIOD.

ON THE SURFACE...HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE WILL PRETTY MUCH DOMINATE 
THROUGH THE PERIOD BUT ENOUGH MOISTURE COMES UP ON THE BACK SIDE OF 
THE RIDGE TO KEEP CONDITIONS PARTLY CLOUDY AT LEAST. 

CONCERNING TEMPERATURES...NORTHWEST FLOW WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES 
BELOW NORMAL AND DEW POINT TEMPERATURES IN CHECK...AT LEAST 
INITIALLY. AS FLOW DAMPENS OUT...TEMPERATURES WILL SLOWLY RISE AS 
MID LEVEL HEIGHTS INCREASE AND WINDS TAKE ON MORE OF A SOUTHERLY 
COMPONENT AS SURFACE RIDGE IS PUSHED EAST. DEW POINT TEMPERATURES 
WILL ALSO BE ON THE RISE AS GULF STARTS TO OPEN UP SOMEWHAT.
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...
MODELS SHOW THE RIDGE MOVING EAST OF THE AREA ON THURSDAY AND ALLOW 
A TROUGH TO MOVE INTO THE REGION FROM THE WEST. AN UPPER LOW WILL 
REMAIN OVER THE AREA FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. THIS WILL ALLOW A COLD 
FRONT TO ENTER THE NORTH PART OF THE STATE EARLY SATURDAY. THE SLOW 
MOVEMENT OF THE UPPER LOW IMPLIES THAT THE FRONT WILL STALL ACROSS 
THE MIDDLE OF ARKANSAS. IN ANY CASE SEVERAL SHORT WAVES WILL ALSO 
MOVE ACROSS THE AREA AND SET THE STAGE FOR A MOSTLY CLOUDY AND RAINY 
PERIOD FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. WILL KEEP POPS IN THE CHANCE CATEGORY 
FOR NOW FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR 
NORMAL.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    60  84  62  86 /   0   0  10  20 
HARRISON AR       56  81  58  82 /   0   0  10  20 
HOT SPRINGS AR    61  85  62  87 /   0   0  10  20 
PINE BLUFF AR     60  85  62  87 /   0   0  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  55  81  58  82 /   0   0  10  20 
MONTICELLO AR     59  85  62  87 /   0   0  10  10 
SEARCY AR         59  83  61  85 /   0   0  10  20 
MOUNT IDA AR      61  85  62  87 /   0   0  10  20 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   59  84  61  85 /   0   0  10  20 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

56/51





866 
FXUS64 KLZK 141531
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1013 AM CDT SAT AUG 14 2004

.DISCUSSION...
MID LEVEL WAVE CLEARLY SEEN IN SATELLITE THIS MORNING MOVING ACROSS 
CENTRAL MISSOURI. FEATURE IS PRODUCING SOME RETURNS OVER SOUTHERN 
MISSOURI BUT TRACK OF THE PRECIPITATION WOULD TAKE THE BULK OF IT TO 
THE EAST OF THE CWA. A FEW SPRINKLES ARE POSSIBLE OVER THE EXTREME 
NORTHEAST CORNER OF THE CWA BUT ANY PRECIP WILL BE SHORT LIVED AND 
CAN BE COVERED WITH NOWCASTS. 

OTHERWISE FORECAST LOOKS RIGHT ON TARGET WITH CU FIELD EXPECTED ONCE 
AGAIN TO DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON SO PARTLY CLOUDY WILL WORK. 
TEMPERATURES ALSO LOOK RIGHT ON TRACK. GRIDS WILL HAVE TO BE TWEAKED 
TO REFLECT CURRENT CONDITIONS AND TRENDS BUT CHANGES TO THE ACTUAL 
PRODUCTS WILL BE NEGLIGIBLE.
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
NOT MUCH TO CHANGE IN PREVIOUS FORECAST. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE 
WILL CONTINUE TO DOMINATE THE AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND. 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW BRINGS CONTINUING SERIES OF WEAK SHORT WAVES 
CLOSE TO THE AREA EARLY THIS COMING WEEK. PREVIOUS FORECAST HAS 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS MENTIONED FOR NORTHERN AND CENTRAL ARKANSAS FOR 
MONDAY AND MONDAY EVENING. MOISTURE LOOKS TO BE A LITTLE SLIM FOR 
ANY RAINFALL...BUT WITH SOME UNCERTAINTY THERE...WILL NOT FLIP-FLOP 
THE FORECAST BY TAKING IT OUT FOR NOW. LATER MODEL RUNS MAY GET A 
LITTLE BETTER HANDLE ON THIS. TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE BELOW 
NORMAL...BUT WILL WARM A FEW DEGREES MORE EACH DAY IN THE SHORT 
TERM. 

UPPER FLOW WILL CONTINUE WEAK AS THE MAIN BULK OF THE WESTERLIES 
WILL REMAIN NORTH OF THE BORDER. A BROAD AREA OF LOW HEIGHTS AT H5 
OVER THE ROCKIES WILL BE SLOW TO PUSH EAST FOR WEDNESDAY. THEN IT 
LOSES DEFINITION BY THURSDAY MORNING. THE CORRESPONDING SURFACE 
PATTERN STILL SHOWS A FRONTAL PASSAGE FOR THURSDAY...WITH LINGERING 
MOISTURE BEHIND IT SO KEPT SMALL POPS FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

44





352 
FXUS64 KLZK 131904
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
203 PM CDT FRI AUG 13 2004

.LONG TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...
SEVERAL RECORD LOWS WERE EITHER SET OR TIED THIS MORNING AS THE 
ATYPICAL WEATHER FOR MID AUGUST CONTINUES. REFER TO LITRERLIT FOR 
THE NEW RECORDS. GFS APPEARS TO BE SLIGHTLY STRONGER WITH THE 
SYNOPTIC SCALE FEATURES WITH THE ETA STARTING TO LEAN MORE IN ITS 
DIRECTION. WITH THE DIFFERENCES BARELY DISCERNIBLE ...WILL CONTINUE 
THE TREND OF THE PAST FEW DAYS IN GOING WITH A BLEND OF MODEL 
SOLUTIONS. WILL ALSO CONTINUE THE LEAN TOWARDS THE SLIGHTLY STRONGER 
AND MORE CONSISTENT GFS.

HIGHLY AMPLIFIED FLOW THIS AFTERNOON WITH DEEP TROFFING OVER CENTRAL 
UNITED STATES AND STRONG RIDGING OVER THE WEST AND CHARLEY HEADING 
TOWARDS CENTRAL FLORIDA. PATTERN MORE REMINISCENT OF LATE FALL THAN 
MID SUMMER WITH WELL ESTABLISHED NORTHWEST FLOW. PATTERN DOES BEGIN 
TO DAMPEN WITH TIME AS EAST COAST TROF FILLS AND BECOMES MORE BROAD. 
WESTERN RIDGE IS FLATTENED OUT SOMEWHAT LATE IN THE PERIOD AS STRONG 
STORM SPINS IN THE EASTERN PACIFIC.  NORTHWEST FLOW WILL CONTINUE 
THROUGH THE PERIOD BUT DOES BECOME LEST PRONOUNCED.

CU FIELD DEVELOPED PRETTY MUCH ON SCHEDULE THIS AFTERNOON AND SHOULD 
DISSIPATE QUICKLY THIS EVENING WITH LOSS OF HEATING. MODELS SWING A 
COUPLE OF WEAK SHORT WAVES THROUGH TONIGHT BUT EFFECT WILL BE 
MINIMAL AS MOISTURE REMAINS LIMITED. RECORD LOWS MAY BE THREATENED 
IN SEVERAL AREAS ONCE AGAIN.

COOL CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH 
TEMPERATURES RISING A BIT EACH DAY AS FLOW STARTS TO FLATTEN OUT 
WITH NEAR NORMAL READINGS BACK AT THE END OF THE PERIOD. SURFACE 
HIGH WILL MOVE OFF TO THE EAST ALLOWING FOR MORE OF A RETURN FLOW 
AND A SUBSEQUENT INCREASE IN MOISTURE. MODELS NEVER DO BRING DEW 
POINTS OVER 70 AS GULF STAYS CLOSED SO HUMIDITY WILL REMAIN BELOW 
THE OPPRESSIVE LEVEL.

CONCERNING PRECIPITATION...A FEW WIDELY SCATTERED SHOWERS ARE 
POSSIBLE THIS EVENING OVER THE NORTH AS A WAVE MOVES THROUGH BUT 
RAIN WILL BE TOO LIMITED TO MENTION IN THE ZONES. WILL TOSS IN SOME 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY AS A WAVE MOVES ACROSS THE ARKANSAS 
AND MISSOURI BORDER. MODELS HAVE COME BACK STRONGER AND WETTER WITH 
THIS FEATURE VERSUS PREVIOUS RUNS.   
&&

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...
MODELS ARE SHOWING A TREND TOWARD A MORE ZONAL FLOW FOR WEDNESDAY 
THROUGH FRIDAY. HIGH PRESSURE WILL SLIDE EAST ON WEDNESDAY. THIS 
WILL ALLOW A COLD FRONT TO ENTER NORTH ARKANSAS FROM THE PLAINS 
THURSDAY MORNING AND SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE ASSOCIATED 
WITH THE FRONT. WILL INCREASE POPS TO CHANCE CATEGORY IN VICINITY OF 
THE FRONT ON THURSDAY AS IT MOVES SOUTH THROUGH THE STATE. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE SLIGHTLY COOLER ON FRIDAY BEHIND THE FRONT. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    57  82  60  85 /  10  10  10  10 
HARRISON AR       53  77  56  82 /  10  10  10  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    57  83  61  86 /  10  10  10  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     57  82  60  86 /  10  10  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  53  77  55  82 /  10  10  10  10 
MONTICELLO AR     57  82  59  86 /  10  10  10  10 
SEARCY AR         56  80  59  84 /  10  10  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      57  83  61  86 /  10  10  10  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   56  81  59  85 /  10  10  10  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

RUSSELLVILLE AR   56  81  59  85 /  10  10  10  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

56/51






055 
FXUS64 KLZK 131535
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1028 AM CDT FRI AUG 13 2004

.DISCUSSION...
NO CHANGES ARE NEEDED TO THE CURRENT FORECAST AS EVERYTHING LOOKS 
RIGHT ON TRACK. PATTERN REMAINS VERY AMPLIFIED FOR MID AUGUST WITH 
NORTHWEST FLOW CONTINUING OVER THE AREA. HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE 
TO DOMINATE WITH HIGHS EXPECTED TO TOP OUT AROUND 10 DEGREES BELOW 
NORMAL ACROSS THE AREA.

DEEP MOISTURE REMAINS LIMITED BUT ENOUGH BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE 
AROUND THAT AFTERNOON CU FIELD IS EXPECTED BUT PROBABLY NOT AS 
EXTENSIVE AS YESTERDAY. PARTLY CLOUDY WILL WORK. ONLY UPDATE WILL BE 
TO CLEAN UP THE WORDING.
&&

.PREV DISCUSSION...
COOL CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE THE WEATHER IN THE 
FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND. COOLER THAN NORMAL TEMPERATURES 
WILL CONTINUE...BUT TEMPERATURES WILL SLOWLY WARM A FEW DEGREES EACH 
DAY. H5 FLOW REMAINS OUT THE NORTHWEST THROUGH THE WEEKEND. MODELS 
INDICATING THAT ANY SIGNIFICANT MOISTURE SHOULD REMAIN WEST OF THE 
AREA...SO HAVE INCLUDED NO POPS THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. 

UPPER LEVEL FLOW WILL REMAIN RATHER WEAK...EVEN AS A SHORT WAVE 
DROPS SOUTHEAST INTO IOWA MONDAY AND IT TRAVELS TO THE WESTERN TIP 
OF KENTUCKY BY TUESDAY MORNING. THE FLOW DOES BECOME ZONAL BY 
THURSDAY. AT THE SURFACE...MOISTURE SHOULD REMAIN JUST TO THE NORTH 
AND WEST OF OUR FORECAST AREA AS RIDGE ATTEMPTS TO HANG ON FROM THE 
MID SOUTH ALMOST TO NEW ENGLAND. THE NEXT FRONT WILL BE POISED TO 
CROSS THE STATE DURING THE DAYLIGHT HOURS THURSDAY WITH THE BULK OF 
ITS MOISTURE BEHIND THE SURFACE BOUNDARY. CURRENT PROBABILITIES FOR 
THURSDAY WILL SUFFICE.

&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

22/32








255 
FXUS64 KLZK 122009
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
300 PM CDT THU AUG 12 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT
DEEP TROUGH OVER CENTRAL PART OF THE COUNTRY/RIDGE TO WEST...WITH
NORTHERLY FLOW ALOFT OUT OF CANADA. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING INTO
REGION...WITH BREEZY NORTH/NORTHEAST WIND BRINGING WELL BELOW NORMAL
TEMPERATURES.

NO BIG CHANGES THIS WEEKEND. MAY APPROACH RECORD LOW
TEMPERATURES FRIDAY MORNING IN SOME AREAS...WITH READINGS SLOWLY
MODIFYING AS THE WEEKEND PROGRESSES. DRY WEATHER WILL CONTINUE.

HEADING INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...RIDGE IN WEST WILL FLATTEN LEADING
TO MORE OF A ZONAL FLOW. APPEARS THAT TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE
MODIFYING TO MORE NORMAL LEVELS.
&&

.LONG TERM...MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...
WITH NO DISCERNIBLE DIFFERENCES IN THE MODELS NOTED THIS
AFTERNOON...WILL CONTINUE THE TREND OF THE PAST FEW DAYS IN GOING
WITH A BLEND OF SOLUTIONS. WILL ALSO CONTINUE THE LEAN TOWARDS THE
SLIGHTLY MORE CONSISTENT GFS.

OVERALL DEAMPLIFICATION ON THE PATTERNS CONTINUES EARLY IN THE
PERIOD AS STRONG EAST COAST TROF FILLS IN AND RIDING OVER THE WEST
GETS FLATTENED OUT. WEAKER VERSION OF THE RIDGE REMAINS OVER THE
ROCKY MOUNTAINS WITH MORE OF A BROAD TROF OVER THE CENTRAL AND
EASTERN CONUS. PATTERN CONTINUES TO FLATTEN OUT DURING THE WEEK AND
LOOKS ALMOST ZONAL BY THE END OF THE PERIOD.

TEMPERATURES WILL SLOWLY MODERATE FROM BELOW NORMAL TO NEAR NORMAL
DURING THE PERIOD AS INITIAL NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT DAMPENS INTO MORE
OF A WESTERLY ONE AND RETURN FLOW ON THE SURFACE STARTS TO GET
REESTABLISHED. WHILE TEMPERATURES WILL BE ON THE INCREASE...THE GULF
ESSENTIALLY REMAINS CLOSED WITH DEW POINTS ONLY CLIMBING BACK INTO
THE UPPER 60S.

LITTLE IN THE WAY OF PRECIPITATION EXPECTED THROUGH THE PERIOD.
SEVERAL VERY WEAK DISTURBANCES DROP DOWN IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW BUT
MOST ARE MOISTURE STARVED WITH VERY LITTLE OTHER DYNAMICS NOTED.
BEST CHANCE OF PRECIP WILL BE ON THURSDAY AS YET ANOTHER FRONT
APPROACHES FROM THE NORTHWEST.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    56  80  57  83 /   0   0   0   0
HARRISON AR       52  73  54  78 /   0   0   0   0
HOT SPRINGS AR    55  81  57  84 /   0   0   0   0
PINE BLUFF AR     56  80  57  83 /   0   0   0   0
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  51  71  54  78 /   0   0   0   0
MONTICELLO AR     55  80  56  83 /   0   0   0   0
SEARCY AR         55  78  57  81 /   0   0   0   0
MOUNT IDA AR      53  81  56  84 /   0   0   0   0
RUSSELLVILLE AR   53  80  56  82 /   0   0   0   0
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

46/56





834 
FXUS64 KLZK 120817
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
316 AM CDT THU AUG 12 2004

.DISCUSSION...
QUITE A CONTRAST THIS MORNING WHEN COMPARED WITH THIS TIME 
YESTERDAY. LAST REMNANT OF ORGANIZED RAINFALL IS WELL TO THE SOUTH 
OF ARKANSAS...WITH COLD FRONT NOW WELL INTO LOUISIANA. COOLER AND 
DRIER AIR AT THE LOWER LEVELS IS WORKING ITS WAY OVER THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN AND INTO CENTRAL ARKANSAS...AS EVIDENCED BY 60 DEGREE 
ISODROSOTHERM FROM NEAR JONESBORO TO HOT SPRINGS TO NORTHWEST OF 
TEXARKANA. ALSO...SPL 06Z RAOB INDICATES SIGNIFICANT DRYING IN THE 
SURFACE-925MB LEVEL. 

SOME LINGERING SPRINKLES MAY BE LEFT OVER EARLY THIS MORNING OVER 
THE SOUTHEAST...BUT THIS WILL QUICKY DISSIPATE BY MID MORNING. 
ALSO...SOME PATCHY FOG HAS BEEN NOTED IN THE VALLEY AREAS OF NERN 
AND ERN OK/SWRN MO/AND NORTHWESTERN ARKANSAS BEHIND THE CLEARING 
LINE. WILL MENTION PATCHY FOG IN THE FORECAST THROUGH MID 
MORNING...FOR ABOUT THE NORTHWESTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. 

AREA OF CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE PREVIOUS SYSTEM WILL CLEAR OUT 
LATER THIS MORNING...FOLLOWED BY MORE CLOUDS MOVING IN FROM THE 
NORTHWEST THIS AFTERNOON. THESE WILL MOVE DOWN IN THE NORTHWESTERLY 
FLOW ALONG THE BACK EDGE OF H5 LOW MOVING THROUGH THE UPPER MS VLY. 

NORTHWESTERLY FLOW REGIME WILL CONTINUE INTO THE WEEKEND WITH BELOW 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES NOTED EACH DAY. BY MONDAY...THERE WILL BE AN 
INCREASING CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS...MAINLY FOR NWRN 
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS WILL BE IN RESPONSE TO SEVERAL 
IMPULSES MOVING DOWN IN THE MEAN FLOW...AS H5 TROUGH REMAINS 
ANCHORED OVER THE CENTRAL PORTION OF THE COUNTRY. 

BY EARLY NEXT WEEK...TEMPERATURES WILL BEGIN MODERATING TOWARD MORE 
NORMAL LEVELS. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE THROUGH...WITH RETURN 
FLOW SETTING UP. THERE WILL BE A CONTINUED SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS...AS MORE DISTURBANCES AFFECT THE AREA FROM THE 
NORTHWEST. 
&&

.SYNOPSIS...
COOL CANADIAN AIR WILL AFFECT THE AREA FOR SEVERAL DAYS TO COME...AS 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW SETS UP OVER ARKANSAS. BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE NOTED THROUGH THE WEEKEND...WITH LOWS FALLING INTO THE LOWER 
AND MID 50S...AND HIGHS IN THE LOWER 70S TO MID 80S. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    77  57  80  58 /  10   0   0   0 
HARRISON AR       71  51  75  54 /  10   0   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    80  56  83  57 /  10   0   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     77  57  80  58 /  10   0   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  70  51  74  54 /  10   0   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     77  55  80  57 /  20   0   0   0 
SEARCY AR         75  56  77  58 /  10   0   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      81  55  84  56 /  10   0   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   78  54  80  56 /  10   0   0   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KLZK 120253 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
953 PM CDT WED AUG 11 2004

.DISCUSSION...
RAINFALL CONFINED TO SERN AR ATTM. CDFNT THAT MOVED THRU DURG THE 
DAY IS NOW WELL S OF THE STATE. EXPECT RAINFALL TO SLOWLY END FROM 
THE NW LATER TNGT AS DRIER AIRMASS CONTS TO FILTER INTO THE AREA AND 
UPPER SUPPORT MOVES FURTHER EWD. HAVE LEFT SMALL POPS FOR SERN ZNS 
AND REMOVED RAIN CHCS ELSEWHERE. CLOUDS MAINLY CONFINED TO SERN HALF 
OF AR AND HAVE REWORKED THE GRIDS TO ACCOUNT FOR THESE TRENDS. ALSO 
LOWERED MIN TEMPS TNGT A FEW DEGREES FOR N-CNTRL AND WRN AR. GRIDS 
HAVE BEEN REWORKED TO ACCOUNT FOR THESE CHGS. REST OF FCST IN GOOD 
SHAPE AND NO OTHER CHGS MADE. UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONES ALREADY OUT.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

811 
FXUS64 KLZK 112004
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
300 PM CDT WED AUG 11 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT
NORTHWEST FLOW PUSHING FRONT THROUGH ARKANSAS THIS AFTERNOON.
FRONT OVER SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE STATE...AND WILL DEPART
OVERNIGHT.

SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE AHEAD OF
THE FRONT THIS EVENING SOUTH OF LITTLE ROCK...WITH SCATTERED
LIGHT RAIN/SHOWERS FARTHER NORTH.

OTHERWISE...NORTH/NORTHEAST WIND WILL FOLLOW FRONT WITH CLOUDS
BREAKING UP FROM THE NORTH OVERNIGHT.

ON THURSDAY...TROUGH WILL DEEPEN ALOFT OVER CENTER PART OF
THE COUNTRY. THIS WILL YIELD FAIRLY EXTENSIVE CU FIELD DURING
AFTERNOON...WITH BREEZY NORTHEAST WIND CONTINUING.

LOOKING AHEAD...DRY WEATHER WILL CONTINUE FRIDAY/SATURDAY WITH
TEMPERATURES SLOWLY MODERATING. EVEN SO...READINGS WILL REMAIN
BELOW NORMAL THROUGHOUT THE SHORT TERM PERIOD. (46)
&&

.LONG TERM...SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY
MEDIUM RANGE MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW GOOD CONTINUITY WHILE
CONTINUING TO BE IN REASONABLE AGREEMENT THIS AFTERNOON. WITH NO
REAL DISCERNIBLE DIFFERENCES SEEN...WILL CONTINUE TO GO WITH A BLEND
OF MODEL SOLUTIONS WITH A LEAN TOWARDS THE SLIGHTLY MORE CONSISTENT
GFS.

PERIOD STARTS OFF WITH HIGHLY AMPLIFIED FLOW WITH LARGE TROF FROM
THE OHIO VALLEY SOUTHWEST TO THE LOUISIANA GULF COAST AND STRONG
RIDGING OVER THE GREAT BASIN. PATTERN DOES FLATTEN OUT SOMEWHAT WITH
TIME AS SHORTWAVE ENERGY MOVES ACROSS SOUTHERN CANADA AND APPROACHES
THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST. EVEN THOUGH FLOW DOES DAMPEN OUT...NORTHWEST
COMPONENT WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE PERIOD. EVEN WITH CONTINUOUS
NORTHWEST FLOW...NO SIGNIFICANT SHORTWAVES ARE SEEN AND PERIOD
SHOULD GENERALLY BE DRY. WILL LEAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN PLACE FOR
MONDAY AND INTRODUCE THEM AS WELL FOR TUESDAY TO ACCOUNT FOR
INCREASE IN MOISTURE.

ON THE SURFACE...HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE THROUGH MONDAY WITH
BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND DEW POINT TEMPERATURES CONSIDERABLY
LESS THAN THEY COULD BE FOR MID AUGUST. SKIES WILL GENERALLY BE
CLEAR WITH SUBSIDENCE BEHIND TROPICAL SYSTEM RACING UP THE EASTERN
SEABOARD. HIGH SLIPS OFF TO THE EAST EARLY NEXT WEEK FOR AN INCREASE
IN MOISTURE AND A SLOW WARMING TREND WITH TEMPERATURES NEAR NORMAL
BY THE END OF THE PERIOD. HUMIDITY LEVELS WILL NOT BE OPPRESSIVE AS
GULF REMAINS CLOSED.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    63  81  57  82 /  30  10   0   0
HARRISON AR       54  72  52  75 /  20  10   0   0
HOT SPRINGS AR    63  82  57  82 /  30  10   0   0
PINE BLUFF AR     64  82  57  82 /  40  10   0   0
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  55  71  52  74 /  20  10   0   0
MONTICELLO AR     65  82  55  82 /  40  20   0   0
SEARCY AR         62  79  56  79 /  30  10   0   0
MOUNT IDA AR      63  82  56  82 /  30  10   0   0
RUSSELLVILLE AR   60  80  55  80 /  20  10   0   0
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

FXUS64 KLZK 112004
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
300 PM CDT WED AUG 11 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT
NORTHWEST FLOW PUSHING FRONT THROUGH ARKANSAS THIS AFTERNOON.
FRONT OVER SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE STATE...AND WILL DEPART
OVERNIGHT.

SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE AHEAD OF
THE FRONT THIS EVENING SOUTH OF LITTLE ROCK...WITH SCATTERED
LIGHT RAIN/SHOWERS FARTHER NORTH.

OTHERWISE...NORTH/NORTHEAST WIND WILL FOLLOW FRONT WITH CLOUDS
BREAKING UP FROM THE NORTH OVERNIGHT.

ON THURSDAY...TROUGH WILL DEEPEN ALOFT OVER CENTER PART OF
THE COUNTRY. THIS WILL YIELD FAIRLY EXTENSIVE CU FIELD DURING
AFTERNOON...WITH BREEZY NORTHEAST WIND CONTINUING.

LOOKING AHEAD...DRY WEATHER WILL CONTINUE FRIDAY/SATURDAY WITH
TEMPERATURES SLOWLY MODERATING. EVEN SO...READINGS WILL REMAIN
BELOW NORMAL THROUGHOUT THE SHORT TERM PERIOD. (46)
&&

.LONG TERM...SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY

CONTINUING TO BE IN REASONABLE AGREEMENT THIS AFTERNOON. WITH NO
REAL DISCERNIBLE DIFFERENCES SEEN...WILL CONTINUE TO GO WITH A BLEND
OF MODEL SOLUTIONS WITH A LEAN TOWARDS THE SLIGHTLY MORE CONSISTENT

853 
FXUS64 KLZK 111733 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1225 PM CDT WED AUG 11 2004

.DISCUSSION...
PRECIPITATION SHIELD BEGINNING TO BREAK UP A BIT IN THE NORTHERN 
HALF OF ARKANSAS LATE THIS MORNING. MEANWHILE...SCATTERED 
THUNDERSTORMS INTENSIFYING IN SOUTHWEST SECTIONS OF THE STATE...AND 
WILL AFFECT AREAS MAINLY SOUTH OF LITTLE ROCK THIS AFTERNOON.

UPDATED FORECAST TO ACCOUNT FOR LATEST PRECIPITATION TRENDS. ALSO 
LOWERED TEMPERATURES IN PARTS OF CENTRAL ARKANSAS GIVEN LOTS OF 
CLOUDS/ENOUGH RAIN TO HOLD READINGS DOWN. 

COLD FRONT IN CENTRAL ARKANSAS WILL PUSH SOUTHWARD. 
MOISTURE/PRECIPITATION WILL BE SHUNTED TOWARD GULF COAST 
TONIGHT...WITH CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE/BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES 
BEHIND FRONT. 

LOOKING AT LATEST DATA...TEMPERATURES THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS A 
LITTLE WARM IN GOING FORECAST. WILL TREND READINGS DOWN A BIT AS A 
RESULT. (46)
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$



079 
FXUS64 KLZK 110801
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
301 AM CDT WED AUG 11 2004

.DISCUSSION...
HAS BEEN AN ACTIVE SHIFT SO FAR...WITH COMPLEX OF ELEVATED STORMS 
DEVELOPING OVER NORTHERN ARKANSAS. SOME STORMS HAVE BEEN STRONG 
ENOUGH TO PRODUCE HIGH WINDS...AND DOWNED TREES HAVE BEEN REPORTED 
IN IZARD...WOODRUFF...AND JACKSON COUNTIES...WITH SOME HAIL REPORTED 
IN IZARD COUNTY. SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES QUASI STATIONARY 
BOUNDARY OVER CENTRAL ARKANSAS...EXTENDING INTO OKLAHOMA. 

ANOTHER...LARGER COMPLEX OF STORMS WAS ALSO NOTED IN NORTHERN 
OKLAHOMA AND SOUTHERN KANSAS...PROPAGATING SOUTHEASTWARD. BOTH 
COMPLEXES SHOULD DIE OFF LATER THIS MORNING. CONVECTION LIKELY TO 
RE-FIRE THIS AFTERNOON...AS REMNANTS OF BOTH COMPLEXES INTERACT WITH 
DAYTIME HEATING AND UPPER TROUGH MOVING THROUGH. COULD ONCE AGAIN 
SEE A FEW STRONG ELEVATED STORMS THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING 
CENTRAL AND SOUTH. 

ANTICIPATED CLOUD COVER AND RAINFALL WILL AFFECT TEMPERATURES 
TODAY...KEEPING READINGS IN THE LOWER 70S NORTH TO THE MID 80S 
SOUTH. PRECIPIATION MAY LINGER IN EXTREME SOUTHERN ARKANSAS ON 
THURSDAY MORNING BEFORE UPPER TROUGH SWEEPS REMAINING MOISTURE 
TOWARD THE GULF COAST. 

IN THE WAKE OF THIS FRONTAL PASSAGE...NORTHWESTERLY FLOW REGIME WILL 
SET UP OVER THE FORECAST AREA...WITH MUCH COOLER AIR IN PLACE. WEEK 
WILL END WITH TEMPERATURES BELOW NORMAL. MAY BE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AGAIN BY MONDAY...AS IMPULSES MOVE DOWN IN 
THE MEAN FLOW. THIS WOULD BE RESTRICTED PRIMARILY TO THE 
NORTHWESTERN PORTION OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    82  60  83  58 /  60  30  10   0 
HARRISON AR       73  55  76  53 /  60  20  10   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    83  59  82  59 /  50  30  10   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     84  61  82  59 /  50  40  10   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  73  55  75  53 /  60  20  10   0 
MONTICELLO AR     85  62  82  59 /  50  40  20   0 
SEARCY AR         80  59  80  57 /  50  30  10   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      82  59  82  59 /  50  30  10   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   78  57  80  57 /  50  20  10   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&
