

413 
FXUS64 KLZK 102000
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
300 PM CDT TUE AUG 10 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT
FEW SHOWERS AND STORMS POPPING UP IN NORTHERN ARKANSAS THIS
AFTERNOON. SCATTERED PRECIPITATION WILL BE NOTED OVERNIGHT
IN ABOUT THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE STATE AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING
COLD FRONT. LOOKS QUIET IN THE SOUTH...AND ADDED NO RAIN AT THIS
TIME.

AFOREMENTIONED FRONT WILL RIDE NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT THROUGH
ARKANSAS ON WEDNESDAY. WILL BE LOTS OF CLOUDS...WITH
SCATTERED/NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. MAIN ENERGY WITH FRONT
WILL REMAIN TO THE WEST IN THE SOUTHERN PLAINS...WITH INDICATIONS OF
AN MCS IN CENTRAL/WESTERN OKLAHOMA. GIVEN THIS...REDUCED CHANCES OF
RAIN JUST A LITTLE AND LOWERED PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS.

FRONT WILL PUSH SOUTH OF THE STATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT/THURSDAY...
WITH ANY LINGERING PRECIPITATION IN THE SOUTHERN COUNTIES.
FRONT WILL BE FOLLOWED BY ANOTHER SHOT OF COOL AIR/CANADIAN
HIGH PRESSURE.

SHORT TERM PERIOD WILL END WITH QUIET CONDITIONS/LESS CLOUDS
AND BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES. (46)
&&

.LONG TERM...SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...
MODELS SEEM TO BE IN REASONABLE AGREEMENT THIS AFTERNOON WITH
REGARDS TO THE SYNOPTIC SCALE FEATURES. DIFFERENCES ARE IN THE
DETAILS IN BOTH TIMING AND INTENSITY BUT OVERALL PATTERN SEEMS
PRETTY CLEAR. WILL GO WITH A BLEND OF FORECAST SOLUTIONS WITH A LEAN
TOWARDS THE MORE CONSISTENT GFS.

PERIOD STARTS OUT WITH HIGH AMPLITUDE FLOW THANKS TO STRONG RIDGE
OVER THE WESTERN CONUS AND DEEP TROF FROM THE EASTERN LAKES TO THE
GULF COAST. FLOW GRADUALLY FLATTENS OUT WITH TIME AS TROPICAL
SYSTEM MOVES FROM THE FLORIDA PANHANDLE UP THE EAST COAST AND
STRONG EASTERN PACIFIC STORM APPROACHES THE WASHINGTON COAST.

ON THE SURFACE...STRONG HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE EARLY IN THE
PERIOD. THAT COMBINED WITH PERSISTENT NORTHWEST FLOW...WILL KEEP
TEMPERATURES BELOW NORMAL AND DEW POINT TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER
50S TO MID 60S THROUGH THE WEEKEND. TEMPERATURES AND DEW POINTS WILL
BEGIN TO CREEP UP EARLY NEXT WEEK AS THE FLOW STARTS TO FLATTEN OUT
AND THE HIGH BEGINS TO DRIFT MORE TOWARDS THE EAST...ALLOWING FOR
MORE OF A SOUTHERLY FLOW. A FEW WEAK IMPULSES TRY TO MOVE ACROSS THE
AREA BUT MOISTURE WILL BE AT A PREMIUM AS THE GULF REMAINS CLOSED
THROUGH OUT THE PERIOD. NOT SEEING ANY PRECIPITATION AT THIS POINT
SO WILL GO WITH A DRY FORECAST THIS PERIOD.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    92  71  82  61 /  20  30  50  40
HARRISON AR       86  64  75  55 /  30  40  40  20
HOT SPRINGS AR    94  71  85  61 /  20  20  50  40
PINE BLUFF AR     93  71  85  63 /  20  20  40  40
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  86  64  75  55 /  30  40  50  20
MONTICELLO AR     93  70  87  65 /  20  20  40  40
SEARCY AR         92  69  81  60 /  20  30  50  40
MOUNT IDA AR      94  70  85  61 /  20  30  50  40
RUSSELLVILLE AR   92  69  82  58 /  20  30  50  30
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

663 
FXUS64 KLZK 101651 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1145 AM CDT TUE AUG 10 2004

.DISCUSSION...
MCS DECAYING IN SOUTHEAST KANSAS/SOUTHWEST MISSOURI. HOWEVER...WOULD 
EXPECT BOUNDARY TO WORK INTO NORTHERN ARKANSAS THIS AFTERNOON...AND 
MAY TRIGGER SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS. GIVEN THIS...HIGHEST CHANCES OF 
RAIN IN NORTH...WITH LESSER CHANCES FARTHER SOUTH. GOING FORECAST 
ADDRESSES THIS ALREADY.

ANOTHER IN A SERIES OF COLD FRONTS WILL RIDE NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT 
INTO ARKANSAS ON WEDNESDAY. CLOUDS WILL INCREASE...WITH RAIN CHANCES 
GOING UP. A LITTLE SKEPTICAL THAT LIKELY CHANCES OF RAIN WILL PAN 
OUT HERE GIVEN THAT MAIN ENERGY WILL SWEEP ACROSS SOUTHERN PLAINS. 
LATEST DATA INDICATING THAT MCS WILL FORM IN CENTRAL/WESTERN 
OKLAHOMA. GIVEN THIS...MAY LOWER RAIN CHANCES A LITTLE AROUND FRONT. 

OTHERWISE...UNUSUAL SUMMER PATTERN WILL CONTINUE...WITH BELOW NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES TO FOLLOW FRONT LATER THIS WEEK. (46)
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

ADDRESSES THIS ALREADY.

ANOTHER IN A SERIES OF COLD FRONTS WILL RIDE NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT 
INTO ARKANSAS ON WEDNESDAY. CLOUDS WILL INCREASE...WITH RAIN CHANCES 
GOING UP. A LITTLE SKEPTICAL THAT LIKELY CHANCES OF RAIN WILL PAN 
OUT HERE GIVEN THAT MAIN ENERGY WILL SWEEP ACROSS SOUTHERN PLAINS. 
LATEST DATA INDICATING THAT MCS WILL FORM IN CENTRAL/WESTERN 
OKLAHOMA. GIVEN THIS...MAY LOWER RAIN CHANCES A LITTLE AROUND FRONT. 

OTHERWISE...UNUSUAL SUMMER PATTERN WILL CONTINUE...WITH BELOW NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES TO FOLLOW FRONT LATER THIS WEEK. (46)
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

46







500 
FXUS64 KLZK 100838
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
338 AM CDT TUE AUG 10 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT
SOME CIRRUS BLOWOFF NOTED THIS MORNING OVER NORTHERN ARKANSAS. THIS 
WAS COMING FROM LARGE MCS OVER WRN KS/NE. FRONTAL BOUNDARY CURRENTLY 
STALLED OVER SOUTHERN MISSOURI AND OK/KS BORDER. THIS WILL BEGIN 
MOVING SLOWLY SOUTHWARD BY TONIGHT. 

LATEST SURFACE DATA INDICATES PATCHY FOG AT MANY LOCATIONS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...FOR THE MOST PART...VISBYS HAVENT DROPPED 
VERY LOW. WILL AT LEAST MENTION THE POSSIBILITY IN THE FORECAST 
FOR THE EARLY MORNING HOURS. THIS WILL MIX OUT AFTER SUNRISE. 

NEXT PRESSING ISSUE IS THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY. THE SYSTEM WILL SLOWLY 
SAG SOUTHWARD BY TONIGHT. HOWEVER...MAJORITY OF THE MOISTURE 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE SYSTEM...AS WELL AS THE UPPER SUPPORT...WILL 
REMAIN POST-FRONTAL. THUS...BEST CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE LATE TONIGHT...AND INTO THE DAY WEDNESDAY AS 
THE FRONT MOVES INTO CENTRAL ARKANSAS. HAVE GONE AHEAD AND RAISED 
POPS TO LIKELY AREAWIDE FOR MUCH OF WEDNESDAY. 

THE EXPECTED CLOUD COVER AND RAINFALL WILL DEFINITELY HAVE SOME 
EFFECT ON TEMPERATURES WEDNESDAY. TO WHAT DEGREE HOWEVER IS NOT  
EXACTLY CERTAIN. READINGS SHOULD ONLY REACH THE MID 70S NORTH TO THE 
MID 80S SOUTH. AS IVE SAID BEFORE THOUGH...THESE NUMBERS MAY BE A 
BIT HIGH. 

MCS WILL LIKELY BE ONGOING WEDNESDAY MORNING OVER ERN OKLAHOMA...
WITH REMNANTS MOVING INTO WESTERN ARKANSAS BY THE AFTERNOON. FRONT 
WILL ALSO BEGIN TO MOVE TOWARD SOUTHERN ARKANSAS AT THIS TIME. ANY 
DAYTIME HEATING WILL INTERACT WITH THE MCS REMNANTS AND WILL TOUCH 
OFF ANOTHER ROUND OF CONVECTION JUST IN TIME FOR THE AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING. THIS WOULD BE MOST LIKELY OVER CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN 
ARKANSAS. 

THERE WILL BE A LINGERING CHANCE FOR RAIN OVER SOUTHERN ARKANSAS 
THROUGH MID DAY THURSDAY...AS MOISTURE REMAINS BEHIND THE FRONT. BY 
THURSDAY AFTERNOON...H5 TROUGH WILL SWEEP THE MOISTURE ON OUT OF THE 
FORECAST AREA...WITH DRIER AND MUCH COOLER AIR FILTERING IN BEHIND. 

FOR THE FIRST TWO PERIODS...MOS GUIDANCE IS IN REASONABLE AGREEMENT. 
NOT SURPRISINGLY...THEY DIVERGE BEYOND THAT. COOLER ETA NUMBERS SEEM 
TO TAKE CLOUD COVER AND RAINFALL MORE INTO ACCOUNT...SO HAVE GONE 
CLOSER TO THOSE BEYOND TONIGHT. 
&&

.LONG TERM...FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW REGIME WILL BE PRESENT FOR MUCH OF THE EXTENDED. 
SEVERAL IMPULSES WILL MOVE DOWN IN THE MEAN FLOW...AND MAY ALLOW FOR 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF PRECIP INTO THE WEEKEND...MAINLY OVER THE 
NORTHWESTERN HALF OF THE AREA. 

MORE NOTEWORTHY IN THE EXTENDED PERIODS WILL BE THE PROLONGED PERIOD 
OF BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES. LOWS WILL FALL INTO THE MID 50S TO MID 
60S...WITH HIGHS IN THE MID 70S TO MID 80S. 

TEMPERATURES WILL MODERATE BY THE END OF THE PERIOD...HOWEVER...AS 
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SETS UP OVER THE EAST AND RETURN FLOW DEVELOPS 
OVER MUCH OF THE AREA. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    92  71  83  61 /  20  40  60  50 
HARRISON AR       86  63  74  55 /  30  60  60  50 
HOT SPRINGS AR    94  70  82  61 /  20  40  60  50 
PINE BLUFF AR     93  71  84  63 /  20  40  60  50 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  86  63  74  55 /  30  50  60  50 
MONTICELLO AR     93  71  85  65 /  20  30  60  50 
SEARCY AR         92  68  82  60 /  20  40  60  50 
MOUNT IDA AR      94  69  82  61 /  20  40  60  50 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   92  67  79  58 /  30  50  60  50 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$


922 
FXUS64 KLZK 092000
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
300 PM CDT MON AUG  9 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT
FEW SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED FROM CENTRAL INTO SOUTHWEST
ARKANSAS. WOULD EXPECT HIT AND MISS PRECIPITATION TO CONTINUE
CENTRAL/SOUTH INTO THIS EVENING...AND THEN QUIET OVERNIGHT.

ONE MORE SUMMERLIKE DAY ON STORE IN TUESDAY. SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL
BRING INCREASING MOISTURE...WITH PERHAPS A FEW THUNDERSTORMS IN THE
AFTERNOON.

NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL BRING NEXT COLD FRONT INTO THE REGION
TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY. AS HAS BEEN THE CASE LATELY...FRONT WILL
NOT HAVE MUCH TROUBLE PLOWING THROUGH ARKANSAS...WITH MUCH COOLER
AIR AND POSSIBLY RECORD LOW TEMPERATURES TO END THE WEEK.

AHEAD OF THE FRONT...SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
IN THE FORECAST WITH LOTS OF CLOUDS. MAY BE A LINGERING CHANCE OF
PRECIPITATION THURSDAY MORNING IN THE SOUTH...WITH HIGH
PRESSURE TO BRING NORTHERLY WIND AND DRY/COOL CONDITIONS
BEHIND FRONT. (46)
&&

.LONG TERM...FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY
HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE OVER THE STATE FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL ALLOW SMALL DISTURBANCES TO MOVE ACROSS
THE STATE...SO HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN FOR SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH
SUNDAY NIGHT. DRY WEATHER REAPPEARS MONDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE
BELOW NORMAL...AS THE PATTERN OF CANADIAN AIR CONTINUES. (58)
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    69  93  72  83 /  20  20  40  50
HARRISON AR       64  88  65  76 /  10  20  50  50
HOT SPRINGS AR    69  93  72  85 /  20  20  40  50
PINE BLUFF AR     70  93  73  86 /  20  20  40  50
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  64  88  65  76 /  10  20  50  50
MONTICELLO AR     69  93  72  87 /  20  20  30  50
SEARCY AR         68  92  71  82 /  20  20  40  50
MOUNT IDA AR      67  93  72  84 /  20  20  40  50
RUSSELLVILLE AR   66  92  70  80 /  20  20  40  50
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

258 
FXUS64 KLZK 091824 AAB
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
120 PM CDT MON AUG 9 2004

.DISCUSSION...
SEVERAL SHOWERS/ISOLATED STORMS HAVE POPPED UP FROM CENTRAL INTO 
SOUTHWEST ARKANSAS TO START THE AFTERNOON. A LITTLE MORE THERE THAN 
THOUGHT WOULD POP UP...SO WENT AHEAD AND MENTIONED SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
PRECIPITATION CENTRAL/SOUTHERN COUNTIES INTO THIS EVENING.

AFTER PRECIPITATION DWINDLES THIS EVENING...LOOKS MOSTLY DRY THROUGH 
TONIGHT/MUCH OF TUESDAY. FRONT WILL PUSH INTO ARKANSAS FROM THE 
NORTH TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY...WITH CHANCES FOR SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS INCREASING. COOLER AIR WILL FOLLOW FRONT LATE IN THE 
WEEK TO KEEP UNUSUAL SUMMER PATTERN GOING. (46) 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

AFTERNOON...WITH LOTS OF SUNSHINE LATE THIS MORNING IN 
NORTHERN/CENTRAL ARKANSAS. MORE CLOUDS IN THE SOUTH...SO REDUCED 
AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES THERE A BIT. MAY BE SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS 
THIS AFTERNOON AT BEST...AND CHOSE NOT TO MENTION IN THE FORECAST. 

LOOKS MOSTLY DRY THROUGH TONIGHT/MUCH OF TUESDAY. FRONT WILL PUSH 
INTO ARKANSAS FROM THE NORTH TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY...WITH A CHANCE 
OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. COOLER AIR WILL FOLLOW FRONT LATE IN



641 
FXUS64 KLZK 090803
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
400 AM CDT MON AUG 9 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT
CONDITIONS WILL FEEL MORE LIKE SUMMER TODAY...AS RIDGE HEADS TO THE 
EAST...AND INFLUX OF WARMER AIR COMES INTO THE AREA. MESOSCALE 
BOUNDARY CURRENTLY IN THE VICINITY OF AR/MO BORDER...WITH SOME LIGHT 
RETURNS SHOWING UP ON RADAR. 00Z SOUNDING DATA STILL SHOWS DRY AIR 
ABUNDANT FROM THE SURFACE TO AROUND 850 MB...AND ONLY CIGS AOA 060 
HAVE BEEN REPORTED AT SURFACE STATIONS THIS MORNING...SO THESE 
RETURNS LIKELY NOT HITTING THE GROUND IN MOST AREAS. 

WILL AT LEAST HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN TODAY AND TONIGHT...AS 
MESOSCALE BOUNDARY WOBBLES AROUND THE FORECAST AREA AND SEVERAL 
IMPULSES MOVE DOWN IN THE MEAN FLOW. NOT ALL THAT CONFIDENT ON 
PRECIP CHANCES...HOWEVER. 

BETTER CHANCES OF PRECIP WILL COME ON TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...
AS SURFACE FRONT WITH A LITTLE MORE OOMPH MOVES DOWN FROM THE 
PLAINS. SHORT RANGE MODELS ARE DIFFERING JUST A BIT ON STRENGTH OF 
THE SYSTEM. GFS NOW TAKES PRINCIPLE MOISTURE AND UPPER SUPPORT 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE SYSTEM TO THE NORTH OF THE AREA...WHILE THE ETA 
BRINGS IT ACROSS NORTHERN AND INTO CENTRAL ARKANSAS. ALSO...GFS IS 
PUSHING THE SYSTEM ON OUT OF THE AREA BY LATE WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. 
EURO AND CANADIAN SOLUTIONS HAVE THE SYSTEM LINGERING INTO EARLY 
THURSDAY. GFS SEEMS A BIT FAST...SO WILL LEAVE POPS IN THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 

GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE IN DECENT AGREEMENT FOR THE SHORT TERM. 
HOWEVER...WITH CLOUD COVER AROUND...NOT TO MENTION FORECASTED 
RAINFALL ON WEDNESDAY...TEMPS DO HAVE SOME BUST POTENTIAL ASSOCIATED 
WITH THEM. 
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY
DRY CONDITIONS RETURN TO THE FORECAST ON THURSDAY...AS COLD FRONT 
MOVES DOWN TOWARD THE GULF COAST. NORTHWESTERLY FLOW REGIME WILL 
REMAIN OVER THE AREA...THUS ANOTHER PERIOD OF BELOW NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES IS POSSIBLE FOR MUCH OF THE EXTENDED. THIS WILL MEAN 
LOWS IN THE MID 50S TO MID 60S...AND HIGHS RANGING FROM THE MID 70S 
TO UPPER 80S. THIS IS AUGUST...RIGHT?
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    92  69  94  71 /  20  20  20  40 
HARRISON AR       85  64  90  65 /  20  20  20  50 
HOT SPRINGS AR    94  69  95  72 /  20  20  20  40 
PINE BLUFF AR     91  70  94  71 /  20  20  20  40 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  86  64  90  65 /  20  20  20  50 
MONTICELLO AR     94  69  95  71 /  20  20  20  30 
SEARCY AR         92  68  93  69 /  20  20  20  40 
MOUNT IDA AR      93  67  95  72 /  20  20  20  40 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   93  66  94  71 /  20  20  20  40 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    92  69  94  71 /  20  20  20  40 
HARRISON AR       85  64  90  65 /  20  20  20  50 
HOT SPRINGS AR    94  69  95  72 /  20  20  20  40 
PINE BLUFF AR     91  70  94  71 /  20  20  20  40 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  86  64  90  65 /  20  20  20  50 
MONTICELLO AR     94  69  95  71 /  20  20  20  30 
SEARCY AR         92  68  93  69 /  20  20  20  40 
MOUNT IDA AR      93  67  95  72 /  20  20  20  40 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   93  66  94  71 /  20  20  20  40 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.



387 
FXUS64 KLZK 081941
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
240 PM CDT SUN AUG 8 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT
MORE CLOUDS AND SLIGHTLY HIGHER HUMIDITY VALUES NOTED OVER AR THIS 
AFTN. SFC HIGH PRES RMNS IN CONTROL BUT HAS WEAKENED SOMEWHAT OVER 
THE LAST 24 HOURS. WEAK UPPER TROF TO OUR WEST WILL SLIDE EWD TNGT 
RESULTING IN PDS OF CLOUDS.

MODELS STILL IN DECENT AGREEMENT TODAY WITH FCST TRENDS IN THE SHORT 
TERM. UPPER FLOW IS PROGGED TO BECOME MORE AMPLIFIED IN THE NEXT FEW 
DAYS...BRINGING UNSETTLED WX AS SEVERAL FRONTS AFFECT THE FA.

WELL DEFINED UPPER LOW OVER THE NRN TIER OF THE NATION THIS AFTN 
WILL CONT MOVG EWD OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS. TRAILING CDFNT WILL APCH 
NRN AR LATE MON AND MON NIGHT BEFORE STALLING OUT NEAR THE MO BRDR.
WITH MAIN UPPER SUPPORT STAYING WELL N OF AR AND LIMITED MOISTURE... 
DO NOT EXPECT MUCH PRECIP AHEAD OF FNT AND LEFT 20 POPS PER GOING 
FCST.

NEXT IN THE SERIES OF UPPER SYSTEMS DROPS SEWD INTO THE GREAT LAKES 
REGION TUE NIGHT AND WED. THIS SYSTEM WILL BE STRONGER AND TRACK 
FURTHER S THAN THE PREV ONE. SFC CDFNT ASSOCD WITH THIS FEATURE IS 
PROGGED TO ENTER NWRN AR LATE TUE NIGHT AND MOVE THRU MUCH OF THE 
STATE BY LATE WED NIGHT. MODELS CONT TO INDC DECENT LIFT/MOISTURE 
ASSOCD WITH FROPA. HAVE GONE WITH HIGH CHC CAT POPS FOR WED INTO WED 
NIGHT FOR THE FA. TIMING IS STILL SOME CONCERN TO JUSTIFY ANY HIGHER 
THAN CHC CAT POPS AT THIS POINT.

TEMPS WILL BE A TOUGH CALL THROUGHOUT THE SHORT TERM. EXPECT ONE 
MORE COOL NIGHT OVER WRN AND NRN AR WHERE DRY AIRMASS STILL PERSISTS 
BUT CLOUDS COULD HAVE SOME EFFECT. MOS TEMPS LOOK GOOD FOR MON AND 
MON NGT. WITH FIRST CDFNT NOT EXPECTED TO MOVE VERY FAR INTO AR 
TUE...RAISED MAX TEMPS A FEW DEGREES IN LINE WITH A NGM/ETA MOS 
BLEND. BASED ON TIMING OF SECOND FNT WED...HAVE GONE WITH HIGHS IN 
THE 70S N AND 80S CNTRL AND S. POTENTIAL FOR TEMP BUST LOOMS FOR WED 
IF TIMING OF FNT CHGS. &&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE IN AFTER FRONTAL PASSAGE...BRINGING 
DRY AND COOL CONDITIONS. NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT MAY BRING DISTURBANCES 
INTO THE AREA...HOWEVER...WILL WAIT FOR LATER MODEL RUNS TO SEE 
CONSISTENCY.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$



268 
FXUS64 KLZK 080745
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
245 AM CDT SUN AUG  8 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT
RATHER PLEASANT MORNING OVER THE FA...AS NERLY FLOW HAS KEPT 
DEWPOINTS DOWN IN THE MID 50S TO LOWER 60S. SOME CIRRUS BLOWFF FROM 
SHORTWAVE OVER WEST TEXAS IS AFFECTING WRN AND PTNS OF CNTRL 
AR...BUT CONDS HAVE GENERALLY BEEN CLR. 

NEXT SEVERAL DAYS WILL BRING MODERATING TEMPS...AS SFC RDG OVER MID 
MS/OH VLY BEGINS TO PROGRESS EWRD...AND RETURN FLOW SETS UP. 
REMNANTS OF SFC BOUNDARY CURRENTLY INVOF GULF COAST WILL BACK NORTH 
ON MONDAY...WITH A COLD FRONT MOVING IN FROM THE NORTHWEST. AT THIS 
TIME...MOISTURE AND UPPER SUPPORT ASSOCIATED WITH THE SYSTEM APPEAR 
TO BE MARGINAL. WILL AT LEAST LEAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE 
FORECAST. 

THIS SYSTEM WILL MOVE THROUGH AND LIKELY WASH OUT SOUTH OF THE STATE 
BY TUESDAY. H5 FLOW WILL BE NORTHWESTERLY...AND WILL PUSH ANOTHER 
COLD FRONT INTO THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY. UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE 
THROUGH AS WELL. THIS SYSTEM WILL BE STRONGER THAN THE PREVIOUS 
SYSTEM.

AT THIS TIME...HAVE LEFT POPS AT CHANCE CATEGORY. HOWEVER...GUIDANCE 
IS COMING BACK WITH LIKELY FOR THE ENTIRE AREA. WILL LET DAY SHIFT 
EVALUATE THE SITUATION...AND DECIDE IF HIGHER POPS ARE NEEDED. LOOKS 
AS THOUGH MAJORITY OF MOISTURE WILL BE POST FRONTAL...WITH BEST 
UPPER SUPPORT BEHIND THE SYSTEM AS WELL. 

THIS SYSTEM WILL DEFINITELY HAVE AN EFFECT ON TEMPERATURES. FOR 
HIGHS ON WED...HAVE GONE WITH MID 70S NORTH...TO THE MID 80S SOUTH. 
HOWEVER...THIS MIGHT BE A BIT ON THE GENEROUS SIDE. IF CLOUDS REMAIN 
BROKEN OR OVERCAST...AND PRECIPITATION BECOMES WIDESPREAD...MOST 
LOCATIONS MAY HAVE TROUBLE CLIMBING OUT OF THE 70S. 

UPPER TROUGH WILL PASS THROUGH THE AREA BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT...AS THE 
FRONT HEADS SOUTH AND EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA. COOLER AND DRIER 
AIR WILL MOVE IN BEHIND THE SYSTEM...WITH MINS POSSIBLY FALLING INTO 
THE UPPER 50S TO MID 60S ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 

GUIDANCE IS GENERALLY IN GOOD AGREEMENT FOR MUCH OF THE SHORT TERM...
SO A BLEND WAS USED. 
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL SET UP FOR MUCH OF THE EXTENDED AS H5 RIDGE 
BUILDS OVER THE WESTERN UNITED STATES...AND GENERAL TROUGHINESS IS 
NOTED OVER THE NORTHEAST. CONDITIONS SHOULD REMAIN DRY INTO EARLY 
SATURDAY...AS SURFACE RIDGE PASSES OVER THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...
UPPER LEVEL IMPULSE EXPECTED TO MOVE DOWN IN THE MEAN FLOW 
SATURDAY...SO DID INCLUDE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN FOR THE DAYTIME 
PERIOD. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    87  68  92  71 /   0   0  20  20 
HARRISON AR       83  63  87  65 /   0   0  20  20 
HOT SPRINGS AR    91  68  94  71 /   0   0  20  20 
PINE BLUFF AR     87  69  92  71 /   0   0  20  20 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  82  63  87  65 /   0   0  20  20 
MONTICELLO AR     87  70  92  72 /   0   0  20  20 
SEARCY AR         85  67  91  70 /   0   0  20  20 
MOUNT IDA AR      91  67  93  70 /   0   0  20  20 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   88  67  91  69 /   0   0  20  20 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&


711 
FXUS64 KLZK 071941
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
240 PM CDT SAT AUG 7 2004

.DISCUSSION...
SFC HIGH PRES CONTS TO BRING BLO NORMAL TEMPS AND LOW HUMIDITY 
VALUES TO AR THIS AFTN. SOME CLOUDS OVER THE FA THIS MRNG FROM DYING 
CONVECTION IN THE PLAINS HAS CONTD TO THIN OUT DURG THE AFTN HOURS.

MODELS STILL IN GOOD AGREEMENT TODAY WITH OVERALL SHORT TERM FCST 
TRENDS. LOOKS LIKE THE GFS IS THE MOST CONSISTENT AND HAVE FOLLOWED 
CLOSER TO ITS SOLUTION. WILL CONT TO SEE AN AMPLIFIED UPPER PATTERN 
OVER THE NATION THROUGH THE PD. 

FLOW ABOVE DOES TEND TO FLATTEN SOME IN THE SHORT TERM AS UPPER LOW 
CURRENTLY OVER THE NERN STATES LIFTS OUT AND ANOTHER UPPER LVL LOW 
TRACKS ACRS THE NRN TIER OF THE COUNTRY. WE WILL SEE SOME MODERATION 
IN TEMPS SUN AND MON AS SFC HIGH SHIFTS EWD AND FLOW BECOMES MORE 
S-SELY...BUT READINGS OVERALL WILL RMN BLO NORMAL.

MAIN CONCERN IN THE SHORT TERM IS IN THE MON THRU TUE TIMEFRAME. 
TAIL END OF OLD FNTL BNDRY OVER THE NRN GULF IS PROGGED TO LIFT NWD 
INTO SERN AR ON MON. GFS IS SHOWING SOME INCRS IN MOISTURE FOR THAT 
AREA MON...WITH THE ETA MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH EVEN HIGHER RH AND RAIN 
CHCS. FOR NOW WILL KEEP RAIN CHCS OUT AND SEE HOW LATER MODEL RUNS 
HANDLE THINGS.

MEANWHILE...ANOTHER CDFNT IS FCST TO MOVE INTO NWRN AR LATER MON AND 
PUSH THRU THE REST OF THE FA BY LATE TUE. SIG MOISTURE RETURN STILL 
APPEARS LIMITED SO HAVE KEPT POPS IN SLGT CHC CAT FOR NOW WITH 
FROPA. ANOTHER SHOT OF COOLER AND DRIER AIR TO FOLLOW.

BREAK IN THE RAIN CHCS WILL BE SHORT LIVED. A MORE IMPRESSIVE CDFNT 
WILL MOVE INTO AR FROM THE NW TUE NIGHT. FRONT WILL WORK SLOWLY SWD 
THRU THE FA WED AND THU AS SEVERAL UPPER LVL IMPULSES MOVE ACRS THE 
AREA. APPEARS OUR BETTER RAIN CHCS WILL BE WED AND WED NIGHT. HAVE 
CONTD WITH GOING FCST AND KEPT SCTD POPS IN FOR THIS TIME PD. 
ANOTHER PUSH OF COOLER AND DRIER AIR WILL MOVE IN TO CLOSE OUT THE 
WORK WEEK.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$



145 
FXUS64 KLZK 070754
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
252 AM CDT SAT AUG  7 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...
GFS THIS MORNING CONTINUES TO BE THE MORE CONSISTENT MODEL WITH THE 
ETA APPEARING TO PLAY CATCH UP. GFS ALSO THE STRONGER SOLUTION AND 
THE MOST AMPLIFIED AND SEEMS TO BE THE MORE REASONABLE CHOICE. 
REGARDLESS... PATTERN REMAINS ATYPICAL FOR EARLY AUGUST. THE ACTUAL 
DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE MODELS ARE NOT EXTREME BUT WILL STILL LEAN 
TOWARDS THE GFS SOLUTION.

PATTERN REMAINS HIGHLY AMPLIFIED FOR THIS TIME OF THE YEAR. FLOW 
ATTEMPTS TO FLATTEN OUT SOMEWHAT DURING THE PERIOD BUT OVERALL 
PATTERN PERSISTS. UPPER LEVEL HIGH CENTERED OVER SOUTHERN NEW 
MEXICO SLOWLY RETROGRADES TO THE WEST AS DEEP TROF OVER THE EAST 
COAST LIFTS OUT. STRONG SHORTWAVE OFF THE WASHINGTON COAST WILL MOVE 
EASTWARD ALONG THE INTERNATIONAL BORDER. WAVE CARVES OUT A BROAD 
TROF OVER THE EASTERN CONUS WHILE RIDGING REESTABLISHES ITSELF OVER 
THE WEST COAST. OVERALL PATTERN KEEPS THE AREA IN NORTHWEST FLOW 
THROUGH THE PERIOD.

ON THE SURFACE...HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE THROUGH THE WEEKEND. 
EAST TO SOUTHEAST LOW LEVEL FLOW WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES IN CHECK 
TODAY WITH DEW POINT TEMPERATURES REMAINING IN THE MID 50S TO LOWER 
60S. CONVECTIVE DEBRIS FROM ACTIVITY IN TEXAS AND SOME AFTERNOON CU 
DEVELOPMENT OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN SHOULD JUST ABOUT DO IT FOR 
CLOUDS. CENTER OF THE HIGH SHIFTS EAST SUNDAY WITH SOME MODERATION  
IN BOTH TEMPERATURES AND DEW POINTS FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY BUT GULF 
REMAINS BASICALLY CLOSED. 

MODELS MOVE ANOTHER COLD FRONT ACROSS THE AREA MONDAY AFTERNOON 
THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING. MOISTURE REMAINS LIMITED AND LIFTING IS 
NON EXISTENT. WITH DYNAMICS SORELY LACKING WILL DROP POPS DOWN TO 
SLIGHT CHANCE CATEGORY. DEEP MOISTURE REMAINS AT A PREMIUM WITH DEW 
POINTS STILL ONLY FORECAST TO CLIMB INTO THE UPPER 60S. WILL GO WITH 
A BLEND OF MAV/FWC NUMBERS THROUGH OUT THE PERIOD.
&&

LONG TERM...TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...
MODELS ARE IN REMARKABLY GOOD AGREEMENT IN THE MEDIUM RANGE AND 
CONTINUE THE AMPLIFIED PATTERN. BROAD TROF OVER THE EASTERN CONUS 
AT THE START OF THE PERIOD DEEPENS INTO A FULL LATITUDE TROF BY LATE 
FRIDAY WITH STRONG RIDGING OVER THE ROCKIES. NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT 
PREDOMINATES THROUGH OUT THE PERIOD AND ACTUALLY DEEPENS WITH TIME.

FRONT THAT MOVES THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT STALLS OUT ACROSS CENTRAL AND 
NORTHERN LOUISIANA FOR A FEW DAYS. SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW SCATTERED 
POPS SEEM WARRANTED TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY WITH THE PROXIMITY OF 
THE FRONT. MODELS MOVE A SHORTWAVE ALONG THE BOUNDARY ON WEDNESDAY 
WITH DECENT MOISTURE RETURN. WILL GO HIGHER POPS HERE. HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS BACK INTO THE AREA LATE IN THE WEEK FOR ANOTHER SHOT OF 
COOLER AND DRIER AIR. TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE TO RUN BELOW NORMAL 
WITH MODELS HINTING AT A SECONDARY PUSH OF COOL AIR NEXT WEEKEND. 
DEW POINT TEMPERATURES ALSO PROGGED TO BE UN AUGUST LIKE THIS TIME 
FRAME WITH NUMBERS COMING BACK IN THE LOW TO MID 60S. MEX NUMBERS 
LOOK REASONABLE.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    84  61  89  66 /   0   0   0  10 
HARRISON AR       81  61  87  64 /   0   0   0  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    85  61  90  66 /   0   0   0  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     84  62  89  66 /   0   0   0  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  80  60  86  62 /   0   0   0  10 
MONTICELLO AR     85  63  89  66 /   0   0   0  10 
SEARCY AR         83  60  88  65 /   0   0   0  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      85  61  90  66 /   0   0   0  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   84  59  89  66 /   0   0   0  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.



000 
FXUS64 KLZK 070754
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
252 AM CDT SAT AUG  7 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...
GFS THIS MORNING CONTINUES TO BE THE MORE CONSISTENT MODEL WITH THE 
ETA APPEARING TO PLAY CATCH UP. GFS ALSO THE STRONGER SOLUTION AND 
THE MOST AMPLIFIED AND SEEMS TO BE THE MORE REASONABLE CHOICE. 
REGARDLESS... PATTERN REMAINS ATYPICAL FOR EARLY AUGUST. THE ACTUAL 
DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE MODELS ARE NOT EXTREME BUT WILL STILL LEAN 
TOWARDS THE GFS SOLUTION.

PATTERN REMAINS HIGHLY AMPLIFIED FOR THIS TIME OF THE YEAR. FLOW 
ATTEMPTS TO FLATTEN OUT SOMEWHAT DURING THE PERIOD BUT OVERALL 
PATTERN PERSISTS. UPPER LEVEL HIGH CENTERED OVER SOUTHERN NEW 
MEXICO SLOWLY RETROGRADES TO THE WEST AS DEEP TROF OVER THE EAST 
COAST LIFTS OUT. STRONG SHORTWAVE OFF THE WASHINGTON COAST WILL MOVE 
EASTWARD ALONG THE INTERNATIONAL BORDER. WAVE CARVES OUT A BROAD 
TROF OVER THE EASTERN CONUS WHILE RIDGING REESTABLISHES ITSELF OVER 
THE WEST COAST. OVERALL PATTERN KEEPS THE AREA IN NORTHWEST FLOW 
THROUGH THE PERIOD.

ON THE SURFACE...HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE THROUGH THE WEEKEND. 
EAST TO SOUTHEAST LOW LEVEL FLOW WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES IN CHECK 
TODAY WITH DEW POINT TEMPERATURES REMAINING IN THE MID 50S TO LOWER 
60S. CONVECTIVE DEBRIS FROM ACTIVITY IN TEXAS AND SOME AFTERNOON CU 
DEVELOPMENT OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN SHOULD JUST ABOUT DO IT FOR 
CLOUDS. CENTER OF THE HIGH SHIFTS EAST SUNDAY WITH SOME MODERATION  
IN BOTH TEMPERATURES AND DEW POINTS FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY BUT GULF 
REMAINS BASICALLY CLOSED. 

MODELS MOVE ANOTHER COLD FRONT ACROSS THE AREA MONDAY AFTERNOON 
THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING. MOISTURE REMAINS LIMITED AND LIFTING IS 
NON EXISTENT. WITH DYNAMICS SORELY LACKING WILL DROP POPS DOWN TO 
SLIGHT CHANCE CATEGORY. DEEP MOISTURE REMAINS AT A PREMIUM WITH DEW 
POINTS STILL ONLY FORECAST TO CLIMB INTO THE UPPER 60S. WILL GO WITH 
A BLEND OF MAV/FWC NUMBERS THROUGH OUT THE PERIOD.
&&

LONG TERM...TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...
MODELS ARE IN REMARKABLY GOOD AGREEMENT IN THE MEDIUM RANGE AND 
CONTINUE THE AMPLIFIED PATTERN. BROAD TROF OVER THE EASTERN CONUS 
AT THE START OF THE PERIOD DEEPENS INTO A FULL LATITUDE TROF BY LATE 
FRIDAY WITH STRONG RIDGING OVER THE ROCKIES. NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT 
PREDOMINATES THROUGH OUT THE PERIOD AND ACTUALLY DEEPENS WITH TIME.

FRONT THAT MOVES THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT STALLS OUT ACROSS CENTRAL AND 
NORTHERN LOUISIANA FOR A FEW DAYS. SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW SCATTERED 
POPS SEEM WARRANTED TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY WITH THE PROXIMITY OF 
THE FRONT. MODELS MOVE A SHORTWAVE ALONG THE BOUNDARY ON WEDNESDAY 
WITH DECENT MOISTURE RETURN. WILL GO HIGHER POPS HERE. HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS BACK INTO THE AREA LATE IN THE WEEK FOR ANOTHER SHOT OF 
COOLER AND DRIER AIR. TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE TO RUN BELOW NORMAL 
WITH MODELS HINTING AT A SECONDARY PUSH OF COOL AIR NEXT WEEKEND. 
DEW POINT TEMPERATURES ALSO PROGGED TO BE UN AUGUST LIKE THIS TIME 
FRAME WITH NUMBERS COMING BACK IN THE LOW TO MID 60S. MEX NUMBERS 
LOOK REASONABLE.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    84  61  89  66 /   0   0   0  10 
HARRISON AR       81  61  87  64 /   0   0   0  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    85  61  90  66 /   0   0   0  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     84  62  89  66 /   0   0   0  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  80  60  86  62 /   0   0   0  10 
MONTICELLO AR     85  63  89  66 /   0   0   0  10 
SEARCY AR         83  60  88  65 /   0   0   0  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      85  61  90  66 /   0   0   0  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   84  59  89  66 /   0   0   0  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

316 
FXUS64 KLZK 061942
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
240 PM CDT FRI AUG 6 2004

.DISCUSSION...
NOT YOUR TYPICAL EARLY AUGUST DAY ACRS AR THIS AFTN. NELY WINDS AND 
MUCH LOWER DEWPOINTS RESULTING IN PLEASANT WX CONDS STATEWIDE. 
SLIGHTLY HIGHER DEWPOINTS NOTED E OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN ACRS ERN AND 
SRN AR...IN LINE WITH CU FIELD THAT HAS FORMED THIS AFTN.

LITTLE CHANGE EXPECTED IN THE SHORT TERM WITH THE MODELS STILL IN 
GOOD AGREEMENT. AMPLIFIED UPPER FLOW TO PERSIST OVER THE NATION WITH 
NWLY FLOW CONTG OVER THE MID-SOUTH THRU THE WEEKEND. MAIN EFFECT TO 
OUR WX THE NEXT FEW DAYS WILL BE PERIODS OF LEFTOVER CLOUDS THAT 
WILL DRIFT SEWD FROM CONVECTION IN THE WRN PLAINS.

SFC HIGH PRESSURE WILL PERSIST OVER AR THRU SAT WITH A CONTD E-SELY 
WIND FLOW. THIS WILL KEEP TEMPS ABT 5 TO 10 DEGREES BLO NORMAL OVER 
MOST OF THE FA SAT. WILL SEE FLOW BECOME MORE S-SELY BY SUN AS 
CENTER OF HIGH SHIFTS FURTHER EWD...ALLOWING SOME MODERATION IN 
TEMPS. GULF MOISTURE RMNS WELL TO THE SOUTH DURG THIS TIMEFRAME.

ANOTHER CDFNT IS PROGGED TO MOVE INTO NWRN AR MON AFTN AND MOVE THRU 
THE REST OF THE STATE BY LATE TUE. HAVE GONE WITH LOW CHC POPS WITH 
FROPA AS LOW LVL MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED.

MODELS STILL INDC THAT THE BNDRY WILL STALL OUT JUST S OF AR AND 
LINGER IN THE AREA FOR A FEW DAYS. THUS...HAVE LEFT 20-30 PERCENT 
POPS IN FOR MOST LOCATIONS DUE TO PRESENCE OF THE FRONT. HIGH PRES 
BUILDS INTO THE AREA LATER NEXT WEEK...PUSHING FRONT FURTHER SOUTH 
AND ALLOWING ANOTHER SHOT OF COOLER AND DRIER AIR TO OVERSPREAD THE 
FA.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$



580 
FXUS64 KLZK 060734
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
233 AM CDT FRI AUG  6 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...
MODELS IN VERY GOOD AGREEMENT THIS MORNING OVER THE MID SOUTH WITH 
THE SYNOPTIC SCALE FEATURES. ONLY NOTICEABLE DIFFERENCE IN THE 
MODELS IS THE GFS DROPPING A SHORTWAVE DOWN IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW IN 
THE FRIDAY NIGHT TIME PERIOD. FEATURE HAS NO MOISTURE ASSOCIATED 
WITH IT AND SHOULD HAVE NO IMPACT ON OUR SENSIBLE WEATHER. OTHERWISE 
FEEL A BLEND OF FORECAST SOLUTIONS IS IN ORDER.

LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES FRONTAL BOUNDARY ALONG THE GULF COAST 
AND FIRING UP CONVECTION OVER THE LOUISIANA COAST. DRIER AIR 
CONTINUES TO SINK SOUTHWARD ACROSS THE STATE. ISODROSOTHERM ANALYSIS 
SHOWS ROUGHLY A FIFTEEN DEGREE DEW POINT SPREAD FROM NORTH TO SOUTH. 
ALL MODEL GUIDANCE CONTINUE TO SHOW DEW POINT TEMPERATURES SLOWLY 
DROPPING INTO THE UPPER 50S TO LOWER 60S AND HOLDING STEADY THROUGH 
SUNDAY BEFORE SLOWLY STARTING TO CREEP UP AGAIN.

PATTERN OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS WILL BE ANYTHING BUT TYPICAL FOR MID 
AUGUST. UPPER LEVEL HIGH HAS SHIFTED INTO THE DESSERT SOUTHWEST...
ANCHORED ON BOTH SIDES BY UPPER LEVEL TROFS. RESULTANT PATTERN WILL 
KEEP NORTHWEST FLOW IN PLACE THROUGH THE WEEKEND. EAST COAST TROF 
LIFTS OUT SATURDAY AND UPPER LEVEL LOW CURRENTLY OFF THE WASHINGTON 
COAST MOVES INLAND. LOW WILL TRAVEL ALONG THE NORTHERN TIER OF 
STATES WITH UPPER FLOW FLATTENING OUT AND RIDGE WEAKENING IN 
RESPONSE.

ON THE SURFACE...CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE DOWN 
FROM THE NORTH KEEPING A COOLER AND DRIER AIR MASS OVER THE REGION. 
TEMPERATURES FRIDAY AND SATURDAY WILL BE BELOW NORMAL. HIGH SLIPS 
OFF TO THE EAST ON SUNDAY AND TEMPERATURES WILL BEGIN TO CLIMB BACK 
TO NEAR NORMAL AS SOUTHERLY WINDS RETURN. WITH GULF EFFECTIVELY CUT 
OFF...MOISTURE LEVELS WILL NOT BE OPPRESSIVE. WILL GO WITH A BLEND 
OF MAV/FWC NUMBERS. RECORD LOWS MAY BE A CONCERN SATURDAY MORNING 
AND WILL NEED TO BE WATCHED.

&&

.LONG TERM...MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...  
EXTENDED MODELS ALSO IN GOOD AGREEMENT THIS MORNING. GFS HAS BEEN 
THE MOST CONSISTENT MODEL OF LATE WITH OTHERS SEEMINGLY PLAYING 
CATCH UP. WILL GO WITH A BLEND OF MODELS AT THIS TIME WITH A LEAN 
TOWARDS THE GFS.

WEAK MID LEVEL TROF WILL MOVE TOWARDS THE AREA EARLY IN THE PERIOD 
WITH ASSOCIATED FRONTAL BOUNDARY APPROACHING THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF 
THE MONDAY NIGHT. FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE STATE TUESDAY. FRONT IS 
DYNAMICALLY CHALLENGED WITH GULF REMAINING EFFECTIVELY CUT OFF 
ALTHOUGH SOME RETURN FLOW IS NOTED.

CURRENT FORECAST OF LOW SCATTERED POPS SEEMS REASONABLE AND WILL BE 
LEFT ALONE. FRONT STALLS OUT SOMEWHERE IN NORTHERN LOUISIANA OR 
SOUTHERN ARKANSAS. EXACT PLACEMENT THE SUBJECT OF SOME DISCREPANCY 
SO WILL KEEP LOW SCATTERED IN THE FORECAST WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. 
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN BEHIND THE FRONT TO HELP KEEP POPS DOWN. 
TEMPERATURES IN THE EXTENDED LOOK GOOD AND WILL LEAVE THEM ALONE. 
ONLY SUPERFICIAL CHANGES NEEDED IN THIS TIME FRAME.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    84  60  86  62 /   0   0   0   0 
HARRISON AR       81  57  84  62 /   0   0   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    86  60  88  63 /   0   0   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     84  61  87  63 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  80  57  83  61 /   0   0   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     86  61  88  64 /   0   0   0   0 
SEARCY AR         82  59  85  61 /   0   0   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      86  59  88  63 /   0   0   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   84  58  86  59 /   0   0   0   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&



135 
FXUS64 KLZK 051946
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
245 PM CDT THU AUG 5 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT
DRIER AIRMASS CONTS TO WORK SWD INTO AR THIS AFTN WITH LEADING EDGE 
NOW WORKING INTO CNTRL AR. HAVE SEEN SOME ISOLD SHRA FORM OVER CNTRL 
SECTIONS THE LAST FEW HOURS IN THE MORE HUMID AIRMASS AND WITH THE 
HELP OF THE H85 FRONT. MAY LEAVE SOME SMALL POPS OVER MY SRN ZNS FOR 
EARLY TNGT...BUT WILL WAIT UNTIL ISSUANCE TIME AND RADAR TRENDS FOR 
FINAL DECISION.

MODELS STILL IN GOOD AGREEMENT TODAY WITH FCST TRENDS THRU THE SHORT 
TERM. UPPER TROF OVER THE ERN STATES WILL RESULT IN CONTD NW FLOW 
ALOFT ACRS AR THRU THE WEEKEND. COOLER AND DRIER AIRMASS WILL ALSO 
TAKE HOLD THRU SAT AS SFC HIGH PRES SETTLES OVER THE MID-SOUTH. THIS 
WILL BE A GREAT BREAK FROM THE HEAT AND HUMIDITY WE WOULD NORMALLY 
EXPECT THIS TIME OF YEAR.

UPPER FLOW BEGINS TO FLATTEN OUT SOME LATER IN THE WEEKEND AS EAST 
COAST TROF LIFTS NEWD AND ANOTHER UPPER LOW MOVES ACRS THE NRN TIER 
OF THE COUNTRY. MEANWHILE...SFC RDG WILL WEAKEN SOMEWHAT BUT STILL 
INFLUENCE OUR WX TO CLOSE OUT THE WEEKEND. PLACE OF THE RDG WILL 
ALSO KEEP THE GULF CLOSED OFF IN REGARDS TO MOISTURE RETURN. TEMPS 
WILL SLOWLY MODERATE BY SUN AND RETURN TO MORE NORMAL LVLS AS SFC 
FLOW BECOMES MORE S-SELY OVER AR.
&&

.LONG TERM...MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY
THE WEEK WILL START OUT WITH HIGH PRESSURE DEPARTING TO THE 
SOUTHEAST...WITH A WEAK COOL FRONT PUSHING THRU THE FA LATE MONDAY 
NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. DEWPOINTS WILL START OUT FAIRLY LOW 
MONDAY...ESPECIALLY FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR...AND SOUTHERLY RETURN 
FLOW WILL NOT ESTABLISH ITSELF UNTIL MONDAY. GULF MOISTURE WILL BE 
CUT OFF FROM THE SYSTEM...WITH MOST OF THE MOISTURE BEHIND THE 
FRONT. THEREFORE...EXPECT MOST OF THE PRECIP TO BE POST FRONTAL.

FRONT MOVES THRU TUESDAY AND BECOMES STATIONARY NEAR THE AR-LA 
BORDER WESTWARD ALONG THE RED RIVER VALLEY. THIS FAR OUT IN THE 
FORECAST I AM NOT OVERLY CONFIDENT ON THE EXACT PLACEMENT OF THE 
FRONT...BUT GIVEN THE OVERALL WEATHER PATTERN THIS SUMMER...WOULD 
FAVOR A FURTHER SOUTH PUSH. BUT WENT AHEAD AND LEFT SMALL PRECIP 
CHANCES IN THROUGH WEDNESDAY TO CONVEY REDUCED CONFIDENCE.

HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS OFF TO THE EAST AGAIN LATE WEDNESDAY...SETTING 
OUT MORE SOUTHERLY WINDS. STATIONARY FRONT WILL RESPOND TO THIS AND 
MOVE NORTHWARD AS A WARM FRONT. PUT SLIGHT CHANCES FOR PRECIP IN 
MAINLY FRIDAY AS FRONT LIFTS THRU FA.

AS FAR AS TEMPERATURES GO...TEMPS WILL CONT WARMING FROM THE COOL 
WEEKEND READINGS. WILL HAVE TO MONITOR TEMPS FOR TUESDAY...IF MAIN 
PRECIP IS POST FRONTAL STRATUS...EXCESSIVE CLOUD COVER MAY HOLD 
TEMPERATURES DOWN A FEW DEGREES.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

44/220

FRONT MOVES THRU TUESDAY AND BECOMES STATIONARY NEAR THE AR-LA 
BORDER WESTWARD ALONG THE RED RIVER VALLEY. THIS FAR OUT IN THE 
FORECAST I AM NOT OVERLY CONFIDENT ON THE EXACT PLACEMENT OF THE 
FRONT...BUT GIVEN THE OVERALL WEATHER PATTERN THIS SUMMER...WOULD 
FAVOR A FURTHER SOUTH PUSH. BUT WENT AHEAD AND LEFT SMALL PRECIP 
CHANCES IN THROUGH WEDNESDAY TO CONVEY REDUCED CONFIDENCE.

HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS OFF TO THE EAST AGAIN LATE WEDNESDAY...SETTING 
OUT MORE SOUTHERLY WINDS. STATIONARY FRONT WILL RESPOND TO THIS AND 
MOVE NORTHWARD AS A WARM FRONT. PUT SLIGHT CHANCES FOR PRECIP IN 
MAINLY FRIDAY AS FRONT LIFTS THRU FA.

AS FAR AS TEMPERATURES GO...TEMPS WILL CONT WARMING FROM THE COOL 
WEEKEND READINGS. WILL HAVE TO MONITOR TEMPS FOR TUESDAY...IF MAIN 
PRECIP IS POST FRONTAL STRATUS...EXCESSIVE CLOUD COVER MAY HOLD 
TEMPERATURES DOWN A FEW DEGREES.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

44/220






707 
FXUS64 KLZK 051602 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1100 AM CDT THU AUG 5 2004

.DISCUSSION...
INITIAL WIND SHIFT HAS PUSHED TO NEAR THE AR/LA BORDER ATTM. LEADING 
EDGE OF DRIER AIRMASS IS WORKING THRU NRN AR AS NOTED BY DROP IN SFC 
DEWPOINTS INTO THE MID AND UPPER 60S. HAVE SEEN WDLY SCTD SHOWERS 
FORM OVER NRN AR THIS MRNG. ACTIVITY APPEARS TO BE ALONG AND AHEAD 
OF H85 BNDRY. ADDED SLIGHT CHC POPS FOR CNTRL AND SRN AR FOR THIS 
AFTN AS THE ACTIVITY SHIFTS SWD.

MAX TEMPS A TRICKY CALL FOR THIS AFTN DEPENDING ON CLOUD COVER AND 
SPOTTY RAINFALL. BACK EDGE OF LOW CLOUDS NOW ALONG THE AR/MO BRDR 
AND MAKING STEADY PROGRESS SWD. EXPECT TEMPS TO RECOVER SOMEWHAT 
OVER NRN AR WITH MORE SUNSHINE EXPECTED EARLY THIS AFTN. TWEAKED MAX 
TEMPS ELSEWHERE BASED ON CURRENT TRENDS...AND UPDATED OTHER GRIDDED 
PARAMETERS IN THE SHORT TERM AS WELL. UPDATED PRODUCTS ALREADY SENT
AND POSTED.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&


911 
FXUS64 KLZK 050846
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
340 AM CDT THU AUG  5 2004

.DISCUSSION...
DRIER/COOLER AIR PROGRESSING INTO SOUTHERN MISSOURI EARLY THIS
MORNING...BUT NOT YET IN ARKANSAS. DEWPOINTS STILL SITTING IN
LOWER/MID 70S...WITH A FEW SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS IN SOUTHEAST
SECTIONS OF THE STATE.

ADJUSTED GRIDS TO SLOW DOWN PROGRESSION OF DRIER AIR. ALSO...
CLEARING WILL NOT TAKE PLACE AS QUICKLY TODAY...ESPECIALLY WITH
LOTS OF CIRRUS HEADING THIS WAY FROM THE PLAINS.

EVEN SO...COOL/DRY AIRMASS WILL WIN OUT...WITH TEMPERATURES
NOT AS WARM TODAY. SURFACE FRONT WILL CONTINUE PUSHING
SOUTHWARD OUT OF STATE...WITH BREEZY NORTHEAST WIND KEEPING
TEMPERATURES IN THE 80S TO NEAR 90 DEGREES THIS AFTERNOON.

FROM THERE...CLOUDS SWEPT OUT TONIGHT INTO AT LEAST THE FIRST
PART OF THE WEEKEND. SURFACE HIGH FROM CANADA WILL BRING AIRMASS
NOT OFTEN SEEN IN EARLY AUGUST...WITH PARTS OF NORTHERN ARKANSAS
IN THE 50S TONIGHT AND AGAIN FRIDAY NIGHT.

BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES IN THE FORECAST SATURDAY/SUNDAY...
WITH OPTIMUM CONDITIONS FOR OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES.

HEADING INTO NEXT WEEK...AFOREMENTIONED HIGH WILL SLIDE INTO THE
SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES. THE WIND WILL BECOME MORE
SOUTHERLY WITH TEMPERATURES/MOISTURE LEVELS SLOWLY GOING UP.
STORM SYSTEM/FRONT WILL APPROACH REGION FROM THE PLAINS
TUESDAY/WEDNESDAY...WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS. (46)
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    87  65  85  62 /  10   0   0  10
HARRISON AR       83  58  82  58 /  10   0   0  10
HOT SPRINGS AR    88  64  86  62 /  10   0   0  10
PINE BLUFF AR     88  66  86  62 /  10   0   0  10
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  82  58  82  57 /  10   0   0  10
MONTICELLO AR     89  65  87  62 /  20   0   0  10
SEARCY AR         85  62  84  60 /  10   0   0  10
MOUNT IDA AR      90  64  86  62 /  10   0   0  10
RUSSELLVILLE AR   87  62  85  60 /  10   0   0  10
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$


980 
FXUS64 KLZK 050209
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
910 PM CDT WED AUG 4 2004

LATEST SURFACE DATA INDICATES COLD FRONT ROUGHLY FROM SOUTH OF CGI 
AND POF...TO NEAR FLP...AND SOUTH OF SLG. CLUSTERS OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED ALONG AND TO THE SOUTH OF THE 
BOUNDARY...NEAR INTERSECTION OF DEVELOPING SURFACE LOW AND H5 
SHORTWAVE. TAKING A LOOK AT THE 00Z SOUNDING DATA...ONLY A VERY 
SMALL CAP AT AROUND 700 MB. UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT HAS INCREASED NORTH 
OF THE FRONT...AS EVIDENCED BY 50KT JET AT SGF. ALSO...SGF RADAR 
INDICATES SOME ELEVATED CONVECTION ATTEMPTING TO FORM BEHIND THE 
BOUNDARY.

EARLIER TONIGHT...ISOLATED STRONG CELLS FORMED OVER TWO OF OUR 
NORTHEASTERN MOST COUNTIES. ONE INCH HAIL WAS REPORTED WITH ONE CELL 
OVER EASTERN FULTON COUNTY. NOW THAT HEATING OF THE DAY HAS DIED 
OFF...STORMS NOT NEARLY AS IMPRESSIVE. 

AS FAR AS THE THREAT FOR ADDITIONAL STRONG THUNDERSTORMS 
TONIGHT...WHILE AN ISOLATED ONE IS NOT TOTALLY OUT OF THE 
QUESTION...FEEL THAT THE BEST POTENTIAL WILL BE EAST OF THE 
MISSISSIPPI RIVER...AS SURFACE LOW MOVES NORTHEAST ALONG THE FRONT 
AND INTERACTS WITH THE UPPER SYSTEM.

NOW FOR UPDATES TO THE GOING FORECAST... FOR THE MOST PART...
TEMPERATURES SHOULD HAVE NO PROBLEM FALLING TO FORECASTED MINS 
TONIGHT. THE ONLY AREA THIS MAY BE IN JEOPARDY WOULD BE THE EXTREME
SOUTHEAST...WHERE THE FRONT WILL NOT REACH UNTIL AROUND SUNRISE. 
HAVE ADJUSTED TEMPERATURES IN THIS AREA UP A DEGREE OR TWO. WILL 
ALSO LEAVE SCATTERED POPS IN AREA WIDE...WITH THE HIGHEST CHANCES IN 
THE EAST. HAVE ALSO ADJUSTED FORECASTED TEMPERATURES AND DEWPOINTS 
TO BETTER ACCOUNT FOR ONGOING SENSIBLE WEATHER TRENDS. 

UPDATE WILL BE OUT BY 930 PM. 

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE. 

$$

57






049 
FXUS64 KLZK 041932
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
230 PM CDT WED AUG 4 2004

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH LVL CLOUDS HAVE HELD AFTN TEMPS A FEW DEGREES LOWER THAN FCST. 
HOWEVER...SFC DEWPOINTS IN THE MID AND UPPER 70S ARE PRODUCING HEAT 
INDICES AROUND ADVY CRITERIA. WILL LET ADVY EXPIRE WITH THIS FCST 
ISSUANCE. 

LATEST SFC DATA SHOWS CDFNT EXTENDS FROM SWRN MO BACK INTO NWRN OK. 
BNDRY HAS BEEN MOVING A BIT SLOWER THAN PROGS INDCD BUT EXPECT IT TO 
SPEED UP THIS EVENING AND WORK INTO NWRN AR. AREA RADARS ARE QUIET 
ATTM...BUT LATEST RUC STILL SHOWING SCTD SHRA/TSRA FORMING BY THIS 
EVENING ALONG THE FNT AS UPPER SUPPORT ARRIVES AND CAP ERRODES.

MENTIONED SCTD POPS TNGT ALONG AND AHEAD OF CDFNT. LEFT SOME 
LINGERING SLIGHT CHC POPS IN FOR SERN AR THU MRNG ALONG DEPARTING 
FNT. OTHERWISE...MUCH DRIER AIR WILL GRADUALLY FILTER IN ON NWLY 
WINDS THU AFTN AND NIGHT.

MODELS STILL IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH OVERALL TRENDS IN THE LATER PDS. 
UPPER HIGH WILL CONT TO RETROGRADE WWD AND A SIG UPPER TROF WILL 
FORM OVER THE ERN PART OF THE NATION. RESULTANT NWLY FLOW ALOFT ACRS 
AR WILL PUSH LATEST CDFNT WELL S OF THE FA BY LATE IN THE WEEK. BLO 
NORMAL TEMPS AND MUCH DRIER AIR WILL MOVE IN BEHIND FROPA AND 
PERSIST INTO SAT.

SFC HIGH PRES SLIPS E OF THE FA OVER THE WEEKEND...ALLOWING RETURN 
FLOW TO SET UP AND A RETURN TO MORE NORMAL TEMPS. NWLY FLOW ALOFT 
WILL PREVAIL BUT LITTLE IN THE WAY OF UPPER ENERGY TO SUPPORT RAIN 
CHCS INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK.

THE NEXT CDFNT IS PROGGED TO AFFECT AR TUE AND WED...WHICH AGAIN IS 
A LITTLE SLOWER THAN YESTERDAY/S DATA INDCD. HAVE PLACED CHC POPS IN 
FOR DAY 6 AND 7 WITH FROPA. GOING FCST TEMP TRENDS IN THE EXTENDED 
LOOK GOOD AND NO SIG CHGS MADE.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

44






891 
FXUS64 KLZK 041620 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1120 AM CDT WED AUG 4 2004

.DISCUSSION...
EVEN WITH A LAYER OF HIGH CLOUDS OVER THE FA THIS MRNG...TEMPS HAVE 
CONTD TO WARM WELL INTO THE 80S OVER MUCH OF CNTRL AND SRN AR. AREA 
OF SHRA/TSRA THAT WAS NW OF AR EARLIER THIS MRNG...HAS WEAKENED 
CONSIDERABLY OVER THE PAST FEW HOURS AS IT WORKS INTO MORE STABLE 
AND CAPPED AIRMASS.

MEANWHILE...SFC CDFNT LOCATED OVER SERN KS/N-CNTRL OK WILL CONT 
WORKING SEWD LATER TODAY AND TNGT. CURRENT FCST HAS A GOOD HANDLE ON 
TIMING AND IT LOOKS LIKE THE 12Z MODEL RUNS ARE STILL IN AGREEMENT 
WITH TIMING OF FROPA OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS.

LOWERED MAX TEMPS A FEW DEGREES OVER NRN AR THIS AFTN WITH MORE 
CLOUDS. CURRENT MAX TEMPS OVER CNTRL AND SRN AR STILL LOOK GOOD AND 
LEFT HEAT ADVY IN PLACE. ADJUSTED HOURLY GRIDDED TEMPS TO REFLECT 
CURRENT TRENDS. UPDATED GRIDS AND ZONES ALREADY OUT.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...HEAT ADVISORY TODAY
FOR ZONES ARZ037>047-052>057-062>069.
&&

$$



570 
FXUS64 KLZK 040907
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
355 AM CDT WED AUG  4 2004

.DISCUSSION...
ONE MORE HOT DAY...AND THEN SOME RELIEF TO FOLLOW. HIGH
PRESSURE WILL BEGIN RETROGRADING TO WEST TODAY...WITH RATHER
IMPRESSIVE TROUGH DIGGING IN THE EASTERN UNITED STATES. RESULT
WILL BE STRONG NORTHERLY FLOW ALOFT WHICH WILL DRIVE A COLD FRONT
THROUGH ARKANSAS LATER THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT.

AHEAD OF THE FRONT...WILL BE THE WARMEST DAY OF THE WEEK TODAY WITH
TEMPERATURES IN THE 90S. SOME DRY AIR WILL MIX DOWN TODAY...WITH A
TENDENCY TO LOWER DEWPOINTS A BIT. HOWEVER...WHEN ALL IS SAID AND
DONE...DEWPOINTS WILL END UP IN THE LOWER/MID 70S. THIS
WILL PRODUCE HEAT INDEX VALUES FROM 105 TO 110 DEGREES IN
CENTRAL/SOUTHERN ARKANSAS. GIVEN THIS...WILL GO WITH HEAT
ADVISORY TODAY FROM WALDRON TO LITTLE ROCK AND BRINKLEY SOUTHWARD.

AHEAD OF FRONT...MOISTURE WILL BE SHALLOW AND MOSTLY NEAR THE
SURFACE. SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD REMAIN ISOLATED TO
SCATTERED THROUGH TONIGHT.

MAY BE SOME LINGERING PRECIPITATION TO START THURSDAY IN SOUTHERN
ARKANSAS. OTHERWISE...A BREEZY NORTHEAST WIND WILL BE FOUND BEHIND
FRONT...WHICH WILL USHER IN COOLER AIR NOT TYPICALLY FELT IN
EARLY AUGUST.

BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES/DRY CONDITIONS WILL HOLD THROUGH MUCH OF
THE WEEKEND. A COUPLE OF WEAK IMPULSES WITH RIDE NORTHWEST FLOW
INTO ARKANSAS...BUT WENT WITH A FEW MORE CLOUDS AND DID NOT
MENTION PRECIPITATION SATURDAY/SUNDAY AT THIS TIME.

NEW STORM SYSTEM/FRONT WILL APPROACH THE REGION FROM THE NORTHWEST
EARLY NEXT WEEK...WITH SCATTERED SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS IN THE
FORECAST.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    97  71  86  62 /  20  30  10   0
HARRISON AR       92  63  82  60 /  30  30   0   0
HOT SPRINGS AR    98  72  87  64 /  20  20  10   0
PINE BLUFF AR     98  73  87  64 /  10  30  10   0
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  92  62  81  59 /  30  30   0   0
MONTICELLO AR     98  74  88  65 /  10  30  20   0
SEARCY AR         96  69  84  61 /  30  30   0   0
MOUNT IDA AR      98  71  87  64 /  20  20  10   0
RUSSELLVILLE AR   97  68  85  61 /  20  20   0   0
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...HEAT ADVISORY TODAY
FOR ZONES ARZ037>047-052>057-062>069.
&&

$$

PINE BLUFF AR     98  73  87  64 /  10  30  10   0
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  92  62  81  59 /  30  30   0   0
MONTICELLO AR     98  74  88  65 /  10  30  20   0
SEARCY AR         96  69  84  61 /  30  30   0   0
MOUNT IDA AR      98  71  87  64 /  20  20  10   0
RUSSELLVILLE AR   97  68  85  61 /  20  20   0   0
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...HEAT ADVISORY TODAY
FOR ZONES ARZ037>047-052>057-062>069.



295 
FXUS64 KLZK 031950
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
250 PM CDT TUE AUG 3 2004

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRES AT THE SFC AND ALOFT RESULTING IN ANOTHER HOT DAY ACRS AR 
THIS AFTN. FORMATION OF CU FIELD HAS KEPT MID AFTN READINGS IN THE 
UPPER 80S TO MID 90S. HEAT INDICES BLO ADVISORY CRITERIA IN MOST 
AREAS WITH JUST A FEW LOCATIONS ARND 105.

LOOKS LIKE WE WILL GET ONE MORE HOT AND HUMID DAY IN WED BEFORE 
ANOTHER CDFNT SWEEPS THRU THE FA WED NIGHT AND EARLY THU. MODELS 
STILL IN GOOD AGREEMENT TODAY WITH OVERALL FCST TRENDS. 

UPPER RDG OVER THE SRN PLAINS WILL SHIFT SLOWLY WWD OVER THE NEXT 24 
HOURS. MEANWHILE...UPPER LVL STORM SYSTEM MOVES ACRS THE NRN PLAINS 
AND INTO THE LOWER GREAT LAKES REGION BY MIDWEEK. AS UPPER STORM SYS 
HEADS INTO THE NERN STATES ON THU...RATHER IMPRESSIVE UPPER TROF 
DVLPS OVER THE ERN HALF OF THE NATION AND ALLOW CDFNT TO MOVE INTO 
THE GULF. END RESULT FOR AR WILL BE COOLER AND DRIER AIR FOR LATE IN 
THE WEEK AND INTO THE EARLY PART OF THE WEEKEND.

EXPECT A GOOD WARMUP AHEAD OF CDFNT ON WED OVER MUCH OF THE AREA. 
H85 TEMPS ARE PROGGED TO WARM INTO THE 21C TO 23C RANGE BY WED 
AFTN...GIVING TEMPS IN THE MID AND UPPER 90S AT MOST LOCATIONS. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS STILL INDCG SOME DRIER AIR MIXING DOWN TO THE SFC 
DURG WED AFTN...WITH RESULTANT HEAT INDICES BRIEFLY REACHING ADVY 
CRITERIA. WILL NOT ISSUE A HEAT ADVY ATTM BASED ON THIS AND 
EXPECTANT AFTN CLOUD COVER.

LACK OF SIG MOISTURE WILL KEEP RAIN CHCS ALONG CDFNT LOW LATE WED 
INTO EARLY THU. HAVE CONTD ALONG WITH CURRENT FCST AND GONE WITH 
20-30 PERCENT POPS WITH FROPA.

RETURN FLOW BEGINS TO SET UP LATER IN THE WEEKEND AS SFC HIGH SHIFTS 
E OF AR AND WE COULD SEE SOME ISOLD SHRA/TSRA FORM. ANOTHER FNT IS 
PROGGED TO DROP SEWD TOWARD AR MON NIGHT AND TUE WITH A LITTLE 
BETTER SHOT OF RAINFALL. 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

44


061 
FXUS64 KLZK 030832
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
325 AM CDT TUE AUG  3 2004

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE TO BRING HOT/DRY WEATHER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS.
MODELS RUNNING A LITTLE HOT LATELY...AND MAY BE A TOUCH WARM TODAY.
ALSO...LOTS OF DRY AIR ALOFT...AND WILL LIKELY SEE SOME OF THIS MIX
DOWN ESPECIALLY IN HIGHER TERRAIN OF NORTHERN/WESTERN ARKANSAS.
DEWPOINTS WILL DROP INTO THE UPPER 60S THIS AFTERNOON IN THESE
AREAS...WITH HEAT INDEICES REMAINING BELOW 105 DEGREES. IN
SOUTH/EAST...DEWPOINTS IN LOWER 70S WILL NET HEAT INDICES AROUND
105 DEGREES GIVE OR TAKE A COUPLE OF DEGREES. WHILE THIS IS
PUSHING HEAT ADVISORY CRITERIA...NOT QUITE ENOUGH TO ISSUE
ADVISORY TODAY.

WEDNESDAY A DIFFERENT STORY AHEAD OF APPROACHING FRONT FROM
NORTH. TEMPERATURES/DEWPOINTS A LITTLE HIGHER...AND HEAT INDICES
LIKELY BETWEEN 105 AND 110 DEGREES IN CENTRAL/SOUTHERN ARKANSAS
DURING THE AFTERNOON. WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED TO HAVE HEAT ADVISORY
POSTED ON WEDNESDAY.

AFOREMENTIONED FRONT NOT HAVING ANY PROBLEMS PUSHING THROUGH
REGION LATE WEDNESDAY/EARLY THURSDAY ACCORDING TO MODELS. HIGH
PRESSURE RETROGRADING TO WEST...WITH WIND FLOW ALOFT DRIVING FRONT
SOUTHWARD. HARD TO BUY EFFORTLESS FRONTAL PASSAGE THIS TIME OF
YEAR...BUT TRACK RECORD WOULD SUPPORT SUCH A SCENARIO THIS SUMMER.
SO...WITH FRONT GOING BY...LOOKS COOLER/DRIER TO END THE WEEK.

AS FAR AS PRECIPITATION...THE FRONT WILL NOT BRING MUCH. MOISTURE
PRETTY MUCH SHALLOW AND IN THE LOWER LEVELS OF THE ATMOSPHERE.
MENTIONED ISOLATED/SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AHEAD OF
FRONT...AND THAT IS ABOUT IT.

PRECIPITATION CHANCES LOOK A LITTLE BETTER LATE IN THE WEEKEND
AND EARLY NEXT WEEK. COOL NORTHEAST WIND WILL GRADUALLY BECOME
MORE SOUTHERLY SUNDAY/MONDAY AHEAD OF A STORM SYSTEM/FRONT
IN THE PLAINS. (46)
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    95  74  97  71 /   0   0  10  20
HARRISON AR       94  72  94  67 /   0   0  20  20
HOT SPRINGS AR    96  74  98  71 /   0   0  10  20
PINE BLUFF AR     96  74  98  71 /   0   0   0  20
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  94  71  93  67 /   0   0  20  20
MONTICELLO AR     96  73  98  72 /   0   0   0  20
SEARCY AR         95  73  96  70 /   0   0  10  20
MOUNT IDA AR      97  73  98  71 /   0   0  10  20
RUSSELLVILLE AR   96  73  97  70 /   0   0  10  20
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&


725 
FXUS64 KLZK 021951
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
250 PM CDT MON AUG 2 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT
HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES OVER THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON. SUNNY SKIES 
WERE OVER MOST OF THE AREA. A FEW CLOUDS WERE SEEN ON SATELLITE 
IMAGES MOVING INTO NORTHEAST ARKANSAS DUE TO A PERSISTENT MCS THAT 
REFUSES TO DISSIPATE. WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS IN FOR 
THE NORTHEAST SECTION THIS EVENING. 

MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH KEEPING HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE 
AREA THROUGH TUESDAY. A COLD FRONT IN THE MIDWEST WILL APPROACH THE 
NORTH LATE WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. WILL BRING A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE NORTH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON...AND 
CENTRAL AND SOUTH WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THE FRONT SHOULD MOVE THROUGH THE 
STATE BY FRIDAY. WILL KEEP FRIDAY DRY AS HIGH PRESSURE MOVES BACK 
INTO THE AREA. CROSS SECTIONS SHOW VERY DRY AIR ALOFT MOVING INTO 
THE AREA FRIDAY.   
&&

.LONG TERM...SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY
GFS AND CANADIAN MODELS CONSISTENT WITH HIGH PRESSURE MOVING IN FOR 
THE WEEKEND. GIVEN RECENT EVENTS...HAVE TROUBLE BELIEVING FRONT WILL 
PUSH THRU MY CWA. GFS IS ADVERTISING DRY AIR TO MOVE IN BEHIND THE 
FRONT...WHILE THE FRONT ITSELF STALLS ACROSS NORTHERN LA INTO 
EASTERN OK. WHILE THE DRY AIR MAY BE OVERDONE A BIT...WONT ARGUE 
WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES FOR SATURDAY. WILL SEE AFTERNOON CU LIKELY 
DEVELOP. GFS IS HINTING AT A SHORTWAVE RIDING THE RIDGE INTO THE 
CWFA SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY MORNING. PUT SMALL PRECIP CHANCES IN 
TO COINCIDE WITH THE SHORT WAVE PASSAGE. OTHERWISE...DIURNAL CLOUDS 
SUNDAY AND MONDAY AFTERNOONS. FOR TEMPS...THINKING THAT WITH DRY 
COOL AIR MOVING IN SATURDAY...THINKING THAT HIGH TEMPS WILL BE A BIT 
BELOW GUIDANCE. DONT WANT TO GO ABNORMALLY COOL YET...BUT WILL HAVE 
TO MONITOR AS DAY APPROACHES. HIGH SHIFTS EAST LATE SUN/EARLY MON 
WITH SOUTHERLY FLOW RETURNING...WHICH WILL PUT AN END TO THE COOL 
WEATHER.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    71  96  74  97 /   0   0   0  10 
HARRISON AR       69  93  72  94 /  10   0   0  20 
HOT SPRINGS AR    72  97  74  97 /   0   0   0  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     71  97  74  97 /   0   0   0  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  69  93  72  94 /  10   0   0  20 
MONTICELLO AR     72  97  73  98 /   0   0   0   0 
SEARCY AR         70  95  73  97 /   0   0   0  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      71  97  74  97 /   0   0   0  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   70  95  72  96 /   0   0   0  20 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

556 
FXUS64 KLZK 020923
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
415 AM CDT MON AUG  2 2004

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE SURFACE/ALOFT WILL BRING HOT WEATHER...ESPECIALLY
HEADING INTO TUESDAY/WEDNESDAY. NOT MANY CLOUDS...AND DEWPOINTS
IN THE LOWER 70S WILL NET HEAT INDICES FROM 105 TO 110 DEGREES
CENTRAL/SOUTHERN ARKANSAS BOTH DAYS...AND HEAT ADVISORY LIKELY
TO BE ISSUED. DEWPOINTS NOT QUITE HIGH ENOUGH/TEMPERATURES NOT
QUITE WARM ENOUGH TO WARRANT HEAT ADVISORY TODAY.

HIGH WILL RETROGRADE TOWARD SOUTHWEST UNITED STATES FROM MID TO
LATE WEEK. THIS WILL ALLOW A COLD FRONT TO PUSH INTO THE REGION FROM
THE NORTH LATE WEDNESDAY/THURSDAY. LATEST DATA INDICATING THAT
FRONT WILL MAKE IT THROUGH STATE BEFORE STALLING JUST TO THE
SOUTHWEST. SHOULD THIS HAPPEN...SLIGHTLY COOLER WEATHER WILL BE
NOTED BY THIS WEEKEND. GIVEN TRACK RECORD LATELY...WOULD THINK
THAT EXPECTED SCENARIO WILL PAN OUT.

MOISTURE SURROUNDING FRONT NOT ALL THAT DEEP...SO WOULD THINK
THAT ONLY ISOLATED/SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP AS FRONT
PUSHES THROUGH. HAVE INDICATED AS SUCH IN THE FORECAST. (46)
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    95  71  96  74 /   0   0   0   0
HARRISON AR       92  69  93  72 /   0   0   0   0
HOT SPRINGS AR    96  72  97  74 /   0   0   0   0
PINE BLUFF AR     95  71  97  74 /   0   0   0   0
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  92  69  93  72 /   0   0   0   0
MONTICELLO AR     96  72  97  73 /   0   0   0   0
SEARCY AR         94  70  95  73 /   0   0   0   0
MOUNT IDA AR      96  71  97  74 /   0   0   0   0
RUSSELLVILLE AR   95  70  95  72 /   0   0   0   0
&&

NOTED BY THIS WEEKEND. GIVEN TRACK RECORD LATELY...WOULD THINK
THAT EXPECTED SCENARIO WILL PAN OUT.

MOISTURE SURROUNDING FRONT NOT ALL THAT DEEP...SO WOULD THINK
THAT ONLY ISOLATED/SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP AS FRONT
PUSHES THROUGH. HAVE INDICATED AS SUCH IN THE FORECAST. (46)
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    95  71  96  74 /   0   0   0   0
HARRISON AR       92  69  93  72 /   0   0   0   0
HOT SPRINGS AR    96  72  97  74 /   0   0   0   0
PINE BLUFF AR     95  71  97  74 /   0   0   0   0
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  92  69  93  72 /   0   0   0   0
MONTICELLO AR     96  72  97  73 /   0   0   0   0
SEARCY AR         94  70  95  73 /   0   0   0   0
MOUNT IDA AR      96  71  97  74 /   0   0   0   0
RUSSELLVILLE AR   95  70  95  72 /   0   0   0   0
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
855 PM CDT SUN AUG 1 2004

.DISCUSSION...
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES PREVAIL THIS EVENING...WITH LIGHT WINDS ACROSS 
THE STATE. THUNDERSTORMS MOVING SOUTHEAST IN CENTRAL MISSOURI APPEAR 
TO BE WEAKENING...AND WILL NOT AFFECT THE AREA...EXCEPT FOR A FEW 
CLOUDS IN THE NORTH. MADE A FEW MINOR CHANGES TO SKY AND TEMP GRIDS 
TO ACCOUNT FOR CURRENT CONDITIONS...BUT OTHERWISE FORECAST IN GOOD 
SHAPE.

190 
FXUS64 KLZK 011949
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
249 PM CDT SUN AUG 1 2004

.DISCUSSION...
FAIR WEATHER CUMULUS ARE NOTED ON SATELLITE IMAGERY THIS AFTERNOON 
ACROSS THE AREA. CLOUDS WILL DISSIPATE AT SUNSET WITH HIGH PRESSURE 
OVER THE AREA. 

HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE CENTER PART OF THE COUNTRY WILL CONTINUE TO 
BRING WARM HUMID AIR TO THE AREA FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS. CROSS 
SECTIONS SHOW PLENTY OF DRY AIR IN THE UPPER LEVELS THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT. A COLD FRONT IN THE MIDWEST 
WILL MAKE ITS WAY TOWARD THE AREA THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. AS THE 
CENTER OF THE HIGH SLIDES TO THE WEST A BIT ON WEDNESDAY...WILL 
BRING PRECP CHANCES BACK INTO THE NORTH. THE FRONT WILL APPROACH 
FROM THE NORTHEAST AND WILL BE SLOW TO MOVE THROUGH THE AREA. THE 
FRONT WILL STILL BE ACROSS THE AREA FOR MUCH OF NEXT WEEKEND...AND 
ALLOW SMALL CHANCES OF PRECIP TO CONTINUE. 

THE MIDDLE PART OF THE WEEK WILL BE THE HOTTEST WITH THE LARGE RIDGE 
OVER THE AREA. HEAT INDICES LOOK TO BE BORDERLINE TO ADVISORY 
CRITERIA IN THE SOUTH MONDAY BUT WILL HOLD OFF ON ANY ADVISORY AT 
THIS TIME. WILL LIKELY MEET ADVISORY CRITERIA DURING THE MIDDLE PART 
OF THE WEEK HOWEVER.  
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    72  96  73  96 /   0   0  10  10 
HARRISON AR       66  92  71  93 /   0   0  10  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    72  95  73  97 /   0   0  10  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     73  96  73  97 /  10   0  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  66  92  71  93 /   0   0  10  10 
MONTICELLO AR     74  97  74  97 /  10   0  10  10 
SEARCY AR         70  95  72  95 /   0   0  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      71  95  74  97 /   0   0  10  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   69  95  73  95 /   0   0  10  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

896 
FXUS64 KLZK 010848
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
345 AM CDT SUN AUG  1 2004

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE SLOWLY BUILDING OVER THE REGION FROM THE
PLAINS. IN GENERAL...HIGH WILL PROVIDE MORE SUMMERLIKE
CONDITIONS...WITH WARMER TEMPERATURES AND ONLY ISOLATED
PRECIPITATION IN THE COMING DAYS.

ANY PRECIPITATION TODAY WILL BE CONFINED TO SOUTHEAST
CORNER OF ARKANSAS NEAR OLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY. FRONT
PRETTY MUCH STALLED AND WILL EVENTUALLY FALL APART...
BUT KEPT SMALL CHANCES OF SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS
SOUTHEAST OF LITTLE ROCK.

STILL SOME RESIDUAL LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ACROSS REGION...
AND THIS YIELDING CLOUDS ACROSS CENTRAL/SOUTHERN
ARKANSAS THIS MORNING. LOW CLOUDS ALSO FORMING IN THE
WEST IN AREAS WHERE PATCHY DENSE FOG DEVELOPING. GIVEN
THIS...WILL GO WITH SOME FOG THIS MORNING AND PARTLY
CLOUDY SKY TODAY. WILL DO THE SAME ON MONDAY.

AS WEEK PROGRESSES...LOOKS LIKE HIGH WILL RETROGRADE
A LITTLE TOWARD SOUTHWEST UNITED STATES. WIND FLOW ALOFT
WILL DRIVE FRONT TOWARD ARKANSAS FROM THE NORTH. THIS
WILL BRING SMALL CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION FROM MID TO
LATE WEEK. (46)
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    93  72  95  73 /  10   0  10  10
HARRISON AR       89  68  92  71 /   0   0  10  10
HOT SPRINGS AR    93  72  95  73 /  10   0  10  10
PINE BLUFF AR     93  73  95  73 /  10  10  10  10
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  89  68  92  71 /   0   0  10  10
MONTICELLO AR     94  74  96  74 /  20  10  10  10
SEARCY AR         93  70  95  72 /  10   0  10  10
MOUNT IDA AR      93  71  95  74 /  10   0  10  10

MANAGED TO WORK INTO NRN AR AND EXPECT LOWEST TEMPS IN THOSE AREAS 
TNGT. REST OF FCST IN GOOD SHAPE AND NO OTHER CHGS MADE. UPDATED 
PRODUCTS ALREADY SENT AND POSTED TO THE WEB.

752 
FXUS64 KLZK 311957
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
257 PM CDT SAT JUL 31 2004

.DISCUSSION...
SATELLITE IMAGES AND SURFACE OBS SHOW CLEAR SKIES IN THE NORTH AND 
MORE CLOUDS TOWARD THE SOUTHERN SECTIONS. SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
DEVELOPED ALONG THE LOUISIANA BORDER. JUST A FEW OF THE SHOWERS HAVE 
MADE IT INTO THE LZK CWFA HOWEVER. 

HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO MOVE IN FROM THE WEST. CROSS SECTIONS 
SHOW VERY DRY AIR IN THE UPPER LEVELS ESPECIALLY AFTER TONIGHT. THE 
ONLY CHANCES OF PRECIPITATION TONIGHT WILL BE IN THE SOUTHEAST NEAR 
THE COLD FRONT AND WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE THERE THROUGH THIS 
EVENING. THE COLD FRONT HAS STALLED NEAR THE LOUISIANA BORDER BUT 
SHOULD BEGIN MOVING SOUTH AGAIN TONIGHT AS HIGH PRESSURE WORKS INTO 
THE AREA. MOST AREAS WILL BE DRY ON SUNDAY. WILL INCLUDE A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF PRECIP ACROSS THE FAR SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE CWFA. 

HIGH PRESSURE AND DRY AIR WILL KEEP PRECIP CHANCES NEAR ZERO FOR 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY. WILL BRING SLIGHT CHANCES BACK INTO THE 
NORTHEAST WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AS A BACKDOOR COLD FRONT MOVES INTO 
NORTHEAST ARKANSAS FROM THE GREAT LAKES. THIS WILL WEAKEN THE RIDGE 
AND BRING PRECIP CHANCES BACK INTO THE AREA WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY.
TEMPERATURES WILL BE NORMAL TO ABOVE NORMAL THIS WEEK.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    71  93  72  95 /  10  10  10  10 
HARRISON AR       66  89  68  92 /  10   0   0  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    71  93  72  95 /  10  10  10  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     71  93  73  95 /  20  10  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  66  89  68  92 /  10   0   0  10 
MONTICELLO AR     72  94  74  96 /  20  10  10  10 
SEARCY AR         70  93  70  95 /  10  10  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      71  93  71  95 /  10  10  10  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   70  93  69  95 /  10   0  10  10

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

204 
FXUS64 KLZK 311043
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
515 AM CDT SAT JUL 31 2004

A FEW LOW CLOUDS HAVE DEVELOPED ACROSS SOME OF THE NORTHERN COUNTIES
SO HAVE UPDATED TO ACCOUNT FOR THESE CLOUDS. 
&&

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION
310 AM CDT SAT JUL 31 2004

.DISCUSSION...
PATCHY FOG CONTINUES TO FORM WITH DENSE FOG OVER AREAS TO MY NORTH 
AND WEST. CONDITIONS WILL LIKELY IMPROVE BY MID MORNING.

THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WHICH BROUGHT SIGNIFICANT RAINFALL TO MOST OF 
ARKANSAS YESTERDAY WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE SLOWLY ACROSS ARKANSAS 
TODAY. THE MEAN RH CONTINUES SOMEWHAT HIGHER OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN 
ONE THIRD OF ARKANSAS AND THIS MAY BE SUFFICIENT FOR SMALL POPS 
TODAY AND EARLY TONIGHT OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN SECTIONS OF MY CWA. 
THE LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS REVEALS A BOUNDARY FROM NEAR KJBR TO 
NEAR KTXK WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE MID 70S ALONG AND TO THE SOUTHEAST 
OF THIS LINE. RELATIVELY COOLER AND DRIER AIR IS FOUND IN THE 
NORTHWESTERN SECTIONS. THIS DRIER AIR WILL EVENTUALLY SPREAD TO THE 
REST OF STATE. A WARMING TREND BACK TO A MORE TYPICAL LATE JULY WILL 
COMMENCE THIS AFTERNOON. AND A BLUE MOON WILL BE HAD LATER 
TODAY.     
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    91  71  93  72 /  10  10  10  10 
HARRISON AR       88  66  89  68 /  10  10  10  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    91  71  93  72 /  10  10  10  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     91  71  93  73 /  20  20  20  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  88  66  89  68 /  10  10  10  10 
MONTICELLO AR     91  72  94  74 /  20  20  20  10 
SEARCY AR         90  70  93  70 /  10  10  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      91  71  93  71 /  10  10  10  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   90  70  93  69 /  10  10  10  10

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

310 AM CDT SAT JUL 31 2004

.DISCUSSION...
PATCHY FOG CONTINUES TO FORM WITH DENSE FOG OVER AREAS TO MY NORTH 
AND WEST. CONDITIONS WILL LIKELY IMPROVE BY MID MORNING.

THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH WHICH BROUGHT SIGNIFICANT RAINFALL TO MOST OF 
ARKANSAS YESTERDAY WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE SLOWLY ACROSS ARKANSAS 
TODAY. THE MEAN RH CONTINUES SOMEWHAT HIGHER OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN 
ONE THIRD OF ARKANSAS AND THIS MAY BE SUFFICIENT FOR SMALL POPS 
TODAY AND EARLY TONIGHT OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN SECTIONS OF MY CWA. 
THE LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS REVEALS A BOUNDARY FROM NEAR KJBR TO 
NEAR KTXK WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE MID 70S ALONG AND TO THE SOUTHEAST 
OF THIS LINE. RELATIVELY COOLER AND DRIER AIR IS FOUND IN THE 
NORTHWESTERN SECTIONS. THIS DRIER AIR WILL EVENTUALLY SPREAD TO THE 
REST OF STATE. A WARMING TREND BACK TO A MORE TYPICAL LATE JULY WILL 
COMMENCE THIS AFTERNOON. AND A BLUE MOON WILL BE HAD LATER 
TODAY.     
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    91  71  93  72 /  10  10  10  10 
HARRISON AR       88  66  89  68 /  10  10  10  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    91  71  93  72 /  10  10  10  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     91  71  93  73 /  20  20  20  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  88  66  89  68 /  10  10  10  10 
MONTICELLO AR     91  72  94  74 /  20  20  20  10 
SEARCY AR         90  70  93  70 /  10  10  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      91  71  93  71 /  10  10  10  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   90  70  93  69 /  10  10  10  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

389 
FXUS64 KLZK 302001
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
301 PM CDT FRI JUL 30 2004

.DISCUSSION...
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MOVED THROUGH MAINLY CENTRAL AND EASTERN 
SECTIONS OF THE CWFA TODAY. KLZK RADAR CONTINUES TO SHOW SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS THE SOUTH AND EAST SECTIONS OF THE AREA. 
STRONGEST STORMS ARE IN THE SOUTH AND EAST WHERE MAIN INSTABILITY 
AXIS IS LOCATED. LI/S IN THIS AREA ARE AS LOW AS -8. LOW PRESSURE IS 
LOCATED OVER THE AREA AND WILL BE SLOW TO MOVE EAST WITH THE 
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT STRETCHING THROUGH CENTRAL ARKANSAS. WILL KEEP 
CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN FOR THE MAINLY THE SOUTHEAST 
HALF OF THE AREA THROUGH MIDNIGHT THEN WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCES IN 
THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF THE AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT. SATELLITE IMAGES 
SHOW LOW CLOUD COVER EXTENDING INTO NORTHEAST OKLAHOMA AND WILL 
ALSO BE SLOW TO EXIT ARKANSAS. WILL INCLUDE PATCHY FOG IN ALL AREAS 
TONIGHT WITH MOIST GROUND IN MANY LOCATIONS.  

THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH REMAINS OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND. 
WILL KEEP SMALL CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN THE 
SOUTHEAST HALF THROUGH SATURDAY. HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE WEST SLOWLY 
BUILDS INTO WEST ARKANSAS SUNDAY THEN NORTHWEST FLOW RETURNS SUNDAY 
NIGHT. WILL BRING SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND THROUGH 
THE EXTENDED PERIOD. 

TEMPERATURES WILL BEGIN A WARMING TREND SATURDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL 
GRADUALLY CLIMB TO ABOVE NORMAL VALUES.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    70  90  72  92 /  20  20  20  10 
HARRISON AR       65  87  67  88 /  10  10  10  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    70  90  72  92 /  20  20  20  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     70  90  72  92 /  30  20  20  20 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  65  87  67  88 /  10  10  10  10 
MONTICELLO AR     71  90  73  93 /  30  20  20  20 
SEARCY AR         69  89  71  92 /  20  20  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      70  90  72  92 /  10  20  10  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   69  89  71  92 /  10  10  10  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

532 
FXUS64 KLZK 300758
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
250 AM CDT FRI JUL 30 2004

.DISCUSSION...
OF MAIN CONCERN ARE POPS AND RAINFALL AMOUNTS FOR TODAY. WILL GO 
WITH THE SUGGESTED CONCENSUS OF MODELS. THE LATEST INFRARED SATELLITE
LOOPS REVEAL A CONTINUED DEVELOPMENT WITH COLD TOPS OVER NORTHEASTERN
TEXAS AND HEADED TOWARDS ARKANSAS. SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS CAN BE EXPECTED THIS MORNING TO MOVE ACROSS CENTRAL 
AND EASTERN ARKANSAS. ACTIVITY WILL BE LESS NUMEROUS OVER THE WESTERN
SECTIONS. BY THIS AFTERNOON...THE POPS WILL DECREASE OVER MOST 
SECTIONS...THE EXTREME EAST COULD BE THE EXCEPTION DEPENDING ON THE 
SPEED OF THE UPPER LEVEL TROF. A TRAIN ECHO EFFECT WITH SHOWERS 
MOVING OVER THE SAME GENERAL AREA IS POSSIBLE AND SOME AREAS OF 
CENTRAL AND EASTERN ARKANSAS MAY SEE HEAVY RAINFALL AMOUNTS TODAY SO 
THIS SITUATIOJN WILL BE MONITORED CLOSELY FOR PONDING OF WATER.   
BY EARLY SATURDAY AN UPPER LEVEL HIGH WILL DEVELOP TO OUR WEST AND A
MORE NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL PREVAIL OVER ARKANSAS WHICH WILL BRING
A SERIES OF SHORT WAVES...EACH CAPABLE OF A FEW SHOWERS. GFS TEMPS
SEEM REASONABLE...SO WILL NOT STRAY TOO FAR FROM THESE.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    83  72  90  72 /  60  40  20  20 
HARRISON AR       78  67  87  69 /  50  30  20  20 
HOT SPRINGS AR    86  72  90  72 /  60  40  20  20 
PINE BLUFF AR     85  72  90  72 /  60  40  30  20 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  77  67  87  68 /  50  30  20  20 
MONTICELLO AR     85  73  90  73 /  60  40  30  20 
SEARCY AR         80  71  89  71 /  60  40  20  20 
MOUNT IDA AR      85  72  90  72 /  60  40  20  20 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   82  71  90  71 /  50  40  20  20 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.



162 
FXUS64 KLZK 291943
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
300 PM CDT THU JUL 29 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY
UPPER TROF WILL SLOWLY APPROACH THE AREA FROM OKLAHOMA TONIGHT AND 
FRIDAY THEN THE TROF WILL HANG OVER THE AREA FOR MUCH OF THE WEEKEND.
WEAK SURFACE LOW WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA TONIGHT AND FRIDAY THEN 
MOVE OFF TO THE EAST. LITTLE GRADIENT INDICATED WHICH SUGGESTS SURFACE
AND LOW LEVEL FLOW WILL BE RATHER LIGHT AND VARIABLE WITH NO STRONG
INFLOW FROM THE GULF. HOWEVER UPPER TROF AND SOME DIFFLUENCE ALONG
WITH PRECIP WATER OF 2 INCHES OR MORE WILL RESULT IN SOME HEAVY 
RAINS. AREA HAS NOT BEEN TOO WET RECENTLY SO FLASH FLOOD CONCERNS 
NOT GREAT BUT ISOLATED AREAS WILL NEED TO BE MONITORED FOR TRAINING
OF HEAVY RAINFALL. WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS IN THE WEST TONIGHT DECREASING
TO THE EAST THEN SHIFT TO HIGHER POPS IN THE EAST BY FRIDAY AS THE 
UPPER SYSTEM SLOWLY SHIFTS EAST. WILL LOWER POPS FROM THE WEST LATE 
FRIDAY. WILL CONTINUE WITH SMALL POPS THROUGH SUNDAY SINCE THE UPPER 
TROF WILL BE HANGING IN THE AREA WITH WARM HUMID AIR MASS IN PLACE. 
MIN TEMPS SHOULD BE AROUND NORMAL THE NEXT FEW NIGHTS WHILE MAXES FRIDAY
WILL LIKELY BE HELD A LITTLE BELOW MOS BY CLOUDS. MAXES CLOSER TO NORMAL
SHOULD SET IN SATURDAY AND SUNDAY AS AIR MASS DIRES OUT A LITTLE. 
WILL GO A LITTLE BELOW MOS ON SATURDAY.    
&&

.LONG TERM...SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY
MODELS STAY CONSISTENT WITH THE UPPER TROUGH OVER THE MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY MOVING EAST OF ARKANSAS BY SUNDAY NIGHT. THIS ALONG WITH THE 
EXPANDING MID LEVEL HIGH PRESSURE OVER NEW MEXICO WILL DECREASE 
CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION. HOWEVER...GFS IS SHOWING A SHORT WAVE 
MOVING THROUGH THE NORTHWEST FLOW AND MORE OF THESE COULD AFFECT 
ARKANSAS. THEREFORE WILL CONTINUE SMALL POPS THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD. WARMER TEMPERATURES WILL RETURN BY MONDAY...AND WILL BE 
SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH THURSDAY.  
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    70  83  72  90 /  60  60  40  20 
HARRISON AR       64  78  67  87 /  70  50  30  20 
HOT SPRINGS AR    70  86  72  90 /  60  60  40  20 
PINE BLUFF AR     71  85  72  90 /  50  60  40  30 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  63  77  67  87 /  70  60  30  20 
MONTICELLO AR     71  85  73  90 /  50  60  40  30 
SEARCY AR         69  80  71  89 /  50  60  40  20 
MOUNT IDA AR      70  85  72  90 /  60  60  40  20 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   68  82  71  90 /  70  60  40  20 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1105 AM CDT THU JUL 29 2004

.DISCUSSION...
DID SOME REARRANGING OF ZONE GROUPINGS AND ADJUSTMENTS ON POPS AND
MAX TEMPS FOR THIS AFTERNOON BASED ON CURRENT TRENDS...BUT OVERALL
DID NOT MAKE ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES. AREA OF RAIN COVERS THE 
NORTHWESTERN PART OF THE CWA...MOVING TO THE NORTHEAST. SOME ISOLATED
SPRINKLES OR SHOWERS DEVELOPED THROUGH THE MORNING ELSEWHERE. UPPER
TROF IS OVER OKLAHOMA MOVING SLOWLY TO THE EAST PRETTY MUCH AS 
PROGGED. PRETTY MUCH SET POPS FOR THIS AFTERNOON AT 70 PERCENT IN 
AREAS WHERE THE RAIN WAS FALLING AT ISSUE TIME...50 PERCENT ACROSS
CENTRAL SECTIONS WHERE THE RAIN ARE MAY SPREAD INTO BY LATE AFTERNOON
AND 30 PERCENT IN THE EAST AND SOUTHEAST WHICH MAY SEE SOME 
DEVELOPMENT BUT LIKELY WILL NOT SEE THE RAIN AREA REACH BEFORE 
TONIGHT...IF THAT SOON. ADJUSTED MAXES TO THE UPPER 70S IN THE
AREAS WHERE RAIN WAS FALLING AND INCREASED TO UPPER 80S IN THE EAST
AND SOUTHEAST WHERE CLOUDS ARE MORE SCARCE. AIR STILL NOT TOO 
UNSTABLE OVER THE AREA SO CONTINUED WITH SHOWERS AND ISOLATED 
THUNDER THROUGH TONIGHT.   
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

29







29







683 
FXUS64 KLZK 290738
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
240 AM CDT THU JUL 29 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT
FORECAST IS GOING TO BE A CHALLENGING ONE YET AGAIN. SCATTERED LIGHT 
SHOWERS HAVE BEEN MOVING INTO WESTERN ARKANSAS AND NORTHERN ARKANSAS 
FOR THE LAST SIX TO EIGHT HOURS OR SO. SURFACE REPORTS HAVE 
INDICATED THAT SOME OF IT IS REACHING THE GROUND. HOWEVER...LOOKING 
AT KLZK SOUNDING FROM 00Z...SURFACE TO 850 MB LEVEL IS STILL PRETTY 
DRY...SO MUCH OF THE PRECIP HAS EVAPORATED BEFORE REACHING THE 
GROUND. 

TAKING A LOOK AT THE LATEST SURFACE DATA THIS MORNING...SURFACE 
RIDGE...ALBEIT WEAKENING...IS STILL IN PLACE OVER THE MID 
MISSISSIPPI/OHIO VALLEY. WARM FRONT CURRENTLY OVER NORTH TEXAS..AND 
HEADING NORTHWARD. SATELLITE PICS AND SURFACE REPORTS INDICATE THICK 
CIRRUS...ALONG WITH ALTOCU BLOWING OFF FROM AREA OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS OVER NORTH TEXAS. 

THE AREA OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER NORTH TEXAS WILL WEAKEN 
LATER ON THIS MORNING...AS THE ASSOCIATED WARM FRONT SLOWLY MOVES 
NORTHWARD...AND SHORTWAVE PROGRESSES EASTWARD FROM WEST TEXAS. MODEL 
DIFFERENCES ARE NOTED ONCE AGAIN THIS MORNING...WITH THE GFS TAKING 
MAIN AXIS OF MOISTURE RIGHT INTO WESTERN ARKANSAS BY MID DAY TODAY. 
GIVEN THAT THE SURFACE RIDGE HAS BEEN SLOWER TO BREAK DOWN...AND 
POSITION OF THE UPPER RIDGE OVER THE OHIO VALLEY...PREFER THE 
ETA/RUC SOLUTION...WHICH TAKES THE MAIN MOISTURE SWATH NORTHWARD 
TOWARD OKLAHOMA BY MID DAY...AND THEN EASTWARD AS THE RIDGE BREAKS 
DOWN AND MOVES AWAY. THIS WOULD PUT THE GREATEST RAIN CHANCES IN 
WESTERN ARKANSAS LATE THIS AFTERNOON...AND OVER THE WEST AND CENTRAL 
TONIGHT. 

PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES WILL BE RATHER HIGH TONIGHT AND ON 
FRIDAY...GENERALLY ONE TO TWO INCHES. DIVERGENCE ALOFT WILL BE 
PRESENT OVER WESTERN AND CENTRAL ARKANSAS...WITH UPPER JET KICKING 
IN. WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED TO SEE SOME PLACES MAINLY IN WESTERN 
ARKANSAS RECEIVING AS MUCH AS ONE TO TWO INCHES OF RAIN IN THE NEXT 
24 TO 36 HOURS. FLASH FLOOD GUIDANCE VALUES ARE RELATIVELY HIGH...SO 
AM NOT EXPECTING FLOODING PROBLEMS AT THIS TIME.

WILL STILL BE A GOOD CHANCE OF RAIN ON FRIDAY...AS SURFACE LOW AND 
SHORTWAVE MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. WITH H5 RIDGE 
STRENTGTHENING OVER THE SOUTHEAST...STILL LOOKS PROBABLE THAT 
BOUNDARY ASSOCIATED WITH THE SURFACE LOW WILL STALL OUT INVOF 
SOUTHERN ARKANSAS BY SATURDAY...WITH NORTHWESTERLY FLOW SETTING UP 
BEHIND IT. THOUGH MOISTURE WILL DECREASE BY THE WEEKEND...HAVE STILL 
LEFT SLIGHT CHANCE/CHANCE POPS IN THE FORECAST TO ACCOUNT FOR THESE 
FEATURES. 

TEMPERATURE FORECAST IN THE SHORT TERM IS GOING TO BE TRICKY...ON 
ACCOUNT OF CLOUD COVER AND ANTICIPATED RAINFALL. LIKE THE COOLER MAV 
NUMBERS FOR THE INITIAL PERIODS. GUIDANCE FALLS MORE IN LINE TOWARD 
THE END OF THE SHORT TERM...BRINGING READINGS BACK TO NEAR CLIMO. 
&&

.LONG TERM...SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY
EXTENDED RANGE SOLUTIONS STILL HOLD H5 TROUGH OVER THE LOWER AND MID 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY THROUGH MUCH OF THE EXTENDED PERIODS. WITH THIS 
FEATURE IN PLACE...AND NORTHWESTERLY FLOW REGIME CONTINUING THROUGH 
THE BEGINNING OF THE WEEK...WILL KEEP SMALL CHANCES OF RAIN IN 
THROUGH AT LEAST TUESDAY. BY THEN...H5 RIDGE WILL BEGIN BUILDING 
INTO ARKANSAS FROM THE PLAINS...SHUTTING OFF RAIN CHANCES. RETURN 
FLOW WILL SET UP...AND TEMPERATURES WILL WARM BACK INTO THE LOWER 
AND MID 90S. WELCOME BACK SUMMER. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    81  70  85  72 /  40  60  60  40 
HARRISON AR       75  64  80  67 /  70  60  50  30 
HOT SPRINGS AR    83  70  85  72 /  60  60  60  40 
PINE BLUFF AR     84  71  85  72 /  40  60  60  40 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  75  63  80  67 /  60  60  60  30 
MONTICELLO AR     85  71  85  73 /  30  60  60  40 
SEARCY AR         81  69  84  71 /  40  60  60  40 
MOUNT IDA AR      82  70  85  72 /  60  60  60  40 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   79  68  84  71 /  60  60  60  40 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$
