

759 
FXUS64 KLZK 281944
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
300 PM CDT WED JUL 28 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY
SURFACE RIDGE HOLDS ACROSS THE AREA KEEPING THE MAIN RETURN FLOW
AND MOISTURE TO THE WEST OF THE AREA. WEAK UPPER RIDGING WSS PRESENT
OVER THE AREA THIS MORNING BUT THIS WILL BE BREAKING DOWN AS THE 
UPPER TROF APPROACHES FROM THE WEST. SOME LIGHT RAIN HAS MADE IT INTO
FAR WESTERN PARTS OF THE CWA. THE SURFACE RIDGE WILL REMAIN AROUND
WHILE WEAKENING THE NEXT DAY OR TWO. NO STRONG INFLOW FROM THE GULF
IS INDICATED INTO ARKANSAS THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS WHICH SHOULD KEEP
HEAVY RAIN AT BAY ALTHOUGH PRECIPITABLE WATER INCREASES TO WELL OVER
2 INCHES. THE UPPER TROF WILL EVENTUALLY PUSH THE MAIN MOISTURE AXIS
INTO ARKANSAS ABOUT FRIDAY. SOME LIGHT RAIN MAY SPREAD ACROSS MUCH 
OF THE AREA TONIGHT SO WILL INCREASE POPS FROM WEST TO EAST. THE
PRESENCE OF THE SURFACE RIDGE SHOULD KEEP THE AIR RATHER STABLE SO
WILL NOT MENTION THUNDER...WILL HAVE LIGHT RAIN IN THE EAST AND
SHOWERS IN THE WEST. INSTABILITY INCREASES THURSDAY AND WILL 
PUT THUNDER IN STARTING THURSDAY AFTERNOON. CONTINUED INCREASING POPS
THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT...PEAKING AT 50 PERCENT AREAWIDE FRIDAY
WHEN THE MAIN TROF AXIS ARRIVES. DROPPED POPS BACK TO 30 PERCENT FRIDAY
NIGHT INTO SATURDAY AS THE TROF PASSES AND MOISTURE DECREASES 
SOMEWHAT. INCREASE IN MOISTURE WILL RESULT IN MINS MOVING UP OVER 
THE NEXT COUPLE OF NIGHTS WITH MOST AREAS IN THE LOWER 70S BY
FRIDAY. MAXES WILL BE SUPPRESSED BY CLOUDS...ESPECIALLY ON THURSDAY
IN THE NORTHWEST. WENT SLIGHTLY ABOVE MOS ON MAXES IN CASE CLOUDS 
BREAK OUT SOMEWHAT. SOME WARMING MAY OCCUR LATE FRIDAY AS MOISTURE
DECREASES THEN MAXES SATURDAY SHOULD APPROACH NORMAL VALUES.      
&&

.LONG TERM...SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY
MODELS STAY CONSISTENT WITH THE UPPER TROUGH OVER THE MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY NOT MOVING MUCH DURING THE WEEKEND. HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
CONTINUE IN THE WEST CENTERED OVER NEW MEXICO. SEVERAL SHORT WAVES 
WILL MOVE THROUGH THE TROUGH THROUGH THE EARLY PART OF NEXT WEEK SO 
WILL KEEP LOW CHANCES OF PRECIP IN THROUGH MONDAY. HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL SLOWLY BUILD EASTWARD ON TUESDAY AND HAMPER ANY RAIN CHANCES 
FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED TO BE NEAR 
NORMAL. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    66  82  71  87 /  30  40  40  50 
HARRISON AR       60  71  63  80 /  40  50  60  50 
HOT SPRINGS AR    66  81  71  87 /  30  40  50  50 
PINE BLUFF AR     67  85  72  87 /  20  40  40  50 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  58  72  62  80 /  30  40  50  50 
MONTICELLO AR     68  86  72  87 /  20  30  40  50 
SEARCY AR         64  81  70  83 /  20  40  40  50 
MOUNT IDA AR      66  80  71  87 /  40  50  60  50 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   65  77  68  83 /  40  50  50  50 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
955 AM CDT WED JUL 28 2004

.DISCUSSION...
SENT OUT UPDATE TO DROP MORNING FOG. REST OF FORECAST LOOKS OK AT
THIS TIME. SURFACE RIDGE HOLDING TIGHT ACROSS THE AREA THIS MORNING
WITH UPPER RIDGING STILL OVER THE AREA THOUGH HEIGHTS ARE ANEMIC FOR 
THIS TIME OF YEAR. BEST RETURN FLOW ACROSS THE PLAINS THIS MORNING 
SO RAIN SHOULD STAY OUT THERE FOR THE MOST PART. SOME STRAY SHOWERS
MAY MANAGE TO REACH WESTERN SECTIONS BUT THE RIDGING AND COOLER...
DRIER AND MORE STABLE AIR SHOULD CAUSE THEM TO WEAKEN AND/OR 
DISSIPATE.

29







210 
FXUS64 KLZK 280805
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
305 AM CDT WED JUL 28 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT
THIS FORECAST IS GOING TO BE A CHALLENGING ONE IN THE SHORT TERM. 
MODEL SOLUTIONS ARE NOT IN GOOD AGREEMENT. BIGGEST CHALLENGE IS 
GOING TO BE TIMING OF WX/PRECIP.

LATEST SURFACE DATA SHOWS STALLED FRONTAL BOUNDARY INVOF THE GULF 
COAST. RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE MID MISSISSIPPI/WRN OHIO 
VALLEY. LASTLY...SHORTWAVE ENTERING NORTHWEST TEXAS/WRN OKLAHOMA. 

CURRENT SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING ENCROACHING ALTOCU AND CIRRUS FROM 
SYSTEM OUT IN WEST TEXAS. SOME STRATOCU ALSO NOTED IN CENTRAL AND 
NORTHERN ARKANSAS...WITH CIGS OF 050-060 AT KHOT AND KRUE. THE 
INCREASING CLOUD COVER TODAY WILL HELP KEEP READINGS IN WESTERN 
ARKANSAS IN CHECK. THE EASTERN PORTION OF THE FORECAST AREA WILL SEE 
THE HIER READINGS...FLIRTING WITH THE UPPER 80S.

HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE AND H5 LEVELS WILL MOVE OFF TO THE EAST 
TODAY. MOISTURE WILL BEGIN ADVECTING NORTHWARD AS WELL...WITH 
INCREASING CLOUDINESS NOTED. STALLED BOUNDARY WILL BEGIN MOVING 
NORTHWARD LATER TODAY. AT THE SAME TIME...SHORTWAVE OVER TEXAS WILL 
BE MOVING TOWARD THE AREA. 

NOW COMES THE TRICKY PART. IT ALL DEPENDS ON WHICH MODEL SOLUTION 
YOU BUY INTO. GFS...WHICH SEEMS TO HAVE FEEDBACK ISSUES THIS 
MORNING...IS BY FAR THE MOST AGGRESSIVE...BRINGING RAIN INTO THE 
WESTERN PORTION OF THE FORECAST AREA BY 18Z...AND COMPLETELY 
COVERING THE AREA BY 12Z THURSDAY...WITH ALMOST A 3 INCH PRECIP 
BULLSEYE IN THE ARKLATEX REGION. 

THE ETA SOLUTION SHOWS A STRONGER H5 RIDGE...WHICH BLOCKS 
SIGNIFICANT FORWARD PROGRESSION OF THE SHORTWAVE AND SURFACE 
SYSTEM...UNTIL WELL INTO THURSDAY. IF THIS SCENARIO WERE TO PAN 
OUT...ONSET OF PRECIP WOULD LIKELY NOT BE UNTIL LATE THURSDAY 
MORNING. 

FEEL AT THIS POINT...THE BEST COURSE OF ACTION WILL BE TO CONTINUE A 
FORECAST THAT IS FASTER THAN THE ETA...BUT NOT NEARLY AS AGGRESSIVE 
AS THE GFS. WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS OVER THE EXTREME WEST 
TODAY...AND CHANCE POPS OVER ABOUT THE WESTERN TWO THIRDS OF THE 
AREA TONIGHT. BEST CHANCES WILL BE ON THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT 
OVER THE WEST...AS THE SHORTWAVE ADVANCES INTO WESTERN ARKANSAS. 
MAIN UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS ON FRIDAY. NORTHWESTERLY FLOW 
WILL THEN SET UP OVER THE AREA...WITH MORE SYSTEMS LIKELY TO AFFECT 
THE AREA INTO THE WEEKEND. SURFACE BOUNDARY WILL MOVE INTO FORECAST 
AREA ON FRIDAY...AND MAY STALL OR WASH OUT NEAR SOUTHERN OR EASTERN 
ARKANSAS. 

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...MOS GUIDANCE IS ALL OVER THE PLACE. 
BASICALLY...HAVE GONE WARMER THAN THE GFS...AND NOT NEARLY AS HOT AS 
THE ETA. 
&&

.LONG TERM...SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY
NO MAJOR CHANGES HAVE BEEN MADE TO THE GOING EXTENDED FORECAST. 
EXTENDED RANGE SOLUTIONS HOLD BROAD UPPER TROUGH OVER THE AREA FOR 
MUCH OF THE EXTENDED PERIODS. WITH NORTHWESTERLY FLOW...NOT TO 
MENTION WEAK SURFACE BOUNDARY INVOF SOUTHERN FORECAST AREA...WILL 
CONTINUE SLIGHT CHANCE/CHANCE POPS IN THE EXTENDED. EARLY NEXT 
WEEK...TEMPERATURES WILL BEGIN WARMING BACK INTO THE 90S. 
&&

.COORDINATION/COLLABORATION...
THANKS TO WFO SHREVEPORT FOR COLLABORATIVE EFFORTS THIS MORNING. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    85  65  86  71 /  10  30  40  40 
HARRISON AR       81  62  78  65 /  10  40  60  60 
HOT SPRINGS AR    85  65  86  71 /  20  30  50  50 
PINE BLUFF AR     86  66  87  72 /  10  20  40  40 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  82  63  80  64 /  10  30  50  50 
MONTICELLO AR     86  67  88  72 /  10  20  30  40 
SEARCY AR         85  64  86  70 /  10  20  40  40 
MOUNT IDA AR      85  65  84  70 /  20  40  60  60 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   84  63  82  69 /  10  30  50  50 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

57





000 
FXUS64 KLZK 280805
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
305 AM CDT WED JUL 28 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT
THIS FORECAST IS GOING TO BE A CHALLENGING ONE IN THE SHORT TERM. 
MODEL SOLUTIONS ARE NOT IN GOOD AGREEMENT. BIGGEST CHALLENGE IS 
GOING TO BE TIMING OF WX/PRECIP.

LATEST SURFACE DATA SHOWS STALLED FRONTAL BOUNDARY INVOF THE GULF 
COAST. RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE MID MISSISSIPPI/WRN OHIO 
VALLEY. LASTLY...SHORTWAVE ENTERING NORTHWEST TEXAS/WRN OKLAHOMA. 

CURRENT SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWING ENCROACHING ALTOCU AND CIRRUS FROM 
SYSTEM OUT IN WEST TEXAS. SOME STRATOCU ALSO NOTED IN CENTRAL AND 
NORTHERN ARKANSAS...WITH CIGS OF 050-060 AT KHOT AND KRUE. THE 
INCREASING CLOUD COVER TODAY WILL HELP KEEP READINGS IN WESTERN 
ARKANSAS IN CHECK. THE EASTERN PORTION OF THE FORECAST AREA WILL SEE 
THE HIER READINGS...FLIRTING WITH THE UPPER 80S.

HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE AND H5 LEVELS WILL MOVE OFF TO THE EAST 
TODAY. MOISTURE WILL BEGIN ADVECTING NORTHWARD AS WELL...WITH 
INCREASING CLOUDINESS NOTED. STALLED BOUNDARY WILL BEGIN MOVING 
NORTHWARD LATER TODAY. AT THE SAME TIME...SHORTWAVE OVER TEXAS WILL 
BE MOVING TOWARD THE AREA. 

NOW COMES THE TRICKY PART. IT ALL DEPENDS ON WHICH MODEL SOLUTION 
YOU BUY INTO. GFS...WHICH SEEMS TO HAVE FEEDBACK ISSUES THIS 
MORNING...IS BY FAR THE MOST AGGRESSIVE...BRINGING RAIN INTO THE 
WESTERN PORTION OF THE FORECAST AREA BY 18Z...AND COMPLETELY 
COVERING THE AREA BY 12Z THURSDAY...WITH ALMOST A 3 INCH PRECIP 
BULLSEYE IN THE ARKLATEX REGION. 

THE ETA SOLUTION SHOWS A STRONGER H5 RIDGE...WHICH BLOCKS 
SIGNIFICANT FORWARD PROGRESSION OF THE SHORTWAVE AND SURFACE 
SYSTEM...UNTIL WELL INTO THURSDAY. IF THIS SCENARIO WERE TO PAN 
OUT...ONSET OF PRECIP WOULD LIKELY NOT BE UNTIL LATE THURSDAY 
MORNING. 

FEEL AT THIS POINT...THE BEST COURSE OF ACTION WILL BE TO CONTINUE A 
FORECAST THAT IS FASTER THAN THE ETA...BUT NOT NEARLY AS AGGRESSIVE 
AS THE GFS. WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS OVER THE EXTREME WEST 
TODAY...AND CHANCE POPS OVER ABOUT THE WESTERN TWO THIRDS OF THE 
AREA TONIGHT. BEST CHANCES WILL BE ON THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT 
OVER THE WEST...AS THE SHORTWAVE ADVANCES INTO WESTERN ARKANSAS. 
MAIN UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS ON FRIDAY. NORTHWESTERLY FLOW 
WILL THEN SET UP OVER THE AREA...WITH MORE SYSTEMS LIKELY TO AFFECT 
THE AREA INTO THE WEEKEND. SURFACE BOUNDARY WILL MOVE INTO FORECAST 
AREA ON FRIDAY...AND MAY STALL OR WASH OUT NEAR SOUTHERN OR EASTERN 
ARKANSAS. 

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...MOS GUIDANCE IS ALL OVER THE PLACE. 
BASICALLY...HAVE GONE WARMER THAN THE GFS...AND NOT NEARLY AS HOT AS 
THE ETA. 
&&

.LONG TERM...SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY
NO MAJOR CHANGES HAVE BEEN MADE TO THE GOING EXTENDED FORECAST. 
EXTENDED RANGE SOLUTIONS HOLD BROAD UPPER TROUGH OVER THE AREA FOR 
MUCH OF THE EXTENDED PERIODS. WITH NORTHWESTERLY FLOW...NOT TO 
MENTION WEAK SURFACE BOUNDARY INVOF SOUTHERN FORECAST AREA...WILL 
CONTINUE SLIGHT CHANCE/CHANCE POPS IN THE EXTENDED. EARLY NEXT 
WEEK...TEMPERATURES WILL BEGIN WARMING BACK INTO THE 90S. 
&&

.COORDINATION/COLLABORATION...
THANKS TO WFO SHREVEPORT FOR COLLABORATIVE EFFORTS THIS MORNING. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    85  65  86  71 /  10  30  40  40 
HARRISON AR       81  62  78  65 /  10  40  60  60 
HOT SPRINGS AR    85  65  86  71 /  20  30  50  50 
PINE BLUFF AR     86  66  87  72 /  10  20  40  40 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  82  63  80  64 /  10  30  50  50 
MONTICELLO AR     86  67  88  72 /  10  20  30  40 
SEARCY AR         85  64  86  70 /  10  20  40  40 
MOUNT IDA AR      85  65  84  70 /  20  40  60  60 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   84  63  82  69 /  10  30  50  50 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&



704 
FXUS64 KLZK 271952
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
250 PM CDT TUE JUL 27 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT
HIGH PRES RIDGE PREVAILS ACRS AR THIS AFTN WITH LIGHT NELY WIND FLOW 
CONTG. EXPECT STRATOCU TO DISSIPATE AFTER SUNSET...RESULTING IN 
MOSTLY CLR SKIES OVERNIGHT. LOOKING AT ONE MORE COOL NIGHT FOR LATE 
JULY WITH LOWS DIPPING INTO THE 50S AND 60S WITH SOME RECORD LOWS IN 
JEOPARDY.

HIGH PRES WILL SLOWLY WEAKEN OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS...ALLOWING SLY 
WIND FLOW TO RETURN TO THE FA. LOW LVL MOISTURE WILL ALSO BEGIN A 
RETURN NWD AS WELL. WILL SEE CLOUDS ON THE INCREASE FROM THE W ON 
WED. THICKER CLOUD COVER OVER WRN AR WILL TEMPER MAX TEMPS...WITH 
WARMEST READINGS EXPECTED IN ERN SECTIONS.

UPPER TROF MOVES CLOSER TO AR FROM THE PLAINS WED NIGHT AND THU...
RESULTING IN BETTER RAIN CHCS. HAVE CONTD THE FCST MORE TOWARDS THE 
SLOWER ETA SOLUTION FOR POPS. THUS...HAVE HIGHEST POPS IN THE WRN 
ZNS AND LESSER CHCS FURTHER EWD. GFS LOOKS A BIT OVERDONE WITH UPPER 
SHORTWV PROGGED TO MOVE ACRS THE FA. AS FOR TEMPS...WENT WITH A 
BLEND OF THE VARIOUS MOS OUTPUT FOR THE LATER PDS.

UNSETTLED WEATHER PATTERN WILL CONT FRI AND FRI NIGHT AS SEVERAL 
MORE WEAK UPPER LVL SYSTEMS LIFT ACRS THE AREA. HAVE KEPT POPS IN 
CHC CAT FOR NOW DUE TO TIMING ISSUES WITH EACH UPPER SYS. LATER 
MODELS RUNS SHOULD HAVE A BETTER HANDLE ON THINGS.
&&

.LONG TERM...SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY
NO MAJOR CHANGES TO CURRENT EXTENDED FORECAST. MODELS CONTINUE TO 
INDICATE UPPER TROUGH OVER THE AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND INTO MONDAY. 
RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE AREA ON TUESDAY. WITH A WEAK BOUNDARY OVER THE 
AREA...WILL KEEP SMALL POPS GOING THROUGH MONDAY...THEN DRY ON 
TUESDAY AS THE HIGH MOVES IN. TEMPERATURES WILL RETURN TO NORMAL.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

44/51







721 
FXUS64 KLZK 270756
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
256 AM CDT TUE JUL 27 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT
WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SOME STRATOCU OVER WESTERN ARKANSAS AND IN THE 
ARKANSAS RIVER VALLEY...MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA HAS CLEARED OUT 
THIS MORNING. WINDS HAVE GENERALLY BEEN LESS THAN 5 MPH. BOUNDARY 
LAYER RH IS FAIRLY HIGH...AND THIS HAS ALLOWED PATCHY FOG TO FORM. 
VISBYS WITH THE FOG HAVE MOSTLY BEEN IN THE 3-6SM RANGE. THE FOG 
SHOULD DISPERSE AROUND MID MORNING. 

RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE CURRENTLY PUSHING INTO ARKANSAS FROM THE MID 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. THIS WILL ALLOW MOSTLY SUNNY/CLEAR CONDITIONS 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY. WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO BE OUT OF THE NORTHEAST/
EAST TODAY AND TONIGHT...AND AS A RESULT TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE 
TO BE BELOW NORMAL FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR. FOR TODAY...GOING FOR 
LOWER TO MID 80S NORTH AND CENTRAL...AND UPPER 80S SOUTH. TONIGHT...
TEMPERATURES WILL BE BACK DOWN IN THE UPPER 50S NORTH TO MID 60S 
SOUTH. 

ON WEDNESDAY...THE WARMUP BEGINS. HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE OFF TOWARD 
THE EAST...AND AS A RESULT...WINDS WILL TAKE ON MORE OF A SOUTHERLY 
COMPONENT. TEMPERATURES WILL CLIMB BACK UP TO THE MID 80S TO LOWER 
90S. 

AS THE RIDGE HEADS TO THE EAST...A SHORTWAVE WILL BE MOVING DOWN OFF 
THE ROCKIES. THIS...COMBINED WITH REMNANTS OF THIS PAST WEEKENDS 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY HEADING NORTHWARD FROM THE GULF COAST...WILL BRING 
ABOUT THE NEXT CHANCE FOR RAIN FOR THE AREA. MODELS ARE DISAGREEING 
ON PLACEMENT OF THESE TWO SYSTEMS. AT 12Z THURSDAY...THE GFS HAS THE 
SHORTWAVE OVER CENTRAL OKLAHOMA...WHEREAS THE ETA LAGS THE GFS...
WITH THE MAIN SYSTEM ONLY IN THE PANHANDLES BY THEN. 

SINCE THE OVERALL TREND HAS BEEN TO SLOW THE SYSTEM DOWN...WILL GO 
WITH A FORECAST THAT IS LESS AGGRESSIVE THAN THE GFS...BUT NOT AS 
SLOW AS THE ETA. AM BRINGING IN RAIN CHANCES TO THE FAR WESTERN PTN 
OF THE AREA LATE WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON...AND OVER THE ENTIRE AREA 
BEFORE DAWN ON THURSDAY MORNING. 

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...MOS IS IN FAIRLY GOOD AGREMENT FOR ABOUT THE 
FIRST THREE OR SO PERIODS. BY THE FIFTH PERIOD /THURSDAY/...GUIDANCE 
DIFFERS ANYWHERE FROM 4 TO 8 DEGREES...WITH THE ETA BEING THE 
WARMEST. TENDED TO GRAVITATE MORE TOWARD THE GFS MOS...BUT JUST A 
FEW DEGREES WARMER. 
&&

.LONG TERM...FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY
BY FRIDAY...SURFACE SYSTEM AND H5 TROUGH SHOULD BE NEARLY IN PHASE 
WITH EACH OTHER OVER WESTERN PORTION OF THE FORECAST AREA. LATEST 
MEX GUIDANCE IS GOING FOR 70 POPS ON FRIDAY...BUT GIVEN THE WAY THE 
MODELS HAVE SLOWED THIS SYSTEM DOWN...AND ALL THIS BEING OUT IN DAY 
4...AM A BIT HESITANT TO GO WITH ANY HIGHER THAN CHANCE POPS. 

BY FRIDAY NIGHT...SURFACE SYSTEM SHOULD HANG UP SOMEWHERE IN THE 
VICINITY OF SOUTHERN/EASTERN ARKANSAS. NORTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL SET 
UP BEHIND THE STALLED SYSTEM. WITH SEVERAL UPPER LEVEL SYSTEMS 
MOVING DOWN IN THE MEAN FLOW...LEFT AT LEAST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN 
THE FORECAST THROUGH THE WEEKEND. IT LOOKS DOUBTFUL AT THIS POINT IF 
THINGS WILL TOTALLY CLEAR OUT BEFORE THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    85  63  87  67 /   0   0  10  20 
HARRISON AR       82  59  84  64 /   0   0  10  30 
HOT SPRINGS AR    87  64  88  67 /   0   0  10  30 
PINE BLUFF AR     85  64  88  68 /   0   0  10  20 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  81  59  84  64 /   0   0  10  20 
MONTICELLO AR     85  65  89  68 /   0   0  10  20 
SEARCY AR         84  62  88  67 /   0   0   0  20 
MOUNT IDA AR      87  64  88  67 /   0   0  10  30 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   85  62  87  66 /   0   0  10  30 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1005 PM CDT MON JUL 26 2004

.DISCUSSION...
CLOUDS DISSIPATING QUICKLY AFTER SUNSET...WITH MOST CLOUDS REMOVED 
FROM THE FORECAST OVERNIGHT. SOME CLOUDS STILL LEFT IN THE 
SOUTHEAST...BUT THESE SHOULD DISSIPATE. 

OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING INTO THE REGION FROM THE NORTH. 
DEWPOINTS WELL BELOW WHAT WOULD BE EXPECTED IN JULY...WITH 
TEMPERATURES FOLLOWING SUIT. WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED TO HAVE A FEW 
RECORD LOW READINGS OVERNIGHT. SOME FOG FORMING IN SPOTS...AND ADDED 
PATCHY FOG TO FORECAST. 

HIGH PRESSURE TO HEAD TO THE EAST TUESDAY/WEDNESDAY. WINDS WILL 
BECOME MORE SOUTHERLY...WITH TEMPERATURES WARMING UP. NEXT CHANCE OF 
RAIN ON THURSDAY AS A COLD FRONT APPROACHES FROM THE NORTHWEST. (46)
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

005 
FXUS64 KLZK 261934
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
235 PM CDT MON JUL 26 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT
SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATES THAT CLOUD COVER CONTINUES TO BECOME 
MORE SCATTERED ACROSS NORTHERN AND CENTRAL PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. EXPECT A CLEARING TREND TO BECOME BETTER ESTABLISHED 
OVERNIGHT. ALONG WITH A LIGHT BOUNDARY LAYER FLOW OVERNIGHT...EXPECT 
LOW TEMPERATURES TO APPROACH RECORD LEVELS.

DRY CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL THROUGH MOST OF THIS PERIOD...AS HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS FROM THE NORTH AND NORTHEAST. THE NEXT CHANCE FOR 
PRECIPITATION WILL OCCUR LATE THURSDAY...AS AN UPPER TROUGH AND AN 
ASSOCIATED SURFACE REFLECTION APPROACHES THE REGION. OVERALL 
TEMPERATURES TRENDS WILL EXHIBIT A SLOW INCREASE THROUGH THIS 
PERIOD. 

&&

.LONG TERM...FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY
NO MAJOR CHANGES TO GOING FCST AS MODELS CONT TO INDC ANOTHER UPPER 
TROF WORKING INTO THE AREA BY LATE IN THE WEEK AND PERSISTING INTO 
THE WEEKEND. KEPT CHC POPS GOING FRI INTO SAT AS WARMER AND MORE 
HUMID AIR ADVECTS NWD INTO AR. WENT WITH SLIGHT CHC POPS FOR SUN AND 
MON WITH WEAK BNDRY IN THE AREA AND CONTD PRESENCE OF UPPER SHEAR 
AXIS. TEMPS WILL RETURN TO MORE NORMAL LVLS THRU THE PD. 44

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    62  85  64  89 /  10   0   0  10 
HARRISON AR       56  82  61  86 /   0   0   0  10

PINE BLUFF AR     63  85  65  89 /  10   0   0  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  57  82  61  86 /   0   0   0  10

MONTICELLO AR     64  86  66  89 /  10   0   0  10 
SEARCY AR         62  85  63  88 /  10   0   0  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      61  87  64  90 /   0   0   0  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   60  85  63  88 /   0   0   0  10

55/99









079 
FXUS64 KLZK 261052 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
550 AM CDT MON JUL 26 2004

.DISCUSSION...
DOPPLER RADAR SHOWS PATCHY LIGHT RAIN IN PARTS OF THE AREA AND PATCHES
OF LIGHT RAIN MOVING INTO WESTERN SECTIONS FROM OKLAHOMA. THIS LIKELY
AHEAD OF THE SHORT WAVE THAT WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA LATER TODAY. 
UPDATED TO PUT IN A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA THIS
MORNING AND CONTINUED THE SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN IN THE SOUTHEAST 
THIS AFTERNOON. UPDATED CLOUD GRIDS TO INCREASE CLOUDS THIS MORNING
BUT STILL INDICATE SOME CLEARING DURING THE AFTERNOON. TEMP GRIDS
ALTERED SOME TO SHOW SLOWER WARMING THIS MORNING BUT MAX FORECASTS
WERE LEFT UNCHANGED. 

.PREV DISCUSSION...
.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY
UNSEASONABLY COOL AIR HAS DESCENDED ON THE AREA AS THE COLD FRONT HAS
SHIFTED TO THE SOUTH AND A COOL HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES IN FROM 
THE NORTH. LOW CLOUDS COVER THE AREA AND THEY WILL LIKELY TAKE MOST
OF THE DAY TO MOVE OUT AS THE UPPER TROF WILL NOT PASS OVER THE AREA
UNTIL TONIGHT. PATCHY RAIN HAS BEEN CONFINED TO SOUTHEASTERN SECTIONS
THIS MORNING AND WILL KEEP SMALL POPS GOING IN THE SOUTHEAST FOR 
MUCH OF THE DAY. ISOLATED LIGHT RAIN HAS BEEN INDICATED TO THE WEST
OF THE AREA THIS MORNING AND CANNOT RULE OUT SOME ISOLATED PATCHES
OF LIGHT RAIN ELSEWHERE TODAY...BUT IT DOES NOT LOOK LIKE IT MERITS
20 POPS BUT DID PUT 5 TO 10 POPS IN THE GRIDS. TEMPS WILL STRUGGLE 
TO RISE TODAY AND MOS MAY BE A LITTLE OPTIMISTIC BUT THINK THE 
INTENSE SUN WILL BREAK THE CLOUDS ENOUGH FOR SOME HEATING AND 
IT HAS MANAGED TO WARM UP SOMEWHAT IN MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS 
THIS SUMMER AT MANY STATIONS. CLOUDS SHOULD CLEAR OUT EARLY TONIGHT
WITH THE UPPER TROF MOVING PAST THE AREA THEN A SURFACE HIGH WILL
MOVE NEAR THE AREA. THIS SHOULD RESULT IN GOOD COOLING TONIGHT AND
TUESDAY NIGHT WITH MINS REACHING THE 50S IN THE NORTH AND WELL DOWN
INTO THE 60S IN OTHER AREAS. TUESDAY SHOULD BE A MOSTLY SUNNY DAY
AND TEMPS SHOULD REBOUND ACCORDINGLY WITH MOST AREAS IN THE LOWER TO 
MID 80S. MOISTURE WILL INCREASE BEHIND THE SURFACE HIGH AND 
ANOTHER UPPER TROF WILL APPROACH STARTING ON WEDNESDAY. THE TROF
MOVES VERY SLOWLY AND IT LOOKS LIKE THE HIGH PRESSURE WILL HOLD
THROUGH WEDNESDAY WITH MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS CONTINUING AND 
MAXES MOVING UP A LITTLE AGAIN. THE TROF STARTS TO AFFECT THE 
AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY WITH AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS. 
KEPT POPS IN STARTING THURSDAY. 
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY
UPPER TROF WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA FRIDAY AND SATURDAY AND THAT LOOKS
LIKE THE BEST CHANCE OF RAIN RIGHT NOW. WENT WITH CHANCE POPS ON 
FRIDAY AND SLIGHT CHANCE THE REST OF THE TIME THROUGH SATURDAY. 
KEPT TEMP FORECASTS ABOUT THE SAME WITH READINGS NEAR NORMAL. IF
THE SCENARIO FOR FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY DOES MATERIALIZE...MAXES MAY 
NEED TO BE TRIMMED DOWN A LITTLE.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    81  63  86  65 /  20  10   0   0 
HARRISON AR       77  58  83  61 /  20   0   0   0 
HOT SPRINGS AR    81  63  86  64 /  20   0   0   0 
PINE BLUFF AR     82  65  87  65 /  20  10   0   0 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  77  58  82  61 /  20   0   0   0 
MONTICELLO AR     84  66  88  63 /  20  10   0   0 
SEARCY AR         81  63  86  63 /  20  10   0   0 
MOUNT IDA AR      81  62  86  63 /  20   0   0   0 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   81  62  85  61 /  20   0   0   0 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT

THE CWA. THE LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS INDICATES THE MAIN SURFACE 
BOUNDARY HAS REACHED A POSITION FROM SEARCY...TO NEAR HOPE.

THE BOUNDARY WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE SLOWLY SOUTH...AND SHOULD CLEAR 
THE CWA BY EARLY MONDAY EVENING. THIS BOUNDARY STILL WILL PROMOTE 
WIDELY SCATTERED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION THROUGH MONDAY EVENING.  
DRY CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT...AS THE FOCUS FOR PRECIPITATION MOVES TO THE WEST.
NEAR TO BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED.

&&

THE BASE OF THE TROUGH. FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE STATE THURSDAY 
INTO FRIDAY...WITH UPPER LEVEL ENERGY CONTINUING THE CHANCE FOR 
RAINFALL THROUGH SATURDAY. HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHWEST WILL 
BEGIN TO MOVE EAST SUNDAY...ALLOWING DRY CONDITIONS.


449 
FXUS64 KLZK 251151
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
650 AM CDT SUN JUL 25 2004

.DISCUSSION...
MAIN AREA OF RAIN HAS MOVED OUT OF THE CWA WITH ONLY ISOLATED 
SHOWERS REMAINING. 06Z GFS SHOWS MAIN MOISTURE AXIS SHIFTING 
TO THE EAST THIS MORNING SO UPDATED TO TAKE OUT LIKELY POPS.
WENT WITH 40 PERCENT POPS ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA FOR TODAY
AS ACTIVITY LIKELY WILL INCREASE WITH HEATING AND ANOTHER
SHORT WAVE ROTATING THROUGH.  

.PREV DISCUSSION...
.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT
COLD FRONT MOVING SOUTH ACROSS THE AREA THIS MORNING SHOULD BE TO
THE SOUTH BY LATER TODAY WITH NORTH TO NRTHEAST LOW LEVEL FLOW 
AROUND HIGH PRESSURE TO THE NORTH. A COUPLE OF WEAK SHORT WAVES
SWING AROUND UPPER TROF TO THE NORTH OF THE AREA TODAY AND THIS
WILL KEEP A GOOD CHANCE OF RAIN GOING TODAY ESPECIALLY IN THE
NORTH. KEPT LIKELY POPS IN THE NORTH AND WEST FOR TODAY WITH 
HIGH CHANCE ELSEWHERE. CONSIDERABLE CLOUDS AND COOLER DRIER AIR
WILL KEEP MAXES WELL DOWN INTO THE 70S IN THE NORTH WITH OTHER
AREAS ONLY IN THE 80S. THE RESULTING LESS UNSTABLE AIR SHOULD
HOLD DOWN THE STRENGTH OF ANY THUNDERSTORMS THAT DEVELOP AND
LITTLE IF ANY SEVERE WEATHER IS EXPECTED. UPPER TROF IS SLOW TO
MOVE PAST THE AREA SO KEPT POPS GOING THROUGH TONIGHT. WENT WITH
DRY FORECAST FOR MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT AS THE TROF AXIS MOVES
PAST AND MOISTURE DECREASES. TEMPS SHOULD STAY BELOW NORMAL WITH
MINS IN THE 50S IN THE NORTH AND IN THE 60S IN OTHER AREAS AND 
MAXES MOSTLY IN THE 80S.     
&&

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY
REALLY SEE NO NEED TO MAKE SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO THE EXTENDED. 
MODELS STILL IN GOOD AGREEMENT...BRINGING SYSTEM OUT OF TEXAS ON 
WEDNESDAY...ALBEIT A LITTLE LATER THAN SHOWN YESTERDAY. OF 
COURSE...THAT FAR OUT IN TIME...MODEL DEVIATIONS ARE TO BE EXPECTED. 
FOCUS OF PRECIPITATION WILL STILL BE WESTERN ARKANSAS GOING INTO 
THURSDAY...AS H5 RIDGE TAKES SHAPE OVER THE APPALACHIANS...AND 
TROUGH DIGS INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. 

BY FRIDAY...FOCUS SHIFTS MORE TOWARD SOUTHERN ARKANSAS...AS A 
SHORTWAVE MOVES DOWN TOWARD THE GULF COAST. BOTTOM LINE IS THAT 
THERE WILL BE A CONTINUED CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIODS. BEING LATE JULY...THE BEST CHANCES 
WILL BE DURING AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING PRIME CONVECTIVE TIME. 

OF NOTE...HOWEVER...WILL BE THE WARMUP IN TEMPERATURES. BY MID TO 
LATE WEEK...SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL RETURN...BRINGING GULF MOISTURE...
AND AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES IN THE LOWER TO MID 90S ONCE AGAIN. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    82  67  84  65 /  40  30  10  10 
HARRISON AR       72  58  80  58 /  70  30  10  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    83  67  84  65 /  50  30  10  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     85  67  85  66 /  40  30  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  71  58  80  58 /  70  30  10  10 
MONTICELLO AR     86  67  86  66 /  40  30  10  10 
SEARCY AR         81  62  83  64 /  50  30  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      82  65  84  64 /  60  30  10  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   80  61  83  61 /  60  30  10  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

29/57








000 
FXUS64 KLZK 251151
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
650 AM CDT SUN JUL 25 2004

.DISCUSSION...
MAIN AREA OF RAIN HAS MOVED OUT OF THE CWA WITH ONLY ISOLATED 
SHOWERS REMAINING. 06Z GFS SHOWS MAIN MOISTURE AXIS SHIFTING 
TO THE EAST THIS MORNING SO UPDATED TO TAKE OUT LIKELY POPS.
WENT WITH 40 PERCENT POPS ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA FOR TODAY
AS ACTIVITY LIKELY WILL INCREASE WITH HEATING AND ANOTHER
SHORT WAVE ROTATING THROUGH.  

.PREV DISCUSSION...
.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT
COLD FRONT MOVING SOUTH ACROSS THE AREA THIS MORNING SHOULD BE TO
THE SOUTH BY LATER TODAY WITH NORTH TO NRTHEAST LOW LEVEL FLOW 
AROUND HIGH PRESSURE TO THE NORTH. A COUPLE OF WEAK SHORT WAVES
SWING AROUND UPPER TROF TO THE NORTH OF THE AREA TODAY AND THIS
WILL KEEP A GOOD CHANCE OF RAIN GOING TODAY ESPECIALLY IN THE
NORTH. KEPT LIKELY POPS IN THE NORTH AND WEST FOR TODAY WITH 
HIGH CHANCE ELSEWHERE. CONSIDERABLE CLOUDS AND COOLER DRIER AIR
WILL KEEP MAXES WELL DOWN INTO THE 70S IN THE NORTH WITH OTHER
AREAS ONLY IN THE 80S. THE RESULTING LESS UNSTABLE AIR SHOULD
HOLD DOWN THE STRENGTH OF ANY THUNDERSTORMS THAT DEVELOP AND
LITTLE IF ANY SEVERE WEATHER IS EXPECTED. UPPER TROF IS SLOW TO
MOVE PAST THE AREA SO KEPT POPS GOING THROUGH TONIGHT. WENT WITH
DRY FORECAST FOR MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT AS THE TROF AXIS MOVES
PAST AND MOISTURE DECREASES. TEMPS SHOULD STAY BELOW NORMAL WITH
MINS IN THE 50S IN THE NORTH AND IN THE 60S IN OTHER AREAS AND 
MAXES MOSTLY IN THE 80S.     
&&

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY
REALLY SEE NO NEED TO MAKE SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO THE EXTENDED. 
MODELS STILL IN GOOD AGREEMENT...BRINGING SYSTEM OUT OF TEXAS ON 
WEDNESDAY...ALBEIT A LITTLE LATER THAN SHOWN YESTERDAY. OF 
COURSE...THAT FAR OUT IN TIME...MODEL DEVIATIONS ARE TO BE EXPECTED. 
FOCUS OF PRECIPITATION WILL STILL BE WESTERN ARKANSAS GOING INTO 
THURSDAY...AS H5 RIDGE TAKES SHAPE OVER THE APPALACHIANS...AND 
TROUGH DIGS INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. 

BY FRIDAY...FOCUS SHIFTS MORE TOWARD SOUTHERN ARKANSAS...AS A 
SHORTWAVE MOVES DOWN TOWARD THE GULF COAST. BOTTOM LINE IS THAT 
THERE WILL BE A CONTINUED CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
THROUGHOUT THE EXTENDED PERIODS. BEING LATE JULY...THE BEST CHANCES 
WILL BE DURING AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING PRIME CONVECTIVE TIME. 

OF NOTE...HOWEVER...WILL BE THE WARMUP IN TEMPERATURES. BY MID TO 
LATE WEEK...SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL RETURN...BRINGING GULF MOISTURE...
AND AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES IN THE LOWER TO MID 90S ONCE AGAIN. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    82  67  84  65 /  40  30  10  10 
HARRISON AR       72  58  80  58 /  70  30  10  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    83  67  84  65 /  50  30  10  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     85  67  85  66 /  40  30  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  71  58  80  58 /  70  30  10  10 
MONTICELLO AR     86  67  86  66 /  40  30  10  10

933 
FXUS64 KLZK 250310 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1005 PM CDT SAT JUL 24 2004

.DISCUSSION...
QUITE A FEW STORMS TONIGHT/SOME SEVERE WEATHER MAINLY IN 
CENTRAL/SOUTHERN ARKANSAS. STORMS PRETTY MUCH WEAKENING...BUT RAIN 
FAR FROM OVER. ANOTHER ROUND OF PRECIPITATION SET TO SPREAD ACROSS 
THE REGION FROM OKLAHOMA OVERNIGHT.

APPEARS THAT BEST CHANCES FOR SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS WILL REMAIN 
NORTH OF FRONT...WHICH EXTENDS FROM JUST SOUTH OF JONESBORO TO JUST 
NORTH OF FORT SMITH. GIVEN THIS...WENT WITH HIGHEST POPS IN NORTHERN 
COUNTIES...WITH PRECIPITATION MORE SCATTERED TOWARD CENTRAL AND 
SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE STATE.

FRONT WILL CONTINUE SLOWLY PUSHING SOUTH ON SUNDAY...WITH SCATTERED 
TO NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUING. ON SUNDAY... 
LOWERED AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES A BIT IN NORTHERN ARKANSAS BEHIND THE 
FRONT.

SOME PRECIPITATION WILL LINGER INTO SUNDAY EVENING...WITH MOSTLY DRY 
WEATHER RETURNING TO START THE NEW WEEK. (46)
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&


470 
FXUS64 KLZK 241953
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
250 PM CDT SAT JUL 24 2004

.SHORT TERM...
FRONT NEARLY STATIONARY IN NORTHERN ARKANSAS. WARM AND UNSTABLE AIR 
OVER CENTRAL AND SOUTH...AS THE TEMPERATURE AT OFFICE WAS 98 DEGREES 
EARLIER. DEWPOINTS ARE IN THE 70S ACROSS THE STATE...ADDING TO THE 
INSTABILITY. SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPED DURING 
THE AFTERNOON IN WESTERN AND CENTRAL ARKANSAS.

A WEAK LOW WILL DEVELOP ALONG THE FRONT IN EASTERN OKLAHOMA TONIGHT 
AS THE UPPER TROUGH MOVES NORTHEAST. THIS WILL MOVE THE FRONT 
SOUTHEAST...WITH THE AXIS OF HEAVIEST RAINFALL IN WESTERN AND 
NORTHERN ARKANSAS. SOME LOCATIONS COULD SEE OVER AN INCH OF 
RAIN...AS WINDS ALOFT ARE WEAK AND STORMS WILL MOVE SLOWLY. MAIN 
CONCERN WITH SEVERE WEATHER IS THE FLOOD POTENTIAL...BUT DUE TO 
AFOREMENTIONED INSTABILITY...COULD SEE SOME STORMS WITH WIND DAMAGE 
AND LARGE HAIL.

RAINFALL AXIS WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST SUNDAY...AS UPPER SYSTEM MOVES 
EAST. HEAVY RAINFALL POTENTIAL STILL POSSIBLE ON SUNDAY IN NORTHERN 
AND CENTRAL ARKANSAS. RAIN WILL BEGIN TO TAPER OFF IN THE LATE 
AFTERNOON IN THE NORTH...AS DRIER AIR WILL FILTER IN. MUCH COOLER 
TEMPS ON SUNDAY...WITH GUIDANCE GIVING HARRISON ONLY 67 FOR A HIGH. 
DID NOT LOWER TEMPS QUITE THAT MUCH...BUT WENT COOLER THAN THE 
PREVIOUS FORECAST. MID SHIFT MIGHT HAVE TO LOWER THEM EVEN MORE.

PRECIP WILL FINALLY CLEAR THE AREA LATE SUNDAY NIGHT IN THE 
SOUTH...WITH HIGH PRESSURE MOVING OVER THE STATE. MONDAY AND TUESDAY 
WILL HAVE DRY CONDITIONS...WITH A WARMING TREND.
&&

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY
UPPER TROF WILL MOVE TOWARD THE AREA WEDNESDAY THEN THROUGH ON 
THURSDAY. WEAK TROFINESS CONTINUES AFTER THAT THEN RIDGING INCREASES
BY SATURDAY. WEAK RETURN FLOW SETS UP WEDNESDAY THEN SURFACE 
RIDGING DEVELOPS TO THE NORTH BY THE WEEKEND. NO SIGNIFICANT 
FRONTAL PASSAGE IS INDICATED BUT A WEAK BOUNDARY OR TWO MAY
MOVE THROUGH THE AREA ESPECIALLY AS THE SHORT WAVE MOVES ACROSS
THE AREA LATE THURSDAY. THIS ALONG WITH MODEST MOISTURE WILL
RESULT IN SMALL POPS THROUGH MOST OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD. DID
INCREASE POPS TO 30 PERCENT FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON AS THE MAIN
UPPER TROF MOVES THROUGH THE AREA. WAS ON THE FENCE ABOUT POPS
FOR NEXT SATURDAY AND DECIDED TO LEAVE THEM OUT FOR NOW. TEMPS
LIKELY WILL BE A LITTLE LOWER AT MID WEEK AND MAXES THURSDAY
MAY BE HELD IN THE MID 80S TO NEAR 90. TEMPS SHOULD RISE TOWARD
THE END OF THE WEEK WITH UPPER RIDGING INCREASING. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    72  84  66  84 /  60  60  20  10 
HARRISON AR       64  77  60  80 /  70  60  20  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    72  84  66  84 /  60  60  20  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     73  85  67  85 /  60  60  30  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  64  78  60  80 /  70  60  20  10 
MONTICELLO AR     74  86  68  86 /  60  60  30  10 
SEARCY AR         70  84  64  83 /  70  60  20  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      72  84  66  84 /  60  60  20  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   70  82  64  83 /  70  60  20  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$


008 
FXUS64 KLZK 240829
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
327 AM CDT SAT JUL 24 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE MOVING ACROSS NORTHWEST ARKANSAS 
THIS MORNING. MOVEMENT IS RATHER SLOW TO THE NORTHEAST AND SOME 
AREAS WILL LIKELY MEASURE OVER AN INCH THIS MORNING. SATELLITE 
IMAGES SHOW ANOTHER STORM COMPLEX IN NORTH CENTRAL OKLAHOMA BUT THE 
CURRENT TRACK OF THIS SYSTEM WILL ALLOW IT TO MISS ARKANSAS. 

HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES OVER THE MID SOUTH AND A DEEP TROUGH IS IN 
PLACE OVER THE NORTHEAST UNITED STATES. SHORT WAVES WILL CONTINUE TO 
ROTATE AROUND THE BASE OF THE TROUGH THROUGH THE WEEKEND. NORTHWEST 
FLOW WILL RETURN TO THE AREA ON TUESDAY. 

THE COLD FRONT CONTINUES TO STRETCH FROM WEST CENTRAL ARKANSAS 
ACROSS NORTH ARKANSAS. SLOW SOUTHWARD MOVEMENT OF THE FRONT IS 
EXPECTED TODAY. THE ONGOING PRECIPITATION WILL MOVE INTO MISSOURI 
THIS MORNING. MORE THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP BY MID DAY HOWEVER 
WITH DAYTIME HEATING. WILL GO WITH 80 PERCENT POPS IN THE NORTH THIS 
AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT. THE SOUTHEAST WILL HAVE THE LOWEST CHANCE 
POPS...CLOSEST TO THE RIDGE AXIS. THE MAIN THREAT WITH THE STORMS 
TODAY WILL BE HEAVY RAIN. MOVEMENT OF THE STORMS WILL BE SLOW AND 
SEVERAL INCHES OF RAIN WILL BE POSSIBLE IF A STORM REMAINS IN ONE 
LOCATION FOR ANY LENGTH OF TIME. BEST CHANCES OF RAIN TODAY WILL BE 
IN THE NORTH. TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOLER DUE TO CLOUD COVER AND 
PRECIPITATION. 

MODELS ARE IN DECENT AGREEMENT BUT SEEM TO KEEP THE SYSTEMS TOO FAR 
TO THE NORTH. CROSS SECTIONS SHOW DECENT MOISTURE ACROSS THE AREA 
TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY. NORTH ARKANSAS IS POISED TO RECEIVE SOME 
HEALTHY RAINS THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE 
PUSHED TO THE SOUTH TONIGHT BY THE COLD FRONT AND AN MCS WILL 
DEVELOP IN THE PLAINS AND MOVE ACROSS THE AREA. THE COLD FRONT WILL 
CONTINUE MOVING SOUTH THROUGH SUNDAY AND WILL TRANSLATE THE 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES SOUTHWARD. PRECIPITATION WILL END ACROSS THE 
AREA BY MIDNIGHT SUNDAY NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE MOVES INTO THE AREA 
MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. COOLER TEMPERATURES CAN BE EXPECTED RIGHT 
INTO THE FIRST PART OF NEXT WEEK.
&&

.LONG TERM...TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY
EXTENDED RANGE SOLUTIONS ARE IN DECENT AGREEMENT THIS MORNING. 
INDICATIONS ARE THAT AFTER A BRIEF BREAK...PATTERN WILL ONCE AGAIN 
BECOME MORE ACTIVE BY MID WEEK. ON TUESDAY...RIDGING WILL BE 
PREDOMINANT OVER THE MID SOUTH...AS REMNANTS OF WEEKEND SYSTEM WILL 
BE HUNG UP INVOF THE GULF COAST. OTHER THAN A FEW CLOUDS OVER 
CENTRAL AND SOUTH ARKANSAS...CONDITIONS WILL BE DRY/MOSTLY SUNNY FOR 
MUCH OF TUESDAY. 

BY LATE TUESDAY NIGHT...MOISTURE WILL INCREASE FROM THE SOUTHWEST...
AND A SHORTWAVE WILL KICK OUT OF SOUTH TEXAS. THIS WILL BRING ABOUT 
THE NEXT CHANCE OF RAINFALL. RAIN CHANCES WILL CONTINUE FOR THE 
REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST...WITH THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF SHOWER AND 
THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY BEING WESTERN ARKANSAS THROUGH THURSDAY. AS 
LARGE H5 TROUGH BUILDS OVER THE SOUTHERN PORTION OF THE CONUS...
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL SET UP OVER WESTERN ARKANSAS. MCS POTENTIAL 
IS CERTAINLY A POSSIBILITY ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT...AND AGAIN ON 
THURSDAY NIGHT. 

BY FRIDAY...FOCUS LOOKS TO SHIFT MORE TOWARD THE SOUTHERN PORTION OF 
THE FORECAST AREA...AS SURFACE TROUGH INTERACTS WITH DEVELOPING 
UPPER LOW OVER THE RED RIVER VALLEY. 

WITH THE EXCEPTION OF INTRODUCING POPS...MADE VERY LITTLE CHANGES TO 
THE GOING EXTENDED FORECAST.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    88  69  85  66 /  50  60  50  20 
HARRISON AR       78  61  80  60 /  80  90  40  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    88  69  86  66 /  50  50  50  20 
PINE BLUFF AR     89  70  86  67 /  40  40  50  20 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  78  61  79  60 /  80  80  40  10 
MONTICELLO AR     91  71  87  68 /  40  40  50  20 
SEARCY AR         86  67  84  64 /  60  70  50  20 
MOUNT IDA AR      87  69  86  66 /  50  60  50  20 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   84  67  84  64 /  70  70  50  20 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

51/57






000 
FXUS64 KLZK 240829
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
327 AM CDT SAT JUL 24 2004

.SHORT TERM...TODAY THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE MOVING ACROSS NORTHWEST ARKANSAS 
THIS MORNING. MOVEMENT IS RATHER SLOW TO THE NORTHEAST AND SOME 
AREAS WILL LIKELY MEASURE OVER AN INCH THIS MORNING. SATELLITE 
IMAGES SHOW ANOTHER STORM COMPLEX IN NORTH CENTRAL OKLAHOMA BUT THE 
CURRENT TRACK OF THIS SYSTEM WILL ALLOW IT TO MISS ARKANSAS. 

HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES OVER THE MID SOUTH AND A DEEP TROUGH IS IN 
PLACE OVER THE NORTHEAST UNITED STATES. SHORT WAVES WILL CONTINUE TO 
ROTATE AROUND THE BASE OF THE TROUGH THROUGH THE WEEKEND. NORTHWEST 
FLOW WILL RETURN TO THE AREA ON TUESDAY. 

THE COLD FRONT CONTINUES TO STRETCH FROM WEST CENTRAL ARKANSAS 
ACROSS NORTH ARKANSAS. SLOW SOUTHWARD MOVEMENT OF THE FRONT IS 
EXPECTED TODAY. THE ONGOING PRECIPITATION WILL MOVE INTO MISSOURI 
THIS MORNING. MORE THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP BY MID DAY HOWEVER 
WITH DAYTIME HEATING. WILL GO WITH 80 PERCENT POPS IN THE NORTH THIS 
AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT. THE SOUTHEAST WILL HAVE THE LOWEST CHANCE 
POPS...CLOSEST TO THE RIDGE AXIS. THE MAIN THREAT WITH THE STORMS 
TODAY WILL BE HEAVY RAIN. MOVEMENT OF THE STORMS WILL BE SLOW AND 
SEVERAL INCHES OF RAIN WILL BE POSSIBLE IF A STORM REMAINS IN ONE 
LOCATION FOR ANY LENGTH OF TIME. BEST CHANCES OF RAIN TODAY WILL BE 
IN THE NORTH. TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOLER DUE TO CLOUD COVER AND 
PRECIPITATION. 

MODELS ARE IN DECENT AGREEMENT BUT SEEM TO KEEP THE SYSTEMS TOO FAR

INTO THE FIRST PART OF NEXT WEEK.


372 
FXUS64 KLZK 240300 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
955 PM CDT FRI JUL 23 2004

.DISCUSSION...
SHEAR AXIS BECOME ACTIVE FROM MOUNTAIN HOME TO BATESVILLE AND WEST 
MEMPHIS THIS EVENING. SOME SEVERE WEATHER/FLASH FLOODING NOTED...BUT 
CONVECTION WAS FALLING APART. MEANWHILE...LARGER AREA OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS IN NORTHEAST OKLAHOMA WILL BUILD INTO NORTHERN/WESTERN 
ARKANSAS OVERNIGHT. 

GIVEN TRENDS...KEPT CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION MAINLY IN THE 
NORTH/WEST...WITH ONLY SLIGHT CHANCES IN CENTRAL SECTIONS. TOOK OUT 
RAIN CHANCES IN THE SOUTH WHERE CAP STILL IN PLACE. 

ALSO...WITH STORMS EARLIER IN THE NORTH...ADDED AREAS OF FOG NORTH 
OF LITTLE ROCK. PATCHY FOG MENTIONED ELSEWHERE. 

FRONT WILL PUSH SOUTHWARD THROUGH REGION ON SATURDAY...WITH 
SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. GOING FORECAST HAS 
THIS COVERED WELL. (46)
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

46







487 
FXUS64 KLZK 231952
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
250 PM CDT FRI JUL 23 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT
ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS BROKE OUT THIS AFTERNOON...AS A 
BOUNDARY ACROSS CENTRAL ARKANSAS INITIATED CONVECTION. COLD FRONT IS 
IN NORTHERN ARKANSAS...ALTHOUGH IS IT MAINLY A WIND SHIFT LINE AS 
THE DRIER AIR IS STILL IN NORTHERN MISSOURI.

BROAD UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION WILL MOVE OFF 
TO THE EAST. THIS WILL ALLOW THE FRONT TO MOVE SLOWLY SOUTH THROUGH 
THE STATE. GFS LOOKS TO MOVE THE FRONT THROUGH TOO FAST...WHILE THE 
ETA LOOKS TOO SLOW. WENT WITH A COMPROMISE...LEANING MORE TOWARD THE 
GFS EXCEPT IN QPF AMOUNTS. DO EXPECT HEAVY RAINFALL WITH THIS 
SYSTEM...AS PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES ARE OVER 2 INCHES. 
HOWEVER...PINPOINTING THE EXACT REGION OF HEAVY RAINFALL WILL DEPEND 
ON SMALL FEATURES. AT THIS TIME...THINK THE GREATEST CHANCE OF 
SEEING HEAVY RAIN WILL BE IN THE NORTHERN AND WESTERN SECTIONS OF 
THE AREA...CLOSER TO THE UPPER LEVEL DYNAMICS. DUE TO THE WEAK WIND 
FIELDS...STORMS WILL ALSO BE SLOW MOVING.

A COUPLE OF SHORTWAVES WILL MOVE EAST OUT OF THE ROCKIES INTO THE 
BASE OF THE TROUGH. THESE WILL BRING MORE THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY TO 
THE STATE. AT THIS POINT...HIGHEST RAIN CHANCES WILL BE SATURDAY 
INTO SATURDAY EVENING. HOWEVER...DUE TO THE MODEL DISCREPANCIES 
...RAINFALL POTENTIAL COULD REMAIN INTO LATE SATURDAY NIGHT. DID NOT 
FEEL COMFORTABLE EXTENDING LIKELY POPS THAT FAR OUT DUE TO THE 
DIFFERENCES.

RAINFALL WILL GRADUALLY COME TO AN END SUNDAY IN THE NORTH...AND 
SUNDAY NIGHT IN THE SOUTH. CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE MOVES INTO THE 
REGION ON SUNDAY...BRINGING DRY WEATHER BACK TO THE STATE.
&&

.LONG TERM...TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY
AREA STAYS DRY TUESDAY WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE TO THE NORTHEAST 
BRINGING A PROLONGED PERIOD OF NORTHEAST TO EAST SURFACE WINDS TO 
THE AREA. SHORT WAVE IN DANGEROUS NORTHWEST FLOW MOVES MOSTLY 
THROUGH KANSAS AND OKLAHOMA AT FIRST AND APPEARS EFFECTS OF IT WILL 
STAY TO THE WEST UNTIL THURSDAY. ON THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY...WEAK 
CLOSED LOW SWINGS THROUGH SOUTHERN ARKANSAS WITH AN ACCOMPANYING 
AREA OF MOISTURE. PUT IN SMALL POPS FOR THURSDAY FOR SOUTHERN HALF 
OF THE AREA...CONTINUING THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING...THEN 
WENT WITH 30 POPS IN THE SOUTH FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON WITH 20 POPS 
ELSEWHERE. MADE LITTLE CHANGE TO TEMP GRIDS. PATTERN FAVORS MAXES A 
LITTLE BELOW NORMAL WITH MINS NEAR OR A LITTLE BELOW NORMAL.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    72  88  69  85 /  40  50  30  40 
HARRISON AR       66  78  61  80 /  50  60  60  40 
HOT SPRINGS AR    72  88  69  86 /  40  50  30  40 
PINE BLUFF AR     73  89  70  86 /  40  40  30  40 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  66  78  61  79 /  50  60  60  40 
MONTICELLO AR     73  91  71  87 /  30  40  30  40 
SEARCY AR         71  86  67  84 /  40  50  40  40 
MOUNT IDA AR      72  87  69  86 /  40  50  30  40 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   70  84  67  84 /  40  50  40  40 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

1110 AM CDT FRI JUL 23 2004

.DISCUSSION...

MORNING...WITH OCCASIONAL THUNDER. COLD FRONT CURRENTLY IN NORTHERN 
ARKANSAS...ALTHOUGH THE DRIER AIR IS STILL IN MISSOURI. UPDATED 
GRIDS TO INCREASE POPS SLIGHTLY ACROSS THE NORTH AND AMEND SKY 
COVER...BUT MAINLY UPDATED FOR CURRENT CONDITIONS. HIGHS IN THE 
UPPER 80S TO MID 90S STILL LOOK GOOD FOR THIS AFTERNOON.

849 
FXUS64 KLZK 230856
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
355 AM CDT FRI JUL 23 2004

.DISCUSSION...
UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES OVER THE AREA THIS MORNING AND WILL CONTINUE 
OVER THE AREA THROUGH SATURDAY BEFORE A TROUGH IN THE GREAT LAKES 
AREA DIPS SOUTHWARD. THE TROUGH WILL REMAIN OVER THE AREA FOR SUNDAY 
AND MONDAY THEN HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS BACK IN FOR TUESDAY THROUGH THE 
END OF NEXT WEEK.

KLZK RADAR INDICATES A FEW SHOWERS TRYING TO DEVELOP JUST WEST OF 
THE CWFA. WILL INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR THE NORTH AND WEST 
THIS MORNING. OLD OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES FROM PREVIOUS CONVECTION SEEMS 
TO BE INITIATING THESE SHOWERS. 

A COLD FRONT JUST ENTERING NORTHWEST ARKANSAS WILL CONTINUE TO 
SLOWLY WORK ITS WAY FURTHER INTO ARKANSAS TODAY. SHOWER AND 
THUNDERSTORM CHANCES WILL INCREASE ALONG AND ON THE NORTH SIDE OF 
THIS FRONT. THE FRONT WILL MAKE IT TO SOUTHERN PARTS OF THE STATE BY 
SATURDAY MORNING. MODELS ARE IN FAIRLY DECENT AGREEMENT THOUGH GFS 
MAY BE OVERDOING THE PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS. AN MCS IS ANTICIPATED TO 
FORM IN THE PLAINS SATURDAY EVENING AND MOVE THROUGH ARKANSAS 
SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY MORNING. HENCE...PRECIP CHANCES WILL 
INCREASE AS THIS SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH. DEEP MOISTURE CONTINUES IN 
THE AREA THROUGH MONDAY MORNING AND WILL CONTINUE PRECIP CHANCES. 

HIGH PRESSURE MOVES BACK INTO THE AREA FOR TUESDAY. WARM AND DRY 
CONDITIONS WILL RETURN AS THE HIGH BUILDS OVER THE AREA. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOLER SATURDAY AND SUNDAY BEHIND THE FRONT AND 
WITH INCREASED CLOUD COVER.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    95  72  86  69 /  20  30  40  40 
HARRISON AR       89  66  80  61 /  30  40  50  50 
HOT SPRINGS AR    95  72  87  69 /  20  30  40  40 
PINE BLUFF AR     95  73  88  70 /  10  30  30  30 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  89  66  80  61 /  30  40  50  50 
MONTICELLO AR     95  73  89  71 /  10  30  30  30 
SEARCY AR         94  71  85  67 /  20  30  40  40 
MOUNT IDA AR      94  72  86  69 /  20  30  40  40 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   93  70  84  67 /  20  30  40  40 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

PINE BLUFF AR     95  73  88  70 /  10  30  30  30 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  89  66  80  61 /  30  40  50  50 
MONTICELLO AR     95  73  89  71 /  10  30  30  30 
SEARCY AR         94  71  85  67 /  20  30  40  40 
MOUNT IDA AR      94  72  86  69 /  20  30  40  40 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   93  70  84  67 /  20  30  40  40 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1005 PM CDT THU JUL 22 2004

.DISCUSSION...
STORMS ACROSS CENTRAL MISSOURI SENDING OUTFLOW BOUNDARY SOUTHWARD 
TOWARD NORTHERN ARKANSAS. COULD HAVE ISOLATED SHOWERS/STORMS POP UP 
IN THE NORTHERN COUNTIES AFTER MIDNIGHT...AND HAVE INDICATED AS SUCH 
IN THE FORECAST.

OTHERWISE...ONE MORE HOT/HUMID DAY ON FRIDAY. COLD FRONT TO NORTH 
WILL THEN PUSH INTO REGION WITH MORE CLOUDS/SCATTERED STORMS DURING 
THE WEEKEND. (46)
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.



142 
FXUS64 KLZK 221926
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
300 PM CDT THU JUL 22 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT
UPPER RIDGE HOLDING OVER THE AREA TODAY KEEPING THE AREA DRY. SOME 
ISOLATED SHOWERS HAVE DEVELOPED JUST SOUTH OF THE AREA ASSOCIATED
WITH WEAK SHORT WAVE AND WILL WATCH RADAR TRENDS...MAY NEED TO 
MENTION THAT FOR SOUTHERN ZONES FOR THIS EVENING. OTHERWISE SHOULD
BE DRY. HAZY CONDITIONS LIKELY TO PERSIST TONIGHT WHICH MAY TURN INTO
PATCHY FOG FOR A FEW HOURS AROUND SUNRISE. HAZE MAY CONTINUE INTO
FRIDAY AS THE UPPER RIDGE HANGS AROUND. COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH
FROM THE NORTH BUT WILL LIKELY HAVE HARD TIME PENETRATING INTO THE
STATE...ESPECIALLY AT FIRST. SHORT WAVE TO THE SOUTH LOOKS LIKE IT
WILL MOVE TO THE WEST FRIDAY WITH RIDGING BUILDING BACK INTO 
SOUTHERN ARKANSAS SO DROPPED POPS FOR THE SOUTH FOR FRIDAY. INTRODUCED
POPS FOR THE NORTH FRIDAY WITH THE FRONT BUT WILL NOT GO TOO HIGH
WITH POPS YET. INCREASED POPS ACROSS THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT AS THE 
FRONT SHOULD SLOWLY KNEAD ITS WAY SOUTH THROUGH THE OZARKS. THE FRONT
PROBABLY WILL FINALLY MAKE IT INTO SOUTHERN ARKANSAS SATURDAY WITH
GOOD MOISTURE BEHIND IT AND A SHORT WAVE OR TWO ROTATING AROUND 
THE UNSEASONABLY STRONG UPPER TROF TO THE NORTH. THIS WILL LEAD TO
GOOD CHANCES OF RAIN SATURDAY THROUGH MOST OF SUNDAY WITH THE BEST
CHANCE OF RAIN AND THE HEAVIEST RAIN IN THE NORTH. AM HESITANT TO
GO WITH LIKELY POPS THIS FAR AHEAD SINCE MESOSCALE INFLUENCES 
BETWEEN NOW AND THEN COULD SHIFT THE MAIN RAIN AXIS AROUND ONE WAY 
OR ANOTHER. WENT WITH 50 POPS IN THE NORTH DECREASING TO 30 IN THE
SOUTH. WENT CLOSE TO PERSISTENCE ON TEMPS THROUGH FRIDAY THEN WENT A 
LITTLE COOLER ON MINS IN THE NORTH FRIDAY NIGHT. MAXES OVER THE WEEKEND
MAY BE HELD DOWN A LOT BY CLOUDS AND WENT CLOSE TO MOS. MINS LIKELY
WILL NOT GET DOWN TO MOS VALUES DUE TO CLOUDS BUT LOWER 60S IN THE
NORTH DOES NOT LOOK OUT OF LINE.  
&&

.LONG TERM...MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY
UPPER TROUGH OVER THE GREAT LAKES STATES WILL MOVE EAST 
MONDAY...DRAGGING THE COLD FRONT WITH IT. AT THIS TIME...WILL GO 
WITH A DRY FORECAST...ALTHOUGH PORTIONS OF THE SOUTH AND EAST MAY 
STILL SEE EFFECTS OF THE FRONT DEPENDING ON THE SPEED. A DRY 
FORECAST WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE EXTENDED...AS MOISTURE LEVELS 
WILL REMAIN LOW AND NO TRIGGER IS SEEN TO SPARK OFF ANY CONVECTION. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    73  95  72  86 /  10  20  20  40 
HARRISON AR       70  89  66  80 /  10  30  30  50 
HOT SPRINGS AR    73  95  72  87 /  10  20  20  40 
PINE BLUFF AR     73  95  73  88 /  10  10  20  30 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  71  89  66  80 /  10  30  30  50 
MONTICELLO AR     73  95  73  89 /  10  10  20  30 
SEARCY AR         72  94  71  85 /  10  20  20  40 
MOUNT IDA AR      73  94  72  86 /  10  20  20  40 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   71  93  70  84 /  10  20  20  40 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

194 
FXUS64 KLZK 220821
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
338 AM CDT THU JUL 22 2004

.DISCUSSION...
SINCE A STRONG CANADIAN HIGH PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD 
AND MOVE SOUTHEASTWARD...THIS WILL CONTINUE TO PUSH A COLD FRONT 
TOWARDS ARKANSAS TODAY AND FRIDAY...AND BY SATURDAY MORNING...THIS 
COLD FRONT WILL BE MOVING ACROSS NEW ORLEANS AS PER THE LATEST 
GFS90. IT IS INTUITIVELY OBVIOUS THAT SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL DEVELOP AND MOVE ACROSS ARKANSAS. LITTLE OR NO 
RAIN IS EXPECTED OVER MY CWA TODAY THROUGH TONIGHT. THERE IS A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FRIDAY MORNING ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN SECTIONS AS THE COLD FRONT GETS CLOSER. MOISTURE WILL ALSO 
INCREASE ACROSS THE SOUTH AND A SHORT WAVE MAY TRIGGER THE 
DEVELOPMENT OF ISOLATED SHOWERS IN THE SOUTH ON FRIDAY. THE CHANCE 
OF STORMS WILL INCREASE STATEWIDE LATE FRIDAY AS THE COLD FRONT 
MOVES ACROSS MOST OF ARKANSAS. A BLEND OF GFS AND ETA WILL BE USED 
FOR MAX AND MIN TEMPS.   
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    95  73  95  72 /  10  10  10  30 
HARRISON AR       91  70  89  66 /  10  10  30  40 
HOT SPRINGS AR    95  73  95  72 /  10  10  20  30 
PINE BLUFF AR     95  73  95  73 /  10  10  20  30 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  91  71  89  66 /  10  10  30  40 
MONTICELLO AR     95  73  95  73 /  10  10  20  30 
SEARCY AR         94  72  94  71 /  10  10  10  30 
MOUNT IDA AR      94  73  94  72 /  10  10  20  30 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   94  71  93  70 /  10  10  20  30 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

719 
FXUS64 KLZK 220309 AAA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
1005 PM CDT WED JUL 21 2004

.DISCUSSION...
A COUPLE OF STORMS POPPED UP IN BOONE COUNTY LATE THIS AFTERNOON.  
AS A RESULT...UPDATED FORECAST TO ADD SMALL CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION 
IN THE NORTHERN COUNTIES. STORMS HAVE PRETTY MUCH DISSIPATED...WITH 
LATEST UPDATE CALLING FOR MOSTLY CLEAR/PARTLY CLOUDY SKY AND DRY 
WEATHER OVERNIGHT. 

HIGH PRESSURE WILL BEGIN DEPARTING ON THURSDAY...WITH HUMIDITY 
LEVELS BEGINNING TO INCREASE. A HOT DAY IN STORE...WITH HEAT INDEX 
VALUES BETWEEN 100 AND 105 DEGREES IN CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN 
ARKANSAS.

COLD FRONT WILL ARRIVE FROM THE NORTH FRIDAY NIGHT/SATURDAY...WITH 
SCATTERED SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS IN THE FORECAST. (46)
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&


967 
FXUS64 KLZK 211916
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
300 PM CDT WED JUL 21 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT
UPPER RIDGE HOLDING OVER THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND WILL GENERALLY
CONTINUE UNTIL FRIDAY WITH SOME MINOR CHANGES. COLD FRONT WILL
APPROACH FROM THE NORTH BUT WILL LIKELY HANG JUST NORTH OF THE 
AREA INTO FRIDAY. SHOULD SEE LITTLE CHANGE TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY
NIGHT WITH NOT MANY CLOUDS AND PRACTICALLY NO CONVECTION AS CAPPING
SHOULD DOMINATE. TEMPS SHOULD BE CLOSE TO PERSISTENCE ALTHOUGH MAXES
MAY MOVE UP A LITTLE FROM EFFECTS OF THE APPROACHING FRONT. STILL
NOT A LOT OF CONFIDENCE IN TIMING OF FRONTAL PASSAGE ACROSS THE 
AREA AS THE UPPER RIDGE REMAINS IN THE AREA. THERE STILL LOOKS TO BE 
A SIGNIFICANT SHORT WAVE RIDING ALONG THE NORTHERN EDGE OF THE RIDGE 
WHICH COULD HELP SEND THE FRONT INTO THE STATE LATE FRIDAY AND FRIDAY
NIGHT AND A SECOND SHORT WAVE SATURDAY MAY GIVE IT ANOTHER SHOVE.
WILL GO WITH THE FRONT BEING NEAR THE NORTHERN BORDER ON FRIDAY
AND SLOWLY MOVING TO THE SOUTH ACROSS THE STATE SATURDAY. MUCH OF
THE CONVECTION SHOULD BE ALONG OR BEHIND THE FRONT SO WILL NOT BEGIN
POPS IN THE NORTH UNTIL FRIDAY AND WILL INCREASE TO CHANCE POPS LATE
IN THE DAY. MEANWHILE...A SHORT WAVE FROM THE SOUTH SHEARS INTO
THE AREA FRIDAY AND WILL PUT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE SOUTH ON FRIDAY
DUE TO THIS. WILL KEEP POPS OUT OF CENTRAL SECTIONS FOR FRIDAY FOR 
NOW. WILL INCREASE POPS TO CHANCE CATEGORY ACROSS THE AREA FRIDAY
NIGHT INTO SATURDAY AS THE FRONT MAY SHIFT TO THE SOUTH AND THE 
REMNANTS OF THE SOUTHERN SHORT WAVE REMAIN IN THE AREA. GFS HINTING
AT AREA OF OVERRUNNING SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. WILL GO LOWER ON 
MAXES SATURDAY DUE TO EFFECTS OF THE FRONT AND THE ASSOCIATED CLOUDS
AND RAIN. MINS LIKELY WILL NOT CHANGE MUCH EXCEPT IN THE NORTH.   
&&

.LONG TERM...SUNDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY
DUE TO STRONG HIGH PRESSURE...THINK THAT THE FRONT WILL HAVE A HARD 
TIME MAKING IT THROUGH THE STATE. AS SUCH...HAVE INTRODUCED POPS 
FROM LITTLE ROCK SOUTH ON SUNDAY TO ACCOUNT FOR TIMING ISSUES. FOR 
THE REST OF THE EXTENDED...WILL CONTINUE THE DRY FORECAST. NEW GFS 
RUN STILL SHOWS CUT OFF LOW FORMING IN THE PLAINS/MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY...AND DO NOT THINK THAT IS FEASIBLE FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    72  95  73  95 /   0  10  10  10 
HARRISON AR       70  91  70  89 /  10  10  10  30 
HOT SPRINGS AR    72  95  73  95 /   0  10  10  20 
PINE BLUFF AR     72  95  73  95 /   0  10  10  20 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  70  91  71  89 /  10  10  10  30 
MONTICELLO AR     72  95  73  95 /   0  10  10  20 
SEARCY AR         72  94  72  94 /   0  10  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      72  94  73  94 /   0  10  10  20 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   71  94  72  93 /   0  10  10  20 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

PINE BLUFF AR     72  95  73  95 /   0  10  10  20 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  70  91  71  89 /  10  10  10  30

FXUS64 KLZK 210818
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
315 AM CDT WED JUL 21 2004

.DISCUSSION...
AS WAS THE CASE YESTERDAY AT THIS TIME...MODELS CONTINUE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT AND WILL GO WITH A BLEND OF GFS/ETA FOR NEAR TERM TEMPS 
AND POPS BUT A GFS/UKMET FOR MASS FIELDS IS PREFERRED. THE TIMING OF 
APPROACHING COLD FRONT REMAINS A CHALLENGE BUT FOR NOW WILL NOT 
STRAY TOO FAR FROM WHAT IS ALREADY OUT TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC. ONE 
COLD FRONT IN JULY WAS HARD ENOUGH TO GET BUT THE ODDS OF GETTING 
TWO COLD FRONTS IN JULY MOVE ALL THE WAY ACROSS ARKANSAS ARE SLIM.  
THE NEW AND IMPROVED GFSLR 21.00 IS QUITE DIFFERENT FROM THE PREVIOUS
VERSION WHICH HAD A CLOSED OFF 570 DAM 500MB LOW OVER MISSOURI JULY 
28. NOW IT SHOWS A MORE CREDIBLE 579 TROF. GO FIGURE. TOO BAD I HAD 
TO WAIT 24 HOURS TO SEE THE CORRECTED VERSION.
&&

.HYDROLOGY...
THE CURRENT DRY SPELL WILL CONTINUE FOR AT LEAST 2 OR 3 MORE DAYS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...



471 
FXUS64 KLZK 201951
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
300 PM CDT TUE JUL 20 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT
UPPER RIDGE SHOULD INCREASE ACROSS THE AREA TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY 
WHICH SHOULD END THE DANGEROUS NORTHWEST FLOW PATTERN FOR AWHILE
AND PLACE A GOOD CAP OR TWO ON THE ATMOSPHERE. THIS SHOULD LEAD TO
HOT AND DRY CONDITIONS OVER THE NEXT TWO DAYS AND THERE WILL BE NO
MENTION OF RAIN. TEMPS LIKELY WILL SLOWLY INCREASE. COLD FRONT 
APPROACHES FROM THE NORTH THURSDAY BUT SHOULD NOT REACH THE AREA DUE 
TO THE UPPER RIDGE IN PLACE. THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT MAY ALLOW TEMPS
TO RISE A LITTLE HOWEVER. THE RIDGE FINALLY WEAKENS FRIDAY INTO 
SATURDAY AND A COUPLE OF SHORT WAVES MOVE ACROSS THE NORTHERN EDGES
OF IT. THIS MAY ALLOW THE FRONT TO MOVE INTO THE AREA FRIDAY AND
THROUGH MUCH OF THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT. CONFIDENCE IN THIS IS STILL
A LITTLE LACKING AS 500 MB HEIGHTS REMAIN AT OR ABOVE 5880 METERS
WHICH COULD ENABLE THE RIDGE TO HOLD FIRM ENOUGH TO KEEP THE FRONT
TO THE NORTH. WILL CONTINUE WITH ENHANCED POPS IN THE NORTH FOR
FRIDAY WITH POPS DEVELOPING EVERYWHERE AND KEEP 40 PERCENT POPS
IN THE NORTH EARLY FRIDAY NIGHT SPREADING TO ALL AREAS BY LATE 
FRIDAY NIGHT. WILL BACK OFF ON TEMP FORECASTS FOR FRIDAY AND 
FRIDAY NIGHT AS WELL.     
&&

.LONG TERM...SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY
FRONT WILL SLOWLY MAKE PROGRESS THROUGH THE STATE SATURDAY. DUE TO 
UNCERTAINITY OF PLACEMENT DUE TO THE STRENGTH OF BERMUDA HIGH...HAVE 
LEFT CHANCE POPS IN FOR SATURDAY. AS FRONT MOVES TO THE SOUTH 
SUNDAY...HAVE TAPERED POPS BACK FROM NORTH TO SOUTH. DRY WEATHER 
WILL PREVAIL THROUGH THE REST OF THE EXTENDED. AM NOT BUYING INTO 
UPPER LEVEL LOW THE GFS IS SHOWING FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    71  94  73  96 /  10  10  10  10 
HARRISON AR       70  92  71  92 /  10  10  10  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    71  94  73  96 /  10  10  10  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     72  94  73  96 /  10  10  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  70  92  71  92 /  10  10  10  10 
MONTICELLO AR     72  95  73  96 /  10  10  10  10 
SEARCY AR         71  94  73  95 /  10  10  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      70  94  73  95 /  10  10  10  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   70  93  72  95 /  10  10  10  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KLZK 201324
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
820 AM CDT TUE JUL 20 2004

.DISCUSSION...
ISOLATED SHOWERS AND A THUNDERSTORM OR TWO CONTINUES IN WESTERN 
SECTIONS WITH A WEAK SHORT WAVE MOVING INTO THE AREA IN NORTH TO 
NORTHEAST FLOW ALOFT. THE SHORT WAVE REMAINS A PLAYER THROUGH
MOST OF THE DAY ALTHOUGH GFS SHOWS IT WEAKENING AND SHEARING. 
WITH HEATING AND SOME UNSTABLE AIR AROUND...THINK THERE IS A
POSSIBILITY ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS COULD EITHER
CONTINUE INTO THIS AFTERNOON OR DEVELOP ANEW IN THE NORTH AND WEST.
SENT OUT UPDATE TO TAKE LATE IN THE MORNING WORDING OUT AND
WENT WITH ISOLATED COVERAGE FOR PRECIP. POPS AT 20 PERCENT IN TEXT
BUT JUST ABOVE 15 PERCENT THRESHOLD IN GRIDS. UPPER RIDGE LOOKS
LIKE IT WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AND THIS 
SHOULD LESSEN ANY CHANCES FOR RAIN AND LIKELY WILL STRENGTHEN 
THE CAP OR CAPS IN THE ATMOSPHERE OVER THE AREA.   
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

WILL CONTINUE TO DOMINATE THE ARKANSAS WEATHER TODAY. THIS UPPER 
LEVEL RIDGE WILL HOWEVER FLATTEN SIGNIFICANTLY AND BY 12Z WEDNESDAY 
WILL GIVE ARKANSAS A MORE WESTERLY UPPER LEVEL FLOW. A NEW COLD 
FRONT WILL APPROACH FROM THE NORTHWEST LATE THURSDAY OR FRIDAY AND 
THIS WILL BRING ABOUT A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.

236 
FXUS64 KLZK 191949
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
246 PM CDT MON JUL 19 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...
THE LATEST SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATES CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY 
CONDITIONS ACROSS ALL OF THE FORECAST AREA. 19Z SURFACE STREAMLINE 
ANALYSIS INDICATES A LIGHT SOUTHWEST FLOW ACROSS NORTHERN AND 
CENTRAL PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. 

FORECAST ISENTROPIC FIELDS PROMOTE THE POTENTIAL FOR ELEVATED 
CONVECTION ACROSS PORTIONS OF MISSOURI LATE TONIGHT. FORECAST STORM 
MOTION VECTORS INDICATE THAT THIS ACTIVITY COULD AFFECT EXTREME 
NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA LATE TONIGHT AND EARLY 
TOMORROW MORNING AS IT WEAKENS. HAVE ADJUSTED POP AND WX FORECASTS 
ACCORDINGLY.  

OTHERWISE...THE REST OF THE SHORT TERM PERIODS APPEAR DRY...AS THE 
AMPLITUDE OF THE OVERALL UPPER LEVEL PATTERN WILL DECREASE ACROSS 
THE U.S. STRONG CONVECTIVE INHIBITION WILL OVERWHELM AND 
WEAK...SMALL SCALE FORCING MECHANISMS TO PROHIBIT CONVECTION. 

&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH MONDAY
DEAMPLIFIED UPPER LEVEL PATTERN WILL ALLOW SHORT WAVES TO PASS 
ACROSS MAINLY THE NORTHERN SECTIONS LATE THIS WEEK. A COLD FRONT 
WILL MOVE INTO THE NORTH PART OF THE STATE FRIDAY MORNING. WILL KEEP 
POPS IN THE CHANCE CATEGORY FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING AS THE 
FRONT MOVES THROUGH. MOISTURE LOOKS BETTER ON THE LATEST RUN OF THE 
GFS.  WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCES OF PRECIPITATION IN THE SOUTH THROUGH 
SUNDAY MORNING AS THE COLD FRONT WILL EXIT THE SOUTH AT THIS TIME. 
WILL KEEP THE REST OF THE AREA DRY FOR SUNDAY AND ALL AREAS DRY ON 
MONDAY. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE CLOSE TO NORMAL THROUGH THIS PERIOD.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    68  93  71  94 /   0   0   0  10 
HARRISON AR       65  90  69  93 /  20  20  10  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    68  93  71  94 /   0   0   0  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     68  92  72  94 /   0   0   0  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  66  89  69  92 /  20  20  10  10 
MONTICELLO AR     69  93  72  95 /   0   0   0  10 
SEARCY AR         67  92  71  93 /   0   0   0  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      68  93  70  94 /   0   0   0  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   66  92  70  94 /   0   0   0  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KLZK 191949
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
246 PM CDT MON JUL 19 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT...
THE LATEST SATELLITE IMAGERY INDICATES CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY 
CONDITIONS ACROSS ALL OF THE FORECAST AREA. 19Z SURFACE STREAMLINE 
ANALYSIS INDICATES A LIGHT SOUTHWEST FLOW ACROSS NORTHERN AND 
CENTRAL PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. 

FORECAST ISENTROPIC FIELDS PROMOTE THE POTENTIAL FOR ELEVATED 
CONVECTION ACROSS PORTIONS OF MISSOURI LATE TONIGHT. FORECAST STORM 
MOTION VECTORS INDICATE THAT THIS ACTIVITY COULD AFFECT EXTREME 
NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA LATE TONIGHT AND EARLY 
TOMORROW MORNING AS IT WEAKENS. HAVE ADJUSTED POP AND WX FORECASTS 
ACCORDINGLY.  

OTHERWISE...THE REST OF THE SHORT TERM PERIODS APPEAR DRY...AS THE 
AMPLITUDE OF THE OVERALL UPPER LEVEL PATTERN WILL DECREASE ACROSS 
THE U.S. STRONG CONVECTIVE INHIBITION WILL OVERWHELM AND 
WEAK...SMALL SCALE FORCING MECHANISMS TO PROHIBIT CONVECTION. 

&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH MONDAY
DEAMPLIFIED UPPER LEVEL PATTERN WILL ALLOW SHORT WAVES TO PASS 
ACROSS MAINLY THE NORTHERN SECTIONS LATE THIS WEEK. A COLD FRONT 
WILL MOVE INTO THE NORTH PART OF THE STATE FRIDAY MORNING. WILL KEEP 
POPS IN THE CHANCE CATEGORY FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING AS THE 
FRONT MOVES THROUGH. MOISTURE LOOKS BETTER ON THE LATEST RUN OF THE 
GFS.  WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCES OF PRECIPITATION IN THE SOUTH THROUGH 
SUNDAY MORNING AS THE COLD FRONT WILL EXIT THE SOUTH AT THIS TIME. 
WILL KEEP THE REST OF THE AREA DRY FOR SUNDAY AND ALL AREAS DRY ON 
MONDAY. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE CLOSE TO NORMAL THROUGH THIS PERIOD.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    68  93  71  94 /   0   0   0  10 
HARRISON AR       65  90  69  93 /  20  20  10  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    68  93  71  94 /   0   0   0  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     68  92  72  94 /   0   0   0  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  66  89  69  92 /  20  20  10  10 
MONTICELLO AR     69  93  72  95 /   0   0   0  10 
SEARCY AR         67  92  71  93 /   0   0   0  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      68  93  70  94 /   0   0   0  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   66  92  70  94 /   0   0   0  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

669 
FXUS64 KLZK 190811
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
310 AM CDT MON JUL 19 2004

.DISCUSSION...
DRIER AIR HAS CONTD TO WORK INTO MUCH OF THE FA OVER THE LAST 24 
HOURS...WITH MAIN EFFECTS NOTED OVER NRN AR. DEWPOINT READINGS IN 
THE 60S COMMON OVER AR THIS MRNG UNDER MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES.

NOT TOO MANY CHGS NOTED IN THE FCST FOR THE SHORT TERM. EXPECT NWLY 
FLOW ALOFT TO PERSIST ACRS AR THRU TUE WITH UPPER RIDGE OVER THE WRN 
STATES AND TROF IN THE EAST. WILL SEE SEVERAL WEAK UPPER LVL 
SHORTWVS DROPPING SEWD INTO THE AREA. HOWEVER...DUE TO LACK OF SIG 
MOISTURE...ONLY EXPECT SOME CLOUDS FROM TIME TO TIME.

MODELS CONT TO INDC THAT THE UPPER FLOW WILL DE-AMPLIFY BY MIDWEEK 
WITH UPPER RIDGE FLATTENING AND NOSING INTO AR FROM THE W. THIS WILL 
ALLOW TEMPS TO RETURN TO MORE NORMAL LVLS FOR LATE JULY ALONG WITH 
RISING HUMIDITY VALUES. HAVE GONE MORE WITH THE ETA TEMPS THE NEXT 
SEVERAL PDS.

NOT EXPECTING ANY PRECIP INTO MIDWEEK. RETURN FLOW/WAA PATTERN COULD
SET OFF SOME CONVECTION TO OUR NW LATE TNGT AND INTO TUE MRNG. 
EXPECT ANYTHING THAT DOES FORM TO STAY TO THE N OF THE FA AS SFC 
RIDGE STILL FCST TO LINGER OVER AR.

LATEST GFS STILL SHOWING THE NEXT CDFNT AFFECTING THE FA LATER IN 
THE WEEK. THE MODEL HAS TRENDED A BIT SLOWER TODAY WITH THE SWD 
PLACEMENT OF THE BNDRY LATER IN THE WEEK. HAVE KEPT LOW CHC POPS IN 
PER GOING FCST. MODELS ARE STILL WANTING TO SWEEP FRONT S OF AR BY 
NEXT WEEKEND AS UPPER FLOW AMPLIFIES ONCE AGAIN. WOULD LIKE TO SEE 
ANOTHER MODEL RUN OR TWO BEFORE MAKING ANY MAJOR CHGS TO TEMPS FOR 
DAYS 5 THRU 7.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

920 PM CDT SUN JUL 18 2004

.DISCUSSION...
LIGHT WINDS AND MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO FALL 
OVERNIGHT. CURRENT FORECAST HAS LOWS TONIGHT IN THE MID 60S...WITH 
THE RECORD LOW FOR LITTLE ROCK AT 64. WHILE TEMPERATURES WILL FALL 
TONIGHT...DO NOT THINK IT WILL BE A RECORD EVENT. HOWEVER...IT WILL 
BE QUITE NICE FOR THE MIDDLE OF JULY.

HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN STRONG THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK. 
MOISTURE LEVELS WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE BEFORE THE NEXT FRONT MOVES 
INTO THE STATE FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.

254 
FXUS64 KLZK 181841
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
140 PM CDT SUN JUL 18 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT
PATTERN WILL REMAIN FIXED IN THE SHORT TERM...WITH RIDGE OF HIGH
PRESSURE TO THE WEST AND TROUGH TO THE EAST. BETWEEN THE TWO
SYSTEMS...ENERGY ALOFT WILL RIDE NORTHWEST FLOW INTO REGION...WITH
PERHAPS SOME AFTERNOON CU IN LIMITED MOISTURE.

TOWARD THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK...HIGH TO WEST WILL SLOWLY NUDGE
TOWARD ARKANSAS...WITH TROUGH TO EAST GRADUALLY DAMPENING. WITH
THIS...WOULD EXPECT A SLOW WARMING TREND WITH WINDS AT THE
SURFACE TURNING TO THE SOUTH. MOISTURE LEVELS WILL ALSO GO
UP A BIT.

BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES IN THE FORECAST AS A WHOLE...ESPECIALLY
EARLY IN THE WEEK. (46)
&&

.LONG TERM...THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY
THIS SECTION OF THE FORECAST CONTINUES ON TRACK. UPPER RIDGE BREAKS
DOWN SOMEWHAT TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. THIS WILL ALLOW SHORT WAVE
SPEEDING ALONG THE WESTERLIES ACROSS SOUTHERN CANADA TO DIP INTO THE
NORTHERN AND CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY BY SATURDAY AND
SUNDAY. ALSO...SOME SHORT WAVES IN THE WEAKER FLOW AROUND THE RIDGE
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE STATE AS WELL. THIS WILL RESULT TO AN END TO
THE DRY WEATHER THAT WILL PREVAIL IN THE SHORT TERM. FRONT WITH ITS
ACCOMPANYING MOISTURE WILL DROP INTO NORTHERN ARKANSAS OVERNIGHT
THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY MORNING. RAIN AREA WILL CONTINUE SLIDING SOUTH
FOR THE FIRST PART OF THE WEEKEND...AND IT WILL BE OUT OF THE STATE
SUNDAY. (32)
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    66  90  70  93 /   0   0   0  10
HARRISON AR       61  88  67  90 /   0   0   0  10
HOT SPRINGS AR    66  92  69  93 /   0   0   0  10
PINE BLUFF AR     66  90  71  93 /   0   0   0  10
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  60  87  67  89 /   0   0   0  10
MONTICELLO AR     66  91  72  93 /   0   0   0  10
SEARCY AR         64  88  69  92 /   0   0   0  10
MOUNT IDA AR      66  92  68  93 /   0   0   0  10
RUSSELLVILLE AR   64  90  67  93 /   0   0   0  10
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

501 
FXUS64 KLZK 180818
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
318 AM CDT SUN JUL 18 2004

.DISCUSSION...
SFC FRONT WAS LOCATED TO THE S OF AR THIS MRNG. DRIER AIR IS SLOWLY 
FILTERING IN FROM THE N WITH THE MAIN EFFECTS NOTED OVER NRN AR... 
WHERE SFC DEWPOINTS ARE IN THE LOWER 60S. CNTRL AND SRN AR STILL 
SEEING TD READINGS IN THE UPPER 60S AND LOWER 70S.

MODELS STILL IN GOOD AGREEMENT THIS MRNG WITH SHORT TERM FCST 
TRENDS. SFC HIGH PRES WILL CONT TO BUILD INTO THE REGION WITH DRY 
WEATHER EXPECTED. NWLY FLOW ALOFT WILL ALSO PERSIST AS UPPER RIDGE 
TO OUR W AND TROF OVER THE ERN STATES HOLDS IN PLACE. LITTLE IN THE 
WAY OF UPPER SUPPORT NOTED IN THE UPPER LVLS TO JUSTIFY ANY RAIN 
CHCS THRU AT LEAST TUE AND CURRENT FCST HAS THIS WELL HANDLED.

WENT WITH A BLEND OF THE VARIOUS MOS TEMPS FOR THE NEXT FEW DAYS. 
STILL EXPECT THE COOLEST TEMPS TO BE ACRS NRN AR. SFC HIGH SHIFTS 
EWD BY TUE AND WED ALLOWING SLY WINDS TO RETURN...ALONG WITH HIGHER 
HUMIDITY.

MODELS THIS MRNG CONT TO INDC THE UPPER PATTERN WILL FLATTEN OUT TO 
SOME EXTENT DURG THE LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK. LATEST GFS STILL 
SHOWING ANOTHER CDFNT APCHG FROM THE N BY THU. GOING FCST OF CHC 
POPS AHEAD OF FNT LOOKS GOOD IN THE EXTENDED. NO OTHER SIG CHGS MADE 
TO CURRENT FCST FOR DAYS 5 THRU 7.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

188 
FXUS64 KLZK 180230
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
930 PM CDT SAT JUL 17 2004

.DISCUSSION...
FORECAST LOOKS IN GOOD SHAPE AND ONLY SUPERFICIAL CHANGES WILL BE 
NEEDED THIS EVENING. LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS PLACES COOL/DEW POINT 
FRONT ROUGHLY ALONG A LINE EXTENDING FROM BLYTHEVILLE TO STUTTGART 
TO PINE BLUFF TO EL DORADO. BIGGEST DIFFERENCE ACROSS THIS FRONT IS 
DEW POINT TEMPERATURES AS SEE BY THE 63 IN KHRO VERSUS THE 70 IN 
KLLQ. HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD DOWN FROM THE NORTH WITH 
CLEARING SKIES AND FORECASTED LOWS LOOKING RIGHT ON TARGET. 

AFTERNOON CONVECTION OVER THE SOUTH KICKED OFF BY DAYTIME HEATING 
AND WEAK SHORTWAVE MOVING THROUGH THE AREA. PRECIP ALL BUT DONE AT 
THIS TIME AND WILL REWORK ZONES/GRIDS TO REMOVE ANY MENTION OF POPS.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

780 
FXUS64 KLZK 171925 CCA
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED TO ADD PRELIMINARY NUMBERS
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
220 PM CDT SAT JUL 17 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT
FRONT HAS JUST ABOUT MOVED OUT OF THE STATE THIS AFTERNOON.
AFTERNOON CU HAVE POPPED UP ACROSS THE STATE...WITH A FEW SHOWERS
ACROSS EASTERN ARKANSAS. THE SHOWERS WERE ASSOCIATED WITH A WEAK
VORT MAX ROTATING AROUND EASTERN CONUS TROUGH. EXPECT CU AND SHOWERS
TO SUBSIDE ONCE THE SUN SETS.

MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS AS SURFACE HIGH
DROPS SOUTH INTO THE REGION AND FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS PUSHED TO THE
GULF COAST. MODELS MAINTAIN BLOCKING PATTERN THROUGH MID WEEK. NO
DECENT SHORTWAVES LOOK TO BE COMING OVER THE RIDGE. WITH HIGH
PRESSURE AND DRY AIR AT THE SURFACE...AND NO LIFTING
MECHANISMS...HAVE REMOVED PRECIP CHANCES THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT.

LOWER DEW POINTS ARE FORECAST TO MOVE INTO THE STATE...WITH THE
GFS A BIT OVER DONE. EXPECT CLEAR SKIES TONIGHT AND SUNDAY NIGHT AS
THE HIGH SETTLES IN. ALONG WITH THE DRY AIR...WENT WITH FAIRLY COOL
TEMPERATURES ACROSS NORTHERN AND CENTRAL ARKANSAS. FEEL THE GFS
AGAIN IS TOO COOL...LIKELY DUE TO EXCESSIVELY COOL DEW POINTS.

QUIET DAY EXPECTED MONDAY AS HIGH REMAINS OVERHEAD. WINDS WILL BE
LIGHT AND VARIABLE WITH DEW POINTS STILL RATHER LOW. SLOW WARMING
TREND TO START TUESDAY AS HIGH SHIFTS EASTWARD AND SOUTHERLY WINDS
RETURN. MOISTURE WILL SLOWLY INCREASE AS WELL. (220/46)
&&

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY
RIDGE OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF THE COUNTRY GETS FLATTENED SOMEWHAT
BY THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK BY A LOW CRASHING INTO THE WEST COAST JUST
OVER THE CANADIAN BORDER. FLOW OVER ARKANSAS CONTINUES WEAK UNTIL
12Z THURSDAY WHEN WESTERN RIDGE REGRESSES FAR ENOUGH TO ALLOW
NORTHWEST FLOW OVER THE STATE ONCE MORE. AT THIS POINT SHORT WAVES
BEGIN INFLUENCING OUR WEATHER WITH INCREASED PRECIPITATION CHANCES
FOR THE WEEK END AS SURFACE FRONT SAGS INTO THE STATE FROM THE
NORTH. (32)
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    67  88  66  90 /  20   0   0   0
HARRISON AR       62  83  60  88 /  10   0   0   0
HOT SPRINGS AR    68  89  67  92 /  10   0   0   0
PINE BLUFF AR     69  88  68  90 /  20   0   0   0
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  62  82  60  87 /  10   0   0   0
MONTICELLO AR     70  89  69  91 /  20   0   0   0
SEARCY AR         65  86  65  88 /  20   0   0   0
MOUNT IDA AR      68  90  67  92 /  10   0   0   0
RUSSELLVILLE AR   66  88  64  90 /  10   0   0   0
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.

FRONT HAS JUST ABOUT MOVED OUT OF THE STATE THIS AFTERNOON. 
AFTERNOON CU HAVE POPPED UP ACROSS THE STATE...WITH A FEW SHOWERS 
ACROSS EASTERN ARKANSAS. THE SHOWERS WERE ASSOCIATED WITH A WEAK 
VORT MAX ROTATING AROUND EASTERN CONUS TROUGH. EXPECT CU AND SHOWERS 
TO SUBSIDE ONCE THE SUN SETS.

MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS AS SURFACE HIGH 
DROPS SOUTH INTO THE REGION AND FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS PUSHED TO THE 
GULF COAST. MODELS MAINTAIN BLOCKING PATTERN THROUGH MID WEEK. NO 
DECENT SHORTWAVES LOOK TO BE COMING OVER THE RIDGE. WITH HIGH 
PRESSURE AND DRY AIR AT THE SURFACE...AND NO LIFTING 
MECHANISMS...HAVE REMOVED PRECIP CHANCES THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. 

LOWER DEW POINTS ARE FORECAST TO MOVE INTO THE STATE...WITH THE 
GFS A BIT OVER DONE. EXPECT CLEAR SKIES TONIGHT AND SUNDAY NIGHT AS 
THE HIGH SETTLES IN. ALONG WITH THE DRY AIR...WENT WITH FAIRLY COOL 
TEMPERATURES ACROSS NORTHERN AND CENTRAL ARKANSAS. FEEL THE GFS 
AGAIN IS TOO COOL...LIKELY DUE TO EXCESSIVELY COOL DEW POINTS.

QUIET DAY EXPECTED MONDAY AS HIGH REMAINS OVERHEAD. WINDS WILL BE 
LIGHT AND VARIABLE WITH DEW POINTS STILL RATHER LOW. SLOW WARMING 
TREND TO START TUESDAY AS HIGH SHIFTS EASTWARD AND SOUTHERLY WINDS 
RETURN. MOISTURE WILL SLOWLY INCREASE AS WELL. (220/46) 
&&

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY
RIDGE OVER THE WESTERN HALF OF THE COUNTRY GETS FLATTENED SOMEWHAT 
BY THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK BY A LOW CRASHING INTO THE WEST COAST JUST 
OVER THE CANADIAN BORDER. FLOW OVER ARKANSAS CONTINUES WEAK UNTIL 
12Z THURSDAY WHEN WESTERN RIDGE REGRESSES FAR ENOUGH TO ALLOW 
NORTHWEST FLOW OVER THE STATE ONCE MORE. AT THIS POINT SHORT WAVES 
BEGIN INFLUENCING OUR WEATHER WITH INCREASED PRECIPITATION CHANCES 
FOR THE WEEK END AS SURFACE FRONT SAGS INTO THE STATE FROM THE 
NORTH. (32)
&&


.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

220/46/32

.DISCUSSION...
A COLD FRONT WAS PUSHING INTO SOUTHERN ARKANSAS LATE THIS MORNING. 
WOULD EXPECT SOME REDEVELOPMENT OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THIS 
AFTERNOON WITH DAYTIME HEATING...BUT THIS PRETTY MUCH CONFINED TO 
AREAS SOUTH OF LITTLE ROCK. 

WENT WITH SMALL CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION IN THE SOUTH THIS 
AFTERNOON. OTHER THAN THIS AND A FEW TWEAKS OF GRIDS TO FIT 
CURRENT TRENDS...GOING FORECAST LOOKS OK. (46)



153 
FXUS64 KLZK 170816
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
315 AM CDT SAT JUL 17 2004

.DISCUSSION...
CONVECTION CONFINED TO SRN THIRD OF FA ATTM. BASED ON LATEST RADAR 
TRENDS...EXPECT BULK OF ACTIVITY TO BE SHIFTING S OF AR BY 12Z THIS 
MRNG. SVR TSTM WATCH 652 WAS ALLOWED TO EXPIRE ON TIME AT 3 AM.

BASED ON SFC DEWPOINTS...APPEARS FRONTAL BNDRY LOCATED OVER CNTRL AR 
ATTM. EXPECT BNDRY TO KEEP WORKING SLOWLY SWD TODAY... ALLOWING 
DRIER AIR TO GRADUALLY FILTER IN FROM THE NORTH. HAVE LEFT SOME 
LINGERING CHC POPS OVER SRN HALF OF THE FA FOR MAINLY THIS MRNG WITH 
SLIGHT CHC POPS INTO THE AFTN FOR SERN AR. 

DRY WEATHER EXPECTED TO PREVAIL SUN AND MON WITH LOWER HUMIDITY 
LEVELS. TEMPS MAY ACTUALLY HOVER A FEW DEGREES BELOW NORMAL TO CLOSE 
OUT THE WEEKEND. HAVE GONE WITH A BLEND OF MOS TEMPS THRU THE SHORT 
TERM.

NWLY FLOW ALOFT OF PROGGED TO PERSIST ACRS THE MID-SOUTH FOR THE 
NEXT FEW DAYS. GFS CONTS TO INDC THAT THE UPPER FLOW WILL GRADUALLY 
DEAMPLIFY AS WE WORK INTO THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK...ALLOWING TEMPS 
TO RETURN TO NORMAL LVLS. GFS ALSO SHOWS SEVERAL UPPER LVL SYSTEMS 
DROPPING SEWD IN THE UPPER FLOW NEXT WEEK WHICH COULD ENHANCE OUR 
SHRA/TSRA CHCS. AS IS USUALLY THE CASE WITH NWLY FLOW ALOFT... 
TIMING/STRENGTH OF SYSTEMS ALWAYS A CHALLENGE. FOR NOW HAVE LEFT THE 
FCST AS IS IN THE LONG TERM AND SEE HOW LATER MODEL RUNS HANDLE 
TRENDS.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

$$

44

772 
FXUS64 KLZK 162349
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
645 PM CDT FRI JUL 16 2004

.DISCUSSION...
WHOLESALE CHANGES WILL BE MADE TO THE ZONES/GRIDS WITH AN UPDATE 
COMING AT THE TOP OF THE HOUR. SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH 648 WILL BE 
ALLOWED TO EXPIRE ON SCHEDULE AT  7 PM AS ALL CONVECTION HAS MOVED 
OFF TO THE EAST. OF MORE SIGNIFICANCE WILL BE A COMPLETE REWORK OF 
POPS AND QPF FIELDS. 

CURRENT SATELLITE SHOWS REMNANT OF A STRONG MCV CURRENTLY IN NORTH 
CENTRAL OKLAHOMA. STILL NO ACTIVITY ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FEATURE AS 
AIR MASS APPEARS TO BE CAPPED IN THIS AREA. QUICK LOOK AT THE 00Z 
SOUNDING FROM KLZK SHOWS VIRTUALLY NO CAP. WHILE PRECIPITATION IS 
STILL POSSIBLE AS FEATURE MOVES INTO A MORE DESIRABLE ENVIRONMENT 
...POPS WILL BE SLASHED ACROSS THE BOARD. WILL KEEP HIGHER POPS 
ACROSS THE SOUTH AS FEATURE EXPECTED TO TRACK ACROSS THE SOUTHWEST.

WILL REEVALUATE FORECAST WHEN NEW MODEL RUN COMES IN AND ANOTHER 
UPDATE MAY BE WARRANTED.
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
&&

716 
FXUS64 KLZK 161947
AFDLZK

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LITTLE ROCK AR
245 PM CDT FRI JUL 16 2004

.SHORT TERM...TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AND A COUPLE OF SHORT WAVES WILL CONTINUE 
INFLUENCING OUR WEATHER TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... 
AFTERWARDS DYNAMICS WILL WEAKEN AND FLOW WILL BECOME MORE NORTHERLY 
AS TROF DEEPENS TO OUR EAST. PRECIPITATION WILL BE COMING TO AN END 
FROM NORTH TO SOUTH ACROSS THE STATE SATURDAY AFTERNOON. NORTHERLY 
SURFACE FLOW WILL KEEP BRINGING DRIER AIR AND A WELCOMED RELIEF TO 
THE HIGH HUMIDITIES THAT WE HAVE BEEN EXPERIENCING. WEAK RIDGE AT 
THE SURFACE WILL KEEP LIGHT WINDS THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. BOTH...HIGHS 
AND LOWS WILL BE LOWER ON ACCOUNT OF THE DRIER AND COOLER AIR THAT 
WILL SLIDE SOUTH ACROSS THE STATE. NORMAL TEMPERATURES WILL RETURN 
BEYOND THE SHORT TERM.
&&

.LONG TERM...TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY
THE UPPER FLOW PATTERN ACROSS THE U.S. IS EXPECTED TO 
DECREASE IN AMPLITUDE THROUGH THIS PERIOD. AN INCREASE IN MOISTURE 
IS EXPECTED AT THE END OF PERIOD...AND WILL SUPPORT SCATTERED 
CONVECTION.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
LITTLE ROCK AR    73  86  68  87 /  70  40  10  10 
HARRISON AR       68  82  62  83 /  60  20  10  10 
HOT SPRINGS AR    73  87  69  87 /  70  40  10  10 
PINE BLUFF AR     73  88  70  88 /  70  50  10  10 
MOUNTAIN HOME AR  67  81  61  82 /  60  20  10  10 
MONTICELLO AR     74  89  71  89 /  60  50  10  10 
SEARCY AR         71  85  66  86 /  70  30  10  10 
MOUNT IDA AR      73  86  69  87 /  60  40  10  10 
RUSSELLVILLE AR   71  85  66  85 /  70  30  10  10 
&&

.LZK WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...NONE.
